Complaints. One of the towels had a black ink smear on it. I guess house cleaning forgot about that towel. Also, they only have wired internet, not wifi. Good thing we didn't just have my ipad and had a laptop as well.

I would stay here again but not before I searched up other hotels first (just because they missed that one towel and because there's no wifi).

Avoid this place at all costs. I stayed 2\/12 - 2\/17 and am extremely disappointed with so many things. This was my second time staying there, my first time was awesome, so I thought I should stay there again. Upon arrival my room was something straight out of the 80's. The room had barely functional furniture, bathroom tile was cracked and dingy. It smelled recently smoked in and just depressing. After 30 minutes of trying to get use to it I called the front desk. 

After an exchange with manager Erica, my room was changed to one of the suites. I thought my problems were over but they were just beginning. While I had no issues with the new room I had to deal with some seriously intrusive and aggressive situations. 

Intrusion was daily by the cleaning lady that would never knock but would just walk in to the room. Every day I would tell her in both English and Spanish to knock. Yet in either language she didn't quite understand the concept. 

One early morning around 4:30 am, as I'm trying to get sleep I start to notice the smell of marijuana in my room. It was coming from the adjoining unit next door. I called the front desk and spoke with the manager who's ridiculous solution was to have me change rooms at 5am. He said he would dispatch security to the neighboring room. 

Security did not go their room, in fact he came to mine and was aggressively pounding on my door as if it was i that was committing some infraction. When I open the door his tone was escalating in aggressiveness. I felt fear for my safety so I yelled at him to leave several times and slammed the door. 

The managers solution was to credit the evening of hell. However the darn resort fees for that night still remained cause this resort specializes in terrorizing its guests. Oh by the way those resort fees are the biggest scam. The pool was operational for only 2 of the 6 days I was there. With no alternatives. They charge you for services you don't use or if you do they are services that you still have to pay for. 

So to wrap up rooms are disgusting, security terrorizes guests, cleaning lady can't understand any language, management is not willing to help, and they will scam you with false fees. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

With this being Vegas and all, my expectations for the "standard" room at the Monte Carlo were already pretty low. My only real expectation was That the room would be clean, even if just the bathroom. I won't go into too much detail, but I think the attached pictures speak for themselves.

The bedding happened to be clean, but I can't say the same about the carpet. 

After reading a few other reviews, I understand that this hotel was built in 1989, but I don't buy that as a valid excuse for controlling a mold problem by layering with years of bathroom epoxy until enough people complain. Supply and demand, I guess... 

Note to Monte Carlo:

1. Taylor Swift was also built in 1989, and she's never looked better. 

2. Hard water can be easily removed with vinegar and baking soda, a Mr. Clean Magic Eraser, or bleach.  

Tips to potential guests: 

1. If you're particularly sensitive to mold, mildew, or weird smells in general, this hotel is not for you. 

2. Bring socks and wear AT ALL TIMES. 

3. If you're lucky enough to have more than one bed in your room, try this fun game: 
a) corral ALL THINGS on said bed (again, at all times), 
b) pretend that you're playing a grown-up version of the playground game "hot lava monster".
c) first person or thing to touch the ground loses!

All the reviews on this hotel are spot on and I will say that I, too had water pressure issues.  The shower was awful.

Also, during my stay there were issues with the mechanics of the door lock; it just wouldn't open when I slid the key in.  I had to try to unlock it about 10x to even get a green flashing "SUCCESS, Open says me!" sign.  I know it wasn't just the effects of too much alcohol one night as even the maid had issues and the three other women who stayed in the room with me did as well. 

I didn't leave the MC thinking I'd like to return.  It just seemed like a regular place to stay with serious water issues they need to address.  Also, I felt as if the Monte Carlo wants to give off the impression they are a cool place to stay while in Vegas.  They aren't.
Forget it. We had a room next to the construction site ( facing north? ) workers loud speak, excavators how are reversing with loud beeping, nailer clacking, etc... It was terrible.

Will not stay at this hotel again!  There are plenty of M-Life selections to choose from for our next trip in April.  Mold in the shower knob? Hard water crust on the shower head? Ripped carpet down the hallway towards your room?  Are you frigging serious?!?! Wow.....the towels do not smell clean nor the bed sheets.  Yuck!

I've read the reviews of those that had bad experiences, and I can only base my review on what I experienced.  I found it to be a great value, great location, easy check-in, good service and great gaming. I didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but had many beverages in the casino. Best Bloody Mary I've had in recent memory (at the bar by the sports book).  I'd go back.

Great for a short or long stay.

Great secure parking. 

Magical shopping centre in the style of Rome down below.

Great staff.

Makes one feel like a million bucks.

I wasn't expecting much out of this hotel, I am not sure why. 

I guess it just flew below the radar for me as far as hotel options go. But we found a great deal, and decided to go for a friend's birthday weekend.

The hotel staff was ultra friendly. The hotel is clean, the hallways are a bit old (carpet) and not so clean but they weren't too bad.

The little club\/lounge called Brand, downstairs actually played good music, and the food at the buffet, not too shabby.

They have some fun slots here, like the Crazy Olives and the Lord of the Rings game.

Overall, I like the hotel and was pleasantly surprised:)

Awesome location, right smack dab in the middle of the strip, and with easy access to City Center.

Interior decor is nice, it's not run down or dirty.  It actually reminds me of a slightly downgraded version of the Bellagio.

Pretty simple & boring casino.  The Deal or No Deal slot (which kept giving good payout) was under maintenance 4 of the 5 times I attempted to play.  

Not much to do on this property.  But it's so close to City Center, that I didn't find this to be much of a problem.  Parking lot is also not a nightmare, so I could easily hop into my car & adventure away.  ***They will be opening two new bars in the near future, including a Minus 5 Ice Bar.  Something to look forward to.

The valet was really great.  I have to say this because at other properties, they usually yell at you for even pulling into the valet lane if you're just doing a pick up.  A friend picked me up, and the valet allowed her to just wait in the front, off to the side (instead of having to circle around again).  They were super nice and chill about it.  

The bell desk was prompt with my bags.  Upon check out, I left my luggage with the bell desk and told them I'd be getting my car from the parking lot.  As I pulled up to the front, my things were right there waiting for me.  No mix up, or anything.  

Buffet was very limited, didn't try the rest of the other eateries (there's about 7 others).  I did make visits to the nice little food court for fast eats.

I could see the pool from my room, and it was very active and crowded.  A live DJ was spinning loud music.  

Room was okay, although the drain in the tub was disturbingly clogged.  The TV is the older box kind, which meant that there were some discolorations on the display.  

I noticed that there were many families with children, something to take into consideration.

My keys kept getting deprogrammed, because the front desk had a discrepancy with my reservation.  I had to go down there 3 times, and  because it was during 4th of July weekend, the wait was horrendous.  There was someone else in line who had problems with their keys, too... Interesting.

Resort fee is low ($12+tax on my most recent stay)... Although no one explained to me all the perks that were included with it until my 3rd night there :(  In case no one informs you, it includes in-room internet, use of the fitness center, printing of tickets, and two water bottles\/per day.

For the low rate I got, I'd stay again.

I stayed in Vegas several of times and I can say that Monte Carlo was one of the worst hotels I ever experienced the outside is fancy but when I walked in my room it was not modern at all they had loud construction at 9 am that woke me up not only that they don't have refrigerators nor microwaves the tv only have about 15 channels mainly sports because of the loud noise I asked if I could get my room switched which they did this room was a lil better it was newer fashion but when I took a shower the water wasn't getting hot so I called the front desk and she told me to let the water run for 20-25 mins smh worst hotel ever!!

The pool area gets 4 stars. Would get 5 if no kids were allowed.

The rooms get 3 stars. The bathroom gets one as the showerhead was about a foot below my head. no Wi-Fi sucks.

The place is inexpensive so 4 stars for the price

We went to Vegas in July and we stayed at the Monte Carlo. I thought since we're staying during the weekdays and not going to be in Vegas for the weekend, that it's not going to be busy. My friends always tell me that July is the hottest month to go to Vegas and many people won't be there, but when we check in. The lady at the counter said they were all booked up so if we wanted to upgrade to a better room, we couldn't. Plus, the lady charged us for a resort fee. And the resort fee is basically wired internet, NOT even wireless and water. (-1star)

The room was simple; two queen beds, a desk and TV. No mini refrigerator or microwave. At least we had a view of the pool. The room was clean though, with fresh linen and bedding. Coming up to the room I noticed the air quality of the hotel (elevator, the hallway) and casino was NOT good, it was really warm, it seems like the A\/C wasn't on or working properly. We left our room at 60C during our stay. 

The pools were great. They have a couple different types of pools: Wave pool, lazy pool & the regular pool. The only thing was that the pool area closed at 7pm. I wanted to go to the pool at night when it's still hot outside, but couldn't.  (-1 star)

Monte Carlo has a monorail that goes to Bellagio, plus a walkway that connected to Aria. The monorail was nice b\/c we didn't have to walk all the way up the strip. Overall, our stay was good for the price we have paid.

Dates 10\/12-10\/16\/2016. Very disappointing stay. Upon arrival we were told there was no pool and if we wanted to use one we would need to walk 15 minutes over to the MGM. We were not told the hotel was in the middle of a renovation and all the stores in the hotel on the Street of Dreams were closed with the exception of 2 souvenir shops near the lobby. The wi-fi was very slow and sketchy at times . At the buffet though you could see many tables available there always seemed to be a wait. Maybe short staffed? Ice bucket in the room was dirty and no plastic bags were left(though they were delivered after a call to housekeeping). 
I'm not really sure why we were still charged a resort fee (was told this was also for use of the gym, which of course I don't care to use on vacation!)
Would not recommend stating here, especially  any time soon with the renovation going on.

We have stayed many places in Las Vegas but never here and now I know why.

45 minute check in only to go to our room and have someone already in there.  Reason behind that was they wrote the wrong number down at check in.

We get in our room to discover we have no washcloths the light is burned out in the bathroom and the bathtub is not draining.  

For all these things they comped the buffet and the resort fee.  Thank goodness I didn't pay for that meal.  it was The Worst!   The selection of food was very disappointing but maybe a blessing because what they did have was horrible.

Continue to checkout,  what a surprise that they charged us our meal, our resort fee, and a random $20 charge not even the manager could explsin.

NEVER AGAIN!

As with all hotels on the strip, after they are open for 2 years -- they become boring. I really like this hotel since it's inexpensive (like back in 2008 when it caught fire, and called them to make reservations for a trade show in June ... $39 bucks baby!) Hey, so what if I take advantage of their misfortune? 

But, from what I remember ... I *think* we are in the age of technology! I was up in Hotel 32 (the top floor of the Monte Carlo) and couldn't check in to any location INSIDE the hotel, let alone make a phone call. Come to find out they have all these iPhone apps, so I wonder if they have a deal with AT&T ... so guess what all you AT&T peeps, THIS is THE PLACE where you get CELL RECEPTION! So each time I had to make a phone call, or check in to any restaurant inside Monte Carlo, or the spa, I had to leave the building. I was baffled that I was practically on the roof of this building and STILL couldn't get any reception. Blah, this is the FIRST time in 16 years that I found a location Verizon isn't at. No wonder they still have land lines in all the rooms, huh?

The staff is always friendly, and I always get an early check in. The spa and the gym are nice, but this visit I was put off by the weird *aroma* they had piped throughout the casino. We all seemed to notice this, and each time I left the casino I was happy to take a deep breath of Vegas diesel air on The Strip.

Can't wait for my last day here, which is tomorrow! 
This has all been a very stressful experience. I definitely suggest you rethink your visit here during their reconstruction. 
There is no front entrance to the check-in counter. We had to park so far and walk through several hallways just to get to the check in counter. 
At the check in counter was the shortest line with the longest wait, frustrating right? 
We finally got to our room and realized the toilet wasn't working right. The room isn't what you would expect. I used to think Monte Carlo was one of the nicer properties, today I know better.
No bottled water as promised, no coffee maker, no mini fridge. I spent $10 this morning just on some liquids to keep myself hydrated. I woke up this morning like a fish out of water, the a\/c blew warm air all night. Talk about waking up like a raisin. I wish it was because I drank and partied so much last night, but no-it's because the a\/c was bad. Oh, no pool of their own for me to jump in when it is 103 degrees out.
To make matters worse, I woke up to the sounds of jack hammers and drilling. Not a very soothing way to wake up. 
I understand that it is not the hotels fault, they are under construction. I do think they should at least give their guests $50 vouchers so we can at least go get some water and coffees and your property for he inconvenience while you guys get up and running. I don't think we would have a problem staying here with you guys if you guys were more understanding with us.

It's not the hottest newest hotel in Vegas that's for sure.
But it's also not the worst.
I've stayed here a few times.
The location is awesome and the rooms are a good price.
Hotel staff has always been super friendly to us, and our rooms have been clean, luckily.
In the summertime they play music out by the pool. It manages to be sort of relaxing even though it's crowded. There were people of all ages which I didn't mind. I don't appreciate bros with bacon skin and hair gel fist pumping, so although its not a Vegas beach party in the Carlo's pool area, it's still fun enough.

Also, this hotel is pretty small especially by Vegas standards, so when you and your drunken girlfriends come back from partying, in your clubwear and heels, gripping each others hands for dear life so you don't fall ass over tea kettle onto the casino carpet, you can STILL find your room. 

I appreciated the little convenience store where I bought mini bottles of champagne and the Starbucks downstars. They have a candy store too, which was fun, but the one in the Paris is better. 

It's not glitzy, but it's decent for the price and service is nice.

I've been to Las Vegas a good share of times in my life and I always stay at a different hotel on each trip. I'm one of those people who always look forward to experiencing something new!! And it would be pretty accurate if you were to say I also prefer "the finer things in life".

So my family and I are on a 3 day vacation in Las Vegas. The vacation was offered through a third party. The options for hotels were Excalibur, Rio, Stratosphere or the Monte Carlo. Of course I chose the Monte Carlo over the others. It's right in the middle of all the action ON THE STRIP. 

Pulling up to the hotel was a bit disappointing because there's a lot of construction going on just outside the entrance. As I tried to snap pictures of the front of the hotel I thought "this sucks".  Nonetheless, I was still excited about our stay. 

Once we got to our room.... The long face and diva attitude was in full throttle. We paid for a room upgrade through the third party and received the most basic, standard room in the hotel. There is nothing nice about this room. The wallpaper is peeling off the walls around the baseboards in the room and bathroom.  It looks to be the original furniture from when the hotel was first built. I stated, we could've done better at a Marriott!! After spending a little more than an hour complaining over the phone we decided to hurry and hit the pool, BEFORE IT CLOSES at 5:00!! Yes, 5:00pm. (Check-in starts at 3pm; there were tons of people checking in at 3:00. The line looked like we were waiting for the DMV to open!!) 

They have three nice-sized pools. Well, a pool, a lazy river & a wave pool (like Raging Waters). It was only about 70 degrees outside so the hubby and I went for the jacuzzi. Yuck!! It was gross!! You could see the oil and dirt in the water. I felt like I was sitting in someone's dirty bath water. I couldn't take it. I went to the lazy river until it closed, which was much better. Oh and there are plenty of lifeguards around too which is really nice. 

When we returned to the room we showered so we could go out and sightsee. More disgust: the shower head is corroded and the water sprays out like a strong mist; the pressure is low because the lever that switches the tub to the shower is broken and won't extend fully, half the water comes from the shower head the other half comes out the faucet; the drain must be clogged because the water goes down EXTREMELY slow!! You end up standing in your soapy shower water the entire time. I don't have a newly renovated bathroom at home and my shower in my house is far better than this!

I tried to make the most of the weekend and as much as I wanna complain I said "no, I'm not gonna be THAT GIRL".  My hubby says just write a review to let other people know this place sucks. (Not his exact words, but that sums it up relatively close.) I waited. I didn't wanna write my review while I was upset. We enjoyed our night out on the strip and a good night's sleep. When I went to grab my cellphone from under my pillow this morning there was a looooooong blonde hair in my hand as well!! Ewwwww, how disgusting!!! My braids in my hair are a #1B!! For those who don't follow, I'm black!! I've had enough, this place will never get my money again!!

Stayed here over a weekend. Their parking lot was not yet finished, so we ended up parking in a lot next to the NY NY parking structure. Nicely decorated front desk area with quick check in. Our room was decent sized with two queen beds with very comfortable mattresses. Overall, the casino theme is a little generic, but there was a nice variety of slot machines and table games to browse around. Not too busy and a decent location on the strip. Not sure if I would spend as much to stay here again.

I'm ONLY giving them a one star because they have a food court in the hotel which includes Starbucks, McDonalds, Sbarro's and other little restaurants.  The casino was decent and not too crowded.  As for the rooms it was not what I expected at all! Now I understand why the rooms were pretty cheap is because they look pretty cheap.  The bathroom itself looked so grungy and dirty that I almost didn't want to shower in them. The room looked dirty when first walking in.  It's liked the cleaning service just vaccumed for a minute and then they were done.  The reason I know this hotel was not very clean to any standard is because the day we left my brother got bed bug bites all over his body!!!!!!!!!! Not just a couple but more than 50!! This just disgusts me for a Vegas hotel on the strip to give somebody bed bug bites and rashes all over! This hotel needs to be inspected from inside and out for bacteria, bites, mold, and so much more!

I am not a happy customer and will never be going back to this hotel again!

After seven years of staying at this hotel! we are severely disappointed in the customer service and the way we have been treated by the staff from the time that we have entered the facility. We were never notified that the hotel was going to be under construction when we booked it in June and we were told by the concierge service that that's too bad that it's been noted on all the websites which it hasn't been.. we were told to go to adjoining casinos and hotels to use the pool!!!!! What the f...? We have heard Jackhammering on since we've have arrived! Now told jackhammer will be from 8 o'clock in the morning and till 530 at night, Monday through Friday the whole time we are going to be here ???? This is what we spent our money to go on vacation for? I would never come here again or recommend it to anybody we know!!!! Worst experience in customer service we have ever had!

nasty!!!! do not stay here. Not worth anything. Old and outdated
 Very nasty. On the strip, but super nasty
 Do not stay here. Do not stay here. Do not!
We ate at the buffet.  Food was just ok considering what it cost!  We were mainly there to see the show. ....which was Cher and that was great.

Our personal favorite for location, price, reasonably-priced table games and our favorite slot machine we can find nowhere else (Good Times, look for it when the multiplier is up past 7x, we've won hundreds on it multiple times... and dropped more than that trying to win....)  A great food 
court, nice enough rooms.

I'll make this short and sweet - 

PROS:
- Good location - cab rides to various hotels on the strip were around $10 or less
- Starbucks, McDonald's, fastfood in the hotel 
- Relaxed casino (they advertise $5 Blackjack but there was only one table)
- Friendly staff that cares - everyone was really, really nice. I had a package delivered and they sent someone to unlock the business office for me even though it was closed 

CONS:
- NO FREE WI-FI - this ended up being a HUGE pain in the butt, especially when we wanted to look for places to eat on Yelp or look other stuff up! 
- No mini fridge - the ice machine was also broken on our floor so that ended up being annoying for the drinks we bought  

Basically, what you pay is what you get here. I went to Vegas during Thanksgiving weekend with three other girlfriends and it ended up being $99 \/ person for four nights. Honestly, I wouldn't have minded paying $20 more per night to have wi-fi, mini fridge, etc. But if you want somewhere cheap and convenient, this is it!

Room are decent for the price. Front desk staff is LACKING in training. The person that checked me in told be she was holding one amount on my card but really held a larger amount. When i called to let management know perhaps this person needed more training I was belittled snide comments by a manager named Ryan. I have traveled a lot of places and have never been tread like this not even at small mom and pop hotels, but especially not in Vegas!

I wouldn't stay here again. We got a couple rooms for my birthday. This place did absolutely nothing special, was full of kids running around unsupervised. The pool closes at 7 and good luck getting anyone to bring you a drink. One day one of the pools shut down because a kid vomited in it, the next day it was closed because a kid shit in it. The buffet there was mediocre, not terrible. The steakhouse where we had my birthday dinner was pretty good. I didn't expect the red carpet to unroll for my birthday but I thought the least they could do was comp the resort fees or the cost of a mini fridge for my room.

Family stayed on comps for two days before driving back to SD last week. My first time in the actual hotel rooms, as I had sampled the casino area before. Atypical Vegas facade hiding the rancid vanilla interior. Clientele on both nights were mostly aging boomers. Crossed my tolerance threshold for loud Hawaiian shirts and fanny packs way too early in the evening. And this was on a Wednesday. 

Room rate was decent, comparable to what you'd pay for an off-strip hotel on a weekend, I suppose. I sat and drank at one of the lounges on the floor and shat the ish with my constantly traveling cuz for a couple hours while trying to get a feel for the place. Bartender gave me a Crown Royal bag and a glass, I guess they had some promo or whatever and they had extras...so one up for that.  

Like Cindy Crawford's mole, this one's all about location. As always, Everyday Bonus Points for spotting the prostitutes.

Had a great 4 night stay.

Pros:
Quick check in and friendly staff.
Nice updated rooms
Clean rooms
Good views
LOCATION 
Great selection of restaurants

Cons:
Mushy pillows
Low water pressure in shower.
Hard to get a drink in the casino.

Based on service, rooms, price, and location I'd absolutely stay again.

If your expectations for Las Vegas are a giant rotting roadside motel with a casino on the first floor, you won't be disappointed! I waited 30 minutes to check in and was looking forward to my deluxe king room on the 28th floor. So I was a bit more than shocked when I walked in the room only to be hit with a stomach churning smell of vomit.

Luckily the front desk changed my room to the 7th floor facing the construction and nonstop garbage trucks. At least the smell didn't make me sick but I felt more empathy for the vommiter on the 28th floor. Maybe they had the same experience with their room as I did- other people hair stuck in the towels and wash clothes, phlegm dried on the shower wall, and a crusty mildewed bathroom.

The base for a hotel is cleanliness but for a "resort" you may also expect furniture that is not falling apart or stained. You might want to use the pool or not have giant booming g construction sounds in your $200 massage. This would not be place for you then. 

May lady luck be with you on your trip to Las Vegas, the luckiest thing you could do is not end up at the Monte Carlo.

Ughhh this hotel needs to remodel their rooms. The bathroom, cabinetries, fittings and bedrooms are very outdated. The showers were probably the worst thing about this place. If you're 6ft tall you probably have dealt with shower heads that are wayyy too low. Monte Carlo is no different. Bottom of the shower head is at 5'9".

Even though valet and bell service was nice, they were handled separately. So you essentially have to tip 2 people instead of one. Front desk service, on the other hand, was awful.

What this hotel does have to offer is its great location. Right next to a CVS and very close to the city center. Either way, I probably would try another hotel before I came back to Monte Carlo.

We were going to a concert at the new T-Mobile arena across the street so we decided to make a night of it and got a room at the Monte Carlo. That way we did not have to deal with the arena parking and could do valet at the Monte Carlo.  MGM properties now charge for parking so it cost us $13 a night for valet.  I know that is low compared to many big cities but you should not have to pay in Vegas. If we had done self parking, it would have been free since my mom is a local.

So we have to wait in a long check-in line but the process goes smoothly.  We got our room keys and headed up to the room.  And this where it all went downhill.  The room is #29130 so 29th floor, way at the end of one hallway. The room is supposed to non-smoking.  We open the door and its as if they have been smoking in that room for years and just that day made it non-smoking.  It was awful.  Every time we came back to the room or left the bathroom, it was like we were stepping into an ashtray.  Since we were only there one night, we did not ask for a new room but I would have if we had a longer stay.  The maid was in the hallway and we told her the issue and she did spray something but it did not make it go away completely.  

Also the hotel rooms and hotel itself are looking very dated and warn down. Everything needs to be remodeled.  New furniture, new fixtures.  Also, there were basically no plugs in our room except one wall plug and one behind the night stand.  Where are you supposed to plug in your phone or computer!?

So I definitely will not be staying here again unless they remodel.

Honestly, I can barely remember being in my room the entire weekend I spent at the Monte Carlo.  But I slept like a fucking baby eeeeverynight on their cushy beds (and not just because I was extremely drunk) and loved all of their freebie provided toiletries.  Best hotel shampoo ever.

The casino is okay. The cocktail waitresses were kind to us despite the fact that we were playing like dime slots. The pool is fantastic. Nothing cures a hangover like a frozen drink and a float down the Lazy River. 

The location of the Monte Carlo is really what's best, as you end up with a decent level of comfort and posh in the midst of great clubs, and only walking distance from others.

When it comes down to it? A great deal.

After reading the other reviews I have myself a panic attack prior to our arrival. We booked our trip months ago and chose Monte Carlo based on price and location. And we got exactly what we paid for. We can get to the monorail in 15 minutes, 15 minutes from airport and its in the middle of everything. Bellhops were great from
The get go. Concierge has been dealing with me over the phone for months. My Vegas app helped us get comps without gambling. 

We got the cheapest room- it's fine! This is an older hotel. But pillows and sheets are great. Shower has awesome
Pressure, tv is up to date. We got a pool view, it's not the Best- but this room was $40 a night.. On the strip! 

As long as your not planning on spending your whole trip in your room
Or trying to overly impress someone, this place is great. Staff is really sweet,
Very pleased so far. 

There is construction, but this is the off season. It's very windy so only one pool open- this is not the resorts fault. Might still take a hot tub, when in Vegas!

Worst hotel experience in my life. And I've stayed in some sketchy places in Africa, Asia and the Middle East.

The best part of this place was entering the lobby. It's magnificent. Beautiful. Elegant.  And the room was clean and tastefully decorated.

But...

The final rating suffers because the hotel falls so short of expectations. A pretty lobby is nice, and a clean room is to be expected even of an economy place.  For a "resort" hotel, the bar is higher.  You expect luxurious amenities.  You expect everything to be well prepared and for your room to be ready to go from the minute you walk in.  Ours was not.

First, access to the fitness center is NOT included in your nightly room rate.  I have stayed at many different hotels across the country and around the world, and this is the first time I've run into this. Maybe it's a Vegas thing? But it was a huge shock to learn I had to pay an extra $20 a night for something that even Holiday Inn includes at no extra charge.

Next, we found out that Monte Carlo's rooms do not have wi-fi internet access at all. There's a single ethernet cable to connect a single laptop, so your wi-fi tablet, smart phone or other device is useless in your hotel room.  If you want to stream a movie on Netflix or surf the web on an iPad, tough crap. Monte Carlo can't get it done.  Even the Extended Stay America I was at the other night could support that one.

Worse, the ethernet cable in our room was damaged by a prior guest, so we had to wait about 20 minutes for an engineer to come up and replace it.  And the picture quality on the beautiful flat screen TV was horrible, so we were pretty darn bored waiting for that engineer.

This morning we got up and wanted to make coffee.  Two problems arose -- first, due to a lack of electrical outlets, we had to crawl around behind the desk to unplug the table lamp so we could plug in the coffee maker.  Then, after making the coffee, we noticed there was no cream or sugar in the room.  We had to call down for that, and that meant our coffee was cold by the time we had cream and sugar for it.

What century does this hotel's management think we're in?  Who would put a phone, lamp and coffee maker on a desk with only two electrical outlets, and have that as the only desk in the whole room upon which guests might want to connect their laptops, recharge cell phones and other devises, etc.?  In the 21st Century, people need plugs.  This room didn't even have enough for the stuff that was already in the room before we got there, let alone for our electronic gear.

I'd love to unwind in the jacuzzi, but found out after working out this morning that would cost an extra $10 per person per use -- and the wife and I would have to be in separate rooms since they're "clothing optional" and the sexes are kept separate.  Is this 1912 instead of 2012?  How about one place for families to enjoy where folks just have to bite their lip and remain clothed?  Would that be too much to expect? 

And the fitness center closes at 7 p.m.  So you'd better not be someone who likes to work out in the evening.  WTH?  Just about every other place I've stayed is open at least until 9 p.m.

The pool closes early, too.  So no night swimming after a long day in the Vegas sun.  Wanna cool off?  Sneak into another hotel's swimming pool.  Monte Carlo does not have your travel needs in mind.

In November 2013, I had a good experience. When we checked in, we had very friendly help & we were surprised with a comped daily buffet for two. Nice! The food was very good. Our room was very clean and I was so happy to be getting a great view from the 23rd floor. The floor was quiet and I had no trouble sleeping. One thing that I was disappointed with was that there was no wifi in the room.

We just stayed at this hotel and it was nice especially for the price.  I was a little scared to stay there after read some of these reviews, but my experience was a good one.  Yes the walls are thin so you can hear things,  but a lot of Hotels are like that if people are loud. The only thing I did not like was the fact that you pay a resort fee and you can't bring anything to drink or eat by the pool, not even a bottled water.  That is why i only give it a 4 star rating. But I will say the staff was great, and I would stay there again for sure.

Not recommended; if there was something lower than 1 star, I would click it. The Monte Carlo used to be my choice to stay and gamble in Las Vegas for nearly my entire life. I loved their slow river pool that meandered through tunnels and under palm trees and water falls, they had nice quiet lobby without long waits, they had a Poker Room and great food at low cost food. The MGM has bought the Monte Carlo and gutted it. There is no longer a river pool (just a bunch of rectangle pools being built; you must get bused to another hotel to swim during the reconstruction. The most beautiful poker room has been taken out so you have go to Aria Casino next door to play poker (which his not bad and their rooms are nice), the cost of food is out of site (a cheap breakfast for two is $50 to $100!!!). Their renovations look bad and the hard surfaces produce loud noisy echo sounds so you can't even think. There is no mini refrigerator, microwave of coffee maker (I have never seen that at a high end hotel). Low end drinks are about $9 to $14. The upstairs Diablo restaurant was rented for a wedding party and the food was so salty that several people had to spit it out and commented to me on the extreme levels salt (maybe 2x or 3x of what was needed). The choice of beer and wine at the Diablo was terrible. The room prices are rather pricey too. The shower drains were slow, the toilet loud, and dirty water spots were all over the bathroom floor when we walked in. Nope, it is no longer the an affordable, quiet, relaxing place  with reasonably priced good food. I guess times are changing in Las Vegas. Look at my past reviews on Yelp; you will see I rarely use Yelp just to say something bad.

Omg Valet parking is now $13\/day, Yikes!!! This weekend was my 3rd time staying here and it's really basic. It never disappoints on price. The rooms are a decent size and adequately clean.. The maids are really nice they don't mind giving out extra towels..The casino is good, watered down drinks sometimes but always good service from the dealers. I personally like that there is no smokey smell on the Casino level. Overall it's not quite spectacular, but you can stay there is you're on a budget :-)

I'm giving this hotel a great rating for a few reasons. Read below!

So when we checked in we were told the Monaco Suite we paid for was on the 7th floor an not the highest floor (we expected 30 and higher) so "Woody" who checked us in let us know that there was a room available the next day on the 30th floor and that he would save it for us. I liked that he did that, it showed how he is willing to go above and beyond and that the Monte Carlo has terrific customer service.  We also interacted with the concierge and I found that they were also very nice, helpful and willing to give us all and any info we needed to get to whatever or wherever we needed and how much a cab should cost to where we were going so we don't get ripped off!

There may not be a lot going on at this hotel but the staff are super friendly and helpful so we are moat definitely coming back and staying here next time!

Monte Carlo is not a bad hotel. It has the basics: store, slots, and a few restaurants. It's nothing fancy but it'll work. We paid $49 for it which is probably the only reason why we stayed 4 nights. 

However, here were my problems with the hotel: 
- we checked in at 2:30 AM (a very long travel story) to them having all their computers down for maintenance. We were seriously penciled in and I had to provide my printed reservation to confirm the price we were paying. 
- when we were given our room, the receptionist actually said, "i can't tell you the state of this room because our computers are down"; what kind of rooms are you letting people stay in? 
- smoking room, smoking hall. see above 2 points for why this was given to nonsmokers 
- 26th floor. Okay, no complaint about actual floor, but we were 26 levels up and I could hear the pool music like it was outside my door. It played at a ridiculous high level until 5 pm every day. This does not add relaxation to a trip. 
- paper thin walls. Our neighbor received a phone call around 9 am every morning. They are apparently not light sleepers because it took about the 5th ring to answer this call every morning. I guess I should be lucky that's all I heard 

I think this would be a good hotel if you're only staying a night or two and plan to be in the casinos 24 hours

I don't understand all the hate on the Monte Carlo.  If you're visiting Vegas, you could do much worse: you get a reasonable rate, one of the best locations on the Strip, a clean and modern hotel, and you're a short walk to the Bellagio to do all the Vegas stuff you really want to do, fountains, restaurants, Cirque, classy gambling etc.

And hey if you take one of those Xanex that's only supposed to be for flying, shoot vodka at Diablo's, stand before the fountain out front and close your eyes and have your significant other whisper in your ear in French, you'll almost trick yourself into thinking you're at the real Monte Carlo.  Tre fantastique!

Great location on the strip! Very accessible to NY NY, MGM, Cosmo, & Aria. Pretty easy stroll the many other casinos and to bus stops. Not a ton to do inside the casino, but really enjoyed playing Pai Gow Poker here. The dealers were very nice. The room was ok, definitely starting to show its age, but very comfortable and clean.

Do not get the Monaco suite!! Total rip off,  it's not a suite, just a big room. The room was dirty and had old coffee still in the coffee maker. We where in the room for about 4 hours before we couldn't take it anymore and complained. The ONLY reason I am giving three stars is because they have us a free upgrade to the diamond suite! That room is AMAZING. Very satisfied with that. However that's a very expensive room, had we not gotten the upgrade we couldn't have afforded it. 

         The pool, lazy river and wave pool are supper gross and small. The water is a milky color, and they are all wayyy small. Lame. 

      Over all the hotels carpets where dirty...room service is NOT 24 hours and it's supper overpriced! $100 for breakfast for 2 and it took an hours to show up. 

Had we not be givin the free upgrade we would have left on the first night. Only plus $5 black jack! I will not stay at this hotel agian.

My brother is a contractor who is employeed to renovate hotels - thus when I stay in one I check details - and this place needs a major rehaul!  I noticed the bathrooms are not equipped for handicapped individuals - showers\/tubs have no handels, the toilets are all low and the entry to each room have a marbel (??) surface that is slippery - an accident waiting to happen - especially when some of these customers have drunk way too much!
It is a place to put yopur head - yes - although the bed is softer on one side than another!

SPEND SOME MONEY HERE AND RENOVATE IT IS ABOUT TIME!!!!

I chose to stay at the Monte Carlo because we had a Seminar that was taking place there. First let me say,I do not understand how this place even rated as a supposed 4 star hotel in Las Vegas.

When we first got here the line up for checking in was so long that I was embarrassed with my staff. Okay now off to the room. Maybe we can start over. Wrong!.  The room looked like they were renovated in the 80s. I would say its spacious There was an old air con\/fan that made terrible noises every 2 minutes so it was useless.  The blankets are paper thin too and I caught a cold during my third nights stay.  The bathtub is so shallow and old and nasty. I didn't even want to complain because I figured they would only move to a different room with the same amenities. I would have rather stayed in a Comfort suites than this place. We were only there for 2 nights so I did not spend much time in my room. The restaurants that were in the hotel and next to it outside were overall good but nothing spectacular. I will definitely not stay here again. I will stay at The Mandalay but I wonder how does this place stay in the M Life group of Hotels.
Needless to say I am ready to get out of there on Sunday AM and I'm waiting in line again for over 20 minutes to check out. Sorry Avoid this place!!!

This place is getting a little old, but it's still a pretty decent hotel. I love that it's conveniently located on the strip. You can get to pretty much every hotel with out much effort and it's super easy to park here. I also appreciate that the lobby is non smoking and that I don't have to walk through the smoky casino in order to get to the lobby or my room.

How is this place considered a 4 star hotel?

PROS:
- Good shower water pressure

CONS:
- Showerhead really low, if you like water hitting your chest instead of your hair (6' tall here).
- Bathtub clogged, backs up water when you take a shower.
- No cover on the drainage.
- No USB charging, anywhere. This is 2017, not 1980.
- There's a giant construction site going on NEXT DOOR that you can hear from the 14th floor.
- Soundproofing is terrible if you want to hear your neighbor's every flush.
- The freaking table CREAKS is how old it is, and they moved the lamp over a giant freaking hole.
- Furniture is chipped, and there's no sitting chair by the window that's pretty standard at most hotels.
- Asked for a King room, get a double.
- Crack in the ceiling of the room seems legit
- Hallway carpet bulges\/bubbles out, indicating water damage.
- They charge $7 to print out a boarding pass? Nice nickel and diming.
- Cable TV has a lot less channels than you'd see at a Marriott.

Honestly, I should have spent my money at the Marriott, which is consistent in maintenance and unkeep. Monte Carlo was not an upgrade at all.

I see many bad reviews about the cleanliness of this casino but it was only $58 plus $36 resort fee
So I thought I give it a shot.  It's a 5 min walk to aria
And not too far from Mandalay bay which is where our convention was held.  I would of paid more to stay at Mandalay bay but it was $575 a night there.  I guess because the convention was held there.  
Overall the rooms design is very poor.  Nothing special, probably worse than holiday in.  The tv was nice and bathrooms are nice though.  Overall very clean and shower water was strong enough.  I guess it should be more of a 3star but given the price and cleanliness, it deserves a 4 star this time.

This review is based on my stay here this past weekend: This room was so gross lets just say I felt the need to put paper down before I used the bathroom. The public bathrooms in the casino were cleaner than the one in the room. The room was so dusty it looked like it had not been touched for months. There was hair on the bathroom\/foyer floors. The walls\/doors had red marks on them. The furniture had chips all over it. I even paid extra for a "nicer" room. This room is in desperate need of a rennovation. I Will NOT be staying here again any time soon or even recommending it to any one. I am giving 2 stars as it was not the worst place I've ever stayed but not as nice as they market themsleves to be.

The power went out for about a four hour period while we were there, which is totally not the hotel's fault, so I can't blame them.  I've never seen so many people in suits scrambling and freaking out before in my life.

The lobby is really nice.  Like, super fancy.  But if you get just a normal room, it's a hotel room like any other hotel room.  Nothing really exciting to note.  A bed, a chair, a TV we didn't use, and a bathroom.  It's a hotel, it's what you expect.
It was clean and nice.

Like most of the hotels on the strip, it's a bit of a maze to get through and is confusing your first day.  After that, you should know where the important things are and should be able to find your way easily enough.

Like everything else in the area, everything is overpriced.  It's the drawback of being in Vegas.  Be prepared to spend $5 on a bottle of water.

It's got some restaurants and coffee shops in it.  So really, you could spend your whole vacation in the hotel.  But that sounds like a terrible vacation.

This place is a dump. 

Rooms are outdated - not just looks-wise, but they offer no amenities such as ipod docks, or even tv-checkout services. Beds are comfortable. 

Our bathroom was fine, but shower had very little water pressure resulting in lukewarm showers. And the tub dripped incessantly. 

The valet doesn't do call-downs either. Ugh. What hotel doesn't offer this service? 

Average restaurants, average casino - won't be back.

Two words:  old and outdated.

Pretty much sums it up.  It's great for cheap table games during the day but other than that it doesn't really lure me to stay there.  It has low ceilings in the gambling area which makes the place REALLY smokey and hard to stay long (for someone who gets migraines).  It really reminds me of how Vegas used to be 20 years ago and has never since updated.

Plus, I'm sure the real Monte Carlo does not look like this!

It sucks no couch in the room. The line to check in took an entire hour to finish. The room had no coffee maker or fridge. They didn't even allow us to request for one. Only 2 glass cups in the room, without a paper or plastic cup in site. Would definitely not recommend spending a day here even for just one like I did.

We loved the monte...great location and we have always had top notch service. We stay here a few times a year and usually have nothing but wonderful things to say and recommend it to our friends and family. That being said this stay was incredibly different after a few hours wait for the room we had to move three different times due to bad odor, uncleanliness and filth. Even the third room had hair, dirt and a leaky faucet in the bathroom but we were too nervous of what we may get next to move again. I have never asked to change rooms in a hotel ever. There was also a room service cart full of half eaten food, not ours, parked outside our room for over 2 days and when I called to ask to see if someone could retrieve the food the front desk attendant snapped that I should call room service to do so it was not her job . For the most part The service and amenities were up to par but it is sad to say we spent the rest of the trip discussing other options for a hotel next time we head to Vegas.

I stayed here October 2009 on my first trip to Vegas. I thought it was a nice hotel for the money, nicely located on the strip.  It's pretty small, which is nice because it doesn't take you twenty minutes to get from the entrance to your room. The staff was friendly and quick to help. The casino was cool and the dealers were nice. The music in the casino was hip, and a few good restaurants.  Oh....loved the steak and eggs at around 4 am!  Brand has a good lounge at night too with a great DJ.  Cool place to hang if you're not in the mood for a club and want reasonable prices. 
Downsides: Rooms were...eh. Nothing special. Didn't like that there weren't fitted sheets on the bed.  My boyfriend is a germaphobe and was really worried his hand was gonna touch bare mattress. lol. Also, no club or big attractions in the hotel, so you HAD to go out for everything.  Cabs were a must when headed out in stilletos at night!
Overall, nice clean hotel for the price and good atmosphere. I'd stay here again.
Best stay for your money! Very clean, friendly staff, middle of the strip location, great restaurants, and a relaxing pool. Monte Carlo reminds me a lot of caesars except it's 5x cheaper per night.

We just got back from another great weekend stay at Monte Carlo.  We love this place specifically for the pool and dj.  We always have fun here. 

What we don't like and what gives this review only a 3 star is directly related to the parking fee.  This fee for 12 mgm resorts is obsured. Since the beginning of time Vegas parking has been free for guests of the hotel and also non staying guests who are guests simply gambling. 

What you (mgm)  are doing is simply drawing guests away.  They will find others resorts to stay at if this continues. Nobody wants to pay $8-10 for being a guest.  And also,  we have ALWAYS drove from hotel to hotel to park and gamble and shop.  Now we are afraid to move our car in fear of being charged $8 at each and every hotel.  This is the dumbest idea and needs to go away immediately.  Yes I know this is business but business was just fine the way it was.  I think you will see how much business you'll lose in one years time.

Worst experience and customer service at a hotel I have ever had in Las Vegas. I booked 2 rooms at this hotel with 11 friends who flew in from all parts of the country to celebrate my 30th birthday. Fortunately for some my friends, only four of them we're actually staying at this hotel with me, but we were all very upset with the lack of common courtesy and respect from the hotel customer service. We arrived very early to the hotel in expectance of having such a good time, in the three days we had planned to stay. The amount of construction that was going on literally right outside our window was unbearable to even talk to one another while in our room. We all had headaches within hours of being there because the drilling was just obnoxious. The hotel staff informed us that there was nothing they can do to accommodate us. Construction was from 6:45 in the morning until 5:40 PM, and while we were checking in that first morning, no one informed us what was going on. Not even an apology for the inconvenience. The only piece of information I knew about was the fact that the pool was under a complete remodel. But seriously, I had no idea the actual hotel was being worked on. It was really unfortunate that I had to spend my vacation and 30th birthday in that type of environment. We all spent hundreds of dollars making the trip possible and we will never forget how unbelievably terrible staying at the Monte Carlo was. We will never step foot in that place again!!!

This placed served it's purpose...a low-key place to sleep, relax and have some fun...oh yeah, and not pay an arm and a leg.

Checked in on a Thursday afternoon and was able to check-in before the set check-in time. Got a ready and clean room immediately. First thing I did was check out the room...disappointed with the lack of a few amenities (lack of shower cap, bathroom ventilation, in-room cable and cheesy Vegas guide magazines). 

In reading the other reviews, i looked for the flaws of what others said...thankfully, I wasn't bothered by some of others' comments, including thin walls and poor bedding (if you're like me, you are rarely disturbed in your sleep), The pools were awesome! We came in a group and got a cabana...totally worth it. But if you don't want to go that route...there is plenty of space around the pool. Some people picked the kiddie pool, grabbed some smalls chairs, put them in the pool and voi'la! The wave pool and the lazy river were my favorite. 

There was a variety of food options...from Diablo's Cantina to the Brew Pub to the food court. BTW: careful, the pool does not allow outside food, but allows drinks (i.e. Starbucks, McDonald's...which can be doctored, wink, wink). 

I would come back here for the pools. The hotel itself is nothing special, but if you're looking for something mellow and not too cheesy, this is your place. It is sorta at the end of the strip, but there are several transportation possibilities.

Black check pays 6 to 5 rather than 3 to 2. And if that's not infuriated enough, Valet parking cost $13 for over four hours, eight dollars for under four hours. This should be the next place they blow up.

We stayed here Saturday day\/night and were highly disappointed. We were excited to stay at a resort and this was far from it. The pool is closed FYI - which I feel like should be more prominently labeled so people know that ahead of time not when they're searching for the pool. Also why charge a $30 resort fee when it's not a resort?? No pool, bare-bones hotel room that are extremely outdated. Overall, stay somewhere else in Vegas.

i love this hotel!! the service was fast when you needed something from housekeeping they're there within 5 mins!! i loved the war tables dealer was so friendly, i just didnt like the dealer at the blackjack tables she seem snooty, hahaha but i played one game with her and i won double the amount of money that i had put in :) yay me!!

Darryl P +1

The reason as to why we stayed here was because of the recent remodeling that was done after the fires that ravaged most of the top floors.  In addition, we landed a pretty sweet group deal so no complaints here.  It was no surprise that we would be guests in these aforementioned rooms of bad memories and smokey nightmares.  In addition, I was cheap and not in a good position to stay at the much nicer hotels along the strip (The Bellagio, Venetian, Palazzo, or Mandalay Bay, The Wynn...........you get my drift)

The entrance to the Monte Carlo was nice, however, given their reference to neoclassical structures and Grecian models in white stone.  The service desk to check-in was efficient but a 5:00 pm check-in?  You have got to be kidding.  Our group arrived around 1-ish and thank-the-heavens that the concierge was more than willing to hold onto our bags.

The rooms were deluxe, with two queen beds, decent desk\/chairs, a TV that accidentally got stuck playing the Lance Burton commercials that subliminally entered my mind during those crazy Vegas nights out cold, and a good sized bathroom.  What we (I'm not the only one voicing this sentiment) found disappointing was that the bathroom lacked a ventilation fan.  So every time the shower was utilized, the bathroom was filled with steam and I could hear my roomie complaining about all the steam and my hair all over the sink for the next several days  :p

The casino here is decent and they have a nice variety of tables and slots.  The Blackjack tables are slightly more expensive so my friends wanted to hit the cheaper tables down the strip.  I was very happy dropping a few dollars here and there on the penny slots, however, and played for quite a long time prior to the machine wiping me out.

Staff are extremely helpful, including the security guard who came over to us while we were checking out the model in the lobby.  He gave us some history as to the specific buildings and then let us know that they were there is we needed anything.

Good service, clean rooms.....you basically get what you pay for.  I am, however, a bit disillusioned by the bathroom (lack of ventilation fans and the horrid hard water that dried out my skin) and the fact a hotel that makes millions off the gambling hordes is too cheap to install a water softener, but that could have been attributed to the Lance Burton visions I had after leaving on the TV all night to ward off any evil spirits  ;o)

Meh.

I was booked here by work when I was in town for CES.  I realise that everywhere's expensive during CES, but for the price being paid, I expected a significantly nicer room -- Not one overlooking a construction site where work started every morning at 6am.

The whole place seemed a bit run-down.  Like it was a glamorous place to stay 15 years ago, but now that the Bellagio and Venentian are up, they don't even try any more.

Of particular annoyance was the Lance Burton advert constantly running on the TV in the elevators.  THE CARDS ARE ALL DIFFERENT THE SECOND TIME!  I GET IT!  I LEARNED THAT TRICK WHEN I WAS SEVEN!

On the plus side: In the mornings, there was a blackjack table with a $5 minimum.  That's pretty hard to find on the strip these days.  Also, there's a CVS right outside the front door, so it's easy to get reasonably-priced bottled water, ibuprofen and cigarettes, rather than the exorbitantly marked-up stock in the hotel shop.

We are still guests here but I had to post a review. The only thing I like about the room is the bed. It seems like a motel room. I don't understand why there is no wifi. I think every hotel should offer wifi, even if it is at a charge. I have to go out of the hotel to Aria to conduct business via my phone. I can't even get the free wifi to work on the first 2 floors like advertised. The hotel itself needs major renovating. It is so dated and the smell is not pleasant. I will say that when checking in, the front desk was helpful. However, we were in a group with 3 different rooms and we asked to be on the same floor which was accommodated. However, upon entering one of the rooms, it was not cleaned yet and so our other guests in our party had to be moved 25 floors up from us. We will not stay here again and would rather stay at the newly updated New York New York or splurge and stay at Aria or Cosmopolitan.

Location, Location, Location. This place is situated right in the heart of the strip. Not to mention it has a tram available to take you the Bellagio( don't forget they have the water show every half over). The Aria is also connected near the Monte Carlo shops. I loved the fact the food court was available right near the Casino \/ Lobby. Here is a quick list of Fast food available. McDonalds , Starbucks, Subway (opened 24 hours)  Sabarro.  The employees at the M Life  players club were very helpful. Don't forget to sign up for your card and use it. If you accumulate enough points you will have many free buffets. The only drawback of the hotel is the outdated rooms. The bathrooms aren't that clean. I wish they would use all the money people put into the casino to update them. I would stay here again.

My friends and I recently went to Vegas.  We stayed at the Monte Carlo and it was a great disappointment.  The lobby looked super sweet and clean.  The rooms are not up to par.  There were stains on the carpets and stains on the sheets.  Super grody.  Will not be staying here again.  :(

This place ain't bad at all, it had nice size room and was very Comfortable. Great location right on the strip. But that 20 dollars a night for the Access to the pool,gym Internet and 2 Bottled water is BS. Other than that, it was cool.

This used to be my hotel of choice, once upon a time a four star hotel at a three star price was unbeatable! Until they decided to stop comping me rooms while I stayed in Vegas. 

Overall it is a probably in my book a 3 to maybe a 3 1\/2(on good day) hotel at a low 3 star price.

YUCK!! DIRTY!! We stayed here on a recent weekend for 2 nights and for $600+ you would think you'd get a decent room. Nope. Even though we switched to a different room after checking in, we were given a room that was further away from the elevator and just as dirty and old and tired looking as the one before. Not only was the room old and dirty, the charger port was broken, carpet was spotted in the common hallway and in our room, Carpet was pulling away from the wall, and there was a lot of dust on the fixtures, The only reason they get one star was because the beds were comfortable. The pool chairs were disgustingly filthy and in need of a good scrub or to be replaced. I've stayed in better Motel 6's for a whole lot less money. The resort fee does not include parking and basically, this place is just a total RIP OFF! BEWARE!!

Monte Carlo has more of an old motel vibe rather than a nice Vegas hotel. While booking the room, I understood the place was an older hotel, therefore, had affordable prices and fewer updated features. In other words, I wasn't expecting much. However, being that it is considered a fancy, top notch Vegas hotel on the strip, I think we deserved a little better than what we got. We were even charged an additional $84 at check out (on top of the price for the room) which made it way more expensive than their advertised price. 

The Room: 
The design is very bland and boring. Nothing special, nothing stood out, nothing that made you feel as if you were in a fancy Vegas room. I booked a room that claimed it had a view of the Vegas Strip, however, we saw the backside of Aria, a bit of the Cosmopolitan, and if you really turned your neck you could barely see Caesar's Palace. The majority of the view was parking lots and streets. Not exactly the "Deluxe Vegas Strip View Room" that I thought I booked. 
The floors were snappy and creaky in some parts under that shaggy old carpet. Someone's hair tie was left behind on the doorknob in the bathroom (gross). The bathroom door itself would get stuck and wouldn't budge unless you put some muscle into opening it. The bathtub facet would constantly leak no matter how hard we tried turning the knob. Very disappointing all around. 

Customer Service:
Each employee was very nice and helpful. The concierge had a fun sense of humor and suggested a few restaurant options. The front desk gal was friendly and quick with checking us in. Checking out was also easy, I simply called their number and checked out over the phone which only took a couple of minutes.  

The Casino:
The few restaurant and lounge options I saw looked pretty inviting and probably good places to eat. We didn't hang out too much in there because the whole casino reeked of some type of sunblock with a strong fake coconut scent. It was very distracting and almost made me feel sick. Pretty small, unexciting place to gamble and hang out. 

The Buffet:
Las Vegas is known for their high quality fine dining. Especially their buffets. In my opinion, that's usually my favorite part about visiting the area. All that being said, this was one of the worst buffets I've ever experienced. The customer service wasn't the problem. In fact, they were all very sweet and attentive and I enjoyed their service. The problem lies within the food. The important part of the experience. It felt like a cheap cafeteria with few options and bland flavor all around. The design of the place was so boring and sad, I couldn't believe we were in Vegas. 

This was my buddy's first trip to Las Vegas and I wanted to make it a cool experience for her. Luckily she's a very optimistic person and was able to enjoy everything about our mini vacation but I'm embarrassed that I chose such a low quality place. I feel like she missed out on that extraordinary, glamorous Vegas experience. 
I only wish that the hotel would either address these problems or notify their guests. Maybe lower the prices and\/or add little perks to lessen the blow? I heard something about the place being torn down soon and that's understandable but why make your current guests suffer for it?

I give them one star because there's nothing lower. What good is the security if they cant find a petty thief (which probably was a housekeeping employee) that stole our wallets the night were out and about. The job was clean. No sign of break in from the door or that spiderman came in from the window. Security was talking to us like kinder gardeners reading a recital. I cant stress enough how incompetent they were trying to handle the situation. They told us that it is "NOT THEY'RE RESPONSIBILITY". It took them 6hours to check security cameras and when they got done done they told us their cameras are not the best quality.. ohh and the sheets where not changed and the room wasn't vacuumed probably because they where busy looking for our wallets. 

MONTE CARLO management i hope that you guys re-evaluate your security personnel. And your whole security strategy period!

As for me coming back after this experience is next to impossible and i do not recommend this place at all

This was our first time in Vegas so we don't have any other experience to compare our stay. With that being said, we're already planning another trip back to Vegas and couldn't see ourselves staying any where else. I'm sure there may be more luxurious hotels but glitz and glam aren't what matter most to us. It's the experience itself. We stayed 3 days and 2 nights for my boyfriends birthday. I've read a lot of posts that claim its in terrible location. I highly disagree. Walking distance maybe, but there are many avenues for you to get to point B easily. There are free inner resort trams  and there are two DUECE tops on either side of the street next to the Monte Carlo. I love the location, really.

Let me start by telling you that I did a lot of research on the resort before booking. We looked for a fair price for the best value and I believe we got that and more. I follow the resort on twitter and direct messaged them about any questions from late check out options to birthday specials. You never know unless you ask and I'm so glad that we did.
We checked our bags at the bell desk and everyone was so friendly and they explained how it worked for us since it was our first time. We spent the rest of the day exploring the strip but still go back to the hotel before check in time. I waited for less than 3 minutes to speak to someone about a possible early check in. She explained that our room wasn't clean but she took my number and told me that I would get a text as soon as it was ready and I could also come back around 2-2:30 to see if it were ready. We went to the desk again around 2:30 and again, no wait longer than 3 minutes, and they told us that our room was ready.We were so pleased at the space of our room. The only downside was the lighting but that's my opinion. There were also no venting fans in the bathroom. Otherwise the room was wonderful and the bed was extremely comfortable. I think we spent more time in bed than the average person in Vegas just because the bed was so nice!

We laid down to rest for a few minutes before exploring again and we heard a knock at the door and before I had time to answer it a woman let herself in. She noticed that our items were in the room and quickly shut the door. She was talking on the phone the whole time so she wouldn't have been able to hear us if we had said anything. I walked out to see who it was and she was dressed in the hotels uniform and just asked if we were happy with our room. That was about it. I'm not too crazy about this incident but I'm not really one to complain either. 

Our favorite place at the Hotel would be the pool since we're not big gamblers. Tons of people so if you don't like a pool party this isn't the place for you.The DJ was awesome and everyone seemed to be having a great time. Definitely our kind of party! There are not even close to being able to accommodate lounging chairs for everyone so if you want one you better go early because they're all occupied by towels by 12pm. There's rarely ever anyone in them but we didn't want to potentially take someones seat who was just going to cool off. There were more kids than I expected but we love kids and they all looked just as happy as we were. The poolside bar doesn't have as many mixed drink options that I'd like. The lobby has a peach margarita that I was craving but the pool bar didn't have it. :( And I couldn't bring my drink from the lobby to the pool so that was a little disappointing but hey, rules are rules.

We tried the buffet and were pleased with the variety. We wen't a bit late in the morning so things weren't as fresh as they would have been earlier but it was still good quality. The Noodle company was AMAZING! Very friendly and the food was amazing! Yusho was delicious as well and the waiter was energetic and fun. The Pub's breakfast was probably my favorite meal. It was so delicious and the prices were very reasonable. The only downside was our waiter didn't make enough trips to our table for my liking. But we got everything we needed and were pleased with our experience.

The casino was nice and didn't smell too bad of smoke unless you passed someone who was smoking. We played the slots and the virtual roulette. Not one waitress asked us if we wanted a drink though. I was pretty disappointed but we didn't spend much time there anyway.

In all, I loved the Monte Carlo and can't wait to come back. We were treated so well and everyone that we encountered was so helpful. Great location and excellent for the price. Love love love! I can't thank you enough to whom ever handles their twitter account. They made our trip everything we wanted it to be and more! Kudos xoxo

I'm on a 9-day road trip, and we decided to stop in good ol Vegas for a few nights. After 3 days of camping and not showering, any hotel seemed good. To my surprise, we paid $105 for a two-night weekday stay! The rooms are simple and have everything you need.  The pools are big and they even have a lazy river.  The location is also top-notch on the strip. Nice food court inside.

However, the casino was not very forgiving, but I partially blame my drunk self for that.

Oh gosh now I'm scared after reading all these recent reviews. I've had my hopes high on this trip. I thought the prices were good. But the resort fee is pretty high, ESPECIALLY since I'm seeing here we won't even be able to use to pool and have to be so inconvenienced. AND Even crappier to know we ALSO have to pay for fricking Parking. THIS IS BULLCRAP. I paid for the room and resort fee already and now I am thinking of canceling and maybe trying Excalibur. I've stayed there and was very satisfied. I thought Monte Carlo was one of the nicer resorts. Crap if I can't cancel hopefully I am in a nice room. Me and the honey haven't had a vacation without kids in our whole 10 year relationship I would be so DEVASTATED if this trip isn't perfect

The walls are paper thin so good luck sleeping. Rooms were not very clean. I found hairs in my "clean" towels and pillows. The shower was cramped and gross. Staff was very friendly and the casino is impressive. I definitely recommend staying elsewhere.

I recently stayed here for one night while showing my Aussie friend around. Our stay was clean, friendly, and we definitely had a good time while there. The hotel room was clean and that's what I always expect out of any hotel. We were not there to lounge around in the hotel, other than use it for sleep. It served it's purpose for me and I'd defintiely book another stay here. The price was very fair for it's location. There's a tram outside that takes you closer to the center of the strip.

I'd do it again................

Great place for the price. Not the most luxurious place on the strip but the amenities are decent, the service is good, and the location is fantastic. Very good value overall.

This is the 4th or 5th time we've stayed here. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and there is a decent selection of food downstairs ranging from McDonald's to 5 star French, and everything in between. The casino floor is a bit small and smoky, but perfect for when you're not in the mood to get dressed up and go out. The spa is small and reasonably priced. And it's only a few minutes' walk to other casinos, restaurants, and shopping at the many malls nearby.

The only things we didn't care much for were the showers (high pressure mist that's definitely not my idea of pleasant) and on our most recent trip the TV didn't work properly (but we didn't call to have it fixed because it just wasn't that important to us).

Yes, you can stay at a nicer, trendier, and\/or more luxurious place on the strip but you'll pay about twice as much. We prefer to stay here, where we're always satisfied, and use the cash we saved to eat, play, and party while we're in town.

We were given a Spa Suite at the Monte Carlo as a gift for our honeymoon.  These suites are advertised as having a view so we were a bit upset when we found the blinds broken.  When the concierge arrived to deliver our luggage he tried to fix them and after admitting defeat, he got us a new room.  When we arrived in the new room the blinds worked but we soon discovered that the cold water handle or knobs for the tub and the mini bar sinks didn't work correctly. It was a challenge to get them to shut off.  When we used the "Spa Tub" which has no jets by the way, we found that the faucet was cracked on the side and water sprayed out the side of it. It's clear that this hotel does not invest in repairs, touch ups, or replacements. 
Oh and then we found mold in the shower... mold!!!

Anytime we travel we request a fan because my husband sleeps with one blowing on him... the response we received when we requested it, "That's not something we provide." What... for a few hundred a night you can't find a fan in your maintenance shop?
I am a Director at a large resort in another state and can tell you that I am usually understanding and sympathetic to hotels as I have probably been in their situation, however, the lack of response when we mentioned these challenges to the concierge desk, the lack of customer service combined with the condition of this room tells me that their is something very wrong with the leadership of this hotel.  Not only will I never stay here again but I will tell anyone and everyone that wants to listen that they need to avoid it as well. 
The only thing this hotel has going for it is the valet staff, they are great!

I took my boyfriend here on a surprise birthday trip. I chose the Monte Carlo because of it great location and reasonable rates. The location did not disappoint, I feel like it was a perfect spot pretty much in the middle of the strip. The first problem which occurred almost instantly was upon checking in the employee at the desk stated that they did not have any high floor rooms available for a while, which we booked. We stated we would take a lower floor if it was ready. I asked for a refund on the difference and she stated there was not a price difference, I knew for a fact there was, but I kept quiet for the time being. My boyfriend asked how much a refrigerator rental was and she stated I believe something like $30 a day, we declined. We went up to the room which was average, but there was a lot of dust. I brought up to my boyfriend again that I knew the price was different. My boyfriend made a phone call and requested to speak to a manager. The manager was very apologetic and immediately put us in a high floor room which was clean and gave us the refrigerator for free for the duration of our stay(mind you the price was much cheaper then the original employee stated).

Now after stating all of that, the rest of our stay was great. We actually gambled in the Monte Carlo casino for the most part. We ate at the P.U.B. which was great. And as I said early the location and price you cannot beat. If returning, I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again!

If I could rate it lower I would. Old out dated decor. Mold in the shower, holes in the furniture. Complained about the construction although I was on the 15th floor, they told me sorry, complained about no pool,they said sorry but I could take my butt to the MGM. I could hear my neighbors on either side showering or using the toilet, they told me they were going to undergo a multi million dollar renovation.  I told them my room sucked but they would put me on a higher floor. DO NOT GO TO THE MONTE CARLO. Wait until they renovate and save your money. Go somewhere else. The restaurants and bars are ok but if you want to relax and sleep, go somewhere else! !!!!

This has been the worst experience. My friends and I planned a 20 year reunion over 9 months ago and were so excited to come to Vegas! 
There are moths in our room, the shower drips constantly, the check in person was so rude to us and every time we needed service we received lackluster responses. Turn down service is non existent. My friend had her shoes stolen out of her room and after basically accusing her roomies (us) stealing them, offered her 50 bucks and showed no care or empathy. 
I come to Vegas often and will never spend another dime here. The rooms are dirty and the service is terrible. STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!

Ok first let me say I'll never stay there unless it's a trip that's paid for I will never spend my own money to stay here again. And even then I might not stay. I was actually excited for my trip but that was short lived. The lady at the counter was rude when we first got there.
