They messed up my reservation tried to change the total for my stay when I thought I had paid in full before I already got there so when I got to the desk I was confused. Three different people told me three different things just to end up giving me what I originally was suppose to pay. Once we get to the room everything seems fine except the drain in the shower is horrible ! It went out so slow it was like taking a bath andddd shower. Food court is horrible this hotel needs a total upgrade. The only thing good about this place is where it's located on the strip. So that's why it got two stars
Not too bad, my only gripe is that the pool was closed.

On vacation in Las Vegas! Beautiful trip minus our hotel experience at the #MonteCarlo Monte Carlo Resort & Casino- Las Vegas because it's a construction site. The drilling and banging begins at 6am and continues until 5:30pm. Unreal! There was zero warning given at the time of booking or at check-in. They totally dropped the ball as it pertains to #customerservice. They will offer you a credit to be used at a restaurant on the resort, but it's not worth it.  We were able to utilize the pool and beach at both #MGM & #MandalayBay. In hind sight, we should have booked at either of those. Take my advice, book your stay at a similar 4-star hotel on the #LasVegasstrip and avoid the frustration and aggravation. Although the construction is totally ridiculous - we will continue to enjoy mom turning 60! Shame on you, #MonteCarlo #MonteCarloLasVegas #MonteCarloResortCasino

stayed here because some friends already booked their trip and we wanted to stay in the same hotel.  I had heard good things from several people and was looking forward to it.   There are 2 good things i can say.   The poker room was a ton of fun and the food at Andre's is exceptional.   Here is what i didnt like
1. Resort fee.  This is the biggest b.s i have ever come across.  I have never paid this anywhere.   Now it wasnt a surprise because i read about it on yelp but here is the thing.  I never used the internet, pool or gym.  Nor did i even get the newspaper it says we are paying for.  This mandatory resort fee is for the birds!  It was 80.00 extra dollars!   I will only come back to play poker.
2. The pool appears nice and looks like alot of fun.  But it gets no sunlight.  It was freezing down there to the point i didnt want to even be bothered.   
Sorry MC-not again!

Truly a disappointment. I know this is now an "older" casino but I still expected more. So outdated didn't even have ports to charge phone\/laptop etc and NO POOL!!!! Are you kidding me? Construction was going on and loud as heck. Crappy inconsistent wifi connectivity. Self parking $10 but what was cool was you can get in\/out at all Mlife hotels. Moral of review? CALL BEFORE BOOKING!! Ask:  Construction? Pool? Wifi connectivity? Charging ports? Are you ready for the 21 century? Just a bummer, will not be back.

This is probably my safest hotel in Vegas for any occasion. The suites overlooking the strip are worth the extra $15. For the location in the middle of the strip is why I give it the additional star. You won't find a nicer hotel in this location for a cheaper price. I booked 5 rooms for my bday for all my friends and definitely never disappointed with what I pay. They are economical and nice. Don't compare to the Wynn or Bellagio but up there regarding the cleanliness and affordability when you're paying for 5 rooms. Even with less than a week notice you can find a room for $150 which is a great price especially around the busy Vegas holidays.
Charged me $8 for a beer with money in play ...  losing $100s apparently doesn't even get me a comp'ed $4 beer.

I stayed here 2\/16 - 2\/18. This is a decent hotel to stay at if you're not going to be in your hotel for the duration of the trip. Disappointed that all the pools were closed for cleaning (understandable) but they didn't give us access to another pool at a different hotel when the wave pool opened that was totally covered in shade. The only reason I'd stay here again is for the amazing and lovely bartenders that worked in the casino, Jonathan and James :)

This hotel is surprisingly simple.  With all the gimics offered by neighboring hotels, the Monte Carlo isn't flashy, nor does it do anything to stand out on the strip.  The best way to describe the reception area is elegant and simple.   Beautiful marble floors, large floral decorations, and fantastic brilliant crystal chandeliers.  I've basically described any hotel lobby in America.

The rooms are typical hotel room.  Again, nothing special.  They're nicely decorated and are comfortable.  That's all I can really say.

The casino is nice.  You can find your way around easily.

If you want a hotel without all the flash, not overly expensive (considering it's Vegas), but near the middle of it all, then Monte Carlo is a good choice.  But don't expect to go WOW.  You'll probably sleep there and then spend your day elsewhere.

SHAME ON YOU MGM! How dare you rent out room in this FREAKING MESS OF A CONSTRUCTION SITE!!!!! I was told on the phone that your pool was being remodeled not the WHOLE BUILDING! I really feel ripped off paying money to vacation in a war zone! We heard jack hammers at 5am till 6pm!. We got letters saying that the hot water was gonna be shut off from 12pm-2pm! The fire alarm went off at 6:30am! I mean really???? You feel ok charging us a $40 resort fee each day for this construction zone??? And another $10 to park here? SHAME ON YOU MGM!

This hotel is old. No basic amenities. It's laughable how much they are lacking. Very outdated bathrooms, not enough towels, terrible AC (took over an hour to cool down the room), I could hear the people in the room next door showering. Alarm kept going off at night BUT wasn't able to handle music off our phones without the speaker blowing out (we didn't blast music either, it was not even as loud as our phones)...No fridge, no microwave, no coffee pot...Come on guys, even motels have these things! Vegas is always a good time but book somewhere else. Can't wait to check out...resort fees should NOT be charged because, what am I paying for?!

My first impression was that the hotel was very nice. It looked elegant and classy. We try to upgrade, but there weren't any suites available so for $20 a night they offered us 30th floor, strip view. We get to the room..... it hadn't been cleaned (-1 star). We got back down to the desk and they give us the room right next to that one. The view was amazing! Totally worth the extra $20\/night.

The room was clean. My only other complaint is that you can hear the water when someone in another room is taking a shower..... not cool when you have trouble sleeping to begin with and you want to sleep past 7 a.m. (-1 star)

The buffet was yummy! The black jack tables were $5 in the early Sunday hours..... pretty nice stay!

Next time we're going to try somewhere else. This place is definitely nicer than your typical like Holiday Inn..... but it wasn't AS nice I I expected. All in all..... GREAT TIME!

I had always liked walking through and hanging out at the Monte Carlo, But when it came down to actually staying there... I wouldnt suggest it now that I have had the experience. I spent $175 for a sunday night in a spa suite. The inside was not very clean. Although the bed was made and everything was neat, there was a stain as if someone spilled a bottle of wine over the tile that surrounded the spa. The pool is LOUD all day long. It is impossible to take a nap because of that. The music is way to Loud during the day. The moldings had scuff marks and other parts of the room looked like a dog had been chewing on it. The water came out cloudy in the sink, kind of disturbing. Finally got home, and noticed on the next billing cycle that they had billed me another $25 for an unknown reason. I am on hold and have been waiting for over 15 minutes. Finally got a hold of some one and they told me it was a "resort fee", which I understand having resort fees, but I was not ever informed that there would be additional charges to the $175 I had already spent for the room AND the fact it was billed out to me on the following billing cycle is disappointing. I wish it would have been one figure that I was aware of and would only have to pay once. Not Impressed with the service or the room... Not going to stay here again

The hotel room walls are thin...I can hear it all! The rooms are substandard. I'm never staying here again. The staff at the blue man group show are unfriendly. I'm spending $400 to watch a show! At least say "hi can I help you?" Or "thank you".

The service was awesome. Every single one of the staff members there were extremely helpful. I enjoyed my stay there but only in the casino, poolside, and restaurants. 

The room I stayed in was lame-o. The walls were extremely thin. I can hear other people talking and showering no matter what time of the day it was. Even worst is after using the sink or shower, it makes a horrible squeaking and clicking noise that last for approximately a long 5 minutes. The shower curtains were stained and dirty and the bath tub had mold all over the edges and handles. The ceiling was so low I cannot imagine anyone over 5'10 being able to shower in that hotel comfortably. 

Would I stay here again? The answer is definitely no, despite their great service. I want to be able to stay in a room that is welcoming and comfortable.

First off let me tell you why they didn't get 4 stars. Booked two room connected with view of the strip. First room was connected but sadly no view of strip only of vents on lower part off roof. Room door was open and looked ransacked. Turns out small mistake had been made. Housekeeping had not cleaned the room yet. They apologize d and moved us from the 3rd floor to the 23rd floor but still no view of the strip. Hallways are kinda narrow but all in all. This is a great place to stay. Location, location M&M store, Coca-cola store, Lion exhibit MGM and Shark reef at Mandalay Bay. There's also a CVS near by. I'll be staying here again but will hope for better experience. But like I said great location to bad Circus Circus is on far end of strip.
.

Pros: Convenient location to many other casinos on the strip. Hotel front desk was nice.
Cons:  No WiFi in the rooms!  You have to go to the 1st or 2nd floor to access a bad WiFi signal.  The hotel needs renovation to get up to speed with the competition.  The carpet needs replacing, the bedroom furnishings are in pretty rough shape, the shower heads need replacing, it just seems that the owners are not taking care of the place.  Additionally, they charge you a resort fee of $22.00 per day and this basically includes use of the pool and fitness center.  The pool has really limited hours closing at 5pm so we could never even use the pool during our visit.  I really think the resort fees should be optional only if you plan to use the amenities.  I know the resort fee is standard for strip hotels now but with limited access to the amenities that you are paying for the fees should be optional.   The price of the hotel wasn't bad but for the same price we could have stayed at the Luxor which is much nicer.  I won't be coming back to stay here in the future.

This is a review specifically for the Lance Burton ticket booth -- I know I should post this onto Lance Burton but the show was amazing and this review has more to do with the casino that the performance. 

My friend purchased our show tickets off Vegas.com and you are required to pick them up one (1) hour prior to showtime otherwise they release them to non-ticket holders. We get to the front of the line and they tell us we don't have any tickets. *Clue in the violin music and bewilder looks on all our faces*  

They ask us if we have a confirmation number which don't as we purchased them off Vegas.com. So the attendant tells us she will call Vegas.com to get this information for us. 

Not willing to stand idle as they investigate, some of us run around looking for a computer and end up paying $10 for an Internet kiosk which didn't work. Oh yeah, just in case you were wondering, the machine is located near the hotel registration desk off the lobby.  

Since that didn't work, we get worried so one of us takes a taxi to and from the hotel to get the confirmation printout from our room. Cost = $20 round trip to get what we needed.   

The other half stresses as the show starts in 15 minutes and decides to walk up to the booth where they tell us how they were able to confirm our reservation on Vegas.com just 20 minutes ago. 

The kicker, they could see us through the booth waiting the entire 45 minutes and yet they said nothing to us. We kept looking at them through the booth and went up multiple times inquiring to no avail. Plus why in the hell do they not have our reservation in their computer systems. How would they know who purchased tickets if their systems were not synched?!?! 

We will never go to another show at Monte Carlo for as long as we live.

Hmmm. The room was advertised at $42, the hotel charged $25 extra for "using the amenities", i.e. for nothing. That is 59% higher. Think about it before you book. They are cheating on the price. Where else?

No breakfast. 
No Wi-Fi. Pure and simple, no Wi-Fi. They offer a wired connection, for the said $25. My iPad can't connect over the wire, so I stayed without internet.

Construction noise.
Rooms are oldish and small, so are the beds.

My recommendation is obvious... stay away from Monte Carlo. Las Vegas is too big and gorgeous. Find something new in it!

Ya here for a beer pong tournament. The REAL beer pong that plays with a paddle.. Lots of fun but no night life going on here at this hotel. Great steak though at Brands! Best piece of cattle ever had!

Believe me, now is NOT the time to stay at the Monte Carlo unless you can figure out how to get into a renovated room. The hotel is way past it's prime and is worn out, literally. My room was the most Spartan room I've stayed in since the last Motel 6 20 years ago. Also, there is no pool - it is being re-done, so you'll have to go to Mandalay Bay or MGM Grand to use their pools, for "free" as they're MGM properties as well. My friends stayed on the 32nd floor and their room was FABULOUS! That is what I expected for the money I paid, not the worn out, out dated room I stayed in. Oh well, it is super close to the T-Mobile Arena ........to be fair I'm sure MGM will renovate this property and it will be glorious once again some day, but for now spend your hard-earned greenbacks at another property and live it up! Oh, the casino at Monte Carlo is wonderful, no complaints and the hotel staff were wonderful as well.

Happy that the pool area Monte Carlo Pool Las Vegas was open today -- unlike many other Vegas resorts this time of year but we were a little disappointed because they didn't tell us that only half of the pool area is actually open. 2 bars closed as well as the bathrooms and lazy river. 

We've stayed here in the past and payed the $35 "resort fee" but I'm not sure it's fair to still charge guests the full fee when only half of the facility is in operation.

This hotel is middle of the road; not the best but not the worst either.  The room was not very impressive at all.  The ipod dock did not work and the shower did not drain well.  They really need to add more outlets to allow for phones to be plugged in near the beds.  Also, no mini fridge so bring a cooler. 

However, it was very clean and the overall hotel was better than some of the rest in Vegas.  If you are looking for a clean place to stay in Vegas that is on the cheaper side, stay here.  If you are looking for a nicer room...I would skip.

oy this hotel sucks. the pool is crappy the hotel halls smell of weed and its noisy filled with fat hispanic men. its just a generic hotel. nothing special. the beds are ok they could use a better comforter. the shower handles are gross. and the views from the rooms suck. no room service and the tv only has like 12 channels on it. no bag in the ice bucket. eh this sucks. yaa i wont be back

We forgot our daughter's pillow as we were on the freeway about 30 miles out and on our way home. Luckily, relatives were still at the hotel. 

Security helped us retrieve the pillow from the room and brought it to my aunt's room. 

Kudos to Monte Carlo security for helping with what would've seriously been a great loss to my 6-year-old who's had the pillow since she was a baby.

-walls are thin
-bathroom smelled like throw up
-shower head was falling off
-throw up stain on the bathroom tile
-graffiti on some of the room numbers

I've been to Vegas before and stayed at the MGM Grand but this time I wanted something a little more central so I chose the Monte Carlo. I got a Groupon on a 3 night stay. It was great. The receptionist was very friendly. The hotel was very nice. The lobby was very elegant. When I got to my room, I was pleasantly surprised. A great view not of the strip but of the T-mobile Arena and the desert mountains in the background. The room was on the 14th floor. The room was very clean. I was happy with my stay here. I would book another room at the Monte Carlo. I also wanted to reserve lounge chairs near the pool. So I went to the pool desk and was greeted by eager and friendly ladies who helped me decide whether to stay with my reserved lounge chairs or get a package which included umbrella, two lounge chairs, our own waitress. The package was $150. I had no quams with that after realizing the lounge chairs had no coverings and with the heat from the Las Vegas desert would have been brutal. I chose the package and was so happy I did. Great service, great food, great hospitality and great hotel. I shall definitely return to the Monte Carlo.

There were two redeeming factors to this hotel:

1. Location: It was not a bad location, especially with the tram that takes you from Monte Carlo to Aria and Bellagio.

2. The Bellhop: When we arrived to the hotel very early in the morning, this towering bellhop (forgot his name) took our bags right away so we could walk around. I'm not sure how standard this service is but I found it very nice.

Other than the above facts, this hotel was not a good experience:

1. Dirty Sheets: Upon arrival, I noticed dried blood on my sheets. Not cool.

2. Room Service: I asked for a change of sheets because of the blood stain. A guy came up to our room with a bag of 5 linens, gave us the bag and told us to change the sheet ourselves. If this were my own home, then alright. But I'm paying for this service, so I found it a bit unacceptable.

3. BED BUGS: I kept waking up to bite marks all over me and actually saw a nice red bed bug run across my linens. I complained upon check-out and the hotel management said they would do a 'complete inspection' and call me back later. Of course, they found nothing.

The one star is mainly based on my experience with the hotel rooms, rather than the casino, lounges and food court. I would have given the hotel two stars but I'm particularly picky about the bed bug issue.
Jist wondering, how you spent a lot of money for refreshment (one or two years ago) and the entrance of Monte Carlo from The Strip to be so dirty?

This place may be in the center of the strip blah blah blah. It has new restaurants and bars blah blah blah. It's building a sports arena next door blah blah. This hotel is like putting a bandaid on a gushing wound. There are so many problems I don't know where to start. 

This casino might be the smokiest casino on the strip. 
They charge top dollar for sub par amenities. 
There is no available food option after 11:00pm on a weekday except McDonald's, subway and sabaro pizza. I'm sorry I didn't come to Vegas to eat mall food court food. 

I could go on, but I'm tired. Avoid.

I stayed here during the weekdays for two days.  I was really happy with my staying.
few reasons below:
-I got the best deal from Monte Carlo website.  I had 2 free buffets per day.  That really saved me tons of $$ spending on food.
-I guess it's weekday.  The check in was not too bad.  It's about 10-15mins of wait.
-I stayed in the 15th floor.  I had the T-Mobile Arena\/Excalibur view. It was really pretty.  My friend who stayed across from my room had the Poolside view.  It's also nice too.
-The parking structure\/Lobby\/Room entrance\/Pool are all in the same area.  I love that I didn't need to take my kids going across the casino to go to the room and pool.
-The parking fee is $8 per day.  It includes all M-Life casinos like MGM, Mirage, Luxor, Bellagio.... 
-The pool was awesome!!!  Kids enjoyed the regular pool, lazy river and wave pool.  
-The front desk was really nice and helpful when check in and out.

one star took off because:
-The room was nice and clean, but the bathroom do need a good renovation.  The shower head was rusted.  Wallpaper peeling off.. 
-The dinner buffet was acceptable for $25, but breakfast and lunch were so less selections of food.
-Pool closes at 7pm.  It's too early in my opinion.

Overall, this is a hotel which is perfect for family with kids.

Will never stay there again. It has been a while since I was last there and sad to see how this hotel has changed. Rented a Diamond Suite to celebrate the wife's birthday. The room was shabby, old sparse furniture, stained carpets and draperies that looked like they were about to shred. No coffee pot in the room (but there is a Starbucks near the lobby). You can imagine the cost for a Vente! This hotel needs a major upgrade!

come on guys.  really 3 stars?  well, ya, you're probably right.  the hotel's quality is 3 star.  but my review is giving it an extra star... why?  because, damn, you're in a decent hotel RIGHT in the middle of the strip and you're paying like 50 bucks a night.  you'd have to stay at imperial palace to get rates like that.  also, this place has a smaller wave pool (can't compare to mandalay) and a cool lazy river.  yeah, so the patrons of the pool are fat and ugly middle americans, but hey, that just makes you look all the hotter right?  i mean, you're not competing with hotties at mandalay or mirage right? you're competing with people that look like goerge costanza  right?  so anyway, given the fact that I have easy access to the places i really want to go, and can lounge around in a great pool, I give this place an extra star.  also, the rooms are not modern.  but they are still clean.  so if you want to stay on the strip, and be close to stuff you really like, and just want to lounge by the pool, come here.   you won't be sorry.  but if you're lookin for a hip luxe experience?  go to mirage or mandalay.  oh one more word of advice... the old "SLIP THE FRONT DESK PERSON A 20 FOR AN UPGRADE TRICK" DOES NOT WORK HERE!!!   their computer systems are set up so any upgrades are flagged and then must be explained. yes, i asked last time.  if you're lookin for awesome upgrades, try Planet Hollywood.  you'll get the best bang for your buck!

I'm writing this review solely to emphasize how awesome our pool experience was here - DESPITE the fact I was practically chased down halfway across the pool area by a security dude asking for my ID (on my 25th birthday, I might add), presumably because I looked "young" and had a beer in my hand.  I mean, I suppose he was doing his job, but that was a bit awkward.  

Aside from that, we went in July and the pool was bumpin' every day starting at noon (even on Sunday).   I knew they had a pool and wave pool AND lazy river, but I had no idea it would have a DJ and an MTV party-on-the-beach kind of feel all day long. This was highly entertaining and was honestly exactly what we were looking for, as we were in party mode.  My favorite part was the lazy river which no one rented the overpriced inner tubes for.  Instead, people just walked around and around the not-so-lazy river aimlessly, drinking and socializing.   There were staff posted around the river blowing whistles at you if you dared sit on the decorative island the lazy river wrapped around.  This seemed amusing at the time but it might have been all the Bud Light Limes.  

Overall the pool area was fun, loud, and packed without being uncomfortably crowded.  It was just sloppy enough to make the people watching enjoyable and it was a great place to warm up before dinner and a night on the Strip.  I would come back here solely for the pool experience.  The hotel itself was clean and airy and our room was generic, albeit reasonably priced.  Monte Carlo had an overall good ambiance for the value and provided a solid Vegas experience.

Went fight weekend(pacquiao vs mosley).  Have to say that the resort is pretty much what i expected...and actually a little more.  Check-in wasn't too busy despite it being noonish.  The receptionist who helped me was SUPER nice(can't remember her name..ugh).  The room was really nice and the flat screen tv was a total nice surprise.  I needed to use the blow dryer and it was broken, they sent one right up. - Super nice staff..when you walk the hall ways they always greet you with a smile and hello.

I had swam at their pool before when a friend of mine stayed here and she snuck us is...the pool is pretty cool, although SUPER crowded!! The first day i had to sit just by the edge of the pool with my stuff.  The 2nd time we visited the pool we were able to get chairs.  The only thing is they seem to ber VERY short staffed with the cocktails waitresses.  There was also a cougar on the prowl and she was dancing with some young guys..it was pretty funny.(check out the picture i posted ;) )


All in all..i would recommend this hotel to a friend....and though i might not stay here again, but that's only because every trip to LV i like to experience a new hotel each time.

I recently stayed at Monte Carlo and had a very bad experience. Me and my fianc was in Vegas for our 10year Anniversary. So we booked Monte Carlo of course 
When we arrived they told us that we have good news and bad news is we sold out of spa suites.. good news is that we got you a better room for the inconvenience. Hotel 32 with your own host food and throw in a 50 dollar voucher. Okay Boom that was Nice. Then after 15mins go by a second manager comes over and says we can't grant you that room. We have your room all ready for you. Well after my Fianc and I was going back and fourth  with the clerk and Manager for an hour you mean to tell me that you now have the room available. And now you can no longer have the room that you all just gave to us for the troubles you put us two through Not cool so then she goes to say we can still grant you the voucher I'll even give you 25 more dollars on US. So now I'm pissed So my fianc is like it's okay let's just go babe. So now we are in our room and we checking it out to come across a Dirty as tub with hair in it. Okay now we have problem so we go back down to the office and explain to them this is not right we spent our money and booked this along time ago and you guys are not treating us fair or good. So then she goes to say oh we can now make your vouchers 100 dollars now ugh it's just still not fair so the next morning we are taking showers and we hear some one coming in while we was naked and the management fails to to do anything. My concerns are they don't have it together and treated unfair. we paid our money to this company for them to treat us like this. On top of it all they took extra money off my card after checkout and has informed us that we can't get it back for a few days. I will never spend my money there again.

Hotel staff people are very nice and do what they can to accommodate. Unfortunately, hotel needs to be fumigated and updated...see bug pic posted.

First given room on eighth floor -disappointing.

Upon check-in found a silver fish insect skittering on the wall near filthy air conditioning duct. Carpet was filthy. Asked for a non-smoking room however reeked of stale smoke.  Felt very dirty.  After finding and trapping critter requested a new room which was given.  Manager stated I would get resort fee credit for 2-days as a sorry you found bug in room; however credit never showed on final bill and I needed to catch a flight.

Stayed at Monte Carlo for 5-days, had a conference in sister hotel.

Early in morning at about 7am saw many small roaches near food court. Then in late afternoon while standing in line saw huge B-52 roach crawling on woman's shirt back. She was totally not aware! Her husband swatted off roach which ran beneath counter.

The second room on the 11th floor overlooking pool -much better.

Hotel needs to be fumigated. Needs wifi in room. Additional $10 to use hot whirlpools not worth it. If you tell customer you will get resort credit than follow thru.

My bf and I decided to stay here because it was cheaper then other hotels. When we get there to check in, the king bed and strip view we paid for wasn't available and so they set us up in another room that had a king bed with no view, but would refund our $ we paid extra for the view back. We get to the room and this room was for someone who was handicap. Nothing against that, but the shower was different and felt like we were at a motel. So we called to asked to be moved to a different room. A dif lady at the front checked n told us a king bed just became avail. We said great well take it! Went to check in our room and it was a double queen bed. Wth. Called the front desk a guy picked up n said they didn't have a king avail n that they'll switch our room first thing when its avail the next day. Next day came we got a text saying our king bed room was avail. We go n check in and guess what? Double queen beds again! We were so furious had to call again and complain n they finally got us our room and told us they will deduct $50 from our bill. So the Last night we were there I was thirsty so decided to get soda from their vending machine. Didn't take cash so I charged it on my cc. First time it didn't seem to take my card so I swiped again. Machine said authorizing then said vending as if the soda was goin to come out. Waited a good 1-2 min. Nothing came out. Checked my bank statement n it charged me twice! Waited another min. Nothing had to call front desk and lady told me I had to go down to the front desk to talk to a supervisor. Oh man by this time I wanted to kill someone! The supervisor was nice enough to refund my $ back. This whole experience was just a living hell for my bf n I and I would never or even recommend this hotel to anyone. It's old, dirty, smells, and have mold stains in the showers.

Stayed here for one night last weekend. The only issue I had was that when we went to check in there was no designated line to wait in. Everyone kinda waited for an individual person at the check-in area. The guy we were waiting on decided to wait until he finished helping the person in front of us to tell us he was closed. This left only one person open and it took forever to check in.

Other than that, the price was reasonable and the room was pretty good. Nothing great, but not bad either. Location on the strip is pretty good too, close to the middle, exactly where we wanted to be.

Good: Friendly staff, nice casino with a goo mix of tables and machines to try your luck, good restaurants (liked The Pub and Yusho was very good), quick access to Aria.  Room was clean and bed comfortable.

Bad:  Room looked old.  Bathroom paint peeling, bath fixtures old and dated.  Buffet was marginal at best.

My husband and I have stayed at many hotels on the strip (high end to middle.) We picked the Monte Carlo because of the price... our friends were staying at Mandalay Bay so we could use the pool there. To our surprise...  The Monte Carlo is the best deal on the strip!!!! I worked in the hotel industry for many years and this hotel had some of the cleanest rooms I've ever seen. The pool wasn't as "grand" as others but wasn't crowded, clean, fun music, lazy river, wave pool, hot tub... everything you need. (There is construction next door, but with the music you couldn't hear the noise.) Draw backs- no extras in the rooms- but who spends time sleeping in Vegas!! All I need is a clean room. Definitely best value on the strip if you don't need all the extra amenities!!! Our friends at the Mandalay even came to use the pool because it wasn't as crowded.

I went to the MC 12 years ago, my last time in Vegas, and I loved it and always wanted to stay there.

Unfortunately, I forgot that a Vegas minute is faster than a NY minute. And things change in Vegas really fast. The people who come in and out every 2-3 days have got to be a constant wear on the city and the hotels, and with the MC, it shows.

The noise you hear from the hall can be down right scary. I jumped up a few times in the middle of the night thinking people were putting their key card into my door, but it was across the hall or next door. I could hear everything through the walls too. My sheets had a rip in them, and were stained. I dropped my room key and when I lifted the bedspread to look for it, there was a ton of crap on the floor from prior guests that had not been vacuumed. Gross.

Agree with the others who say the tv channel selection is horrible - you get 12 channels and 2 are MC in house channels, 1 is the Vegas channel which loops ads for the hotels and clubs on the strip, and 1 is a rolling commercial for the show in the MC. 

I said to everyone on the plane going home: The city of Vegas has a great PR agency. They make it look like everything is new and ritzy and glamorous, and in reality, it's all wheelchairs, oxygen machines and run down hotels unless you pay top dollar, or go downtown - where the casino employees are cute. In the strip hotels, they have gone way downhill in terms of appearance. It's surprising.

I'd go back, but if I'm going to stay at a sub par hotel, I'll take the Ex Calibur, which is really the cheapest on the strip.

please please read before considering staying at this hell hole who has crooks working for them!!! 
our brand new car almost got stolen at valet when we were checking out! 
some theif attempted to steal our brand new mercedes benz that still has dealer plates on the car!! if you have a new car with dealer plates stay away from here, the valet guys are crooks and allowed a prostitute who was high out of her mind, with her pimp put her belongings in our car without checking her valet ticket. the valet guy pulled up to valet and was giving our car keys to a prostitute when we realized that was our car,( because it has custom stickers and plates on the car) we ran up to our car and the valet guy was in shock and popped our trunk open and to our shock there was this prostitutes duffle bag already in our trunk!!! i dont know how. he then doesnt say one word to us, quickly snatches the duffle bag out of our trunk and goes up to the prostitute with her duffle bag, whispers something to her ear, then she quickly walks away with no apology or anything as if nothing happened!! 
why didnt thier valet guy check her ticket before allowing her to put her belongings into our car!? why were her belongings already in our trunk before the car even got to the valet area? our car pulled up to valet with her stuff already in it, how?! any normal guest has to wait for their car in the valet area, give their ticket to the valet guy, then get their keys. how was her stuff already in the trunk of my car before my car even got to valet waiting area? why didnt she or he apologize? why did she quickly storm off once she got caught with no apology or anything? the valet guys working here are crooks who work with local criminals and help them steal peoples new car with dealer plates on them still so the car cannot be identified. stay far far away from here if you have a new car with dealer plates, the valet guys will give your car to away to prostitutes without checking their tickets.
(this all happened on our check out date ) 

rewind to our stay at this dirty run down hotel. 
short story: my husband and i had the misfortune of staying at this hotel.we were given the wrong room instead of what we reserved, our water in the hotel got shut off while we were staying there (no shower, no toilet, no faucet water) and last but not least they have crooks working for them in their valet area!!

our reservations were for 1 king bed,when we showed up, we were put into a 2 queen room. why?i dont know. we got into our old dirty outdated room and the neighboring wall couple were having an argument and yelling and screaming calling each other every name in the book and we havent even been into our room for 5 mins yet and my blood pressure is going up. we go downstairs to complain and tell them this is a wrong room and the people next door are in range with each other and i dont want to hear any of their yelling and just want to be put into the room we reserved (a king bed) the "manager" at the front told us he cannot put us in a king bed, but changed us to another room with 2 queens. fine. we get to the other room and the beds are dirty, the skirt on the bed had white stains all over them ew!!! the electrical outlet was broken, rooms were depressing, didnt even have decent sized drawers to put our clothing in. the next day (friday) we were finally put into our correct room (1 king bed) so now we have to repack everything and drag all of our luggage into the room we should have been put into in the first place. we finally get all of our stuff into our new room (now we have changed rooms 2 times due to their screw up) and decide to make the best of what is left of our trip, we go downstairs to the pool area, (which you are not allowed to float around in with a drink in your hand, you must be glued to the edge of the pool and not float around if you have a drink) after we leave the pool,we go to try and shower in our rooms and all of our water is now shut off, we have no running water to shower, use the sink, or flush our toilets. we are both drenched in chlorine, and cant shower. we go downstairs, again, to complain. the lady at the front desk tells us they are having problems with the pipes and there is leaking and they had to shut off our water to fix the water. what!!!! what kind of pos hotel is that?! this is by far the worst vegas trip i have ever had. my husband and i come to vegas at least 4 times a year and this has been the worst trip and hotel we have ever had. the only reason we stayed here is because every other hotel was already booked and we were highly recommended to try this hotel out.  the only good thing about this hotel is the location.

Monte Carlos claims 4 star hotel... Well, I paid over $210\/night including resort fee; the room I stayed felt like some cheap motels.  The room I stayed at has bathroom titles coming off, bathroom grout is black is some area, the shower curtain rings are plastic, shower fixtures are not matching in colors and last but not least, the carpet in the room were coming off and dirty in the corner.  In addition, I am disappointed that no coffee machine in the room. 

Giving one star for the nice clerk at the check in counter.  

Extremely dissapointed and totally disgusted with the condition of the hotel room!!!!!   Wonder if the general manager at Monte Carlos EVER bother to check\/inspect these rooms?  He\/she should be fired for renting out such high price rooms with such filthy condition rooms!!!

12\/1\/2015:
I appreciate your response.  However I am sorry to say the response to me seems superficial.  Just empty words.... For a large corporation such as MGM who are suppose to be top notch service in the hotel industry, I would expect an offer of refund in my hotel room cost or a voucher for next visit. ($210x2, I paid for two rooms.  The second room where my children stayed, they told me security had to be called because there were fight in a room next to them, things were being thrown around and someone was screaming for her money!)

This hotel gets three stars for two simple reasons - price and location.

I stayed in this hotel for a business meeting. I know we got a good price on the rooms. The rooms themselves were standard for a mediocre hotel -- basic bed, average bathroom, coffee machine, etc.  The one nice thing was a view of the mountains to the west.  Otherwise, there was nothing good or special about the room. This may be fine for a discount price, but not for Vegas.  

However, the location for the price was great, mainly because it is next to Aria. The hotel is connected to Aria by a walkway.  There is also a tram that goes from the hotel to Aria and the Bellagio.  It is about a five minute walk to Aria and ten minutes to city center shops.  Short by Vegas standards.  Needless to say Aria is great - beautiful casino, great restaurants, overall excellent vibe.

Not so for the Monte Carlo. Going from Monte Carlo to Aria is like going from the Vegas bus station to the real Monte Carlo.  The Sports book is the best example.  In Monte Carlo it is old style, with a bunch of 30 - 40 inch TVs and a couple of non-HD big screens.  In Aria, the sports book has a HUGE wall of TV's (probably 20 ft high), all in HD.  Similarly, the Monte Carlo Casino is downscale and feels small and the restaurants are mediocre.  At night, the sports bar suddenly stops being a sports bar and instead features dueling pianos (yes a "sports bar" with dueling pianos).  Even the staff felt this was a terrible idea.  Unless you enjoy the downscale feel, there is simply no reason to stay on the property.

That said, if you get a really cheap hotel price, and it lets you play or eat more at Aria, it may be worth sleeping in the room.

If you are on a tight budget - the Monte Carlo is probably one of the better bargains on the strip. From our stay it seems to be popular with overweight middle-aged White people, and frugal Asians. And luckily for me at their gym - seems neither of those groups work out!

Given my recent experience though - I will probably spend a few more bucks next trip and stay at Vdara or similar (discount rates via Jetsetter\/Hotels etc). I knocked this from 3 to 2 stars for uncleanliness. Details follow....

The Dirty Discoveries:

- Bathroom floor: dirty, especially under the sink. I mentioned once to room service, but it was never mopped. I rubbed around a towel to verify it was dirty, and not just the color of the floor
- Dirty Washcloth: the second day I was delivered a washcloth with multiple large, bright red stains in it, that looked like fresh blood. Made me think they don't bleach their towels enough. Unfortunately it was right on top of other towels on the rack. Those all went on the floor, unused.
- Found half a condom wrapper under the desk, in the far corner of the room, next to the wall (thankfully, no condom, and unfortunately too small sized for me anyway)
- Found a pill on the floor, next to the bed, while checking around to see what other goodies we might find. Googled it and it was a birth control pill, and not one that any of my girlfriends' take. And, unfortunately, of no use to me (being male).

Previous guest - whoever you were - when you leave pills behind - please leave me some of The Good Shit. Thanks.

We ended up leaving the wrapper and pill on the floor, to see if it would get cleaned up. They were there our entire stay, until checkout. To be fair - we didn't call room service and tell them about it. But, I wanted to gauge how often\/well the floors were cleaned before I performed any calisthenics on the floor. Needless to say we decided it was better off to wear socks and avoid touching the floors.

Overall I thought it was kind of funny, minus the bloody washcloth, but my girlfriends' were fairly unimpressed. I've stayed all over Vegas, and in this price range the MGM Grand was similar but cleaner. But that was 9 years ago.

In Summary -

Pros:
+ cheap
(I paid roughly $115\/night for 5 days = $585 total. I've read other folks found 5 night bargains for as low as $300. For $300 I'd give this place 3-4 stars)
+ No taxi line, ever, even peak evening times.
+ Beds were decent for a cheap stay.
+ Great, free gym, very clean, new equipment, that nobody uses. Very friendly and helpful gym\/spa staff. The gym alone would be a deciding factor in staying here again, were the rooms clean.

Cons:
- Hallways to room were worn down, dirty
- Room was very dirty - see above.
- Checkin lines looked insane most of the time I walked by. Luckily when I arrived (on a Tuesday) it was fairly dead. I waited maybe 15 minutes total. Later in the week looked light it might be painfully long in line.
- Only tried eating at "The Buffet". Food was overall very low quality, in all of my guests opinions, for $25\/apiece. I'm more of a quality than quantity guy, but we wanted breakfast food.

ProTip: Didn't try their other restaurants, but we found out we could have eaten at The Buffet for roughly $10\/person by calling Tix4Tonight.

Stayed here back in December 2013. The price for the room that weekend was pretty affordable since they were having some sort of construction outside. I was a bit worried that I would be awoken in the morning due to the noise but to my surprise there was none. The room needs to be remodeled though for sure. I wish it had a better tv and better phone reception. The colors are funky too. The hotel location was very convenient though which was a great plus for us that rainy weekend. We were able to take the tram and get to other hotels such as Vdara with no trouble at all. I wouldn't mind staying here again because it was very convenient and affordable. There was plenty of gambling options downstairs as well.

Beware of the flyer that the cleaning staff leave in your room called Pizza Bella - don't order from them - expensive and tasteless food.  No one ever offered a complementary drink in casino - like they do in other hotels. Average rooms. No wifi!!!
We just got to our room and there was no electricity I'm sooo furious this is disappointing.

Idk how people can give the MC such bad reviews. I got my room comped from the FB game MyVegas and you would expect a comp room to be sucky but NO! My room was excellent! I think I might've gotten an updated room bc the furniture was very modern and the 2 queen beds were comfy! We even got a view of the pool which was awesome! Too bad it rained so we couldn't even go but this is def a hotel I would consider going back to!

Unfortunately, the Montecarlo Hotel was a disappointment.  The carpets in our room and our daughters room were dirty and worn to threadbare and ripped.  There was mold in the bathtub, the furniture is old and chipped, the shower curtain in our daughters room was full of stains, the closet door was missing a door knob, the walls were scuffed and the baseboards were dirty, not to mention that there was no modern amenities such as a coffee maker, alarm clock, microwave, refrigerator or bottled water.  The pool is apparently closed for good, so we had to walk to the MGM Grand to enjoy some poolside time.  To be honest, I didn't even want to walk on the carpet or use the bathroom.  It was gross and tired.  I would recommend that the management make some serious repairs and upgrades.  Also, get the housekeeping up to par.

It's certainly not the worst hotel out there, but it's definitely showing its age. The lobby and casino area was actually pretty nice, though I wish I could say the same about the hallways and rooms. Overall the hallway and carpets looked a bit dirty, like it was demanding a new paint job and some recarpeting. The room was about as standard and traditional as it gets, and everything looked pretty old for 2014. The room was missing 2 basic things in my opinion: a mini-fridge and wireless internet. Granted fridges are available at an extra cost, but I figured since it was Vegas and hot most of the time, a fridge would be standard. There is actually free wireless in the lobby\/casino areas, however the rooms only provide wired internet service. Again, I figured this would be standard as well. The Monte Carlo certainly isn't a bad place since it has a decent casino and a few good places to eat on site (800* Neapolitan Pizza, Yoshu, Blvd Creamery), but the rooms are just screaming for a remodel.

Very disappointed in the room. None of the 3 desk in the room matched each other and they were old and chip. The chair is dirty and stained. The bathroom is tiny with an old fashion tub . On there website, it had a completely different picture from what we got. So we had to complain to get a nicer room but we had to pay $35 more a night.

Very nice.  It is moderately priced, pretty well maintained, and conveniently located on the strip.  It is part of the tram line that runs from MC to City Center to Bellagio.  It's usually not too crowded as a lot of people don't know about it.  

As for the crowds, it's not too bad. Since it is a smaller property compared to others it is easy to get around and there aren't tons of people meandering through looking at stuff.  

Our room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. We had a nice view of the pool and city center buildings.  For the price, we would return.

Nope. Don't do it.  I would leave if I could and go to another hotel. 

Staff is rude, casino basic, and rooms are run-down - especially the bathroom.  I couldn't wait to shower then I couldn't wait to get out. 

Hate, sorry loathe, this hotel.  Never again.

This review is based on a business trip, not personal trip. I wish I could give this place no stars. There is no WiFi in any of the rooms, only wired internet. (Do they even make laptops with that port anymore?) Also, the room looks like a motel room (nothing fancy, poor decor, no fridge, and no view) with very limited power outlets. I had to literally move a dresser next to my bed and unplug a lamp to charge my phone. If you work in tech, this is too appalling to experience. I would not stay here for business travels ever again. (And I'll also be steering clear of it personally in the future.)

There are a lot of options in Vegas, so I'm still going to explore and see what else is out there, but my experience at the Monte Carlo was fine.  There was nothing fancy about the room, but they manage to do ever tying really well.  Room service was right at my elbow when my card wouldn't open the door.  

The pool area is nice.  I wouldn't want to be out there on a busy weekend day because in the middle of the week the lounge chairs were totally taken up and there wasn't a lot of space in the pools.  They rent a tube to take around the lazy river for $10, which seemed like a bit of a ripoff.  Drinks and foods are also a ripoff, but it's easy enough to walk 200 feet to the Monte Carlo food court and grab a burger, sandwich, slice of pizza, Chinese food, or fish taco.  Don't even think of bringing any foodstuff back to the pool area.  The TSA agents at the airport have nothing on the people who watch the entrance to the pool.  

The fitness center has enough to keep all but the most serious of exercise enthusiasts happy.  There are 6+ jogging machines, a lots of stationary bicycles, and a elliptical machines.  there are also enough weight machines to keep your shoulders and legs pumped up.

There's a nice monorail that will take guests from the hotel to Aria or The Bellagio.  This makes a big different because there are a plenty of fun places to visit parallel to these places and the sidewalks can be much less than fun on hot days or busy nights.

I do think that it's ridiculous that any state of the art hotel doesn't have free WiFi in this day and age.  Trying to plan my trip was a complete pain in the ass given my iPhone took ages to download even the simplest of pages.

This place was great and def better than expected after reading recent Yelp reviews. We stayed on the 28th floor facing the MGM and didn't hear any construction what so ever. Everyone from the concierge to the maids were beyond friendly. Only had 1 issue where our neighbors blasted music at 330am and when I called down the front desk the lady was so nice and had security sent to deal with the issue promptly. I mean this is no luxury hotel but you aren't paying luxury prices. For what we paid a night it was more than satisfactory. I liked the casino and they had plenty of restaurant options. We were only there 3 nights so we didn't get to hit them all up but the ice bar and the cantina looked really cool. As for shops in the walk way to the aria being closed, who cares, there are 2847273848 other places to go if you want to shop. 


Only advice is to waive resort fees while in transition to the new hotel because we couldn't use the pool which was a downer, and I'm not walking all the way to the MGM. Or make an equivalent discount or give me a buffet ticket or something.

Really good hotel for the price.  Very luxury looking for a cheap hotel price, which i was suprised how cheap it was to stay there.

PRO's-Hotel lobby was absolutly beautiful, chandelers everywhere, checkin fast, free upgrade to strip view but the hotel doesnt have a real good view of the strip anyway =( hallways were very pretty decorated with motown artists, room was very big, comfy beds, old tv though, but bathroom was super nice. toiletries were from their spa which was a plus, double sinks, big closet, and bathtub.  Casino was very nice and super clean, employees nice, awesome food court, and affortable resturants which is rare for a property like this.  good location, good crowd.

CON's-parking is terrible, the garage is kind of a far walk, there is a side parking lot that is full most of the time, pool was nice but couldnt use it because no available seats. buffett was kinda of small for the price.

Look - if you aren't staying at the Bellagio, or the absolute NEWEST hotel in Vegas, then you shouldn't expect 5 star service! Monte Carlo delivered as far as price goes.

We got the rooms somewhere around $80-100 a night, over memorial day weekend. It was our first time in Las Vegas.

The Good:

1) This part will also show up in my "bad" section, but we were given two queens our first night, after having reserved a king. The view from the queen room, at the end of a very quiet hallway on the 30th floor, was amazing! So we never asked to be placed in the king we initially asked for. I don't think you'll get a bad view in this hotel if you get a higher level room.

2) There is SO MUCH TO DO in the hotel itself. We had a hard time leaving, actually. So many restaurants, with great variety, as far as type of food, service, and price go. Starbucks for a quick pick-me-up, Sambalatte for a casual latte. McDonalds for a quick fry, The Cafe for an upscale diner-like experience. There's literally everything you'll ever need in this hotel.

3) The pool. We weren't looking for noise, so we sat at the very far left, near the hot tub\/actual pool, and far away from the wave pool. Yes, you can hear the music on the speakers here ("club" music started at noon every day), but its HALF as quiet (if not more) than sitting elsewhere in the area where the DJ is. We would walk up to get drinks and go, wow, how is it so quiet where we are over there but so loud at the bar?!

4) LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! Monte Carlo is in one of the best spots on the strip, ever. If nothing else, stay here for the location.

The Bad:

1) Yeah, we reserved a king and got a room with two double-beds. They should honor the reservation, but kings are "first come first serve" and we checked in at 10pm on a Wednesday night. Nonetheless, they texted us the following day saying our king was available, but we enjoyed our view and room location so much that we didn't bother to switch.

2) When we checked in late, there was food on the floor. Crumbs, ramen noodles dried up near the bed, etc. Very visible. We didn't complain because we figured housekeeping would get it in the morning, but they didn't. So we had to call housekeeping and tell them about the food. After this, they cleaned it up very promptly and our room was always in good condition. You're not getting housekeeping service like you'd get in a Hilton, but we never felt "dirty" in our room after that (aside from the food incident).

3) It's not a 5 star. Maybe not even a 4. Yes, the furniture is "tired" (I hate this saying) but THE PLACE IS CHEAP! There are some nicks on the furniture, the decor is a little lacking and old, but it was not unpleasant at all.

4) ITS THE YEAR 2014, MAKE WIFI FREE IN EVERY SINGLE ROOM, EVERY SINGLE FLOOR! UP THE TECHNOLOGY - IF I CAN CHECK-OUT FROM MY TELEVISION, I SHOULD GET WIFI. 

Overall, we'd stay here again. It fits our budget. It had everything we needed. It was very pleasant!

Extremely disappointed with this hotel and MGM as a company. I booked a 3 day stay based on the promotion that gives you 2 complimentary show tickets, and when I arrived they tell me the promotion was never applied and they can't give me tickets. This is a complete scam, false advertising, classic Vegas I guess. I will not be back to the Monte Carlo or MGM resorts. At least wait until I sit at the slots to rob me.

Monte Carlo is a good place to stay in Vegas. It's towards the middle of the South Strip I guess you could say so it's not a far walk to nearby hotels\/attractions. There is a CVS next door (necessary). It's not as huge as the mega-resort properties and I think that better b\/c those places become a chore to get to your room, restaurants, parking, etc. The prices are good too for this nice a resort.

I was pretty disappointed with the room here.  Granted we went to Vegas to have a good time, but it would have been nice to have a room that actually looked like Las Vegas.

There were 2 holes in the walls.  There were black marks all over the ceiling.  The A\/C didn't work all that well.  The mirror in the bathroom was dirty and there was hair in the sink.  The window was also dirty to look outside.  There was an old standard TV in the room.  I was expecting a flat panel TV.  The bathroom didn't have an exhaust fan.  

On the other hand the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Like I said it was a disappointment to be in Vegas with a subpar room.  I have stayed in "standard" rooms at other casinos in Kansas City Mo and the rooms there are amazing.

I've only stayed here once, and only for 1 night

The room was average, which is good in my eyes. Spacious, clean. Can't complain. The food court is decent for fast food. 

The pool, I haven't checked out yet.

Stayed over on Labor Day, Monday night. This should be one of the least filled nights out of the year so plenty of rooms available. And looking at the place, it was pretty empty when we arrived st valet and the check-in line was short. That being said, they still managed to give us the crappiest room possible. It was on a lower floor and right next to our room were several rooms marked "employees" which wouldn't be a big deal if we didn't have to hear people working inside really early in the morning! And then looking out the window, there was non-stop construction ALL NIGHT LONG! Good thing I'm a deep sleeper and only woke-up a couple of times to loud back-up lights, but my spouse said there were trucks non-stop coming in\/out due to deliveries, and workers working and yelling. We pretty much stay at all the Mlife hotels and eat\/gamble at the mLife hotels, BUT, we always forget to bring the card. So I guess if you're a nobody (not being mLife tracked with our stays, etc.), this is how you get treated. Believe me, Vegas is NOT my choice for a vacation except maybe once or twice a year but we go 4-6 times a year for sports related events.

So my question is, why did the employee specifically choose this crappy room for us if there are plenty of other rooms available? Was it based on:
1) no mLife card given?
2) paid low price due to low season so give us crappy room? 
3) didn't like the way we appeared?
4) didn't look like we'd complain?

Normally, a hotel would assign a better room than normal because they CAN! Why not show customers your best? I'm not saying give us some fancy suite or upgrade, but rather, at a minimum, a room AWAY FROM CONSTRUCTION AND NOISE. But I guess Vegas is so popular and the employees are just desensitized and could careless. Just looks at how much you paid and are you a regular, is my guess. Sad thing is is that we ARE regulars...

We just returned from our 4th trip to Las Vegas, where we enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo. The room was fine, we aren't real particular. The hallways have clearly put it with countless people, many of which were probably intoxicated. If having some blemishes in the hallway is going to bother you, than I guess you'll have to pony up probably double the $$ and stay at a newer resort. 
The location was great, the casino was good. The staff were excellent in terms of everything related to our stay. From the gentleman who helped us out of the cab, to the bell desk attendant that brought our bags, to the front desk clerk who checked us in. 
We got in late on a Friday night, it took about 25 minutes to get through the check-in line, it feels like longer, but it wasn't. I had my stopwatch going. when I informed the people in front of me how long it had been, they were surprised, because it felt longer. When you first get there, all you want to do is be in your room with your stuff and getting ready to hit the town, so everything feels like it takes forever. Grab a beer and relax, it will be OK. 
The pool is definitely the highlight of this resort. The Lazy river is a lot of fun and a great atmosphere for partying or people watching, or just relaxing and recovering. The drinks are really good, but spendy. Plan on $18 plus tip for a 24 oz slushy cocktail or $8 for a 16 oz bottle of beer. 
All in all, for the price range this hotel was in, we loved the location and were satisfied with everything else.

This place is pretty much under 75% remodel. No pools. Two of the floors are completely unusable for hotel rooms. Buzzing every morning from work starting at 9 even when we were suppose to have a room far away from the work being done. Had to switch rooms yesterday due to brown colored water coming from ceiling in bathroom down mirror onto counter. Ruined my gfs, makeup bag and both toothbrushes.. and they offered nothing for this, however They were nice enough to switch rooms. The thing is though is that it doesn't tell you this hotel is being remodeled when you book through most sites and you don't know until you get a hotel confirmation trip before you leave saying the pool isn't open due to construction but doesn't specify that the whole hotel is. First time here, stayed at Harrahs last time. For the money it's pretty good considering it's location to the strip. However If you pay more you might just avoid construction and no pool.

*edit to one star. Switched rooms and went up to the 30th floor. (Was told most construction is 24 and 25. Definitely not true. Loud grinder or buzzing starting at 840 to 9 everyday. So if you plan on sleeping past that time after a long night then DONT GO TO MONTECARLO...

Rooms were horribly old and dated, no plug-ins to speak of. The staff was friendly, but the casino was dank and dark. For the outrageous rates we paid, I expected better. Hopefully they renovate soon.

Moths in my room! 

It's been several years since I last stayed at the Monte Carlo, but since it was a pleasant stay then, we thought it would be a pleasant one again now. When I made my reservation I requested to add a note that I would be checking in late as I was expecting to arrive after midnight. When we checked in at 2:30am we were informed that because it was so late, they would have to give my husband and I a room with 2 queens instead of a king (which we were ok with, we were tired from travelling and just wanted to get into our room). The overall check-in process was quick with no issues and the person at the front desk was very pleasant. We got a room on the 15th floor, and as I opened the door I was startled with a large moth flying right to my face. Surprised, I stepped back and my husband proceeded into the room. As he turned on light above the doorway, 2 more large moths started flying in the room. We immediately knew we wanted another room, so I went to turn on the light on the desk to use the phone to call the front desk, and another 2 large moths were sitting on the lampshade! When I called the front desk to let them know there were moths in the room, the first response I received was, "Ok, I can send housekeeping up there to get rid of them for you." SERIOUSLY?! I informed her that I did not want that, I wanted a completely new room. She proceeded to find me another room on the 5th floor and transferred our keys, but then said "I can't guarantee that there won't be moths in that room either, because of the season, guests have been leaving their windows open." As I was talking with the front desk, my husband was checking around the room and found more moths in between the window curtains. We immediately went to our new room on the 5th floor, and thankfully it was moth free.

We had a Deluxe room, and it appeared pretty dated but the beds were comfortable. There were not many available outlets in the room, and the ones that were available seemed loose. The shower had strong pressure to our liking, but did not drain quickly and I was always standing in ankle deep water by the end of my shower (and I didn't even take long showers). The water also leaked onto the floor when we showered, so we always had to put extra towels down. Our room was cleaned daily, towels & water bottled replaced. Employees we interacted with were very courteous. We also liked the proximity of the convenience shop & food court to the guest elevators. Other than the moth incident, the overall stay was just ok, but I don't think the Monte Carlo will be a first option for us the next time we go to Vegas.

We stayed here this past weekend. Shower was AWESOME!!  Bed was comfortable & the room was relatively quiet. You can spend the day at the spa which was great and relaxing. Cons: Pillows are horrible. The headboards were stained & there was a stain on the carpet. Gross!

Giving this hotel 2 stars because the rooms were just normal. Dissapointed with the overall experience here at Monte Carlo Hotel.. Waited close to 45 minutes to check in....the excuse is its the summer. Really!!!!!! you have only four front desk people helping over 40 people checking in. thats a Fail.   

If anything that a five star hotel can do is at least make sure the room is clean. I got to my room and there was stains still on the toilet... wow this is gross.... i complained to the front desk....and she made it sound like i was making it up.... for my troubles here is a refund of your resort fees. and im sorry... Again thats a FAIL
 
THE CASINO WAS FINE....had a good time playing the slots.

Just a note even though a room may be complimentary maybe it would be better just to pay to get a better room and enhance your experience.

I will definetly not stay at this casino again

This hotel is crap. From little things like the bathroom not being stocked with hand towels to being locked out if our room for no apparent reason after a long day on the lake; from a serous lack of courtesy on the part of nearly every staff member we had contact with to having to park our truck and jetskis in the Excalibur parking lot a block away because the Monte Carlo has no RV parking; from the horrible buffet (which made my husband sick after breakfast) to being woken up at 6 am because that's when construction starts at the site just outside our window; pretty much every aspect of our stay was a disappointment. The only redeeming point...the beds were very comfortable, that's why this hotel gets one generous star from me. I will never stay here again and would not recommend Monte Carlo to anyone.

The first time I visited Vegas was in 2005, and this place was supposed to be some hot stuff. This time around, it is not any more. The place is so run down. The only nice thing about it is the lobby.

Work event brought me here for a week. The other recent reviews from guests are spot on. 

Downstairs: Valet was prompt and accommodating. The lobby was clean and pretty. Registration was prompt. I asked for a room with morning sun, and none of the three desk reps knew if the room they were giving me would meet my request. (Turns out the room faced north west. Boo.) 

The elevator access from the lobby is easy - and you don't have to trek through the casino. This is a great plus for me. 

Upstairs: The 19th floor was showing it's age. The wall paper was peeling in the hallway, and you could see many patched areas in the wall where they changed the art, but didn't bother taking it any farther. 

Once in the room, it appeared clean and had recently been cleaned. I know this because the carpet was wet. When I called down to inquire if there was anything special I should know (and to quiet my active imagination), the front desk said it was indeed cleaned and should be dry "by morning." Huh. Lucky me! 

The bed and pillows were comfortable and clean. The drapes were falling off of the track and the shower curtain rod was coming out of the wall.  Towels were dingy and had several had holes.

I love the comment the other reviewer left about the shower. What is with that spray of needles?! (I'm awake, already, I'm awake!) 

This place was in DESPERATE NEED of an update. 

PS...One more thing.  The walls are realllly thin.  In case you were wondering, my neighbors had a good time.

I really wanted to love this hotel but it wasn't so great. It is a four diamond resort and I can see why. Remains of a once luxurious hotel still remain but the rooms could use a little renovation. But here are some pros and cons to staying here;
Pros:
1. Friendly front desk staff who is willing to answer all your questions.
2. Taxi stand moved pretty quick.
3. Convenient tram connecting Monte Carlo to Crystals\/Aria and Bellagio.
4. Close to city center.
5. Next door to a CVS (incase you forgot something or need meds).
6. Nice rooms with updated flat screen tvs and Keurig coffee maker with complimentary coffee and water. 
7. Cleaning staff does a great job cleaning your room and bathroom.
Cons:
1. Cafe service sucks, don't even go there. We went and after waiting over 10 minutes for our waiter to even come say hello we decided to get up and leave. The place was not even busy yet our waiter kept telling us "I'll be right with you" and never came. We ended up going to Denny's across the street which was packed yet we were seated in 10 minutes and were immediately helped by our awesome waitress. 
2. No Internet service on my iPhone through my cell phone provider. Monte Carlo has wi-fi which the shamelessly charge 14.99 for 24 hour period.
3. Bathrooms need renovation. Gold fixtures are discolored and rusted. Sink drain smelled like sewage and when you turned off the facet the water going down the drain made too much noise. Sounded like a pluming problem. The shower head was horrible with no good water pressure. It seemed to low so tall people beware. After turning off shower, water still came out of the tub faucet.
4. Walls are paper thin!!! I could clearly hear conversations next door. I was awoken at 5 am but the noisy neighbors next door. There is also a gap underneath the door where noise easily came in. I could also hear conversations going on in the hall. In the bathroom you could also hear people in the bathroom next door. So in other words, noise comes in from all sides of your room.
5. No blow dryers which was ok for me but could be a problem for others.

Meh.
I've stayed in a number of hotels in Vegas, and we booked this one because of the lazy river and the expected beautiful decor. 

When we got there, we immediately noticed the wonderful aroma that wafted through the hotel. nice. We were pretty sweaty after hiking from the parking garage in the 115 degree Las Vegas weather, and we weren't impressed with their air conditioning. The elevators were downright hot. The check-in was pretty easy and we were given our keys and directions to the room.

Arriving to the room, we weren't impressed. The view was decent...we could see out to the Hard Rock and M&M store, so that was cool, but the room was just meh. 

The longer we stayed, the more we noticed things falling apart. Our sink wasn't draining, the iron was missing from the closet, and there were about 15 escort business cards in the drawer next to the bible. We called down to the front desk to ask about wifi, and we were told that they didn't have it. They told us that there was a plug in the room, but it seemed that someone had taken that, too. And we learned later that it wouldn't have worked for a Macbook Air anyway. ugh

When we went down to the pool, it was really crowded. One of the pools was way too warm to be comfortable in 115 degree Vegas heat. The "lazy river" that we were looking forward to was a circle...really not impressive at all.

One of the days, we went to the buffet and paid for endless mimosas. Every time we looked around for our waiter to refill our mimosas, he was nowhere to be found. But eventually, we would track him down. When we waved him down for our fourth round, he gave us a dirty look. He was really rude.

All in all, it was just an average hotel. I can't say that I will be staying here again. There are for better places to stay on the strip that have better amenities and better decor.

We come to Vegas at least once a year, this was our first time to stay at Monte Carlo.  Our room was nice, but old and needed some updating.  ( we were told that a total remodel was in the works). Our bed was good and pillows were too. 

Room was clean.  Bathroom was too, but shower head was like showering a carwash ( high pressure nozzle!) 

Variety of restaurants were nice too.  The pool area was closed ( it was February !) and was undergoing a renovation.  

Casino was hard to play in as the machines were tight.  

The front patio was awesome, sunny and clean bordering Las Vegas Blvd and was a good place to hang out when you run out of money! 

Also you can walk very easily over to Aria, (the casino was looser) without having to go outside.  

Overall, we will be back here again!

With this being our first trip to Vegas, we didn't know where to stay. My wife and I booked at the Monte Carlo because the price was right and it had a four star rating. Sadly, we walked through some of the other casinos that were awarded 5 star ratings (Bellagio, Ceasar's Palace, etc.), and it doesn't seem fair to award the Monte Carlo a 4 star rating by comparison.

THE BAD NEWS:

The rooms weren't special at all; with the peeling wallpaper, ruffled carpets and worn interior it felt more like a Holiday Inn than a luxury resort on The Strip. The casino area wasn't great either. It hardly ever seemed like the place to be to lose all your money at.

The pool area was lively and entertaining, but there were still some soft spots: (1) there were all these roped off hutchs and pool beds marked "Reserved" or "VIP", but no one was ever in them... kinda a bummer us not very important people couldn't use them. (2) They charged a whopping $10 for the floating tubes, and as a result the lazy river was filled more hardworking people that stood in it drinking beer and fighting the current. (3) The "wave" pool gently swished back and forth for about 3 minutes before shutting off for at least 10 minutes... it was so boring that even the creepy weirdos that would normally indulge in frottage stayed away. (4) Drinks by the pool were ridiculously priced and you can't bring in drinks from the other bars at the resort.

THE GOOD NEWS:

The staff were all amazing. We felt very taken care of there. The casino is relatively central on The Strip with it being just north of New York New York and just south of the Aria. And as I said before, we couldn't beat the price of this place.

ADDED BONUS:

The Blue Man Group performs here. I HIGHLY recommend you see this show. It was wildly entertaining and hilarious.

If you like checking into rooms that have the previous guests urine on he toilet seat and dirty towels over the floor - please give Monte Carlo a shot!

We checked in at 2am after a delayed flight, however I called to confirm that we would be showing up.

1.  They gave away one of our rooms that was a double (we explicitly reserved a double)

2.  They assigned us rooms that were filthy.  Urine on the toilet seats and used towels everywhere.

3.  We complained.  They "upgraded us" to strip view rooms on a higher floor.  These rooms also had the previous guests urine on the toilet seat and one of them reeked of some kind of curry or body odor.

4.  We complained again.  I insisted on speaking to the manager who then talked down to me because "I was being too aggressive and threw my phone at him" to show the pictures of the dirty bathroom.

Mind you it was about 4am by this time.  I didn't throw the phone but it did fall from the counter into his computer area because I wanted him to see the filth.

5.  We moved again.  One room was a suite the other a double that faced floodlights on the outside.  

This place is a disgrace.  Avoid at all costs.  See my picture and judge for yourself.

-- The generic cut-and-paste comments from customer service at the resort really don't make up for the vacation day that was ruined by zero sleep or the rude experience with the night manager. 

Note to MGM: Yelp lets you reply to negative comments to express your honest and heartfelt reply to issues that impact your customers, some of who only get to go on one or two trips each year.  Ruining one of them can be devastating.  Your reply doesn't provide any kind of indication that you understand this at all.  It is corporate and hollow.

I love the Monte Carlo for several reasons: its across from the MGM (allowing access to that monorail system), next to City Center (allowing for their new tram system), it isn't the 800 lb gorilla that MGM is and the pace is less crazy too!  The room was large and comfortable; there was  WiFi access and a Deuce stop nearby. The hotel is well-maintained and the staff very courteous and prompt. My only complaint is that their wave pool is nothing like the one at Mandalay Bay and one afternoon they ran out of pool towels.  All in all, I would recommend this to friends and family!

First time at this hotel. It is centrally located in the strip, not to far on either end, right in the middle which I loved. Check was fast on a Thursday night. Checkout took a little longer on Sunday but there's express checkouts available. There was construction going on; if you aren't sensitive to those things you should be fine. Nice rooms but no fridge. A fridge would be nice. Overall it is a nice hotel and not expensive.

I really like this hotel. The rooms are definitely modern and up to date. Bathrooms are clean and marbled. Beds are comfy, inviting, and looks new. Updated amenities. The suite was spacious and enough for at least 4 people.

The pool was amazing. They have a normal pool, a lazy river, AND a wave pool. I am in love with the wave pool! I spent most of the time in the wave pool, and when it's turn off, I'd grab a beer and lounge in the lazy river. There's also DJ\/ MC the last time I stayed there, so it was entertaining as well.
