They have about 11 lazy river day beds, 2 with pergola like things so you can use curtains to shield. Include a fun queen sz bed with 2 lounge chairs, towels, 2 tubes.  Or, the basic which we got, and it is so fun...umbrella with the bed and 2 lounge chairs.  Service is awesome and attentive.  

TIP: For the cost of the rental, you can apply ALL food and bev charges towards that.  Family of 4?  I should be able to do that by noon lol.  Husband was gonna hit Starbucks and I tripped him walking away,  no way, we are eating at the cabana ONLY today!! That is a deal.  I did not get that offer at Bellagio or Caesars cabanas.  FYI we paid top pricing for saturday on the holiday weekend, so $400, plus they add 18% gratuity and tip.  Well spent IMO.  If no one has rented by noon I heard you can "make an offer" too.

Hotel Location: Great. My little one isn't a fan of walking and the 13yr old can shop 24\/7.   This is perfect.

Recap: I researched for days and days to make this trip work for kids.  Top 3 hotels for families are consistently MGM, Mandalay and Monte Carlo.  This one for price, amenities and location win IMO.
First time in vegas ,hotel was great, got a good view, would definately come back again!

I wrote this to customer service with no response 



I just left your Monte Carlo location with by far the most horrendous experience I have ever had in my entire life at a hotel . From the check in process I requested a high level strip view and was told I was not going to receive that request and ended up with the lowest level construction and no difference in price , at first I was extremely upset that not only was I being given attitude with the impression as if I wasn't worth a nice view I had  to ask for a compensation I was given the choice of one resort fee removed or a 50.00 credit . I inquired about the credit and was told  " oh no not just for one restaurant you can use it for anything in the casino don't worry ! It is just taken off the room at check out !" Well okay that seems like a great deal we will take that . We get to the room and not only was it not clean enough to my standard the grout in the bathroom had black mold on it and the wall behind the bathroom door had yellow stains everywhere . Okay so besides the room , we paid for buffet as well we walked into the buffet and no one greeted us we stood for 20 minutes and no one came to guide us in so we didn't get to eat , my child was crying and I had to settle for a fast food establishment . Now at my check out experience was the absolute worse booking.com gave me a grand total that was 100 dollars over what I was told on booking and the booking had included resort fee , the lady helping me was raising her voice and all I was just asking to break down every so I can understand at this point from all previous experience I was exhausted and just so dissatisfied thus far I was exhausted.. at the end I was told the credit was only for food and beverage and I was a liar , called a liar to my face and that was when I had enough . My name is Blank  and this casino treated me worse than any other experience in my life and ruined every other Vegas experience , I drove 5 hours home in disbelief . I would appreciate a call or some kind of conversation with someone who cares .

Sent from my iPhone

Stayed here June 27th-30th for a girls trip. 

Overall, it alright, nothing spectacular. Checking in, we tried to suavely hand over the $20 trick, which the check-in lady promptly gave back. Yeah, not so suave. But then she "upgraded" us to a strip view room to a strip view room on the 118th floor so yay! 
Be aware that there is a mandatory hotel services fee of ~22 dollars per day (includes not so great Wifi, water bottles, gym). 

The room was alright...kinda dingy really (even the considerably cheaper Flamingo's pink decor seemed nicer). Unfortunately, the walls are as thin as paper. There was a group of 15+ girls next to us banging the walls and screaming every 10 seconds. We even heard vomiting sounds an hour later...ughh disgusting. Thankfully they checked out soon after.  

The location is the best part. It's right next to MGM (Hakkasan anyone?) and in close proximity to other hotels like the Cosmo and the Wynn. I highly suggest driving and using valet (cheap at $2-4 tip) or using a taxi because it is sweat within seconds weather over there.    

There's 3 pools. Be sure to get there early or be forced to walk in the hellish heat looking for a seat. Or, get on a guestlist\/talk to a promoter and go the awesome pool parties (I recommend Encore Beach or Marquee Dayclub!).

Just back and still tired from my weekend partying in Las Vegas. 
For what we were looking for this hotel met our needs. Well priced and good location. The hotel itself if a 3 out of 5. 
I had reserved a room with a king bed and they were out when I checked in and I wound up with 2 doubles (not even queen beds). I notice little things when I travel like wallpaper peeling in the bathroom and showers in need or re-grouting. It's annoying to look at. 
For the little amount of time I spent in the room it was fine. I cannot say that about the pool area which was sad looking. Yes people enjoyed themselves, but it was hard to find any chair in the sun and they want $12 for a tube rental in their super small lazy river. The good deal to be had is a large reusable plastic drinking cup is $16 for your first drink and only $12 to refill. 
As far as the casino- SUPER SMOKEY. They need an upgrading air system.
Would I stay here again, sure. I saved money that I spent out and about in the city and at other casinos.

Staying at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas and can't believe there are crickets on the 29th floor!  We told house keeping, maintenance and the front desk. They all couldn't believe us but after numerous attempts to get someone up here to hear them at night NOT ONE hotel employee came up to investigate even though they said to call us at night so they could send someone up.  We called and even asked for the manager on duty and still NO ONE!  Also since they are renovating the hotel the construction noise is terrible!  They turn off the water intermittently without informing the guests or housekeeping. One day housekeeping came and turned on the faucet in our room and discovered no water. She cleaned the rest of the room and then came back a few hours later to a flooded room. We got a call saying our room was extracted bc we left the faucet on. No apologies at first!  The maid turned it on and left it on!  The tub is always dirty and the bathroom towel racks keep falling. It's a waste of time to tell anyone. Customer service has gone down hill here. Maybe it's bc of the renovation but right now it's not worth the money to stay here. They tried to give us a food and beverage credit but most of the restaurants are closed here!  Don't bother staying here right now. At least until renovations are over and maybe they will refrain the employees on customer service. An employee at MLife actually complained to me that they keep pressing customer service but half their equipment is broken and they go back and forth on their promises to the customers. My recommendation, avoid staying here until renovations are done.

Vomit Carlo -- They really must think about changing the name. Vomit stain on the carpet coming off the elevator, for 2 days. Girl vomiting all over the elevator lobby at 4am ... what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas for her because she won't remember a thing. Oh, nice acoustics in the rooms, between the cleaning staff laughing it up and talking on radios in the hall, to the very quick but happy ending sex of the couple next door and the alarm clock going blasting spanish radio with volume set to 11 in the other adjacent room -- with nobody home, it is just an audible delight. 

On the upside, the Vomit Carlo is pretty easy to get in and out of and centrally located so it can be an okay home base. I'd take ear plugs for the room and watch you step but the sheets are clean and there is excellent water pressure in the shower!!

Some folks in our group heard that it had been recently redone but we didn't see any evidence of that in the guest room area. 

Pros: Cheap
Cons: Vomit

First let me start with we went to see Cher who is amazing as usual and  I had a wonderful night at the Park Theatre. It is beautiful, sound is amazing and really no bad seats. But beware of the parking!!! My sister went on Friday the 5th and when they were asked if they were there for a Venue and she showed them her tickets, they did not charge them. We went on Sat. the 6th and when he asked for our parking pass I explained we were there for the Cher show. Frank Vargas said I should have purchased a parking pass ahead of time to save money $16 instead of $20... I asked why, there was no charge for Friday night, no answer, we paid the $20 and let it go.   I called today and was told, when there is an event at T-Mobile, the Monte Carlo will charge you for parking because patrons of T-Mobile park in their garage?  If I show them my ticket that clearly shows I'm going to their Park Theatre I should not have been charged. I understand the employee only does what he is told but shame on Monte Carlo for finding yet another way to rip off the locals.  This is why Uber is so popular and why I will never give another one of these hotels my money for parking. So I guess call ahead and see if it is a rip off night or you park free.............

There are nicer hotels for the same prices. I always thought Monte Carlo was higher class, UNTIL I STAYED THERE. Stained & wrinkled carpets, chipped bathroom decor, etc. I stayed for the pools, but the lazy river is very small & the wave pool gives off tiny waves, not even a tad fun. Not staying here again.

BOOKING: I am truly surprised at all the great reviews Monte Carlo has because my recent experience was pretty terrible! My mom had a high school reunion at the Monte Carlo, so she decided it would be a great idea to make it a mini family vacation. I called Monte Carlo a couple of months in advance and got a special rate with complimentary strip view for two rooms. Every staff member I talked to prior our visit was extremely helpful, kind, and respectful which was a great start. 

LOBBY\/ARRIVAL: Monte Carlo is on the strip and will cost you about $13-$17 including a $2 surcharge fee for any airport or McCarran property pick up. The lobby was extremely clean, everything was easy to find (casinos, food court, pool, ballrooms etc) and the rooms were separated by elevators (ie rooms 5-12, 27-35 etc) Since we had a 5am flight and arrived at 7am, we asked if there were any rooms available for us to check into for the meantime. The employee informed us that it would be a $20 per room charge to check in anytime after 9am and before 3pm and also informed us that we could leave our baggage for no additional fee. It was around 7am and we decided we would keep our bags and eat breakfast at the McDonald's in the food court. At 9am, the line grew to about 10 parties and there were only 3 employees designated for check in, which increased the waiting time to 30 minutes before I got to check in.

ROOMS: Tracy, the employee who helped me, was extremely kind, personable, and very helpful during my stay. She informed me that they were at 97% capacity and the only rooms she could give us were on the same floor, but about 15 rooms away from each other for $22 and some change (including tax) Since it was 9am and most of our party had pull all nighters, I agreed to pay the fee and we went straight to our rooms. Immediately upon entering, I noticed that room 5-320 was very dark and had a view of construction, which we didn't mind at all. The room was seriously something out of the haunted mansion with the light fixtures bearing dim bulbs! The cleanliness of the room appeared to be okay, until we removed our shoes and stepped on the carpet which felt filthy! As for the sheets, I am not super picky about sheets, but everyone in our room agreed that the sheets felt rough and many complained about bites in the morning. The worst part was the bathroom; the bathroom didn't include a hair dryer and we had to request for one, the bathtub was flooded, and the towels smelled like syrup. 

The remaining of us stayed in room 5-335, which was all the way at the end of the hall. My mom immediately called me and asked if she could switch rooms because it reeked of smoke and it was aggravating her asthma. I went to check it out and indeed, it smelled of cigarette smoke so I called front desk and they informed us that housekeeping would bring in some sort of odorizer, but we would need to be out of the room for an hour, which was fine with us. After taking a nap, I checked on the room and it smelled much better than when we first arrived, so kudos to the housekeeping staff for being efficient! My youngest sister told me that their towels were dirty, which is extremely disgusting. Again, the staff was really great about replacing dirty towels, but that is something that could've been avoided in the first place!

The next day, I received a text message saying our adjacent strip view rooms were ready at around 2pm. 27-213 and 27-215 were such an improvement from the rooms on the 5th floor! The rooms were both clean, bright, and had great views of the pool and partial strip views. We all agreed that the upper floor rooms were more updated than the ones on the lower floor, so do request for an upper floor room if you can! 

AMENITIES: Monte Carlo has a great casino near the lobby and I was pleasantly surprised with my winnings from the trip. On our last day, some of the machines weren't working due to a power outage, but at least my favorite machine was still working! They have a small food court with Starbucks, Sbarro, McDonald's, Rubio's etc and some were open 24 hours! The pool was great and had a variety of swimming pools such as a lazy river, a wave pool, and a regular pool. I noticed that they had small cabanas, a sandy seating area, and a VIP pool with a cabana! Along with the hotel fee, you have to pay a mandatory resort fee of $20 something dollars and you get a $50 credit to spend on one of their Las Vegas Blvd restaurants, which was nice. Don't forget that you have to spend the $50 credit before checking out or else it becomes invalid! Also, wifi immediately disconnects when checking out. The best part about this hotel is that there is a free tram that takes you to the Crystals, Bellagio, and of course, the Monte Carlo - the wait time was less than 6 minutes!

Overall, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again and would much rather stay in an updated hotel.

The Monte Carlo was an average to below average hotel in my opinion. the rooms were relatively nice, but the whole place just seemed second rate. 

ROOM: The beds were pretty comfortable, but when we asked for more towels for our room, it took the staff 30 mins to bring them up. 

POOL: sounded so cool in the descriptions, yet when we arrived, looking for a relaxing time and a pina colada by the pool, all we found were dirty frat boys drunk off their asses at 4pm. The first thing we saw was a girl being half carried out of the area by two security guards because she was so wasted. And the bumping house music was really annoying. My friends and I are no old ladies either, we're three early 20 somethings, but I'm sorry, but when I want to go to a club, I'll go to a club, not a hotel pool. Even the hot tub smelled like beer, and no one in it at that moment was drinking. GROSS. 

BRUNCH: 21.99 all you can eat? I'm in! After a crazy "only in vegas" night, my friend and I ran down to the brunch, only to be greeted by a long, snaking, disneyland-ish line to pay. The brunch really had EVERYTHING (normal breakfast fare, crab legs, sushi, chinese food..) but all of it was vaguely average and slightly questionable. The only good things we ate were the scrambled eggs and the biscuits. everything else was blehh. especially the french toast and the omelets from the omelet station! Very disappointing as we were hungover and really looking forward to a good sobering brunch. 

I wouldnt recommend someone stay at Monte Carlo, but if necessary I would stay there again. I would probably choose another hotel to stay in next time though. 

one thing i didnt like was that you had to pay a "resort fee" of $13.00 so you could use the gym\/internet. But we DIDNT use either soooooo, waste of money. 

But we still had a fab night in vegas.

I'd like to put this in words for Monte Carlo because it will be more detailed. We're staying at Monte Carlo spa suite (floor 20 room 202) for my birthday from July 4th thru July 6th. Everything went well on the 4th until the morning of 5th when construction noises was bothering us and water was not running. We were desperate for a nap after a long stroll outdoor. We decided to make a room change request on the 5th at 4:50PM, and Andrianna at the counter was super friendly to assist us in that request. However, she told us that all spa suite are booked. She inform us that she would go talk to the manager, and she said she can upgrade us to a diamond suite that was originally $180\/night but we will have to pay $30 as upgrade fee. I asked Andrianna what would our other option be? She said that is the only option. She is trying her best to help, we wouldn't give her a hard time. I don't feel like we should have to pay the extra because it is not our fault and we were not notified of the constructioning that's above our floor. It's unfair and this caused an inconvenience to us and upsetting on my birthday.

I've stayed at the MC a few times before and it's always been a pretty nice hotel but this last experience I had in late June was kinda disappointing and I'm not sure I'd go back again, at least not til some things change. 

It started with a ridiculously long wait to check in --over 40 mins on a Wednesday? Really? I could see this kind of a wait on the weekend or a Friday night but this took me by surprise as I've never waited this long mid-week. The irritating part was there were clerks at their stations who just weren't calling people. I supposed they could've been working on some other issue but then don't stand there and make it look like you have all these clerks working when only two are actually checking people in. :( 

My other major disappointment with the MC was that they closed the pool at 4PM for a PRIVATE event. Really? During the summer when it's 100+ degrees and your guests want to stay by the pool most of the day, you close the pool that is supposed to be for ALL guest for a private event? Keep in mind, they charge us a resort fee for all the amenities including the pool and yet, we can't use it because they're making money off it for a private event. I think at the minimum they should've refunded our resort fee on the day they closed the pool but no such offer was made at check-out. 

I go to Vegas quite often and there are many other options in Vegas to not get better service. Hopefully they will improve in the future.
Front desk manager Allison May. Horrible customer service. No common sense and completed wasted our family's time. Great work on losing multiple customers at once.

This Hotel is a little past it's prime......was there for Xmas '09 with the family...and was lured by its 3 nites for the price of two deal.  I arrived around 11PM...the line for Check-in was long...as they had the "individual lines" method instead of "one big line" method, which makes check in much longer, but it "looks" better.  Despite ordering 2 Bd, non-smoking, they said they only have 1 King rooms.  After complaining, they put me into a 2 bd smoking room since they ran-out of non-smoking rooms...whatever.  Elevators up to the rooms had brass which was cloudy and unpolished, the first sign a hotel is deteriorating.  Room was OK....except the trash can was not emptied and hair dryer was not working.  The room had only a square TV and was showing it's age.  Compared with similar class NY NY and Excalibur, the room is much, much worse, as both NY NY and Excalibur has remodeled its rooms with nice furniture great flat-screen TVs.

The next day, they did put us in a non-smoking room...but when we got to the room it was not yet cleaned....yuck.  After complaining some more, we got two free buffets, so it was fine.  Overall, a bad experience...except for the free buffets after we complained a lot.  No wonder it had a  3 nights for 2 deal.

For a similar price\/class:  Stick with Excalibur or NYNY

It's just alright.  No bells or whistles.  I haven't stayed here in years, and since then they've remodeled.  But the pub doesn't brew their own beer anymore!  Boo!  Nice that it still has a tram that connects you to Aria, Crystals and Bellagio.  Convenient, but wish it covered the whole end of this side of the strip.  Summer at the check in desk was great- got us a view and printed my gaming cards for us.

This review is for Drew, the bartender at the Brain Freeze Bar at the Pool at the Monte Carlo. While the casino at the Monte Carlo is a little boring, the pool is great!  If you go to the pool, you have to see Drew, the bartender at the Brain Freeze Bar! He makes the best drinks and his Bloody Mary's are the best on the planet! He really made our stay a lot of fun.  It's people like Drew that will keep us coming back to see him.  The other bar at the pool is ok, but Drew at the Brain Freeze is the man to see!
Every pool needs a Drew!  Thanks Drew!

My friends and I make a yearly trip to Vegas I was very disappointed with the Monte Carlo! On the upside; The girls at the front desk are friendly and professional, the view was nice, The location could not be better, the restaurants and bars inside were all Amazing (Id recommend Minus *5 ...very COOL experience... and Diablo's Cantina ... the food was very tasty) The food court is also very convenient and offers a decent variety. On the down side the moment you walk in you smell this over powering scent that is similar to that powder women in there 60's and up wear and cigarettes (yuck, definitely not something you want to smell if you're coming back from a night of drinking) the room was to small for two beds, there was no frig or coffee maker, the walls are thin and you can hear everything everyone is doing on both sides, there was not enough counter space (or maybe that's because there were 5 people in our room) *oops* lol, the "wii-fi" was the worst it kept disconnecting, the hotel is very out dated and could use MAJOR and I mean MAAAAAJOR updating everything thing seemed old except for the flat screen TV, I tried to take a bath and the water kept draining by its self the plug didn't help the water would not stay at a level that covered my body and I'm not big In fact I'm very small it shouldn't have been an issue, the toilette seat was not sturdy and made this loud noise every time we flushed which scared me almost every time, room service\/housekeeping took forever and were not friendly, and the hotel is trying to preserve water so they don't change the sheets unless you ask them to what kinda **** is that? I'm all for going green but I just expected more. We stayed at the Luxor in a high price room  for cheaper than what we payed for the Monte Carlo ...again disappointed... also most of the guest and crowd are older not exactly the place to be for the partying all night. 

To wrap it up I would go to the bars and restaurants inside the Monte Carlo but I would not stay there again. (hope this was helpful (first review))

Will not stay again.

The only reason for 3 stars was because I stayed on a weekday and it was cheap, less than $60 per night.  Otherwise ratings would would be much lower.

This "3.5 - 4 star hotel" for this Hotel-Casino is based on amenities only.  The rooms are plain.  The covers\/blankets on the bed are made of the cheap, brown blanket with bedsheet combo found at cheap motels.  There is no fridge.  No hot water heater.  The TV is CRT and not even flat-screen CRT.  

The gym is $19\/day.  Internet is 14.99\/day.  Ridiculous.

On the plus side, customer service was excellent.

Hotel and Room: the hotel and room are both dated. The room itself has a lot of broken and torn things (ie lamps, shower curtains, furniture etc). That being said, my biggest issue with the room was that cell reception was horrible and there was no in room wifi. There is only wifi on the casino floor. Walls are also VERY thin. We were stuck between a room with an infant crying and a couple who rotated between having sex and arguing all night.  Either way, was a long night. The hotel itself is fine. The casino and sports book are both a decent size. The line to place bets in the sports books was handled efficiently and effectively. 

Pool: the pool is small. You have to walk over random people in order to get to your chair. Chairs are jammed pack right next to each other and the entire area gets extremely crowded during the weekend. I highly recommend that you rent a day bed or a cabana. It made a huge difference for us. The food at the pool was great. Quesadillas were fantastic and the drinks were delicious.

Restaurants: there's a good variety of food here. Yusho was a classic Japanese style restaurant. The flavors could be very difficult for people who are not used to fermented ingredients. The coffee shop has amazing breakfast sandwiches as well. 

The reason I am giving this place a three is a combination of the wifi issue and the crowd. It wasn't what I was looking for. There are a ton of kids ranging from infants to teenagers. If you are booking a place for your family, this may be ideal but when wanting to focus on sports and relaxing by the pool, the magnitude of kids screaming and running around can be a bit much. It's also a bit uncomfortable to have five year olds staring at girls throwing around a rubber penis for a bachelorette party. Odd mix and crowd cramped way too close together in a small pool area...recipe for disaster.

Peggy is a horrible drink server. Never come here. Don't waste your time or money. There's a reason why this is the most unpopular and empty casino on the strip. The drink servers are horrible and please never tip Peggy because she surely doesn't deserve it. Never coming back.

This hotel is kinda like bud light, taste great less filling. Or rather, nice location, nice rooms and easy on the wallet. (as far as being on the strip goes). I found a deal on US Airways.com for 6 nights plus airfare for around $800 per person flying from DC. This was a really great bargain. It sits on the south end of the strip closer to the airport.

We came during Christmas week and they hotel interior was decked out with trees and bulbs. The check in line seemed to move pretty fast. It took less than 15 minutes to reach the front desk. We were given a room with a view of the strip, so I felt pretty excited about that.

However, we got to our room and we hit a snag. The room was not cleaned. I was a little outraged. I called the front desk and they quickly reprogrammed our cards to another room. We didn't have to go all the way back down. The new room was okay, it had two queen sized beds. Then next day they gave us the option to move to a room with a king sized bed (which we accepted). 

The rooms were nice but basic. No microwave oven or refrigerator. Basic toiletries. 40 inch flat screen tv, dresser, small table with two chairs and a desk. No wifi, but they have an LAN cable to connect to your laptop for internet. I unfortunately did not bring a laptop.

They have a food court at the casino level with subway, sbarro, mcdonalds, a chinese carryout, mexican restaurant and a cheese steak joint. Here is where you can get the hotel wifi. The food court is also right next to the tunnel of shops that lead to the Aria hotel. They also have a few sit down restaurants that are more costly.

They have an outdoor pool, but it was apparently closed at the time, but I was able to go to the Aria hotel next door and use their pool by just flashing my room key. Their pool is outdoors but heated and they have 3 giant hot tubs to ease into as well. 

The casino was pretty typical. Lots of different slots, table games like poker, blackjack, craps and roulette. The Blue Man group performs here. We received a couple of tickets along with our package from US Airways. It was nice to just go from our room straight to the theater to see them.

Though not as popular or "snazzy" as a lot of the other hotel options on the strip, it's "low key" and cheaper price still puts you on the strip where you can just walk to everything.

To make a VERY LONG and disturbing story short, The Monte Carlo is like the cross eyed, fat, hairy, smelly and hunchback sister of the Las Vegas blvd hotel family. Even it's prime location can't save the disaster it is. 

After bring to Vegas nearly 30 times and staying almost everywhere, I hoped that my 400$ (!!!) weekend will at least buy me a little bit good time. boy I was wrong!

The SMELL: You know how when you go into some hotels your lungs are filled with joy and happiness? well, that's not the case here. The lobby\Casino smells like a french whore house. To the point I felt my nostrils are about to collapse and I'm going to throw up right in front of the slot machines.  

The ROOM: Our room was on the 26th floor (smoking floor) and it smelled the part. we asked for it - not complaining. But we never asked for Ugly, beige, old, dirty, 70's porn movie like type of room as well. It's that ugly. The shower top had green mold on it, the wallpaper was stained and peeling, the furniture was squeaking and old,... we were embarrassed to invite a friend over.

The STAFF: Some were okay, smiling and all, but a few were so obnoxious and rude I wanted to slap them in the face. 

Anyways, do yourself a favor and find a different place to stay in. TRUST ME!

Location is great. It's in the middle of the strip. Across from MGM grand, New York Hotel, Excalibur... It's not one of the super high end hotels, but I thought it was great. Very clean and classy. You don't need to spend extra money on expensive hotels. I'm assuming you won't be staying in your room all night long. You'll be out exploring VEGAS and can easily walk into any other luxiourious hotel and enjoy their casinos, pools, and clubs.
Stayed here for 4th of July weekend and got a good price too! Rooms are average, very friendly maids and overall great service. Really liked our stay here and will definitely be coming back. :)

one star for the nice lobby, friendly staff and clean bedding. now for the hates:

the tv sucked. no premium stations, the info button on the tv control didn't work. the bathroom fan didn't work and the toilet seat, bathroom counter, and shower head were very outdated. the bath water came out super strong, immediately filling up the tub, until you turned on the shower. towels were covered in wrinkles like they'd been sitting in a basket for days before being folded. there were red stains all over the carpet (looked to be some cheap-ass strawberry hill remnants), no coffee maker in the room (so you are forced to buy an overpriced starbucks drink in the lobby) and the damn "do not disturb" sign flew off the door handle every time the door was opened. would not stay there again.

Usually walk through here at least once during a Vegas trip since we often stay at the Bellagio and they have a tram here.  They still have a few good old machines I enjoy playing, but that's about it now.  Their buffet is pretty basic, but we used to come for their breakfast as breakfast is pretty hard to screw up, and it was less expensive than other buffet's.

Well, I'm walking down the long hallway from the tram, and like the other reviews, notice everything is under construction.  I actually came for breakfast, and all the signage for the buffet is still there, but alas it also was under construction.  

I'm all for progress and glad to see the renovations coming along, but at least remove or cover up your signage please.  Signs indicating what's closed as you exit the tram would be helpful.  Sure - you still want people to walk to through the Casino, and I probably still would have, but i wouldn't have been disappointed when I arrived knowing what to expect.  

I've never stayed in their rooms, but check out the pictures of the new rooms.  They appear to have gone the route of the Linq hotel.  Bare bones minimum.  Hopefully the rates will reflect the offerings.

I enjoy staying here on Vegas visits. I've stayed at a handful of other hotels, and for the price you pay, it's not bad. I stay here when it's cheap. I won't pay more than $50 for a hotel there. Rooms come with a keurig, chick is great because it's the only Vegas hotel I've been to that has a coffee maker, that saves me easily $5 a day. 
The rooms are clean, and simple. The beds are comfy. I like the seating area with a table and couch. Self parking is among the easiest compared to other hotels. 

I did too much day drinking last time and stayed in for the night while the man went out to play. I was too lazy\/sick to go get food for myself so opted for room service. $15 for a sandwich is ridiculous but it was so convenient I didn't even care. And it was tasty and cured me. 

The pool is fun. Crowded. But I like floating around in the lazy river and hope people don't pee in it. They also have a jacuzzi. I don't think I've ever seen another hotel that has a jacuzzi. Something about liability with the mixture of booze and heat. But I'm glad they have one. 

They have tons of restaurants and a food court which is very easy. The pub was a good place to hit up for happy hour. Nice priced well drinks and food. Neat decor. No complaints really.
Very nice for the price, very convienent location on the strip and the front desk very tentative!!!

Got a really great deal on lasvegas.com. i paid $157.00 includin resort fees and a $35 food or drink credit. Me and my husband stayed sunday and monday. They let us check in at 8am with no extra fee which was awsome cause ive had other places charge me for early check in. Everyone was incredible nice from the receptionist to the housekeepers. They Always tried making conversation. 

Pros:
Room was pretty big nice comfy bed. Had a little desk. Bathroom was a good size. It was soooooo easy to get around that hotel everythin was a turn away. I loved it. I never got lost.

Cons:
Wifi only worked in the first 2 floors. Otherwise it was dial up in your room. There were no ammenities.

You guys really gota check out rio.
Great experience! The staff was helpful and quick to respond to our every need. The hotel had a very nice vibe to it and everything was clean.

POS!! POS!! POS!!

Stayed here one night and it will be the last night I ever stay at this piece of shit hotel. This place is super outdated....they better pour some money into renovating this shit hole.  I was expecting MGM level accommodations but was deeply disappointed that it was more like Circus Circus. 

The arrival:

1:30PM: called them when we hit Primm to see if there would be a problem checking in early (normal check in is 3PM).  The retard on the phone said she doesn't know and that I would have to check with the front desk when I get there.  
2:15PM: Stood in line to check in.  
2:35PM: Yea, that's right!! 20 minutes to get to the front desk. 
2:42PM: They finished checking me in. Hey, at least I was able to get my room almost a whopping 20mins early.  

The shower: 

I woke up to no hot water and when I physically went down stairs to check out and complain; they gave me coupons!!  


The conclusion:

F-ing coupons!!  Take your coupons that came with a free subway 6inch and shove it up your ass Monte Carlo!!!    

If only I could give negative stars!!

First and last time I stay at this POS!

Monte Carlo Hotel is kind of near one end of the strip (near the end where MGM Grand is at) and is a classical hotel. It has been here since the 1990's and hasn't really updated their look since. As of right now, Blue Man Group is currently playing at this hotel (they have been featured at other hotels in the past few years). 

Anyways, what gives this hotel an extra star (putting it at a 4 star rating) is the at they provide complementary wifi to everyone who comes to their hotel (guests and visitors). Honestly, that is a rarity of a hotel on the Vegas strip to offer free wifi (Why? I have no idea... All the hotels should provide it for free instead of asking for a daily fee). Their wifi is quick and fast and very easy to log into. It really does make me want to come visit this hotel while I am visiting Las Vegas. Now granted you can also find wifi at Starbucks, Earl of Sandwich, Famous Footwear, BCBG & Sephora at the Miracle Mile Shops, but I don't feel obligated to spend my money to use their free wifi and can actually just sit back on one of the benches in the lobby area and relax and take as much time as I want to use it. 

Plenty of parking in their self parking lot. Clean restrooms. Happy to come back and visit. The only major con I see for this hotel is that they do not allow dogs, other than service dogs.

True story conversations:

"where are you staying?"
"Monte Carlo."
"where the eff is THAT?"

"so what do you think about this hotel? be honest."
"GHETTO."

I've stayed at Monte Carlo twice with a few girlfriends for our past Vegas trips. All I have to say is that as a hotel, it gets the job done. There are clean beds, a clean bathroom, place to put your shit, mirrors, lights, an iPod dock... but that's it. Otherwise, it is old and doesn't feel shiny and pretty like Vegas should. 

I had stayed at the Aria one night and after checking into Monte Carlo it hit me hard that this was a MAJOR downgrade. My exact thoughts were "....damn, should've showered when we were in Aria." My thoughts after getting in the shower were "... damn, should've grabbed the shampoo and conditioner from Aria." The shampoo and conditioner SUCKS sooo much here, don't even bother- it doesn't do ANYTHING for your hair. AND the bathroom ventilation is crappy. I could go on and on...

The location is semi-okay but technically this hotel isn't even ON the strip. You drive down this long street\/ side road to get to it. Two good things I can say for Monte Carlo is - 1) huge free self parking lot and 2) it's pretty close to Aria and City Center in which you can take a short walk or the free tram.

Seriously, you know the hotel isn't nice when you notice there's not a single security at the elevators... even at 4am...

For people on a budget and with low standards then Monte Carlo works. For me, it is definitely not my preferred choice.

We really enjoyed our stay here! We stayed in a spa suite and found the room to be large, clean, comfy and wonderful! No, it wasn't decorated the way I'd choose for my home, but it was nice! The very large jacuzzi tub was great! The wetbar area included a mini fridge and keurig coffee maker.  I didn't notice any funky deodorizer smell that many of these reviewers complain of. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful.  The main pool is in the shadow of the hotel all day, as previously mentioned, but the lazy river and wave pool are in the sun most of the day. We loved the lazy river! Drinks are expensive by the pool, but this is normal for vegas. We kept beer in the fridge in our room, much more cost effective. Although the hotel is not the most updated and modern you can get it is perfectly nice, in a great, central location, and a great value for the money. We were very pleased with the service. Didn't have any difficulties with check in or out. We didn't have any issues with our stay at all. Enjoyed everything, and the Monte Carlo definitely exceeded our expectations. We can't wait to return!

it was alright. 

after my 4 hour drive to vegas (i know.. i should've flown) i FINALLY arrived at monte carlo at 2:30 am. I was promptly checked in and I headed over to my room.

As I was walking.. i noticed a lot of things that should've put up red flags, but I was too damn tired to even take notice of these things.  The hallway became so humid, and there were things everywhere in the hallway, like newspapers from the morning and food from room service...

Anyway, I go inside my room and I noticed an empty can of beer on the bedside..thing? table? whatever the hell its called.

then I go into the restroom to find a bag of trash on the countertop and the toilet had shit in it. 

wow monte carlo. where's your cleaning crew at?!

I went down to the front desk, told them everything, and they gave me a new room immediately and lots of coupons... that I didn't use.  

the new room was pretty much the same room, except cleaned. 

also. I stayed at the Monte Carlo hotel only because I wanted to see the Jabbawackeez show.  I had purchased meet and greet tickets, and the show was phenomenal. It was the best show i have ever seen.

My only problem was Monte Carlo.  We weren't allowed to snap photos during our meet and greet... we had to purchase their professional photo... which is fine, so long as I get my damn photo with my idols\/husbands hahaha.  Meet and greet ended and we were waiting for our photos to get developed so that we could buy them... and then the photographers came back empty handed and said that they had no photos for us and that they were sorry. wtf. 

that such bull. 

anyway, i called to complain the next day and the next time i watch the show, i'll be able to meet them again without having to pay extra for the meet and greet... but seriously, that sucks so much for all those fans that flew from michigan, washington, san francisco to see them. at least i'm a driving distance away.

Dear Monte Carlo and any future guest,

I am not a prude person nor do I ever write any reviews, but this hotel took the cake for me and my 6 friends who went.  We reserved 3 rooms which were a disgusting smelly filthy mess with beds that look like they were never even changed and peeling wallpaper and carpet that needed to be cleaned and stretched. I was SO disappointment.  NO! I didn't look on the reviews because for 1 it was stated as a 4 star hotel, 2 it was in Las Vegas on the strip and a well know Casino which stupid me I just took for granite.  So we get in at midnight and of course starving only to find NO room service, as as I write this I get so angry I am not even going to go into ALL the horrible things this hotel has to offer.  ON the plus side, MOST of the people working there were very nice.  They did nothing to fix the problems, but when we needed assistance with a friend, they were on it.  BUT DO NOT stay here if you think you are going to get a "fine, nice, clean elegant hotel". It is only one notch above a "motel".  Very disappointment.

The only reason this is getting two stars is because of the location. 
I booked this hotel through a vacations package and was so excited at how inexpensive is was. I had stayed here in the past but it has REALLY gone downhill. We got to our room and it barely had a closet and it faced the dumpster so the whole night we could hear the trash being dumped. I asked to switch rooms and they said they would be able to the next day (we checked in on a Saturday). In the middle of the night the couple next to us got into a raging fight. The walls were so thin that it sounded like they were next to us. We called security but I could not wait to get out of the room.
The next day we packed up our bags like we were told and left for the day. I was supposed to get a text between 2pm and 5pm about our new room and they would move our bags and our keys would work in the new room. So I though that would redeem the stay. Never got a text, checked with customer service and they never had anything in our room about switching. Even though I was upset they didn't seem to care about moving us, we had to do it ourselves and the second room wasn't much better. Dingy and old and GROSS stains on the furniture. 
I agree with the other reviews, $30 for a resort fee per night when you had to go to the MGM to use a pool AND had to pay an extra fee to use the gym. What exactly does that pay for? We got room service and the guy who dropped it off was really nice and told us they are upgrading the hotel in the next couple years. I get that they don't want to put money into something they are changing but would new chairs and possibly an alarm clock kill them? I will never stay here again even after the upgrade.

Do not stay here.  We feel
Completely lied to.  The hotel is under MAJOR renovation right now and 90% of every single amenity they offer is closed. No pool, no day spa, no buffet, one restaurant in the food court. This WAS NOT disclosed to us upon booking.  You will also find it extremely hard to locate that info on their website.
We were upgraded to a new room, after being checked into a horribly outdated room with filthy carpet.
The new room is fun, hip decor, BUT TINY!!! No dresser drawers, no closet space, and a weird green color that bothers my husband.

Also 75% of the casino is closed this weekend. I really can't believe this was not disclosed to us.

I will never stay here again.  Which is too bad because the staff is wonderful. Great dealers, players club, servers, bell hop.

Initially I didn't like the Monte Carlo because of the hard beds, horrible shower head and thin walls. But MC keeps throwing free nights at me and I'm a sucker for free. Eventually I got better beds and further away from noise so I'm much more amenable. 

But damnits, what the hell is up with the shower head pressure??? You don't shower, you end up sanding your skin clean layer by layer. Another annoyance, they charge $15 resort fee but don't even offer Wifi. How outdated! 

The pool area is the smaller version of the Mandalay Bay. It has a lazy river and volleyball beach area. BYOT! (bring your own tube) It's wonderful when it's not-so crowded!

I like the location, walkable to lots of casinos, UA movie theater and shopping!
Horrible experience will never stay in this hotel again in my life, the room was really small and the furniture looked really old, very depressing.

I came this hotel due to one of my friend's suggestion. However i did nit find what i expected. Actually i dont have high expectaions but my room did not provide minimum requirments that all hotels have to provide. 
First of all i found hair on our towels. Maybe they are clean but when i saw someone's hair on tHe towels it was not a good first impression. 
Second i realised that our tap in the bathtub was broken. It did not work properly. 
Last there was no slipers in the room. I was glad that i brought my slipers. 
There are some minimum standarts that this kind of hotels should provide to their customers. Unfortunately monte carlo did jot support these standarts at least during my vacation. 
On the other hand Its location is really good. It is on the strip and almost near bellagio amd paris. And also you can usen free wifi in your rooms too. The speed is enough.

Stayed at the Monte Carlo last night for a Mariah Carey concert at Caesars Palace. The room was clean and the staff is friendly. I was a little irritated with the little upgrades and early check in fees but I guess you get what you pay for and I didn't pay too much. Overall positive experience.

Worst of the worst! "Spa suite"  (I believe 301-1 was my "first room") I fell for the upgrade offers and was very disappointed! I get there and i unpack and I have friends come over for some drinks so we could figure out what bars we're going to visit and the lights start to flicker on and off! I thought maybe ppl where bumping into the switch but I was wrong. A friend asked "Aren't you supposed to be in a spa suite why don't your lights work? I thought you had a jacuzzi? pretty embarrassing! yeah I was so pissed I didn't want to ruin my night by having to switch rooms and getting upset with the front desk! The next morning I wake up and request a different room and I was moved down from floor 30 to floor 28... They must have left the original mattresses on floor 28  from when they first opened! Worst mattress I've ever slept on! But the lights worked lol I've got to say tho the rooms are spacious and the shower and wet bar are really nice. I mean if my car wouldn't have gotten broken into in their parking structure I would stay there again! And by their parking structure  I mean if something happens to your vehicle they'll say "well the parking structure doesn't belong to the Monte Carlo" and give you this run around! They call security and all they do is have you write a voluntary statement, walk you out to the structure that the  Monte Carlo "doesn't own' and take a picture of a sign that is on one side of a pillar that's only visible if you park in a certain section where I didn't park! He takes your statement down and never contacts you to follow up. Oh and the cameras that face where I was parking didn't work and the other ones I pointed out Weren't actually cameras lol I called back 2 times to see if maybe someone had turned in my duffle bag that got stolen or caught who did it! I figured who ever stole it threw it right out of their window because it had my equipment that wasn't useful to anyone! $700 worth probably got tossed thrown out their window because the criminals where too ignorant to know what they had stole! I had stayed at the Monte Carlo Halloween weekend, just recently decided to review this place because I hope who ever plans on staying there is careful with there belongings! Beware of bad security, thief's, lighting issues, and bad mattresses, a lot of other things I mentioned when they sent me a survey but even then they didn't bother to contact me back about my awful stay...

I will never, EVER stay here again. It was the worst hotel experience I've ever had to deal with. 

We got to the room only to realize that someone else had obviously been in there and it was never  cleaned up. The soap was open and the wrapper was on the floor, there was trash in the can, and the person even left his plane ticket from that morning. He must have not liked the room and then switched, but house keeping didn't clean the room in between. 

Then the safe was broken, and so we needed to switch rooms anyway because I had a very expensive camera with me.  Of course they didn't have any rooms left with 2 beds so they told us our only option was to stay in a smoking room that night. Gross! It smelled so bad! And on top of that, my camera didn't end up even fitting in the safe! 

When the bellman brought our bags up to the room, he was very nice at first...I tipped him at the end, and to my surprise - he counted the money right in front of me, snarled and stormed out of the room without a word!!!!! I could NOT believe it! 

Then on top of everything, we called for a few extra towels and another blanket and it took us calling 3 times (and being very nasty the 3rd time around) for them to bring us anything. Finally someone came with 1 blanket and we were told that was "all they had left." You mean to tell me you run a giant hotel on the Las Vegas strip and yet somehow all you have left is ONE blanket in the entire hotel?? REALLY?!

I could go on, but honestly I am so disgruntled that I don't even want to relive it. The worst part is that upon checking out when we explained everything that happened, they didn't offer us anything. The clerk rummaged through some drawer, said "sorry, we don't have any coupons left" and that was it.

For a hotel on the strip. Itself. One of the worst stays ever. This place felt like an overrated motel. Fantastic misleading lobby to run down rooms. It felt as though I felt i was stuck in a middle seat of a 12 hour flight across the Atlantic.  And this was just the bed. The showers leaked and the tube overflows. Smdh

I was in Vegas during Route 91 last weekend and ended up being on lock down at the Monte Carlo Sunday night. First of all, the hotel offered blankets, pillows, waters, and a small food selection to those of us that couldn't make it back to our room, and were super accommodating in answering our questions and getting us information when we were confused and scared. By 6 am Monday morning we didn't know when the Mandalay would be reopening for us to get back into our room, so the Monte Carlo woke us up off the casino floor to put us in a complimentary room. We were there for another 4-5 hours or so and I'm so thankful that we had an actual bed after such a long night. I'll never be able to express how grateful I am to MGM Resorts and the Monte Carlo staff for being a comfort in such an ugly situation.

Basic comfortable stay choice. We stayed in 8th floor room 315 facing the strip. There is mostly the ceiling of the casino to see and a partial view of MGM\/NYNY. Good location on the strip and the tram nearby takes you till the Bellagio. Large room, TV, and moderate size bathroom, free wifi and boarding pass printing included in 28$ resort fee\/day. They provide a hair dryer and iron box.
The lobby of the Monte Carlo is very inviting and not seedy-like(compared to Bally's). 
Valet service was prompt and very courteous despite the July 4 rush.

We were on a tight budget so chose Monte Carlo. You will not have a great experience but it wasn't a bad one either. 

You can tell that the place is a little old (the bathtub grout was orangey in the corners) but it's not something that will repel you completely. Bathtub is a small one to take a bath unless you are really petite, but with the slight discoloring of the grout, I would not take one anyway.
There were no amenities inside the room like mini fridge\/bar or a microwave\/coffee machine.
The mini soap provided was good initially but with more use it started smelling funny.
Carpeting is a little discolored so we can tell that the hotel is definitely not sparkling new. Overall a good budget stay.

Very, very disappointed. No where on their mobile website does it say they are under renovation. Half the property is under some sort of construction or remodel. No pool(s), no spa, 3\/5 restaurants are closed, got the wrong room, room is dirty looking, dated and stinky. Manager was not very accommodating although she did move our room. To not inform us before travel that they are doing renovations was just plain crappy.

Worst hotel ever! Staff is rude, I'm surprised they don't charge for air to breathe. I was looking forward to staying here, as they sent many emails leading up to our stay. Once I arrived, I realized it was a mistake to stay here. No wireless internet? Seriously? Better off to save money and go to Motel 6, same thing minus the casino. Never again. I had to give one star since there is no option for none or negative.

I booked a room here for the Las Vegas Rock N' Roll Marathon weekend.  They had a special rate for us runners...$110 a night.  I didn't exactly search for other deals, so I hope that really was a good rate!  I chose this hotel since it was only about 1 mile away from the start of the race.  

There were 4 of us, so I got a room with 2 queen beds.  The beds were ok, but the pillows were a bit flat to me.  The bathroom was pretty spacious.  They only gave us 3 towels, but house keeping was very quick to respond to our phone call and bring us extra towels.

The rodeo was in town for the week, so there was some event happening outside, and it woke me up at 9am on Saturday morning!  They were also playing country music in the casino all weekend.  I have nothing against country music, but I really don't think I could gamble and listen to it all night long.  

I was able to get a late checkout, so we were able to take our time and shower after our half marathon.  Overall, the service here was good, and the rooms are decent.  I would probably consider this hotel again if I decide to run the race again next year.

Upon getting in line to check in at the front it took about 2 minutes to get our room key. The lady at the front was super kind and welcoming. She was super helpful in showing us around the hotel. Our room was on the 24th floor and had a less than ideal view of the strip but you get what you pay for. $406 for two nights on Memorial Day is a steal to me. The view was basically a view of the storage\/ dumpsters and slight glimpse of the MGM. Also- our room came with 2 complimentary buffets. A steal if you ask me since the buffet is slightly overpriced to say the least. Happy with our stay overall!

Outdated! In need of major renovations! Cheap quality! Great location on the strip is the only positive. Upon check in, they gave me a room that had not been cleaned and was not a king bed which is what I booked. I went down and they apologized and switched me to a clean king room. The only one available was a smoking room when I specifically requested non smoking upon booking. You can smell the smoke when you get off the elevator. The entire floor reeks of smoke. Floor 26. The smoke scent in the room is intolerable. The room is small compared to other hotels. Just compare the building to that of The Aria right across the street. Monte Carlo is dwarfed by it. This was probably a nice hotel in the 80's but they clearly have not kept up with the times. I've never stayed at ANY hotel that did not provide at least two soaps (one for face, one for shower) but they only provide one here. Bathroom is small and the quality of towels is definitely inferior. The long from them rubs off on your body. Pathetic. I saved the worst for last. No deadbolt! For those who do not think it's important like I once did until my girlfriend enlightened me. (She works at a hotel) Suppose someone checks in at midnight while you're in your room sleeping. If the agent at the front desk accidentally codes the key to your room, that person will enter while you're sleeping because there is no deadbolt. How scary that could be. It could be a robber, who knows. As I said not a good hotel other than location. I would not recommend to anyone. F-

We stayed here the weekend of the mayweather fight. The prices were sky high, but cheaper than any other hotel (just that weekend). Fast, friendly service, clean, convenient, and beautiful. I've stayed a few other places on the strip and after a sub-par stay at another hotel this weekend I will never stray from the Monte Carlo again. Their nightly rates may be a few dollars higher, but their resort fees are almost half of some of the other hotels.

I am planning a Las Vegas wedding and decided to book a room block at the Monte Carlo since they had affordable prices. I was greatly disappointed to find out that the hotel would be under construction during our stay, they notified me and said it would not be a problem. I sent out my invites (180) stating that we would be hosting a meet and greet at The Pub (this is before I even knew about construction, no mention of it when I booked room block) in the Monte Carlo. We thought it would be a great way to see everyone and handout welcome bags, as the Monte Carlo wants to charge $2.50 per bag! So about a month out, I get an email, not a phone call, an email stating The Pub will be closed! What!? I asked kindly if they could deliver the 20-40 bags to guests staying at their hotel and maybe meet up in one of their lounges and they said NO to the bags, not even a discounted price! So now, I'm stuck planning for another location, distributing bags, and sending another notice to guests (postage is not cheap). This is all going down about a month out! Not impressed with their service and concern for my inconvenience :(

I stayed here in March with a few girlfriends on a girls Vegas trip. The only reason we picked the Monte Carlo was because the place seemed to be okay and the price was much better than many of the other places. I guess I should have known as there was some activity going on the weekend we were there (i.e. Spring Break ...) and all the other hotels were equally expensively prepared except for the Monte Carlo.

The Monte Carlo was just one disappointment after another. First, they were doing construction on their parking garage so you could either park in a very tiny lot that filled up quickly near the hotel or risk a cold 10 minute walk in the March Vegas weather to the entrance. Not very well thought out for its patrons indeed. Their check in was okay but their baggage service was forced upon us even though we declined. Who does that? And the rooms were okay, the bathrooms need better ventilation and they seriously need to remodel. This place isn't even on the strip as you have to drive through a very long road \/ side drive way to get to the actual strip. Now that City Center is up it essentially blocks out Monte Carlo's view of the strip altogether and completely overshadows the place.

It doesn't even have any good restaurants or casino area as the buffet was $20 \/ person on a weekend and there was like ... nothing appetizing. With all the other fantastic options on the strip I definitely would not stay here again in the future.

Worst hotel I've ever been to !!!! 
Did a reservation on hotels.com paid $300 for a room with two queen beds
once I checked in bed sheets were stained mold was in the restroom called ther front desk to complain told us to wait for a few minutes shes going to try to get us another room she had the keys transfered to another room we had to go back down stairs take another set of elevators to go to that room me and my sister opened the door to the new room and guess what there was a freaking couple there absolutely unacceptable literally one of the most embarassing moments ever called front desk again to complain was put on hold after I told the girl what she just did gave us an excuse that the customer was suppose to be already checked out 
not my problem how does a hotel do this to someone after that she sends me to another room had to go back down stairs and take another seperate elevator wasted a fuc#### hour going back and fourth becuase of their stupid mistake DON'T STAY HERE AVOID IT 
I would rather stay at best western thats literally  only a few miles away 
and the only thing they did was give us a $50 credit for room service when it was my sister , my boyfriend and i how the hell is that even close to being acceptable for what they put us through wasnt even enough for two meals.

I liked this hotel because it is situated between a lot of other interesting hotels just South of the center of the Strip and it was easy for my elderly in-laws to get from the room to the casino or for something to eat. 

Pros:
Decent food court (Starbucks, McDonald's, Sbarro, Subway)
Casino with nice games and that doesn't completely reek of cigarette smoke
Restaurants
Clean spacious rooms

Cons:
No fan in bathroom
Bar soap provided smelled awful
No real shopping to speak of
Very small outdoor pool and hot tub
Crappy $10 daily "resort" fee that includes nothing I utilized

Overall I would stay here again for the price and location. Plus they were accommodating when we checked in (four hours early, no less) and asked for two rooms close by each other and the elevators so my in-laws didn't have far to walk.

Tip: Go across the street to that food court if you want ice cream. It's Dreyer's (aka Edy's) so it's better, plus it's cheaper than the place in this hotel. Try the gelato, it's very yummy!

Visit Date: 11\/16\/09-11\/18\/09

Stayed here for my trip in July.  Booked my room online for about $300 for 5 nights.  When we checked in around 7pm, it was pretty quick.  The checkout counter was very near to the taxi drop off.  I almost forgot about the free buffet credit that came with the hotel booking, but the receptionist was kind to remind me and let me know how to redeem it.  

The rooms were better than what I expected after reading reviews online. It's not the most luxurious, but worth what I paid for.  The only minor gripes off the bat were that I had to plug the bed light and turn on the main power switch for the TV. This would've been more of an inconvenience for a non-techie.  The resort fee included coffee (1 cup coffee maker using packaged grounds), wired internet (wireless was spotty on the 17th floor, but they only guaranteed connection on floors 1 and 2) and 2 mini bottles of water.  The beds were comfortable and soft. Our room was facing the pool side.  I didn't think the noise level was distracting, but others not used to it might not enjoy it.  It was only on during early afternoon to sunset. Other reviews said the walls were thin, but I couldn't hear any of my neighbors.  Bathroom was a good size.  Fixtures could use an update soon though.  I thought the shower faucet was leaky at first, but I just had to turn it tight.

One of the reasons I chose the hotel was its central location.  New York New York was less than 5 minutes walking distance away.  There is a free monorail past the shops that stopped by Crystals Center and Bellagio.  The temperature at that time was between 100-110 degrees, so this helped a lot and saved us money that we normally would use on the bus or taxi. There is a good selection of places to eat here.  New places opened up in the front area facing the strip.

The casino itself was one of the smaller ones on the strip I've been to other than Bally's. The only slots I really play are Wheel of Fortune which are conveniently placed by the room elevators and buffet. The Pai Gow dealer Fernando was very friendly to chat with.  Drink service was excellent all around, especially at the tables and Wheel of Fortune areas.

This is the worst hotel in vegas. I am an mlife member and always stay at mgm. Stayed at the monte carlo because I assumed as a business it would be similar. My how I was wrong. Since the beginning they act like they upgraded me to a newly remodeled room. Little did they say at 7 am there would be consrructuon going on underneath. Call because i cant sleep make me come downstairs to get a room change. So i go down get a room no oenr helps me move. Then i walk into  my new room smells like a straight ashtray. Call down again and met with hostility. Why anyone would ever stay here beats me. Sad to see how bad of a company this really is.

I'll start by giving Monte Carlo four stars for a beautiful hotel and casino, at least in the public areas I observed, and for a good selection of slots and other gaming devices.  Then I'll subtract one star for the complete lack of complimentary cocktail service during my last visit.  I sat at a quarter slots in the center of the casino for over an hour and never once had a cocktail waitress stop by, nor did I even see one off in the distance anywhere.  Shame, shame.  That puts it in the same category as the Four Queens downtown.........poor drink service in my experience.

Monte Carlo tends to get overlooked because it's kind of tucked in between all the Project Center City construction going on with restricted sidewalk usage in that area.  Also, it doesn't have some flashy theme or gimmick to draw people in.  But it's actually quite a nice place and, except for drink service as noted above, I felt very comfortable inside and sincerely liked it.

I actually really like the Monte Carlo and sad to hear MGM is rebranding the Resort. This hotel has always been here and will not be the same without it, but that's the MGM company for you.

To start off this is a cheaper, cleaner, and friendlier Resort than Luxor or Excalibur, Don't even consider Luxor, read my review to see why.

The walk from the Parking garage to Registration was actually very short. There was no line to check in and the man was very friendly. The Elevators are literally next to the Registration desk, the corridors were very short and clean. 

ROOM: The room was very basic but clean and nicely appointed. The beds were comfortable and the air felt great! My view was of the T-Mobile Arena, New York-NewYork and the dreaded Excalibur and Luxor. The bathroom was nice, a little dirty. The shower head was disgusting! It was one of the most disgusting shower heads I've ever seen. Other than that the room was great! 

The casino was very nice, felt as I was inside a 5 star Resort, that's what's great about this property, you feel classy with this being a 3 star resort. 

Overall: This is not the best place to stay but this is a clean, classy, cheap experience- and that's hard to find. I'll take this over Most of the MGM properties any day!

I do need to stipulate a couple of things. First, this was my first trip to Vegas and thus my expectations were high. Second, because I majored in Hospitality during college, I know what should and shouldn't be in a situation.

The short version: we had a good front desk person to start, but after bugs, weed, thin walls, terrible customer service, and a myriad of charges and fees that were inexplicable considering the circumstances of our stay, our stay was exhausting, overpriced, and very frustrating to a first time visitor to Las Vegas.

We arrived on Saturday night\/Sunday morning around 12:30 or so. The front desk person, Chrystyna, did an excellent job. We reserved a King bedroom, which they were out of for the first night. When we got to the room, which had two double beds, we discovered that moths were already occupying that space. After a short conversation, Chrystyna helped to facilitate a room change the following day and said she would waive two of the resort fees for our stay (more on that shortly). This would be the end of our "luck" at the Monte Carlo.

We changed rooms the following day after an excursion to Death Valley. Shortly after we changed rooms, the entire floor of our room was filled with marijuana odor. I get it, you're in Vegas, it's basically legal in all of the states around here, but at least do it on a smoking floor. The person at the front desk said that several people had complained, but no apology was offered, just a simple "security is working on it". 

The ambiance was severely lacking in both rooms we stayed in. The walls seemed to be paper thin, and we could here entire conversations even at a whispers sound level. Our second room also had an adjoining door in between rooms, which contributed to a lack of sleep on our side. I'm glad the couple next door had fun, but it was not fun for us.

The final full day of our stay was relatively quiet. We spent some time at the pool, which was nothing special but adequate. If you want anything to drink, it's a hassle and a half to get a waitresses attention, even on the casino floor. 

Regarding the casino, I am a novice when it comes to slots. I didn't play a lot of them, but they seemed to dominate the floor. The smell of the casino is a mix of air fresheners and cigarette smoke, which was not unexpected. The card games have $10 minimums, also not unexpected, but it can get pricey if you're not prepared. Bring at least $500 if you plan to gamble any on the strip (sans the slots). 

This leads us to what I feel is the final nail in the proverbial coffin of this resort, checking out. The process was convenient, but we got a couple of unexpected surprises. First, we discovered that we were not comped two nights of our resort fees. Though resort fees seem to be the norm in Vegas, we booked our stay through hotels.com, and in each case of booking through that website, all of the potential fees, charges and taxes are included in the final tally. It's frustrating to find out that not only were you not given what you were promised, but that the charges were added after the fact. 

After talking with a supervisor for all of 30 seconds, she waived three of the resort fees. We appreciated that, but after checking the credit card balance, we noticed that there was a hold for roughly $140 on the card card from the resort. 

We literally spent no money on the card in question while at the resort. No room service, no meals charged to the room, no blue man group tickets, not one thing. We gambled in cash, didn't eat or drink at the resort, and didn't go to any shows. 

The explanation given for the hold was for "incidentals". Never have I had a hold of that much put on a card at any hotel or resort (including Disney properties). I understand a business wanting to ensure they get paid for their service, but this was a bridge too far. After speaking with a customer service rep, she said it would take 5-7 business days for it to be returned.Why not charge as you go? Why not decline a charge if there isn't enough money on it? Those are questions that I did not ask because I was too livid, but still deserve an answer to. 

Bottom line, which ironically is all that this hotel cares about, you should most definitely consider staying at a different resort. It seems to be worth the extra money to stay at Caesar's or the Venetian. If you're going to get a bunch of fees and charges, you shouldn't have to put up with stuff like this. A couple of apologies and fixes along the way (which did happen with Chrystyna) and a majority of my issues are null and void. Instead, I was brushed off with little to no regard. 

I'd be happy to discuss my issues with someone from management. You may feel free to contact me here.

One of my worst hotel stays in Las Vegas was here at the Monte Carlo. I would have given it a 1-star rating, if it wasn't for the fact they didn't kick us out when we got really belligerent. haha

Okay, first thing. The rooms were pretty clean. But it was the casino area that really sucked and caused us to get aggravated. We sat down to play some Blackjack. After a few hands, I pulled out an Ashton Churchill cigar (a big one!) and started to light it up. But I was stopped by the dealer. "I'm sorry sir, there's no cigar smoking here." Me - "What? Seriously?" Dealer - "Yes." So I stopped playing, stood up, and lit my cigar. I think I smoked half of that thing right by the table before the dealer was changed out. For some reason, it was okay to smoke there right next to the table, but not while sitting at it. WTF? Every casino lets you smoke but this one?! Casinos let people smoke in them. This means cigarettes and cigars. 

So, then we moved on to another table. I was still smoking my cigar, but a friend of mine sat down and started to play. He let out a big "F^@#" when he lost a big hand and the dealer told him to watch his language. (There were two other guys at the table about our same age.) We were starting to get pissed off now, so he just kept saying it - with the dealer correcting him every time. So now I started asking questions while he was playing; also including that great word at least 5-6 times in every sentence. This place was pissing us off.

Then we decided we had enough and went out to get some drinks. We went to a liquor store and picked up quite a few items to supply us for the weekend. I picked up a 750ml bottle of Jack Daniels and my buddy get a similar size bottle of Jaeger. This was going to be our gambling drinks. We also got some more cigars. We then went back to the hotel's casino and walked through the place with the giant bottles of alcohol while smoking our cigars. Every employee we passed asked us if we were done with our drinks and wanted to take them. I'm surprised we didn't get kicked out, but after all they just wanted our money. Who cares if we were a PITA.

I will never go back here, unless I feel like doing this again.

Haven't stayed here for couple of years (after the fire sometime ago). We booked this for cheap, with tax n resort fee (we never use the gym and pool, but oh well), came out to like 70 bucks\/nite, which was alright considering the X'Mas holiday.
So far as good. The ONLY gripe I have..... No WIFI.....the heck? 2015 just around the corner, who still lugs their Lappie and use RJ45?

I've now stayed at every MGM resort in Las Vegas. I rate Monte Carlo second to last with Excalibur being dead last for being more of a dungeon than a castle. 

Plus- good location, connected to Aria (love the restaurants and cocktail lounges at the Aria), tram access to Bellagio, housekeeping staff was very attentive 

Negatives- it's like Excalibur, it's the one MGM forgot. Very plain, basic, still not quite sure of the theme, rooms are like staying at a regular hotel. Doesn't feel like a resort. Front desk staff treated me like I needed a tutorial on understanding the bill  (I asked very simple question and he repeated his explanation 4 times with hand gestures). Now why did this bug me? I travel to Vegas at least twice a year and some years 4 times. Don't talk down to the guests please! Limited room service (or not all). That wasn't clear.

I stayed at NY NY in July and it's much nicer and right next door. 

Until I receive confirmation the hotel has been upgraded with all new rooms and better restaurants I'm never staying here again.

Sorry Monte Carlo. I tried to like you. I'm sticking with MGM Grand and NY NY. It shouldn't matter anyway. It's all in the family!

Old and busted.  Rooms are dated.  $20 to checkin early.  

I heard the guests in the next room coughing.  Yeah, just normal coughing.  Nothing crazy, but annoying you can even hear the next door guest doing normal room activities.

So I'll own the fact that I didn't know about all the construction. I knew some but not the vastness of it. While I feel lucky to have gotten a new room that was really nice the hotel was horrible. The charge a $35 resort fee per day which I know these hotels do. We've been to Vegas at least a dozen times and I'm aware of this. However. When there are no pools spas hot tubs saunas or fitness center and only two restaurants that close at 10 and one of those restaurants has the only lounge\/bar in the hotel also closed at 10 then I think MGM should waive that fee. Limited slots was also disappointing. Oh. And room service only 6am to 2pm. Our faucet in the bathroom had no hot water. Thankfully the shower did. Our room was only cleaned once in 5 days and when I called for wash rags and hand towels I was told they "were out". They sent up 1 wash rag and said to call back tomorrow. Most disappointing Vegas trip thanks to this hotel.  MGM. If your remodeling the Monte Carlo then close it down and just get it done. Don't let guests suffer. God knows you have enough other hotels making money

I stayed here over this past weekend. We were accidentally given one king sized bed instead of two queen beds, but they immediately called and switched us. As we were entering the new room, housekeeping was still (not) cleaning, but sitting on the bed watching TV. WTF? Seriously? 

So, the room was in decent shape, I mean, it's just a budget hotel in a decent location, but there were no cups in the bathroom, and only 1 pillow per person. Standard I guess in such a hotel. 

We only had the room cleaned one day out of the four we were there, and they did a lame job of it. Not all towels on the floor were picked up, and there was an empty takeout container left in the room. I understand it's hard sometimes to figure out what's garbage and what's not, but after the TV incident, it was hard for me to give them the benefit of the doubt. 

The pool was fun, until I wanted to relax and read a book. It screams MTV Spring Break. So, not a place to go for a quiet read, but still full of good booze, music and people. I asked our waitress for a glass of water, along with a mojito and a burger. My friends ordered food too. We got everything except the water, which our waitress said that she couldn't give us tap water. We had to buy bottled. Really? How crass.
