The pools are a lot smaller than the pools (including the wave pool and lazy river) at other hotels, particularly the similar pools at Mandalay Bay. Towels are a bit old and run down. Very small bar. and "gift\/pool shop."

Hotel\/Casino\/Buffet:

Eh, the buffet was okay, but there are much better places to eat to your heart's content in Vegas.

The casino itself is really small and is a lot smaller than other hotels' casinos on the strip. There weren't a lot of slot machines or card tables. There is a poker room, though, so that was nice.

The food court is really small, and there was nothing special. 

LOVED, LOVED, LOVED the tram to Bellagio\/Aria. You can also walk to Aria without going outside. Big pluses. 

I'm not sure if we'll stay here again, because it is a bit off-center of the strip, but having a tram to Bellagio makes it okay. Also, there are a lot of great hotels on the strip, but this place is a pretty great deal if you're in a pinch or need a place at the last minute. It's a lot better than Luxor or Excalibur, so I'd definitely stay here over those hotels.

Revisited the Monte Carlo for three days. I remembered my first visit to the Monte Carlo 5 years prior as being a very nice comfortable hotel that lacked that Vegas umph. This time around I had to take off a star. 

First off it took us maybe 40 minutes to check in. Lines were long and they were understaffed. Once checked in we were shocked to see how run down the room was. It was dirty. Dirty towels, dirty tub, and dirty floors. We asked for a new room and right away they sent a bellman to take our bags to our new room. Between waiting in line and changing rooms it took us almost two hours to settle in. 

The room was clean but run down. No glasses to go with the ice buckets which is no big deal as I just called room service to have them delivered but the lack of attention to detail showed me that the Monte Carlo had gone down quality wise. 

Every morning we woke up to dance music at 9am that was being played poolside. Nothing wrong with music by why is a DJ blaring music at 9am? We never were able to sleep-in. Last thing I want to do is party late into the night to be woken up at 9am. 

The only good thing was the price. Priceline offered a 110 dollar a night special that included a free buffet for the both of us every day. 

I would never stay here again. I don't need a posh room but cleanliness and peace and tranquility in your room is a must.

There are much nicer places to stay in Vegas for this price tier. The hotel is tired and desperately needs renovation. The carpets in the hallways are puckered and rippling, like undercooked bacon. The pillows are flat and minimal. The 
The housekeeping staff has, "called in sick" so there is no housekeeping services. Abysmal, really. The tap water smells like farts, tastes like metal, and any bottled water available will run $4+
Forget this place

So amazing. The place was beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. My friend and I stayed for 3 nights for $369 total. The buffet was pretty good and so was the cafe. It is on a fun piece of the strip right across from a movie theater and within walking distance of so many of the iconic Vegas sights. I had an amazing stay here and next time I go to Vegas this is where I will be booking my room.

This was my first trip to Las Vegas. The next time, I will not be staying at the Monte Carlo. When we arrived, it took an hour to get checked in. There was minimal staff to check in a waiting line of about 100 guests. When we were close to the front of the line, Everyone at the front desk just left for about 10 to 15 minutes. When they returned, we were helped by a young man named Tony, who was very nice. However, when he pulled up the reservation, they attempted to overcharge us for the room. Fortunately we brought with us a printed copy from when we originally booked the room, so they did fix the problem, but that doesn't make up for the attempt to overcharge us in the first place. The hotel was being remodeled and there were few restaurants and no pool. The biggest problem however, was the thieving cleaning crew. We left one day and upon return, I noticed most of the change I had left on the night stand was missing. All the silver was gone and the pennies were left behind. We later noticed a pair of earrings missing. So this was without a doubt my first and only stay at the Monte Carlo.

We had a Monaco Suite. Expected a little better for the money. Furniture could use replacing. Toilet in main bath wasn't working properly. And never could get Wi-Fi. Had issues with the front desk upon check-in too. Casino was nice and lobby was beautiful. Housekeeping was very good. Buffet was expensive, but very good. Great location on the strip.  Probably wouldn't stay there again unless it was at the Hotel 32.

Stayed 4 nights at the Monte Carlo.  There are a lot of choices in Las Vegas and I have visited for work and pleasure a lot.  I've stayed at the hotel more than 4 times but never again- as I said there are too many other options.  2 of the 4 days my room was never cleaned.  I. Ever used the do not disturb and the room was vacant from 7 AM to 6 PM.  I had to chase a service person down one of the other days.  What a hassle to go find towels- after I am back to the room who wants housekeeping coming in then?  I called the front desk and never heard the words we are sorry or anything is that sort.

First and last stay at the Monte Carlo.
Booked a package through Orbitz that included flights and hotel stay.  After being there...I discovered why the price was so low.
Found out that my package price didn't include "resort fees" (or something like that) and I had to pay another $80 or so upon check in.  That's more of an issue with Orbitz than the hotel, but that's how my stay started.

Didn't have any major issues with the room.  Not much to it...no refrigerator or microwave.  Lights in the entryway were burned out, which made for a problematic first entry.  But this was fixed quickly after a phone call to the desk.

The real issue was foodservice.  Literally half of the restaurants were closed down.  I understand restaurants may need to close periodically for renovations or cleaning, but closing  everything at once was a problem.  It made every other location swamped with people, which led to long waits and poor service.
There are two Starbucks locations...but one was closed.  That led to a 20 minute wait in the morning to order coffee.  When I finally get to the front...they're out of soymilk.  That left my lactose-intolerant girlfriend out of luck and left me wanting a 1\/2 hour of my life back.

When looking for dinner one night, we walked to two locations that were closed.  No master list anywhere that we could find as to what was open and what wasn't.  Not wanting to waste anymore time walking around, we asked the concierge.  He directed us to a cantina that was open.  It was literally at the furthest point away from the hotel from the desk.  We walked about 10-15 minutes down there...and......you guessed it....it's closed too.

We ended up leaving the hotel for dinner...and I made a specific point to go to a non-MGM Owned hotel.

Monte Carlo Management: 
1.) Don't close all your foodservice at the same time. It's very frustrating to your guests. 
2.) If you do...train your staff correctly.  If they don't know what's open...how do your guests?


Just saw the response from the hotel manager.  Totally avoids the issue of the concierge directing us to a place that was closed...and apparently they have no plans to change their seasonal closure practices.  Solidifies my decision to avoid this place (and every other MGM-owned hotel) like the plague!

This is a pretty nice hotel for the price. It's four-star hotel rating is a bit inflated (as with all of Las Vegas), but it's also cheaper than four-star hotels elsewhere (again a feature of Las Vegas), so it all works out in the end. Amenities include TV, a safe, and wired internet. The safe is large enough to hold a laptop or a small purse, but anything larger (like a backpack) won't fit. Since the internet is wired, be sure to bring a laptop if you want to use the internet. Your smartphone\/tablet won't work. With the way the economy is going, they probably haven't had the money to upgrade to wifi. The interior decor is OK, maybe more like a three-star hotel, but the lobby is quite opulent.

The parking structure is across the street, with a second-floor sky bridge connecting them. When you enter through the sky bridge, you will first go down an escalator to get to the lobby, then proceed to the elevators which is also where the casino entrance is.

When booking, you can pay extra for a high-floor (21+)* room for a better view and even more for a high-floor room with a view of the Strip.

* No, I don't mean only people of legal drinking age can stay in these rooms, I literally mean 21st floor and up.

So I made my follow-up visit after a very nice invitation from MC to return, based on my previous review.
As I usually like to do, I travelled to Vegas during the middle of the week, in December, as I find it so much nicer than the crowded weekends.  Walking into the lobby, I was literally the first person in line to check-in.  Sweet!
We were given a nice room, on the 31st floor with a decent view.  Everything in the room was great.  Nice set up, good bathroom, great shower. And being there at that time of the week, retrieving the elevator was not a problem.
Monte Carlo has always been a very nice place for us, except for one time.  But it has all the restaurants and amenities you need.  Nice casino, nice stores and fantastic restaurants.

One final shout out - Many thanks to Rachel Romero, whose kindness and concern were very much appreciated.  We hope to return to MC soon.

Just arrived and checked in and it was a unpleasant experience. Now I can see why I never stayed at the Monte Carlo before and I will never again. We checked in very late and extremely tired but did the front desk person checking us in take that into consideration? No! She had a nasty attitude and we just found out that they were renovating their pool to my disappointment and I asked if there are other accommodations and she just told us that you can get shuttle to the MGM. I told her I really can't go on a shuttle based on my current condition and she just dismissed me. I was told her looks like we are never staying here ever again. If I knew about the pool we would have stayed elsewhere.

Ive stayed here 3 different times... this is definitly a value hotel.

The room rates are great, the location is superb, but this hotel is lacking. The rooms are average, the pool is average, and the casino is average. Theres nothing special about this place. If you are looking for action, excitement, and VEGAS fun... I would opt for MGM or Planet Hollywood. (in the same $$$ range). There arent even any cool places to eat or drink here. no clubs either. 

BUT...If you are on a family trip looking to save a few $ this is a good place. I saw numerous families here and its a fitting place for that.

This hotel is OK...and really mean just OK. Im not going to be staying here anymore and pay a couple bucks more elsewhere.

I came to the Monte Carlo for a business trip and was immediately struck by how good it - wait for it - smells - inside! I'm not kidding - really, they must put something in the air vents to make it smell nice and fragrant no matter where you are. 

My company takes good care of us when we're out so I had one of the business suites to myself, up on the 18th floor with a great location by the elevators and a really nice view outside. The room was always clean and comfortable, and I had fun ordering room service a couple of times - which wasn't any more highly priced than other four-star hotels. 

I like the setup of the Monte Carlo with the casino nested between a food court and with several restaurants lining it. It felt very Vegas-y to me, for lack of a better way to put it, like something you'd expect Vegas to be. I was there for business so I didn't get out to really explore the casino and bars, but I liked the atmosphere a lot. 

My only complaint is that I'm currently dealing with a misplaced charge on my credit card courtesy of the hotel itself - several hundred dollars that shouldn't be there - and I had a rather rude girl from the MGM accounts receivable department smart off to me over the phone. That isn't something I appreciate, but I've got both my company and my credit card company involved, so that will be sorted. Nothing against the Monte Carlo itself, though - the staff were friendly, attentive, and charming.

I wouldn't mind staying here again. Good Vegas experience.

Also, there's free Wi-Fi - rather, it's included in the resort fee, and it's super fast. Definitely a plus!

I stayed at Monte Carlo for 3 days, big disappointment! First of all, their pool is under construction. I was not aware of this when I booked my stay. It was an inconvenience to go to MGM pool instead. .Second, it was very noisy! You can hear all the drilling due to the construction. Another thing that it's a concern, it was very dusty and dirty in the hallways. It had an unpleasant odor inside the casino. 
The only positive thing that I observed, was their friendly staff. Housekeeping staff are very friendly and helpful.
Overall, not coming back or staying here ever again.

I am forced to give this place one star.  Unsafe and unclean and I wouldnt trust any dish used. Housecleaning the worst. This is not a 4 star. More like a 1 1\/2.  After 5 days of a broken shower head, broken phone, unclean dishes and I'm not even sure about the sheets. Enough is enough. Good luck getting ahold of any manager since they are all in meetings all the time.

My husband and I go to Las Vegas every end of summer.  For many years, we stayed at the Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino in Downtown Las Vegas but for the last two years, we have stayed on the strip trying a new hotel each time.
Our annual trip to Vegas unbelievably is not about the gambling but rather the entertainment, dining and relaxation; a key piece of our trip is about relaxing in the sun by the pool.  I love laying by the pool from 10 am until 4:30 pm drinking, reading, swimming, eating lunch, sleeping on and off and basically just being lazy.  When home I am not the type of person ever to "sit still" but my yearly mecca to Vegas is the one and only time of year where I do nothing absolutely "N-O-T-H-I-N-G" and love every minute of it.
This years' trip took us to the Monte Carlo.  I booked our trip through Southwest Airlines Jackpot Deals.  I have to say I expected more from my stay at the Monte Carlo and was so disappointed that I called Southwest Airlines Jackpot Deals two days into our trip (we were staying for a total of 4 nights and 5 days) and asked if we could change hotels.  After the Southwest Airlines Rep spoke with Monte Carlo Reservations, we were told we could move to a different hotel and that we would receive a refund for the remaining time we would have stayed at the Monte Carlo.
The pool area was rather disappointing.  The whole flow or feng shui of the pool layout was not welcoming; the position of almost all lounge chairs face away from the pools except for the pool that is shaded throughout the entire day.  The wave tech pool was a complete disappointment.  It was too short to really get any true waves going within the center of the pool.  They have a volleyball area, which I personally, think is silly.  Why not make a giant wave tech pool forgo the volleyball area and put some lounge chairs in the shallow area of the pool like at the Golden Nugget or Mandalay Bay.  Place a few tables for gambling and a bar.  The music was much too loud for the small pool area.
As for our guest room the furniture was cheap thin wood had a feeling of being rickety, the mattress was very uncomfortable and there was not any Wi-Fi available in the room.  I found this so astonishing!  It is not as if WI-FI service in hotels is not common or has not been available for quite a few years nor were we traveling in Europe where I would be surprised at any sort of frequency of WI-FI accessibility.  This is 2013; almost everyone has a smart phone and some sort of table.  I was shocked.
I think it is absurd to complain about check-in and out lines in Vegas so yes we waited in line for a long time, is this an anomaly in any sense, no this is quite common at all properties all over Vegas except if you are staying off the strip then you probably will not have to wait long at all.
The feel of the hotel is okay.  Again, it is not really luxurious or stunning in any way.  The hotel staff we encountered were all fantastic, courteous, kind, professional and friendly but the hotel itself was not our cup of tea, thus we went over to the MGM after finding a descent rate on www.i4vegas.com for last minute reservations.

This was my first time staying at Monte Carlo and I have to admit that I was quite surprised by my experience here. My initial thoughts about staying was a little iffy, but after my stay, I am definitely sold on Monte Carlo as an inexpensive hotel to stay at that offers a great location on the strip and good comfortable rooms to sleep in.

I have stayed at the MGM tower too many times to count and the east tower at the Luxor so it was awesome to find out that the rooms at the Monte Carlo are comparable. Similar furniture, similar bed, similar layout to the room. I say similar because they is definitely a difference and I definitely prefer MGM, but it is close enough especially when taking price into account. Apparently, Monte Carlo had gone through a remodel in recent years and it looks they will benefit from it because I liked the rooms here.

The casino is smaller than some of the other hotels but they do have pretty much everything you could want. Roulette, video poker, that annoying Wheel of Fortune game and etc. Restaurant wise they have only few choices but there is variety and they seem fairly decent (we did eat at a couple of them. To be reviewed). Checking in took quite some time but hell, you only have to go through it once during your stay. Overall a pretty good hotel that I can definitely recommend. 3 stars!

Resort Fee is Bogus!

We checked in after waiting over a half a hour.  We had asked for adjoining rooms and there are none... that's right on a Wednesday there is no adjoining rooms in this whole hotel.  Then we get to the room and the resort fee is supposed to include 2 bottles of water, free local and 800 calls and printing of boarding passes.  There was no water in our room so I called down and they have changed the policy even though it clearly states it on our confirmation.  They no longer offer water or free calls, so I asked if we can just not use the resort portion (we don't need boarding passes printed and don't need to use the gym or whatever else might be included) and the answer is no.... They should just include this resort fee as part of the price since it really doesn't give you anything special.

I guess it depends on what you are looking for. The price was good. The pool was nice but I didn't use it and it's very well located on the strip. However the paint was peeling in the bathroom and the room in general was very basic and pretty run down. The hallway to my room had large stains on the carpet and the walls were beat up. My recommendation would be to spend an extra $30 a night and take advantage of some of the specials the nicer resorts offer. I will say though the customer service at the Monte Carlo was excellent.

3 stars because it was sort of A-okay? Mixed review ahoy!

I admit I was sort of dreading staying here with all the crummy reviews, but it was chosen for a big (BIG) group of friends to go to Vegas and the price was right. It was better than I expected in some ways (cleaner, the room was quiet enough, there was no mold that I could see in our bathroom, the location is aces, convenient food court and amenities), and worse in others (no fridge in the room, no coffee maker in the room, thin\/cheap towels, squashy-in-the-bad-way bed, inconsistent service on property). It is, as one of my friends sagely pointed out, the Holiday Inn of the Strip. No frills, but a good location, and does the job. If you're not going to be in your hotel room much this might be a good spot for you.

We had a room on the 19th floor facing the new arena. With two nights of a George Strait concert, it was audibly busy in the evenings, but it was fine. That said, I don't know how the lower rooms or the rooms facing the pool do it. The pool music is blasting from the early morning hours and it is LOUD. Something to consider when reserving a room. 

Service at the Pub, Brand, and the pool was mixed, but mostly not great. Service at Double Barrel was really good. 

That said, the management at the pool was EXCELLENT. We reserved one of the lounge areas our first day, and we had terrible service. My friend spoke to the manager, who knocked $100 off the bill AND comped us the VIP cabana and private pool for the next day! The manager came over to check on us to make sure we were doing okay, and the service was perfect. It was much faster (no waiting 90+ minute for one order of chicken fingers), and hey guess what? As a result we spent WAY more money. Everyone wins. (And let me tell you, if you have enough people to split it and make the price right, do yourselves a favor and reserve that VIP pool. It was so great and became the talk of the trip.)

Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again because what's important to me is being really comfortable in my room and being able to count on service, and this place seems pretty hit or miss.

I liked Monte Carlo and would stay there again. I've only been to Vegas one other time two years ago and stayed at the Orleans (not my decision). We arrived at the Monte Carlo around 10 am on Sunday and were able to get checked in right away. Nice! So my friend and I ventured through the hotel to get a feel and grabbed a bite in the food court. Then it was off to the pool!
The pool was awesome. There is a DJ there on Saturdays and Sundays. I wish it was all week long because the pool wasnt the same on Monday as on Sunday. Don't get me wrong, I love kids, I have 6 year old twins myself but Vegas is NOT the place for them. I noticed a lot of kids at the Monte Carlo pool. The lazy river is not the place to teach your kids how to swim. Whats nice is you can walk around the lazy river or stand at the side and drink. Not everyone is in a tube. Drinks are expensive. But its Vegas. 

The room was clean. Nice. There was some wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. But I'd give the room 4 stars. 

Resturants, The food court was expensive but again, its vegas. The restaurants in the hotel were good. We ate at the Cafe once for dinner and once for breakfast. Decent prices good food. Cannot rate the buffet. Heard it wasnt great so we didnt bother. The Pub in the Monte Carlo is a whole other review UGH! 

The tram to Crystals and Bellagio was nice but really people? You walk further to get to the tram and to get from the tram out of Bellagio then if you were to walk down the strip. 

I would stay here again for sure.

if you can score a promotional price for here, its a very nice option for staying on the strip in a central location. our standard 2-queen room came out to roughly $115\/nite (hard to say since it was a flight\/hotel package through southwest) and I thought it was classy economy...good middle of the road option.


ROOMS:

good sized room (e.g. not a shoebox at all) shared between 4 people (4 girls in vegas sharing a bathroom though...never big enough!).

beds and sheets felt aaaamazing when we arrived. somehow got really uncomfortable toward the end :-\/

****standard pillows are AWFUL!!!****** but guess what? all it takes is being a bit assertiveness to find out you can request FEATHER PILLOWS!

shower was fantastic, great water pressure

free internet (provided ethernet).

SERVICE:

We made several calls for various things and I was shocked at how quickly they fulfilled the requests. new pillows? pronto. more towels? well be right there. the phone was always answered and they are obviously well-organized.

*One gripe is that on the only day we wanted housekeeping and took the "do not disturb" off our door, we did not receive it :( came home late at nite to find our rooms still a mess. would have been fantastic sleeping in clean sheets and a made bed :-\/ ironically every day we didn't want service (and forgot the sign), they tried to come about 5 times.

FOOD:

Didn't eat in any of the restaurants but we did partake in room service a few times :) Actually pretty reasonably priced and delicious. $12 for a grilled chicken sandwich with bacon, avocado cheese and all the fixins' was not a regrettable choice. During peak hours you do need to be patient. I think it took about an hour to receive.

There is a good food court as well with plenty of options and fulfills the late night munchies. 

POOL:

I had no idea the pool here was so cool. Lazy river with intertubes and wave pool :D

+1 for including delightful and amusing british gentlemen for our entertainment.

CASINO:

...I have no opinion on this. I do not gamble.

Overall very pleasant experience and I'd definitely stay here again.

ehhhhh is all I have to say about this resort. First off, the rooms were decorated very tackily. The carpet was straight out of a clown career college and the beds were harder than rocks. The pool, which is essential to any successful Las Vegas hotel, lacked in many ways. The pool was tiny and there were so many beach chairs you could get lost. I would definitely not return, although the price was very cheap.

I never write negative reviews but this place is the WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD! 
- They take forever to check you in and when they do they have an attitude. 
- If you pay the parking fee with your ticket at the end they will still charge you to your credit card and when you are trying to get the $ back they let you holding forever and pretty much laugh in your face
- THE ROOMS SMELL REALLY BAD !!
- I WILL ALSO POST IT IN MY 50K SOCIAL MEDIA KNOW SO NOBODY ELSE EXPERIENCE A NIGHTMARE AT THIS PLACE

The hotel itself is clean but it's kinda out of date. The rooms had old wallpaper that's peeling off.

There were 2 screws on the floor in our room and I was walking around barefoot. I came close to stepping on it. Luckily I saw it before I did. The cleaning crew must have gotten lazy.

I EFFN LOVE staying here, middle of the strip and affordable prices. If you stay here I recommend you check out their pool area.They have a lazy river and wave pool with a live DJ that gets the place popping. Their rooms have the most comfortable beds ever I could have slept all day in them. The rooms are pretty spacious and clean, this is def one of my favorite spots to stay at when I'm not trying to overspend on a hotel.
this casino sucks dont stay here worst customer service in the table games buffet also one of the worst anywhere

Stayed here for a night on July 4th weekend.  The rooms are your standard rooms, nothing crazy.  

Even though the hotel is aging, their rooms are still clean.  Our room had a coffee maker in it. It was a nice morning pick me up.

Didn't get to go to the pool, but they have a lazy river, beach volley ball and something that looked like a wave pool.

They have a food court, near the lobby that has MCDs, sbarros, subway, rubios, starbucks and a couple of other places to grab a quick bite.

I would go back and stay, if the price was right.

OMG.- this is going to sound like a Taylor Swift song because we're never, ever, ever going to stay there again. They switched \/ upgraded our room twice (that means 3 rooms) because the rooms were so bad \/ dirty. Found a fly in a breakfast bun. On and on and on.  Even the workers said that they were supposed to be renovated a year ago. Too bad.

The best part about this hotel: Lazy River Pool.
I had several troubles with my room and checking in. I had booked a King bed for two adults and for some reason, they didn't have anymore King deluxe rooms so they had to give us two Queen size bed rooms. The biggest problem was the hygiene of this hotel. The two rooms we switched to all smell like urine and cheap cover up scent mixed together. We called many front desk agents after the unpleasant experience and no one was able to help. I was too furious that at 12am after hours of checking in, I was still not able to sleep in a room that didn't have so many flaws so I asked to speak with a manager. Blake was so sincere and understanding and took care of the issue right away! Exactly what I expect a manager would do! Five stars for Blake's customer service. He made my spring break's rocky start better and even called to check in and see if everything is going good!
it's kind of an old hotel so we didn't expect much so we weren't too disappointed. it's affordable and makes sense if you won't be spending much time in your room. the pool isn't the best either...

I like the Monte Carlo.  The hotel is clean, location on strip is great and the hotel staff is always helpful and friendly. It's a smaller casino on the strip which can be both good and bad as far as gaming availability.  There's a great selection of restaurants. I look forward to doing a stay-cation and checking out more food here and the lazy river at the pool before summer is over.

Three stars in many places, but as Vegas hotels go only one star. Very disappointed with the Monte Carlo itself as a facility. The people are nice but they charge one of the highest resort fees on the strip and the rooms do not have Wi-Fi (they advertise high speed Internet, but it is only a lan line-the kind that would work on the lap top I replaced a few years ago. Wi-Fi is only available on the ground and second floors). 

We paid a premium price for a strip view, but due to newer hotels blocking the view, our strip view represented about 100 actual yards of the strip. 

One of the days we came back to our room after 10:00 at night, and housekeeping had not gotten to us yet. 

The carpets all look like they should've been replaced five years ago. It is just run down, and while I have only speculation based on observation to go by, my guess is that MGM (the owner) is going to bulldoze the place for new facility within the next 18 months.

I don't know about some of the bad reviews but we just stayed there for 3 nights during Spring Break and it was Awesome!!! We are a family of 4 with our kids being 12 and 8 and everything was perfect!!  
Our rooms were great and Clean! The staff was courteous and friendly. The restaurants were great and the pool area was clean and fun!!!  We will definately stay there again!

This was my first time at the Monte Carlo (like seriously.  Even when I was younger, we skipped the Monte Carlo because they didn't have any kid-friendly attractions), so I was pleasantly surprised.  My friend is a hustler (har har) so we were able to get a room for Labor Day weekend.

The room:
A little outdated, but large and comfortable.  The toilet had a crack (i didn't do it!) and the shower head tried to blast all the skin off my body.  There was no refrigerator (boo having to drink warm Four Lokos... ok just kidding, we made our own fridge in the sink :P) and our room was the very end of a long hallway (but not as long a hallway as the Mirage, so still alright!).  It came with free wired internet (which we didn't use because seriously, who doesn't have a blackberry\/iphone\/smart phone by now?) and a binder that advertises the Lance Burton show (haha, didn't that thing get cancelled like 5-10 years ago?).  There was an ipod docking station and 2 phones (which were practically next to each other.  convenient, no?)  Our view was of the pool, which looked pretty awesome actually.  If my friend had brought swim shorts, we would've gone!

The hotel:
Small strip of stores\/restaurants in the "Boulevard of Dreams" or whatever its called.  A small food court which included Subway, Starbucks, Sbarros, Hagaan Daz, McDonalds, and some Chinese restaurant.  There were bars\/restaurants scattered through the casino area.  Nothing crazy impressive, except for the minus 5 Ice Lounge (which was overpriced, but still awesome).  Bonus points for having a direct connection to the Aria and a tram that goes to Aria\/Crystals and Bellagio\/Vdara.

Overall, its a great location to sleep in\/pay little money for a room, but if you're shelling out big bucks, you might as well stay elsewhere.

My letter to MGM.., my name is Jannelle Poole and I wanted to take a moment to let you know about my most recent experience with your resorts. First I must say that I am a huge Vegas fan, our family celebrates Thanksgiving in Vegas every year and we have family that flys in from New York, Florida, and Honduras...it's always been something that I look forward to...we start off in a time share and then after the holiday about half of us stay on, always in an MGM property. About 2 years ago I started playing the my Vegas abought the reward on my Vegas after reading the terms and conditions, verifying that it was valid for the intended dates...all good...so then I click the link to book the room at New York, ...it won't let me book for Saturday night. I try calling and am told yep, no Saturday arrivals...as though that was already stated and I'm a moron for asking...I triple checked, it's not stated. Okay so I ask which reward could I use for Saturday, she says she can't check. .just keep trying . Now beyond irritated.....I ask her which one she thinks would be more likely to have that option...she says Monte Carlo. I buy the reward, then she checks ...nope your out of luck ...but I can book a room, you pay for Saturday and then use the reward for Sunday and Monday...I agree. ...she starts looking for the rate....I tell her my husband Erick Flores has the credit card from Mlife, will that help...she asks for his Mlife #, quotes the rate of 85. Plus the resort fee, then books the comp room using the reward and we are good to go. We go to check in..h.mmthat's odd, they only have the one night....then when she finds the second reservation that reservation is also for only one night for a total of 2 nights....well okay I say to myself surely this is an easy fix, ...flash forward 30 full minutes after she has made several calls to my Vegas to m life to everyone...she hangs up and says, well according to them this is the second time this has happened, there gonna call you later after they investigate...now at this point I'm pretty sure she is insinuating that I've done something...God only knows what...so with dread and like a scolded child I go up to the room...as I walk through the casino I'm shocked to see the tiny little size...wait...and there are no restaurants open, no pool, no spa.....no shopping....and about 1\4 of the casino..the room ...I must say I adored...we go to the room

..shower...then because I have Anxiety disorder and can't stop worrying decide to go to the m life desk ...we are summarily dismissed saying that they don't do reservations. You know, for some reason dismissal by a 19 year old that didn't even have the courtesy to let me finish my sentence made my worry flash to anger...it was a slow flash...about 2 hours later we went back to the m life desk.

..met a ray of sunshine... intelligent, helpful, no nonsense sweet heart who fixed the problem, explained that the guest services staff doesn't have the access to my Myvegas ...I was so dissatisfied with the State of the Monte Carlo, we left a day earlier anyways so I need not have spent the whole evening in angst

..but I had no idea.... There ought to be a duty to just the general satisfaction of your customer to inform them of the fact that the casino is no resort...with no amenities....we check out...after standing in one long line...are directed to stand in a different line....only after we get to the front....then are asked by the gentleman that stands behind the clerk's...um do you have a question? Yes, we need to check out...he asked the room number...he says he will don't out a receipt ...gets distracted helping someone else...meanwhile this is all with us still in the second line and him still behind the counter...when he remembers us he raises his voice to be heard over the man that being helped properly at the counter.."next time do mobil check out. (Hahaha) we will send the receipt to your email.

Cherry on top, we get home...even though it's clearly not justified resort fee charged for 3 nights...what does the resort fee include?...and please don't say Wi-Fi... because my data plan is unlimited...we stayed 2 nights not 3....the 85 dollar rate was not the lowest rate for Saturday night, I don't think they used either Mlife reward # to allow points for the stay and I still have to emailed receipt.

Jannelle Poole

pp.

Last time we were in Vegas we had a wonderful stay at the Monte Carlo, so we didn't look around at other options, we just booked there for our recent stay.  Very polite check-in staff.  She offered us our choice of room location.  She stated that there was "a little street noise" if we chose a room with a view of the Strip.  Knowing that this kind of noise is minimal that high up (18-20th floor), we chose one of those rooms since one person in our group had never been to Vegas before.  The room looked okay when we got there, but as time went by we noticed a lot of issues.  The bathroom was not all that pleasant - the bathtub fixtures were mismatched (some silver, some brass), and all were very worn.  The bathtub faucet was actually coming off the wall.  There was wallpaper peeling off the walls as well.  The furniture was worn and the desk chair quite uncomfortable.  The "decorator" pillows were worn and dirty, and housekeeping had put them on the bed pillows (yuck!!).  We were rudely awakened by very loud construction noise at 5:00AM!  They are building something next door, and all of the noise was banging on metal - not something that can be slept through.  As we unhappily got up earlier than planned, we found, as each of us took a shower, that the towels are TINY.  The towels are so small, that not one of us could wrap it around ourselves (not even the petite size 2 person).  When we discussed our concerns with the front desk later in the day, their solution was to have ear plugs sent up to our room.  Their new arena was opening that day, and they were much too preoccupied with that to be bothered with complaints about already checked-in guests who couldn't sleep through construction noise.  The ventelation system in the casino is horrible - much more smoky and stinky than many of the other casinos. The pools are pretty basic compared to most other hotels on the Strip.  One person in our group had several hours worth of work with her, but wasn't able to do any of it, as the wi-fi was out for almost the entire second day of our stay.  Since we couldn't sleep and we couldn't work, we checked out and went elsewhere.  Everyone in our group unanimously agreed that none of us will ever return to the Monte Carlo again.

We booked Monte Carlo last minute for my Boyfriend and I's 4th anniversary. We work late so rushing from UT to make it in time for a decent dinner was a task in itself. Valet was quick and accommodating but when we walked in the line was outrageous for check in. My stress levels rose as we had dinner reservations in 20 minutes at Jullian Serrano (The last reservation of the night) Frantic I ran to every open rep \/ concierge around the front desk and luckily someone was willing to help us out given the circumstances. Within 5 minutes we were checked into the room. The hotel was very nice inside and out. The rooms were very clean and didn't have a dingy smell some older Vegas hotels do. We liked the fact it was centrally located and had direct access to the surrounding casinos. We will definitely be staying there again. Thanks Monte Carlo!

Old, dirty, unfriendly, unaccomadating. Never again, EVER! When we arrived for check in at 3:30 on Thursday we were told by a Michelle G, who checked us in, that there were were no longer any king size bedrooms available, which is what we had reserved. This left me to wonder whether the guests waiting in the gigantic and growing line behind me were going to be told the same thing and how pissed everyone was going to be, right? My husband asked how that was possible and the chick had the audacity to tell us that technically check is 3 but no one is guaranteed their room until 6 pm!! Seriously?! Then why isn't check in at 6?! That was ridiculous. She must've thought we were stupid or something. She treated us like second class citizens and this really disappointed me. Well after my husband refused to budge, she made a call and magically found a king size bedroom available. She took no responsibility, made no apologies and frankly looked mad at us for some reason! Talk about quality customer service, what a joke! Well she must have had some sort of beef with us because the room we got was awful! Ugly, drab, old and equivalent to a crappy holiday inn, even then that may be an insult to the holiday inn. The bathroom had mold and hard water stains, and small.  The furniture was chipped and dis colored and carpet was old. Mind you we're not pretentious or picky but even this was pretty bad for vegas! We called to complain but the hotel refused to take responsibility and said they'd call back to switch our rooms and never did. When we met up at our friend's room I noticed their room was bigger and newer and a tad better but even they weren't happy with their room. Never again will we make the mistake of staying here. The Monte Carlo claim that "luxury should make you feel special no matter who you are" and that was a bunch of BS. I should've just stuck with the Mandalay bay or Luxor. Sorry for grammar and punctuation, I'm on my phone and mad!

They do not have wheelchair accessible rooms with two queen beds. They will offer you a roll-away bed, but that doesn't sound too great for a vacation, to me. They also don't tell you this when making reservations online, so luckily I called to double-check the reservations. I made online reservations for 2 beds in a wheelchair accessible room, but those rooms don't even exist at this hotel.
I enjoyed my stay here a few years back-the pool was nice, the food was good, and it is in a good location, so I was going to return. However, I refuse to stay here, after this fiasco. 
I called a few times to double check this, but the people I talked to didn't really care. I talked to a few people and they all had the same attitude towards the situation. They just kept telling me I could have a roll away bed put in my room, but why would I do that when I could go somewhere else for the same price or cheaper and get two beds?
Not offering this is not okay, but I would have tried it again in the future if they would have told us this from the beginning. Instead, they let us reserve a non-existant room. They also charged the card for a deposit fee after the website said no deposit needed.
I am taking my business somewhere else and will not come here to stay or eat.

The honey and I stayed here one night when we were in Vegas and it was a great hotel. The pool was amazing, the view was breath taking, the service was great, even the lines were set-up efficiently and moved quickly. 

the only real problems were, that the moment you walked in it had this odor of bad flowers and smoke smell, it made me ill. also with the new aria Hotel, it is a maze of stairs, walk ways and BS to get past it and to the Monte Carlo, I almost feel bad for them. The last complaint, for whatever reason we didn't like to gamble there!! maybe the smell, or the older "we take things WAY to serious vibe" types of people or what, but we never spent a dime there!!

but if you want to stay at a wonderful hotel, with great views and not too expensive, then this should be on the top of your list.

So, this side of the strip seems to be the side that is slowly dying. What I mean is, it appears harder to keep up with their newer, glitzier neighbors (i.e. Aria, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, etc). The check in area is nice, not as fancy as some of the other hotels but no biggie. It's when you go upstairs that it becomes obvious this hotel is much older and in need of some repair. The carpets seem to carry an odor (cigarette smoke, various smells, etc). The walls of the room were thin, as we heard people coming down the halls, talking and making noise all night long. There weren't many amenities to speak of (i.e. coffee pot, water, refrigerator, microwave, etc). I get it, it's Vegas, they want you to spend $$$ in their hotel or restaurants on site. Our beds were ok - the pillows and mattresses weren't too comfortable. I'm comparing it with the La Quinta that we stayed at and to me that's like comparing apples and oranges. I had higher expectations from the Monte Carlo and that might be what's wrong. I expected too much?!

I stayed here last weekend with my friends, free comp through myvegas. The hotel itself is nice, everything is where it should be with 4 swimming pools, I liked that some fast food places are open 24\/7.

Check-in was fine, the rep was friendly and let us check-in 2hrs early. However, she asked me if I had booked the room through myvegas and I told her yes, but she did not enter it in the database. I was charged at the end of my trip when it was supposed to be a free comp for my whole stay. Another thing was that our room had wet tissues... The whole box of tissue was wet inside.. A bit disgusting. 

Anyway, after finding out my credit card had been charged when it shouldn't have been, I had to call to dispute this issue. I was on hold for about 30mins, and finally a representative answered, after explaining everything to her, she told me the rep who checked us in didn't put the information needed down. So I had to deal with this myself. 

It wasn't all bad, but I honestly expected more from Monte Carlo. Just a little bit disappointed..

stayed once in this empty shell of a hotel\/casino and let me tell you what happened...

check in and notice that it's basically a generic skeleton of a hotel\/casino with nothing giving it a personal touch or making it special...fine.

get to the room, throw our stuff down and quickly change for dinner and drinks...don't notice much except that it's a bit small but hey, it was pretty cheap.

what happened from the time we left to go out until the time i woke up i'm not so sure...but what happened when i did wake up...GROSS.

so i wake up hungover and scratching my legs...no big change there.

but then i keep scratching...and scratching...and scratching, until finally i pull back the covers with an annoyed "what the fuck" and i see BUGS.

BUGS!!!!!! WITH WINGS!!!!!! IN THE BED!!!!!!BUGS!!!!!

i'm not all that squeamish, but c'mon!! 

then i notice bugs on the bedside table and around the window sill(which are sealed shut!)
so i call the front desk and get an uninterested employee transfer me to security where i get the fuckhead asking "are you sure they're bugs, ma'am?". WTF. you don't really confuse an infestation with anything else.

after a thorough inspection of our infested room(you best bet i acted squeamish then), we FINALLY got transfered to a suite. great, but i still feel like there's gonna be bugs in my bed. 
they tried to give us 2 free nights there to apologize...NO FUCKING WAY!!! why would i ever stay at they're empty, no fun-havin', bug-infested hotel?

if it's affordability you're looking for, the Luxor or Rio are far superior.
Poor planning, three people at th registration desk looking as if it's their first day, 75 guests in line wanting to check in.

Unfortunately, I had to give them a star. If not it'd be a big goose egg. Worst stay ever and I mean it. It stunk like sewer which pretty much reflects their terrible service. Made us wait a long time at 12 am in the morning and finally gave us a room with one bed (booked two bd 3 months in advance) then said "here's a cot". Unbelievable.

I have been staying here on and off for the past 10 years and although I still love it I will say that its not the same as it once was but still, I will continue to stay here because of the location. The location is great because you are in walking distance to a bunch of great hotels like New York New York, MGM, Aria, Excalibur and the Luxor. Another great perk is how close the food court is to the elevators, which helps a lot if you just want to grab some food and head back to your room. And last but not least the pools. Not only do they have a wave pool but they have a lazy river if you just want to kick back and have a beer.

Worst hotel experience in Vegas ever. We booked using Priceline and the site said that the pool was under construction, didn't care much because they gave us free alternatives. But the floor above us was under construction. We asked to be moved and they said no. The noise went on from 7am-5pm pretty much the only time you would be in your room sleeping from being out all night. Literally so loud you couldn't have a conversation. When I tried to call to complain they said they couldn't hear us! Ha exactly my problem. Go any where else this hotel sucks

3 1\/2 Stars!

Monte Carlo is one of the most underrated hotels on the Las Vegas Strip.  I suppose if the room doesn't cost more then your car note per night its not good enough.  Well shame on you, shame.  I have had the pleasure of staying at the Monte Carlo on more then one occasion and let me tell you it does not disappoint.

PRO:  The Smell.  Seriously, it smells sooooo good in this hotel all the time.  I find myself walking through the hallway and casino saying aloud "OMG it smells so good".  Even when I'm sober.  Now that's major.

CON:  I completely forget about this place when I'm planning a trip.  I'm so sorry Monte Carlo, I really am.

Funny story.  My cousin and I were on our way out to the club.  Looking cute and stuff.  We get in the elevator, and there.... Is a girl who just got out the pool.  Oh wait, no... she pissed on herself.  Not only is she pissy in the elevator but she keeps saying "Lance Burton.. Master Magician".  HILARIOUS.  We still make fun of her to this day.

The rooms here are nice, typical Vegas rooms (that smell really good).

Of course, if the possible get the Monaco Suite.  It is spacious and mid-level luxurious.  Luxury without the price tag of a 5 star hotel.

Stay here, you wont regret it.

Good for: Romance, Girls Trips, Guys Trips, Relaxing Weekend

Stay away till this craphole gets its fufu makeover. Staff can care less and clearly the rooms show how negligent they become. Only good staying there is location and the tram that goes to Bellagio. Had a hard time checking in that took over an hour and was trying to charge us for a comp room, forgot to add my name to the room and couldn't redeem myvegas reward without going back to check in. Bathroom was nasty with other peoples dirty towels and empty shampoo bottles, used soap. No apologies what so ever. Still paid for resort fee, this is not what you want on vacation. STAY AWAY.

Having not been to Vegas in a long time; I thought this would be a great place to stay.  The price was right and the location great.  But besides that - there isn't much more.

I have NEVER stayed in a hotel room that was so noisy.  It is impossible to take a nap (it is Vegas and there will be those late nights) - so much noise and yelling in the hallways; doors slamming and you can hear everything.  Even house keeping makes a racket.

I didn't like the $12.95 \/ day charge - for the pool and internet? Really?

The pool was great; but it reminded me more of spring break than a nice hotel on the strip.

1. A worker in the food court tried pulling a fast one by keeping my credit card and giving me another plastic card.                                                              2. Blood on my clean towel
3. No cofee in our room.                            4. No refrigerator in room.

The last time i was in Vegas we stayed at the Bellagio.. this time we stayed at the Monte Carlo and it was just okay. It wasn't horrible. I didn't feel like i was gonna get the herps. The hotel itself is decent. It was like staying at a Marriott. I wasn't impressed and i wasn't grossed out. Its nice that they provide free Internet and two bottles of water a day. It was also nice they didn't try to charge me for a fridge. There's nothing to do in the hotel and there weren't many places to eat. 

Want to get to citycenter\/bellagio area quickly? Take the monorail and save $!! Monorail is located at the end where to pool is located.

We've been coming here for the last 10 years and our last 2 visits have left me disappointed.

Our trip here last year really sticks out in my memory because when we got to the room the toilet had a HAIR on it (actually I think it was 2), and I'm not talking about a hair from your head!  It was extremely disgusting and I called housekeeping right away.  Just shows that they're not cleaning and sanitizing the toilet seat after every guest checks out of that room, which leads me to think well whatelse may they be slacking on?  Sheets!!  I don't even wanna think about it!

So this years trip, forgetting all about the HAIR incident, I decide to book us a room here again, being that it is the most reasonably priced decent casino on the main area of the strip.  We check in, I had a non smoking room with a king sized bed reserved, and they tell me they have no king sized beds available, it's only about 6:30pm, how could they possibly be out already?  WHATEVER, we took the room anyway and check out our 2 queen sized beds, so my hubby and I each get our own bed, okay I'm over it now.  I go in the bathroom, no hair on the seat, but the floor is visibly dirty, gotta give it up for their immaculate housecleaning staff again!  2nd year in a row! 

Needless to say, I doubt we'll be returning to stay at the Monte Carlo again!  EVER!

BTW - when you take a shower, you'll pretty much be standing in a pool of your own dirty water, the drains always seem to be clogged and don't drain fast enough.

I've been spoiled by staying at Palazzo, Wynn, and Bellagio on our last few visits to Las Vegas.  On our last trip, however, we planned at the last minute and got the best deal at Monte Carlo ($49 Fri\/Sat, Comped Sun\/Mon).  I really didn't like the fact that they tack on a mandatory $12.95\/day "resort fee."  They say it covers use of the pool, local and 800 phone calls, newspaper, printing your boarding pass, and wired internet.  Really, I think these are things that should be included in their normal rate.  Making this additional fee mandatory just puts a sour taste in my mouth...but apparently this is becoming the norm in Vegas.

The location of the hotel on the strip is convenient, especially since they have a tram that goes to Aria and Bellagio.  Check-in at 5 pm was quick and easy.  The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming.  The room itself was basic.  It is a bit run down, but I am glad that they did away with those old bedspreads.  The brass bathroom fixtures showed the age of the hotel.  There was some painters tape left on the walls.  There was no fridge or mini-bar in the room.  The pillows are super firm!  They were so hard and high that I decided to sleep with no pillow under my head.  The walls are also really thin and you can hear any time people walk down the hall, doors opening\/closing, and conversations in the next room.  My parents were kept awake by loud music and partying going on in the room next to them.

The resort itself was pretty good.  We enjoyed the pool and the lounge at Brand Steakhouse.  The ice bar also looked cool, but we didn't want to pay the ~$30\/person entry fee.

Overall, I'd prefer to stay at Palazzo, but Monte Carlo wasn't bad for the price.  I would consider staying here again if I couldn't get a good deal at one of the luxury hotels.

Decently priced place to stay at on the strip. However, the person who helped us check in could use some brushing up on customer service skills. We got to the hotel at around 11:00 pm, and they had a long line but I don't see this as valid for not being thorough on explaining the charges that were gonna be placed on my credit card, or offer additional help for our stay. 

The rooms were clean enough, and you get two free water bottles a day due to the resort fee you pay. So I'd contemplate staying here again, but it's not my first choice. 

Tip: There's a walkway that leads to Aria if you can follow the signs from the food court, so that was convenient.

P.s. the walls are sorta thin, so we can hear the people next to us going at it.

why does it smell like a sewer?

oh, it's the Monte Carlo

next

Staining around for 20 minutes to check in with two people working the front desk and a bunch other people standing around. Pay a couple bucks more and go to a much better hotel their customer service is horrible

i stayed here two nights and i would defiantly come again. It's not as fancy as the other hotels but we weren't in Vegas to stay in our room! The  standard rooms are reasonably priced and are neat and clean, just like the pictures here on yelp!  The pools were my selling point because i really wanted to get some swimming done.  They have a wave pool, it wasn't on the day I was there but it was cool because i hung out in the river pool, lots of fun! rent a tube if your there.  I didn't plan on eating fast food while i was there but they had a pretty convenient food court for when we got hungry after the pool and didn't want to go back to the room and change. Overall good place to stay right on the strip.

Everyone does Vegas different so I'm going to give my style to gauge if this review is helpful or not! Viva Las Vegas! 
I'm a decent looking blonde thirty something who works hard! So for vacation, I enjoy relaxing by the pool, cold drink in my hand, and good food (I always include wine as a food group).  I don't want the no party zone but also not quite the full party zone! 

The Monte Carlo is about as stale as my party days! I use to love this place but this time the staff wasn't great, the pool was awful, and of course the food and drinks mediocre at best.

This place is less expensive so I'm not expecting Cosmopolitan or Palazzo rates.  We were looking for a mid week cabana or lazy river day bed (they weren't sold out)  and their rates were astronomical! I spoke to both the pool staff and concierge, both said that's just what it is.  I also informed the staff I had rates less expensive at the Cosmopolitan and the Hard Rock! These other two pools are far more well known than the Monte Carlo!  I ended up at Cosmopolitan's Boulevard pool!  I was in some ways glad it happened as it will forever break my cycle of staying at the Monte Carlo.  The Boulevard pool was that perfect party mix.  30-40 something's, classy, sophisticated, yet fun!  Excellent price and great time!  We spent far more than the Monte Carlo was asking in the long run (food and beverage) but, the food and beverage minimum was much less!  The Boulevard was also far more up to date and beautiful! 
 
Most of the bars at the Monte Carlo also offer cocktails at $20 a piece so you may as well stay at a place worthy of a $20 cocktail.   

The room wasn't just old it was also dirty.  The table lamp only worked if you hit the table due to a short in the lamp, the bathtub was always full of standing water while showering. 

The only perk to the Monte Carlo you can experience without wasting the money to stay in their hotel.  Stay some where else but do visit the Pub,  a restaurant inside the hotel!  Amazing staff and great happy hour!  I appreciated the staff so much in this location!  Rebecca, Paul, Tim, and James were the best part of our stay.

I feel like the Vegas hotel industry is similar to a banking industry though, If you aren't a million dollar account, they don't care. Myself and my friends are likely more than an average stay but less than a huge client (obviously). I've planned many trips to  Vegas for other people as most know I'm pretty familiar.   I won't book myself, a bachelorette party, or anyone else I know at the Monte Carlo! 

I don't complain about noise, drunk people,  or other things that are complimentary of being in Vegas.  I will say this hotel in summary, less expensive stay rate and all else is the same or higher than much more desirable hotels.  I love the location but your better opportunities are next door! 

Good Luck and Happy Vegas

(This review was written based on my stay 07\/11\/15 - 07\/15\/15)

The worst hotel I've stayed at.
Rooms are not cleaned well. Bathroom covered in mold, dirty towels on the floor from previous guests.
Rooms do not even have coffee maker or fridge. 

Hotel is nothing compared to hotels nearby. Pool is under construction which we we were not notified of until we actually arrived. 
IMAGINE GOING TO LAS VEGAS IN JUNE and staying at a hotel that does not have a pool. They claim to have partnered with MGM grand to use their room, but didn't even have a shuttle! So had to walk 40 minutes just to get to a pool.

Terrible customer service, rude staff. 
Do not stay here.

This is a great location on the strip. It is affordable and always extremely clean. The rooms could use a little update (bathroom, mainly the shower) but nothing catastrophic. They are currently renovating a few different areas right now. We have stayed here several times (and several other hotels on the strip) and this is one of our favorites for the price. A big bonus staying there is the casino area is not as packed as some of the other hotels tend to get!

Important note: pool season is coming up and while visiting this past week the pool was completely torn up (part of the area they are renovating) and didn't look like it was going to be completed in the coming months. So before booking in the coming months I would definitely check on the status of the new pool.

Horrible stay. The pictures online definitely do not look like where I'm staying this room looks nothing like them. Horrible experience definitely will not book here again even after the do their renovations and I will tell anyone I know not to waste their money here.  Was charged a resort fee pffffff what resort this place is a dump these rooms suck and I have to stay for three days. Seriously thinking of cancelling and just booking elsewhere for the rest of my stay in Vegas!!!!   If you can book elsewhere please do so this place is not worth the stay.  1 star is too much star for here.

This used to be the hotel I would tell people was the best bang for the buck. It was nice but you could get a decent price and it had a decent pool. I hadn't stayed her in quite a few years because I felt it had become run down a bit.  I was excited to hear it was being remodeled but quickly disappointed by the cheap quality of the remodel.   The pool was shut down during my stay so they allowed us to go to MGM or Mandalay Bay to go to the pool.  They are nice substitutions but a bit of a pain.  The worst part is the arena being here.  They really needed to put in pedestrian bridges and fencing to keep people out of the street.  I'm not sure why they didn't but every night when the arena lets out you will spend an hour trying to get back to the hotel.  Don't take an Uber or cab here in the evening.  You will never get in.  I also don't like the fact you have to pay to park now.  First was the high resort fee that they added on that doesn't show on their rates online and now you pay for parking.  It is what it is, so I recommend paying the extra $5 a day for valet. Makes it more worth the money since you can park on other properties.  The one positive note is that the employees here are great.  They always willing to help and I appreciate that.  My final conclusion is that I would not stay here again if nothing else because it is so hard to get in at night and the fact it feels cheap now.  The clientele have also changed.  This has become a more bargain location which is I am guessing what the owners wanted.  If you flew in and don't have a car it isn't bad.  Just have the Uber or cab drop you off at New York New York and walk over.

Decent hotel for the price. The room we got was clean, reminded me of an older mirage room. We stayed mainly for the pool, we wanted to book a daubed with cover but were informed the website is out of date and they no longer have those. So we got a basic day bed for 225. You have to spend that much in food and beverage, however the grill was down and they only had a very limited selection of foods. The pizza was disgusting, the nachos with steak was ok as by the time we got them they were cold-ish, idk how that happens when you're in 110 degree weather but ok. Had to order a ton of drinks to make up the cost since they was hardly any food. The wave pool was nice but they shut it down with no reason after about 3 hours of being open. It didn't reopen the whole time wee were there. So since the wave pool closed, the lazy river and lounge pools became pretty over crowded. For the price, we got what we paid for, wasn't awful but nothing great by any stretch of the imagination

First time staying here. We were put in a room right next to construction. Had no idea there was NO POOL until check in. They want us to travel to go to a pool offsite? It's a holiday weekend and (my birthday) and now I'm really upset. The air seems to work-ish. Room isn't staying cold tho. No fridge. Holes in the furniture and they gave us two beds when there's only two of us. Walls are paper thin I can hear neighboring rooms conversations. Also wasn't told there was a (free) tram to bellagio and we walked. Not having a great time here and feel the price plus a resort fee when there isn't even a pool DURING SUMMER to enjoy. Don't see us coming back anytime soon, if ever.

I checked in here for a cheap one night stay for about $85 with all resort fees\/taxes.  I didn't know what to expect but, you should expect something slightly better than a motel room. Out of the 2 cheapest choices, I like the Excalibur better; however, Monte Carlo is slightly more towards the middle of the strip which is the only pro.

new gripes...

- thanks for knocking on my door at 9am on Christmas morning for house keeping when the DND sign on the door
- 11 AM check out is kind of a pain (in Vegas, heh)
- SBUX does not accept gift cards (so I can get points) because they are not owned by corporate (wtf?)
- to use the spa\/pool in the work out room is $5 (in additional to the $14.50 resort fee you're already pay)
- screw you Deal or No Deal machine ;-)

What was good: The price was okay, not great.  The room was clean.  The beds were fine.

What was bad: The shower was terrible (fixed shower head, too low).  The internet access was terrible.

There's no reason to say much more, as this review will get lost in the hundreds of other reviews.

Monte Carlo, why did you charge me more then you said you were going to? Why did you bring me a roll-away bed when I called to cancel? And why did you charge me two nights for the roll-away bed when I only used you for one? Finally, why did you guys steal my friend's pillow?

The price is decent for a hotel like this. I got everything I requested for online, two queen sized beds and a non-smoking floor, hallelujah. I was the only one out of a group of fourteen that got exactly what she wanted from the hotel she stayed at. Umm... what else? The pool looked kind of small, but I can't justify it's true size because I didn't really get poolside. The lawn chairs looked cushy, though. The interior and exterior are beautiful. Nothing too special about our room, just a room that you stay at on the Strip after a night of drinking and partying with cheating wives and guys tha look like they are from "That's 70's Show".

Used to stay here often. Was always very happy. But the service has really gone downhill. 

I stayed here last year and had some problems with the pool staff, but not a big deal. I filled out their survey and asked to be contacted. Never was contacted.

Decided to give them another chance. Booked a trip with my wife for valentines day. Requested a king bed. Upon check in, we were told none were available. Said they would contact me the next morning to switch rooms. 4pm comes the next day and still no call. I check with the front desk. They said again none available. I said I would pay for an upgrade or willing to switch hotels. Again they said they would contact me. Still no call. Stayed all weekend with small bed and no call. Again not that big of a deal, but enough to be annoyed. 

Upon coming home, I got another survey. Again I filled it out and asked to be contacted. Over one week later and still no contact. Why ask to be contacted and send surveys if they won't read them? Maybe they will read this yelp review. Last time I stay or gamble at Monte Carlo.

Came here with my best friends for a ladies weekend!  This hotel wasn't the fanciest hotel I've ever stayed at on the strip. But for the money ($240 for 3 nights in a high floor room) it was was what I would expect. The beds and pillows were clean and comfy. The shower worked. It was a basic run of the mill shower. The only thing I wish they had was a little fridge. But it's ok. We stopped the sink and filled it with ice as a make shift cooler. I didn't mind it. Honestly, if you are looking for a great location on a budget this place is fine. I liked the pool just fine. The wave pool was my favorite. I also liked the food court. The check in \/ check out process was painless (granted we did check out at 4:30am....) any questions I had about my bill they helped me figure out and the staff was great. I would have given 5 stars except the room was just ok. The shower was just ok. The room keeping lady seemed fine. The lady came to our room and asked if we needed service. We said no and she went away. As soon as we left (all but 1 of the girls left) she came back into the room. We thought that was odd. And thank god a girl stayed behind to nap other wise we wouldn't have known she came back into the room. Why would she come back immediately after we left? after we said the room was fine? I don't know. But other than that strange happening everything was fine. No secret charges. Nothing.

I like the laid back atmosphere of the Monte Carlo. It isn't too flashy, just right. It is home to the Ignite lounge, Diablos, Yusho and just outside is one of my favorite pizza stops, 800 degrees.

The gambling is okay, drink ladies are pretty scarce. Just sayin'!

I've stayed at Monte Carlo on the last 2 visits I've made to Vegas. This a a NO FRILLS hotel. Great location adjacent from MGM and across from Hard Rock. 

Pros
Pool Scene - pool scene is nice, definitely not as glamorous as most on strip but ok. Like the sand volleyball, music and games.

Room Rates - great even on event weekends.

Cons
Rooms - a little dated. You will not find super fancy decor and walls are then. But then again Vegas IS built for no sleep and you will hopefully not spend a lot of time in your room.

My fianc and I stayed August 18th till August 20th and our stay was fabulous! 
The check in like was awhile. I would say approximately 30 min wait. Until I realize there was a self check in (so maybe my mistake) but the check in desk girl was awesome gave me wonderful and friendly service. I addressed my concern about al the rumors I heard about construction noises and crickets etc she said ok we will move your room too the 31 floor. Which was perfect because we didn't hear anything ! 
We didn't get to use the pools because we didn't have anytime. But since the pools was down I don't think being charged $100 resort fee was necessary. I understand the casinos and restaurants etc. so maybe that's what the $100 would go too. 
Overall we had a wonderful stay. The concierge desk was amazing and very friendly also. 
I plan on staying on Monte Carlo again :)

Oh, Vegas. Why must you torture me so? Every time I swear I will never drunkenly stomp down the strip again, it seems as though, with a click of my heels, I'm magically home again.

This past summer, I decided to venture out on a journey to an oasis in the middle of the desert, called "Vegas" to some, but known as "Sin City" to many. My roommate and I decided we should try something new for a change, since whenever I am in Vegas, I am seen stumbling around Excalibur, trying to find my room but having no recollection whatsoever wherever it is. I am geographically challenged. So, we decide to stay at Monte Carlo. It looks pleasant enough on the website, and a five hour journey later (give or take an hour), the interior looked impressive.

While waiting in line impatiently, we were slightly spooked because the lady in front of us was rambling about how dirty her room was, and how she filed several complaints about it. She proceeded to fill us in on all the gory details, and I was slightly perturbed. Had we made a mistake? I was tired, and anxious to be in the comfort of my room. Finally, after what seemed like an eternity, we were at the front of the line, checking in. I was slightly annoyed, because they were under staffed, and there was no distinct formation...it was all haphazard, to say the very least.

But I was happy on one note. There was a bell hop, and he was happy to serve us. We were also in no mood to find parking, so we went through valet. They were nice guys, so score for that. Anyway, on to the room. When we got to our room, I was content. I immediately flopped on to the bed, and noticed how soft it was. It would do for later on, when I would more than likely be buzzed, and even a cold, hard bathtub would do for a sleeping arrangement. The bathroom was quaint, but the lighting did not flatter, but I was okay with that. There also was a floor length mirror right in front of my bed, and while it wasn't the most flattering...I felt like it added ten pounds...(or was it my endless drinking that caused that?)...it was convenient for when I wanted to straighten my hair.

The first night, a friend joined us from Mandalay Bay, and we were determined to go out, but we were side tracked by a bar. Funnily enough, we never did go to the club we were originally thinking of going to, but spent our night away, getting intoxicated. The bartenders were a blast, and we did not feel sleepy until eight in the morning, when both of their shifts ended. I believe that place was called Ignite Lounge, and while my other friends went out, I was quite content staying within the safety of my casino for the night. It was a ritual throughout the trip, and amazingly enough, I met a couple of regulars that were staying at the Monte Carlo, as well. It transformed in to a kind of "Cheers" joint. I also met another fabulous bartender at Hit Lounge, and he entertained me for a couple of hours, talking about Las Vegas shenanigans, and actually told me to come on through later on if I wasn't going out, so we could throw back a couple of shots together. He was an older guy, but boy, he was so fun and relaxed! I suppose this is why I love casino bars. Since I'm from Arizona, and I frequent Scottsdale, I am accustomed to the snooty clientele that the nightlife attracts. I loved the chill factor here.

And lastly, the food. Well, I went to the standard food court. We were supposed to all go to a buffet, but that plan was a bust. It definitely was an improvement to my eating fiasco at Excalibur. My whole diet consisted of a six inch sub from Subway, and that was my ambrosia for my duration of the trip.

Would I come back and stay here? Abso-frockin'-lutely. I would stay here, JUST for the bartenders at Ignite lounge. Cool, cool dudes. We were even supposed to go to a strip club with them, but that will hopefully be another story for next time. Damn you, Vegas! 

PS: And may I add, I guess I had a pleasant stay because of the company I kept here. Remember, it's not the places you go to that counts...it's the people that can make or break an experience.

New renovated\/upgraded rooms are AMAZING. Every classy and sleek looking. Love this hotel although it is under renovation it's still very good pricing. I love staying here because you can walk out and you're right on the strip. Diablos cantina is also one of my favorites. Parking is $15 a night not included when you book. Love the new look!

For the price it is an excellent hotel.

When it comes down to it, in Vegas the restaurants, casinos, etc are not particularly important in the hotel you are staying at because you can walk for 5 minutes to go next door.  In those terms this hotel is one the best hotels in Vegas because it is cheapish while being perfectly located to quickly get you to the Bellagio, Aria and other much more expensive hotels with better food and casino options. BUT this place also comes with an above average pool that other similarly priced hotels lack. 

It also has a food court with very cheap food options that a lot of other hotels lack.  I will walk a mile to eat at a nice restaurant but it is pretty hard to walk that far for a McDonalds... having the option for some cheap eats helps your wallet while also allowing you not have to spend 1hr+ at every meal.

We would stay here again but next time will probably spring for a hotel a level up (and no kids).
There was no water at 2am after we came up from casino. At 930am there's loud construction going on the floor above us. This place is trash.

Went on vacation to get away, that's what normally happens right? Something went wrong everyday of our stay here from little things such as not receiving a do not disturb sign which we called for, to the male maid walking in while my friend was in the flesh. Wouldn't have happened if we had the sign, I'm sure..or Maybe it would've who knows, it's Vegas. They did their best to accommodate the situation which was a nice gesture until check out when they said the things purchased didn't fall into the category of the credit we received and we should have seen it on the card with the listed places we can use it on. Ohhhhhhh what?! A card? One that we didn't receive from the Assistant Manager of the hotel? Splendid. I won't be staying here again, I'm sure but if i do I hope I get to enjoy it.

I hate this hotel money was stolen from my room and my friends money. Also we had other friends staying in the same hotel and there money got stolen too. There security was bad, they made us fill out a report and told us to call them Monday. Haven't received  a call back since and I left messages. The staff didn't  care and they didn't offer us anything or apologized. Never again am I staying in Monte Carlo!

Nice place but would be nice if their bathrooms were  a little more updated. Close to some of the big hotels on the strip like Aria, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, MGM, etc. Check in was short. Had a strip view room (decent size and clean) but the view is mostly blocked out by the newer hotels. Nice that you get some complimentary water too. Hotel has a number of decent restaurants mid-range or can go the "cheap" way and go to their food court instead.

Enjoyed our stay here. Rooms are pretty standard. Nothing fancy, but nothing horrible either. My sister in laws room was pretty dirty upon arrival, but ours was fine.
