Worst part was no wifi above the second floor!!! They have an Ethernet cord but that didn't help with our iPhones and iPads! Pool was nice. The area right by entrance was fully shaded in the morning which was perfect for letting my infant swim for a short time. Wave pool and lazy river were nice also. The food court is convenient. The buffet was horrible!!  Friendly staff. I would stay here again if I wanted something not too expensive.

To stay at all the Vegas hotels and experience them would require a concerted effort with  a lot of vacation time mixed in. Or have the luxury of being a local!

Monte Carlo is positioned well on the strip next to city center and the T-Mobile arena. A Mono Rail connects the hotel to the Bellagio saving you a lot  of walking time for no cost if you choose to use it. 

Room cost is modest for Las Vegas. The parking garage will cost $8 every 1-4 hours with valet getting you for $10. The parking garage sports overhead lights to inform the driver of an available space. (Incredibly helpful option)

The hotel and casino are a good blend of clean, fun and affordable, offering a pool and Spa in good lad Vegas hotel fashion even sporting a wave pool!

The upgraded room offered for a modest price increase sported a better city view. Worth it unless staring at A\/C roof units is your thing. 

Cleanliness and a handful of restaurants with its great location make it a great  stay house for a vacation.
Checking in took over 35 mins waiting in line.  I'm thinking of choosing another place next time or join special programs to avoid this craziness.

Thank you Monte Carlo for the best weekend ever! I really can't complain since I was only there to sleep and get ready!

 The hotel is a bit out dated compared to the newer more modern hotels on the strip.  The rooms itself are decent size, nothing to fancy about them, small desk, ok tv, bathroom was a bit spacious and beddings were a bit old. A good thing about the hotel is the food court, that is open 24 hrs and all the other resturants that are located downstairs. It gave us peace of mind that we did not have to walk for to grab something to eat. 

Room service was great. We called in for an extra cot ( which was very comfortable, twin size and fit perfectly in the room), small fridge and sewing kits. They were pretty good and speedy about bringing these items to the room.The pool is amazing! They have a reg pool to kick back in, a wave pool, and a lazy river!! The lazy river is the best, just rent or buy a tube and your set for a relaxing ride!

Location wise the Monte Carlo is a bit far from the middle of the strip. However it was easy to get to the strip because of tram that took us to the Bellagio. A good penny saver since cab rides do get costly!

Not the most luxurious of hotels on the strip but it is centrally located, and the prices are reasonable. We booked early and paid $88\/night, minus the stupid resort fee, which is a huge ripoff.

The rooms are standard issue, but it's true that the walls are thin and it's easy to hear everything. Especially the plumbing - showers and flushing toilets are LOUD. We also had the unfortunate experience of having the alarm clock in the next room go off each night at midnight. And of course there is no one in that room, so we had to call Housekeeping to turn it off, which took over 30 minutes each time. Ugh. 

We stayed on the 3rd floor this time, which gave us a hideous view of the roof with all the trash, dead birds and vacuum cleaners on it. On the plus side, we were towards the center of the building and actually got wifi in the room! That made our son happy, since there isn't supposed to be wifi in the rooms, and iPods don't work with ethernet cables. Not fast connection though.

Pools are nice, but crowded and not a lot of shade for those who can't be in the sun all the time. Chairs fill up fast, so go down early and stake out a spot. Don't bother with the inner tube rental in the lazy river - eventually, one will free up and you can use it without paying the $5.

The experience has been less than enjoyable thus far, and I should have continued my stay at the Rio.  Arrived early to check-in but of course they wanted an additional $20 to check-in early, before 3pm (the Rio just let us on through, no concerns to nickel and dime me).  We checked our bags to go walk around, and we're supposed to get a text when our room was ready.  We never got the text and it was kow 3:30 and I had to go to the Concierge, and they just gave access to the room immediately.

I paid for a 1 king bed, got a 2 queen room with a joint door between.  (Romantic for me and the wife? Nope) Shower is less than impressive and outdated as all can be.  No mini fridge, nothing for the $250 price tag.  Ice in the trash can I guess to have cold drinks.

My advice: stay at the Rio and pay a $8 uber ride to the strip if that's what u desire.  However there is a CVS just outside, so save the money any buy booze there!

Another trip to Vegas and tried out another strip hotel casino. This one really has nothing special to offer that differs from the rest. Rooms could use a little updating. The pool was nice with a lazy river, which I always find to be a bonus. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Can't say I would like to come back for sure. But I bet I will come back just for gambling.

2.5 Stars

I would consider Monte Carlo to be a mid-level Vegas hotel. It's not fancy & nice like the Wynn or Cosmo, where you want all your friends to know that you're staying there. However it does not belong with the Excalibur and Circus Circus class either, where you DON'T want people to come hang out in your hotel room. 

I've stayed at the Monte Carlo a few times now, the most recent being in September. We booked a block of rooms. It was great that they let us check in early (without having to pay a fee like Planet Hollywood) and managed to keep all the rooms on the same floor. 

The room itself definitely needs a face lift. (Hopefully they will get around to it after they have completely the exterior renovations.) You can see the age in the furniture. We stayed in both the Diamond Suite and also the normal Deluxe room. The Deluxe room is your typical hotel room, no frills. The Diamond Suite was of course bigger. Loved the 2 people jacuzzi in the bathroom. The tub literally had 2 spots wide enough for 2 people to be side by side of one another. (Which is great since the typical jacuzzi is much smaller and you can't lay down.) The bedroom is separated from the rest of the suite. The living area had its own separate restroom, along with everything you would expect in a typical living room. There is also a wet bar that came with a mini fridge (not stocked) and a sink.

Nearly all of the hotels on the Strip has imposed the daily resort fee and the Monte Carlo is no different. Internet is included in the cost however the fact that the rooms do not have WiFi makes me not too thrill with having to pay for something that I can not use (there is a hardline that you can use for internet but my iPad and my phone sure as hell don't have those ports!). Aside from the "internet",  you get 2 (small) bottles of water and Keurig coffee. 

One thing I do like about the Monte Carlo: LOCATION. It's almost to the center of the Strip and if you forget anything, there is a CVS right next door (food, drinks, souvenir, etc.)

Would I stay here again? Sure, why not. It has the potential to be a great hotel. Hope the remodeling will make it so that it will be a place where I would WANT to book instead of being a backup hotel.

OK, stayed again the week before Thanksgiving. Things were better this time. Sure, the rooms are still pretty shabby, and the internet abysmal. But on this trip the casino drinks were really flowing! Did they read my last review? Haha. 

Really, I intended to stay there on my free nights and just walk to Aria to do my gambling, but the frequent drinks kept my ass in their seats! Also, I had a work emergency and a document I had to sign and return to work that day. I could not get on the internet at all in the room, and the business center does not allow email access. But the young gent who has worked there a good while (Miko? I've sent postcards through him there in the past) was very helpful. My boss emailed him the doc, he printed it, I signed it, and he scanned and emailed it back for me. Easy peasy and was done in 10 minutes! They really saved my ass on that one. At 2 in the afternoon I already had a 4 drink buzz, so it was nice to git 'er done and get back to the gambling and drinking. 

The only reason I won't give 4 stars this time is the internet access. I always have trouble there getting online, and I never have a prob at Luxor and other casino rooms. Plus in the past when I do get online they heavily censor it (in Vegas? C'mon. Probably frat boys banging hookers next door).

SO happy I chose this hotel for my stay in Sin City! Right smack dab in the middle of the strip with so many things around to do and see! The hotel is a little older but nothing that will alter your stay! Beautiful chandelier lobby's, spacious rooms, and one of my favorite casino layouts on the strip! a down side would be that they need to install a better air ventilation system in the casino area, you walk away smelling smoky and light headed.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good time and not trying to break the bank! The room wasn't in brand new condition but I thought it was comfy and nice for the price paid. Room service was awesome!! We slept in one day and missed their services but when we left the room and took the "do not disturb" sign off of the door we arrived back to a perfectly clean and tucked room! I never expected them to come back once they had already passed! Bravo in my book because what a perk to be able to sleep in and still get your room cleaned! The staff was very helpful and friendly, and we even rented a car for about $150 (for one day), which is way cheaper than getting a taxi for travel. We stayed on floor 12, which I think the higher floors are newer? I'm not sure but that is how the elevator lobby looked for the higher levels. It was too cold for the pool to be open during my visit but the area looked very nice! Very convenient shops and food places available right on the lobby floor, and if you aren't interested in those choices there are plenty of choice right across the street! Although it is a far and long walk down the strip to get to the more fancy choices like the Venetian and Caesars Palace, it is a short walk to the luxury stores of Louis Vuitton and Prada. THANK YOU MONTE CARLO FOR THE GREAT EXPERIENCE, MY 21st BIRTHDAY WAS WELL SPENT! I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!!! :)

Like many other reviewers said, this is basically an economy motel in the guise of a nice hotel.  The water came out so quickly in the shower that it couldn't drain fast enough and crawled up to ankle level. And there is no control to reduce the water pressure. Brilliant! Especially in these times of water shortages. I actually had them switch rooms because I thought my shower was busted, but the second room was no different and I see that other people here had the same issue.  No premium channels on TV. Like 15 bucks for internet service in the room and no wireless, just plug in with a tiny cord that can't even reach to the bed.  Their business center charged 8 bucks for 15 minutes of internet use!  And the customer service was beyond horrible. Everyone acted like they didn't want me to be there. You'd ask someone behind a desk a question and they'd just ignore you, as if pretending you weren't there.  Maybe an okay place to gamble at, but certainly not worth staying there. I've legitimately had better service at random cheap motels.  The only reason I'm not giving one star is because the room was clean.

My Man and I came here on my big 2-1st!!!

We had a suite and the Bellagio, but decided to play here since his friends had a room here. 

Not to Brag but for my big birthday celebration He brought 10g's with him and we went from new card hold members to BLACK CARD members in less than 24 hours.

I Had the BEST TIME!!!! 

I felt lucky and walked into the high limit slots area, I inserted $80.00 in a $10 machine- max was $20 a hand and on my second hit I won 668.00!!!

and that Wheel Of Fortune slot... I was glued to that for days!!!! 
While my man played tables, it was my time alone to play!!!!!
I hit $1,200 twice in the same day! 

Rick Kolosawksi, I know I butchered his last name, but he is a big part of the reason why we continue to visit this casino\/resort. 
He was VERY accommodating.. well of course cause we drop stacks! BUT he is always friendly, gives off a great vibe, always making sure we are taken care of, and very personable. 

The suites were not that extravagant compared to Bellagio. 

But it is Monte Carlo after all.

We also came here for the Halloween $25,000 slot tournament which was a wonderful experience, but the tournament was rigged because the more you spent before and during the tournament, the MORE time your permitted.

I've gained so many great memories here! 

Customer service: 5 stars 
Decor\/look of Hotel: 3 stars
Slots: 3.5 stars
Tables: 3 stars

Hotel\/Room: very nice and reasonable rates, pretty modern

Casino: I like the feel of it, not bougy like Bellagio or Wynn. Very. Homely feel, hard to find $5 craps

Restaurants: pretty good for anything on the strip, but without comps don't go to the Asian restaurant, Italian is good

Stayed here for my birthday, loved it! I do not recommend their birthday deal though, those drink coupons aren't worth it.
I love the pools! There's a lazy river, a pool with a wave machine and a DJ, and a regular quiet pool. I wish people didn't bring infants \/ toddlers in the Wave machine pool...
The resort is beautiful! The room was nice too!

Recently visited to watch the BlueMan group, I loved it! It's such an engaging and funny show! No bad seat in the house!
People were friendly and the employees were helpful.

Rooms were pretty old and dated stayed on the 7th floor and the carpet in some spots was coming up. The casino is getting taken over by machines. Drinks are expensive and food at least at the buffet was not that great. The best part of the hotel was the outside lounge area along the strip.

They charged 20 usd for each, already we paid whole amount to expedia.
So we did not understand, they said it is just deposit but we understood that it is not. Cheating Monte Carlo, also they did not give the exact room which we reserved, the view was also bad, we were looking at construction area. Thanks for this terrible weekend!

This place absolutely sucks.  First off, I had to wait over two hours for my room keys despite the fact I pre-checked in on my phone 6 hours prior.  They gave me a handicapped accessible hotel room which i didn't want or need.  I discovered black mold in the bathtub and asked to be upgraded to a new room.  The front staff refused... I had to really push just to get moved to a new (non-upgrade) room.  They finally budged but I think they purposely gave me an even worse room out of spite.  This new room was on the 30th floor and was the furthest possible from the elevator.  The worst part was that the air conditioner was broken.  Called the front desk to get it fixed by a technician and they never came.  I literally slept with no clothes or blankets\/sheets and still was sweating like a pig.  Such a horrible experience.  Do not stay here.. if you do, avoid room 30-136!

This place is fast becoming a total trough of a hotel.

Rooms are haggard and falling apart.  The shower head sprayed everywhere except where it was supposed to.  The rooms are dated the carpet filthy and the bedspread scary.

Service is poor and the televisions broadcasts are fuzzy.

The Casino however is a different story.  It's one of my favorites and they recently updated the Sports Book making it my favorite in town.  Black jack is most fun on the east end near the strip!  You'll see what I'm talking about =]

Great restaurants also.  The food court can become jammed but has a wide variety of selections (McDonalds, Italian, Subway, Chinese).  Also, one of the best steak restaurants in Vegas is located here... The Brand Steakhouse.  GREAT!

Attached to the hotel, near the strip is Diablo's Cantina.  A great place for Mexican.  Try the fish tacos!!

Gamble here but sleep somewhere else.

Check your credit card!
I booked through priceline for a total of $99
When I got home, I had a resort fee of $22 and some random charge of $79.
I had to call their accounts payable department to get the $79 refunded. 
I asked to have the resort fee refunded as well but was told to talk to the front desk supervisor. 
i spoke with a woman that was not the supervisor and she wouldn't transfer me. 
I explained that the two amex charges I was charged equaled teh two charges they charged me. 
She explained in different words teh same thing - they can't refund a resort fee. 
She then explained that the $79 wasn't an additional room charge but rather an error. 
She didn't indicate what the error was. 
Really, they just randomly charge extra charges and hope you catch it?
I wonder how many other people out there got charged extra and didn't catch it. 
Trust level with this hotel = 0

Honestly for the price you pay its well worth it. This place is pretty affordable and the rooms are cozy and clean... Bed was comfy but their pillows sucked!! My only complaint is right when you leave the tram and walk through from aria to Monte Carlo there's about half of a mile of walking and it smells like there is a pile of shit lurking right behind you and following you... Every Time I passed by there I wanted to vomit! It's horrendous! You can even smell this rotten spice of air refresher they tried to use to mask the smell of shit but it made it smell like shit spice. Please DO NOT pass there! This should be a health hazard period... If someone pooped there it should be found and removed IMMEDIATELY!

i was staying there last summer. got a really good deal on the room cost, the quality of the room and service had nothing less than a high end resort; it was just much cheaper. it was like most of the areas including the casino and rooms were recently remodeled. it was walking distance to Aria, so basically you don't even have to go outside, you can walk through the casino and go to Aria to hang out if you prefer a higher end atmosphere. I also got a good resort credit that I used. overall, it was a happy stay for a much cheaper cost.

Yeah it's swanky but the Monte Carlo gave me that eh feeling. It really doesn't seem to offer much or at least anymore then some of the lesser hotels. The rooms were nice but the bed\/pillows were too hard. I will give credit to the service it was excellent and they are smart enough to have staff on hand during the day to take care of people. With only one show going on now and it being a magic show you're better off somewhere else. 

Maybe it's because I lost money here that I'm not so thrilled but really it was kind of boring. 

Brand Steakhouse -located inside the Monte Carlo 
We only had drinks and it's pretty much just because we couldn't find anywhere better to have a night cap. It was expensive and the service was very slow and kind of rude to some people.

Nice clean spacious rooms. The bathroom was especially large. Great view from my 31st floor window. 

The bedding was comfortable and soft. The beds were not soft or firm. Just right. 

The location is what this hotel is really about. It's in the middle of everything. I'll be back.

What a headache! We booked 11 rooms for wedding guests and everyday over the week the room keys stopped working. 

The last thing a wedding needs is to deals with guests being locked out of their rooms at unexpected times throughout the day. In addition to dealing with long lines at the front desk numerous occasions to resolve the problem each time.

Completely unacceptable! We will not be returning ever again and will inform all our international travel affiliates to stay away.

I've stayed at several hotels on the strip and this hotel isn't a great value.  Paid $130\/night for the deluxe guestroom on the 15th floor which is not the cheapest price I saw compared to other hotels but I thought it was going to be a better quality hotel so I booked it.  I was wrong.  There is NO WIFI and we could hardly get any service on our phones in the room which made things very difficult as we were trying to research shows and restaurants to go to.  There is an ethernet cable that you can hook to your laptop which is an amenity included in your resort fee.  Wish I would have known that but I have never stayed in a hotel that doesn't offer free wifi so I didn't even think about it.  The hotel room was pretty dated.  I was kind of disappointed walking into the room after looking at the photos posted on travelocity's website.  At any time of day the check-in line was lengthy, even on Monday as we were checking out, the check-in line was just as long as it was on Saturday.  Some people were getting frustrated because they had 2 people working the check-ins.

Pros:

Location:  Not quite at the end of the strip.  I've stayed at the luxor which is at the very very end of the strip so it was nice not to have to walk as far.
Tram:  There is a tram that takes you to the Bellagio.  And it's FREE!  Just ask the staff about it or look for the signs.  There is also one across the street at the MGM.
Blue Man Group:  Affordable show to see and also convenient since it's located in the hotel.  We bought our tix from the "Tix4tonight" booth across the street for $68 each. 
*Tip for seeing shows:  Check living social or groupon for deals... saw some awesome deals on there after purchasing our blue man group tix.

Cons:
No Wifi
No Mini-Fridge
No dvd-player
Average looking lobby
No food or drinks allowed in pool (probably the same at all hotel pools) which means you have to wait in the huge line to order drinks
Smells like sewage outside

Will not be staying here again unless there is an Awesome deal going on.

Not a hotel I would return to. I went into several different hotels while on my stay here and Monte Carlo was by far the worst smoke smell hotel here. I got a cold from it. And it was outdated.  I knew about the renovation about the pool ahead of time but it took forever to get to the MGMs but it was much nicer over there. Kinda wish to have booked reservation at that hotel instead.

Just finished a three day stay at the monte carlo and boy was it rough. The room did not smell fresh. There was so much mold in the tub my daughter wore flip flops to shower. The smoke alarm started beeping at 8 am. There is no in room coffee, so you have to wait in a 10 minute starbucks line. The pool situation is a situation.  Your choices are drive to Mandalay bay ( which is a nice pool) or walk 30 min to mgm. They will tell you mgm is 10 min walk. That's a damn lie. If you like being in water that has cigarette and beer bottle trash floating by all the while listening to expletive laden rap music while watching drunk guys wrestle in the pool - the mgm is for you! The maids and the valets and bell men were the best part of monte carlo. Seriously.  So helpful and kind. Nice people. The hotel should have offered a pool shuttle for hotel guests wanting the pool. But they just don't give a shit about the pool. It's only gambling they care about. But not everyone in our party in into that. The pool is important for those on holiday.  Never again.
I was only there for the show. Already, they have good customer service including valet parking. I will try and stay there next time. It looks like they have lots of eateries to choose.
What a dump!!!  Smells like a smoking room, lamp doesn't work, mildew in the shower. The one star is for the shampoo.

The room was dirty with trash left behind, the shower leaked badly and the shower head had bad calcium build up, the remote for the TV didn't work, there was no refrigerator in the room, no pool due to construction, the resort fee and the security deposit was $300 and not even crappy coupons for the buffet were included. I stayed the night before at treasure island and should have just stayed there.

I like the casino in Monte Carlo. I used to avoid it because of the air freshener they used to use. They no longer use it, and the casino itself is much more pleasant. They have tables for poker, blackjack, roulette, and craps. Their high roller area is very nice and well attended. They have tons of different slots at varying dollar amounts. It is a little difficult to find a cocktail server, but overall, it's a decent casino.

Very rude personnel, even the manager. This was the first time in Monte Carlo, won't come back. They gave up 2 quin beds,we requested a king,they charged us extra 30 dollars for a suit and the suit looks horrible!

Noisy hotel.  My room was next to the service area and the noise was from the staff was horrendous through the thin walls.  I called the manager and she just apologized and said she would talk to the staff but nothing changed the following nights.  Most likely the last time I will stay here because I actually like to sleep in hotels I stay in and this one did not cut it.

This is a great hotel in terms of location and price. We went when they were having a sale on hotel rooms and spent about $60 a night for a high-floor deluxe room. 

The hotel isn't one of the best on the strip and the food can use an improvement. They just added a new bar when we were leaving so maybe they might start updating the rooms and food area as well.

I would definitely stay here if you needed a reasonably priced room located in the middleo f the strip.

This place is bullshit with there stupid ass staff they charged me 4x and said my card didn't go threw when I have bank statements. Rude ass bitches thinking she was funny. I will never come back here I said I wanted my money back because I wasn't happy with there service and they still kept my money haha bitchesssss

I don't think whoever built this place used insulation in the walls, I can hear every word (even though I can't understand it) the Asian family next door is saying, we also got 2 free passes for the buffet, the only thing I can compare it to is OCB, avoid anything deep fried it's way overcooked. The toilets have a super flusher on them, I was 3 feet away and feared I would get sucked in, good god man!

After  5 hour flight, then 50 mins to check in at 9pm. Come on guys! Pay a little extra and get the customer experience spinning from the beginning. Dont come here if u feel like you will be tired after your flight
Just terrible!  Dealers are all right, but pit bosses are like high school rejects on a domination regime.  This place is just not worth being at!

Pros

Affordable!
Love there shower head! 
Love the pool area! 
Tram to take to Aria, City Center, n Bellagio. 

Cons- this hotel is a little outdated but so are a lot of the hotels on the strip.

Buffet- skip it. Depending on which sites u book your rooms they usually offers two free buffets but u can eat at any sister hotel. Aria is the best out of all of them! 

Would I stay here again?! Yes!

Stayed here for one night recently and it is nothing special. The men's room at the pool had a nauseating stench pouring out of it, the air conditioner in my room didn't work, it took over 40 minutes to check in, the customer service was really lacking, the pillows were the quality of a Motel 6. It is cheap and pretty centrally located, but I would rather spend a little more to have better amenities and services. Also was extremely bothered by the lack of security at the elevators. Won't be back.

I think I had too many expectations. It was a very average hotel. I think for the same price, I would have rather stayed at one of the more elaborately themed hotels. Quick check in and average room. The iHome is convenient for phone charging. The view from the room was horrible (the roof of the parking garage?! yuck). Old windows, the tinted tape was peeling off. Carpet stains and no fridge in the room (I guess that needed to be requested). There was a regular pool, lazy river, wave pool and sand volleyball. The wave pool was too calm and the lazy river as well. The water was extremely dirty and there was trash everywhere. By 5 pm, there was barely any sun in the area as the Mandarin Oriental and Aria blocked the afternoon light. It got cold really quickly. There was a house dj at the pool that made things more exciting. Tube rentals are $10, but there's no room to float. Back inside, there were bouncers pushing the lounge with open bar for ladies. The casino wasn't too packed, not even the Below 5* bar. The shopping area was dull, too. Housekeeping was nice about attending to our requests (such as more towels or coffee). The staff in general was friendly and we didn't have any hiccups. We were misinformed about the airport shuttle service, which was slightly frustrating. They should at least write the fees on the reservation website if they don't mention it on the phone\/during check out. The hotels fees for four drinks was more than the beers themselves, which was ridiculous. This place should NOT be called a resort. It was very small and very disappointing with its amenities and services. Overall it is not a place to return to. Especially for a first time Vegas experience, not someplace I'd go to.
Mediocre at best; reasonable rate, but a bit tired and worn. Room was fair, but the premium for a "high floor" room was a waste. Look around, you can likely find better deals.

The Monte Carlo is a fairly priced, solid hotel. I generally go to Vegas to lay by the pool and relax. I have stayed there many times, and I feel that I get a good value for my money. Rooms are clean, there are a lot of reasonably priced "standard' food choices in their Food Court (i.e. Starbucks, Subway, McD's, mexican food, chinese food), as well as other restaurant choices. It is also a centrally-located hotel, which makes it good if you like to explore without walking for miles at a time. The other thing that's handy is a CVS store right at the front corner of the property, in case you forgot to bring anything, or if you want cheap snacks\/bottled water. 

My favorite part is the pool, though, which is why I usually choose the Monte Carlo. 
It is a good-sized area, but isn't overwhelmingly huge. It has a lazy river and a wave pool, plenty of chairs at almost any time of day (whether you want shade or no shade), and then a regular pool and hot tub. The customer service is very strong, too! I always rent a cabana or a daybed when I stay there, and the servers are very friendly, helpful and professional. 

I've only had one issue during the many times I've stayed there, and that was due to a drunk guest at the pool who was getting all up in my business. He threatened me and the Pool Manager was very helpful. He took care of the situation quickly and effectively, and was aplogogetic, even though it wasn't the hotel's fault. 

Depending on what you're objectives are for going to Vegas, Monte Carlo might be a good fit for you. When you think about what you get for the money, it's a great choice!

My family meets up for spring break every year in vegas! The Monte Carlo has become our favorite out of most resorts! However my last trip, I was truly disappointed...not only did they not have a pool because it's under construction...(FOR THE SUMMER)...but they continue to charge you a resort fee even without a pool. What's sad is they actually raised the resort fee and didn't think about lowering...I get it we have to walk a mile or two....in our bathing suit over to MGM or Mandalay Bay. However it's a resort and I'm on spring break. I really enjoy waking up every day on spring break going straight from my room to the pool and then being able to walk straight back up to my room to change and get ready for the night. If I didn't spend 50% of my time at the pool I wouldn't have rated the Monte Carlo so low. Also I'm not a big fan of the name change happening to Monte Carlo, I understand MGM owns about 70% of the strip but I like the historic names of Monte Carlo, New York, New York, Excalibur...etc so on.

My fianc and I stayed there this past weekend and we were very impressed. The room was very big (even though we didn't really need that big of a room). This was our first experience staying at the Monte Carlo, so I had no idea what to expect. Upon our arrival we checked in and the girl at the front desk was very nice to us. Keep in mind this was Memorial Day weekend, I'm sure she was tired and had dealt with so many crazy people. Her name was Leilani. She even gave us a room with a view on the 30th floor which was really nice!!! Thanks Leilani!!!!

We only stayed there one night and had a really good experience. We are planning on going back to Las Vegas very soon and will def consider booking a room here again. Thanks again Monte Carlo for making our stay a great one!!!!!

So wish I had seen the reviews on Yelp, rather than just Expedia.  We were so disappointed by the Monte Carlo.  We had mold in the bathtub and I called to let housekeeping know.  The answer was they could re-caulk, but we wouldn't be able to use it for a couple of days.  No offer of a different room, just we wouldn't be able to shower.  Needless to say, we turned that offer down.  We had just one washcloth and one soap in the room.  We called regarding that issue and they brought a huge bag of towels and toiletries to us.  Odd, but nice be able to pull out what we needed.   No coffee maker in the room and that was a bummer.

We headed out to take the free shuttle to Mandalay Bay to be able to use the pool since theirs was under construction.  We don't push and shove others to be first and held back.  We stood in the back of the shuttle and were informed they couldn't let anyone stand and we had to exit the bus and wait an hour for the next bus.  Wow.  An hour.  We'd already been waiting 15 minutes for the bus to arrive.  If it had been there earlier, people could have boarded as they arrived and we would easily have had a space.  So frustrating.

We did like the tram that could take us to the Bellagio.  That really helped with all the walking so much!  The resort fee should absolutely NOT be charged.  Maybe when construction is done it would be appropriate, but right now, this is just a substandard hotel room with no resort amenities.  We won't be staying here again.

Booked for this week through Hotels.com. I was never informed of the pool being under construction. I also was not informed that this hotel has bed bugs aside from the random reviews here on Yelp. Quickly called Hotels.com to cancel and Monte Carlo stated no cancellation. I guess they want people getting eaten up by bed bugs. Not acceptable at all!  I refuse to sleep there. Waiting on hotels.com to resolve this issue with either a refund or another hotel room.

Bargain spot on the far side of the strip, just next to New York New York.  The rooms are bland but clean.  Lobby is separate from the casino, so you can actually walk to your room without passing through a bank of slot machines.  Thought it was less smoky than compable hotels.

If you bring a car, then should go ahead and use the valet...cause its a long walk across hot concrete from the hotel entrance to the parking lot.

Minus a star for the noise level -- construction noises can be clearly heard in the early morning hours.

M.C. bills itself as a resort but toss your expectations of plush out the window cause if you want any amenities you're gonna have to throw down some ducats for them. 

Let's get to the good stuff first: the staff I interacted with were amicable. The house-keeping staff were mindful of guests sleeping in (that would be me), the luggage check desk couldn't be sweeter, and the taxi concierge did his job efficiently when I needed to get to the airport. The guy who teaches the craps lesson is more engaging than than many of the shows on the Strip. Craps is a pretty intimidating game, this is no easy feat. 

MoCa has a token 24 hour cafe which I can totally recc if you're feeling breakfast foods. There are the obligatory omelets, but I'd steer you toward the carrot cake waffles and the dessert tray. Servers are not in a hurry: you've been warned.

Unless you join in the morning stampede to nab a poolside lounge chair you may end up having to shell out for a cabana. I circled the area three times before spying a spot and this was a weekday. All the pools were busy but navigable. Buy a tube at the nearby drugstore to avoid having to rent one from the resort (for the lazy river). You're in Vegas, which isn't know for it's peacefulness, so if you're staying here Thursday-Sunday a DJ starts spinning at noon. (I kinda liked it, even though it's all top 40s. I'd prefer that over listening to guests plan their nightclub itineraries while guzzling margaritas.)

Bad stuff: Gym use is an additional fee per day. Want to use wi-fi or the business center's computer? Expect to fork over some bones for that as well. The room was adequate but my comforter had several small tears in it. No directory of services in our room, we had to call front desk for every query. I avoided the food court but it would make for easy eating if you have a hungry mob of kids in tow. While it's a solid choice for snoozing after exploring the Strip, there are other places that offer more comforts and character. 

FYI: Want a free work-out while staying here? Hit the stairs, just dress appropriately, you're gonna sweat.

It's funny how Monte Carlo responded to my bad review with a comment to contact them by email to talk to them further about my complaint. I already did that and got no response from them as well on their worthless survey they sent me the day after I checked out. I made two attempts to contact them before I wrote my review on yelp and they choose to respond publicly on yelp to show that they supposedly care, what a joke.

We have stayed here often when visiting Vegas over the past 6 years. The location is great, easy walking to most places and easy access to the tram that takes you a few hotels down the strip. Fairly decent priced fast food you can get at any time of day. Rooms are good, always a pretty good view, beds are decent. Even with the renovations going on it's still great! Can't wait to see what it looks like when they're done.

I don't care what anyone says, this place is one of the best values on the Strip.  I stayed here a while back with the boyfriend and we booked online.  I saw a few days later that the prices online were a bit cheaper and I called in and they changed it for me, no questions asked, no trouble at all.

When we arrived, we were told by a very nice, very pregnant woman that we had been given an upgrade.  Out of curiousity, we asked why and she said that sometimes it just happens.  We figured it can't be a bad thing and at least we'll get a good view or something.  Turns out, they gave us the freakin Spa Suite.

The room had a GIANT tub near the window that would make Joe Francis whip out the camera faster than a hooker drops to her knees.  There was also a California King bed with an oversized comforter, a sofa, tv, coffee table, separate shower and toilet and a wet bar.  There were power blackout blinds you could close from the bed area or the tub area and they gave you plenty of bubble bath for your sudsy pleasure.

All in all, the Spa Suite for the price of a regular room (120 the first night and 109 the second night) was absolutely worth the whole trip.  

I don't really understand people who complain about the casinos in their hotel being bad because seriously people, it's Vegas, go outside, walk 20 feet and go to another casino!!

Reading through the responses to the reviews, it sounds like this planned renovation project couldn't come soon enough.  The first two rooms we tried out had mold in the shower, carpeting that was bunching up, broken lampshades, stained furniture....they really need a complete overhaul.  Our shower also didn't drain properly, and the shower curtain was stained.  After our complaints, the hotel did accommodate us and moved us up to the 32nd floor, which offered much nice amenities.  They usually charge more for those rooms, but honestly all the rooms should look like that.  They are nice, but basically what you would find in any other newer hotel.  The lounge area and all of its offerings was excellent, and would probably be worth the price to stay up there.  

Security was rude to my husband, who didn't feel well and got up in the middle of the night to walk around for a bit.  He wasn't drunk or making any noise whatsoever.  They asked to see his room key to make sure he was staying on the 32nd floor.  THE ROOM KEYS FOR THE 32nd FLOOR LOOK EXACTLY THE SAME AS THE KEYS FOR THE OTHER FLOORS, so I don't know what he was trying to accomplish by demanding to see the key.  The security manager or security office didn't seem to care about this incident.  No hotel should be hiring rude employees.  Hotels are a service business and no customer deserves anything less than courteous treatment, regardless of the situation.  If employees can't learn to keep a professional demeanor, they shouldn't be working in a hotel, period.

Parking is convenient to the lobby, casino is nice (although I don't know how so many people still smoke, it's disgusting to have to smell their cigarette smoke).  Overall the common areas are nice but I would never choose to return to stay in the regular hotel rooms.  The buffet was excellent.

Nice, clean, friendly staff... but NO COFFEE pots in the rooms... $150 in a name brand hotel (good price btw) but NO COFFEE pot? That is enough to take a hotel from a 5 star to a 2 star alone, but the kicker was $18.95 to have room service bring it up to you. Shame on the Monte Carlo...

I'm surprised to see how many negative reviews on here!

We stayed 10\/5-10\/8 and everything was pretty great. We arrived at the hotel around 930 am so there wasn't much of a line for check in. We took our chances and asked if there was a room available. There wasn't, and we were informed that we would get a text when a room became available. That text came around 2:30pm. The bellboy held our bags while we drove down to china town. When we got back to the hotel we went up to room 15-117. The room is pretty standard. No fridge, no coffee maker but that didn't bother us. Who needs a coffee maker with such a delicious coffee place down stairs?

Monte Carlo took such great care of us. From comping us dinner and resort fees to cocktail waitresses always being present. 

The only reason this isn't a a 4 star review is because 2 out of the 3 mornings we were woken up by women speaking Spanish next door at 8 am. The first morning we thought they were guests but after leaving our room discovered that it had been house keeping the whole time. It's so rude!!

Excellent hotel and convenient location. Near convenience stores and has an in-casino food court. Although the food court selections aren't the most exciting, there is some variety, but be ready for higher prices and adjusted menus.

Overall, Monte Carlo definitely has everything you need. And an A-OK buffet.

The location of our $325 daybeds is pretty choice, but not worth the money. If you opt for the cheaper daybed solutions you will be sorely disappointed and in the shade for the vast majority of the day.

The $325 daybeds by the lazy river do offer some grade A people watching, and since you're right up against the water there isn't a lot of traffic walking through your space.

The food was in fact, extremely horrible. My sister (Jessica O.) also reviewed this place, and she hit the nail right on the head. Everything was hot and greasy, and generally of a very poor quality. This place even found a way to F up nachos. I don't know how, but they did it. 

The drinks were outta this world, lucky for us because we needed to spend $110 bucks a piece on them. 

The servers are good not great. The few servers I saw were attentive enough, but not overly friendly.

The pool is great and definitely worth a visit. But don't bother with reserving day beds...and DO NOT eat here.

I've never been a huge fan of Monte Carlo since my very first visit as a teenager years ago.  Since I never stay in hotels, my criteria always comes down to the attractions, the restaurants, and (now that I'm an adult), the gambling.   The casino is dark and uninteresting and there's not much else to entice visitors.  While they do have a number of restaurants, none of them have ever appealed to me.  The biggest positives of this place are its location, bridging the south and center portions of the Strip, and the fact that the new, free monorail that serves Bellagio, City Center, and Aria, also stops here.  When we needed to cut back on the walking due to a health emergency, we used the monorail down to Monte Carlo to make it easier to get to NYNY and the tram to Mandalay Bay.  For us, Monte Carlo is simply a hallway - a place we pass through to get to somewhere else.

Seriously?! There isn't a well placed outlet anywhere in my room and no WiFi?! Are you kidding me?! The shower is awful and there's redneck crap all over the hotel.

There's more!

Paper thin, tiny shower towels. The water doesn't drain when you take a shower so you have cold water for your feet. The bed messed my back up, so now I have to go to the chiropractor.

Then you had the dealer at the craps table. I was standing about 3 to 4 feet back. I had my phone in my hands behind my back. It was unlocked and he tried locking it as he walked by. He was straight faced. No smile like he was joking. Don't you touch my f*cking phone. I have I picture of the guy I'll be reporting to the hotel. He should be happy that I was too tired to chew him out. 

Screw this place.

Ok, this place is a toss up.  The hotel rooms are cheap, you can't stay at your local holiday inn for the price here.  With that being said this place is a great value for what you're paying.  The rooms are average, nothing special, same with the casino and buffet.  The location is greedy, easy walk to several casinos, fairly centrally located on the strip.  We left the casino during the day and only returned to the Monte Carlo to sleep.  They gave great customer service at the front desk, if you're gambling, DONT expect to get a drink.  The ONLY was we got any drinks here were walking up to the bar and playing the slots there, and we only got one after the bartender decided to come over and ask us if we wanted anything which took awhile.  But all in all this place is one of the best places to stay for the value!!!  It is not a bad hotel by any means.

After 4 hours on the road with traffic, rain, and near miss idiots on the road. We get to the hotel and they're out of rooms with King size beds, when I specifically requested one. All that was offered, was to relocate us in the morning. Such a pain! The #LasVegas #MonteCarlo hates tall people.

To be fair, the front desk was courteous and verbally apologetic. Parking was easy even with the construction of the Arena - will come back once it's open. Restaurants and food selection were fine, nothing memorable.

The bed and pillows were comfortable; however, we had to sleep diagonally. The other problem was the shower head that sits too low. We had to crouch down in order wash our hair.

I appreciate the apology online (in response to my review); however, it is still mediocre at best.

This place used to be nice. It's not that great anymore. Rooms are run down, hard to sleep with all the noise in the halls\/rooms next door, & staff is just okay. 

And you have to pay a mandatory $20 resort fee each day. This fee gets you 1 K-Cup, 1 small bottle of water, and access to the crowded pool (good luck getting a chair...)\/workout center. Not worth it.

Worst stay I have ever had in Las Vegas.  Construction noises hammering and drilling so loud early in the morning it sounded like it was right next door.  When we finally tuned that out and emergency alarm test would go off real loud in the room for over a half hour.  When we called the front desk I was informed they didn't know about any alarm or test being ran as the alarm blared around me during the call.  I will avoid the Monte Carlo in future visits and warn all my friends and whom ever I can not to stay here

The Monte Carlo is by far the best hotel for me. It's centrally located in the heart of the strip and despite the recent renovations next door, it still fits in great. I can't eat at any other cafe. Seriously, their food is so good. From their country fried steak to their chicken carbonara. So delicious! Any of their dishes appease any craving that I have. The dishes have always been cooked to perfection (except for the ONE time my hash browns were a little over-done, but it's cool). Other than that, nothing compares to their cafe for the price.

Their customer service has always been outstanding. The staff is always pleasant and accommodating. IF something does go wrong, they always do their best to fix it.

For those of you who enjoy gambling like myself, the MC is great. I'm a slotty gal so can't say much for the tables, but they have machines that range from $.05 to $5. Can't say the same for Aria next door. $10 video poker?! I ran right back to MC.

The rooms I have stayed in were always clean. I also tip the maids regardless if they come into my room during my stay. If everyone at least left them a few bucks to show appreciation, it'd go a long way. Oh yeah, tip the cocktail waitresses too. $1 a drink is my rule. It's just a classy thing to do.

All in all, MC is my #1 hotel in Vegas. Affordable, awesome food, friendly staff, and great for gambling. I tend to never leave MC because I'm usually disappointed with the other options. I love you guys!

LOVED that I didn't pay the bill for this hotel.  So as far as writing you get what you pay for, I wouldn't know.  


I know this isn't a very new hotel, but its also not the oldest.  I don't know if all the rooms are like this, but our bathroom had peeling wallpaper, and you could clearly tell that there was water damage in the shower.  The bright gold fixtures in the bathroom were so dated, it was irritating to see.  The showerhead had so much calcification on it that not much water came out to wash my hair.  The beds were obviously already used a lot, however they were comfy enough.  Pillows were very big and fluffy, nice for leaning on, but literally a pain in the neck to sleep on.  I had to take two Tylenol and four ibuprofen for a week after leaving Vegas.  

The casino wasn't too bad, I didn't mind it at all.  We actually enjoyed the Go Go Girls dancing on a short runway.   I even appreciated the non-smoking FLOORS.  Wish all of Vegas could be non-smoking indoors like California.  A girl\/mother can wish.  

Overall, not too bad of a hotel, especially if all you're gonna do is sleep and go out all day.

Ok, if you are looking for a nice, clean, and safe place... Monte Carlo is the place to stay.  And if you want to stay at a super central locations... this is the place.

Nothing is fancy at the Monte Carlo, you can't brag about that, its not Bellagio or Mandalay Bay but its inexpensive and the hotel itself has everything you need right inside, even a tram that will take you from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio, with a stop at the Aria.  

The staff are friend and very helpful when you have questions or concerns.
Horrible service! Dealers are unfriendly and cocktail waitresses non-existant!!

One word: CONVENIENT! 

Went for a friend's bday and the only thing we had on the agenda was to sit by the pool and go to the hottest clubs. 

We checked in at about 1pm Friday since our room was ready. We had a room with two queen beds. The room was clean and service was great. I ordered towels and extra cups and they came right away. We knew we wouldn't be staying in our hotel for much of the day except to sleep, so why pay for a room that wouldn't be utilized? Late check out is at Noon. We left on Sunday. 

Pool: there is a lazy river, wave pool, and regular pool. I don't think this is a kid friendly hotel. The pool was conveniently located a couple of feet from the elevator which meant we didn't have to walk that far. It was HOT!  There were more 21yo and up adults drinking and smoking, than families. 

Food court: I love how convenient this hotel is. Once you got out of the elevator it was only a couple feet away from the food court, which included MC Donald's, Subway, Sbarro, Hagen Daz, etc. Sit down dining and buffets were also close together. 

I'd stay here again based on price and how convenient everything was located in the hotel. I mean if you don't plan on staying in your room and cabbing it everywhere, why pay more on a hotel room?

I stayed here on a work trip. The clock in my room is stuck on Chicago time, my tub is leaking and there is no wifi (how is that even possible!!?). Also, they add $20 to your room bill every day for coffee and water. I wouldn't stay here again.

Hubby n I needed a retreat from our day to day life.  He surprised me with a room that included a jacuzzi facing the strip!  This room also included a wet bar which came in handy as we bought our own alcohol.  The room was nice and pretty clean.  What I didn't like was the hallway smelled like old musky cologne.  I don't think it was from an old man because that smelled lingered there during our whole stay,  The elevators were pretty accessible meaning they weren't crowded all the time, like some other hotels.  I really like the location of the Monte Carlo, smack in the middle of the strip.  Another plus is that it tram that connects to the the Aria and to the Bellagio,  It was super cold when we were there last week, 40's, and we didn't want to be walking from one place to the next.

This was my favorite hotel while here. My friend and I hotel hopped. Started out at Stratosphere for two days and ended our Vegas trip at the Monte Carlo. This hotel is beautiful. I love love LOVE the pool! It's calm, older crowd. So if you're expecting Tao or Rehab NOPE! If you expect to relax, read a book YUP lol. This place was definitely a great choice. I would say I would book again but I really love hotel hopping. I mean we had a car so it was easy. I would advise hotel hopping to the people that are able to. Best way to experience multiple hotels in one shot. I wish I could have took advantage of the buffet but next time.

I just flew back home from the Monte Carlo yesterday. 

I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend this hotel to someone else.

The pictures are very deceiving. The rooms are not nearly as nice as they look in the pictures. There are no coffee makers, microwaves, or refrigerators in the rooms. I called the front desk and asked for a fridge - they have them but charge an additional $25 per day to use them. The rooms do not have a closet, rather they have an armoire type piece of furniture to put things in. 

The carpet is dirty, old, and in many spots wrinkled (where it appears that the carpet has either flooded or gotten wet). 

The shower and sink drain very very slowly. The sink filled when washing hands\/brushing teeth and water remained for a long time afterward. 

The entire pool is torn down right now and has been for some time; there is no mention of this on the website. There is major construction going on; construction is very loud and begins early in the morning. 

There are very few shops\/restaurants open at this time as they are all under construction.

We also got a wake-up call from the front desk for someone else. They apparently called the wrong number, so whomever it was that wanted a wake-up call may or may not have gotten the call.

Room is kinda boring and basic. It's just the usual small two queen room with a tv and a restroom. Nothing out of the normal. Other hotel rooms here in Vegas look way more grand than this. There is an open case of Ferero rocher left here and the coffee maker also wasn't cleaned out. Will not be returning.

at 50 this was my first visit to vegas. got to say its not what i expected nor my cup of tea. the monte carlo was not our choice (traveled with a group) but the quality of rooms and service did not help me feel like coming back in the near future. price paid per night for a room with no in room coffee or refrigerator was ridiculous. the comfort of the furnishings in the room was terrible. the maid service left a lot to be desired. things like towels, shampoo etc was never the same. we were there in august it was 100+ degrees every day and the air conditioning in the room never got the room temperature below 78 which for a nordic person like myself is 20 degrees above my comfort level. finding an outlet to charge a phone or camera was not easy. there was exposed wires, rusted fire sprinkler heads and much more. the hall floors had trash on them for days. it seems all the focus was on the lobby and the pool area. the cost of a simple bottle of water was what a mixed drink should cost. god forbid you asked for a pop or juice to rehydrate you had to take out a second mortgage. now for the webpage. it states things like water and coffee are free in room but when we pointed that out we were told the webpage needed to be updated because they don't do that. in a city where there are so many choices one would hope a resort would do better than this.

We had a great stay here, a few issues when we it initially booked into our room...tv wasn't working, no room service menu etc, but they were quick to fix them and upgraded us to a deluxe room for the remainder of our stay. Beds were comfy, room servicing was lovely, casino staff really friendly. The spa and gym are beautiful. It's a great hotel if your looking for something central and affordable, I would definitely  stay here again.

I loved our Kind sized bed! It was like sleeping on a cloud and I really wished I could spent all day lounging around. The room had a Keurig machine, which was used, and the television was awesome (it was the same one we have at home). The only problem I had was there was no blow dryer so I had to leave with wet hair. The toilet scared me because it was so powerful! The shower was nice, but it wasn't very big so you couldn't have a bath. I really, really  wished the walls were thicker because when the tricks next door stumbled in at 4 am, laughing and screaming, I was not a happy camper. Alas, there is no way the hotel can control that and people are just rude. The main floor was awesome and it smelled like incense! I will give the props when it comes to ventilation because amidst all of the smokers, I wasn't overwhelmed with the smell. I really, really liked that they had a food court because if you didn't feel like spending a million dollars on a big meal, you can just grab a snack. We spend most of our time gambling in Aria because the casino was crowded at Monte Carlo.  However, I wasn't happy with having to pay a resort fee, but I guess that's what I get. We got a great deal on our stay so if you are looking for a nice hotel on the strip that won't break the bank than Monte Carlo is a great choice.

I just got back from Vegas was there over the holiday weekend let me just tell you this was my first time staying at Monte Carlo and it will be my last!!! It was a HORRIBLE experience. When I arrived it took forever to get checked in by the hotel staff then when I finally got assigned a room I went upstairs to the 17th floor and the room that was assigned was a mess! Housekeeping hadn't cleaned the room from the last visitors. There was trash left around, the beds were a mess, towels everywhere and the room had a horrible smell. I called downstairs to guest services they stated I apologize we thought the room was cleaned please go to the 22nd floor the key will work. Well I get to the 22nd floor and the door wouldn't open so I go back down to where guests get checked in well guess what I had to wait all over again. I asked to be compensated for the inconvenience considering I had luggages to carry around and wasted over an hour getting checked in but nothing was done. Anyways finally got a new room and key assigned got to the 22nd floor and it smelled. Throughout the hotel there was a horrible smell and stains on the carpet. The rooms are old and need some major remodeling. To make matters worst my money got stuck in the slot machine I pressed for service nobody came by to help 45 minutes had passed and still nobody came to help. I had to track someone down to help me!!!! Also when I booked the hotel I had 2 free buffet passes WORST buffet ever it smelled like a hospital cafeteria good thing it was free and I didn't waste money on that too. Not one food item that was supposed to be hot was hot everything was at room temp or cold. no flavor at all.Only good thing about this hotel was the swimming pools and the valet employees. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and won't recommend it to anyone such a waste of money.

Great location and I enjoyed the tram to Aria and Bellagio. The line at check-in was LONG but went by fairly quickly (about 20 minutes) and the front desk staff that I dealt with were all friendly and eager to answer questions and provide information. Great room rate ($40!), but the resort fees blow (all of the Vegas hotels charge them). The casino is pretty smokey, but I was pleasantly surprised that my non-smoking room was not at all. Most of Vegas wreaks of smoke so it was nice to be able to retreat to a place with some clean air. Score one for the Monte Carlo! Our room was clean and the bed and pillows comfortable. That said, the rooms could probably use some updating. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and the furniture in our room was pretty scuffed up. The carpet in the hallway on our floor (the 30th) was rippling, so I hope no one trips on it. Bottom line... A moderate hotel for a decent price. Nothing mind blowing but the Vegas strip is only a few steps away.

3 star hotel with 5 star service. Since it was built in the early 90s, Monte Carlo has been my favorite hotel in Vegas. It might not have all the glitz, glamor as the Bellagio, Wynn, or Venetian, but you'll get great clean rooms at decent prices and good service. 

I like the Monte Carlo because it's conveniently located on the Vegas strip with easy access to shopping, dining and walking distance to all the popular casinos and hotels. Access from parking garage and valet area to main lobby is quick and easy. Not crowded and jam packed with cars like other casinos. The minute you arrive at the main entrance driveway you're greeted with friendly, attentive valet service. Front reservation desk is perfectly located near the room elevators for quick room access (unlike other casinos that make you walk through their main casino gaming area to get to your room...What a hassle, inconvenience!). They've lay-ed out and designed their casino floor plans perfectly, making your stay very relaxing and comfortable. As soon as you come down from your room elevator, you have access to shops and dining, casino gaming, and front desk. No other casino in Vegas provides this type of experience which is why I keep coming back to the Monte Carlo.

This is a perfectly serviceable hotel with just plain bad customer service. You'll be fine staying here if you don't have any issues, but woe betide you if you do. The rooms are very meh. Outdated and boring - but who cares how the room looks in Vegas? 

About customer service. We had an unfortunate incident where (on the recommendation of someone at the front desk) we ended up waiting half an hour in the concierge line for outlet mall shuttle tickets for a shuttle that turned out not to exist. No apology for our long wait, or for being given the wrong info. We were dismissed.

I also dealt with some damage to personal property. Housekeeping wedged one of my high heels under the frame of a roll-away bed in the room, and it chewed up the leather on the heel. Okay, fine. These places have insurance, right? The security officer who came to deal with the issue, was rude, dismissive, and had no information about the process of filing a claim. He strongly hinted that if I filed a claim with risk management, I was unlikely to see any kind of compensation from them and it would be out of the hotel's hands at that point. After some back and forth with a manager I was offered a food and beverage credit and to have the resort fees waived to make up for it - neither of which would help me get my shoe fixed, but I elected to take it because they implied the alternative would probably end up being no compensation at all. 

Using the food and beverage credit was its own hassle. There was a tiny list of places we could use it, and they were all closed by midnight. Since we were given the credit the night before we left, we had to order a massive breakfast...and dinner for later, and snacks...at the cafe the next morning before we checked out of the hotel so we wouldn't lose the credit. 

The icing on the cake was that when we went to check out, they had not waived the resort fees - in fact, they had charged us twice for them. My friend had to spend half an hour working it all out with a manager while we just sat around. We were offered a 15% discount on future stays for the multiple inconveniences, but obviously we will not be staying here again.

All that being said, we did have a few good moments - Preston at the front desk gave us some great suggestions for food and entertainment, so props to him. The staff at the cafe (particularly our waitress Jennifer) were fantastic dealing with our last minute flurry of orders trying to spend the food and beverage credit. And the bell desk very kindly let us leave our bags of extra food with our luggage so we wouldn't have to cart them around all morning, even though it was against their policy. Those good moments bought the hotel an extra star.

Stayed here over New Years and had a blast! Location wise, it couldn't have been a more better location on the Strip then this one! NYE was so much fun here!! Got an upgrade of our room to high floor deluxe and super comfy bed! Casino wise, couldn't ask for more and lots of dining, Blue Man Group and shops all around. Thank you Monte Carlo for a great stay!

Think this is a better priced hotel when you peruse online travel sites - BEWARE! Monte Carlo charges the daily resort fee of $30.00 + $3.67 tax when you checkout. Had I known, I would have stayed at other nearby hotels. There is no mini-bar. The shampoo, conditioner and body wash were not replenished our second night. The bed sheets had holes. The disappointment goes on!
Andres cigar bar is a great place to try rare single malt flights 5 for $25 on a Wednesday  and enjoy great Appies and a good cigar

Just went yesterday. If it weren't for the show my wife and I saw at Park Theatre inside the hotel (Ricky Martin) I would give this Hotel zero stars. The room was dirty and reeked of weed. After the front desk agreed to put an ozone machine in the room while we were out they NEVER DID. They also picked a bad time to renovate their pool as it's over 110 degrees and the nearest pool
Is a long walk outside. I will stay elsewhere next trip in September to see Bill Burr unless their reviews come way up.

The rooms are clean - but that's the most I can say about them.  Monte Carlo - wake up and smell the wireless!!  There was none!  Horror!  Just a 2 foot long ethernet cord smack in the middle of the air conditioning draft - I left Vegas with a lovely chest cold as the price of my connectivity.

And mind you, I stayed in the middle of a heavily-trafficed conference, but this place was just under $400\/night - nuts!

Good service , very friendly people at the concierge, they were helpful. Room was overall nice. Except the bath tub , the water didn't fully drain. It drained minutes after I had taken a shower. So basically I took a bath with a tub full of water. The bed was so comfortable, and the sheets were clean. The view wasn't great but then again I didn't pay extra to have the LV strip view. 
Overall I would recommend this place to anyone, great for families and couples. Im hoping to come back again to this place but this time with our infant.

Meh is how I felt.I maybe have too high of standards but with a name like Monte Carlo (and the pics they post!) I thought I would be more blown away.

Checking in was easy enough. Staff was super friendly. The casino had a really good choice of games as well. And the best part....Starbucks right downstairs! 

As far as room. Was very dated. I don't like that they don't have the bathroom seperated (sink outside of toliet\/shower part) like most are these days. Walls PAPER thin. I thought are toliet was still running but the person next door was showering..very LOUD. 

The hotel did not have as grand of a feel as I was hoping for. In fairness though, I did get a pretty good price though. Too many other nice hotels to stay here again though, IMO

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #14:
a solid middle-range casino on a prime piece of real estate; wedged between Aria\/City Center and the currently-in-building-process Las Vegas Arena and The Park areas; they have really upgraded this place, so while not all that big, it is a worthy spot, especially for mid-scale dining options; many of these are on the now-completed Strip-front walkway area; I challenge you to find a better deal for Strip-front dining than the inexpensive & super-tasty 800 Degrees (Neapolitan pizza); there is a small, but nice, shopping corridor with the best feature being The Pub (read on); best craft beer bet = by far, it's The Pub, which has a genuinely excellent beer list both on tap & in bottles; nice big space too, although I could do without the horrid dueling pianos bad-80's music when I was there; overall, the Monte Carlo rates at 3.5 stars, but I will bump them up due to The Pub and the Strip-front dining spots (BTW, the corridor walkway from the casino to Diablo's Cantina is pretty cool).

The location is good.  The public areas are nice.  The rooms are terrible.  May as well have been a Motel 6.  Small rooms to begin with and then: Terrible mattress, old fixtures, cracked tiles, dingy\/cracked bathtub, small hard towels.  They had few tv channels and no movies available for purchase.  The phone check out wasn't  working and they don't  have tv checkout available.  We'll  go elsewhere next time for sure.

So my husband and I decided to get away for the weekend and this was an affordable place to stay on the strip. 
The rooms are clean and decent no roaches or anything so that is a plus. 
When compared to the other places in Vegas like Caesars, Venetian, Wynn this place sucks but one can take a cab or walk to these places.  
My husband and I love to eat when we go on vacation and the buffet was gross. Good thing it was free because I would not pay 20 bucks for that piece of crap. 
Make sure to use the Valet if you are driving since there is no self park. 
Decent place to stay at Vegas but not the best.

We just left after staying 3 nights 1\/1\/14-1\/4\/14.  Here are the pros and cons

Pros-
Free Tram that goes to Aria and Bellagio.

Location is somewhat central, but still on the south side, tram really helps time wise getting down the strip.

Inexpensive

Cons-
Small Rooms with PAPER THIN walls

No fridge or microwave in room

No bathrobe

No real theme to hotel, nothing that makes it fun or unique

In Conclusion-it's fine for a cheap place on the strip, if you can stay at Paris, Planet Hollywood or Ny Ny for a similar price I'd pick them

Last minute booking to Las Vegas, booked at this hotel just to give it a try.  First of all online it stated they had a club and music, there was no club and no music ever, I asked the front desk and they said they were renovating the club.  First disappointment since I selected this hotel for entertainment to avoid going out late at night.  The rooms were outdated, no tv cable, no internet and no coffee maker in room.  The only good thing in the entire hotel was the Mc Donald's, even though I'm not a McDonald's fan.  I really don't know what the resort fees are for!!!! This hotel doesn't offer much, take the tram to other hotels.

When I went, they were renovating their front part of the hotel so it was a mess. Hotel itself is good but not great. They have a mall-like food court with subway, chinese food and etc. Casino floor was good but also not that great. I would go again because their rate is great but the food and overall it's just good, not great.

I visited here during Christmas and loved all of the decorations. The staff is friendly, we got a standard room and were a little disappointed that there was not many amenities that came with it. There is some construction so it's a little confusing figuring out how to get in and out of the area.

This was my first time staying at Monte Carlo. We were in Vegas for a family reunion and the fam wanted to see Blue Man Group. When I looked up Monte Carlo on Orbitz and some of the other travel sites, it showed 4 stars. My BAD for not checking Yelp first!

We traditionally do not stay in less than 4 stars, especially since this was a family reunion and I wanted it to be nice. I thought "why not stay at Monte Carlo so we can watch the show and not jump from hotel to hotel?". WORST. MISTAKE. EVER. I was so embarrassed. :( It's an MGM resort but definitely not MGM standards.

We checked in at 2am and were greeted by an agent who couldn't crack a smile if we paid her. Then, we were put in a room that had a broken fire alarm, reeked of plastic, and looked like a Clarion hotel. At 2am, we had to switch rooms only to find issues with the room again. Missing stuff and remotes not working, etc. We were so exhausted it wasn't worth it.

I checked with the family on the other rooms: there were paintings missing leaving a barren room with holes in the walls and the inside toilet paint had worn off. It was so embarrassing that I had booked this hotel for family.

The only good thing: it was fairly clean. 

Monte Carlo needs a complete makeover with a new look and should definitely improve the experience. I will not go back again.

HORRIBLE. My boyfriend and I went on 11\/11\/15 for our birthdays and got bit by bed bugs and god knows what. We were treated badly by staff and management and we are STILL itchy with bites all over our bodies. We also still haven't gotten refunds or explanations for anything even though we keep calling and asking to be reached out to. Never going back. EVER.

Expectations were definitely not met with this hotel.

We started off with a long line at check in. This was understandable given that it's a large hotel resort and it was the weekend. Once I reached the counter, the associate provided me with a free buffet for two when I inquired about upgrades available. This was essentially the only high point of my entire stay here.

We arrive in the room and it was obvious this is one of the older hotels on the strip. The carpets had old faded stains, room was slightly musty, and there was green\/blue mildew in the shower head. Although all of this is bad, it's not bad enough in my book to warrant a one star review. Here's the kicker that drove them down to the lowest rating possible - moths.

I had five moths coming out of the ventilation system over the course of a single night. I killed three and cleaned up the mess but after I had to kill the fourth and fifth one, I just left their dead bodies on the walls and called down to the front desk for a different room. I was initially met with "we're fully booked tonight" and it wasn't until I insisted on getting out of this room that they moved us. They did not seem taken aback from moths in the vents as it sounds like it's a regular occurrence - "People leave the windows open and that's how they get into the rooms and vents. Nothing we can do about it." Their only compensation for my disgusting inconvenience was to take off one out of two nights' resort fees.

I don't know about you, but I for one don't enjoy sharing my room with a colony of moths.

Our stay last weekend was just fine. We got an upgrade to a room on a higher floor, the bed was great, the pillows were comfy, and, despite who we recognized to be noisy neighbors, were unheard of all night. GREAT!

I reserved pool chairs through their company loungereserve.com to prevent the stress that comes along with forcing yourself to wake up early to get a coveted seat by the pool. When we went to claim our reservation our first day there, we were seated right by the DJ booth and were told that the DJ would be starting at 12p. Holy hell! Being seating by the DJ booth was not something I agreed to when I reserved my seats! But, this is where the $20 seat reservation area is. It seems like they should tell you this before you book. So, I immediately went to cancel my reservation for the next day and was told I had to do it through the website where I booked it -- loungereserve.com. I did this as soon as it was possible and explained the situation, noting that it would take 24 hours for someone to get back to me. Fast forward 1 follow up email and 7 DAYS LATER -- they finally responded saying cancellations must be made 48 hours in advance. That was it. So, I wrote back and explained the situation AGAIN and they said that it was the resorts policy and there was nothing they could do. So, Monte Carlo pool staff threw me to them and loungereserve.com threw me back to Monte Carlo. What the hell?? Haven't heard anything back from them since responding that there had to be something they could do. 
Next step is to contact Monte Carlo directly and pray.

I won't be staying here again and I will never use loungereserve.com again either. I HIGHLY recommend that you stay away from this money grubbing site and just get to the pool when it opens to snag your seats.

I have never stayed here before and would never stay again.  My daughter turned 21 and we wanted to stay somewhere closer to the middle of the strip.   There was construction going on and the pool and some shops were closed. When we made our reservations they did not tell us that a remodel was underway.   Our room looked like it had been thrown together,  none of the furniture matched.  The carpet was just thrown on over the floor and covered vents.  Our safe and several lights did not work.  There was no mini fridge, no informational book about hotel or Las Vegas.  The only bright spot was the salon\/spa.   I got my nails and hair done, and from the reception to the end everybody was incredible.  Don't stay here!!!!

First reactions .... The casino is nice. Shops and restaurants seem good. The hotel rooms need to be updated. Our room is supposed to be nonsmoking but it stinks like cigarettes. We asked for a room change let's hope we get something nicer then this.
