We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The casino and whatever you find in ground floor is very good but rooms are not special. The restroom is very outdated. There is no ref. no coffee maker, the phone was broken...
But considering the price it was a good deal.

The rooms are nothing special. But they were clean and our view was pretty good. The bathrooms need updating; small tub and loud flushing toilets. 
The people in the room next to us smoked pot the whole time, causing the odor to leak under our adjoining door and stink up our room.  But my ingenious hubby stuffed a towel under the door.  Problem solved.

Here's where we were totally impressed: Customer Service, Location, and Food Court.  We stayed for 7 days and had dealings with extremely professional and helpful staff. They happily printed off our boarding passes for the flight home; thus avoiding the $1 per minute computer fee's for everyone else. Their location is mid-strip which is perfect.  It's an easy walk to either end of the strip.  Not sure if this matters to most people, but I hate dragging my luggage through the casino floor after I check into a hotel.  This place has a great layout.  The taxi drops you off at the door nearest the lobby, and the hotel elevators are right next to that; thereby avoiding that embarrassing walk through the casino area with luggage.   Lastly, they had a nice food court which was perfect when you're looking for something small to tide you over.  They had a ton of options to choose from, and considering it was in Vegas I guess the prices weren't so bad. 

Last year we stayed at the Bellagio for 8 days. Even though that room was ultra-nice, I still lean towards Monte Carlo for the above reasons.

Just arrived home from my 4 day\/3 night birthday trip at the Monte Carlo. This was my third time in Vegas, but the first time in this hotel. We walked up to the check-in and we mentioned that it was my birthday and they upgraded us to a high floor strip-view room which honestly was a great way to start off the trip. I immediately dropped off my bags and ran to the window to watch the strip\/people. You can see some pretty interesting bits going on if you pay attention close enough downstairs.

That was the first great thing that happened. The second thing which was cool was the room credit. We booked this room specifically for the birthday promo on their website which included 2-for-1 drinks at Big Chill and free select domestic beer at The Pub. They ended up not having any of the coupons for Big Chill prepared so they comped us $50 in dining credit for wherever we decided to go in the hotel. Cool, thanks! We enjoyed quite a few drinks at the bar during happy hour, and didn't have to worry about the cost of drinks on my birthday. Can't complain.

The BMG, which I didn't get to see, looked pretty interesting but I've heard the shows were just okay. The pricing was about 40% off for MC hotel guests if you wanted to go. I didn't make it this time, but maybe next time I'll try and catch their show. They have a nightly procession through the lobby at 6:15 which showcases some of their contraptions: a drum that moves itself and a lot of bright lights and sounds. I heard the show was just okay but I'll never know for sure. 

The casino was considerably smaller compared to the Aria, MGM Grand, etc. There also isn't a lot of waitresses walking around taking drink orders which is why I spent most of time at Aria. I sat at their computer roulette tables and got about 4-5 drinks during the hour - hour and a half. I was lucky if I got ONE at the MC. 

Their food court has a Mickey D's (what I call the McDonald's), Sbarro, Subway, Original Chicken Tenders, and Nathan's (I think). The line was super long for MCD's which I got one night when it was late and I didn't feel like walking the strip looking for food and I've had some....a lot of drinks. 

You can take the tram to Aria, Bellagio, Crystals, and I also think Cosmopolitan. I used this quite often to go around to all the hotels and take some shortcuts. 

Okay so in conclusion to my review I will say this and then press the "post" button and hope I made no spelling errors. The hotel was in a nice location, easy access to other hotels, The Pub was a quick happy hour stop, and the beds were comfortable enough for me. I loved the view I got but if I had not gotten the strip view it probably would have sucked, but I got what I paid for. The hotel seems a bit run down as far as decor goes, there's a lot of faded-ish looking gold and brown tones and the walls are thin. I could hear what my neighbors were listening to at all hours. The price was good for what we got: location, location, location. 

P.S. I really hope they get free wi-fi past the first two floors for their guests.

So I picked the MC because I wanted an affordable place that wasn't filled with kids. I got that, but I also got a boring and mediocre hotel. 
The rooms reminded me of a mediocre Double Tree in Iowa City, but I didn't spend that much time there so it was ok. The casino was never very filled, which might be good for some, but I need some interaction. 

Fortunately I found some nice folks at the Blackjack tables, unfortunately they didn't know what they were doing (this happened a few times.) If you don't play blackjack, then having bad people at your table actually does effect the game and is a bad thing. The waitresses were old (sorry) and slow with the boos.

The pools were crowded, but much more geared towards kids. I ordered a drink and it was $10 for a small. It did come from a very attractive waitress, so I couldn't complain that much...now if we could only get them at the tables...

We ate at the buffet for breakfast one morning and it was your standard buffet. We also ate at the cafe type thing... I can't give that a glowing review as we had terrible service...there were four other tables yet it still took us an hour to get our food.

Value: I can't complain too much as I didn't pay too much (I think it was like $60 a night.) But you can find better prices at the same quality hotel...I think I would go with Luxor or Bill's next time.

Overall: There is no need to stay at the MC and especially visit it.

Ok, first MC is probably the cheapest, decent (and by decent I mean, not smelly and not dirty) hotel you'll be able to find in the center of the strip. That being said, you need to stay in this hotel with little to no expectations. The hotel itself is really boring, the casinos are hardly ever busy and some areas were roped off the last time I was there. It's a place to sleep and shower... while you enjoy your fun elsewhere.

It was fine. We had 4 of us including an 8yr old and 17yr old and got a room with two queen beds. We arrived around midnight and check in was super quick. While in line a couple cut us and then started yelling at us for looking at them and judging them. FD upgraded us to a strip view room. The room was nothing special, very basic. There was a tv with very few channels, a bathroom and 2 beds. Housekeeping needs to step it up. We had a child with us and there were items under the bed left from previous guests. Not cool, not cool. There are several dining options such as a food court, buffet, steakhouse, etc. The pool was not open, however we were offered access to the Luxor or Bellagio pools. The location was really awesome. We were minutes from New York New York which has a great arcade and roller coaster. We also ate there a few times. There is fun coca cola store across the street where you can try coke products from around the world. Another bonus is the tram that takes you to the Bellagio and the Crystals shopping center. The rooms do not have fridges but you can get one from HK for $25 a day. I gambled in the casino and won a couple hundred. The place is smoky, but yeah its a casino and its vegas. All in all it was an ok stay. Not sure if we will return.

Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino is a fun place to stay. Good services and gaming. The pool area is awesome, Lazy River, Wave Pool, Outside Bars and a large area to lay out and get some sun. The tram is very close to get to other places on the strip. The rooms are very nice for the price. Overall a really fun place to stay in Las Vegas.

My eyes sting from the perfume they put in the air to mask the smoke fumes. The bathroom was disgusting. Hairs everywhere. The nightstand had hairs everywhere. Looks like they did a horrible job cleaning the room. The room was dirty, not to mention completely outdated - which I would overlook had it been cleaned and sanitized. 

The lobby is beautiful and you would hope the rooms would reflect the same.

Solid hotel that gives a decent balance of price, location and amenities.  Monte Carlo is a pretty good option if you are looking for an affordable, yet some what nice place to stay in Vegas.  Its much nicer than The Imperial Palace...now dubbed The Quad (but it will the IP to me forever!).  The rooms are decent... or at least they were at one time.  Our room had a slight run down feel to it.  The power socket next to the desk was broken, the wall paper in the bathroom had seen better days but still I felt comfortable there.  There was no closet just a cabinet in the room, nor was there a fidge or wifi (though there is wired internet).

Amenity-wise there are a row of shops and a food court, both of which were a tad on the small side and the casino floor itself felt a little limited, but proximity-wise you are close to everything so its easy to hop around to the hotel of your choice.

Overall, had a good stay and would probably stay here again.

Easily one of the most disgusting hotels I've stayed in (For reference, I've stayed in a Motel 6 before). Check-in staff was friendly and happily accommodated our floor preference. However, the room itself was a bitter disappointment. The bathroom was NOT clean. GREEN calcium stains on the shower head and fixtures as well as mold stains around the tub seals. GROSS.
Beds looked clean, but did not smell clean. Definitely some residual perfume left over from the previous guests.

To top it all off, the Air Conditioning did not work properly. Woke up at 2 AM to find the temperature had climbed to almost 80 degrees!

A four night stay turned into one night and I checked out the next morning feeling disgusted and exhausted. Will not be staying here again!

I just wanted to update my review. After waiting about 45 minutes to check in, the rest of my experience here will definitely make me rethink staying here again and will definitely not recommend to my friends. 

My sister and I only stayed for one night and I'm the morning as we were trying to sleep before our drive back to la we began to hear loud hammering and drilling in the next room. At check out, the front desk guy apologized saying he was not sure why the maintenance people were doing that. He offered to refund the resort fee. I checked my account yesterday and apparently he did not refund the resort fee. I called and the representative on the phone stated that she checked with the front desk and that while there were notes, that they forgot to proceed with the refund process and it would take an additional 5 business days. 

If it's just to save a few dollars don't stay here! Lesson learned!

Stayed here for two nights and really liked it!  The price was pretty decent, as was the location.  The sheets and beds were surprisingly really comfortable and super clean (as were the carpets and the entire room).  My only complaint was the bathtub was a tad small, and the towels were low quality.  Aside from that, I loved it.  Definitely would consider coming back!

Went for a couple day trip to LV. Found a room here for a decent price and the reviews were good so I went for it. We only used it as a base to explore the city, and it worked well. Parking was easy to find and spots were plentiful. We never used valet, only self park. Check-in took about 5 minutes waiting in line, not a big deal. Got room keys and found the elevator to our floor. The room was nice, clean, and had no smoke smell. We had a view on the pool and parking garage. One thing noticeable is that there was no WIFI, only an ethernet cable to use. That was annoying. The only other complaint I have is the shower leaked all over the floor. No matter how you did the shower curtain, it still soaked the floor. Beds were comfy with a nice duvet. The hotel was also quiet. Walking through the casino, there are a few nice places to eat, as well as a food court that's open 24\/7. The hotel is right across the street, and maybe a 10 minute walk from the Monorail station at MGM. One thing to be aware of is the outside pool and hot tub close in the winter. I was surprised it wasn't open and heated. Also, though it's not the hotels fault, AT&T seemed to be in a virtual dead zone around this hotel. Full bars and no connection. It wasn't isolated to one phone either.

We wanted to stay on the strip but for a decent price. The best price for hotel and location was The Monte Carlo. We stayed 2 nights on a weekend and it was $236 including tax and resort fees. I think it was around $90 per night before fees etc.

We found a parking spot in the small lot right outside of the lobby. They have a parking structure too but definitely check the small one first! We were advised to move it to the structure but it was free parking anyway and we assumed right that no one would check. 

On check in, we were offered a high floor with a strip view .. AWESOME! And it got better fast. We were told we had $75 to spend on food\/drink at 'THE PUB', the bar in the Monte Carlo. We ate there twice, for free! Can't beat that price. 

Okay, the room. Definitely not as nice as newer hotels, but it wasn't not nice. The only major problem - no fridge in the room. Something which is pretty standard i feel like? 

Also, we put the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door and housekeeping still knocked numerous times. WHY DO THEY DO THIS IN EVERY HOTEL?. Seriously? It's Vegas, the city that never sleeps. I'm not in bed at a reasonable hour, so don't disturb me early morning - ESPECIALLY when the SIGN is on the door! 

Oh and the water pressure in the shower was LAME. Why is it so hard to find a nice shower. 

I'd stay again! But in summer, so we can check out the lazy river!

i didn't stay at this hotel but i ate here everyday. This Hotel has the best breakfast buffet around... 4 stars!! This hotel also has a wide variety of food options from Mc Donald's to steak houses and cigar bars. Next time i'm in vegas, i will stay here for sure. I enjoyed coming to this hotel everyday. The wifi is free if your staying at the hotel. This hotel is on the strip which is very important if you want to avoid cabs.. And it was way better than the hotel i was staying at which was not on the strip (which i didn't know)

Ok, how\/where do I start?  I think the nicest accommodation they have is the valet parking. then 2nd best would be the front desk after that I believe everything goes down hill from there except for the Blue man attraction. 

But from not having WiFi in 2014 probably the only hotel in Vegas without it. To the old room and some picture frames missing from the hall ways lol from the hallways I wonder if I was at a Motel 8 no I wasn't they have WiFi.   Oh the breakfast left @ someone's door and wasn't picked up all day smh. The hotel looks old period.  

It was my birthday weekend so I didn't mind that much I was in a good mood the whole time.   Now this was the weekend of Nov 7.  So going back to the beginning when we check in, the lady in the front desk asked for a credit card like all the hotels in case something happens.   Never had a problem providing my credit card to hotels for any charge we might charge to the room.   There's a little problem when we checked out there were no extra charges so we were good to go, until I check my bank and there was a almost $300 charge.  Well I'm thinking that it's pending and it will go away in the next couple of days.  It's a month later and I have to make a credit card payment because these people can't see the charge us twice even when we provided both statements.

Do not stay here. Bad. Bad. Bad. Old run down rooms. No hot water in the shower (although SCORCHING in the sink). However, that was not the worst...you are right next to the new T Mobile stadium so there is LOUD music outside your room ALL night!!!! We had to go buy earplugs and that didn't help much. UHG. Never again!!!! Do not stay here! We NEVER will again. HORRIBLE!!!!! Minus 1 star. Stay far away!

Worst experience I have ever had at any hotel. Apparently they are doing construction on the rooms all around us. We called guest service and they said we told you on the website we had construction. I have not had a vacation in the last year and they ruined it. Don't stay here.

Monte Carlo is starting to show it's age, but it's still a decent on strip bargain.
Tip- pay the extra few bucks for a room upgrade, the higher floors are in much better shape than the lower ones. Lower ones would get 1 1\/2 stars from me- pretty bad.

Beds are comfortable, and the rooms are decent sized. They now give you two in room complimentary coffees (Keurig, not too bad)  to save you the hike down to the Starbucks at the food court. The CVS next door sells Keurig pods,  so you can stock up, if you are a heavy coffee drinker like myself.

Alarm clocks with phone docking station.

The resort fee (and extra $20 on top of the room rate) includes the coffee, WIRED in room internet, newspaper, and gym usage.

Pool is very good, but they have added too many cabanas, and now seating is pretty difficult, unless you show up around opening time. Pool closes at 7. They sell and rent floats for the lazy river ($10-20). Beers are about $8. DJ on the weekends.

Valets do a good job, so do the bellhops,  and the maids tend to do a much better job on the higher floors...a decent tip will certainly help in all these areas, and  is much appreciated.  Front desk service is good.

Skip the Buffet- go to Aria, Bellagio or Wynn. All good bets. The room service is fairly reasonable for Vegas.

All in all, you can certainly do worse, and the cheap rates and good pool keep me coming back. if you don't care about the pool however, I would keep looking. You can stay at a much nicer place for another $50 or so a night.

I will say first off the staff at this hotel are FABULOUS!!!! However, I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. The ventilation system in this hotel is horrible!!! I am a NON smoker and in fact I am allergic to smokers, due to breathing issues. We stayed in a nonsmoking room and the entire floor smelled like smoke and I had to keep the window cracked to get and fresh air coming in. The bathroom was gross and out dated and the shower head is made for ppl under 5' tall. The Brand restaurant was delicious and my husband enjoyed the casino. I will not stay here again due to the poor ventilation system. If you bothered by smokers DUE NOT stay at this hotel!!! You can't escape the smoke in your hotel room.

I have stayed here before but my latest stay was not enjoyable.  The outdated furnitures are now showing their age.  The door has a big chip on it.  There is no coffee machine.  The sheets are plain and looks outdated.  The room has a nasty scent.  We were in a room with 2 beds and I was itching in the bed that I was in.  The resort fee is $28 which is very expensive.  I paid almost $400 for 2 nights which I think is not worth it.  I availed of their Yusho Restaurant promotion which gives you $50 credit to the restaurant. I received my Hotel Bill and the discount was not taken out.  I am also an M life member but booking it as a member was more expensive. So I took out a star for each of these reasons.  I gave 2 stars for the Wave pool and Lazy River pool and access to the Tram going 2 other Hotels like the Bellagio. Will not come back here anymore.  I will spend my money elsewhere.
The price is relative lower in the strip. Good location, big pool, huge parking lot. Room just so so and kind of old. The room keeper will enter into your room without knocking on the door.
Awwww, this is the way Vegas was meant to be....not too pretentious, but still a little bit of everything.

My friend and I came here for a quick girl's getaway in Vegas. We booked the summer escape package and planned to use most of the offerings.
When we arrived on Thursday night we waited in line for about 10 minutes to check in. The woman that checked us in was super friendly and gave us an upgrade room facing the pool, since there were no more queen non-smoking rooms available. Thumbs up for her!

We went up to our room, primped and planned to use the 2 for 1 appetizer and free champagne that came with the package, but by the time we got down to the caf around 10:15, it was closed (What closes at 10PM in Vegas???)

The next day we planned on hanging out by the pool for the whole day floating on the lazy river. We arrived at the pool early and found some seats. By 11:00AM on Friday morning the pool was already really crowded. I recommend arriving early if you want a beach chair. Part of our summer escape package included 2 for 1 raft rentals. When we went up to the rental counter, the guy said they don't do paid rentals anymore and that we needed to buy a raft for $50 we'd get a rental for free. (WHAT? I PAID EXTRA MONEY FOR THIS DEAL AND NOW YOU WANT ME TO PAY ANOTHER $50 FOR A CHEAP RAFT AND RENTAL? THIS IS BAIT AND SWITCH PEOPLE!!!)

The room was clean and plain, but we were in Las Vegas to party, not to sleep! It did the job. I liked the location since it was an easy trek to the city center where all the newer hotels are.  I might consider staying there again, but I will never pay for a package again when they make it so difficult use what you paid for.

I got an amazing price with booking with southwest at the Monte Carlo. The hotel was close enough to all the attractions Las Vegas has to offer. The people at the front desk were helpful. The hotel room was average nothing to brag about: it was clean and the beds were comfy. The pool was relaxing with the lazy river even though you had to rent the tubes. The buffet was meh but we got the buffet for free so no complaints from me. There were lots of other shops and food in the hotel. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again.

We arrived late at night, and noticed that there's no lane for check-in.  The valet working the driveway told us where to self-park and didn't inform us that the valet is free!  Our room was completely done up in beige.  The clock radio did not work and the shower didn't drain properly.  I had to notify maintenance twice before they fixed the shower, but the staff was very accomodating.  The room was spacious enough and though not completely soundproof, we were fairly certain that our neighbors couldn't hear our baby crying.  I would only stay here again if it was significantly less expensive than its neighbors.

Monte Carlo has no nightlife (read no night club) and no attractions.  The pool area has a "lazy river" you can float in.  The arcade is beyond small and boring.

Room service has a nice selection.  The cleaning staff is very good, but uses way too much lemon-scented aerosol air freshener.  You have to pay for the gym.  And worse, you have to pay $11 per day per laptop for an internet connection.

The casino floor is loud and bright.  It has its share of smokers (of course) but is well ventilated enough that it doesn't totally reek.  Alongside are a food court and the following restaurants:
* Market City Caffe (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/ppmYIHMCIL5bocUsJSsDWA?hrid=m3R1TFBnWTzGB_8XxuCLjA)
* Andre's Monte Carlo (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/pmoIMK8zGWvKsVOPDBYfzg)
* Monte Carlo Buffet (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/V9klA6JGT6Fz2UpVP_7sBw)
* Dragon Noodle Company (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/5VXlHFrYZZzj7zfZEsz5nQ?hrid=MxhxTquKMr4DI2QE3IZcCw)
* Monte Carlo Pub & Brewery
* Cafe (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/-JfncbVURtvuzBbof40o1w?hrid=MLe5OT6nlKSseKc7yWAuCw)

Hotel is old, we checked in no problem get our keys and we go to the room. We opened the door and it's not what we paid at all. The carpet was ripping,the furniture was chipping and old and the water took a while to go down from the sink.The beds were so old and the whole room was antique. I was very surprised the room this way, they did have the pool close now for 1 year due to construction and you have to take a shuttle to go to either MGM or Mandalay bay. I think they should update their hotel rooms to keep their customers happy,and our guest paid for a suite and they gave him the incorrect room that he paid $100+ more for 1 king when he got to the room it was a 2 bedroom. When we going down to the lobby there was such a strong smell of bleach\/cleaning products that you can see the cleaning lady's cart using a whole amount. Monte Carlo did refund our money since it was less than 20 mins of check in and thank you. We booked MGM which was a total different experience ! Loved their Executive king suite! Check their rooms so much better be nothing beats Venetian! Over all never again with Monte Carlo, not my personal choice to stay and get comfort.

Stayed here last month.  I have since talked to guest services and was given a 50.00 credit for my stay.  Makes up for some of the terrible service.  First the good- the pool area is great, but you can't take anything in not even water.  Brand Lounge is amazing.  It's small, but great music and the best service we had was here.
The bad- There is no wifi in the rooms only the lobby, the rooms are dated (but i could live with that since I wasn't there much), I had a smoking room and the ashtray was taken and not replaced, the service all around was terrible from the place we ate to the concierge desk.  If you're looking for a cheap place to stay this would work.  But don't expect service with that.

The hotel is really nice it is not as luxurious as other hotels on the strip but it's elegant it's not too much and the name Monte Carlo works for the hotel. Monte Carlo is peace and quiet and fun I enjoyed the shows I enjoyed the casino the fast food restaurants inside the hotel or not that great but the gourmet restaurants are really good. I like my stay in hotel 32. Very relaxing

Stayed here one night, 1\/23\/2015,on a last minute trip. My parents had asked us to come out and offered to pay for our room. We're MLife members so I checked to see if we had any offers, didn't want them to pay an outrageous amount so I decided to go with The Monte Carlo's offer. It was $85, then with taxes and the resort fee it was $123 and some change. We had never stayed here before so we figured why not.

Check in was just a little bit of a hiccup. My parents had come the following day to pay for the room and apparently asked the lady who helped them if there would be any trouble when we arrived and checked in, if they weren't with us. She told them the room was all paid up and there should be no problems. Well there was, we were asked to show the credit card that was used to pay the balance. Well we obviously didn't have it and thankfully one of my parents were with us when we checked in.

The lady who checked us in wasn't very polite about the whole ordeal, which was irritating. I understand they have a policy and there was a mix up when they asked the original lady they dealt with but you're in customer service. Being short and impolite isn't the way to go and reflects badly on your resort.

After that we had no problems. Every other employee we encountered was polite and helpful. Room was average but clean and bed was comfortable. I completely agree with other reviewers in that it's about time the rooms had an update. But for the most part our stay was enjoyable and we might consider staying again.

(writing the review while still here...)

pros: 
good location

cons: 
#1- if you have mLIFE priority check-in, forget it. it wasn't available when we checked in and i've been watching everytime we go downstairs...NO ONE IS THERE...roped off.

#2- hotel looks promising but the rooms look like a La Quinta.

#3- no writiing pens in the room.

#4- no wifi info provided until i called.

#5- no mention of construction going on AND the pool being closed when i booked this.

#6- air conditioning will not meet set point. reasonable setpoint,

#7- super dim lighting in the suite bathroom.  can't see to shave face!

#8- closest hotel-managed snacks\/drinks\/sundries vendor can't read my business debit card.

#9- don't forget a razor blade.  $25.99 downstairs (and they can't read wells fargo debit business card or manually enter the numbers). wtf

#10- significant carpet stains on 29th floor.

Wow.  I can't put together a coherent review which would capture the "run! don't walk!" for anyone considering booking a reservation here.  The first assault is olfactory.  The MC "perfumes" their common areas and casino with something best described as Ozium and urinal cake at the Greyhound bus terminal.  What? Why?!?

The "decor = tired"?  OMFG, my frat house last century was in better shape than this tijuana brothel.  Just pathetic.  We moved from 8th, to 9th and then 24th floor in sequence, a futile "Escape from Craptastica!".  Each floor has less busted stuff, but in the end, nothing even reach Howard Johnson status.

The vaunted pool?  I would rather go to Rosarita Beach and wallow in a Papas & Beer cesspool of Nortenos Spring Break urine.  That almost captures it, I really felt as if I was in some Cancun sh1thole with a bunch of low-rent state school college kids on Spring Break.

The Monte Carlo never pretended to be the Venetian, or Mandelay Bay, or Bellagio back in the day.  But a value proposition it is no more.  It's a tired old rag of a hotel with no pretense that they give a damn about anything, so there you are.

The workout area and spa are definitely acceptable, I will give a gentlemen's B+ on this feature only.  Woe betide anyone who isn't physically off spa premises at 7:01P as you'll get the bum's rush at closing time.  But if you're a saavy consumer of value, $10 for the spa is a great deal.

I'll wrap up this revue with a simple observation about the Monte Carlo for anyone who brings their laptop in case they're thinking of doing email and perhaps some work while enjoying a 5 day visit to the Strip...at the Monte Carlo, even the DSL is slow...
Great hotel - good location and overlooked in favour of the bigger names (so better prices than its better known relatives) - give it a try as an alternative to nyny or mgm grand.

Staying here was the worst experience we've encountered! 
The customer service at this hotel is horrendous.  We went for my mom's 50th birthday and they made offers over the phone then retracted them once we checked in. In addition,  they argued about a buffet discount that was offered through their own affiliates.

Conveniently located in the middle of strip.  It's connected to two other hotels via tram.  Easy access from the parking to the hotel.  They have great deals for their rooms and the rooms are pretty nice.  They just opened up the new below 5 ice bar. The eternity pool is nice, kind of crowded, but they have cool hosts and are very friendly.  My boyfriend and I are definitely going back!

All I have to say about this hotel is that I don't think I will ever be staying here again.  Maybe I'm just picky but this place was very dull.  You go to any casino on the strip and you'll find it a lot more busy and rowdier than over at Monte Carlo.  Not to mention the not-so-friendly staff who took all of my gambling money.  Okay, I can't exactly blame them for my losses (which I will never gamble here ever again), but the service definitely did not make it any better.  From the point I checked in to the point I checked out, I think there was only one staff member who was actually friendly out of the 298437592 others that worked there.  

As for the rooms, I got a deluxe room but after staying in this very dimly lit room with cheap carpet and just an icky ambiance about it, I had no choice but to upgrade ourselves to a spa suite, just because I couldn't stand it.  I admit, the suites are the only good thing that the hotel has going for it.  The jacuzzi was nice and the suite itself was not bad but that still does not change my opinion of this place.  The view isn't much because of construction but even without it, you wouldn't be able to see much.

My recommendation is to stay at NY-NY next door or MGM across the street but steer clear from this place.

My husband and I were going to book here because it was located near the Polo Towers where our daughter was staying. However, we had a problem with the resort fee due to the fact the pool was closed and asked if they would waive the fee. Customer service replied " we do not waive resort fees until the property is booked." We were denied talking or a call back from a supervisor is this "resort" thinking. Why would we book a room if we had a problem with the amenities and I do not believe a pool relates to a resort and if we got there they did not waive and we are stuck with it. Who wants to walk a mile to a neighbor property to use "their" pool. We have stayed at 5 star resorts "industry rated" and they truly are. When is it that consumers do not disagree with a fee that use to be considered an amenity and treated like crap. Now Super 8 charges resort fees. Monte Carlo is working their way towards "Motel 6" status. Charge what you have to charge but do not disguise it as a resort fee when you want to make more on the room and when does a pool and wifi make you a resort.  You are not even offered free entry to use the spa facility which would be a resort item. Do they offer combs, blow dryers, brushes, sandals, robes etc to make it a true resort or is it just super greedy companies. Could you call a bellman to bring you a bucket of ice or do you get to do it yourself.

Just stayed in the hotel for the first time this last weekend. If the hotel was in any other city in America, you'd probably think it was fantastic, but for Vegas it leaves a lot to be desired. Nothing terrible here and I would probably stay again if the price were right, but they just don't pay close attention to the details.

The tv and cable package are bad. No wireless internet (even though you have to pay a resort fee). The shower is older and not that great. The hallways are often cluttered and dirty. Elevator buttons sometimes don't work. Stuff that really annoys you.

That being said, they did provide us with a crib and refridgerator at no charge. The casino is nice and it's in a great location. The all day buffett was decent and relaticely inexpensive. All in all, it's an ok place if the price is right.

A few things about our stay could of made this my first trip to Vegas a more enjoyable experience. We asked for a room with a view of the strip. The view we got from the 8th floor was of the recycling bins which they empty bottles in even after midnight which is not a very quiet experience. A few things did stand out. The valets all of them were really friendly and pleasant. Made sure always we were in the right place or if we needed a cab. The room attendants seemed like they left our room nice and clean with fresh towels.  I never saw one to ask for my bed to be untucked. Food court pretty good. Shops decent selection. Another thing was when we asked about getting a comp at the Mlife desk she said I could get a Starbucks with it. When I went to Starbucks it was actually for $25 in coffee!! I know Starbucks is expensive but I had to use it all or lose the balance which was not explained to me at the desk which would of been nice. Anyways Monte Carlo thanks for the memories too bad you just came short on making a good experience great.

Awesome pool area but it gets crowded.

The rooms were ncie and clean but you can hear people next door....

The views are not so great either. Having to open the blinds we had a metal chimney thing in our way.

Last weekend my boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo with my brother and sister-in-law. Before booking a hotel in vegas, we did a lot of searching and wanted to find a hotel that was reasonably priced with a good pool. We ended up choosing Monte Carlo.. and after this weekend I wish we would have decided on another hotel. 

We arrived late Thursday night (close to midnight) and the line to check in was about an hour wait. They only had two people working!! Finally someone was smart enough to request backup and once a few other employees came to help the line moved much quicker. Once we arrived at the front desk, we were greeted by an extremely rude male employee. He acted if we had just ruined his evening by walking into his place of business! As we were checking in, he informed us that only one room would have a king (which we both requested) and the other would have a queen. Then he said they would be smoking (we requested non-smoking). We asked if there was anything he could do to make changes because we would be extremely unhappy with those accommodations. He said there was nothing he could do and then gave us a figure as to how much it would cost if we wanted to cancel our reservation. At this point I asked to speak to the manager.

Once the manager arrived he was extremely polite and apologetic for his employee (must happen often!). He gave both rooms a $50.00 credit to a variety of restaurants in the hotel. He found two non-smoking room, one with a king and one with two queens, which at this point was fine with us because we wanted to be done with this process already! 

The hotel was extremely out-dated and we had a worker come up UNANNOUNCED to fix something in the bathroom. My boyfriend stayed at Harrah's for a fraction of the price the last time he was in Vegas and he said the rooms looked exactly the same! 

We figured the pool would be the saving grace for the hotel... but sadly we were mistaken. Unless you are traveling with children - this pool is not for you! There were kids everywhere!! Not that I can't stand children (I've been a nanny for 6 years) but when I want to take a dip in the pool, cruise down the lazy river, dance in the wave pool with the DJ playing music, or lay out.. I'd prefer not to hear screaming kids or be splashed like crazy! 

And to top off this awful experience, my credit card has been charged an extra $150 on top of what the total charges for our stay were. I called the front desk (which took over 20 minutes waiting on hold to finally get a live person) and they said that its just an insurance charge that will be removed once the total room charge has gone through on the account - WRONG! At this moment my card has approved, and been charged both the total charge for the weekend AND the $150 "insurance". I am calling back today to get this sorted. 

The only thing this place has going for it is the location on the strip 

OVERALL : Monte Carlo = Monte Crapo!!

Hmm...I have mixed feelings about this place. 

The Pros:
-Lazy river! :) wave pool!

The Cons:
-ice vending machine on our floor was not working 
-shower head was leaky
-bathroom smelled like smoke even though it was a non-smoking room (bad vent?)
-front desk workers contradicted one another and give me different answers when i asked them about the complimentary buffet passes (if you don't know the answer, please ask your supervisor!)
-mandatory resort fee

The $20 resort fee per day also had a 12% tax on it. During check in we tried to get them to waive the fee since we never use the amenities the resort fee is supposed to cover (i.e., coffee and water bottle in the room, printing service, newspaper, etc).  however, their policy is that the fee is mandatory for everyone.

Also, when we booked our room, it came with 2 complimentary buffets. I was very annoyed that when I asked 3 different people from the front desk how to use the complimentary buffets (like, is it for breakfast? lunch? Is there a max value to it?) they each gave me a different answer. 

Overall, 2.5 but since my previous stays here were not as terrible, I'll round up to 3 stars

Ok, so I've been there a few times but never stayed....this review is for the Hit Bar & Lounge located in the Monte Carlo.  Let's just say it's one of the best real drink bars in all of Las Vegas.

When you walk in from the strip, the Hit Bar is just past the steakhouse on the right.

The best thing about this bar is that it is NOT focused on tourism or video poker or anything other than drinks.  They take classic drinks from around the most popular hotel bars in the USA and replicate them!  They present all of them in a cool faux leather bound menu...and fix very traditional and proper concoctions.

The bartenders are real, no sloppy drinks here.  If you want a Bud Light or a shot or a crappy drink, just go somewhere else.  If you're looking to get your money's worth for a superior blended beverage, then indulge and enjoy.  One of the best "secret" finds on the strip!!

If you like real drinks, stop here...you will not be disappointed.

Picked this hotel because I wanted a good location on the strip, which it is. I booked through Priceline because booking directly through the hotel is way overpriced because it is basic; clean rooms with comfortable beds but nothing fancy, extra or special. Skimpy on towels and soap. :\/ We didn't enjoy the parking charge, even for self parking. But that isn't this hotel's fault, all of Vegas is doing this now. -__- 

The customer service was great though, front desk employee gave us an early check in and a room away from the construction. There was a situation our first night with the room next door. Security was quick to handle it and assured us that if the situation continued we would be moved to another room\/floor. That wasn't necessary though. 

My husband left his suit in the room and remembered once we had checked out, so we called about getting it back and were told to fill out a form online and IF the item is found we would receive an email. Depending on how that goes I'll update this review.

I usually don't complain or write reviews about things, but this is a MUST! 

Wouldn't even give them one star if I had a choice.

Don't bother wasting your time  money to stay at this 4 star hotel that is dirty, old and that offers low quality service. 

I am very disappointed and disgusted with my experience at Monte Carlo hotel this past weekend.

The room we were given  had a bad smell, like the room hasn't been used in months, and you can smell it as soon we you walk in. I called the front desk, who assured me that the room has been 'used' recently and that they will send up air freshener for the smell. 8 hours later I return to the room and no air freshener and it still smelled. I was going to take a shower before heading out to dinner when I saw that our shower was completely covered in mold!!! 

Take a good look at the picture and tell me if this looks like a room that has been used recently?!! This is a 4 STAR HOTEL folks! 

I went to the front desk immediately to complain and was so disappointed by the 'service' of an employee Juanita. Her response to my complaint after she 'talked to her manager' was 'we don't have any rooms available but you can upgrade for $20) I never asked for an upgrade to begin with and if there aren't any rooms available the LEAST they can do for the inconvenience is to change us rooms of NO CHARGE!!!

The manager (I don't remember his name but saw Los Angeles, Ca on his name tag) who didn't bother to apologize didn't want to change us rooms. After arguing,  a vacant room 'magically' appeared when 2 seconds ago Juanita said there weren't any. I've worked in customer service and the golden rule is 'The customer is always right' and apparently the employees need to be retrained because they don't know a thing about working in customer service.

To top it off, I randomly ran into a friend who was also staying at the hotel and I was telling her about our horrible room experience and she told me that she got upgraded for free without even requesting it at check in. To me, this sounds like racial profiling. She is white and I am Asian. As soon as I walked up to the front desk, it was clear that Juanita just saw me as an Asian person that wanted a free upgrade, which is clearly not the case. I don't think expecting a clean shower without mold at a 4 star hotel is too much to ask for.

The shower in our 'new' room 3116, had a clogged drain and the water took forever to go down. I wasn't going to even waste my time asking for another room change.

After this experience, Monte Carlo doesn't even deserve 1 star.

I did not enjoy this hotel. Where to begin? We arrived into town around 1:00 and called to see if we could check in early (check in time was 3:00). We were told it would cost an extra $20. Let the nickel-and-diming begin. We opted not to check in early and when we finally did make it to our room we were unimpressed. It was no better than any low-end hotel room. The fixtures in the bath tub were loose and the cold water dripped after turning the faucet off. The attendant handed us a pamphlet at check in listing the amenities at the hotel. We were excited that Keurig coffee makers were included in the room as part of the resort fee (we had seen this listed elsewhere as well). We did not find a Keurig in the room, but a cheap coffee maker with cheap coffee. We called the front desk to find out why our room did not have a Keurig, and were told they didn't have them any more. After expressing displeasure at the false advertising, they agreed to refund one night's resort fee. We wouldn't be using any of the other amenities. Also, the pool looked awesome but was closed for the season. The temps were in the mid-70s and pools at other hotels were open. Another disappointment. 

When I tried to turn on the television with the remote, nothing happened. I found that the TV was unplugged, but plugging it back in did not help matters, although I was able to turn it on with the buttons on the TV itself. The front desk sent someone up with a new remote, but that one didn't work either. They promised to send up a technician "right away", which didn't happen. A little while later someone called the room to find out if the television had been fixed, and they also promised to send someone "right away." Hours later, the TV did get fixed while we were away from the room. Also, when I tried to plug in two electronic devices, one of the outlets would not accept the plug. No idea what that was about.

Now for the positives. They had great customer services. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. It's in a good location with convenient dining options. Blue Man Group promotions are everywhere, and you're confronted with loud advertisements every time you enter the elevator. They do have a fun parade every evening that storms through the casino. The rooms were acceptably clean and the beds were comfortable. We stayed here because the price was right, but next time I'd choose a different hotel.
Very outdated rooms, you do have a better location but it's sad to say the updated rooms in Excalibur are a better option then the rooms in Monte Carlo.

I feel like the Monte Carlo deserves more credit than it gets. I recently took a trip to Vegas. Typically I'd stay at the Wynn or Aria but I was traveling with a friend who was trying to stay on a limited budget so we opted for cheaper options and came across a really good deal at the Monte Carlo. I was pleasantly surprised with my experience. While the Monte Carlo is outdated and largely lacks the luxury of hotels like the Wynn or Aria, it was great considering it only cost about a third of any of those hotels. My room was very clean, the staff was as friendly and helpful as can be, and the location is pretty good. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants as none were particularly appealing, and that's probably the biggest drawback. On the plus side, they have Sambalatte Torrefazione which quite easily makes the best coffee anywhere on the Strip. The casino is pretty low key and laid back too, which I did appreciate.

If you're looking for some world class hotel, the Monte Carlo isn't that. But if you want a comfortable stay in a convenient location with a friendly and attentive staff at a great price, the Monte Carlo should be at the top of your list.

This was the first time staying in this hotel and we really liked it. Mind you, we did manage to get a Diamond Suite on the 20th floor for a pretty good price so that could be swaying the number of stars! 

The suites are located near the elevators so no long walk down the hallway to get to your room. It was a nice size unit with a separate bedroom. The bathroom had the biggest jetted tub I have ever seen in a hotel! This room had wi-fi so that was good as well. Higher-end finishings but were a little old and could use an update.

I was not too impressed with this hotel. They screwed up our reservations (which had been made a couple of months prior) and didn't have the correct room available, which led to us having to relocate rooms during our stay. The restaurants and casino inside the hotel were mediocre at best.

Stayed here while in town for a conference. Although the staff was very polite and accommodating, the actual venue is what I wasn't happy about. The outside is beautiful of course due to the series of restaurants surrounding the hotel and the new T-Mobile Arena. The casino floor is also nice  although it does appear to be a little outdated. The rooms are a different story. They are outdated, old, stuffy and flawed. Furniture is vintage and by vintage I mean chipped and scratched, the beds are hard and I had a king size bed with little bed coverings and 3 standard pillows, not very inviting for sleeping. The bathroom tub was stained and the toilet is so loud when flushed you could probably hear it outside and down the hall. I ordered room service and the "California" omelet I ordered was horrible. Soggy eggwhites with absolutely no flavor and cost me about $30 bucks. Very disappointing, especially when you're starving and too tired to venture out of the room to get a decent meal on the casino floor.

I was also disappointed that their gym was only available between the hours of 6:00 a.m - 6:00 p.m. which made it impossible to work out. What hotel gym has these hours??? No one! Based on my experience I will probably never book here again.
Good Hotel for the valuce the sports book is pretty good although the gaming area is a little small. I like the location right on the main strip not too far from the good stuff but not.

Convenient location, dated, poor sound isolation, no WiFi, fridge in rooms

I was torn between  ** = Meh. I've experienced better and  *** = A-OK.  I have decided that "OK" represents my impression of the stay more fairly.

Stayed here with my 6 year old son Tue-Fri in mid Nov 2014. 

Overall, I do not regret the price I paid  for the hotel - $200 for 3 nights.  The best part about this hotel is its convenient location and a tram to City Center and Belagio.  It is also close to New York New York, MGM Grand, City Center, and M&M Store.

We came to LV to see shows.  Blue Man was one of them, and it is at Monte Carlo.  We both liked the show.  In fact, my son wanted to see it again, which we did.

Check in was quick on Tuesday, and the staff was friendly and polite.  The room seemed clean and did not have any weird smells.  Towels and linens were clean and beds were comfortable.  AC worked well and was reasonably quiet.  However, all this is expected, so it's not like I would award extra points for any of this.

I thought that there was a mismatch between the beautiful external appearance of the hotel and a pretty nice looking casino and an average tired-looking hotel room.  You can almost immediately tell that the hotel is older and that the attention to detail is lacking.  

* There was some cable coming out of the wall that had a cut end.  There was another cable that was stapled along the bottom of the wall, but it was not straight, and a considerable portion in the middle was not stapled so a slack was just lying on the floor.

* The desk had a hole drilled through it.  It probably had something attached to it, which since has been removed, but no one bothered repairing the hole or putting a plug to at least cover it.

* The bathroom had all traditional gold color fixtures except for the shower valve which was brushed nickel, and a modern square chrome shower head with four square holes from which water was shooting out in an unpleasant pattern.

* The free TV reception was horrible - grainy with washed out colors, like if they were using a rabbit ears antenna, but they were not.  There was a cable connecting TV to the wall.

* Sound isolation between rooms and between a room and the corridor is terrible.  I could hear doors opening and closing, and people in corridor and neighbors in their room speaking in normal voices (not screaming).  Then, I heard neighbors getting it on - "Ai...  ai...   ai...", but they were done quickly.  Thanks, man!

* I was annoyed that for the $20 "resort fee" the hotel does not provide anything of real value.  They just charge $20 to be able to advertise a low base rate.  The "resort fee" includes 2 small bottles of water per day, and WIRED internet connection.  They have WiFi on lower two floors but not in rooms.  In the room there is ONE ethernet cable coming out of the cable modem, so if you do not bring a laptop or a travel WiFi router, you can't use hotel's internet because tablets and smart phones do not have ethernet sockets.

* No mini fridge or hair dryer.  I did not think a modern hotel can have these two items not provided.

As I said, it worked as a place to sleep, and it was conveniently located, but rooms and servicesd could use some TLC.

A couple friends and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for a few days. And I must say that i definitely expected better! From the outside it looks pretty descent, the room however was a disappointment. From some sort of stains on the sheets (it almost looked like mold but I really don't know what it was) to stains on the towels in the bathroom. There was even a dirty pad behind the lamp desk! How disgusting is that??? The walls are paper thin because we were woken up in the wee hrs of the morning to our lovely neighbors getting it on. The room was small and dark, outdated furniture...the list just goes on. Overall, we were just disappointed with the Monte Carlo as a hotel. On a positive note, they had this little restaurant inside called "The Cafe" and it had some yummy food! And really good deals during happy hour! However, we definitely won't be going back whenever we visit Vegas. The Rio was a MUCH better stay. Bigger room, cleaner bathroom and just better atmosphere in general. They were even cheaper. The Monte Carlo just takes advantage of its location on the strip, which is a good location (probably the best thing about the hotel). My opinion, try other hotels.

Was better than the first hotel I stayed in on my first visit to Vegas. Hotel was decent no microwave $34 resort fee and $150 security fee just a basic room ice machine at the end of the hall. Oh yeah please tip Paula when at the casino she got pissed when I didn't lol

Horrible! Have been here 30 minutes and check in experience has been the worst I have experienced in quite awhile. In addition:
1. Long line to check in
2. They refuse a valid and active credit card
3. They didn't give me the room I had reserved several weeks ago.
4. They gave me 2 queens instead of the king bed I had requested.
5. AC is barely working in my room - and of course it is 100+ outside

Avoid this place unless you have no other choice! Their customer service is non-existent!

The Monte Carlo is one of my very favorite casinos to stay in on the Strip! We live in Vegas, but do a "staycation" once in a while. The MC has great restaurants and bars. The beds aren't as awesome as some of the other hotels, but it is always clean, the staff are professional. I loved the Brew Pub, but it is no longer there, but I look forward to trying its replacement!

No, not acceptable! 

I stayed two nights in April, as I had tickets to see the Backstreet Boys at the Axis. Unfortunately, my budget didn't allow for me to stay at the Planet Hollywood. 
So I found the Monte Carlo, which I always considered as one of the more luxurious hotels on the strip. Boy, was I wrong. 
I arrived around 4 PM. There was an insane line for check-in (it was a Thursday-yes, the start of the weekend! However, never had this problem at the MGM or the Linq, or any other hotel on the strip I stayed at)
There was a line for mobile check in, which didn't work for most of us trying to check in on our phones. Staff was extremely unhelpful.
Got to my room. I had asked specifically to have a room on a higher floor, to stay away from the noises from the renovation. Ha.
I got a room on the 22nd or so floor. That room was last renovated in the early 90's or so it looked. I found a purple clip on nail and various peanuts on the floor. Obviously, they don't clean the room properly between guests. 
The walls between the rooms are a real joke. I heard ALL of the phone conversations from the room next door. And I heard when he flushed the toilet, and I head when he got back to the room, and I heard his alarm go off in the morning... you get the gist!
The elevators are scary to say the least! They look like they could use a replacement. The carpet in the hallways is disgusting and it's all lifted. I get it, you guys are renovating. Ever considered keeping the hotel closed? I don't think these terrible reviews are good for business. 

Next time I'll be staying at the MGM, where, by the way, the guests were sent if they wanted to go to the pool. If you guys don't have a pool for the time being, either remove the resort fee or at least cut it in half!

Very disappointed.
As I walked into the room, I found a pair of dirty stockings hanging on the bathroom mirror.
I called front desk, and without apologizing told me they would send housekeeping to pick them up (That took more than 45mins).
I spoke of my concern about the rest of the room being clean, and their answer was "I don't know".
I was not offer a different room, any compensation... Not even a ticked for a show!
I felt unwelcome.

For check in, line was very long despite we have been paying all.
Noisy hotel, we could not sleep well. There was annoying sound at 5 AM to 5.30 right next door. And then the noisy show was not over : a female housekeeper was disturbing us at 7 in the morning : just for asking : do you want your room to be cleaned? When we were trying to find : do not disturb sign, we realized that they did not provide it yet on the table (like upscale hotel used to be).  My girl was so tired and sleepy but could not sleep well because of those annoying incidents. 
What was nice  : go to the back, passing food court and stores, keep walk and go down, you will see long escalator. Go up and see there is 2-3 doors connected to several hotels. Choose which one you want to go (mandarin, aria, belagio). If using tram, it will be totally free and tram will be on 24 hrs.

This hotel wasn't bad. It was my first time in Vegas and after walking around and seeing other hotels I will more than likely stay somewhere else next time but again it wasn't bad. It was affordable which worked for the group I was with. The only complaint I have was the bathroom in our hotel room. Wasn't very clean but everything else was fine.

Just got back today.. 45 minute check in then we had to wait 2 hrs for our rm to be ready.. yes and the front desk put a rush on it. After 2 hrs waiting i got my rm and a compd buffet. We stayed in a spa suite. The view was nice but the room. So not worth being called a suite. Stains everywhere, the floor was wet, carpets dirty. Please don't pay full price for this. I got it for $55 and was worth just that. 
2 stars because of the location, the ease of self parking, and something I really look for is ease of the hotel. Very easy access from Ur room to the casino and a quick walk, and Ur on the strip. I would stay again but not in a suite. O and the buffet was gd because it was free. So not worth the $18 for breakfast.
Great weekend bad customer service

This is the place if you want a relatively quiet, clean, cheap, and comfortable place to stay on the strip.  I would rather stay some place I could sleep and then walk to the more lively modern places on the strip.  

The pool area was great.  My group got to the pool early for our pick of chairs.  If you don't come early, then your pretty much out of luck on where you want to sit or you just might not even get a place to sit!  I love summer.  Women and bikinis make me happy.  They played a variety of music catered to the 20's crowd.  

They also have a variety of gambling tables and slots in the casino.  Las Vegas is the only place I've ever seen people loose money and still smile.  I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again.

I stayed here overnight and was somewhat disappointed.The room decor takes you back when the Bee Gees were still together and we only had three channels on TV. My room had that shaggy carpet look from 1973;REALLY AWFUL. The bathroom was a little dirty and the bathtub was uncomfortable and it took forever for the water to drain. I would describe this hotel as a Best Western experience or a upgraded Motel 6. I know that they are renovating the pool but the rooms need a serious upgrade. When you think Monte Carlo, you think about ritz, glamour, and superb style. This hotel does not offer any of those amenities. Also, you really need to add a second Stair Climber in the Fitness Center. Come on MGM Resorts you can do much better.

My gf and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for four days in the Monaco Suite. I was really looking forward to this trip b\/c it was a gathering of cousins.

We started by going to happy hour in the afternoon at The Caf. I ordered Chicken Tikka. About 2.5 hours later, I started to break out in sweats and had to go to the bathroom multiple times. It kept me sick throughout the night including my dinner at a Brazilian steakhouse with the group of 15. I totally didn't get my money's worth b\/c I had only two plates before having to go back to my room.

I thought about all the things I ate and drink up until that point and I could not find any other explanation except for that Chicken Tikka. DO NOT ORDER IT!

After several hours of napping back in the room, I tried to get settled in and take out my luggage. That's when we found a number of problems. There was a bottle of KY Jelly in the drawer next to the bed, a bunch of trash in the drawer under the TV and the bathroom faucet was full of gunk.

I took photos of all three items and went to Guest Services to complain. The gentleman listened to my complaints and saw the pictures I took. He apologized and gave me a $50 credit and said he would get me another room that's equal or higher. I said since it's already 12am, I can wait until the morning. He said okay and someone will call me between 12pm and 5pm tomorrow.

The next day, we went for lunch and put the privacy card on the door. I still haven't received a phone call after 2pm So we went back to guest services to check the status.The gentleman told me that it looked like we are downgrading to another room. I was extremely frustrated and upset so I explained the whole situation to him. He had to get a manager (CeCe) to get me an upgrade. Cece comes and said there's nothing for me. I explained my situation again, showed her the pictures and then she had a change of mind. She gave me an upgrade and said someone will come up with room keys for me to a new room.

When we returned to the room, we realized the privacy card was gone from the door. Someone came in and cleaned our room. What the heck! So we got our keys a bit later and moved everything into the new room.

The new room was the Diamond Suite on the 18th floor. So we walk in and after a few steps,I stepped on a Cheeto on the floor. Then we found a pair of jeans in the bedroom, the shower handle was full of gunk and some of the lights did not work. Despite all of that, we were willing to deal with it b\/c at least there's no KY Jelly in the drawer. We started to unpack and I realized that my cigar cutter is gone. It was sitting on the table in my previous room. I'm pretty sure housekeeping took it.

The new room also didn't have a privacy card or an in-dining menu. I had to write a note on a piece of paper and stick it outside of my door for "DO NOT DISTURB." 

This was the most frustrating stay I've ever had in Vegas. Besides the location of the Monte Carlo, there is nothing to like about this place. It was dirty, I had my stuff stolen, my room was cleaned despite the privacy card and I got food poisoning from their food. I would not recommend anyone to stay here for all of the reasons above. If I had to do it all over again, I'd spend the extra money to stay elsewhere. It's not worth saving the few bucks per night.

an oldie but a goodie. there's nothing spectacular here (except for the Jabbawokeez and the pool.. haven't used it but i've heard about it!). this hotel gets the job done. everything is just enough; not particularly exceptional and not ridiculously bad. just right. 

The rooms here are quaint. I didn't have any crazy stains (thank god) like some other reviewers. In Vegas i don't know how much time all of you spend in your rooms but we were rarely there (and if we were there we were passed the hell out lol). beds are cozy, tv is a cube, and bathroom is presentable. again, nothing to woo you... it is what it is. 

what i love about the monte carlo is their food court. i don't eat too much, i'm more of a snacker. while vegas is full of amazing buffets i never get my money's worth. do i really want to shell out 40 bucks to eat one plate of pick and pull stuff? not really. ill take my dollar menu thank you! the food court is open all the time (i went at 3am to get a pizza at sbarro). they have your mcds, sbarro, subway, starbucks.. just to name a few. similar to a mall foodcourt only less crowded. big plus? it doesnt smell like casino in there! 

front desk people are friendly, they don't judge. me and my girl wandered into the lobby after a fun night at TAO only to realize we forgot what room we were staying in. we went up to the front desk attendant and explained our situation then she happily tended to us. thank god she didn't give us a "these drunk b*tches" look otherwise we wouldve exchanged some words. YAY for help! 

A-OK monte carlo. when people tell you you're old just say you're a classic.

We chose the Monte Carlo to stay at during Martin Luther King weekend since there was a cheap deal for about $70\/night. I guess there was a reason for this. The customer service during check-in and check-out took unnecessarily long (15-20 minutes per customer), and our room wasn't even clean when we walked in! After calling the front desk, they said the earliest they could get someone to clean our room was in 3 hours. Unbelievable. The amenities were decent, beds were ok, bathrooms were a bit small, and the location is great. Unfortunately it was the lack of customer service that earned this rating.

Stayed at the Monte Carlo for my niece's 21st birthday, and all I can say is *what a disappointing experience* - just poor customer service all the way around. Is there such a thing as negative stars?

At check-in we were given keys that didn't function, so after we schlepped all of our stuff up to the room, we had to go back down to the lobby and wait another 10 minutes to have a fresh key made. Apparently the front desk clerk didn't even check us into our room the first time around. Fortunately the second set worked, so we went in to freshen up and go have some fun.

The first sign we should have checked out and gone somewhere else was the hair all over the bathroom floor. The dirty toilet and tub faucet that ran (not a drip, either, but a steady stream) constantly weren't really promising signs either.

But, 21st b-day, right? We were *determined* to have fun! So we went down to the concierge to see where we could have the most fun. Since my niece turned 21 at midnight, we wanted to take her to someplace fun for dinner and a club after she was finally legal. The concierge sort of flipped through a book, pointed to a couple of places, but didn't really offer any suggestions,offer  to book us a table with bottle service - it was like they couldn't be bothered to put out the effort. I could have gone through any Vegas visitor's guide and done that. So, we did. Honestly, the waiter at brunch the next day was more helpful than any concierge at the Monte Carlo. He told us where the best clubs were and not only hooked my adorable niece and sorority sisters with wristbands for free entry and drinks, he also hooked up her four 40-something aunts with a smile. Too bad he was at Planet Hollywood!

Hoping that the first day was an aberration, we went down the next  to get directions to VegasStrEATs, an art and gourmet food truck event that was happening across the street from the El Cortez. This particular concierge had never heard of the El Cortez, though she spoke such broken English that it took several minutes of back and forth for me the get that she didn't know what we were talking about. While this was going on, the other 3-4 desk clerks around her pretended they didn't see what was going on. After asking if anyone else who worked there had *any* clue where it might be, one of the guys kind of dissmissively told me "That's downtown" and gave us a map. Which was nice, except it was a map of either the Strip *or* Downtown, without directions about how to get from one to the other.

We chanced taking directions from the valet anyway, but after an hour of driving around in some sketchy neighborhoods, we finally gave up. 

The only points I can give the place *at all* were the creepy-cool Engrish-style ad campaign for their Dragon Noodle House and its proximity to The Cupcakery. Everything else was just another bullet point in my "Why I'll Never Stay at the Monte Carlo Ever Again, Ever" list...

Stayed in this hotel Sunday through Thursday. I've stayed in a variety of hotels, both high end, and low end. I give this hotel a solid 4. Our king-bed room was on a high floor. Initially we were given the choice of waiting for a high floor, or taking a lower floor ready room. The room we were given was right by the pool, which was quite loud. I wanted to get some r n r on this trip, so that wouldn't work. A quick call to the front desk, and twenty minutes later we were in a room on the 15th floor with a different view. The front desk staff was excellent.

The room was basic, but nice. It was quite roomy, especially the bathroom. The chairs were a bit worn, but other than that, it was quite comfortable. The water pressure for the shower was very strong, but that was perfect for me. I'm used to a low pressure shower. It was definitely better than I was expecting. Please note that there is a resort fee (seems standard for the hotels on the strip), which included bottled water, USA Today, and Internet (bring an adapter to plug in tablets, etc). There's also a Keurig maker, and 2 pods. 

We booked this hotel for the pool complex. The wave pool was fun, as was the lazy river. I actually had more fun strolling\/swimming, than in the hard-to-control inner tubes (5$ for rentals).  There's a larger pool where most adults hung out\/talked. There were a lot of chairs, some even in shade! I preferred the pool later in the afternoon. It was a bit more emptied out.

The location was great. There was a tram to the Bellagio (don't know why anyone would take a cab when a bit of walking got you anywhere for free), which gave us access to more hotels on the strip. There was a CVS down the block, and a Walgreens across the street. Go here first if you need anything, or want to buy drinks. Much better pricing! We were also next to the NY NY, which connected us to walkways to MGM, and Excalibur. From the MGM you can get the Monorail, and from Exacalibur, you can get to the trams to Mandalay Bay, and the Luxor. Also nearby is a discount ticket seller, which sold discounts to the local restaurants and many shows. We bought vouchers for the Buffet, and Cafe at the MC. The buffet was a bit of a let down, not much for vegetarians when it came to dinner. It was fine for brunch. I knocked down a star b\/c of the buffet. The Cafe was a tasty choice for sandwiches, etc.

The casino and hotel were much smaller in comparison to the nearby hotels, but we liked that. Being out of the hype was a relief. Can't comment on the table games, only played craps for a bit. But the staff seemed friendly. 

We went to the Blue Man Group show (so much fun!), and got discounts because we were hotel guests. Perfect. We also went to the Minus 5 bar, which was a lot of fun. Coolest place in the desert (yes I'm a dork). 

Overall I would stay there again.
Parking sucks at this casino!!!  But the hotel itself is quite nice inside.  I thought the beds were way too soft though, I woke up with a back ache cause of the lack of support.

I stayed here Thanksgiving weekend, and all I can say is that MC is an absolutely disgusting establishment.

Granted, MC is your more economical choice for staying on the Strip. I wasn't expecting anything extravagant, but after my experience here I would have gladly put down the $30 extra a night to stay at a decent hotel.  My terrible visit began with the hour-long wait to check in.  I know Thanksgiving weekend is mega busy for Vegas, but come on.  When I finally made it to the check-in desk, I was informed the room I booked was unavailable, and was assigned one equipped with handicap facilities. No big deal.  That is, until I got up to the room, pulled back the comforter, and discovered a pool of BLOOD on the the sheets! It was everywhere and so horrifically disgusting!! 

I immediately when back down to complain, where I had to wait another hour just to talk to someone.  When I finally did get a hold of a person, they were only willing to change out the sheets.  Uh, hell and no on that! My God, there was BLOOD on that freaking bed!  The MC staff acted like I was complaining about a full trash can or something!  

 I demanded a room change, even though they kept insisting there weren't any available rooms.  They kept giving off this whole, "What's the big deal?" attitude to the whole situation, which I was not having. Finally, after asking for a refund, they offered to upgrade my room for free.  The new room was decent, (of course though, the bathroom lights didn't work and we had to call and have them replaced) in that there did not appear to be blood on the bed, and since I had already wasted my whole day dealing with the MC staff I took it to try and salvage some vacation time.

Naturally, at check-out they tried charging me for the upgrade.  Dealing with MC was a nightmare.  I strongly urge others to avoid this place.  Overall, you really don't save that much compared with other hotels.   Save your time and sanity and go somewhere sanitary.

I stayed here because it was on the AAA website. Next time I will not bother. 

1. I reserved a king bed. I arrived before the allotted check out time and they said they only had 2 queens available. This was after standing in line for a bout 30 minutes to check in, the line wrapped around 3 times! Of course I was frustrated! What made matters worse is the man checking me in was RUDE. He said they would call me the next time when there would be a King room available. I asked to verify what number they would call me on and he mumbled out a phone number. 

I then told him that number did not sound right and told him my correct phone number, which he seemed to ignore. 

2. The 1st room was sad. There was pink mold in the shower. The remote to the TV did not work. I could hear everything from the next room over. 

Finally the next day after not getting called about an available king room, I went downstairs to the check in line and finally got the king room...but note they did not call me to tell me one was available. If I was not proactive I would still be stuck in the room for the next 3 nights. 

On top of all this they added 20 dollars for a resort fee! Which included two baby water bottles and WIRED internet...there was no wifi...who the heck uses WIRED internet anymore!

I am just going to try another hotel next time!

Pros: decent, but dated rooms. Not so over-the-top like other Vegas hotels.
Cons: old, uncomfortable furniture in rooms, spotty to nonexistent wifi, pitiful workout facility (8 treadmills for over 3,000 guest rooms).

I'm reading all these reviews and I'm completely dumbfounded by them.  We began our Honeymoon here - booked a room for $59\/night off of a great Travelzoo deal.  Ended up upgrading for another $50\/night to a jacuzzi suite overlooking the strip and it was perfect - the room was huge with a great whirlpool in front of the window overlooking the MGM grand and the mountains.  The room had a surround sound DVD system, a very comfortable bed, a wet bar (we didn't do any entertaining, but it was a great place to put all our crap coming and going out of the room), and a large bathroom with a big shower and a separate room for the toilet.  For a little over $100 a night, we couldn't have asked for a better place to start our honeymoon!!  The hotel is clean, has great service and we liked the smell (each casino and resort has a different aroma pumped into it, in case you haven't figured it out...).  There IS construction going on around it, but it didn't bother us at all - the pool area was clean (nothing floating in the pool, and we were there at the beginning of October) and though there was construction going on, they are well past the bulldozing phase, so it was just some general noise in the background and was generally overshadowed by the music in the pool area.  The pools were great and the service was terrific.  Our bellman who helped us with our luggage on the way out was extremely nice and even tried to call friends in CA to help us find the name of a restaurant he wanted to suggest to us (we were heading to Malibu next).  

I've never been to Vegas and it was my wife's second visit (she previously stayed at Mandalay Bay) and we both absolutely loved it.  We weren't there for "the scene" or for gambling, so I don't know about any of that.  We loved the room, the service was great, the pool was just what we wanted, and it was a good deal. 

The only caveat to this: obviously their special deals are working for them, since when we first checked in, they could only put us in a regular room with two double beds.  We ended up doing the upgrade on the second night and they were very accommodating with the change.  The regular room wasn't anything special - but not dirty, dated or noisy like some of the other complaints.  I guess if you're not facing the strip it may be noisy because of the construction, but its not like the strip side is that quiet (it is the Vegas strip...) and we couldn't hear a peep in either room.  I think people may be getting "dated" confused with "themed" - yes, the fixtures are big and ornate and old fashioned looking... perhaps French-ish?  Perhaps even Monte Carlo-ish???  Hmm...... could be!!

It was my first time in Vegas and I stayed at Monte Carlo Hotel. Rooms are clean but the bathroom needs more attention.
