(I guess I should consider the fact that the hotel was had a fire incident a year before I went... but still...) Staff were friendly and it was off the strip so I guess it is okay overall.

Rooms are ok maybe 5 out of a 10. And I've been to almost all the hotels on the strip.  Service was good. Nice customer service.  Bad part is the construction going on now!!!!   It's ok during the day, actually kinda fun to watch. But since the window in our room did not shut all the way, the continued construction all night was very loud and annoying.  Oh ya stay away from the buffet atleast  at this point.  Not good...

Do you still talk with your friends from college? High school? Middle school? I've got some awesome ladies in my life who have been there for me from the tween years thru present day. Now that I live in Las Vegas, we have the opportunity to indulge in living out our adolescent and college dreams of pool dranks, sunshine, and not having a curfew (yeah right, I think we were back in our room by 9! lol) 


We got a great deal on a room, so my friends (who both live on opposite ends of the country) convened in Las Vegas for what we call a #baecay - because we are 34 and that's what the young kids say. 

We arrived at check in time to a small line, I waited while someone else went for coffees - love having Sambalatte so close! 

Our room was clean and had a nice view. It was a little outdated. We slathered on the sunscreen and headed to the pool. No problems finding seating, and within minutes we had drinks in our hand - perfect! The bartender was doing a Red Bull and vodka promo, but let us get whatever vodka drink we wanted for the same price which was excellent. 

After a tough day of laying by the pool, and dinner nearby, we called it quits early and enjoyed watching bad reality TV in the room. 

Great location on the strip, nice pool, clean, comfortable beds, and moderate pricing. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to out of town guests who are wanting some pool time.
There was a bug crawling on our bad. The manager just said sorry and asking us to change room. My wife got allergic because of the bad. No one taking to us after change the room. Very disappointed.

Michelle A. Was awesome! She takes care of your every needs. my wife and I and kid is the first time here in Vegas and o my some of the workers go that extra mile to make your visit extra comfortable. I have told all my friends and relatives to go to Monte Carlo and ask for Michelle A. she makes this hotel awesome! I know for a fact the way she works she has a sense of pride and ownership of the hotel. Which is rare to find these days in some workers. Will return here in a heartbeat!

The hotel really needs a face lift. In the one-bedroom "suite" I booked, the furniture was beaten up and was "repaired" using marking pens.  The Internet cable (NO WIFI! -- REPEAT, NO WIFI!) was broken and despite three calls was not repaired -- I had to get under the desk and move furniture around to try to get it to work, and it never did.  You pay $20 a day as a "resort fee" for this non-functioning service.  The comforter on the main bed is super thin -- you'll need to request about four blankets.  They will bring you a cot for extra guests in the suite, which does NOT have a pull-out sofa, but charge an extra $30 a night -- so, on top of the resort fee, that's $50 a night on top of the quoted rate!  The in-room coffee cups are styrofoam.  The suite had a kitchenette, but absolutely no equipment -- no dishes, cups, etc., and no microwave!

If you try to complain to someone, you'll find that no one cares or is even concerned about TRYING to help.

The resort itself is pretty lacking, as well ... and worse, they are charging full Strip prices.  If you're going to Vegas and want to stay on the Strip, be advised not to consider the Monte Carlo.

Do not book through montecarlo website and choose one of the concert packages!!!!!!


Upon check in at the GoldMember Mlife counter they had no idea about the promotion, after spending 15 minutes speaking to about 3 people there and standing around while they called around still I received to resolve. They issue was that I received my $200 food and bev credit and the upgrade strip room but nothing about a dinner and bottle of champagne. They advised me to go to my room and call the steakhouse. 

Went to my room and called the restaurant, no one there knew anything about a promo and advised me I needed to go back to the front desk. At this point I was frustrated and just wanted to start my vacation so I left it alone. 

The next morning I went back to the front desk. There I stood for about 45 min with Karen and finally she was able to resolve that it was $200 food credit and the dinner, advised me to make my reservation at the steakhouse and order the "preshow" menu. She stated she would notate my reservations so I wouldn't have any problem. 

Went to the steakhouse that evening (good food) I ordered the preshow menu and was very happy with the service there. Great server Brian. 

When checking into the Cher concert I went to the VIP line and they stated they didn't have my name as VIP . 

Went back to the counter the next morning to see how much of my food and bev credit was remaining as well as confirm the $300 dinner would be taken off and surprise surprise it wasnt. 

Karen was off today and the note was not specific enough. Again wasted another hour at the counter with little help from the "Manager" Zach . Man he was a piece of work, and kept repeating "I dont know what the conversation you and Karen had was" and instead of actually assisted me he kept assuring me I was wrong and even though I showed him THEIR website and my confirmation email he wasn't going to give it to me. 

ALL IN ALL I SPENT $400 FOR 1.5 DAYS IN VEGAS IN A RUN OF THE MILL ROOM WITH A STRIP VIEW. AND HALF THE TRIP WAS WASTED AT THE FRONT DESK COUNTER. DIDNT GET MY VIP CHECK IN AND MY $200 IN FOOD & BEV Should of just went to Mandalay Bay. Will never go here again. 

Below you can see the promotion they have on their website and my email confirmation which clearly states KEYWORD "ALSO" AS IN AN ADDITION TO:  "Special Pre-Show Dinner for Two and Bottle of Champagne: Each of you will also enjoy a special pre-show menu at either BRAND Steakhouse or Yusho Asian Grill and Ramen House. "
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
CHER AT PARK THEATER
Through Dec 29, 2017
Book Now and receive up to $200 in Food and Beverage credit!
Stay where the party is and receive the following:

Upgrade to a Strip View room
VIP Check In Experience
Park Theater VIP Line Access
Special Pre Show Dinner for two at Brand Steakhouse and Lounge or Special Pre Show Dinner at Yusho Asian Grill and Ramen House
Bottle of champagne with dinner
Package does not include tickets to the show
Offer Code: MC17CHER

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Ms. Kasia Kinaman,
 
We look forward to welcoming you to Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. Thank you for staying with us and booking our Park Theater Room Package.
 
As part of this special package, you receive a number of special inclusions. To take advantage of these inclusions, please follow the guidelines below. 
 
Upgrade to a Strip View Room: Your Strip View room has been reserved for you. We hope you enjoy the view.
 
VIP Check-In Experience: When you arrive to Monte Carlo, please proceed to the Priority Check-In Line at our Front Desk.
 
Park Theater VIP Line Access: You may pick up your Park Theater VIP Line Access wristbands at the Park Theater Ticket Office. Simply give your name to the ticket office representative and they'll be able to provide them for you. Please note that these are not your tickets into the show. You will still need to present your purchased Cher tickets at the Park Theater entrance for the show.
 
Special Pre-Show Dinner for Two and Bottle of Champagne: Each of you will also enjoy a special pre-show menu at either BRAND Steakhouse or Yusho Asian Grill and Ramen House. Your package also includes a bottle of Champagne for the table. To take advantage of this package inclusion, please charge your dinner to your room. You may view these menus and make dinner reservations using the links below:
               
Yusho Asian Grill and Ramen: Menu & Reservations
 
BRAND Steakhouse: Menu & Reservations
 
Also, as a reminder, this package does not include tickets to the show.  If you have yet to purchase tickets to Cher, please visit ParkTheaterLV.com or call Monte Carlo Concierge Services at 702.730.7010

This review is for the hotel\/hotel rooms only.
Monte Carlo and its sister hotels charge a $9.50 "Resort Fee" PER NIGHT for which you get 2 (tiny-mini) bottles of water a day, a "free" newspaper each day (which are located in the lobby of the floor and everyone and their mother has access to), a pass for ONE person to go to their gym each day (which if you are a couple, the other has to pay), and the ability to print your boarding pass out at the hotel (which you can also do at the airport).    PLUS, you pay TAX on top of this fee!!  Seems like all of the major hotels in Vegas are starting to do this, so you should research and find out which ones don't or do - and how much it will cost you.  Basically, you are forced to pay this fee.
As for the hotel, it is okay - but it's not like the Bellagio or Mandalay Bay or one of the newer, nicer hotels.    Our room was missing the "room number" sign on the outside, so someone had to hand-write the number on the wall with a black Sharpie!  How ghetto.   I've already decided I am not going to stay there again.

I joined a little 7 day tour group and Las Vegas was my last stop before I headed home. Our group stayed at the Monte Carlo and really I have enjoyed my stay here. 

First, we were conveniently dropped off at the taxi\/bus area, a quick walk inside and immediately you're in the lobby. Thus, I cannot speak for the parking situation. Our tour guide got everyone the room keys and the elevators are located near the food court where Starbucks and other eateries are located. So points right here. 

Now for the rooms, as other fellow Yelpers have mentioned, is this the most modern, beautiful, newest, grandest hotel? Nope, however, the rooms are pretty spacious, bathroom is big and plus I'm operating on 4 hours of sleep (which still might be too many hours for being here!) so you can tell I didn't spend to many hours in there. When in Vegas; one must play! 

Also, being somewhat centrally located where New York New York to my right and City Center and other resorts to my left is why I liked my stay here. 

The casino area is easy to navigate around and getting out to The Strip wasn't a maze. Starbucks being right off the elevators was major. Need my Starbucks!! And bonus, there are many eateries located right outside in the new T Mobile Arena. 

Overall, a new place I got to experience. I don't see why one couldn't not stay here.

This the first time staying at the Monte Carlo. It will be the last.

I purchased a package through Expedia that included the airfare and hotel for 4 nights. I upgraded to a Spa Suite so I paid extra up front for a nicer room.

At check in the clerk tells me that I owe an additional $89 for a "resort fee". I told him we paid in full and was unaware that there was a resort fee but I paid it anyway just to get to the room.

First impression of the room is that it was spacious and nice. Nice bar, a couch and two chairs along with the king sized bed. The spa turns out to be a big bathtub, no jacuzzi, but ok, still romantic. 

After getting to the room we met with friends and decided to get a bite to eat and a few drinks. Well apparently the kitchen in the hotel closes at 10. We went to a connected restaurant that was not very good and last call was at 10pm. Double Barrel Roadhouse, expensive and poor quality food to boot.

Back to the room and getting ready for bed and try to connect to my computer only to discover there is apparently no wifi. I call the front desk. You are put on hold and then when it rang the person hung up. I called again and waited at least 10 minutes to speak to a clerk. I explained the problem and she said "There is no wifi above the 3rd floor. You have a wired connection." I was shocked that a "resort" hotel wouldn't have wifi in 2015. Any second rate chain hotel provides wifi to their customers. 

I then asked her what the resort fee was for. She said "You get two complimentary bottles of water a day and coffee in the room along with the wired internet. You also get a free paper if you want one and access to the pool and spa."

I was not a happy customer at that point and let her know that this was the first and last time I would be a customer. Forget using the "wired" internet if you have a tablet, not going to happen for you.

Beyond that the furniture looks like it came from a second hand store. The dresser and armoire showed some battle scars. The tile in the shower looks like it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in some time as there was some black mold? in the grout lines.

This is not a premium resort, there are many other higher quality choices. Do yourself a favor and skip this place.

I have stayed at several hotels in Vegas, from the Cosmopolitan and Wynn to Harrah's and Circus Circus, but this was probably one of the worst stays. I booked the room through Expedia, and it was very decently priced, or so I thought. It turns out that the Monte Carlo is cheaper than other luxury hotels because they charge you for everything! 

- Waited about 15-20 minutes to check in. Employee was very rude and made an unfunny joke about my last name (I'm Asian)
- Friend asked me if they had wifi, employee told her very rudely that she should ask him directly
- Room was decent size. 18th floor, great view of City Center. 
- No minifridge (would be an extra charge)
- Room safe could only be used if you swiped your credit card
- Room looked older, inconvenient outlet locations, some did not work
- Room lacked lighting. Bathroom was very dark since there was only light near the sink. Shower area was very dark. 
- Hotel fee of $20 a day, plus 12% tax on that fee. This is supposed to cover 2 Keurig coffee cups, 2 half size bottle of waters, newspaper, in-room internet (Ethernet, they don't have wifi here), etc. You only get these things if you have the staff come and clean your room.
- The coffee maker was pretty annoying in that it did not recognize the glass cups they provide. They will only recognize coffee mugs. However, when we called the staff, they said we would be charged EXTRA for coffee mugs.
- The room also does not have a corkscrew, so we had to order one for $4.50 plus tax from the hotel. Our $4.86 corkscrew http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/oIggWgX.jpg
- The bed sheets (http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/hsa3FTN.jpg), pillowcases (http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/63A3HJj.jpg), and towels (http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/W6Oi40d.jpg) had stains
- The carpet did not look vacuumed, as I found many sequins on the floor along with a Victoria Secret price tag
- The walls for the room were VERY thin. I could literally hear every conversation from the neighbors crystal clear. I could even hear their alarm going off at 10 AM. 

Other than that, the casino area was fine, and there was a food court with McDonald's etc which came in handy when we wanted a quick meal. Great central location with easy access to Aria, Bellagio, etc. Overall, I honestly had a better stay at the Circus Circus hotel than here. I expected much more from a hotel with a 4 diamond rating. I wouldn't even put this hotel in the same ranking as the New York New York or the Paris hotel. Would not come here again.

The experience was great with my friends specially when we had to walk ahort distances like 3 or more times a day. It is vetter having a monorail that connects the basic things than walking under the sun and skipping all the people!!
Rooms are regular ones nothing special but there's no way to prevent anyone coming up to the rooms.

I like this place b\/c it's simple and no frills.  The rooms are decently nice, reasonably priced and the pool is pretty good - especially for photoshoots.  I stay here for the women's tri fitness events and shooting around this hotel is great!

Despite the savings you really should spend a few more dollars and stay elsewhere.  Worst mLife property on the strip.  Rooms were clean but they appear to cut corners everywhere else to include customer services.  Pay the extra few dollars and avoid this property.

the hotel seemed nice and busy when I checked in... however my room was terrible. For the price of the room and the resort fee... it was extremely boring and lacked additional seating.  Not all of the lights worked and it just seemed mediocre.  I stayed for 2 nights.  The room was never cool and the ac barely blew even after i adjusted it.  The bed was the absolute worst.  The pillows were extremely lumpy but were like twice as high as regular pillows...the bed itself somehow set off every single pressure point in my back... so after 2 days... my sister and i limped out of there as it felt like I would have been better suited to have slept on the concrete outside of this old hotel.

Monte Carlo came highly recommended.
I was greeted by the warmest person and told me where to go and she will looked after my bag while I checked in.
The lobby looks nice and classy.
However they have no king bed for me and make me pay $10-$15 to get a king bed - ripped off!
The room was a bit bare, no fridge? My bedsheets was actually dirty, like dirt and when I pull up the top sheets, the bottom sheets was dirty as well.
In the bathroom, there is a shampoo, a conditioner, a body lotion and a soap. Very basic for the rave review I received!

I could hear my neighbour talking, when they open their doors and when they turn on the taps.

I hate myself for staying here again - I really truly do.  But people: location, location, location!  For some unfortunate reason Monte Carlo is located so damn conveniently for my family that we have a hard time going with any other hotel.  This time we figured upping our budget and booking suites might make the experience less unpleasant.  Alas, throwing money at the problem did not make it go away.  If anything, we were left even more disappointed.  

Let me tell you right now the Diamond suite looks NOTHING like the pictures you see in their marketing material.  NOTHING.  The pictures will lead you to believe you're booking a modern and stylish yet comfortable room.  And then you enter the chamber of horrors: the carpets are old, dirty and disgusting: I was again grossed out by the idea of walking on them, even while wearing socks!  The furniture is painfully outdated: the gigantic old-fashioned sectional takes up most of the space in the living room section. There is still one of those enormous wooden entertainment units in one corner of the room with a sad lonely TV sitting in it and drawers that just fly open at random intervals and stay half open all day, staring you in the face, empty, like you've been robbed.

The bathroom sinks are beige with gold faucets- the kitchen sink black with gold faucets- the shower and the entirely useless Olympic pool sized jacuzzi all come with gold fixtures and accents, management appears to have a hard time letting go of the 80's; maybe it's because Trump is so in right now.  The toilets, another beige offering are so old that after years of cleaning, the original paint inside has worn off and been replaced with a million black lines instead.  Most of their roll-away beds are broken and useless.  Need I go on??  Well, alright...

...on top of the terrible rooms, ever since they removed the nice fountain and statues from the exterior, and replaced them with a regular run of the mill coffee shop and that loud dreadful pub style restaurant, this hotel has completely lost its character - I am not sure what look they are going for, probably trying to appeal to the young and the brainless, but it's just not a unique place any more.  

And to round up my list of endless complaints: we had to pass on the pool because the water was not clean - which, after a holiday weekend with lots of super hygienic things going on in there, you'd think they'd put extra effort into maintaining, but nope.

The staff are nice enough, the food is okay and the size of the place is ideal, not too big, not too small, but my god, this poor hotel is in desperate need of remodeling.

Stayed here this past weekend for 3 nights. We were on the 22nd floor with the side\/back view of  NYNY and Excalibur. Rooms were ok,our bathroom door was hard to open,it was a struggle at times to get it open and or desk drawer would open on its own when setting something on top of it?! other then that everything worked fine! Elevator kinda slow, one time it opened and closed  2 or 3 times before it would move up to the next floor it did that 4 floors going up. Pool was nice didnt really spend that much time there tho and bed was ok kinda hard! It wasnt a bad stay nor a great one but it did its job!

One of my favorite spots to stay and gamble at in Las Vegas. 

Hotel rooms are nice - usually very clean and well maintained. Parking is very accessible to the hotel - not as much walking as other spots on the Strip. Staff is friendly and pleasant. Decent location and with a tram stop going to Bellagio and another just down the Strip that goes from Excalibur to Mandalay Bay, it's easy to get around there. 

Low key Sports Book that is often not too busy, which makes it nice for those of us who use it. 

My only complaint at Monte Carlo is that they hit you up with a $14.50 "resort fee" which to me is more of a nuisance tax. If they need the money that bad, they should just include it in the rate.

Came with party of 14! Booked 4 rooms. No pool?!?! No A\/C???!!? Can't help us?!?!!?

We were not aware of this info.  Construction everywhere (we understand) but still pay for parking?!!? Very inconvenient for HANDICAPPED family member.  We also have a family member who works for Expedia. She Cannot believe what we  are going through!!!! 

1 room with NO A\/C!!! Wow! In the Summer???!!!  Plus with 3 kids. Called front desk. "There is nothing we can do" especially with hotels that are partnered with them. What to do????

 A\/C tech was sent to our room, Cannot be fixed! Was switched to another room. Btw, everything booked?!!?? So So Sad....Not a great start for our family vacation. Very very disappointed Monte Carlo.

Nasty!!! Worst hotel ever!!
Reserved a spa suite for my b-bay ,when I got on the room the shower had human hair all over the tile on the floor and very old and run down then the actual spa floor had paint all over it in an attempt to "renew"it and it was chipping off in the water and stabbing me ...switched rooms and the second room the spa doesn't even run!f*luck this place ..if u care about your health DONT stay at the Monte carlo!

room kind of smelt like a sewer. they didn't change sheets just made the bed. found a baggy of cocaine in my sheets. mom had coffee on sheets. didn't receive room we had paid for. was an ok view of the T mobile arena. won't be returning to this hotel

Stayed at this hotel\/casino for 6 nights the week before Memorial Day and my review consists of good and not so good remarks. Overall I give it a 3. The bf and I met 4 friends in Vegas and all together we had 3 rooms. Good: our room was clean, was in the location of the hotel that we requested (strip side) but then again, if we were paying for the strip view then should I really be congratulating them on giving me what I paid for? Cost was very reasonable - Took advantage of a 20% off strip view promo which brought the price down to about $70 per night. The Resort Fee gets you - but I'd imagine that all of the hotels charge that. Location was fine especially for not paying top dollar. The hotel's pool area was a 4 out of 5. The pool options were great and the time spent in the water was a good time. The lazy river was perhaps our favorite. I had never seen a wave pool so that was a fun new experience. You could bring your adult beverages into the water with you. I did not like the lounge chair set up in the pool area. Very little seating surrounded the pools themselves and since it was crowded you often got stuck in seats that were just rows upon rows of lounge chairs staring at more lounge chairs. I would have liked to see more seating around the pool so that I could be soaking in the rays while watching my friends in the water. Lastly, I'd like to give a shout out to The Pub - a restaurant in the hotel. We ate there twice and I only wish I had more opportunities to eat there more. The service and food were great, the beer list never ending. Something like 200 beers on tap and the staff could talk about the beer and answer questions to help you choose - much appreciated. 

Now for my Not So Good remarks. The customer service is horrendous. So much so that after a few incidents my party and I were telling them we would not be staying here again. I had called the hotel 3 weeks before our arrival and had all three reservations linked together so that all 3 rooms would be on the same floor. We arrive and this had not been done. Then, they put 2 of the rooms on a smoking floor when specified was nonsmoking. They then tell us that the rooms were not linked together because we got there after 5pm - however the customer service rep I spoke to when putting in the request said nothing to me about that being a requirement nor about it not being definite. It was confirmed and sounded taken care of when I ended my conversation 3 weeks prior. The person we dealt with at concierge said that the nonsmoking room was merely a preference and not a guarantee. Really?! Perhaps it is their liberal smoking laws in the state of Nevada - but that seems like a big "request" that should be fulfilled. When we showed obvious dissatisfaction over the lack of rooms together, and 2 rooms being completely filthy in cigarette smell, the concierge did nothing to ease our discomfort and the reply was very much like, "oh well, nothing we can do for you...". Eventually we were able to get the two smoking rooms on the same floor as the third room, but it required a night in the disgusting smoke filled rooms 5 floors down. The next day when the other two rooms were reassigned, one of them was without a strip view - we were paying for the strip view. This was not determined until we had left the concierge, had gone all the way upstairs to move bags into the new room, and noticed the view was not as requested. The person we dealt with should have known what we were paying for, and said something at the time of switch that either there was no strip viewavailable and given our money back for paying extra for it, or made other arrangements. But instead we had to go back downstairs, wait in line again to speak with someone - and explain the situation once more. Again, all this running around, room change, lack of reading the computer to see what was on our account - certainly required some sort of compensation. We finally got something after speaking to a manager. The 1st room was fine, the 2nd room got 50% back on the first night spent in the smoke room, and the 3rd room ended up without a strip view, and they gave us back the extra money that paid for that view. It took multiple trips to the concierge desk to get this made right, and it wasn't until speaking to a manager that any compensation happened. The desk people were very passive and did not seem interested in making us happy.

Went to Vegas for Interbike in September 2015 and made reservations on Expedia only to experience the following:

First off, I had reserved my room via Expedia for a Single King, Non Smoking.  At approx 830am I asked to check in early and was willing to pay extra to get room so I would not have a hassle doing so later and that my belongings would be in the room. When I did check i I was told Early Check in would cost $20 more then told that I would have to be upgraded costing me another $10. When given the room key I went to the room only to find the Bathroom torn apart and tools spread all over the floor. I then went back down to the Front Desk to find a huge line so I went to the Concierge how told me they would text me immediately with the room number and gave me a set of room keys. I then had to check my luggage with Bell Hop since I could not put them in a room, thus costing me a tip when dropping off and picking up to ensure they took great care of my luggage. 

Approx 330 while at my conference I noticed I had NOT received a phone call or text telling me a room was ready!!! So in panic that I may not have a room I left my Conference and ran back to the Front Desk which was again a huge line. I went to the Concierge Desk again and explained the issue. They Issued me a room number yet bnot once mentioned that I was still in an upgraded room. When I arrived to my room it was a Single King in Non Smoking....so I dint think of it at all.

When playing slots in the hotel for 2 hours I had ordered a Coke after 15 minutes and the Server walked past me more than a dozen times never bringing me my Coke!!!!!

At 9 am the maid walked into my room without waiting to hear my rsponse and was halfway into my room as I yelled out. The Next morning when checking out I noticed an additional $40 charge, when I went to the Front Desk I was met with a rude attitude and no regard for customer service. I asked for a Supervisor who provided the same type of disregard to Customer Service and I verbally voice my opinion. They Stated that I checked in early and was upgraded......Is that what you call service?

You wonder why I took so long to respond....? Being a Business Owner I have my own Customers to ensure they receive the service they should expect and have been extremely busy. I hate having to make a statement to prove my self as a customer yet to receive such hideous service is uncalled for....

I thought about calling my bank to contest the funds, write to headquarters, BBB and others to get my $40 back yet the time has been costly. So lesson Learned, Never Again will I stay at the Monte Carlo or allow my Friends and Family to do so if at all possible.

Your Service sucks and if Employees and Supervisors have a chip on their Shoulder they should revisit Who actually puts money in their pocket.....Customers if you didn't know. 

As a Company you should find a means to amend this dishonor to a customer.

What I like most about this hotel and casino is that I can actually breathe.    Our reservation was originally for the Orleans Hotel and Casino for the onsite children's center and we had arrived and walked into the Orleans Hotel and was immediately assaulted by the overwhelming stench of cigarette smoke and perfume used to cover the smoke smell.

So, we left the casino to stay at the Monte Carlo for the lazy river and wave pools and were very happy with our stay.  Any small issue we had was corrected immediately, the place is clean and they have an all day-all you can eat buffet for a decent price!

BAD:  no wifi, in room dining staff did not take away the cart for two days.   We called them to take it away as they instructed us to do and we left it in the hall and when we left two days later- it was still there.   Most of the table dealers have no personality.   But I try and look over that because they probably deal with assholes and idiot tourists  every day.

My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 days 3 nights, it was for our one year anniversary and a mini getaway from life. We are locals so we never venture out to the strip due to our work schedules and well the strip isn't our thing!

Monte Carlo was just what we needed. Alongside from the construction, it was quiet. We stayed on the 29th floor, room 134, which was the pool view and it was nice and quiet for us. The other casinos at night looked pretty from our room and we were still able to see the sun rise and set from bed! The room was nice, nothing super luxurious but nothing like motel 6. It was just right for us and it was pretty cheap, alongside other hotel rooms. The toilet though was the main issue, as it was having issues flushing, we had to call maintenance twice. The shower is tiny so no romantic bath time there lol! The pool wasn't bad, the lazy river is smaller than the pictures, gets crowded easily. Needs more shade! But other than that it was good. Oh and there needs to be more pool staff to take orders, I waited a half hour for someone to come take my drink\/food order. Also the food court area, don't go to Manchu Wok, the food is gross, overly expensive and there are unprofessional ppl behind the counter. It's embarrassing. I've worked in the hotel industry as well as food and beverage for 12 years...if the lady was like that on my team I wouldn't allow it. I know Monte Carlo isn't held responsible for most of the food court.

Other than that, I do want to say that whoever the housekeeper was on the 29th floor on Tuesday and Wednesday, she is amazing!! She's super sweet, very friendly and very attentive! I will be letting Monte Carlo and the housekeeping manager know, I just didn't get her name though.

The Monte Carlo is undergoing renovations until Spring\/Summer 2018 and the place is a mess. Even if you book a room on one of the renovated floors, some amenities won't be available. There are detours\/construction throughout the casino and it's not worth the headache on a vacation.

I thought that the Monte Carlo was fine.  The employees were are really nice to us at all times and I thought that the hotel was relatively clean.  The only downside is that the pool is in the shade most of the day, but they have absolutely no control over that considering there are buildings blocking the sun all around them.  They also have a beach volleyball court which is pretty cool.  I would definitely recommend staying at the Monte Carlo.

Horrible.  No communication on how the pool was closed. Check in sucked. Stood in line for about an hour. Line was crazy line with 2 people helping.   Resort fees charged and what are the amenities?  Nada.  This used to be a great place to stay but currently it's not so grand

Total dump! Another hotel that needs to be imploded and replaced just like Bally's further up the strip! Front of hotel looks like trash they took out the big fountains and replace them with these silly looking rock waterfalls and they keep adding bars to the front to squeeze out every penny they can from the square footage! Don't go here!

Okay, first of all, a friend paid for it, not me, so I'm not sure about the price, but...

When we got there, getting checked in was a pain in the ass.  There is NO line control at all-my friend got cut in line by two Italians that proceeded to argue the entire bill.  For a half hour.  Finally getting a room, the first room we got had broken glass, used condom wrappers, and used condoms in various odd places.  Telling the desk, we got another room-which had the alarm and lamp wired into the wall (my friend travels with a CPap machine) and that meant a third room...

Which, if I'd checked, should have been a fourth room.  We got two beds and mine had half the mattress broken.  And, didn't know that until I had gotten in bed that night.  Ugh!

The hotel claims to have room wi-fi, but I've never seen it.  They have a ethernet cable, at $10\/day.  I used the wi-fi down in the food court via McDonalds (neither of the Starbucks they have have wi-fi).

The hotel restaurant\/cafe is poor-I ordered a burger there and the bun was greasy and soggy, the fries were undercooked and they were billing me alcohol prices for a glass of OJ.  The Buffet was poorly organized-I didn't even get to see it-the line was stuck for about 30 minutes or so.

The only real advantages to the hotel is that it's pretty central to the rest of the hotels on the Strip.  Take that as you will...

This was my first time at the Monte Carlo Hotel, and there was really nothing special about our stay. We would normally find ourselves at the Bellagio, so it was incredibly convenient that there is a free tram that connects Monte Carlo to Crystals to Bellagio. 

The casino and the rooms felt a little outdated. The room looked minimally clean, but upon closer inspection, the beds were dirty with black specks and I found little bugs in the room. I think the bugs may have come in from when they cleaned our room and had forgotten to close the windows...On our last day, we were attempting to check out in our room, but we weren't able to because the TV was doing something funky upon choosing that option. It's no big deal because we ended up checking out downstairs, but it was my understanding that checking out in our rooms was a simple convenience that most other hotels had. Eh. I wouldn't come here to shop since there weren't many options, I wouldn't come here to gamble, and there's no major attraction that Monte Carlo can boast outside of the Blue Man Group.

2 free bottles of water and coffee a day + buffet passes for guests. At least Monte Carlo was on the strip, so I wouldn't mind staying here again.

not too shabby.  was here from november 14-16.  initially i was a little worried after having read about the construction and noise but i survived a weekend just fine.  the rooms were clean and well kept.  that's really all i need.  we stayed two nights for just under $300 and it was well worth it.

there was one little snafu at the very start.  the room we initially checked into had random tools and towels lying around but the front desk got us a new room with no problems immediately.  problem solved.

This hotel is awful, awful, awful. Rude staff, outdated rooms, and the pool was eh! The lazy river was the only reason I convinced my boyfriend to stay here and it was the lamest lazy river I have ever seen. It was crowded with people in the giant tubes, who didn't care if they bumped it you. People were jumping over the median and nobody was stopping them. Such a waste of a trip to Vegas. Won't be coming back!

Just got back from spending a long weekend here with my husband for a belated celebration of our anniversary!

Pros:
- FAST CHECK-IN: this could not have been easier, very straightforward
- GOOD MAID SERVICE: Housekeeping started coming around early on our floor (like 8:00AM) and the maids were very nice about giving us extra shampoo every day
- CONCIERGE DESK: we were able to pick up our tickets for shows at other MGM hotels at the Monte Carlo, which was super convenient!
- TRAM TO CRYSTALS AND BELLAGIO: in 100+ degree heat, the air-conditioned tram service to the city center and Bellagio hotel was a godsend.  
- EXPRESS CHECKOUT: there are a number of ways to easily check out of the hotel (checkout is at 11:00AM) and the hotel really wants to streamline checkout so that there aren't a ton of people clogging up the lobby like it is at other hotels
- FOOD COURT: because not every meal in Vegas has to take place in a buffet or a pricey restaurant.  There's Starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, Sbarro pizza, Nathan's hot dogs, Mexican, etc here and is great if you're traveling with kids.  

Cons:
- WHERE'S THE GUIDEBOOK?: usually when I stay at a hotel, there's some sort of binder or guidebook that they leave for their guests that gives info about room service, Vegas shows, restaurants in the hotel, etc... for some reason there wasn't one in our room, so my husband and I were forced to keep the Monte Carlo channel on TV on endless loop to find out info about the hotel and things to do.  
- TOO MANY CHAIRS AT THE POOL: I don't know why they do this, but they've packed the pool area with so many lounge chairs that it is literally like sardines in a can.  It's uncomfortable and makes it very awkward to get back and forth from your chair.  
- LAZY RIVER TOO PACKED: maybe the concept of a lazy river has evolved since the last time I was in one, but getting into the Monte Carlo lazy river is like pulling into rush hour traffic on the 5.  Like the chair situation, it's congested and uncomfortable.  

Other useful things to know:
- There's a little shopping section next to the food court that has a big candy store, women's clothing, bath accessories, cupcakes, frozen-yogurt, and crepes... Monte Carlo is trying really hard to cater to people who don't necessarily want to spend all their time gambling and clubbing and\/or people with kids
- Guests were bringing large coolers packed with bottles of spring water (and other beverages) because it's $5.50 per bottle of water at the hotel
- You can't bring outside food or drink into the pool area and your bag WILL get checked for it
- Inner tubes can be rented from the pool area for the lazy river, and after 2PM they're only $5 each
- If you forget sunscreen or other toiletries, don't purchase from the Monte Carlo convenience store, the prices are outrageous!  Instead, walk across the street to ABC Store or Walgreens, or try the 24-hour CVS just 1 block down the strip.

Room was nice- but not for the price. Paid for strip view, but at check in they told me they were out of strip view and only had 1 smoking room with 2 queen beds available or could waive the resort fee... probably wont go back. A little disappointed they weren't able to accommodate us a little more.

Vegas is known for partying, but also gets a fair amount of business travelers. This hotel was by far the WORST night sleep I have ever had in ANY hotel around the globe. There is zero soundproofing between rooms. I could here everything (music, giggling, drunkards) that happened in the rooms flanking mine and every foot fall in the hallway. Also, guests should not be able to hear a toilet flush or shower turn on two floors away. I'm giving and extra star only because the noodle restaurant was superb and bartender very personable.

Worst hotel ever. Waiting in line to check in for over an hour. 3 agents doing nothing and are super rude when anyone comes up to ask questions. Sue from Ely, NV was the worst. Watching her be rude to guests was priceless. 2 other agents shooting the breeze with the same customers for over 20 min. Found out the lazy river pool\/wave pools are shut down for reconstruction. No email or mention of this before we booked. Still waiting in line trying to be patient because ta our anniversary. Absolute shit show. Don't stay here.

For a theme hotel, this one is really boring. You just have some statues hanging around. This is like a lesser version of Caesar's Palace, except Caesar's Palace is cool. The hotel room is decent - everything was clean and in working order. I feel like this is the forgotten hotel of the big hotels on the strip. Never in conversation with friends do we ever say, "This one time at Monte Carlo..." unless we're talking about the fire on the roof.

If I can give 0 star I will!! Services was so suck!!! I know it is busy about 4th of July. BUT It doesn't busy at all right here but services So fucking suck!! The one ladie at the reception, she is a bitch!! I can't believe it how can she work here. I never got any suck service right this before in my life!! FUCK!!! NEVER COME BACK AGAIN!! Event Doesn't have any hotel in Las Vegas Strip any more!! I WON'T!!
Service is really bad here ! i been waiting hours to check in ;( I regret coming here

I do hate to rip on places, but I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo in Vegas and I have a few things to say about it.  

First, I'll point out that it's cheaper than most places on the strip, there's a McDonald's inside in the food court (great for breakfast and when you don't want to spend $80 on dinner), and the casino is pretty good.  Also, the location of the MC, with the help of the tram, is pretty darn good.  All of these things make for at least 3 stars. 

However, having stayed at a bunch of other hotels on The Strip, this place was the worst from a room comfort perspective.  The rooms were built in the 80s or something and they certainly show it.  There are cracks and mold in the bathroom tile, the showers aren't great, the carpet is stained, and the fixtures are way out-dated.  I guess I'm a bit of a snob, but I couldn't see past all of that.  I stayed here for a few nights and then stayed at the Bellagio for a few nights, and the difference in comfort level is pretty staggering - to me.  

If you don't care about the details and are on a budget, the MC is probably a good place for you.

I actually think MC is a solid 3.5 Stars, but am rolling up since my gripes are minimal and I would go back if I got the same room.  So, on with it....

My hubby and I come to Vegas 1-2 times a year and tend to move around, never the same hotel twice. We got a great deal on the Monte Carlo Spa Suite so figured why not? Sure the MC is bit old, but its location next to the City Center is awesome! 

We arrived a few hours before check-in, but they let us check in at noon. Score! We took a short walk to the elevators and headed up to the 31st floor. The spa suite didn't disappoint! Sure it has a bit of an older style (brass fixtures, carpet and sofa have seen better days), but the view from the jacuzzi is out of this world (strip\/mountain view)! It also had a king size bed, sitting area, bar area and decent size bathroom (although no double sinks). And it came with robes and slippers. 

The room was very clean and the maid service was prompt. When I had to call down for a hair dryer (none in the room), they got it up to me in 10m! Room service was prompt and good also. And all in all it was a good stay. 

My only complaints are 1) they really need new windows, we could hear the screams from the NYNY roller coaster riders some nights - with the windows and curtains shut! 2) Their resort fee of $20\/day is a joke. It gives you bottled water (which we only got 1 day of 3), free phone calls (!? um, who doesn't have a cell) and a paper every day. Oh and WIRED internet access. Here is one place MC needs to get current - wifi please! 

Other than that, we really like the location and the hotel itself. It was nice to be close to all the newer spots on the strip without paying the big bucks. This place is small, but that is nice sometimes - less walking!

Room Tip: The spa suite (31-101) has views of the mountains on on side and NYNY, Excalibur and Mandalay on the other - beautiful!

They definitely need to update this place. The bed was uncomfortable. The floors were dirty. It kind of smelt bad in the room. We bought the deal off groupon and thought we had a deal but we could of spent our $350 else where.

Do yourself a favor.. stay somewhere else! 


This is one of the most BS hotels in Vegas. When booking and scheduling, not once did they mention the hotel was under construction and remodel. Half the restaurants for the place are closed and you wind up walking to another resort to eat. They basically have a mall type food court, or $55 per person buffet.

The rooms and amenities are old and dingy, furniture is scratched as hell, my floor and room constantly smelled like pot. The walls are paper thin and you can't sleep if your neighbor is making any kind of noise at all.

The staff is semi friendly, but regardless, the hotel is completely understaffed. You're going to wait In a ridiculous line to get coffee, water, etc. There is no real connivence items in the room, coffee maker, water, etc., and there isn't even a pay bar in the room either. It's BS..!! Curtains don't close all the way, room temperature is always in the 80s, no matter what you set the AC at.  Room service is constantly moving your shower\/bath items, including taking the soap. You have to open new soap everyday..???

I was absolutely disappointed in this stay and will likely never be back after renovation.  It might be a better story if they had good customer service.. but they seem to struggle at that. I felt like I was staying in a 40 year old roadside motel..  not Vegas quality, but totally Vegas prices..

To begin, my husband and I came to Vegas for our honeymoon meaning that expectations were high. 
When we arrived to the hotel at 3:30pm we were told that we were unable to check in to our room until 5pm and that they would call us if the room was ready earlier. 5:05 rolls around no call, no room. I head to concierge to see what's happening and her response is "oh, your room is ready. Sometimes they get backed up on calls" that's it.

During our stay, every single day a maid attempted to enter (let me assure you that we displayed "DO NOT DISTURB" remember, we were on our honeymoon!) Instead of knocking and awaiting a response, the key was already in the door followed by a knocking than entering. This killed the mood on more than 1 occasion. 

We have not seen extra charges yet but we will keep our eyes peeled!

The room was clean, quiet, and nice. 
The hotel was very well maintained.

Quite disappointed with this hotel.

- Bed was disappointing.. pillows were stiff, blanket and sheets were uncomfortable and cheap. There was not even a fitted sheet to cover the mattress--literally just a normal sheet thrown over it and tucked under! Needless to say it came off the mattress when slept on.
- We were not told at check-in that we were booked in a handicapped room. This meant the shower was really ugly and practically impossible to use--showerhead was like 5 feet tall. Floor in the shower made a loud creaking noise when you moved around. The dial to control the temperature was broken. What a JOKE. At least ASK us at check-in if we want the handicapped room with the shitty shower!
- I always use the extra lock on the door at night in hotels, but there was not one on the door. I forgot to put the "do not disturb" sign out the first night, and at 10am housekeeping knocked once and opened the door. My boyfriend and I were still sleeping. Naked. I screamed. Not cool. Checkout time is 11.. Why would you have maids going around before 11 cleaning rooms?
-Tried to get in a mid-day nap. That was useless. Pool party was raging EXTREMELY LOUDLY outside, and we could hear all of it, even on the 25th floor. I understand it's vegas and people want to rage at the pool, but seriously, sound-proof those windows or some shit.
- Watched some TV, and every 10 seconds the screen would get all messed up with static. Really? 
-NO WIFI IN THE ROOMS! There was a cable to plug in to your laptop, but we couldn't even get that to work! 


Overall: Surely you could find more disappointing hotel rooms, but this place was just not very nice at all. Needs a facelift... updated decor and bedding for sure. I expected more from a place that really TRIES to look luxurious.

On the plus side, it's a great location on the strip. And didn't see any bugs. I think that's about it.

This hotel is one of the cheapest 4-star hotel in Vegas (especially if you get the room through Priceline), and you can easily see why it is so cheap once you get there.

-  It is in the middle of some major construction sites (i.e. 5 buildings in the new Las Vegas CityCenter).  Therefore, do not expect the environment to be plesant at all.  Even the hotel staffs admitted that "every customers who has a room facing the constructions conplained about the noise and dust"...

-  The hotel recently had a major fire on the top floor in January.  Although the exterior of the hotel has been restored, they are closing all the top floor.  As a result, most of the room do not offer much of a view even you are facing the strip.  I can only see the pipes on the roof of the casino from my strip-view room.  But I guess it is still better than the rooms facing the construction

-  I read a lot of positive reviews about their pool before I went, but was extremely disappointed.  Their pools are extremely small, and none of them except the kids' pool is heated.  Coupled with the fact that the constructions are blocking the sun, you can only see a handful swim in them....

-  Mediocre Service: It looks like their rooms with King bed is extremely limited.  I asked for one, and the staffs was so rude as if I am asking for an upgrade.  They finally assigned me one, but  I had to check back with the front desk 3 times after I checked in to see if my room is ready.  At the end, they cannot make it ready until 5pm....

-  The room is nothing special compared to any 3-star hotel.  I do agree with one of the other comments about the bedsheet being extremely rough. Like sandpaper.....

I am not sure if I would stay there again.....

Worst Las Vegas experience. The hotel is in horrible condition! Dirty and damaged carpets through the whole hotel and in the rooms. Even the walls in the room was dirty. Hair in the showers. 

Had to switch rooms three times! Due to the dirty condition of the first room. A very loud party with drunk men yelling in the hallways. Also had a problem with room keys working. 

Took security well over an hour to come to the room. Same with the bellman. 

The pool area is geared towards alcoholics not families or anyone over 30!

I found out that the hotel does not care about the cleanliness, or their what goes on because they are waiting to start a renovation of the hotel. 

Never never again!

To be honest, I thought my stay at the Monte Carlo was just ok. Don't get me wrong, it's an above average place to stay at, clean, semi-new, on strip, and decently priced--but my experience didn't thrill me or anything. Stayed here for four days, three nights and all during that time everything was ok. It's not a destination hotel like MGM, NYNY, Mandalay, Paris, or Planet Hollywood. It's a good place to stay if you not looking for a lot of action and a nice bed with a clean room.

The room was nicely furnished and it was a handicap room, but that really didn't bother us. What did bother us was that the first night we were there we had problems with water drainage in the shower\/tub. Water just wasn't draining fast enough and the tub started filling up. Needless to say that was not good. It didn't bother us too much as the next day we called maintenance and by the time we came back from going out for the day they had fixed it.

Probably the bigger issue I had was that the lot they had for self parking was not big enough to accommodate everyone at the hotel. Apparently what had happened was that as part of the City Center construction which is happening right next door, they demolished their parking structure and are currently in the process of building a new one. In the meantime, they have an open air lot that is not big enough to hold everyone. So at night what happens is people are driving around hunting and waiting for parking to  open up. You might say, "well why don't you valet the car, it's free." That is a good idea, too bad almost everyone else has it as well. One night after we had come back we go to valet the car and the line for the valet is packed, come to find out that the valet is full for the night and we have to park at NYNY, which is also right next door. Luckily as we were driving through the small lot to go over to the NYNY someone pulled out and we were able to park in the self park.

Other than that, the only other thing I disliked was the fact that there was no complimentary WIFI or internet at this place. Boo that.

Never again. 

My friend and I both work in customer service and we understand that customers can be terrible people. They are not always right. So, naturally we hate complaining about anything and even when we do, we do it with a smile and the empathy that not everything is in your control as an employee. 

However, there seemed to be a distinct lack of customer service and overall upkeep during our simple one night stay at the resort.  We moved rooms twice and there was a problem in all three rooms we had. 

We paid for early check in and our first room wasn't even clean. There were towels on the floor, a trash can in the tub, dirty drinking glasses on the desk, and a distinct layer of dust on everything. We called the front desk and they changed our room.

The second room initially had no problems. Then I took a shower and after I was done, the faucet wouldn't stop loudly dripping\/trickling water. We decided to just give it time and went out for the day. Upon our return and subsequent outlet search to plug in our phones, my friend found that someone had written REDRUM on the wall. While honestly kind of funny, it was rather unnerving and we didn't want to be charged for graffiti so we called the front desk again and our room was changed.

Our third and final room had an AC unit with a banshee call that could wake the dead. At this point, we were tired of moving and tired of bothering the front desk, so we just turned it off and went to bed. 

While the staff was great at dealing with our room problems, every other time we came into contact with someone else, it was not a pleasant experience. We wanted to know where to stow our bags before our flight left after we had already checked out. The MLife check out desk woman looked like she was trying to ignore her customers rather than deal with them as we had stood in line for a while and she didn't even look us in the eye once. We were there a good while before we gave up and moved onto the regular check out line where the woman there also barely looked us in the eye before barking out, "Bell desk!" and gesturing in its direction. The lady at the bell desk just scowled at us before gesturing  to the bellman standing behind us (who turned out to be one of the nicest people we came into contact with). She then went back to some conversation she was having with another bellman. 

To top it all off, my friend ended up talking to the manager on duty who tried to smooth everything over with a $50 lunch voucher to Diablo's which unbeknownst to us, but should have been known to her, was closed for the season. 

In the end, nothing really seemed to be resolved and we couldn't get out of that building fast enough.
Staff is extremely rude and ineffective. Construction, and resort fee with no pool or amenities. Horrible.

The AAA listing claims that the Monte Carlo has wireless internet. However, this is absolutely not the case. (apparently they only have it in two rooms... And they're 'suites'.) I am a junior in college, taking online classes... With deadlines. Internet is a must for me. I found out that my initial hotel room didn't have it and (after a VERY rude encounter with a front desk woman) was told they would have a new room for me by 12:00 today WITH wireless internet. After going through 3 different concierge people, they finally found a different room for me by 6:30pm.... It was filthy and STILL no internet. Moved to a THIRD room. This one with a shitty view of the roof and heating ducts, and Lo and behold.... STILL no working internet.... What exactly are we paying this $20 "resort fee" for, again?

Lackluster room, casino is dirty and slow service on drinks if playing slots.  They charged a daily resort fee and the pool was closed for renovation, with a sign posted on doors to pool that you were welcome to use MGM Grands pool with room card. No good restaurants to eat at, had to walk over to New York New York for decent food. Now who wants to leave the hotel they are being charged a resort fee to walk a good mile for a pool? Nothing on the website or at check in was mentioned about pool being closed. Long story short, after a day and a half of trying to find something positive about the place we just went up to Caesars Palace and stayed in that vicinity till it was time to sleep. Stay anywhere but here. Fifth trip to Vegas in last 3 years and most disappointing experience was here.

How depressing, this hotel is like checking into a motel 6 with IKEA like furniture. Not even a dressor in the room. Bed is like a $100 mattress at a discount store near Tijuana.  White walls,no art work carpet is what you would expect on a outside patio.

I am not going to enjoy this visit to Vegas, Circus Circus would have been better than this. Low end

The rooms are decent. Not very fancy but right in the middle. The staff wasn't surly , they were actually very pleasant with me but I guess it depends who's helping you out. We requested a high room and we got the 19th floor facing the strip, not too shabby at all. 

There were construction noises in the wee hours of the morning which made it kind of hard to sleep. There are no fridges in the rooms which is a minus but there's a great ice machine in the hall!

The hotel itself isn't too far away from everything else on the strip. It's a bit of a walk of you're trying to get to Caesar's Palace, Treasure Island, The Venetian, etc. about a 20 minute walk. It's very close to Planet Hollywood and the Bellagio.

Don't gamble here, take your money to the Bellagio.

My favorite part: the elevators were sexily adorned with posters of Lance Burton, rawr!

We got a super great deal on our room and now I know why.

Check in was pretty simple. They were able to accommodate our party on the same floor which was great. 
 We upgraded to a Monaco suite solely for the whirlpool tub. We got to our room and we had just a normal tub. I called to find out why our suite did not include this and they informed us that the health and safety department made them take the jets out. Totally fine, but considering we upgraded for that purpose and the website as well as their brochure states that's what the suite included I was a little irritated that they did not notify us about this or at least give us the option to cancel our upgraded room. Our bed was lumpy and we didn't get much of a good nights rest the first night. 

I contacted the front desk about it and they didn't really do anything, just said sorry. The next day I was pretty peeved and decided to speak with the manager. He really wasn't of much help anyway and offered to move us back into a standard room. We booked at this hotel for the spa, why would we want to downgrade!? I wanted to take a epic bubble bath in the comfort of my room!!!

I basically had to ask for them to move us into a spa suite that had not yet been converted. Finally They did after I explained how messed up it was for them not to inform us. It took forever for our room to be ready. They sent me a text saying it was ready so I went back to the room to confirm, only for them to tell me the text was sent prematurely and the room wasn't ready. We spent all day really waiting for our room and at around 4 ish, it finally was. 

The room was nice once we got there. Bed was MUCH more comfy. But honestly, there was too much work trying to get into a room that we paid for. This is a good place if you just want a place to lay your head and not actually "relax". I would definitely stay elsewhere!

The room was in decent size and clean.  The price was also decent.  The bed was ok but their policy is just bad. I got my room from one of these websites and I requested and confirmed a King.  When I checked in they said they don't have King anymore and it's their policy that they don't confirm the bed when you reserve.  Now if you wanted two queen beds, they charge you more so I just told the lady that it's BS.  

The pillows were small and super hard.  You can really sleep regardless how tired you are unless you're used to sleeping on rocks.  The walls are super thin.  You can hear people talking in the adjacent room and walking in hallways.  Basically not a good experience.

The Monte Carlo is a nice hotel that is in a good location on the strip. It isn't super fancy but it is nice enough. There have been some renovations recently that made it a little bit nicer. 

Last time we stayed, which was in the month of April, it was $200 a night which was really expensive in my opinion but we needed a place to stay that was at the same hotel as our friends. However, it is not as expensive as Mandalay Bay and the Bellagio so that is something to keep in mind. 

We stayed in a standard room and the rooms are pretty good. Best part about the rooms was the big and comfy beds. I truly believe though that you don't need a fancy room in Vegas because you really don't spend any time in the room other than to sleep and get ready to go out.

does monte carlo have a new wing?  if not, they really should build one.  or upgrade their old one.  i don't remember them being so crappy when i stayed here 5 years ago.  

they've still got the old box TV, no clock, and a REALLY old shower that needed some major drano.  and the pillows were LUMPY!  all of them!  for $150\/night, i expect more.  or is that just how much the strip costs now?  maybe i've been staying at my family's house too long.  fortunately (or unfortunately depending on who you are) a friend of ours lost enough money that our room was comped.

pool area was large.  they even have a river thingy where you can rent an inner tube and just float along the river all day....with your beverage!

nice "fast food" food court near the elevators with mcdonald's open 24 hours to fulfill those late night cravings of cheap eats.

We came here to see the Blue Man Group, unfortunately our show was cancelled and we were not notified or given any sort of refund. Disappointed. We walked around the hotel a bit and to the candy store, which my boyfriend and cousin liked. We then walked over to Aria. It's convenient and maybe next time we'll be able to see the show.

BE CAREFUL!!! My husband, cousins and I stayed at the hotel for 1 night. We arrived in the morning and were out and about all day.  When we returned to the hotel I plugged my cell phone (iphone) to the outlet closest to my bed, took a nap for 2 hours and when I woke up my cell phone was no longer working.  I thought maybe it was my phone (reasonable).  My husband then plugged his cell phone (iphone) to the same outlet and his phone got so hot we had to unplug it after 30 minutes. Now his phone wont hold the charge for more than an hour. A coincidence? I don't think so!!! Now I have no cell phone and my husband has to find a place to charge his phone every 30 - 60 minutes. My cousins plugged their phones into a different outlet and the phones were perfectly fine.
Before leaving the hotel we made a report with security and were told to take our phones to an apple store and get something in writing stating how much it would be to replace our phones. The costs was $269.00 plus tax. We called, followed up on the claim, sent the document the apple store provided only for the security department to tell us they will not replacing or reimbursing us for our phones. The gentleman in security stated they had an engineer (an employee of the hotel) take a look at the outlet and nothing was wrong. Of course they are going to say whatever it is they can so they won't be liable. Please think twice before staying here. You don't want to end up like us, having to purchase 2 new phones and a larger expense than what was expected.

This place sucks! There is no wifi at all in the hotel, you can connect to the internet but through hard wire only. On the website the two amenities that I cared about having were the microwave and refrigerator but what they don't tell you is there's a $30 charge per night for the fridge and there is no microwave. Wth!

We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights only however overall we were happy with the accommodation. This Casino is located on the new strip and it is a short distance walk from all luxury casinos. We loved the 5$ Black Jack table and our room on the 20th floor. We had free parking (don't get me talking about the issue we had with parking at Luxor) and overall enjoyed our stay. The place is puppy friendly and staff is pleasant. The swimming pool is under renovation which was a bummer but we did get a free pass to MGM swimming pool instead.

I stayed here one night and I absolutely love the Service and cleanliness of the room. I really do appreciate the quick service at checkout as well. The room smelled amazing when we walked in. The closet was huge and the beds were super comfy. I also like the entrance of the hotel it is very elegant and classy. 
Parking is $10 
Easy to get around the strip, beautiful pool and awesome views of the strip.

March Madness left me no choice.

I must say, March is not the best time to visit Vegas unless you have a reason to be there.  Spring break, march madness, some sort of junior soccer convention, and everyone's bachelor\/bachelorette parties resulted in high hotel prices.  In comparison to the other hiked up prices of rooms along the strip, the Monte Carlo offered a modest deal of $130\/ night plus the $20\/night resort fee.

Honestly, it's not worth that much to stay here.  The room was okay, the hotel appeared to be clean and orderly, and front desk was friendly -- but for $150 is coconuts.  

Biggest peeve.  Rooms don't have wi-fi.  They have internet but you need to plug it in to your laptop.  The cable that they provide in the room is attached to the wall so you have to work on it AT the table -- you can't bring your laptop to your bed.  

Location of hotel is okay.  Not close to where I like to walk around and play, but the necessities are near by.  

I had a good experience here but definitely not one of my favorites.

The hotel is looking at little dated, but they are doing some new construction. The thing is, we didn't know that until we made our reservations. Once our reservations were made they emailed us to let us know that the pool, the Pub and other things were closed because of the construction. The rooms are ok, they are looking a little rough, but we did get a pretty good deal.

Hmmmm....not sure of what to thin of this place.....

From the outside, it looks very elegant and classy....beautiful statues and fountain outside and very well kept grounds......

Inside, the lobby is beautiful and impressive and you catch yourself thinking "WOW, my room must be really something" just by the look of things so far. 

Once inside your room you realize a few things: 1. This room is really no different than most places on the strip and 2. The linens, carpet and room in general is subpar for the amount that we are paying.

I am not a picky gal....I don't care if my sheets are Egyptian cotton, I don't mind it too much if I only get 400 thread count sheets, and hell, I don't care if they toiletries are designer....

My towels, comforter and sheers on the windows all had holes, carpet had a cigarette burn (Hmmmm....wasn't this a NON SMOKING ROOM?) and was stained...and I am paying HOW MUCH to stay here?? Are you sure there is not a Motel 6 sign out front and someone left the light on for us?? 

They also have a new policy.....they are going green and therefore, unless you request it (which I am sure if more $$ in their pocket) they will not change your sheets on a daily basis...well I am glad at least that you got rid of my towels!! Maybe I should pack some from home next time I come to Vegas!! 

All in all, its an okay place to stay BUT don't expect a hole bunch!!

Jamie Schmidt; This is the hotel manager of this hotel. My experience with this hotel goes as follows. 

I order to get a room cleaned, they don't clean it. I call again(after the club) and ask for them to PLEASE clean my room that they are too busy to clean apparently. 

So , I get a lady to clean my room. The lady this hotel sent me to clean my room was either on drugs, or was on 2 hours of sleep. So after she cleans my room, I tip her and go to  bed (finally with a clean room for gods sake). 

When I wake up in the morning, I am ready to go to wet republic (mgm grand hotel). Making sure I have all my necessities for the club , out of no where, my California drivers license is gone. I was for certain that I had my ID at the moment I got my room cleaned. 

So , monte Carlo got my ID STOLEN, and then I got the "pleasure" to meet their hotel manager, Jamie Schmidt. I have never dealt with a more unreasonable, uncaring manager in my life. 

Worst customer service, she was rude, uncooperative under their mistaking circumstance. After the fact, she had the nerve to tell me that it was my fault for leaving my driver's license on my bed sheets. She insisted that I was too irresponsible to not tell the cleaning lady to be careful about my Very Important ID that is obviously needed for anything as a 21+ adult. 

Due to this unfortunate turn of events, my stay in Vegas was stressful and wasteful (not how my vacation should have gone). 

I highly reccomend to never deal with this hotel and their very poor and lacking customer service. 

Jamie Schmidt should consider another job opportunity\/profession; she doesn't seem to have the intellect to give people a clear and concise answer to questions of concern. Her communication skills are poor (stutters); she doesn't seem to care about your stay, as long as you have your credit card on file, that's all she needs. She will not compensate anything for you, even if it is 100% the hotel service's fault for an inconvenience.

Monte Carlo resort should be looked away from. They ruined my vacation trip with 0% compensation for their mistake. 

*\/*****
Im not a gambler, but the rooms were cozy and clean, the restaurant was yummy and the overall experience was fun.
Stayed here for the night and beds were uncomfortable 2 Queen beds one was tilted from the feet higher than the headrest and the other one was like a chalupa and sank in the middle restless night....

i will say its a good location that  you don't have to pay 5 stars for it like a couple of nearby hotels. i would have done three stars but the experience here with customer service wasn't the greatest.

i got my reservations through southwest and included a restaurant credit. asking about she replied "yes show them at the restaurant". i did, then they said they it wouldn't go through... after we ate our meal. (so we paid thats fine). called a different customer service through monte carlo and left a message (maybe two), no reply back----- the whole time i was there. it was til i was checking out, the person who help us and gave us different paper... so we carried our bags and used it at bar until it had to be time to go to the airport.

rating for: (Group Sales) (management) (concierge)
Monte Carlo is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at on the strip! DO NOT stay here! Unless you like unclean rooms, horrible customer service and the worst management team possible. I had my son's birthday party at MC and I regret it! I did group booking 9 months in advance and booked multiple rooms. The noise coming from the outside was so bad that I couldn't sleep, rooms were completely outdated and I am not sure how they get away with that. It was also told to me when reserving the multiple room booking that we were guaranteed to be near each other in the hallway since we are a large party. However, upon each check in, the front desk kept trying to place them on other floors and different wing. One room had to switch rooms halfway into their stay to finally get the room they were promised. 
Upon speaking with the front desk manager and concierge manager the second morning of my stay, before any of our guest had arrived, they told me that to help with the noise... "here are some ear plugs". Then they began telling me about not being able to hold my gift baskets.
I was told that I could have gift baskets at the concierge desk for when each guest arrived, but they were unsure if they could hold them for me. I ended up having to be downstairs to greet each guest on arrival to give them their baskets. It was over the whole day I had to keep going upstairs to get the gift, then run down to meet them.
Between no sleep, being promised things they did not hold up their end and it was my son's 21st birthday which I'm trying to make perfect... this was not going well!

I decided to walk away after standing there so upset and the managers promise to send up blankets, pillows, and to have all my guests next to us. NONE OF THAT HAPPEND.
I never went back to the front desk during my stay, because if I did, the whole hotel would have heard me!

It took me 2 days after I returned to calm down and email the Monte Carlo Hotel to explain to them what they did wrong to a customer who had many people stay and spend money at the hotel. The way they treated us was UNBELIEVEABLE and HORRIBLE.

Over 8 emails to MC concierge management and Guest Relations Management, I still feel disrespected, treated unfairly and advise anyone who is looking for a decent hotel and a fun time.... DON'T TO STAY HERE!

I generally rate hotels by

(1) how much I have to pay,
(2) how much of a hassle parking can be,
(3) the customer service at registration,
(4) how comfortable the bed is, and
(5) how convenient the newsstand\/food options are in the general vicinity at 4am.

(1) With an MLife players card discount, we paid $75+ ~$17 resort fee. Probably still the cheapest deal for a hotel in the center of Vegas on a Friday. Star.
(2) Parking is right across registration, so just one straight walkway. Parking is pretty ample too. Star. 
(3) ...took too long. About half an hour and there were only three groups in front of us. Managment makes 'em type in like, pages of info (I saw them typin' at 100wpm for minutes at a time!) so that slowed things down. Kind of irritating. Negative stars!
(4) Star. Probably one of the most comfy beds in Vegas. Room could have been bigger...
(5) There is a food court that's easy to access, but no ample food options like NYNY unless you don't mind Mcdonalds, Starbucks, n Rubios. Meh.

The Monte Carlo is a cool hotel. 

 Updated furniture, nice tv's, and good service.

The pool at Monte Carlo is underrated.  Its a pretty nice pool to hang out, but minus the big rowdy crowd. 

Great location on the strip as well.

Well let me just start with we booked ahead of time during the week for my husband's 40th birthday. Which is something he was really looking forward to.  Going to Vegas to celebrate sounded like a great idea at a time. I guess we should've did more research on the hotels. First off it was way to families &  kids running around everywhere makes an adult feel weird about drinking in front of kids. Second the check-in my was super Duper long and moving slow like you were the themepark! Third the front desk clerk didn't really know anything and had to call to see what was going on, then proceeds to tell us that there would be an additional $50 a day charge plus $20 daily resort fees on the spa room that we booked which was fine for deposit but daily deposits on the same room that your staying in for a consistent number of days I just didn't understand that!! & the part that made me upset was it didn't mention any of this online.. So instantly I felt like we were getting ripped off I think hidden fees are just wrong I'm sorry people should know what they're looking forward to spending ahead of time and not thrown for a loop when you get there. 
So then I asked my husband let's just be sure and ask the lady at guest services; she goes on to Tell us in a very nasty way oh she should have charge you'll  $100 a night deposit for the spa suite! I looked at her and said well you all should list these prices and fees on your website and not trick people once they get to your hotel for their stay. But anyway they told us they no longer honor the birthday comps or  coupons they offer on their site so he was kind of feeling down about that but was like oh well. The buffet which he really looked forward to going to was very overrated this was in their hotel!! Way too pricey for the little bit of stuff they offered and it was self-service..
