In the mornings the housekeeper knocked then just entered the room so if you were unclothed or indecent she just barged in!! 
The cocktail waitresses never came back if u happened to see them you have to run them down for one.. Which when some people are gambling it's kind of nice to not have to chase a drink down.. The room itself was okay kinda dated the jacuzzi tub was the only  good point for me.. I'm usually pretty open and easy when it comes to reviewing things but this was very disappointing which was sad for me because his birthday was ruined.. Service was just terrible .. We checked out early and went to a different place.. But all in all we will never stay there again

Had a wonderful experience at Monte Carlo this past weekend. Staff is friendly and always polite when we had questions or requests. The rooms were nice and had exactly what you needed. Stayed in a strip view. The bed was actually comfortable. Room had a vanity\/desk, Keurig coffee maker, side table with a couple of chairs,  flat screen, two night stands, closet, and full length mirror. Bathroom had a tub\/shower combo, 1 sink, toilet, large mirror, and vanity mirror. The resort fee is actually worth it because you get free wifi (it does work despite other reviews), two bottles of water daily, two pods for the Keurig machine daily, and newspaper. I think you get some other amenities too that I can't immediately think of. Almost all hotels charge a resort fee, but don't give you anything. Hotel is very easy to navigate. The shops, elevators, casino, food court, and taxi stand all meet in the main lobby so you won't get lost. The pools are awesome. Really enjoyed the heated lazy river and wave pool. Also took advantage of the Minus 5 Lounge. They do charge to get in, but it was a cool experience, just wish they let us bring our phones in. Great location on the strip plus there is a walkway from hotel to Aria and a free tram that goes to Crystals Shopping Area and Bellagio. I admit the reviews on Yelp almost scared me from not staying here, but I'm glad I gave it a chance. I think a lot has changed since some reviews were written. This is a decent hotel for the price and I would definitely stay again. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and tend to lean toward the fancy ones like Caesars, Wynn\/Encore, and Palazzo. Yes these hotels have nicer more modernized rooms, but my overall experience at Monte Carlo was better than at those hotels which really surprised me. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We were celebrating two birthdays and had a group of 35.  Most were staying at Monte Carlo and a few of us very lucky folks stayed at the amazing Hotel 32.  I've already reviewed Hotel 32 so I won't include any details here.  I really enjoy the smaller size of the casino and was very, very impressed by the lack of smoke on the casino floor.  We rented the executive (party) cabana on a Saturday and Sunday and WOW this is definitely THE way to go with a group our size.  There is a wading pool that's kind of like a moat that surrounds the cabana and I believe is 15-18 inches deep.  Being able to sit in the wading pool with the temps well north of 100 both days was oh so perfect!  We also enjoyed the exclusivity of this cabana as the other smaller cabanas really don't provide that exclusive feel since they are set up in the main people traffic areas of the pool\/lazy river.  The cabana service was definitely first-rate.  We can't wait to return!!!

I recently stayed at Monte Carlo. I probably won't stay here again until after they renovate. It's not that there was anything wrong with Monte Carlo, it's just that it's seen it's better days. Rooms are boring. Casino is boring. Restaurants are boring. It's just kinda boring! Didn't feel exciting and engaging. I didn't feel thrilled to be in Vegas, in fact I found myself spending most of my time at other casinos! The Cabana was cool and may have been the highlight of the trip. Otherwise there are no memorable moments except the midnight pizza run to the food court.
You can't beat the price when there's a sale. A good tip to get good deals would be to sign up for email deals. I love their pools and lazy river.

It was a pretty good hotel. The price was right. We got the cheapest room because, when in Vegas, we don't stay in the room too often :)

BEST FEATURE: Right next to the CVS!!! Easy to access to the strip and shopping. It's absolute BEST FEATURE.

POKER ROOM: About a quarter of the size of Bellagio. Not the biggest poker room. It was nice enough. Played a tourney there. It was okay but I like bigger rooms.

There's a new "Street of Dreams" shopping area that leads to the monorail. That will take you to ARIA, Bellagio and other hotels. Pretty convenient. 

I saw security in the hallway making sure that a couple having a "discussion" was not actually having a disruptive "argument" - I'm grateful to that. I detest rowdiness unless I am the creator of it.

Did not visit the pool as it was winter.

I'm starting to go to Vegas a little more - now that I have $$ to spend. Most of the hotels are pretty much the same. Keep in mind that big conglomerates own these babies now - as evidenced by the M-Life card.

Old hotel, everything outdated, nothing impressive. It was actually not that memorable. The hotel is set back a little from the street, so you feel like you're never reaching the hotel door. The casino was old and our dealer was a jerk. He assumed no one knew how to play roulette & spoke as if we were children and reminded us when to make bets. Never visiting this hotel\/casino again.
First time in the Monte Carlo resort , don't really like it theirs no wifi the rooms are not that great

I give 4 stars because the front desk staff is very nice. I would give 3 stars for the hotel because the view of the strip kinda sucks & the rooms are just average. Hotels is in desperate need of a renovation, inside. The front of the hotel just had a renovation within the past few years & is very nice.
The pool area was good, not big enough for everyone, but it was slow when we were there.
Location is pretty good, I wouldn't say the middle, but close enough.

Super disgusting hotel which should be called a motel by the way!
Construction on every floor and the supervisor was not taking responsibility to refund or even apologize ! 
Dont stay here !

First time staying at the Monte Carlo and I was very impressed. I stayed in one of the Diamond Suites on the 30th floor and really liked how the hotel split the elevators based on what floor your were on. This was great since I didn't have to share an elevator with any drunken frat boys or trashy low-class families from the Midwest that time forgot. 

The room was excellent and the service was impeccable. They really made me feel welcome and tended to my needs. I got there very early at around 11:30am and they let me do an early check in for only $20.  Before you cheapos complain, let's remember that's $20 for early check in on a suite. 

I really liked the atmosphere at this hotel. It was fancy without overdoing it. No wacky gimmicks or anything. Just a really well done hotel and casino. Far from being trashy like Excalibur but not as fancy pants as Bellagio.  Sure, you see people that look out of place and probably cashed in their MyVegas rewards for a free room but it's OK. They should enjoy this fine hotel since next week they'll be back to living in their van down by the river.

This is probably one of the worst hotel and casino resorts in Vegas. Every staff member was unsure of the simplest questions. They were unhelpful and did not care about customer service. I couldn't even walk up to talk to my grandmother who is disabled without being pushed around and discriminated for how young I look. Upgraded to a suite room because the first room was gross. Come to find out the suite was dirty as well. Our drain was clogged and flooded our whole bathroom, the sheets had wet dirty towels stuck in them with hair all over. At midnight we called for new sheets, they did not arrive until 2 am. At the seafood buffet dinner there was moldy food and poor service. I left an item in the first room we tried to stay in and they couldn't find it until 2 minutes before we left. The food everywhere was gross. The pool closed at 5. The only good thing about this hotel is the valet service. The valet was very pleasant!!

This hotel is the WORST hotel I have EVER stayed in. If I could rate ZERO stars I would. We stayed there a total of 3 nights and not ONE did house keeping visit our room. (No we didn't have the do not disturb sign on the door). The shower head , toilet and sink were filthy. The same cart of eaten food, glasses and plates sat in the hallway for 3 days. Each time we came back into our room it smelled as though it was the 70's and a marijuana festival was going on inside if our room. I called to have my room changed and I was told that I would charged a fee.p

The Worst Way To Start My Bday!!!!

The hubby and I went to the Monte Carlo to celebrate my birthday! We get there and the wait umm not to bad. Customer service was good i'll give them that. After 7 minutes we are checked in , and we are ready to head to  the room when we get there it was disgusting!!! 

Stains everywhere!!! The bathroom had hair on the floor!! Eww can you say gross!!! Ok so hubby calls front desk and  explains the situation and we were transferred to another room... Ok not bad right? WRONG!! 2nd room had pube hair in the shower! stains on the bed , the floor on the LAMPS!!! Like are you serious?!?!

I wanted OUT of there!!! This whole process took 3 1\/2 hrs!!!!! 

Off to the MGM we went! I will never stay at the Monte Carlo again!!!!!

Do not stay in room 3-112! Starting at 4am on 8.26.17 the noise was unbareable and impossible to sleep through. It started with a continuous knocking sound similar to a headboard hitting the wall over and over again. We figured the next door neighbors were going at it, but after discovering the headboards are attached to the wall, we knew that couldn't be it. Then we remembered that Monte Carlo is under construction. I checked my phone and saw it was 4:40am, so it definitely couldn't be hammering from construction. The knocking noise was continuous from 4:40 am to about 5:30. Around 5am another secondary noise started. The sound was similar to someone drilling a screw into wood or similar to a phone vibrating on a wooden desk. It is now 8:45 and the second noise happens every 6-7 minutes and last for about 10 seconds. It's so loud and disturbing. At 7:30am the knocking that had stopped is now back! Now both noise are continuous. I have no idea how this hotel expects someone to be able to sleep here. I can't be the only one that has made the complaint about this room. I have no clue what is making the noise but you literally have to hear it to believe it! It's crazy loud. We called to the office twice now asking to be moved immediately, well guess what, there is no availability because its one of the biggest boxing fight weekends! Great! Now we have to wait until someone checks out at or around noon in order to be moved. Their response, "wait for a text" then your room will be ready. No one apologizes for the lack of sleep my husband and I had to endure, no one asks if they can send someone to check it out to see what the hell is creating the noise, no one cares that the lack of service and urgency is not being given to a customer. I will never stay here again and I will be sure to spread the word about my nightmare experience.

We stayed here during Easter weekend, everything was very nice with the exception of one thing. The Buffet is one of the worst Buffets in Vegas, Very disapointing "Easter Buffet", seemed they charged more for getting less, not much of variety, cold food, dessert bar because of Easter was a lesson on "100 ways "to use Jelly beans, it didn't get better the next day again lack of variety, which wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't one of the highest priced Buffets in town. The service staff in the buffets were excellent.
The breakfast at Denny's across the street was one of the best meals we had in Vegas

We just returned from our yearly trip to Vegas, and our second stay at Monte Carlo. Last year, I would have given it 4 stars, but this year it only gets 2. 

What I like: the bed was incredibly comfortable. I could have slept all day in it. I like the fact that they now have a tram to Bellagio, which is super convenient. Easy check in\/out. Shorter ride from the airport, so lower cab fare. Two Starbucks on site. I've had great luck on certain slots (better than any other casino). Choice of a couple restaurants that I would pay 2nd visits to (Dragon Noodle & Diablo's Cantina). Nice pools. The casino always smells fresh. Free printing of boarding passes. Great deals if you sign up for their e-mails - but then again, I feel like you get what you pay for (we paid $39 a night for two nights and $49 for the 3rd). I really like the makeup mirror in the bathroom (when it wasn't fogged up).

My complaints: (and these are all from this visit) Easy to hear people walking down the halls, and TVs through the walls. We stopped back at our room mid-afternoon one day to nap so we could stay out late, and finally gave up because we could hear conversations and the TV from our neighboring rooms. 

The bathroom has no ventilation fan, and no light above the shower. We ended up showering with the bathroom door open so we weren't fogged in. The shower was pretty dark. Also, in our room this time, the hair dryer was near death.

We don't order room service, but had we wanted to there was no menu or any hotel related binder with hours of restaurants\/spa\/pool etc. 

I know we stayed in the standard room, but a dozen channels on a TV that isn't LCD\/plasma doesn't really cut it for Vegas standards. We don't go to Vegas to watch TV, but we usually have it on for a few minutes before going to bed. 

The decor was average. I wouldn't call the room outdated, but there was nothing that made it stand out. Again, we were in a standard room, other rooms at higher price points may be decorated more stylish.

We've stayed there twice and even this time wasn't something that I would complain exuberantly about, but we've decided that for our future Vegas trips we will be trying other hotels.

Pros: great customer service, fast check in\/check out(even if the lobby looks full because there are a lot of front desk workers), comfy bed, friendly staff, fast room service

Cons: mandatory resort fee PER NIGHT(which was useless & a waste of money because I didn't use it at all), lack of channel selection(which didn't matter since I was rarely in the hotel room), room was not 100% cleaned- couple things were left behind from last guests, mandatory deposit at booking

Overall, Monte Carlo was a good hotel and I wouldn't mind staying here again! The price is good and the pros definitely outweighs the cons.

I would recommend this hotel room to a friend.

Absolutely horrible. The front of the hotel was under constriction and they didnt tell is that when we booked. My husband and I reserved a king bed, and instead we got two doubles. When I called down to
Ask about it, they said they "didnt have anything available" even tho we booked
Our trip 3 months in advance. Their solution was to give us one the next day in the smoking section. The bathtub had black hair all over it, and the glasses provided for us has lipstick stains on them, the floor wasnt vacuumed either. My
Husband called this time
To complain and they offered us a $30 food credit. We ended up staying one night out of 4 in the hotel and got
A refund. This place is a joke.

Nothing ritzy, or breath taking. Okay hotel. It gets the job done, you have a place to sleep and you're pretty accessible to most popular areas of the strip. You can access city center by taking the tram in the bellagio and get around easier. Or just walk over to NYNY. Amenities not so impressive. If you're looking to spend all your time getting blasted on the strip, and only need a bed, roof, and some sheets. Be a guest at the Monte Carlo.

I stay in Vegas often and usually try to pick a different place each time just to try everything.  Lately, though, I've been staying at MGM more and more often just because the other properties seem to be going downhill.  Monte Carlo is one such property.

Casino:

The casino was OK and had a good vibe.  My only annoyance here was a pit boss totally ignoring me betting $20-$30 per round on roulette because I was using the $1 chips (it was a $5 minimum table at the time).  After several rounds he finally came over and offered to explain how the comps work and that we need to bet a lot more than the minimum to be noticed.  Really?  Well if you'd been watching, you'd have seen that I just dropped $400 on the stupid table.  He did try to make up for it once he noticed how annoyed I was, though, so that was cool.  Also, it didn't help that the dealer at the roulette table was totally uninterested and kept looking off in the distance and yawning.  I don't think the employees are very happy here.

Hotel:

The hotel is "eh".  My standard rant at any of these properties are their so called "queen sized" beds.  They are NOT queen sized beds!  They're doubles!!  Don't advertise that you're getting a queen size when it's a tiny little double!!  The pillows were like 2 foot tall bricks the first night.  I asked housekeeping for better pillows for the second night and they brought some feather pillows up which were much nicer.

The rooms are VERY loud.  I could hear people coughing and sneezing a floor up and below from me and also next door.  The plumbing is really really loud, too, and at one point was making a really loud hummm for hours.   I was awoken each morning around 6AM  and couldn't get back to sleep because of all of the noise.  Not a good way to encourage me to stay up all night gambling :(

Go to MGM.  It'll be much nicer.

Not impressed at all! No Wifi internet service in guest rooms. Room service lacked attention to detail and the overall maintenance left something to be desired. Half the lights in the room did not work and the TV was broken. Luckily I was too busy to use the TV. Spend a couple bucks more and stay at the Luxor.

@ben_freedman

Hotel room was not clean.... there were coffee marks on the sheet... and.. hairs... we booked 2 nights originally, but end up cancel and switch hotel after few hrs...... they really need to remodel their room... theres no Wi-fi in the room, which sucks.......

Not the best hotel I have been to, but it's big, has a pool (party pool mostly) a gym, an overly expensive spa and lot's of function rooms. 

It's at a very convenient location allowing for walking around the Las Vegas Strip. Inside there is a small food court (starbucks, sbarro pizza and a couple more places). It's a walking distance from a CVS as well. Rooms are very spacious and beds are comfortable.

I was so excited to stay at this hotel based on all of the great reviews from my colleagues who had stayed here before. What a disappointment!  First of all, they charge a ridiculous resort fee for the "great amenities" they offer. What amenities?  The pool is closed so I couldn't even relax in the lazy river I had heard so much about. Then, I asked for a rollaway bed for my other guest who has severe neck issues. I was told that they could not put a rollaway bed in my room even though when I had called weeks prior and they told me this would be possible if I went to the front desk and requested it. Speaking of the front desk, don't even get me started. Unaccommodating, and incompetent. To assist me, instead of giving me the rollaway I requested, the manager said to me "here's a $25 credit that you can spend in our hotel."  I don't know about you, but I am not excited to give this hotel any more of my business or hard earned money. What a disappointment!  My dissatisfaction is through the roof.

This is the go-to hotel in Vegas if you're on a budget but would rather not stay in a rathole. We stayed here for the Pacquiao fight last weekend and, being right across the street, it turned out to be the next best thing to staying at MGM itself. It's right in the middle of everything along The Strip and is easily cheaper and just as nice as most of the big resorts surrounding it. I was a bit under the weather and pretty much called it a night after the fight ended so the cleanliness of the room was much appreciated. That soapy smell in the lobby is damn near intoxicating but the kicker was turning $2 into $20 in one minute playing the Wheel of Fortune slots right before we headed to the airport for the flight home. At least I won back *some* of my alcohol money.

Planned a quick trip for my mother in laws birthday so we had to book a room fast. My mom has stayed at the Monte Carlo years ago and she loved it. So we decided to stay here since all the other hotels were booked. We get to the hotel and wanted to see if we could get the same floor to my sister in laws room since she as well was staying at the hotel. They told us that was possible but our room wouldn't be ready until FIVE PM.. Mind you it was ELEVEN AM. No way would we wait that long so we decided to just get another room in any floor. BIGGEST MISTAKE! The front desk told us we would get a strip view for the inconvenience on the 9th floor. We were excited to go check out the room and when we go in the view of the strip was non existen we had a wonderful view of the roof of the top of the casino.. 1 star down..

I tried to be open minded and not let that bother me.. But then I go use the restroom and the door gets jammed! I yelled for my mother in law to go help me open it because I was literally stuck inside the bathroom. It took about 5 mins to finally be able to open it . She had to push the door open with her whole body..Another star down..

We go down to the pool to tan and relax for a bit. They do have a small pool and even smaller jacuzzi.  A lazy river. And a wave pool. We walked around and it was beyond crowded you had to search for any empty chairs. The water was so nasty and hazy . I didn't dare to even go into the pool!

Bathroom lighting is horrible and the toilet flushing is so loud.. So night time rolls around and it's time for us to shower and get ready so I let my mother in law shower first. When she's done showering she tells me I might have to wait to shower because the tub is full of water.. The drainage was so bad it took forever for the water to go down. So we ran late to dinner because of this . Minus another star.

The pillows are not comfortable at all! They are so hard I even had to sleep with no pillows since it was unbearable.  On the other side of my bed there was also a big wet stain. Of course I didn't realize it until I stepped on it with my bare feet. I will never know what that was..

At this point I wish yelp had an option to put zero stars.. I won't ever be staying here again. If everything wasn't so crammed in together I would've been able to complain but by then I just wanted to hurry up and self check out and never stay in this nightmare or a hotel again. If your running on a budget there are plenty of inexpensive hotels on the strip. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY STAYING HERE.

Monte Carlo is a fairly good value but just too boring for me. Mind you I'm in my early 40s so I'm not the twenty something all wild and crazy in Vegas but Monte Carlo is a snooze fest. Stayed here on a MLife offer for a comp night Sun - Thurs. Paid for a Sat & Sun and got a Monday night free. Got a standard two queen bed room on the 8th floor. Definitely a "beige" room. NOTHING has changed in these standard rooms since I stayed here in 1998 and 2008. Oh, except for the resort fees of which I get nothing out of them experiencing a terrible headache when I have to pay them. Come on get with the times Monte Carlo and get wi-fi all throughout the hotel and casino! Who uses a wired internet connection anymore? This is a beige and brown, bland, boring hotel. There's just nothing special here. There is a flat screen tv in the room with no hi-def signal. It is pitiful! The tv looks terrible but who's in their room watching it anyway I guess. Just wanted to watch a little NFL football on a Sunday morning while getting ready though. The furniture in the room is so old and scratched in the room you would think you were staying in a bad, cheap motel. The room decor has not changed since it was built. I think that goes for the beds and mattresses too. Ours was not comfy, it sagged. The mattress looked and felt like it was worn out and needed to be replaced. However, if you stay at Hotel 32, which is on the high floors that were renovated with insurance monies from the fire a few years ago, that is now a resort within a resort and those rooms have wi-fi and are much nicer. Bottom line, inside of the hotel needs a thorough renovation to modernize. The rooms need complete remodel and updates asap plus wi-fi added throughout the entire hotel. If you read more reviews, they say the same thing about no wi-fi throughout the entire hotel, it's only in the lobby. Despite what you think casino management, people gamble while on their smartphones on Facebook, Twitter, texting and Yelping of course!! Plus, people will stay sitting at slots longer because they are digitally connected and can get in touch with friends and family via electronics. Ha, maybe tell them to come and sit by them and gamble with them!

Yeah, Monte Carlo has the Blue Man Group, the Ice Bar, The Pub and a steak house but if you don't go to them, then there's nothing else. Tried to go to The Pub to watch NFL on a Sunday but it was packed. Servers said you have to get there really early for a spot. The pool is shaded most of the day and everyone crowds into the littlest sunny spot in the earlier part of the day.

Mold around the tub and shower in the bathroom was just plain gross. I just don't see how it is that much work for maintenance to remove the sealant around the sides of the tub and shower that is moldy and apply new sealant. It is so gross to look at it, none the less, shower in it. The shower head is terrible. My 6'3" husband has to duck a mile to wash his hair. It's like they placed the shower head in a spot on the wall for growing adolescents. Plus, of course there is no water pressure because they are using water saving faucets and shower heads. 

I redeemed rewards from Facebook myVegas slots for a buffet of buy one get one free at the Monte Carlo buffet. I would not eat at the Monte Carlo buffet again. There's a reason you've never heard of the Monte Carlo Buffet before. It was not good. Not even worth the coupon. I would spend my time and money going to a higher quality buffet in the future. Even Harrah's buffet is better. I cannot remember one item of food that I consumed that had any real taste. Everything was bland.

The only good things for Monte Carlo Resort and Casino are that check-in was fast, no cab line (I wonder why? not many guests staying there?), lots of elevators to room towers so no wait for elevators, Diablos out front is pretty fun late night for some people watching, Ignite Lounge up front has some pretty good specialty drinks, staff are friendly for the most part, and housekeeping seemed pretty good. If you like coffee there is a Keurig in the room but I didn't use it. If I would've known maybe I would've brought a flavored coffee k-cup with me but I wasn't interested in the plain black stuff. No fridge in the room if anyone is wondering.

If you're looking for a very basic, value property in Vegas with no frills, no pizazz, no glitz, then Monte Carlo may be for you. It's just too blah for me and I can't handle the mold in the shower. Even a three-star Harrah's or Flamingo mid-strip is more exciting for me. Especially when the Linq is done. Go Rooms at Flamingo have mini fridges in the rooms I might add.
I love the pool at the Monte Carlo.  Specifically, the lazy river!  Great people watching, cool views, and cold drinks.  GREAT DJ most days.

i'm rating em based on my casino experience.. i think monte carlo is smart to have lower limit on the table games.. the inside.. is so average.. casino doesn't look appealing but hey! its a casino.. no matter how it looks like, u still throw money in there.. lol lost a lot there.. but i think i enjoyed my experience meeting up with the friendly dealers.. the people who play there are friendly and nice too.. it was great.. oh and i played in front of dancing bimbos.. they have great butts.. worth checking.. :D they moved em a lot too.. so for guys who like butts.. i think u can go try to check it out.. play blackjack in front of moving butts.. 

oh.. its minus 2 stars coz the club is located right inside the casino.. and its friggin loud!! the songs are pretty bad too.. and oh.. the dancing chix place also have another music.. they're not better.. horrible choices of music.. 

otherwise, if u win, and the music is better.. monte carlo is fine.. i guess..

I havn't been to Vegas in 6 years or so. i wanted to stay on the strip during EDC. had sum friends who got suites at the Monte Carlo. read some reviews, and thought it would be fine. overall, i would rate my experience a 4. free self-parking was a plus. 
also, there's a tram (for FREE) that takes you to the Bellagio!

the pool was really cool. they have a lazy-river! i rented an inner-tube ($10 each) for a day. be careful! there were many ppl trying to steal other's inner tubes! it only cost $10 people!

all rooms in my opinion, should have a mini-fridge and microwave. i was told it would cost $30 for a mini-fridge! because i got a "deluxe" room, and they had to downgrade me because i wanted a smoking room, i was able to get the mini-fridge comped. that was pretty cool. 

the "view" of the strip, was o-kay. got room service for breakfast one morning. that was fun. i agree with some other people, the shower head was ridiculous! seemed hard to get any water pressure out. the shower head looks fancy, but doesn't do anything.

my only BIG complaint is that the pool closes at 7pm!!!! this is vegas. why not midnight?? 

other than that, it was a nice hotel

$5 black jack tables on a friday night, personable dealers and efficient cocktail servers. We had a great time at the Monte Carlo Casino, all the dealers were fun and friendly; which always makes winning (or losing) better. This casino was a good time, we left full of booze and with some cash in our pockets!

This is a decent hotel. Good location,across MGM hotel and there is free a tram ride to Bellagio. Other than a casino,there are many more facilities inside but the whole experience was just so so...
Overall the decor is simply forgettable, we already forget how it looked like. 
Morning buffet could get crowded and you might have to wait to get seated.
In the sea of hotels in Las Vegas strip, we might stay elsewhere next time...

Had my first stay at the Monte Carlo this last week on 3\/27\/17. First of all, my room was comped, courtesy of the MyVegas app. Paid the resort fee and tax, and had myself a room for about $50 when all was said and done.

For the price, this place is pretty outstanding. As a person who won't spend Bellagio prices on a room in Vegas, this is one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in. The hotel features a respectable amount of artwork everywhere, lending to it's visual appeal. Every single hallway is lined with original artwork. I stopped to look at dozens of them and never saw the same painting twice. Best of all, there are many sculptures on the property as well. Not quite as large and ornate as you might see at Caesar's Palace, but quite respectable given the price range.

The casino is pretty standard, with a good selection of slots and tables games, and even a small poker room. They do feature $5 blackjack, which was a plus. And hanging above all the tables are these large, expensive-looking chandeliers - a nice touch. Furthermore, if you aren't gambling, there are still plenty of places to get cheap drinks! One of the bars had $4 pints of Shock Top and Sierra Nevada. Not bad. 

Now we come to the room. Again, for the price, it was rather impressive. Even more artwork was to be found in our standard, 2-queen room. We did not upgrade to the strip view, but still had a very nice view of the Aria, the Cosmopolitan, and even a glimpse at the Mirage and TI. A lovely view, only slightly dulled by the dirty window, and the construction going on way down below. The bathroom featured very nice tile in the shower. And all the fixtures and accents had a matching gold trim. Only complaint about the room would be that the mattresses were pretty saggy. I still slept soundly, however.

The Monte Carlo, like all MGM Hotels on the strip, DOES charge you for parking, even if you're staying at the hotel. Pretty lame, but the that's how things seem to be on the strip these days. There's still a few hotels that do offer free parking, Closest would be the Tropicana. We parked there, and it was a pretty long 15 minute walk with our bags.

Overall I was pretty darn happy with my stay. I would definitely be fine with staying here again.

Came here to gamble because of my wife's cousin. Loved that there were some slots at 50 cents, a machine with $1 blackjack, and another machine with $1 roulette, and a table with $5 blackjack. The rest are about $10 minimum bet. 

Now the main issue here: parking is a bit misleading. If you are an overnight guest, it is $8 for parking. If you aren't, it is $20. Keep that in mind!

More like 1.5 stars.  

I went to Vegas for a quick overnight trip and needed a room for one night.  The location is great because it is on the strip, next to Citycenter and my friends were staying here as well.  Outside of that, this place blows more than the girls pictured on the flyers handed out on Las Vegas Blvd.  Even though I only paid $79 for the room, I know I paid too much.  

The rooms are old and need a major updating.  They still have cathode ray tube televisions in the rooms.  The rooms are clean and seem to have new bedding but it still doesn't help.  

The hotel\/casino is only a little better.  A little more up-to-date but there's a smell that you can't get away from.  At first, we thought it was some lady going nuts on the cheap perfume and we happened to be trailing her but it was there everytime we walked in and out of the gambling area.  We concluded that it was some perfume\/scent pumped in to mask what ever smell was going on at this place.  

The dealers are\/seemed so unhappy working here.  They were just counting the minutes until death showed up or maybe a paper cut from one of the cards they were dealing so that they can go on disability and not have to be at the entry way to purgatory.  No smiles, no personalities, just a blank stare at you with emptiness inside of them.  Sad.  

The customer's here are a "little rough around the edges" is the best way to describe it.  They look like they could be locals who usually gamble in downtown but wanted to upscale it for the night. 

Never again will I stay in this place regardless of my friends.  Should have trusted my gut and booked a room at Vdara, Aria or the Mandarin Oriental since they were right next door.  We wound up gambling at the Aria casino anyway.  Uggghhh....

We stayed here last couple of days ago and all I can say is "i wil never gonna stay here or at any hotel affiliated with this hotel ever again"
The room is just regular room nothing so special about it.. just the Strip view. Idk maybe I just expect too much.. coz I paid too much maybe.? Lol
All is well.. until the day of our check out... so before leaving Vegas.. we had a branch at the buffet. 
Then my father in law need to use the restroom which located outside the buffet so.. he went out to use the restroom, and never get back to us so we finished our food and saw him in front of the buffet with a security... I thought they're just talking.. not until I saw my father in law showed his ID to the security guy.. so I was like.. umh the'res something wrong.... my husband asked what's going on... and the security said." HE'S NOT WELCOME HERE. HE'S UNDER surveillance" .they want to escort my dad to leave tbe hotel..  How could someone get under surveillance when he just got out from a buffet????? 
My husband told the security guy we're a  hotel guest  here how could you say that he's not welcome here???this is so embarrassing.   Then the security guy radio it.. and the security guy" oh you're a guest here? I'm so sorry he looked like someone who's under surveillance" mistaken identity in short.. That incident is NOT FUNNY AT ALL!!!!!!!. 
I really wanted to talk to a manager or supervisor that time but
We just really need to leave that time coz we have kids with us... but I'm still trying to get in touch to Monte Carlo regarding with this incident..I want a clear answer from your security...... 

Date June 6 
Around 12:30 pm in front of the buffet

Good strip hotel and an excellent value. Centrally located. I don't much care for the theme or decor, seems generic.

I like to access the hotel from Frank Sinatra Dr. It easier to access the parking lot and registration.

This is your average hotel on the strip. There is nothing fancy about it but it does have Diablos Cantina next door which shows a lot of your high profile sporting events. 

      Check-in at the Monte Carlo went very smoothly. I had reserved my room on a comp that I received through "My Vegas Slots" which is a Vegas application on your smart phone, and I had no issues redeeming it. I even requested a room next to some friends and they granted my wish without hesitation.

     My one complaint about this place is that the wifi is very sketchy. Downstairs in the casino and surrounding areas it worked great. Once you tried using it in your room it would fade out. If you are going to charge your guests over $25 for resort fees, I would expect everything to be at it's full capacity.
Monte Carlo is renovating. Do not come here until it's done. Jackhammering right above my room. I think it's a ploy to get me in the Casino.

This is the last time I am staying at Monte Carlo. I stayed before and loved it but this time was the worst experience I have ever had. First when I got there I was placed on 7th floor with a view and I asked to upgrade and they said no rooms available. That was fine but when I got to the room I found dirty bed sheets. So I told the front desk and instead of giving me a same floor type of room they down graded me 3 floors to floor 4 and took away my view. Forget all of this the next day there was no house keeping for my room, and when I asked for fresh towels they left the dirty ones in front of my door outside cause simply "too busy right now". It was there still when I was walking out the next day to go check out. I would never stay here again, and would not recommend it to anyone.

So, awesome evening. Came back to the hotel after a long day at work to find a letter left in my room saying the water is going to be shut off to upgrade the plumbing at 11pm. The front desk said they can't guarantee they will have it on by 5am so I may not be able to shower before heading off to work in the morning. Really?? You didn't know this when I checked in Sunday AND my reservation was for all 2 week stay?? Since I had to be up for work early tomorrow,  they offered to switch me to a different room. I had packed up all my stuff (keep in mind that it's 2+ weeks if stuff) and trek down to the lobby with all my stuff, get onto a different elevator to head to the replacement room - which despite the inconvenience was NOT an upgrade.  The bed in the new room was beyond saggy in the middle as well as squeeky. There were also crumbs all over the floor. So they moved me to yet ANOTHER room. The room still wasn't an upgrade to either rooms. Now, at 9:45 pm I have to unpack - again, get some sleep and be up at 5:30 to get ready for work. Completely exhausted, frustrated and pissed. Let's hope the remainder of my stay better.

Casino is OK. There was a bar there... Sort of at the end of the ice bar. The service there was really bad- never asked us what we wanted. After waitig 19 minutes, we asked for service and waitress was offended and rude.

This hotel was what we needed it to be, a clean room and comfy bed and it helped that there were some great dining and entertainment choices downstairs. 

We stayed during the week and came for a conference so we avoided the high weekend prices. I would definitely suggest coming during the week if you can, it's always packed but you can save some money and still have a really entertaining time. 

This was our first time in Vegas so I'm sure if you browse around you can find some great deals in some great rooms, but as far as I'm concerned the Monte Carlo was great.

Monte Carlo is not what I expected. Many people asked where I was staying and I said the Monte Carlo & everyone would say, "wow what a nice hotel". Maybe I set my expectations high due to those who said only positive things about this hotel but it isn't all that. Although what did I expect. The staff here is very helpful which I did enjoy. Everyone including the housekeeping were amazingly nice. I loved that about this hotel. Now talking about the room, I found hair in a couple of places including our bed & the bathroom. Then there was a cup placed right out our door that had been left there 2 out of 3 nights of our stay. A cup that was not ours. The location is okay, I noticed we walked all the way over towards the Bellagio to Harrahs, but thank god for the tram that allows you to get to Bellagio. Another thing, the water drain in shower does takes FOREVER to go down. Though the rooms is very clean and comfy I liked this hotel. All hotels have the good and bad. I had a good time though. I will be returning to the Monte Carlo for my 21st in August. It sounds that I'm only talking bad but I really enjoyed my time, and the Starbucks down stairs. The food court down below is nice as well, so when you return with drunken hunger you have choices. I would recommend this hotel, it is nice! But not the best, though I have nothing to compare on the strip.

We chose this hotel because it is located in a good spot on the strip and the price was good. We were told that the pool was under construction so we would have free access to MGM and Madalay pools, which was absolutely fine and we knew this ahead of time. However, we were not told that there would be construction above our room. We were woken up at 7am by banging- like wall shaking banging. It was awful. We went to breakfast and were hoping the noise would be gone by the time we returned to our room. The noise was worse when we got back. I was scheduled for a late check out at 6pm with a fee of $60, which I was ok with... until I realized I would be sitting in a room with vibrating walls due to something that sounded like a jackhammer above me. I called guest services to see if they would waive the $60 because I had no choice to stay (my flight was later) and I needed to get work done. I was on hold for 22 minutes!!! I timed it... it was 22 minutes. Finally, when someone answered they said they could give me a late checkout for $30. You would think they would have said something like "sorry we didn't inform you construction was inside" or would just waive the $60 without question because they had to know seriously how loud this was. So, after 10 minutes they agreed to waive the $60. Absolutely horrendous to say the least. If you choose to stay here, expect incredibly loud construction INSIDE and OUTSIDE. And worst of all, no one seemed to care how it affects you. Maybe try this hotel after construction is done, but stay far away until then.

The person that delivered our bags and the pool waitress provided amazing customer service. They are the only reason I'm giving this place a 2star rating. The food sucked, the shower was broken, lamps in room didn't work. They make it impossible to use the resort credit. They charge $25 a day to have a fridge. Upon check in they asked if we were interested in a room upgrade because the rooms below the 12th floor were "really crappy." When we agreed, they told us "oops, I'm sorry we don't have any rooms available. You will be fine, the rooms aren't that bad." Really??? Who does that. The pool area SUCKS!!!
Realllly bad ... Bad service , bad room, no wifi in room.... I will not come here anymore.  Horrible hotel ........

I was accosted by a security guard because "you can't videotape in here sir;" I was FaceTiming my fiance.  It seems every time I come to Vegas, Monte Carlo management thinks up a new way to make me hate them more. 

As always, I pity anyone who stays or plays here. Maybe with all these renovations they're doing, they can replace their entire workforce too, and then they'll have a fighting chance. I'm not surprised to see their Yelp rating continue to sink while other MGM properties fare better. Jim Murren has some decisions to make about who runs MC.

Booked here for EDC weekend, room was good , I couldn't complain for the price we paid. 4 nights and no more then 800. The only thing is that you have to request a refrigerator and a microwave. The walls are tiny, so you hear EVERYTHING from the other rooms. Beds were comfy.

Let me start by saying, my wife and I have been coming to the Monte Carlo for years and we love it. Currently, they're going through a remodeling phase and we understand noise and other things come with that. The two star rating has nothing to do with that. We are more than confident the outcome of the remodel will be worth it. 
Now, let me get to my point. This trip has been issue after issue for us. After checking in, I realized my card was charged twice for our 3 night stay in a suite; you can do the math, it was a nice chunk of change. I contacted the front desk and did not receive an apology, empathy or any reaction that led me believe they were sorry or even cared about the mistake. I was told, "your card will be credited. This will take between 3-9 days. Is there anything else I can do for you"?
Next, we get to the room and discover the safe doesn't work. We contacted the front desk and security was sent up promptly. They were unable to fix it and advised a locksmith would respond within 10-30 minutes. 1 hour later and no one arrived. We're in Vegas and have better things to do so we went about our night on the town. We returned in the early morning hours to discover a loud beeping safe with "error" continuously flashing. Too tired to bother with it we went to bed and were awoken throughout the night by "beep beep beeeeeeep". 
In the morning we wake up and  prepare to go about our day when we now discover the lights and plugs in the master bathroom aren't working. After this happened I truly thought I was candid camera. Never have I had so many issues at one place. 
Needless to say, it has been a disappointing and frustrating experience with the Monte Carlo.

The Monte Carlo is the practical strip-goer's casino. It is probably the best balance of price and comfort available on the strip. It also offers an extremely high convenience factor when compared to other strip casinos. I'll explain.

1. There's a CVS right next door. In a town like Vegas, spontaneous supplies such as sunscreen, sunglasses, water, and Plan B may become crucial to a successful trip. When you stay at the Monte Carlo, your 24 hour CVS is just a quick walk away.

2. There's a tram to Aria and Bellagio. If walking is starting to get to you, this tram is your answer. It comes often and quickly whisks you a few hotels north so you can save your walking energy for later. This is especially useful if you need to get to the Bellagio quickly to give someone Plan B or money you owe them.

3. You aren't going to be killed by mobs when you walk around. The Monte Carlo is one of the smaller casino resorts and, as a result, doesn't draw a million people who just sit around and gawk at the craziness of the building. If you end up here with a woman screaming at you about some unplanned pregnancy, you're not going to draw nearly the number of stares that you would at the Venetian. 

4. The walk from your room to the outside world is very fast. This can be compared to the MGM Grand, where the walk from your room to the strip will take 2 days each way, which is hard when you're dragging someone somewhere while they are trying to make a scene.

Oh yeah, internet access is included with your room...but you have to use an ethernet cable because the year is 2003.

Old hotel but has some new amenities. The keys sometimes work which is all weird. Maybe it's our door. Hotel was very basic since i guess we got the cheapest room we can get? The cool thing is they have a great gym facility which i located on the 2nd floor pass the spa area, however they are not open 24 hours. The lazy pool was cool, and so was the beach wave\/ volleyball court. Overall, not a bad hotel and close to CVS, Walgreens and Ross and M&M factory
Amazing Hotel with alot to see and do!very nice hotel. Lazy river pool is great for kids.

My family and I stayed 3 nights in the Monte Carlo hotel after Memorial Day weekend. We've booked the trip via Expedia. We didn't know there was a 'RESORT FEE of $25 per night and wasn't told as we were checking in. 

Not sure where the hidden charge came from. If I knew of it, I would have booked another hotel that would have been a lot nicer. The Resort fee really doesn't include any special service. Worse of all, even the basic WIFI doesn't work in the room. Not only that, the WIFI in the public areas was so poor, we could barely connect to it. 

I am very disappointed with the stay. The rooms were old and with the additional $150 we paid for the stay, I have to say it was not worth the money. There are better options in Strip.

They have a 50's system! Overall, they still deal with issues as if they didnt know how to use IT systems! Could not believe what they have made me go through to make room charges, when im getting his trip as a present. They do not care for the credit card you book the room with!!! Dont even understand how that could work... Book with my dads Credit card since he is the one giving me and my bro the trip as a present. I was supposed to have my dads credit card with me when checking in to swipe! As if this wasnt enough, now i have to deal with everything by fax cuz they dont deal by email... FAX? R u kidding... On top of that, some of the people i have to deal with, not nice at all.. Some others were nice but mostly werent!

Baaaaaaaad for an MGM resort... So far, nothing like Aria!!!!

Held my wedding at the chapel inside this hotel and it was quite nice.  They have great wedding packages so I chose this hotel for the budget my husband and I were in. I wasn't able to meet the lady who set up the event for me, but  I was easily taken care of by someone else. 

The guy who handled our licenses didn't pronouce my last name correctly so I give one point off the rating. Other than that, the hotel lobby is quite spacious, but I wouldn't say that this hotel would fit the younger crowd.  My in-laws actually introduced me to this place and it isn't that bad.  

The standard rooms are decent and clean.  The view from the top is nice and I think this hotel is quite reasonable at price.  If you are looking to stay in a quiet atmosphere away from all the hype, then this is a great place to stay.

We stayed in the casino for about 40 minutes; 20 minutes longer than we wanted to. When I tried to cash out at the penny slot I was wasting money on, the machine refused to print my ticket. My boyfriend, at the slot machine next to mine, was able to print his, but no other machine, including the cash dispenser, would accept it again. After pressing the attendant call button and flagging down a cocktail waitress, eventually a nice old man came and apologized, and handed me my cash right away.

I'm giving it two stars instead of one because on the way out, we saw a sign explaining that they were experiencing network issues with the slot machines, so I appreciate their candidness. Unfortunately, there are probably 20 entrances to the casino, and there was no such sign on the one through which we entered.

Location! Location! Location!! This hotel was decent for the money. Our room was clean and we were well taken care of at the hotel. We used the pool area one day and were very pleased with the service poolside as well as the pool area itself. Had a pedicure in the spa it was average, that you could get anywhere but 3 times the price. Also didn't like that while the person was doing my pedicure, she was chatting about the days activities with a co-worker doing someone elses nails. For the price, it should be a more relaxing environment.  

The only bad thing about our stay, was that the night we arrived, it was late and our flight had been delayed. After finally getting our rental car and getting over to the hotel and checked in, we were thristy and hungry. We headed over to the bar area where they generally serve food as well.  Apparently we got there, just as food service was cut off (it was like 11pm on a Thursday). Everyone had ordered drinks already before finding out there was no food to be had here.  Since I was 6 mos preggo at the time and starving, we asked if we could go get McDonalds (which they have at this  food court thingy right next to this bar area) and eat that with the drinks that had been ordered. I couldn't believe they wouldn't let us! I could totally understand that if they were serving food still...I wouldn't have even asked.  But with all the tourists and the liklihood of delayed flights and such, I think they should have accomdated us.  So, instead of having a few more drinks there (sprite in my case) everyone else was drinking these huge beer spout things they  have, we headed out after one drink to sit in the food court and eat McDonalds.  Then, off to get drinks some place else.

Perhaps it was the heavy duty alcohol induced partying or maybe I just fell in love with the beautiful view from the 18th floor. Whatever it was, the Monte Carlo was good from all that I can remember. 

Two friends stood here for two weeks. So we decided to take the after party back to the room. 

It is massive, beautiful, and clean. Wish I could've experienced the pool, which looked beautiful from the top. I hear they have great pool parties. 

The lobby is humongous, I felt like I walked miles just to get to the elevator. The casino was dead at the time that we rolled in. Looked like a typical casino, slots, slots, slots.

The room was spacious, bright, minimal, and clean. The beds and pillows were so comfy, just what the doctor ordered to sleep off a hangover.

Loved that the windows could be opened a bit even though we were high up. Most hotels do not have windows that can be opened on higher floors. Leaving only the choice of the AC, which I am not a big fan of. Having the window open came with a price... Very loud music disturbing the peace from 7am until 9am.

All in all, I had a great time at the Monte Carlo. I would definitely visit its casino the next time I am in town.
Not the best place to stay.  No coffee in the room.  :-).  Check line was a nightmare.  Staff is nice though and bed is comfortable.

So I booked a room on Lasvegas.com and the only bad thing is that I was supposed to get a room facing the strip and I did not end up getting one. Other than that, the place is very beautiful and super clean.

We were in Vegas for the Marine Corps Ball but we didn't have a room for the prior night so we thought we'd stay in Monte Carlo since we were already there. It was very cheap, $70\/night, not bad at all. But you get what you paid for, it was just a room, nothing fancy, holiday inn quality. But on the plus side, it was very clean!
low end rooms need updating, construction makes it hard to get in and out.  I have been going to vegas for over 21 years would never stay here again.

Another stay here and I still haven't been swayed towards the negative. It was extremely convenient to catch the shuttle to CES. Although the hotel was a stop, we could never seem to make it in time for the 10:30am cut off. Fortunately, it's along the route of the City Center Tram, which also stops at the other shuttle area at the Bellagio. The staff was wonderful as always. Even my friends who have never stayed here until this past weekend loved it too. Then again, anything's better than Motel 6.

Spent the weekend at the Monte Carlo it was convenient right next to the T mobile arena. I won't stay here again the rooms really need to be upgraded. They were clean but old and dingy. Woke up to a guy sleeping in the hallway and empty bottles of beer by the elevator. We did eat the brunch and it was good food clean and fresh.

My girlfriend and I arrived at the Monte Carlo to see the Blue Man Group. We arrived and had a hard time locating the self-parking section. We looked for signs and only after driving through the Valet section of the Hotel did we see the self-parking parking structure. 

As we pulled into the parking structure we observed a Security Guard in a 'Yellow' shirt driving around on a mountain bike. This helped our State of mind about leaving our suitcases and dry cleaning in the vehicle while we were inside the Casino for several hours, prior to walking away from out vehicle my girlfriend and I pulled a 'surfer' changing outfit routine inside of our vehicle. My girlfriend did not find it as amusing that as cars drove by I was pointing at her, it was funny and no harm no foul because they just thought I was a lunatic pointing at our car, my girlfriend was blocked by car doors. 

We parked on the 2nd level and found a tunnel\/bridge that leads directly into the Casino. As soon as we walked into the Casino I asked the first employee I laid eyes on 'Where is the Blue Man Group Theater.' The employee was super helpful and directed us in the right direction. 

As for the Casino itself it was a little bit too commercialized for my taste. As I have stated before I am more of the type of person that wants to kick it 'Old School' in Downtown Las Vegas. I tend to gravitate toward the closer surroundings of a Casino. I want to feel the energy while gambling instead of walking a maze of slot machines & roulette tables to get to a bathroom. 

I will be kicking myself in the butt because in the process of walking to the bathroom I said to myself put $20.00 on '24' on Roulette, I didn't and of course what hit but '24' dang you!!!!!!! 

We did enjoy our time inside the Monte Carlo but I cannot imagine a situation where I would ever come back here to gamble. I would without question come back to see the Blue Man Group again, that was an awesome show and I applaud the Monte Carlo for bringing a show like this to their Hotel & Casino.

***Side note I took a picture which is attached to this review of a food challenge being offered at the Monte Carlo, that picture is a must see!!!!!!!!***

The prices are very reasonable even on a busy weekend. I love the lazy river pool and I especially love that the parking structure is close to the rooms. 

I can deal with not staying on the strip if I can save myself a couple of bucks, which I do if I stay at the Monte Carlo.

The Monte Carlo is a decent place to stay, but aside from that, there is not much else to do at the hotel. There used to be a brewery, but now that is gone...and along with it, any chance that I will ever really visit Monte Carlo unless I happen to get comped a room there.

The rooms are all decent. Nothing special, nothing amazing, but livable for a few nights away from home. 

I can't even begin to review the casino, because I have never really gambled here outside of the Poker Room, and only for a few minutes at that the only time I was there. 

Basically, the Monte Carlo is only good for sleeping and not much else, in my opinion.

The hotel is pretty at the lobby and appearance. However the rooms are disappointing considering the star level of the hotel. And most ridiculously it does NoT have wifi at all! Not even you wanna purchase it!! And mobile reception is horrible in the whole building. Unless you wish to gamble all the time and forget about the rest of the world, you'd rather run to the affiliated parking lot to get some connection than staying in the room.

The wall is extremely thin that we could hear any coughs from our neighbors. 


We came on a Sunday at 7:00pm. The check in line was like half an hour long.

Dynamite location on the strip. You can easily access MGM, Aria and the Cosmo by staying here. The price\/value is top notch, however the rooms are in need of a major upgrade. Everything in the bedrooms is so outdated! The bed was immensely comfortable though. If you can get a room here for under $100 I'd say it's worth it, but at $140+ I would stay somewhere else. I say Cosmo is a 5 star place, MGM a 4 and Monte Carlo is a 3. The best part about this hotel\/casino is the location and the pool. They do not have any late night restaurants except a pretty chintzy food court. The pool area is actually pretty good - not nearly as good as MGM, but pretty dang good for a hotel pool (and there are 3 of them - a regular pool, a wave pool and a lazy river).

Other than the check in line taking forever, nice hotel. Decent clean room but nothing special, nice shops and good options for places to eat. Diablos cantina is really good for lunch! And some guy in the casino gave me free tickets for the blue man group because his friends didn't want to go and that show was awesome! I would pay to see it again. The Casino is a casino, just like most of the others in Vegas, not too crowded though which is nice, didn't win anything though!

I enjoyed my stay here more than I expected to, after reading the Yelp reviews. I found a great deal that included free buffets, free drinks, and access to their spa facility. Time passed by so quickly during our stay, we didn't get to take advantage of the spa facility before we left. But who wants to be indoors in the water, when you can be OUTdoors in the water AND under the warm sun with plenty of drinks in hand. They have a few pools to choose from. Loved the river pool with the current that pushes you along. Didn't really go in their wave pool, but it looked like a lot of fun. Good location on the strip, not too far south, you still feel like you're in the mix of things. But not recommended if you're looking for a young scene. People who stay at this hotel tend to be older and families.

On the strip

We stayed here a while back, awesome view. No balcony. Yes it was a bit pricey, two beds, and it wasn't as spacious as others that I've stayed in that was much cheaper. Very clean. That's major for me. =) Very huge t.v screen though, and we watched about 3 movies the whole two days we were there. Forgot the total price of movies I think it's $10\/movie...but it was all worth it if you plan on just going to vegas to really be lazy and relax. 

Price: over $150 night that's because it was on a weekend. Every hotel is cheaper if you go on the weekdays. For the price, nothing was special. No sofa, fridge, balcony, etc.  The bed sheets seems clean, but as always, I never use their blanket w\/o covering myself with the plain sheets first.  Overall..it's not over the top or anything major because we got the regular room not a suite or anything fancy.

I really liked this hotel. And for $50\/night it was a great deal. I will definitely stay here again. The check in was fast & easy at about noon, I noticed later in the day the front desk gets super crowded & people probably wait a long time. The parking tower is really conveniently located near a bridge that leads right into the hotel lobby... Not blocks of walking & searching. From the front valet entrance, they must have some kind of air freshner pumped into the vents because it always smells so nice & fresh. There is a convenient food court right on the main floor just beside the casino with a 24hr McDonalds (makes good for any time easy eats), there are a variety of other chains in rife food court none of which are 24hr (Starbucks, Sbarro). The casino is ok. Pool was open (November) but the lazy river & what looked like a wave pool were drained & under construction. 

The only negative I can think of is the elevator system. The hotel rooms are separated into three sections, each with its own elevator: floors 1-12, 13-20, 20-35 (something like that). Our room was on the 11th floor & our friends were on the 18th floor. The only way to get to their room was to take our elevator down to the first floor & take their elevator up to the 18th floor because our elevator only went to the 12th floor. besides that, it's a great hotel.

The room was clean & everything functioned well. Soaps & lotions were cheap-hotel grade, but I guess it's priced accordingly. The strip views from the room were nice. The walls are thin- neighbor next door had screaming baby at all hours of the night & day. If I would have forgotten my earplugs it would have been a problem but I had them so it was all good. Internet didn't work so well, kept dropping signal.

Good & bad! First the bad. I was charged a $20 early check-in fee even though the room was ready and I had upgraded my room. I was told that I could get the fee waived at checkout - WRONG! I will never stay there again for that reason alone. It's not the $20 but it's the principle!   Also our room had only 2 bath towels. I had to ask for more and they acted like they were doing me a favor when they gave them to me.  Also the towels at the pool were shabby, some had holes, some were stained they were all definitely old. Now the good:   Room rates were very reasonable. Location is good. Pool area was nice with a pool, a wave pool and a lazy river. It was what I had expected for the price paid. Definitely not luxury hotel but a decent place to stay.

Pretty sad when the Gold Coast has better star-ratings than the Monte Carlo...

This is a classic example of management not caring and running a great hotel right into the ground.  I can't tell you the number of things that were wrong with my brief visit, from the messed up construction-laden confusing check-in\/parking lot, to a not-so-clean room complete with hair all over the bathroom floor, ink-stained sheets from someone's Sharpie, and to top it off oppressively loud music from the pool that will pummel your brains in even staying on the 23rd floor with the windows SHUT. As I told the management, if I can still hear your stupid DJ  a mile below me while I've got earplugs in trying to catch a nap before a wedding, then the music is way too loud. That's coming from someone who likes loud music.
Given a chance to make things right, they did clean the room for me but no offer of any comps of any sort.
What should have been a great stay was awful and I couldn't wait to checkout.
There's  a reason this place has so many poor reviews.

This past weekend, I trekked my way to Las Vegas again to have a little fun with my friends.  I stayed at the Monte Carlo because my room was comped, and I'm glad to see that there were some improvements made since my last stay.

Check In

Check in was a breeze.  I arrived at the hotel at around 8AM because I flew in on a red-eye flight from the east coast.  When I arrived at the check in counter, the agent informed me the room hadn't been ready, however would contact me when the room was ready.  I felt that the service was personable.  The room was eventually ready by 11AM.

Bell Hop

Very friendly service.  Stored my bags in the back, and my laptop in their locker.  Felt very secure and safe that my personal belongings would be kept in a safe area.

The Room

OK, so this hotel can't be compared to some of the other newer properties for obvious reasons, but really, how much time do you spend in your room?  Do you actually take time to observe and nip pick on the decor?  You gotta be kidding me...you are in your hotel to pass out from partying, and wake up with a hangover....duhhhhh!  The room was fine--no frills, no fancy stuff....serves its purposes with beds and a shower.  It was fine for us.

The Casino

Man, this casino was hoppin' like no other.  My friends and I won a ton of money here---craps, blackjack, and slots.  For some crazy reason, it was paying out like crazy, and I don't regret it at all.  

Overall

I don't hate or love it.  It's a hotel right on the strip, and you can't beat its location.  Sure, if I had a little more money, I'd probably stay in a higher end property, but the bottom line is that it served our purposes--a place to sleep at the end of the night and I can't complain about that for sure.

My overall grade:  B \/ B+

Can I give zero stars? Had the worst time in Las Vegas thanks to the Monte Carlo. Why? 

1. It smelled like a sewer all over the lobby. I guess there was a pipe that busted in one of the bars or something and they didn't bother sanitizing the stagnant water. They were really on top of their perfume pumping though.

2. This is subjective but the bed was extremely uncomfortable. Staying up till dawn and waking up at 10am because your back hurts isn't very Las Vegassy.

3. I requested an upgrade to a jr. suite and was quoted a what I thought was reasonable price upon check in. At check out, the price had gone up and it turned out that the front desk check in guy had lied to me.

4. The ridiculous $10\/day charge for the tepid bottles of water they have available in your room, the newspaper I never received and the gym that I could care less about. 

5. The fact that they don't tell you about this charge until you check out (then point to the .01 sized font and say "its there in the small font that no one ever reads") 

6. Unwelcoming dealers who seem to hate their jobs.

7. No WI-FI! NOT EVEN AT STARBUCKS!

The only thing good about this hotel is that its connected to the new city center.
Central location on the strip with standard hotel rooms. Not too bad but nothing special about it either.

I stayed here with friends visiting from overseas. When looking to book a hotel in Vegas, we were all on a bit of a budget and wanted to find a fairly affordable place to stay on the Strip without sacrificing too much by way of quality and comfort. The Monte Carlo came up on the radar, sounded good, so we decided to book 3 nights here. All things considered, we were not disappointed.

I booked through a 3rd-party site, which may have been a mistake, really, because they didn't disclose certain fees and policies in place at the Monte Carlo. So, at the time of check-in, I wasn't aware of the $20\/night 'resort fee,' among other things. It left me feeling a bit 'irked' at the check-in counter, but it wasn't the fault of the hotel so much as the website I used to book, so I can't fault them for that. The check-in woman was very nice and helpful. The two rooms we initially received didn't meet with my expectations, but upon calling the front desk, they quickly transferred I and my friends to two adjacent rooms on a higher floor, which were much better.

Our stay here was fine - not super-memorable or anything, but pleasant and excellent for the price and location. The valet service was prompt, the staff friendly, the housekeeping service efficient and the casino floor & restaurants clean and not overly-crowded or smokey. It was a good place to stay, particularly if you're on a bit of a budget and want to be close to the action that the Strip has to offer. It's not the Bellagio, but it's no CircusCircus either. I enjoyed my stay here, and would consider staying here again.

Alright, I really loved the Monte Carlo until I stayed there this weekend.  We stayed in the "Diamond Suite", room 170001.  It's spacious but severely out dated.  The first shower we went to take the shower drain clogged right away, the jetted spa tub was rusty and had particles floating in it.  I called to have maintenance come up and unclog the shower.  I had to do this 4 times within a 2 day period.  The room location faces the back side where the freeways are, very noisy.  You can hear people showering next door, flushing the toilet and coughing.  The next night we decided to go eat at their buffet, um...YUCK!  Stand clear even if you get a free buffet with your room purchase.  The food was awful, cold and unappetizing. I wish someone would have warned us before we paid $54.00 for two people.  The casino is very smokey and I felt like I was suffocating walking through.  I won't be staying at this hotel again.

worst hotel i have stayed in in Vegas. Checked in room was to small no biggie we'll up grade. Called the front desk no up grade available go to front desk get upgrade. first move new elevator new wing. The suite only one bed so now a roll out bed. Bed comes move the furniture and their is candy and a frisbee on the ground . Now back to the front desk they said they would give us the same suite and comp the resort fees ok we second move third elevator third wing still no second bed now 30 dollar up charge for roll out bed. Three hours of Batchelor party in Vegas wasted Monty Carlo fail won't be back say somewhere else for the money

I have stayed at this hotel twice and was satisfied for the most part. One thing that really ticked me off the first time was the daily resort fee. I am pretty sure other hotels have this as well but it really stinks because I booked through www.Priceline.com and there was no mention of the fee. 
Anyway, I had no complaints about the room - view was decent (depends which side you get) and they do have a nice pool. Actually, two pools and also a wave pool, which was pretty fun. The hotel also has a food court which is nice to be able to grab breakfast & Starbucks in the morning. The Monte Carlo casino is also a good one - plenty of tables & slot machines. Also, the hotel is located in a convenient location on the Strip. Overall, I would recommend the hotel. Not sure if I would stay there again only because I want to see what the other hotels have to offer.

I have stayed here a few times over the years and I will say it never lets me down. The price is right for the clean modern rooms, proximity to the action, and the pools. Although I have yet to try, they look fun.
Love this casino\/hotel. Nice and simple. good amenities and location. Hooked to ARIA.

Shower was funky
casino wasn't lucky
came up to my room tv on the fritz
would have been better to stay at the ritz
the no wi-fi could make a man cry
i did like the bed 
BUT
i was naked when the maid poked in her head

Clean and decent. Very affordable place to stay. It is your typical average size room. My 3 stars represent a decent hotel on the strip in Vegas. I would give 5 stars to places like the Venetian, Bellagio and Encore.

Like the location of Monte Carlo, don't really care for the hotel rooms.  The foyer where you wait for check-in is quite nice looking.  It makes you feel like you're staying at a really nice place.  That's about the only nice part of the hotel that I can remember...

Rooms = Our room was at the end of the hall, right next to the fire alarm exit door.  Standard 2 queen room that had a leaky tub faucet.  I thought the room was bland (nothing special about it at all), the window had a hand print, and I swear to you I want to say I saw blood on the walls.  I already felt dirty.  I don't like outdated, non-decorated rooms... I felt like I was staying at one of those INNs or Motels.

I will say that if you're drunk, hungry, and like Mc Donalds... you're in luck.  There's a food court downstairs.  I don't remember what time they are open till, but I do remember being there at one point.  

The hallways are kind of creepy, but that may have just been me.  There was this one time I was leading everyone back to the room... I slid in my room card, but the light kept flashing red.  I knew that we were the very last room next to the fire exit door, but when I looked at the room number it was different - like the numbers had moved around.  I seriously felt like I was in an episode of the Twilight Zone and started freaking out, hahaha... (mind you... yes, I was not sober - just imagine how you would feel).  That's when my friends realized we had just walked down the wrong hallway - each hallway looked exactly the same.

Yes, the rates are cheaper than other hotels on the strip, but my experience here wasn't up to my standards.  I would possibly give Monte Carlo another try if I was on a super tight budget, other than that... the room they gave me was no bueno.

Best location on the strip! Best payouts on slots on the strip.  Friendly staff.  You can't beat the Monte Carlo for gaming or its central location.  Reasonable new restaurants on site.  Monorail access to Crystals and Bellagio.  My only complaint is that too many guests bring their kids with them.

Stayed at The Monte Carlo again as always this visit was good only had a few blips. I understood there was construction going on but unfortunately I had a room where I heard the outdoor construction starting at 6 am. And one more thing I was quoted me price for my room on Tuesday but had to pay a different amount when I checked in. Other than that I will be staying there again.

I stayed recently at the spa suite and it was great! I asked at registration if there was a suite with a strip view and she checked and I got an amazing view.  Bed is comfortable, nice pillows and the room was clean only the couch had some stains but no biggie.  The tub did have a little crack which I mean doesn't bother me but idk in the long run how that could cause mold. Lol anyways, 4 stars! Pretty much because of the couch and the window since it was a bit dirty. staff is very nice too!

Been here a few times and just recently stayed. Super fast check in and the valet guy was friendly and pleasant. I really have no complaints. It's not a new hotel but our stay was comfortable. The water pressure at the shower is strong as well. Enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi. For the price I paid, it was definitely worth it. I would stay here again.

My recent trip to Vegas was for a conference. I wasn't too jazzed when I was told where we were staying but having actually never stayed at the Monte Carlo I thought I'd just give it a chance. Well I was not impressed. The room space is small and dark, the furniture a little outdated with definite indications of  wear, the curtains didn't close completely as the curtain was missing pin hooks. The sheer curtain had a hole in it, the bed sheets were clean but had stains. Even though the room was on the 22nd floor, I could still smell smoke. Perhaps I was on a floor that had smoking and non smoking rooms because at times it smelled like it was fresh cigarette smoke. I think the walls are pretty thin too because I could hear the obnoxious neighbors at all hours. And while I recognize that a lot of people come to Vegas to party, it would be nice it they practiced some common courtesy and consideration for those who are trying to sleep.

My husband and I come to Vegas every couple of months for some relaxation and gambling. This is not a place I would return to stay. I might come back to the casino on another trip because the dealers were pleasant but as far as I'm concerned this is NOT a 4 star hotel so I would not stay here again.

I'm sure if someone is just looking for a place to lay down their bags and are out of the room most of time, this place may be okay.
