I'd certainly consider staying here again while in Las Vegas.

My husband and I went to Las Vegas for our anniversary.  The Monte Carlo was suggested to us by a friend.  We arrived at the Monte Carlo early but we decided to try to check in.  The first guy who helped us was nice and upgraded our room being that it was our anniversary and my husband's first time in Vegas.  He told us that our room wasn't quite ready yet but that the bell hop would hold our luggage and we would be receiving a text between 2 and 3 pm with our room number.  We walked over to the bell desk and the two attendants that were there completely ignored us.  The third one who helped us was rude and very short with us.  My husband even tried to make small talk but she wouldn't even glance up at us.  We went to lunch then walked around, we waited till 3:30 pm, 30mins after the front desk told us our room would be ready.  We decided to go back and the second guy we talked to was also extremely rude to us!   Then he proceeded to tell us that our room was still not ready.  I told him that the Monte Carlo's website said check in is at 3pm.  He corrected me and told me that, "technically, check in is between 3 and 5 pm."  It must be in the fine print.  Then he refused to honor the upgraded room the first front desk clerk gave us.  After seriously arguing with him he finally allowed the upgrade and then GUARANTEED us that our room would be ready by 5pm and that we would then receive a text.  So we left and wandered the casino.  At 5:20pm we still hadn't gotten the text that our room was ready, we were furious!!  We went back to the front desk and immediately asked to speak to the manager who then was going to down grade our room.  After arguing with the manager he finally got us into a room.  Mind you, we originally reserved a room with a king bed.  He put us in a double queen bed room.  We then had to call down the front desk again and switch rooms.  We were really upset that we were treated the way we were by so many of the hotel staff.  Even the casino waitresses were mean and rude.  To top it off, the ice machine on our floor wasn't working and the room wasn't that cleanly.  Awful, awful experience, we will not go back.  Happy anniversary....

I have stayed at Monte Carlo many times and used to really like it. I used to think it was a nice, comfortable place to stay at a decent price. Unfortunately, my current stay was not good and I probably would not stay there again. The hotel rooms and hallways are getting very run down. I didn't find the staff very friendly or helpful. Even though they charge a daily resort fee of $33.60, there is no coffeemaker in the room and you get very cheap toiletries. With two of us in the room, the toiletries were not automatically replenished on the second day.  There are so many choices of great places to stay in Las Vegas, I think our group will look elsewhere next year.
Not bad, the rooms have a decent view and the hotel is clean and nice.  The only drawback is the extra smoky casino and resort fees.

The Location is good because right on the strip. Lobby and Casino ok. Rooms very old. Nothing special at all. Where it got interesting was as someone stole 250$ cash right out of the safe. Security detected a broken door lock. Apparently everyone has access to the floors without keycard. We reported the thievery and they did nothing about it!! Switched rooms within same category but with a bad view. No appologies, upgrade what so ever. Runined our holidays. That hotel NEVER AGAIN!!!

Registration (check-in) line is consistently long and slow. Front desk clerk was ok but seemed like she'd rather be somewhere else. Rooms were just ok, but did not have a clock, microwave or refrigerator. Beds were comfortable so I'll give them that.

Came here for the weekend since it was pretty cheap, $100 a night. There are some crappy things, but some bonus things about this place. Let's start with the bad. The check in counter, there's no single line. You just stand behind a person that's being helped. and everyone follows. So you can be outta luck if the person in front of you is taking FOREVER. the room. nothing fancy, but the beds and pillows were comfy, definite plus. The room though, omg...you can hear EVERYTHING. i mean ive been to hotels where the walls are thin, but because of the connector door, we could hear everything from the next room. Sunday morning, I could hear the football game's play by play going on next door. Ridiculous. The bathroom has no fan, so you can hear everything as well, and the toilet flusher makes a crazy loud noise. Overall, the room was whatevers, but at least the key thing was the beds and pillows were comfortable, but I just couldnt enjoy it with all the noises outside. Another negative thing is the elevators are quite slow, and don't seem to come and go as often. 

Casino is decent. I didn't imagine them to have such a big one, and some decent lounges and restaurants inside. However, if you play slots, cocktail waitresses DO NOT come around. And every single one I encountered (one time I had to walk around and find one myself) are all MEAN. Their M Life players club line...there's only one person tending to guests. I tried waiting in line 3 different times, and even with only one person in line, it took DAYS. i probably could've gotten a lot of points on my first day but with no card, no luck. 

The pool looks so janky, and they have a lazy river that my friend enjoyed the first 5 minutes. 

The best part is the food court, which is critical in any hotel. McDonalds, Sbarro, and Subway are open 24 hours, WAHOO! and the McDonald's has the $1 menu and mini meals, which is a definite plus. Pizza and fast food are the main staples of food after a hard night of drinking. 

Other than that, it was an okay stay, nothing fancy, but got the job done.

not a bad hotel.  lobby is pretty, beds are comfy.  nice restaurant Diablos... but small casino, a bit dark, not happenin'.  and all the employees were sullen, not friendly at all.  We will definitely be staying at a different hotel next time.

Finally, I'm moving up in the world! (From the Tropicana and then the Circus Circus... haha)

Really no complaints about the Monte Carlo, it was nice!  Most of all, prime location if you don't need something super high-end.  Close to all the action and just steps away from the beautiful City Center!

My husband and I travel to Las Vegas 3 to 4 times a year from the Seattle area.  We always stay at the Encore and or Wynn.  This time we were meeting friends from TX who were on a tighter budget and they chose to stay at the Monte Carlo, we did not want to stay here but did anyway. 
We got a suite and hoped for the best. 
The front desk service is great, the lobby is lovely. 
BUT the rooms are really run down!  The beds are SO lumpy!  The furniture has cracks in it, paint is peeling, glass is chipped.  
The couch in the suite looked like it was left over from an old 70's party and dropped off at the curb and the monte carlo thought it was a good idea to put it in their rooms.  Gross! 
The casino was TERRIBLE!!!  The smoke was SOOO bad and the dealers were some of the RUDEST I have ever ever ever dealt with.  They didnt laugh, they didnt talk and they would hush people and ask people to leave if they were too loud etc.  One lady told a guy to leave her table now!  And he was just trying to make conversation with him.
Dont even get me started on the Cocktail Waitresses.  They were all Grandma Moses and slower than molasses.  It took us 45 minutes to get ONE drink.  So we started ordering two at a time. 
We finally had enough after just the FIRST nite in the hotel and we decided to take a cab down to The Encore to gamble.  No smoke, great casino, wonderful dealers, NO kids... heaven!! 
We wont ever stay here again.  They need to update this place.  Its just disgusting! 
The ONE good thing is that The Cafe had good breakfasts at a reasonable price.  Kind of like a Dennys but nicer and right in the casino.  
And as I said the front desk was great and the room service crew was nice but otherwise AVOID this hotel! 
You would be much better staying at the Vdara and or Aria which are newer and cheaper and have better tables, food, dealers and rooms!

How are you going to charge for parking when you are already fleecing us of every dime we have? Bad decision by the people in charge. Absolute asinine idea. I guess I'll spend my money at Caesar's Properties from now on. Absolute joke! Not to mention the line backs up in the parking garage and takes forever to get out because guests don't know how to pay before they get to the exit. Worst decision ever MGM. Thanks for making it an easy decision to never return.
The monte carlo is basically rooms, location, great restaurants, and a little gambling. What's wrong with that?
Alright for the money. Small rooms, dirty-ish bathroom. Great service though.

I stayed here during EDC weekend and I would say Monte Carlo is a nice place to stay. The rooms are not anything special and do not have fridges or microwaves. I like the hotel mostly for it's location on the strip and the food court downstairs.

The hotel is located next to New York New York and is a short walk to the Bellagio\/center strip. You can also explore the cosmopolitan right next door. Although there was construction going on, it did not seem to hinder my schedule during EDC weekend.

I'm glad the hotel has it's own food court with subway, Mcdonalds, asian panda express type resturant etc. It made it really convenient for me and my friends who just needs a quick bite to eat before heading out. The prices are typical and is not overpriced just b\/c it's in a hotel.

I'd stay here again.

I stayed here for a weekend during my spring break. It was a trip planned for a friend's birthday. We got our rooms right away. It just sucked cuz our rooms were the very last rooms in the hallway which made it a long walk to the elevators. The rooms were clean but average looking. Also we said non smoking rooms but somehow our room also smelled like cigaretttes when we first walk into them. 
Monte Carlo has an OK food court and it was open 24hrs. Great casino, swimming pool. The hotel was nice but next time I would like to go to a luxury hotel.

Stayed here last weekend 6\/9-6\/12 and it was so so. The reason that I had to make it 3 stars was that the front desk put me in a smoking floor instead of non-smoking. Also the offer that I had when I booked the room was bogus. I would rather stay at something better next time.

I've had better experiences at this hotel. I think I will try other hotels now, after this last visit.

We've stayed here before and always got a great room with optimal service. This time around we get a danky hotel room that have walls that are way too thin. 

* No room service menu or information binder. 
* Tube TV. 
* No coffee in-room. 
* No sewing kit or shower cap. 
* No outlets near a table or bedside to charge your phone.
* No in-room check-out.
* Weak shower (i think they're ALL weak), with a dilapidated tub.

I think for a Vegas hotel, in a prime location, they should "up the ante" ...pardon the pun.

3 Stars.

We walked into Monte Carlo feeling great but it took us at least 30 mins just to check in... pretty ridiculous!

I give it 3 stars not for the room but for other things such as the location, ease of getting to other hotels, and the other hotel amenties.

The hotel room itself needed serious help. I have been on plenty of cruises and the toilet flush reminded me of a cruise boat... loud and noisy!

The bed was HARD and we were annoyed because we booked a king bed back in June and we came late August and had two beds! We had to wait until 3pm the next day to swap out. UGH! How annoying to drag all your stuff and move rooms.

The internet was free but no wireless which was annoying. I never use desks in hotels, especially in Vegas so they really need to look into having a password system or something!

The actual room amenties were yucky, the soap was hard, the water was hard coming out of the yucky shower head. The towels stunk and it was just all around not that great. Luckily for us we left the room more often than not.

The buffet was just okay. The food was just okay for brunch... they do have unlimited mimosas for $2 extra but it wasnt quite worth it to me. The crab was the best thing there.

Beware the $15 resort fee they charge you at checkout. Get what you can from it, use the pool! It was SO much fun with the DJ and I think they were having contests and things which was entertaining! 

The Brand Steakhouse night club was nice. You get hounded by so many people asking if you want to go, that we decided to check it out. Friday night was girls night I guess where everyone pays $20 cover but girls drink free. I love that you can exit and enter and come back after you gamble a bit. The music was great, a mix of hip hop and pop and house\/techno. We danced quite a bit and felt that the $20 was worth it!

The location was perfect! You can walk to New York New York and catch the tram all the way to Mandalay Bay or you can catch one to Aria and Crystals and Bellagio. You can walk basically to Ceasars without a cab or catch a cab and hit the other part of the strip.

The other reason we had reservations here was because the really good show Jabbawockeez was playing here so we only had to get dressed and go downstairs, PLUS!

We were so close to Planet Hollywood and the ABC store, UA theatre, Hard Rock and the little flea market to get little trinkets.

Overall the location is what you pay for so if you dont intend on sleeping, stay there!

cheap hotel rates for sure. but the rooms are just okay. This hotel is considered old and I think they should fix up the hotel rooms a bit. I do like the location of this hotel, even though it's located toward the south side of the strip, they have a monorail that will take you to Aria, City Center and Bellagio. In fact you can just walk to Aria without going outside. No need to worry about scorching hot weather or rainy seasons. 

If you want a decent room and good rate, I recommend this hotel. But do not think this is mirage status, it's one step lower. Don't even compare to bellagio or higher. 

If you don't care about fancy schmancy rooms, and your idea of a room is just a place to sleep, then Monte Carlo is a good stay. The pools are pretty nice: man made beach and lazy river. You will be close to the more popular clubs: hakkasan, marquee, etc.

The only reason I'm reviewing this place is because everyone is giving it such crappy reviews. 

My experience was stellar. We got a cheap room after the recent fire (hehe) and had no problems during the whole trip. Everyone was super friendly...and they didn't give us any shiz about cramming 5 people into a room with 2 queens.

The staff was even friendly when I stumbled in at 5am three nights in a row without a room key.

The food court with McDonald's, Sbarro, Subway, Rubio's, etc was perfect for us drunkies. 

Even the casino staff was really nice and taught us lots of random shiz as we were trying to get drunk for free at the nickel slots.

My only complaint is that they charge $12 to rent a tube for the lazy river! I just bought one at the store next to the pool for $10 and then used it all weekend.... weird.

I'd stay here again - for sure.

went here recently on an annual trip to vegas for the super bowl.  usually stay at mandalay, palms or one of the other high end places, but this year tried the monte carlo.  i mean, who really spends time in their rooms in vegas anyways!?  the monte carlo is in the middle of everything, it has the newness quality to it, great tables and staff and a fairly young crowd (its no hard rock though). definitely recommend it for people that are needing a home base but not seeking a vegas destination.

I rarely write reviews and try to find positive things about places but couldn't here. Don't stay here. Paper thin walls and window. In 31 floor and can hear freeway, something sounding like a leaf blower, cat alarm, airplanes, and hear both neighbors.  Been to several hotels here and have never had this problem. Bed feels like it's made of wood, shower sprays everywhere, and faucet looks like it's starting to rust. Yeah glad I'm an MLife member and didn't have to pay the full price of over $300 a night. Still not worth what I had to pay. Would not recommend. Waste of money. 

Don't want to give it any stars but had to

First time staying at the Monte Carlo (1\/25-1\/28\/17) I was a little late on filling out mobile check in and didn't do it till we had gotten to the hotel so we had to wait an hour for our room to be ready (oops my bad! Fill it out when in route) We ended up in what appeared to be an updated deluxe king room on the 29th floor facing where the pool used to be (now a construction site). Room was clean, very spacious, and furniture was in good condition. Fianc was a little concerned about the construction noise at first when we first got our room and I told her we would see how loud they were in the morning and if it was bad we'd ask for a room transfer, come Thursday morning you couldn't even hear the construction! Overall great experience! We will be back!

The worst experience in Las Vegas, after going there for many years two or three times a year, we decided to stay at Monte Carlo because we stayed there 10 years a go when my husband be I got married. Starting with the check in, we waited over half hr to check in at 1:00am, only two people at the front desk,after a two hour flight delay that's the last thing that you need. I arrived with a terrible cold so we stayed in the room and order breakfast in our room, at night, my husband brought dinner and we also had dinner in the room. The next day I wasn't feeling great but we have to attend a event, it was very upsetting to get to our room around 1:00am (we left at 10:00am) and found the table with all the dirty dishes from breakfast and dinner from the day before, disgusting! Also the ironing board was in the middle of the room, the same way that I left it before we left. The housekeeper never replaced our glasses, we had the same dirty glasses the four nights of our stay. We are very disappointed and we will never go back to that hotel, forget about sentimentalism, it's not worth it!! Oh, I almost forgot to mention that we paid extra for a deluxe room, Deluxe???!!  Check the pictures!
Also, The Buffet, the worse food ever on Las Vegas, it was just disgusting!!
The pool, they have a nice lazy river, too bad that it was filled with drunk people and that they have to call security for that reason, also very dirty, there was garbage under all the lounge chairs. A very unpleasant stay.

The rooms are basic, but my room was clean and quiet.  The staff was friendly.  There were problems with check-in though.  Our friends were told that they would receive a text when their room was ready.  No text ever came.  When they finally got a room it was dirty.  The hotel's solution was to downgrade their room.  They eventually straightened it all out, but it was an unnecessary annoyance.
My companion and I decided to go to the Pool at Mandalay Bay since the Monte Carlo's pool is being renovated.  No one at Mandalay Bay could direct us to the free shuttle which was supposed to bring us back to the Monet Carlo.  Concierge at Mandalay Bay said that the staff at The Monte Carlo did a poor job of providing them with such information.  It took us over a hour to catch the shuttle back to the Monte Carlo.  SO BE WARNED:  THERE IS NO POOL AT THE MONTE CARLO UNTIL 2018.  It was a very long walk to get to the pool at the MGM Grand too.

This was the third and probably the last time we will stay at the Monte Carlo.  I was very disappointed this time that we were given  a room that was meant for a handicapped person.  I almost fell while getting out of the bathtub because it was higher than normal ones. When we got to our room we did not have any face towels or bath mats. Another day we did not have enough hand towels.  We had to write a note requesting that housekeeping provide us with three sets of towels and they still couldn't get it right.  

There was so much construction going on inside and outside.  Construction outside was really bad because they started work at about 5:30 A.M. Don't they know most people are still asleep? They tore down the parking garage so we had to park in the lot across the street.  But instead of parking in the lot across the street we parked at the MGM Grand Hotel where there was indoor parking.

This is the worst hotel in Las Vegas. Do not stay here. Ever!  Our reservations were made by a travel agent six months ago. From the time our reservations was made until our stay they changed the policies on amenities. Nobody bothered to tell us that we were about to get screwed on what we were paying for. There are no coffee makers in the room, although this seems to be a trend in Las Vegas And even though we had three rooms for three nights they wanted to charge us $28 for room service for a pot of coffee. The walls are thin and you hear everything. Construction and jackhammers at 3 o'clock in the morning. The scent that they pipe in the vents to cover the odor of filth is disgusting. Sheila in room service was rude and unprofessional. The carpet was obviously not vacuumed prior to our arrival which makes me wonder what else was not cleaned properly. Other than the bellman who was incredibly sweet and helpful this place is horrible.

I'm never going back there. The service was bad. Staff members were snobby. They didn't make me feel welcomed at all. On my first day there, i arrived too early (6 am), so I had to wait until 8 am to check in. Then I had to wait until 2:20 pm before I could go to my room. The staff member told me I could call before 3 pm to check if the room was ready.  When I called, a female staff member answered the phone, and spoke to me with an attitude. Her tone of voice was not pleasant. At the buffet restaurant, I asked for a new set of silverware, and the waitress asked me, "Why?! That's not enough?" Duh! I wanted a CLEAN set of silverware! I wasn't about to use the same fork that I used for Fettuccini Alfredo the entire time there. To top everything off, the stamp vending machine took my money without giving me a stamp. The Monte Carlo people weren't gonna do anything for me. They told me to call the post office. I wasn't gonna waste my time for that. I had the same type of experience with the stamp vending machine at Luxor, but they gave me my money back when I went to the cashier. The Luxor staff members were a lot more friendly and helpful.

Warning..Do Not leave any thing inside of your parked car. Their parking garage has no security, and there are gangs that hang out in these various garages and as soon as you leave they smash your window and take everything. You will get absolutely NO HELP from the hotel. You are on your own. The police will not even show up. You must go to the police station. My daughter lost all of her professional make up supplies and many other items. This has been an ongoing problem, and yet nothing changes. The Hotels will not accept any type of responsibility..but they make millions from your gambling losses.

The new "remodeled "suites suck.. it's downgraded version of what used to be a Monaco suite.. there's no coffee maker, no fridge, there's 2 tvs within feet of each other. A dining table with one chair.. I was really disappointed with my latest experience and I've stayed at the Monte Carlo for years.. it's time to pick a new spot

Stayed here the Saturday after New Year's. I wasn't dramatically impressed, but I didnt have a bad time either. 

Pros:
- Price for the night was $65, (though plus tax and that stupid resort fee it was $84), still not bad
- Right on the strip near NY NY, MGM Grand, etc, walking distance to everything 
- Nice italian wine bar and restaurant inside (D Vino)
- Very comfy beds
-They let us check in at 1pm (even though check in isnt supposed to be until 3pm)
-Free parking, nice parking garage
-Very easy to get to from the highway

Cons:
- Be wary of "strip view" rooms...since the casino is in front of the hotel, you can't see much if the strip except the taller big buildings. I didnt pay extra for that though, so it was nice. 
-No matter how you reserve the room, apparently they dont reserve specific room requests, like 2 queen or 1 king. so stupid!
- No free wifi. In fact it was like $16 for the day!
- The line to check in and check out is RIDICULOUS! you wait 10-20 minutes AT LEAST. 
-No fan in bathroom
-Pillows flat and not comfy
-Pool wasnt open obviously cuz we went in January, but no hot tubs either! ugh!
-Escalators werent working half the time (this was actually true all over Vegas)
-Old TV, remote wasnt working
-No wall light switches for lights in room except for one light in entry way
-We did not get our two "free" bottles of water 



Ultimately, for the price, it was great. I would NEVER spend more than $100 for a room here though!

I will never stay her again, so many hidden fees. For the price I paid the room didn't have a refrigerator, nor coffee maker. The ac didn't work and the light in the bathroom went out. Worse hotel stay ever

One of the smaller hotels on the strip. I wanted to stay here because its cozy. The Starbucks and the food court downstairs are convenient when you're  staying away from buffet meals. Our room was on the 17floor. It was a spacious room, however the furniture are old and need updating. The shower leaked all night, the kureg coffee maker didn't work wifi needed to be fixed and Let me warn you, the walls are very thin. I could hear the conversation next door. Everytime neighbor door opens and closes it shakes my door. We visit vegas often and stayed in many hotels but might not stay here again.

The Monte Carlo rocks! Also, Jake from Guest Services rocks!!! I had some problems in the beginning and was a little disappointed because I have enjoyed the Monte Carlo. That all changed when Jake swooped in to save the day! I now love the Monte Carlo more than before!!! A big thanks to Jake and to the Monte Carlo! You made my stay wonderful!!!

The place was nice and the area it's in is convenient. The rooms are smaller than previous places I've stayed. The shower nozzle was crappy. Felt like the pressure was way to high, felt crappy like a navy ship shower. Our bathroom door had a crack on door handle as if someone kicked it open. 
The place is okay but not sure I would stay again

The resort was fine, but nothing spectacular. We stayed at the Monte Carlo because it was one of the cheaper hotels after the price kept going up for other hotels and the Monte Carlo still got relatively decent reviews and was in a decent location on the Strip and wasn't too far away from things we wanted to see.

We tried to check in a bit early because our flight was an early morning flight, meaning we arrived in Vegas in the early afternoon. However, instead of checking to see whether there was a room available, the Monte Carlo said there was a fee for early check-in. Therefore, we opted to stow our suitcases rather than pay the silly surcharge and we walked down to the Bobby's Burger Palace to get some lunch while we waited for our room to be ready. 

The shower head was very harsh, so much so I had to put it on half tub and half shower and it made a horrible moaning sound just so the water wouldn't hurt so much. 

Our room overlooked the park outside the T-Mobile Arena. When we arrived in our room, there was a notice explaining that there was a concert being held in the plaza. I missed the noise associated with the plaza concert because I attended a concert at the Caesar's Palace Colosseum that evening and the plaza concert outside the window was finished by the time I got back to the room, by my friend came back to the room earlier and said the concert in the plaza was quite loud. 

The morning before we had to checkout, we visited the pool. The pool area was nice, although the pool chairs were very tightly packed together. I really enjoyed the lazy river area. You had to pay to rent tubes, but we just floated in the lazy river without using the tubes and there was decent water pressure to get you around the lazy river area.

Like most Las Vegas hotels, there was a resort fee of $33.60 for one night.

Overall - decent for the price, but nothing special.
I go to this hotel for tans, quite a bit.  I think it is nice.  Nice valet and easy access to the rooms, not a 3 mile walk to the guest elevators.

First we had to wait for some 30-40 minutes to check in, while only 10% of counters were open - terrible service
When we finally got to the reception we discovered that on top of the price we already paid through Priceline.com there is also a "resort fee" of 35 dollars, which is nothing but a hidden fee and a way to mislead customers. Please pay attention - the price advertised is not real!! Add at least 35 dollars to it!
In order to get in and out of the hotel you have to get through a crowded casino full of smoke. Parking is not easy as well, it took us some 20 minutes to find a place.

This is probably the best value in Vegas. We've stayed here several times and are spending a couple nights this weekend. For the base room, we avg. $50\/night. That's not bad for a themed hotel that is clean with lots of great shops. 

The only annoying thing: Jabbawokee music playing every time you enter the elevators. I'll take the stairs. They aren't booking the best shows\/entertainers, but it's better than some of the other hotels.

When we left in February they were in process of putting in new Samsung flat screen TV's. This is a nice upgrade, seeing as how the old CRT's had their day. 

Overall a great place to book if you're on a budget but still looking for a place that's clean.

Pro tip: join MLife so you can get really good deals. d.Vino is a must--great food, great prices.
Reserved non smoking room,Got smokiing room, can't change it and need to wait for the next morning! Unsatisfied!

Nice hotel. Had a fridge in our room which is always good to keep out drinks cold! The pools were cool. The wave pool had the dj. Thought it was weird that they had wet t shirt and booty shaking contests with lil kids there. It should just be an adult pool.

This place is great. The hotel\/resort is beautiful and the rooms are roomy, clean and elegant. With regard to the bathtub, it drains nicely.  Very nice rooms. My pillow was too plump for me, but my husband had a nice feather pillow which i might have taken had I known! Just a very nice place so dont let the reviews fool you.  It was perfect!

Impressive from approach, the lobby and casino were up to par with the other places I have stayed in Las Vegas.  The front desk was courteous and friendly. Then, I walked to my room and reality hits.  The coffee machine did not work.  The towel was thread bare.  The caulking around the bathtub was deteriorating. Hints of bacon and eggs serving downstairs permeated in the room in the morning.  Oh, well guess this is what I should expect from a package deal.

Best deal on the strip.  The casino has good music, great drinks. awesome service, and the rooms are cheap yet very nice.  It's not as busy as some of the more popular casinos so there is very fast drink service and plenty of open machines with a lot of wins!  It's in a great location too, I don't think I would want to stay anywhere else unless I wanted to pay twice as much for  some sort of special occasion.

We arrived at 11 am to check in. We booked two connected rooms. One room with two queen beds was ready but the other room with the king bed wasn't ready for another 2 hours. We left and went to walk the strip. I received a text saying my room was ready. When I got back to the hotel they said our room wasn't ready unless we wanted a different room and not the connected room. It was 340 pm at this point. They told us it would be another hour or more for the room to be ready. We called downstairs at 430 and asked about the room. Still not ready. We asked for a discount on the room since it wasn't ready when regular check in time is 3 pm. They wouldn't give us a discount but offered $50 in food and drink credit. We already had a $35 credit in food and drink from booking the room through hotels.com. We wanted to make sure the $50 was on top of the $35 credit. They told us it was not. But we were able to correct that. So we had $85 in credit. Then we received a call and they said our room was ready and they programmed the key cards we had for the connected room. They said to try our cards to see if it would work. It did not work. So they ran up a new pair of cards. Then they told us that the room was clean this whole time and that the housekeeper had forgotten to update that the room was clean. Also, we told them not to clean our hotel room and to give us a do not disturb sign. When we came back to the room it had been cleaned. This hotel is horrible. They do not communicate with each other. I would not recommend this hotel. I will never come back here ever again. 

The shower was nice. There was strong water pressure and lots of hot water. Also, no fridge unless you want to pay $25 a night. And there is no microwave. Cheaper hotels offer fridges at no charge.

I would have stayed at the f'n luxor over this place. Rooms?  Clean and regular.  The price i am fine with. It's Vegas I want ohh and wow., not 2 queens no view.  FYI cheaper  other hotels offer better amenities.  FYI desert inn offers free coffee and bagel.

the pool won me over. i love lazy rivers.. and i dont have to get all dressed up and put my make up on because its more real and less superficial here... or maybe just no good looking people to impress? 

for the good deals, its worth staying here. we stayed in a standard the first 2 nights and had a spa suite the 3rd night. if you have a bunch of people and u can get the spa suite for a good deal, take it! theres a bar, a jacuzzi in the room, and a nice view! 

the people at the desk were always really nice and easy to talk to.. there were a few times when they forgot to bring us a bellman, or tried charging us 2 bucks for ranch when we got room service.. but its all good. 

i really didnt think it was a far walk from places on the strip.. and plus, it's nice to be at a particular location and explore things nearby more. we barely ever went to places near Wynn\/Circus Circus because it was far but we went to Tropicana, Hooters, the m&m store and what not. it was fun! i know i have lots of Vegas trips ahead of me so no big deal, ill explore all of it sooner or later. and plus i like walking!

Good price for a beautiful hotel in the middle of the strip.  Love this place!!  The lobby was clean and the lines for the front desk went fast!

We politely asked for something close to the elevator no matter the view and they gave us a room by the elevator with a great view!!!  Bonus on 
Customer service!

This is the worst hotel in Las Vegas. There's nothing in the room. Their service is awful. None of those staff we talked to are helpful. 
The room is for 4 people, but they put service for 1 person.
The room doesn't have the primary service.
The key of the room is not working. The Starbucks in the lobby is bad, too. It's funny that after waiting a long time in line, it's server tells you, we are run of this or that. Here is a hotel and you must be ready for the guests.I don't recommend this hotel at all.

3 stars but I will still never stay here again!  The rooms need updating, the hotel itself was nothing special, and the restaurants were very average.  Also, the pool was extremely loud and crowded. The pool chairs were so close together I would have been more comfortable in a coach seat on US Airways. I finally left their pool and walked to MGM to use their's. I couldn't wait to check out!

I've stayed at the Monte Carlo before and the value is okay, even with the $35 resort fee.  They are doing some remodeling and closing the poker room.  This is the main reason I stayed here, so probably will look for somewhere else next time.  (Mike, Kim, Steve are the three best dealers!) The only really bad thing this trip was, a room service carte was outside a room at 6pm and still there the next morning at 9am.  If the price is right, it's clean.

I was so excited to book at Monte Carlo because my uncles had stayed there last year during the Mexican Independence day. So, I arrived Sunday afternoon and all the sheets were ripped and the restroom was so dirty. The tub had tons of hairs and had mold. This was suppose to be a 4 star hotel however it was more like a 2 star hotel. The only sort of luxurious part of the hotel is the lobby. It is definetly not worth the money you are paying.

I stayed here for 5 nights last week and had a good experience.  The Monte Carlo is in a great location on the Strip and the restaurants\/amenities are convenient and what you would want from a hotel.  I really enjoyed the free yoga on the Plaza on Saturday morning...I only wish they would offer it more often during my stay.  The rooms desperately need updating - the bedding, curtains etc. are all very dated.  If they made some minor renovations to this property, it could be back on top again.

Stayed here July 3-6 in a deluxe room. My girlfriend and I were able to obtain 3 comped nights via myVegas on a holiday weekend - can't beat that!

Location: Great location close to the middle of the strip. The hotel has a free tram that connects to Aria and Bellagio, a major plus in the summer heat. Another plus is the huge parking structure and a dedicated street via Rue de Monte Carlo, accessible from LV Blvd. and Frank Sinatra, making it easy to get in\/out of the hotel.

Check In\/Out: Check in late Thursday night was a breeze, but I saw huge lines on subsequent days while passing through the lobby. The hotel was never too crowded and its layout is simple and easy to navigate, which was a big plus for me on a busy trip. The front desk was helpful with our requests, which included a room change and reservation change (from my girlfriend to me).

Rooms: Originally got a 5th floor room (which overlooked a generator) but were able to move up to a 19th floor strip view room our second day (19321). Rooms are middle of the road - I've stayed at better, I've stayed at worse. A little rough around the edges and a bit outdated, but the room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Amenities: Of what was covered by the $22 resort fee, we took advantage of the 2 bottles of water and internet, which was wired (outdated, but needed due to the shoddy wifi in the hotel). The pool area and LAZY RIVER is a must-visit if you're staying at the hotel in the summer months.

Dining: I found the dining here to be overpriced, even for the Strip. Skip the food court, if possible - I paid almost $9 for a 6" Subway and bag of chips. Yusho and Double Barrel restaurants caught my eye but the prices drove me elsewhere. I heard the buffet was no good, so we skipped that. There are a few highlights, however: Tried Blvd. Creamery, where they have interesting alcoholic ice cream\/sorbet. I ate at Diablo's a few years back and if they still have it, the $40 burrito was a great deal. 

Entertainment: Blue Man Group is the headliner here. If you can't catch them, they have a free processional through the lobby at 6:15 PM. Due to its location, it is easy to check out club and show offerings of other hotels. Only gambled my first night here and broke even. If you're new to gambling, take advantage of a free daily 11 AM craps lesson!

Overall: About as middle-of-the-road as you can get in Vegas. The Monte Carlo's location, ease of access, and pool make for its shortcomings. Price-wise, it's usually comparable to TI, Bally's, Tropicana and NYNY. Although not my favorite hotel from that group, I would stay here again without hesitation.

Ok...so I understand about the construction as they are upgrading the surroundings, but come on.  No WiFi in the rooms above 2,3???  So I am there for work and have to wake up at 6:30am....but they have construction starting at what seemed like 4...augh!!!

I go down and ask for a room change and the person at the desk is quick to change me...very nice.  looks at the room I will be staying in and says that this one should work as it is away from the construction and over looks the pool.  I think cool...quiet.  Nope, I am over seeing the lower level of the casino which has all the fans working...augh!!  Oh well at least this room has a good shower head...the other one sucked.

What made this stay (8 days) decent was the valet and how they handle themselves...very nice and professional.

doubt that I will be back.

Honestly, who sleeps when they're in Vegas. This is a good hotel for those who want to party all night and then have some place to crash afterwards. For $39 a night on certain weeknights who can complain. I have even stayed here on a weekend for less than $250 (Sat\/Sun). Even on the weekends they offer one of the lowest rates around town. I like the central location on the strip and I like the convenience of the CVS store just a few steps away. They offer the basic necessities: a bed, a bathroom, a TV, and a food court. The other plus is that they let you check in early.

HORRIBLE DO NOT STAY HERE!  I booked this because we came down specifically for a concert at the tmobile arena and I wish i had chosen elsewhere.   Found out a few days before that the pool and spa were closed but that we could use the pools at mgm grand.  What they dont tell you is that those pools are on the other side of the grand, not "right across the street" like they say.  We walked over a mile to get there and found to go to the adult pool was an extra 25 dollars!  The first morning we were woken by loud contstruction at about 7 am.  They did move us, and gave a 75 credit for dining which covered one meal at the buffet.  There is no service to the machines like other casinos, i was offered one drink that never arrived.  The room was very basic, nothing special and room service endes at 2pm.  If you are here for an event at the T-Mobile save yourself get a room at the stratosphere  and uber.  The strat is way cheaper with better amenities and service.  Also, the little store in the monte is horrible.  40 bucks for a pint of vodka and a Gatorade.  17 bucks for sanitary supplies.  I will never stay here or at any of their hotels again.

Horrible, just horrible.  Room not very clean, bathroom had mold, no hot water for shower at 5 am, $30 noodle bowls at the asian restaurant.  All the restaurants were waaaaay overpriced.  Will not be returning EVER

Don't stay here. It's not worth it even tho we got a deal thru expedia. Pay a little more and stay someplace newer. I hate dirty hotel rooms and this one is up there on my list of disgusting. My expectations are pretty standard, clean sheets, pillow cases and clean bathroom. The first room had stains on the sheet which could only be bodily fluids. These were NOT old stains, they were new. Housekeeping had not changed sheets in both beds. They just made the bed. Gross. They moved us into another floor\/ room and saw the housekeeping crew working to clean the room. Refunded resort fee for the first nite. Can't make things better by refunding and moving us. At this point the hotel is forever etched in my mind as disgusting.

So if you want a room that looks like it belongs in the early 90's with rips in the lampshades this hotel is for you.
 We decided to book a few nights here since Hyatt diamond membership now transfers to mlife statues that's equal. Unlike Hyatt who really makes a point in letting you know that they appreciate choosing them, here does not. We didn't get any upgrade or extra anything plus worst rooms ever.
    In the room you can hear any little noise from the hallway which makes it hard to sleep. Plus our room was nonsmoking but smelled musty and smoked in pretty often. 
The view is the outside rooftop and when I opened the window curtain workers were outside waving at me. Not far away 1 foot away workers just sitting up there and chatting.  The other oddity was the lampshades were ripped in places. 
Next time we are on the strip we will defiantly choose outside mlife brand hotels.

I do like that Monte Carlo is near the middle of the strip, but that's pretty much all I liked about it.

The rooms are not impressive and for some reason seem a bit musty\/dirty. Definitely a bit outdated. Asked for a King bed but they only had 2 queens available.  Both beds were lumpy and uncomfortable to sleep in.  

The bathroom was dingy and super outdated. The shower curtains were heavy and dark so when I was showering, it provided very little light for me.  The toilet- oh man- was SO loud. I was nervous to flush because it made a very loud flushing sound. Every time we flushed, it woke the other person up!  

* I noticed an advil pill under the sink when I arrived.  Even after housekeeping stopped by, the same pill was there which led me to believe that they're not that thorough.  Ew.

The ceilings in the hallway were also really low.  I'm 5'7 and when I stretched my arm up, I could touch the ceiling.  So weird.

I emailed concierge regarding all the yelp reviews I've read and was upgraded to one of the newer rooms--thank you Gina.  I felt like a king compared to renting at the Freemont. The room that was assigned to me was not ready so I was given another room higher up with the t mobile arena as my view --thank you Amy.
There was some construction noise in the casino area, you will need to inform checkin and get a separate key if using the small but almost adequate, not a whole lot of placed to dine but breakfast at Primrose was great!
Workers and staff are extremely friendly!  Although I don't travel to Las Vegas often I f I'm staying on the strip I'd definitely consider the Monte Carlo. Can't wait to see when it is officially Park MGM.
Some shade at the pick up area across valet would be appreciated.

This was my first time staying at Monte Carlo. I loved the location and how everything was close by. The staff was great and friendly. The room itself needed an upgrade but still clean. 

We enjoyed the casino floor, it wasn't too crowded and very spacious. We'll definitely be coming back when all the renovations are complete.

totally disappointed! this is one of the worst hotels I been, is dirty, it smells horrible, not only the rooms but the hallways too. the noise level is high,  day and night you hear people working in some kind of recycling  business, the water pool smells horrible,  I expected better rooms for the price I pay. this was definitely one of my wors experiences in vegas...people stay away from this place!!!

I've stayed at the Monte Carlo in the past. I came here the weekend of 11\/11\/2017 to 11\/13\/2017 for a Rock and roll half marathon, I was very disappointed from the start, i got into the guest services check in line and was happy that i checked in before arriving because the other line was extremely long. i had only two people in front of me. well that other line of approx. 40 people went through twice while i stood there waiting patiently, and they had kiosk that didn't work, what a cluster, besides that  I knew they where doing construction before i got there and accepted that i would have to eat at other places, but what blew my stay was the new rooms. I stayed in a new Park MGM room 21215, as soon as i walked in i had problems with the poor design, there is no dresser or anywhere to layout your clothes, imagine this is a 4 person room with 2 queen beds, also the light switch next to one of the beds is covered halfway and you cant, turn the light on, contractor must have had a bad day while installing, poor craftsmanship, ok now here's is the best part, the bathroom is a sliding door that is used for both the closet and the bathroom, but the things is that is has a embedded door handle which is going to cause a lot of finger injuries. if your not careful closing the bathroom door you will smash possibly break fingers. the door slides way to much and the handle goes beyond the door jam. this is a serious pinch point, with a simple fix, of adjusting the door stop on the track above with a Phillips screwdriver. as of now because the dresser and clothing storage issue, i will not stay here again, big designer fail,

This review won't be too helpful to anyone, but I still wanted to write about the place.  I've only stayed here once.  The room was average for a hotel on the Strip.  If I were to compare it to a room not in Vegas, then I'd give our room at the Monte Carlo Hotel a 5 star rating.  Since I'm comparing it to other hotels in Vegas, I'd have to give them 3 stars instead.  Room was clean, tastefully decorated, comfortable, and I got a great night's sleep.

I have not eaten at any of the restaurants here so no help there.  I haven't even eaten at their buffet.  

What I do like about the Monte Carlo is the casino.  I'm not a high roller.  My budget nowadays is $20 to $50 for gambling whenever we go to Vegas, and I have never gone over the budget.  I pretty much consider that money a donation.  At Monte Carlo, though, my $20 turned into $500!!  That's why I'm giving them 4 stars!  I'm a fan of a casino that will give me money!

Another positive about the place is the location.  It is walking distance to all the major hotels on the Strip.  Very convenient.

Bottom line is I probably would not stay here again unless the price was right.  I will play again at their casino though!  Maybe next time, my $20 will turn into $1000!!
Nope. Nice amenities, but room Ethernet was bad, wi-fi was evidently hackable (my account was compromised while there), and paid thru the nose for everything.

Never ever ever again.  I've always loved this place because of it's convenient location.  It's a decent price with nice pools.   Well that all changed.  This place should be shut down during construction.  I knew coming into it that the pools were closed due to renovations but I did not know THE ENTIRE CASINO IS A CONSTRUCTION SITE.    This is my last morning here and I've never been more excited to get home from a vacation.  Absolute nightmare.  Stayed for 5 nights and was woken up 4 of the 5 days including Sunday (apparently Labor Day was special) before 7am with banging and drilling all around me.  Out of control.  Ac in room didn't work. Had to call down at midnight because I couldn't sleep from the heat.   You step off the revelatory and heat is pouring out of the vents.  Does management not realize it's 106 degrees?!  Outlet plugs in bathroom don't work.  No place to put clothes except a tiny closet.  No drawers.  No microwave or fridge.  I typically love all the bathroom products.  There was cheap shampoo conditioner lotion and a bar of soap.  For an upscale place, it's not ok.   I don't even want to ask for extras like I normally do.  I don't even feel clean after just showering.  And the parts that are renovated suck.  I am so beyond disappointed.  Last night I came to room to order a movie to take a much needed break from the strip and what a surprise, no movies available during renovations.  I couldn't even buy an overpriced movie.  Ridiculous.  I called down this morning to request a noon rather than 11 checkout and was denied.  Are you kidding me?!?!   Customer service was awful, prob because every single person at this hotel is complaining.   My vacation was basically ruined from this.  Not cool at all, MGM.  I expect much higher levels of service from a MGM property.  I will not be staying here again.   I'm generally positive so I will say the beds are nice.  Not that it matters since they woke my butt up so early every morning.   Aaarrrgh.   Angry.

What can I say that the 52 other reviews haven't said?  I didn't actually read all 52 cause that's a lot of reviews....but here's my 2 cents.  The Monte Carlo is one of those large hotels on the strip but is relatively unassuming compared to other monsters out there.  It's nice, it's classy (in that Vegas sort of way) and it's not too overdone with giant sphinxes and steaming volcano's.  The prices are always moderate compared to the other biggies and the rooms are nice, spacious and well kept.  It's centrally located on the strip so you can experience the ostentatiousness of some of the other hotel attractions, but then come back to something a little less gaudy.  I have not sampled the food, although they do have a kick ass concierge floor that my co-worker was staying on.  The pools looked nice from a distance and the Monte Carlo didn't take any of my money at the tables.  In terms of nice but affordable accommodations on the strip this is a great choice!

I love our stay at the Monte Carlo. We had Spa suit ($90) sweet. Room was big with bar, sofas, comfy bad and nice jacuzzi next to the window with the strip view.Awesome.
Cleaning service was very good.
Definitely I will stay again.

Before arriving at the hotel, I was in contact with the concierge (who were awesome and responsive!). I wanted to make sure everything was perfect because we were celebrating my boyfriend's 30th birthday as well as 20 years cancer free. They were super friendly - which is what I was expecting upon arrival. 

During check-in we were greeted by a not-so-friendly worker. (Who also almost mischarged us more). We were so tired that we didn't address the issue then and there. We went to our room and were very pleased. It overlooked the pools and everything was clean. (I think some rooms must be more updated than others. Because reading other reviews regarding outdated things and cleanliness, I cannot relate). 

My boyfriend and I decided to go down and speak to someone. We spoke to a very friendly and helpful person at the concierge who then introduced us to the manager. He was super nice and accommodating and we were upgraded to a better room. We were so happy! The new room was great, two bathrooms, a couch, lots of space and overlooked the strip.

Food - We had the pub on our first day and it was great. There's also a good slushie place downstairs near Starbucks.

Gambling - Aside from all the smoking, had a great time gambling and service for drinks were great.

Conveniently, there is a CVS down the block as well. 

Our trip in Vegas was incredible and we would definitely stay here again as well as recommend it to others!

I haven't stayed here but I've been inside. Hotel looks really nice. Nice lobby and very well decorated. Its located at a decent location on the Strip. However, their casino isn't the best. If you are a gambler, might wanna hit up some other casinos.

Absolutely appalled that after a well known NIGHT TIME event, they would be okay waking up their hotel guests at 6am!. The construction was literally right next door to us. If 6am is too early for them to pay their employees to open their hotel shops (b\/c they know in Vegas nobody on vaca is up that early), then why would they think it was okay to start construction at that time? 

Next, apparently house keeping saw my husband leave with a bag (that we wanted to store in the car). I stayed back..no knock, no announcement, NOTHING and all of a sudden our hotel room door opened. I was changing! I shrieked and yelled what are you doing? Andshe said "oh sorry,  housekeeping". They are supposed to knock and say that BEFORE opening the door.

Front desk didn't give two beans. No need to go back. Plenty of other options in vegas.

Everything was good here. The value was good (approx. $110\/night). I won't ever use hotels.com anymore because they have some shady pricing going on where they don't disclose everything up front. We ended up paying extra per night and they said that it included stuff like pool access and water bottles. The water bottles were child portions so don't get excited. The property is clean and the staff was great but we ended up going during moth season and let me tell you, they were everywhere. I think I killed so many in my room that PETA would attack me if they knew. 

The casino was nice and offered lots of stuff to suit different tastes like the Blue  Man Crew, a cigar lounge, bars, restaurants, and the traditional buffet. Can't expect the Monte Carlo to compete with the high-end resorts but then you are saving a ton of money while having a good experience, with the exception of the damn moths!

I've stayed in a number of MGM Properties in Vegas and I have to admit, I really liked the Monte Carlo. Initially, I expected to hate it so I was pleasantly surprised.

it is kind of crazy getting to and from the hotel due to all of the construction but it's really not that big of a deal. We didn't hear the construction from our rooms so that was a plus.

I even really liked the casino- it isn't huge but Mom and i managed to spend twelve straight hours gambling here and we didn't go broke or get bored. That rarely happens. 

Overall, it was a good value for the price but you won't be "wowed" like you would at some of the other Vegas properties like Wynn or Pallazo.

I'm considered a kid lol so I must say that it was pretty okayy. I mean it wasn't bad, but the first room we stayed in, it smelled like smoke :P And we specifically asked for a non-smoking room, but they gave us a room that smelled really badd. Later on they gave us a better room near our cousins\/family ( i went with my grandparents and cousins )

My traveling companions and I arrived at the Monte Carlo on a Thursday evening (around 8:00 PM) and were pleasantly surprised. We'd found a really outstanding rate for the long weekend and having never even walked into the place on previous visits to Sin City weren't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised.

The cab dropped us off and a bellman was there within seconds to take our luggage. Our luggage was taken away and we were given a number to call to have it delivered once we were in our rooms. It was so easy. 

We walked in and I immediately noticed how good it smelled. This is not the typical experience I've found, especially when smoky casinos are involved. The friendly staff member who checked us in informed us that the pleasant fragrance was from the fresh-cut roses seen all over the lobby that were also placed into the ventilation system. The bell desk staff was also very friendly. We'd ordered a motorized scooter to be delivered for my grandmother (we were in town celebrating her 80th birthday and while she can play slots all day and night she can't walk there) and it was ready and waiting. The whole check-in process took at most ten minutes.

The rooms were very nice and our luggage arrived within 5 minutes of calling to request it. The rooms were quite spacious with clean, soft bedding and plenty of pillows. There weren't enough hangers in the closet which is not something that bothered me but if you're like my grandmother who apparently is allergic to wrinkled clothing you might want to bring or request extra. The bathrooms were pretty typical, very clean and stocked with plenty of towels. The biggest issue with our rooms, which were on the pool side of the hotel, presented itself the next morning when the pool opened and the music blared from 9 AM - 6 PM. It was loudest on Friday and Saturday so if you are one who likes to sleep in or take naps so you can party all night you may want to request a room that doesn't overlook the pool.

Speaking of the pool area...it was quite nice. There were people lined up at 9:00 every morning to be sure to get seats but many of them just put towels on chairs and took off. The days we got to the pool later in the day we had a bit of trouble locating chairs but always found some. The wave pool was a lot of fun and the other pools were also great, never overcrowded even with the place was packed. They have some ridiculous pool rules, however, namely the rule against bringing food or beverage. I understand that they want to sell as much food and drink as possible but to not allow even bottled water is a little silly, especially in the DESERT. We ended up purchasing bottles (at $5 each) but they were served with as many cups as we wanted and plenty of ice. Drinks were pricey as was the food which meant we didn't do much drinking or eating at the pool. 

There were plenty of options for food in the hotel including a food court with plenty of quick and economical choices including McDonald's, Subway, Starbucks, Sbarro and Rubio's. The Cafe is open 24 hours and had really great food ranging from breakfast to sandwiches to pasta, etc. We also dined at the Italian restaurant, D. Vino, and the food\/wine were excellent. 

The casino is on the smaller side but still has plenty of tables and slot machines. I really don't gamble all that much but managed to have a good time on the penny slots. 

Housekeeping was a bit pushy. I am not the type to need my room cleaned every day which seemed to be something that unnerved them. They called and left messages every day and were in our rooms seemingly within seconds if we neglected to hang the "do not disturb" sign. They also did room check at 9 AM on the day we were checking out when official check-out wasn't until 11 AM and we were even granted an extra hour at no charge. I suppose this is better than having unresponsive and incompetent cleaning staff.

I really enjoyed my experience at the Monte Carlo and would definitely stay there again!

We stayed there 4days! From the pictures and the lobby it looks very nice, but once we went into our room it was like a days inn room. We would wake up very sore every morning. The food court looks terrible. They need update this hotel. We paid almost $500 to stay here. I should have listen to the reviews. Never will I stay here again.

Have been here several times over the years, will not be back. Monte Carlo is a dud, mostly empty for super bowl weekend, the pools are gone, the pub is gone, the dancing girls near the black jack tables are gone, the theater was not open for the big game, nothing about the place makes me want to return.

The only thing that bumped this to a 2 star rating was the variety of slot machines their casino has. 

The room was a deluxe king with a view. Had a great view of the Aria, that's about it. The decor was very bland and uninviting. Bathroom was in desperate need of a remodel. Tiles were coming off and there some gold fixtures and some silver fixtures. Not what I expect when I pay this much for a "deluxe" room. 

The shower head was the absolute worst one I have ever experienced in any hotel across the counties I have traveled to. 

Visit Monte Carlo for Blueman Group, the five below bar and the casino....but stay somewhere else nearby.

Four stars for fun pools, tram to City Center and  Bellagio, a very comfortable bed, the great wait staff and people who work in the shops, etc. Pleasant, courteous people. Minus two stars for hot, smokey casino, rooms need upgrading, $20 daily resort fee yet no wifi in rooms and lack of clearly defining the use of $35 restaurant credit at check in.

It is a bit hard to get to because there al;ways seems to be construction around it. First they were redoing part of NewYorkNewYork next door, then redoing the front between Monte Carlo and NYNY, now they are doing the park and events center in between the two resorts. 

Still rooms are decent for a medium budget locatation, and despite the area construction it is very convenient to most of the mid-South Strip locations.

What happened to this dump?  I closed the door and a tile fell off the wall. The rooms are out dated and dirty. There are no comforters on the beds only sheets. I slept in my jeans every night because the bed was cold. House keeping didn't even come everyday.  The casino,  lobby and shops are ok in terms of decor but that's about it. I went for a conference, if I had to pay for this dump I would have not been happy. The front desk staff are nice, helpful and informative.  Too bad the place needs a complete overhaul to stay competitive in Vegas. I don't know how it survives.

I'm at Vegas for CES and needed a cheap place to stay. Found Monte Carlo on Bookit for $60 total for CES weekend. (Must've been a price mistake) so I figured why not. Front desk is a bit disorganized as the lines just sort of just merge from everywhere. Not to mention they took a long time checking each guest in. Got to my room and housekeeping was still in there.. (wth) ok fine, whatever.. they had to fix a broken lamp. I'm not going to complain about that since they did make the effort to fix something that was broken.

The restroom towels seems kind of.... not clean? Haha.. I don't know how to properly explain it. Just seemed not properly put up.

I think for the price I paid it's definitely not something to complain about, but if I had gone with the a rate of more than $120, I would expect something better.
Nice, comfortable rooms......nothing flashy....nothing gross.

The Monte Carlo website brags, that the "Monte Carlo Resort and Casino is undergoing an exciting transformation into a new luxury resort experience" so we gave it a try this past weekend only to be very disappointed. We were in a newly remodeled room on the 24th floor. The room smelled like new carpet and was cute with trendy dcor. However, a few trendy features do not make a luxury room or a luxury hotel! The window was small and had cheap coverings. There were no robes or slippers and the linens were mediocre. The bed was comfortable. There was no in-room coffee or tea and none offered on the floor. There was no fridge and no space or stands to set suitcases on. The bathroom had a modern finish with a shower (no tub) and no toilet room. The shower itself had very poor water pressure and there were no adjustable settings. It was a chore getting the shampoo and conditioner rinsed out of my hair. The toiletries (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion) was very, very, very cheap. I have experienced better showers at Holiday Inn\/Hampton Inns. There was no room guide so I don't even know if they have room service or not. On a positive note, the Sambalatte coffee shop on the property was very good! AFTER booking the room we received an email notifying us that the pool was under construction. However, we were able to take a shuttle to the Mandalay Bay pools. The Mandalay pools were extremely overcrowded (assumedly due to the additional guests from Monte Carlo?) and it was difficult to find a place to sit. There were too few complimentary water stations and people were literally passing out! I had to assist a young girl who seemed to suffer from dehydration. There were not enough poolside servers and we sat over 10 minutes at a bar with no greeting and left without a drink. We overheard a patron ask the bartender, "If it's not too much trouble can I get some ice when you get a minute?" and the bartender replied quite dryly "What's the magic word?" This is not a luxury experience. We have also stayed at the Mandarin, Vdara and the Aria in the past year for a very similar price point and enjoyed those properties much more! It seems the Monte Carlo is taking advantage of their location next to the T-Mobile arena and is charging top dollar for pocket-change service and vacation experience. Total for two nights was $650. Go to the Mandarin or Vdara instead!

This place is pretty dumpy and has been on its last leg for quite a few years now. People stay here because of the location and the price. If you have expectations beyond that, you will be disappointed. 

The pool scene here is laughable, it is very much a Wal-Mart crowd. The water in the lazy river smells like it was pumped fresh from the bathtubs of the hotel. The rooms all have issues and aren't the cleanest, but the beds are comfy and overall not too horrible. 

There is always a line to check in, so expect that as well. Drinks in the lobby are $10, so bring a flask if you're feeling frugal.

So disappointed...
If it's just my husband and I, we'd be staying at Bellagio, but when you bring the kids, Monte Carlo used to be our destination of choice in Vegas.  It was never a 5 star destination location, but because it was easy, reasonable, had one of the best pool complexes in Vegas and was good for the family, Not Anymore.
Everything from customer service, to amenities to the property itself is in need of a major over-haul. We had booked two adjoining rooms this time.  When we arrived at 5:00 p.m. on a Friday, we were told no adjoining rooms available.  Wasn't until we escalated our concern to a supervisor did we get the rooms that we had actually requested.  Representative at check- in was rude and lacking in customer service skills...not a great way to start a weekend.
Next, rooms were outdated and worn.  Granted, you don't spend a whole lot of time in your rooms in Vegas, but with so many options these days, would expect better. You are charged a $20 per night resort fee that gets you two Kerurig K-cups, two small bottles of water, access to the overcrowded\/loud pool and the gym - what it doesn't cover is Wi-Fi in the rooms - because they don't offer Wi-Fi in the rooms - only wired connection if you can hunt down the cord.  
Walls are paper-thin - you can hear every conversation outside of your room.
Pool was a nightmare...crowded beyond belief....drunks everywhere you turn - ABSOLUTELY not family friendly.  So many drunks in the lazy river had to get kids out before a full lap around.  Very loud at the pool...not a single spot where you could just relax and read  or chill...Also, service at the pool was terrible.  Was dying to eat waited 45 minutes for a waitress..ended up having to get up and find someone myself.
Had dinner at the buffet - food was mediocre at best. (honestly, some of the worst Prime Rib I have every had  - tasted like it was pre-made and rewarmed for serving - no one is our party was ablet o have more than a bite or two of it) Significantly smaller than most other buffets in Vegas and far less crowded.  Would not go back to buffet.
As others have mentioned, there is a food court, but don't fool yourself into thinking it's cheap like the food court at home, this is after-all, Vegas.  A slice of pizza, a dinner salad and a drink was $16.
The only reason I would ever consider staying here again would be 1) the location - prime spot for walking to other attractions locally (especially if you have kids and are willing to pass on the pool, M&M Factory and Coca Cola store are right across the street, movies theaters right across the street and roller coaster at NYNY is next door. 2) the tram to Bellagio...easy access to another prime spot on the strip (on a Saturday night we were able to get to Ceasar's in about 15 minutes.  We were too tired to walk back and were going to take a cab - was told cost on a Saturday night would have been around a $40 cab ride in traffic.  Tram is free  3) easy access - very easy to get on and off of Highway 15 without having to spend much driving time on Las Vegas Blvd.

Definitely in need of an upgrade.  But if you're looking to stay on the strip for a reasonable price, this fits the bill.  Everything, while dated, is clean and manageable.  Pool is nothing like other pools on the strip.  It's definitely not Luxury, which is what they're going for since that word is printed everywhere in their hotel.

I've been to Vegas a few times, and after staying at a few places, I guess you could say ny expectations were high. Nonetheless, I expected our rooms at the Monte Carlo to have that "Vegas look." Wrong. The rooms looked as good if not worse than any other generic hotel, such as La Quinta. I've stayed at Hiltons that have by far better rooms than this. But I guess for the price I pay, what do I expect. No wifi was an inconvenience as well as no microwave nor fridge? I know to many its not a huge playing factor, but when you're there for a week, its nice to have food\/drinks on hand without burning a hole in your pocket or having to go down to the lobby. Shitty showert that would clog and super loud flush for the toilet. Walls are thin. We heard everything and anything the people next door were doing. 

Another issue was room service. Your room service staff is very friendly BUT out of the 6 days we stayed, our room was cleaned once on the 2nd day. You best believe by the 6th it seemed like a tornado had hit. (We were only in our room to sleep and gone 80% of the day\/night). I understand that at times, wed be in the room when they would come by.. but they wouldnt come back again.

The staff is very friendly though. So 3\/5.

If youre on a budget, I would recommend to come here. If not, invest in a nicer hotel on the strip. I definitely won't stay here again.

I stayed there years and years ago when it was still new!
It was my first Las Vegas trip.
Roomy hotel rooms. Average comfort.
The casino area stunk  cigarette even though it was a newer hotel.
When I went it was more expensive but now since the fire you can get AWESOME deals some with foods for less than $90 bucks a night!

Let's just start off by saying this was the last time I'll ever stay here. Once we checked in we went up to our floor and once we got out of the elevator there was a funky smell decided to ignore it but when we got into our room it still smelled in there. We got a room with a view but didn't have anything! No coffee machine, no alarm clock, no bible (even motels have bibles) and no fridge. I called the front desk & asked if they had any of those items & the lady just said they couldn't provide them even if we paid extra. Also we had the "do not disturb" sign on our door & they still opened the door while we were sleeping.

I recently stayed here for 3 nights last month. I was a little skeptical because of the many, many bad reviews I've read after booking my stay. (It was a last minute thing and it was a decent price for Spring Break) I feel like I payed too much for it.. but oh well.

I was actually surprised by how much I liked the hotel. The rooms are very outdated, yes. But mine was clean! The service I got from check in to check out was great. The pool was pretty much like a dayclub on one side and that was pretty fun. I wish they were open longer though. They gave us 2 free buffets and 2 drink vouchers that we used and that was nice. I also won a nice amount of money in the casino. :) Maybe it was beginners luck because I rarely gamble lol.

4 stars because I handed the maid a $10 tip before I left the room for her to clean it and she did a horrible job.. All she did was remake the beds. One blanket had a huge stain from us spilling soda on it the night before and she didn't even change the sheets. She flipped it thinking we wouldn't notice I guess..

Overall, I would want to stay here again after a remodel.

So, my boss booked 6 rooms a month ago. We got to this hotel an hour ago and we are still not in our rooms. Apparently they "over booked" their rooms?' WTF?! Why? When we are CONFIRMED guests that double checked and confirmed our rooms. This is completely unacceptable!! I'm going to wait for the outcome of this $#!t show and will adjust my review accordingly.

I thought the Monte Carlo was one of the bigger places on the strip but really it's just a lil hole in the wall casino without a god damned thing to do. The place isn't dirty or anything like that so I can't completely one star 'em. But for the price you pay and for where they're located this place really needs to step their game up because you could do better at a bunch of other places in the area. Definitely wouldn't rebook.

Yuck! Is all I can say... We stayed here our last night in Vegas after staying at Delano for 3 nights and you can't even compare... I guess we were spoiled. It was dirty, smelled and the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced.. The most disgusting thing was when my boyfriend lifted the toilet there seemed to be either dried vomit or feces on the seat.. When we called to complain they seemed like they could care less saying they would send someone to clean it... Asked if we could leave the room while they cleaned ... At midnight after a long day of driving! No joke this was just terrible .. Save yourself and do not stay here!

After staying here for 4 nights Wed-Sun, I have to say this place isn't half bad. Rooms were expected, not completely luxurious but not your basic hotel room.

Prices were reasonable for the rooms, I booked two adjoining two queen bed rooms and it still ended up being barely more than just 1 room at a more upscale hotel such as The Mirage or MGM.

The pool is awesome. Lazy river, wave pool and a volleyball court. Casino isn't crazy big and just the right size. Game options are good, plenty to choose from. They have a food court with a good amount of options. Id avoid it though cause they literally rape you with the prices there. $10 for a $5 subway footlong?! I'll walk a bit more and grab something cheaper and better.

Location isn't bad either, it's at the beginning\/middle of the strip. It's convenient that there's a CVS right in front of the hotel and tons of places to eat within the vicinity.

Overall if you're on a budget and don't need anything overly luxurious I would recommend this hotel.

I arrived at the Monte Carlo late at night due to a delayed flight and my first impression of this hotel was formed at the front desk where they said "Looks like you've had a rough trip, you're booked on the 3rd floor with no view but let me see what I can do...", this resulted in a complimentary upgrade to the 28th floor with a pristine view of the strip, MGM Grand, and New York New York which made my girlfriend and I very happy. 

The room was a little dated, the plumbing fixtures could use replacement, and there was no mini fridge in the room but all the basics were covered (including a large TV). Let's be honest though, you don't go to Vegas to spend your time in the hotel room...

The Casino floor was well equipped with tons of slot machines, ample table games, and several bars (including an ice bar). There were also plenty of restaurants to choose from and a really nice coffee shop that you can hit up in the mornings. 

The best part of this hotel, in my opinion, is the location. We were able to walk to either end of the strip easily and it was a breeze to Uber to\/from the airport. I would definitely recommend the Monte Carlo if you're visiting Vegas for a few nights and you're looking for a nice price\/quality ratio with your hotel booking.

As others have stated, best things about this hotel are the location on the strip and the cheaper prices. However the rooms themselves are dirty and outdated. The bathroom had foreign hair all over it, shower drain didn't work properly, and entire shower felt flimsy...The hotel buffet is a JOKE and really gross, stale food.

HOWEVER, my check in process was excellent. Of COURSE there was a line, and lines tend to be longer at peak times. The same is true of ANY hotel in Vegas. The desk clerks were very helpful and informative. And I can't complain too much, because I DID win about $400 there. 

Check out the Ice Bar (Minus 5) if you have the chance OR you win a little money haha. Pretty cool experience, my boyfriend and I enjoyed it.

For the cost and location, it's a good deal. The rooms are clean and the casino floor is reasonably modern. I really appreciated that the food court stayed open pretty late. Great late night drunk meal.
