The Monte Carlo has good things and not so good things. The check in desk was great, the staff ran things efficiently and quickly. The young man that assisted us was very professional and friendly. We had a room upgrade, big mistake! The suite was very out dated, the Monaco suite looked nothing like the actual room that we got. The first bathroom sink was clogged and the other bathroom had tile that separated along the wall. Nothing too major just a bit of sprucing up was what this room needed. The suite was okay and the bed was very comfortable but made audible spring sounds. Get your mind out of the gutter it was an old mattress but comfy non the less. The walls in the suites are thin, we had to call the front desk to have the next door guests lower the banana boat tunes (Harry Belafonte) aye! aye! aye! after midnight was what we were woken up to, also when ever the guests sprayed perfume the scent made its way under the adjoining door. They staff of this hotel did tell our inconsiderate neighbors to lower the music and the excessive loud talking. We were grateful and we fell back to sleep.
The casino also gets a thumbs up, so far so good Monte Carlo! this hotel gets a big fat "F" for the food court Vagrancy. apparently this is common at the Monte Carlo. One male came to our table and demanded we give him our food! Then two more people did the same thing. security was finally called when one of the vagrants helped himself to someone else's breakfast but he let the other two stay. Be forewarned you will pay for the resort fees without a pool for this hotel.
This place is horrible, book somewhere else! Customer service here is non Existent! From dirty rooms to rude front desk manager, my stay here was dreadful!

I have stay at the Monte Carlo multiple times but this time I have to take the time and review this hotel.

The check in was super easy I checked in the night before our trip and got an email about 1pm that our room was ready. Me and husband got there about 2pm and we didn't wait in line for our key,  they have a self service  station so it was very easy and fast to get the keys.
The room was nice and clean but the A.C. wasn't working that well it was still hot inside the room. NO POOL it suck since you pay a resort fee for pool,internet and ac and they failed two things out of three.
All their staff is super friendly from the  people who help me with my reservation on the phone to the house keeping and the little shop station by the room elevators!!
Ice machine in floor 5 didn't work so I had to go to floor 3 and they don't sell coke at all I hate pepsi!! Lol ignore soda comment I'm just been really picky.
I will give this hotel another try since I hace stay here before and I love their customer service!! See you soon Vegas

Zero STARS!  Piece of junk hotel. Booked 4 nights here but on arrival the room wasn't available so they charged us extra $50.00 per night for another room. Upon reaching the room we found out that it had only one bed. Very old room with a dinosaur age TV. They charge parking for guests now! Security kept coming to our room for noise disturbance when we were not even making much noise. Walls are probably made with cheap materials that does not reduce sound. Left the hotel next day! Never going back.

Staff were so helpful. I came here for my birthday and I had a blast. Family and I enjoyed it. I will return soon. Hopefully watch a show next time around. Diablo is a good place to go eat and get drinks. Thank Brian for all the help.

We got a great hotel\/flight deal online. This was our first stay at this hotel. The first room they gave us wasn't made up yet so they moved us to another immediately (unfortunately, the first room was facing the Strip, the second room was in back & faced construction). While the pricing was good, the one big drawback about booking through Expedia was we weren't guaranteed a king bed (instead of two queen). We were there to celebrate our anniversary so we didn't want two queen beds! When I called the hotel to confirm our reservation & ask about the bed situation, they said they'd note our anniversary but still couldn't guarantee anything. Comfortable room, decent casino, friendly staff, included a free meal at the buffet (we used it for lunch & it was quite good for a big buffet). A little disappointed with the pool - the surrounding buildings block the sun so it was quite chilly & the pool's odd shape makes it nearly impossible to do laps. Overall, good experience & would stay here again.
Incredible staff, very accommodating, lovely casino, rooms could use an update, but overall very clean and comfortable. BEST BEDS EVER

I know you might be wondering why Monte Carlo would be getting a four star for my review but really they have so much inside this casino that they deserve a four star!

A lot of people might say this is an old casino worth not going to but I really believe that this place does take very good care of the customer! Which is you and when you, and when you are on vacation you want to be nice and happy!

One thing I love about it was how friendly the check in counter was. The girl literally told me what her plans were for the weekend. Be reminded that I did check in on Thursday and stayed till Tuesday. It was a long week for me in Monte Carlo but I did feel a sense of belonging! Fast service and then after that when we needed extra towels a few times, they brought it up quickly and left in a second!

Alright so what else is great about this resort? Well the pool is amazing. I was in that pool daily and I loved it. They have many different types of pools, a small wave one, a lagoon, and just regular pool. All were really nice and the music was amazing!! 

What more can you ask for? Also they do let you drink alcohol but you have to buy it from the pool side area. If you want come early because this place is pretty packed and the lines for alchy can become long! 

With soo many lounge chairs to be able to lay around and be comfortable is amazing! I thought this place should really get an award for being on top of comfort for guest ! 

I love also how it is connect with Aria and Bellagio by this awesome new tram. Just ask for assistance if you can't find it and someone will really help you out! No Joke. 

Thanks for making my week a very great and fun time,I will for sure recommend coming here if you love to have a great time in the pool and quick service! :)

We stayed here at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights during the week, I thought there was not going to be too many people, but yeah, there were. We booked a High Floor Deluxe Room with 2 queen beds, 29th Floor.

Mmm, let's start by saying that when I first went into the room my first thought was "ugh... it does not look like in the picture, the bed is missing the red tootsie roll pillow (or whatever that pillow it's called). I thought it would have a fridge, but it didn't, it would have been nice, but I guess I should have paid more, but now I know; we had to use the sink as a cooler (that's always the cheaper option haha).

Anyway, back to review what was actually there (it's so easy for me to go off on tangents). 

Air quality in the elevators and hallways to go to the room is bad, and I don't know what it is, but it smells like old people's house but once you go into the room and lower the temperature to 60-65 degrees then you feel better. 

Everything was fresh and clean: bedding & towels. They have good room service too, I ordered more towels and they took them within 20 minutes, I feel like a cheap ass now because I forgot to tip the guy :(

There was one problem though, the bathroom door was too long or I don't know what the problem was, the thing is that to close it you had to force it shut and it would make a lot of noise (inconvenient for the other people sleeping because it would totally wake them up).

The pools:
They have the lazy river, I loved that thing! That's great for children and grown ups like us that don't know how to swim but that don't want to look dumb just standing in the pool. They also have a wave pool, that was fun too, they activate\/deactivate the waves approximately every 15 minutes (don't quote me on the time, that's what it felt like). The waves won't catch you off guard because they have this "recess bell sound" that warns you they are being activated. My wanna be bf, told me there was another pool, I was distracted looking at the $31 sandals they have so I don't remember but anyway, YEAH, if you need sandals and don't want to spend $31 go to the Ross that is right on the strip like a block away from the Monte Carlo. WE got some very cute sandals for like $10! Just saying, that should be a total separate review on Ross, I know, Sorry.

Bottom Line: Definitely this is not nicest place that I've stayed at, but for $180 for two nights I can't complaint, it had a great location. Will I stay there again? Probably not.

Review for 06\/04\/10 wknd:

First time staying here & it was great!

We got to Vegas super early around 9am & decided to go ask what was the earliest we can check in, their response: How about in 20 minutes? - Sweet! 

ROOM: Clean, we could see the pool, comfortable bed
Roomy bathroom. Everything worked & it was clean.

POOL: Fun, fun, fun! They have 3 pools, a wave pool so I felt like I was at Hurricane Harbor but waaaaay less kids, they have a DJ and awesome drinks that made me loose track of time. They have a lazy river where we spotted half of the Jersey Shore crew...well not really but they sure looked like them!  Then a regular pool & a jacuzzi.
If you don't like loud music while you lay out in the pool this is not the place for you.

The Buffet: We got a complementary buffet so we opted for the breakfast one, since Champagne was included we sat here for over 3hrs drinking & no one bother us, waitress (Karla you rock!) kept refilling & checking on us to make sure we were doing good but not being intrusive. 

Diablos: This place sucks ass, it was not packed at all & we were told that we couldn't get a table unless we were eating an Entree, there was not room to sit on the bar so I pointed out to the host that all their meals contained meat & since I don't eat it, I just wanted drinks & appetizers. She replied with "Fine, we are not that busy" 
Food was gross. Waitress was cool.

The Cafe: Great breakfast, service was good & prices were good.

Their Stores: Super Pricey!! we got back at 2am from a concert, rough night, needed water & end up paying $5 for a small bottle!! Discovered the ABC store across the street the next day & things got better.

We were allowed to check out at 12pm so it was perfect.
No wait to check in or check out, guess we timed it good.
Internet never worked so they reversed the hotel fee to our card.

Parents: Not a great place for kids, please take them somewhere else.

Being that this is a "European" themed hotel, it is nice but not as impressive as the other European themed hotels on the strip (like Bellagio, Venetian, Caesars). However, the price we paid was great (as we got a Groupon deal) and it is in a good part of the strip. Also parking was easy (short walking distance from the structure to the lobby!), they give a coupon for 2 free drinks, and self checkout was great!

The rooms are pretty standard; its clean, some items show wear and tear... one thing I didn't like was the thin walls... you could easily hear guests in the next room. Luckily we weren't in the room most of the time, we were just there to sleep after partying!

Overall, an OK place. The highlights for me were the parking and the self checkout :) I would come here again if the price was right. Thanks!

One of my favorite hotels on the strip. Its not super expensive and it convenient to a lot. The rooms aren't fancy, and the casino isn't my favorite, but the food court is good, theres a Starbucks and another coffee shop and the pool is great, with a lazy river and wave pool. The poolside drinks are some of the best. Definitely recommend staying here.

The "strip view" room was alright.  A pretty typical hotel room that you would get at a motel 6.  The maids could do a little better of a job.  The air vents are covered in dust and the bathroom grout is nasty\/moldy.  The view of the strip was nice except you also look down on the massive, ugly roof of the casino.  They don't have any wifi but offer free wired internet via an ethernet port.  The Keurig they promised isn't a Keurig.  It's some weird generic coffee machine.  It's not a bad hotel, it's just not really that great either.  Overpriced for what you get.

I've stayed here in the past, in a standard room and it was fabulous... This time around, it was in a spa suite on the 23rd floor, with a view of the city. 

They are definitely due for a renovation.

The room was clean, comfortable and satisfactory when we checked in. The thermostat read a 74* F when we put our luggage in & then went out to the strip (without running the AC while we were out). 

When we returned to our room later at night, we still had not even turned on the air yet. The room was more warm by then & smelled of traces of mildew. The scent was stronger around the carpet area surrounding the tub. I figure, we'll it's a spa room, what can you expect. I am sure the previous guests have carelessly distributed to this and condensation from use of the tub has absorbed into the carpeting. 

I opened the window to air it out a bit so it wasn't so humid & there was a horrible toxic tar chemical coming from the construction tractors working on the rubble below. After 15 minutes, the room filled up with these gross toxic fumes, so we decided to shut the window and run the air. This seemed to help over the next couple of hours...

The shower and toilet faucet, drain, spouts and handle hardware looked awful, they looked as if pieces were "peeling" & were mismatched of gold, brushed nickel, stainless steel. The tiling in the shower was deeply stained, and showed of signs of heavy wear and tear, broken and chipped. 

We were awoken early the next morning by loud construction tractor sounds coming from direction of the window. I figure, OK, so it's normal early morning hours during the week, so we understand that this may be a potential thing. So we didn't complain. 

The second night came about & It wasn't til 1 am I realized this construction job never ends and like the city, they operate & work 24\/7. 

3 am strikes & I have a hard time falling asleep to the noisy ruckus they were causing outside. Had I known there were going to be some construction going on, I would have requested to stay on another side of the tower. There was no construction discount or notice as we booked the room, so this was not expected. I was finally able to fall asleep with a pillow over my head. 

The duvet blanket on the bed looked like it came from a homeless shelter. It had many holes in it, wasn't in a cover and it was placed between one flat sheet and another. 

I purchased my room through the MLife website through the $134.99 \/per night rate & receive a $50 credit promotion. They never mentioned anything the promo credit it in my confirmation email or when I checked it. The MLife desk was closed when I attempted to ask about it. We checked out & then went to the Mlife desk & then the representative got approval to give us a meal credit at the hotel buffet. That was nice :)

I love staying here! Not only do I stay here. Only bad thing is the service fee they add on with your stay which is about extra $15 per day. It includes 2 bottles of water, free local calls, and water usage. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. The TVs could use a little upgrade. Service staff are friendly. The casino downstairs has lots of games. It's got the look and feel of one of the bigger hotels but with friendly, welcoming atmosphere. I love staying here!

I visited last summer and for the price, it was worth the stay. The room, from what I can recall, was very clean. I had no complaints with it. The main reason we decided on staying at this resort is because it was in the center of the strip which was perfect. I hadn't been to Vegas since I was 10 years old, so to me, I thought this hotel was nice and the price was perfect, only paid about $70 a night. I can't remember the name of one of their restaurants(it was Italian), but the food was delicious. Compared to the other hotels, I thought their casino was the least smokey. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here. I would definitely recommend this place to others and would even come back myself.

Kinda old looking decor, not the most stylish hotel on the strip, but who goes to vegas to stay in a hotel all day.

Perfect stay for come in sleep, shower, party.  Could use a better shower head though

Monte Carlo is a good place, however there are a few things that could be improved. Im aware this hotel is going to be transformed into another brand very soon as well.

Check in: The line was long, but it still went fairly fast.

The Room: I was initially checked into a room (Monaco Suite) that wasnt clean, had to call down & speak with a manager so i could get a room that was actually clean. I got the new Monaco Suite and it was clean but definitely showed its age -furniture severely chipped. It was an ok room.

Pool: Wave pool was fun, but the pool area was very busy so it was very difficult to find an open chair.

Bars: fun atmosphere. drinks are pricey (like every other hotel on the strip).

I cant wait to see what they have planned for its rebranding as Park MGM
How does any modern hotel\/casino that charges a report fee in Las Vegas NOT have WiFi available.

I researched the online reviews and completed our online reservation 02\/17\/16 without bias, but I should have heeded the online reviews! I selected a deluxe room and confirmed directly with hotel for a KING size bed.  I called the hotel a couple of weeks before our arrival date and requested NOT to be assigned near the noisy construction site, and the hotel staff accepted our request. 

We arrived on 04\/27\/16 and the check-in process was smooth and efficient and it all ended there. Upon check-in I reminded the check-in desk staff of my request for a KING size bed and NOT to be assigned near the construction site. The staff informed me they were "committed" for the night and I was assigned two queen beds. Staff cited I purchased the "Best Rate" available ($400.00 + the $30.00 per day BS resort fee) and she could move me to a higher floor for an additional $10.00 a day, which I declined. Staff's statement seemed scripted. I assumed no big deal, two queen beds would suffice. 

I accepted my room key and headed to room 05-331 (5th floor room #331). As I walked towards my room I noticed a good chunk 6'x6' of wall paper was missing from the wall adjacent to my room (another clue of a classy hotel) and the elevator doors had indication of graffiti. 

Entered my room and looked out the window to find I was assigned a room looking directly at the construction site (Photos attached). For the next three mornings I was awaken at approximately 6:00 AM to construction noise. Management, it an urban legend no one sleeps in Las Vegas, especially after being out late! 

Bedding and towels had holes and in deteriorating condition. Tub spout appeared to be falling apart and mold inside the shower area. 

We visit LV approximately four times a year and will NOT give our business here.

Been a while since we stayed here but just as we remembered.

Downside - the rooms are a bit outdated, the bathroom faucet leaked all night, we had trouble with sketchy wifi and when we moved the couch over we saw the carpet hadn't been vacuumed in lord knows how long.

Upside - spacious suite, excellent view, comfy bed, slept great, restaurants are fantastic, location is great and staff is friendly.


My husband was extremely frustrated with the wifi when we first arrived because it was needed to get sone work done, which he ended up losing some when documents couldn't save, but once work was out of the way we had a great time.

50 pc (YES, FIFTY!!) McDonald's McNuggets for $9.99 in the food court here. DELICIOUS!!

Rooms are pretty decent. Service is good and attentive.

When I booked this hotel at hotels.com it was the same price as a few other placed I've stayed such as the hard Rock and mgm so I thought I should try something new and comparable. 

So many issues. My first room had Luke warm water and no water pressure. The SC shrieked at 5am for no reason. They moved us to a room that sounded like someone was bowling above me. It did have good water pressure but the tub did not drain. 

Tiles were falling off the wall in the bathroom, there are hardly any outlets to plug in appliances. Yhey only put one bar of soap in each room, so either the sink or shower go it. The check in on a Thursday was long, they told me I didn't have a room, and had to look it up another way. I wasn't able to express check out because the system didn't recognize me. 

The lobby is nice but most rooms need an update bad.  Worn out carpets are replaced by different pattern carpets to make the floors look miss matched. I'm not a huge hotel snob but was a little embarrassed to take my girlfriend there.  Staff is friendly enough and the location is good but for the money would of much rather have stayed somewhere else. 

Stay somewhere else until they give the place an update. Or at least 2 bars of soap.
Old hotel but always filled with guest and tourists. The Jaba was a great addition to this hotel!

I was contacted by the hotel today and they have agreed to return my deposit. The whole situation was quite aggravating. The hotel is under construction and some what dated. I imagine once the construction is complete it will be nice. It is located in the middle of the strip which is nice.

-------
Had to request a trash can, pillows, and  soap. Made my own bed most days. Have contacted three times but still have my 250 dollars and has been two weeks. Say the money is released but still not showing up in my account.

Not a great experience so far.  Check in the lady was rude and wasn't helpful.  The rooms are gross, dirty carpet, stains, dirty baseboard, almost like a Super8.  The hallways are filthy, black grime and dirt all along the base, and ripped carpet, and the view from the 6th floor out the front is just a roof and AC units.

Great hotel to stay at! Especially If you get the strip view rooms you can see a lot of the new City-center complex, MGM and some of New York-New York. 

The pool layout is similar to Mandalay bay and MGM, but on a much smaller scale with a Lazy river, wave pool, Jacuzzi, and a regular swimming pool. 

The food court has some good options including: McDonalds, Subway, Rubios, Manchu-Wok, Sbarro, Starbucks, and the original Chicken tenders. 

They have a mall called: the street of dreams which leads to a free monorail system that takes guests to Aria and Bellagio which is perfect for anyone who wants to catch a fountain show without too much walking distance, or for anyone to just look around City center! 

I would definitely recommend the Monte Carlo resort we've stayed there since the beginning and we've never had any complaints. This resort really offers a solid product for an affordable price!

PS: BLUE MAN GROUP! enough said.

They will nickel and dime you to death here! I came here for the Ricky Martin concert. I had to pay $12 to park just to pick up my tickets! I returned for the show later that night to pay $15 to valet my car. NOTHING is free anymore! My friend and I sat at the bar and each of us put $10 in a machine to get a free beer and the bartender refused to serve us saying "You have to put $20 in the machine to get a free beer!" I would give 0 stars if I could. I talked to numerous hotel guests and all of them absolutely hated this place!

I love this place..... Fifth time there... Excellent location, (ask for high floor and strip view). Nice gym and the BEST COFFEE place in the world (SAMBALATTE)..... Amazing options for coffee lovers.....

I stayed here last month with my husband. It was our honeymoon\/birthday trip, so we wanted to stay at a hotel that was affordable and close to everything. Monte Carlo was perfect. For an extra $10 a day, we upgraded to the 31st floor with the perfect view of the pool area. The housekeepers did a fabulous job with cleaning our room everyday. The casino was good too. Also, it is right next to the new arena that opened up recently. Took away one star because the traffic is not well maintained during events. Besides that, nice hotel.

BACKGROUND Where do I begin! Let's just start off by saying what I'm about to write is not even exaggerated on my 1 night experience at the Monte Carlo. Mind you I'm local to Las Vegas area, have stayed in almost all hotels on the strip so I'm not a newbie to this town, know many in this hospitality industry and do A LOT for this community at large. A trip that was suppose to be a seamlessly STRESS FREE stay was far from it! This was suppose to be an experience for my daughter attending the Ariana Grande concert across the street at MGM Grand and had plans to do a little sightseeing beforehand. Needless to say plans changed!

CHECK-IN: It all started when we valeted at the Monte Carlo to check-in. My reservation was no where to be found in their system so thought nothing of it and figured it was a technical glitch of sorts. I proceeded to check-in where I waited for approx. 30 min. in line. Once I got to the front where a nice polite gentleman began to assist he too tried to locate my reservation and clearly did the best he could. Unfortunately, after exhausting all his options he had to call in a manager. To make a long story short it was about another 30 min. of him trying to work the issue, but it got escalated to Zach Bell who was the manager onsite at the time. I provided all the documentation and evidence (i.e. credit card used where I pre-paid, drivers license, reservation email booked on MonteCarlo.com). Anything I could prove to show it was a COMPLETE RESERVATION I provided!  After a complete 1+hrs  trying to check-in we FINALLY got keys to our room on the 30th floor. 

THE 1ST ROOM: The room provided to us was on the 30th floor when immediately upon entering were welcomed with an overpowering bold smell of cigarette smoke. It was by far disgusting! In addition, the decor from the wall, to the wires exposed along the base boards and the dingy\/stained wallpaper was enough to deal with (pics provided). Unfortunately, had to go back to guest services and see about getting moved to a 2nd room, which went hassle free (good news there). 

THE 2ND ROOM: After getting keys to a new room just a few feet from the original it was even worse in terms of a smoke smell. This time it was the overwhelming smell of weed filling up the hallway and even our room! It was so strong NO ONE could miss it! The room was a little better than the last decor wise,  but since I was traveling with 2 young girls especially one with special needs it was not healthy to keep her there. This time I phoned the front desk from the room to see what could be done. Eventually transferred to Zach the mgr who stated he would ensure the next room would be checked out by the housekeeping supervisor so we did not have to continually move from room to room. Within a few min housekeeping supervisor met me (nice lady) at the room to verify not only the smell, but to check-in on us. Since she did not manage the 25th floor  she could not do anything to further assist us. She then later called Zach again to see what we were to do and was told someone would be coming up to assist us with our luggage and move us into the new room located on the 25th floor. Of course none of this happened! I WAITED 30 minutes before heading downstairs to guest services AGAIN to figure out what was going on. The lady who was assisting (she had glasses on) was reading through all the notes and later determined the room was placed on hold. I began to ask her WHY is the room on hold and no one is communicating with me on what to do next. Needless to say, after dealing with the matter she finally handed over our new keys to the 3rd room. I was so frustrated by this point I was NOT going to leave without new keys in hand or without someone escorting us as originally communicated. 

THE 3RD ROOM: After over 2 hrs from the time I tried to check-in we FINALLY made it to room 25-335. Feeling exhausted with this experience we finally settled into our room. The appearance of the room was no different from the other 2. It just smelled less like smoke. Let's just say these rooms need a MAJOR OVERHAUL. 

CHECKING OUT: Considering everything I went through I managed to get a complimentary late check-out and the resort fee waived for inconvenience, which was appreciated given the craziness from the prior day. Needless to say things went from almost being OK, to yet another nightmare! In the process of trying to use the EXPRESS CHECKOUT I had noticed a charge of $109.00. Knowing I had already pre-paid $186.48 (12\/29) and showed this to the front-desk yesterday and forwarded my confirmation email directly to Zach Bell figured there had to be a mistake. I proceeded AGAIN to GUEST SERVICES where I was finally assisted by Clayton Horger. He proceeded to tell me because of a 'vendor' partner that did not pay them I had to be charged $109 because they did not receive payment. MIND YOU I BOOKED AND RESERVED MY HOTEL ON MONTECARLO.COM.  

100% of this experience was a 1 night nightmare!

Definitely the best bang for the buck, easy location to major strip sights, conveniently to malls and foodcourt.  Interesting pools, spacious casinos, friendly staff abound! Whether you've got kids or seniors or a group on a guy\/gals getaway, this is the one resort in Vegas where I really felt all were welcomed!  I've stayed at Wynn, mandalay, venetian, mgm, flamingo, bellagio and this is my fav mid price resort.  Go to the wynn if you want to splurge but be prepared for the inconvenience of WALKING\/WAITING to get anywhere.

Pros: Love the variety of pools, lazy river has current and wave pool makes a dip quite fun!

Elevators are SO close to everything, if you got kids, are senior or just plain lazy like me, food, pool, casino and exits are all within 50 feet from the elevator.  Wish more resorts were laid out with this convenience in mind.

Rooms were standard for the $100 price range, what do you expect?

Cons: The resort fee has got to go!  Marriott tried it and had to end it!

Reasons why I am AVOIDING this hotel for awhile

Long line to check in due being under staffed, not due to being over crowded at check in.

 Starbucks inside hotel out of cold brew for 3 days straight. Their ice drinks lacked ice

 No pool, it's currently under construction. NO ETA on when it will be finished.

 Construction on pool starts promptly at 6am. Not what I want to hear every morning in Vegas.

If you are into that kind of stuff, this is your hotel. If not, look elsewhere for awhile.

My fiance and I are coming to the end of a seven day, six night stay. We have enjoyed our time here. It's true that the hotel could be updated a bit more, but the customer service is excellent, friendly and knowledgeable. there are a variety of eating options and we've tried almost all the restaurants. They have some great happy hours with delicious food at Brand and Andre's.  We were on the 23rd floor with a nice view, away from the construction, non-smoking, and away from the elevator (which we love as there wasn't much noise).  One big con for me is that there is no free wifi throughout the hotel--I think that could be changed pretty easily. Everything i have seen (our room, common areas) is clean and simple. It's true that it isn't a higher end hotel, but it was just fine for us. I would think about how much time you will spend in the room. We also liked the free tram between Monte Carlo and Bellagio--very useful, especially when your feet are tired!

KID City not SIN City...Short Stay type of Motel Rooms not Hotel Rooms.

The room reserved for me was outdated with stained and dirty chairs, stained carpeting throughout (I couldn't sit or even take off my shoes) peeling walls, no mini fridge, plus I got a view of their HVAC system. They graciously changed my room it was approximately 20 percent better, but I still wouldn't wouldn't sit on the chairs or walk bare foot.

The chaise lounges at the pools are also dirty and stained. You have to climb in it because there is no room on either side of the lounges. They are one on top of the other. The towels at the pool had either yellow stains, holes, shredding at the edges or all of the above.

If you want to relax by the pool or in the jacuzzi is not going to happen. Infants and Children galore. So expect a lot of pee pee going on in the water.

Even though it is modestly priced. It still wasn't worth the money. 

Staff are friendly and professional. 
A serious upgrade is an extreme necessity. 

Gravely DISSATISFIED!!!

What a nightmare of a hotel.  Construction does not seem to stop so bring your ear plugs if you get a room opposite it.  My room is old and dirty.  I found other people's stuff in it.  If you are looking for a cheap room, it's here.  I am only staying here because I am part of a business conference.  I would never come back here if I had a choice.

With the days counting down to the last day of the Monte Carlo, it is appropriate that I pen a review for this mega resort that has given me so many memories. 

  For 19 years the Monte Carlo was the laid back property in the shadow of the High energy NY-NY and MGM Grand. In the heart of Bright Light City it never lit up the pizazz. However, it's laid back atmosphere carried a special aura. 

  The closing of the Monte Carlo coincides with the end of an era. With the pending name change and refurbishment, the days of complimentary parking to spend money at a property is going the name of the Monte Carlo name. But that act of greetiness would be factored into the new resort's review. This is a shame because the pre T-Mobile Arena Monte Carlo parking garage has was the best place to park on the Strip. Parking is as easy as turning off Frank Sinatra Drive onto Park Drive then making two lefts into a well designed garage. In the last couple of years this was my parking garage of choice on the Strip. The best part of parking here was a signalized exit onto Frank Sinatra Drive. 

    After parking my car, there were a few traditions that I enjoyed. After walking along the marble floor of the lobby under the chandeliers I'd sometimes turn right into the ordinary casino following the wall of the Blue Man Theatre to end up at the Monte Carlo Sambalatte to enjoy a cup of coffee. Then sometimes from the lobby, I'd turn left onto the Street of Dreams to enter the attached Aria for a drink in a pub. Regardless of what I did, the Monte Carlo was a gateway to the Strip. 

   After MGM built the City Center, I always considered The Monte Carlo part of the development. It is attached to the Aria which is the heart and soul of City Center. The Street of Dreams retail corridor leads from the lobby and casino to an escalator that transitions into the Aria walkway. The Monte Carlo is to the Aria what Bally's is to Paris, which is a glorified older wing. For the money conscious consumer that is not big on hotel room amenities, the Monte Carlo is a way to enjoy the Aria for less money. The Monte Carlo is also connected to a Monorail to The Bellagio. 

   I have had mixed reactions on the job they do with the theme. The outside of the hotel is interesting minus the pizazz of NY-NY and several Las Vegas Strip icons. Inside, the hotel lobby is where the theme shines. The Street of Dreams is a poor attempt at a Monte Carlo theme. Instead of the ceilings of painted changing skies at competing resorts, the sky of a Monte Carlo street is a black ceiling with exposed pipes. The relatively large casino is an ordinary expanse of indoor space that is more inviting for passing through than stopping to spend time. 

   Over the years I have spent plenty of time inside Monte Carlo. Taking into account that I am a coffee fan, in addition to Sambalatte that opened a year ago, there were fun times at the food court and Street of Dreams Starbuck's. Late at night I'd enjoy relaxing on a comfortable couch in the Street of Dreams Starbuck's before heading to the car. When I was in a beer mood, there were times that I'd venture into the Pub to enjoy a cold one while watching the Dueling Piano players. In the earlier hours, there were times I'd stop in the Monte Carlo Food Court for a quick meal at McDonald's (out of Business), Nathan's (Out of Business), and Sbarro. I was never impressed with the over priced buffet. It was more than food and drink that kept me inside. A few years ago, we saw Lance Burton perform in the theater. In the theater of slot machines and table games, I rarely gambled here. 

   In the 19 years that I knew the Monte Carlo, zero nights were spent in one of their hotel rooms. There really was no reason to; especially after the ridiculous resort fee. I do know that 1) it is a 4 Diamond AAA rated resort and 2) is associated with Hyatt. As a matter of fact there is a rumor that the name is being changed to Hyatt Park Place. 

  With the final curtain closing in on the Monte Carlo, I am left to say goodbye to one more Las Vegas icon. Monte Carlo resort, if I don't get the chance to see you again this review is my way of saying, "Goodbye and thank you for the memories.

Wave pool was the ONLY redeeming quality.

Despite being a relatively newer building, we were amazed at how poorly maintained the rooms are (mold, paint peeling, loose caulking, etc).
 
But what really was an absolute rip off was the $22 per day "resort fee".   Here is what that unwarranted fee entails: "Fitness center access Internet access (may be limited) Newspaper Phone calls (may be limited) Faxes In-room coffee In-room bottled water Additional inclusions".

Since we did not use any of those listed, we should not have been charged the ridiculous fee.

Next time in Vegas we will be staying ANYWHERE else.

Monte Carlo gets 5 stars for several reasons. I've stayed at several hotels now in Vegas and I've enjoyed most. I enjoyed Monte Carlo because of how of everything I actually did while I stayed at the hotel. The pool was great, I usually don't go to the pools in Vegas. This one had a lazy boy if you want to just relax while the water pushes you. A relaxing jacuzzi. I'm not much of a gambler either I usually go to Vegas to party and enjoy the clubs and the strip. But the casino was great too. I had a good time playing. One thing I didn't know was that you have to pay for parking now, I think it's at all MGM hotels now but I'm not 100% sure. I did love that as soon as we parked the car in the parking lot all we did was walk over the bridge and the lobby to check in was right there. Most hotels you have to walk a mile to get there. I forgot to mention that the room prices are very affordable and reasonable so that's always a plus! Two thumbs up!

I love it when you get to check in at VIP and then get into your room and there are DIRTY wash cloths left hanging in the shower. Call housekeeping and all they say is that they will tell the housekeeping supervisor.  The carpet in the hallways were all bunched up and it and the rooms needed to be updated.  Then they hang up.  Nice. Not.  We paid for a high floor strip view.  When we reached our room it over looked the freeway and construction.  We called the front desk and was told by a young man that they did not guarantee rooms with views and that they did not have any left.  I told him that we paid for it and then I would like some of the charges taken off then seeing a room with a strip view cost more.  He said he would not do that.  We asked to be transferred to VIP lounge and he said they would not be able to do anything either.  We insisted that he transfer us and he finally did.  We explained to the young lady what had happen and what do you know we are being moved to another room, this time it is with a partial view of the strip and construction.WOW!!!  Then we decided to head to Diablos for some drinks.  They had plenty of open tables on the patio, but no where to sit at the bar.  So we decided to sit at a table.  We were told that we could not sit there if we did not eat dinner.  So we left.  Went to Ignite Bar in the Monte Carlo Casino and while we were playing video poker we ordered 4 Jager Bombs for our birthdays.  We drank them and then they told us it was $60.00.  Oh, I thought drinks were comp while playing games.  Guess not.  Then we were being snubbed by the bartenders the rest of the night.  We spoke with the bar manager and hotel manager.  Nothing was really done.  The bar manager gave us a free drink at a different bar.  That was nice of him.  When we checked out of the casino we wanted a copy of our bill so we went back to VIP lounge and we were told (very rudely) that we need to stand in line outside with the other people.  This is for invited guest only, but since we were there they would check us out.  Really????  Invited guest????  They do not pay for anything, and we are paying and you treat and talk to us like that?  Well needless to say, I will never stay nor recommend this MOTEL every again.  The only people there that were nice was the bellmen and the valets.  We tried to make the best of it.  While speaking to the management it was oh well what do you want us to do kind of attitude.  I felt like they really wanted us to get out.  Hopefully someone at the MGM resorts will read this and do something or contact us seeing the Monte Carlo really could careless.
My sister and I stayed here for three nights. We had a great experience at this hotel and casino. I gave it a four because our room was super basic with a view of a out of commission pool.
Love the Monte Carlo! It's always been clean every time I have stayed here! The staff is all professional and the renovation is coming along beautifully!

On my annual trip to Vegas, I decided to stay at the Monte. Dont get me wrong, its a nice hotel for the price (3 stars normally). +1 star for being next to the city center +1 star for the location on the strip +1 star for the overall appearance of the hotel. -1 star however for the BLOOD STAINS ON MY BED. Ok Ok, let me explain. We check in early, and the front desk tells us our room is ready. We go upstairs all of a sudden we experience a real CSI las vegas, except the murder weapon was most likely a tampax. Definately gross, called the front desk and asked for it to be made up ASAP. It wasnt made until 3PM that afternoon! Otherwise, OK hotel for the price... casino floor is kind of boring, and a little plain jane overall. 3 stars minus one for bloody sheets.

Stayed here for our wedding over the weekend. Took FOREVER to check in. Was told we had a "special room set aside for us". Was the exact room we had paid for. Decor is all over the place and tacky. Absolutely no storage in the room for anything. The size of the casino is a joke compared to neighboring hotels, which I gave them the benefit of the doubt because of construction. 

But the room is odd. Decor is odd. Our tv never worked right, kept stuttering and freezing during shows and movies we paid to rent. If you have ANY other options for hotels I recommend choosing anything but Monte Carlo.

worst hotel ever!!!!!! dirty rooms and bathrooms. found a broom with nasty panties on it. stuffed behind my bed. got moved to 3 rooms i want to give negative stars! each room was still dirty, there was hair and stains on the beds. I was highly disappointed with this hotel. The only good thing we got out of it was the nice manager who's name I will not mention, bought us dinner and extended our stay till our flight

Stayed here during New Years.  Besides the price, our experience was positive overall.  

Check in was pretty quick - we got there before the rush (about 10:30 AM).  Valet was pretty efficient.  Bell service was fine.  The place was clean.  Awesome spot on the strip to watch fireworks at midnight during New Years.  I also liked the fact that there were fast food restaurants inside the casino - I like having this option after a hard night of partying.

I have stayed here twice now and both times the rooms were very comfortable.  Last year, there was construction going on so quite noisy, but the room was nice and the view was great so it wasn't to much of a bother.  This time we chose a lower floor with no view, but it was a suite this time.  Definitely spacious on all accounts.  I love the location and for Vegas, it was a pretty quiet hotel.  We will be staying here again!

Supposedly this hotel is a 4 start but there is nothing 4 star about it. I would have to say their customer service in front desk is probably by far the worst. I was checking in four nights got in very late as I pull up to the valet The valet guy or manager starts walking very fast towards our vehicle and tells me that there is no parking here for my vehicle because I have a trailer and told me to go to a another hotel and park it there and walk back I'm like WHAT???? So I decided to go back inside the hotel asked the front desk lady if I can talk to a manager she asked me for what was no help very rude and looked at me very very awkwardly. It was my mistake by booking the room here I would've paid an extra $200 a night for better service . I thought Valy was to be free in Las Vegas but I feel like the manager of their valet pulled a fast one and charges $50 for one night. Honestly this is the worst hotel experience anyone can have so I highly recommend book your room elsewhere you get abd the rooms are very old cracked wallpaper in the bathroom really really sad for hotel with very VERY bad customer service !!!!!

My last 2 years of visits to Las Vegas this has been my go-to place to stay for the price, the life style and the crowd

You get a good mix here of younger people, families and older people as well - the casino floor is easy to navigate - not too large but not too small 

I always seem to win here - so one of the main reason why I like to stay here 

The pool is great durning summer time - and these guys throw a great pool party on the weekend during the summer season 

I usually stay in a pretty basic room - I'm in vegas for the fun not for the room so it works out well being center strip. Parking here is usually pretty easy to figure out as well with the multi-tierd parking garage in the back of the hotel. The food court is open at all hours as well - which is a big plus if you are out all night and want something to eat at 3am before bed 

This really is the place to stay with its location, pricing, and all around offerings -- one thing to note BECOME AND "M LIFE" MEMBER  and get one of the players club cards that work at multiple casinos in the area, take advantage of the room deals and other offerings.

I'm not crazy about casinos to begin with, let that be said. I found everything here to be fine, not great, not bad...just fine. For $107 a night, its a great location. It has a indoor pathway to the Aria and City Center next door, so you'll never run out of things to keep you busy. I can't speak to the tables or shows, but the restaurants are above average.

Waited 45 min at 9pm. Seriously? Why is there 4 front desk agents and a manager standing around and not getting rid of a line of about 30 people. This is a joke. Spending money for this. Rather go to another hotel. Horrible service!!! Don't waste your time
The new renovated rooms were nice. The tram was convenient. Would still prefer Wynn or Venetian.

You get what you pay for. 

The good things about this place is that its close to the middle of the strip with access to the city center, crystal shops, Aria, and Belligio through the tram. The hotel was cheap and the lobby is nice. 

Now the bad things: 

- The walls are extremely thin so you could hear every conversation, every toilet flush, every shower, and every door being opened and closed. They were so thin that you could hear your neighbor having SEX! Very disturbing!!
- Housekeeping is horrible: we had five pillow and all but one had a stain. Even the comforter had a stain. 
-The bathroom, most of the furniture, bed, and television were outdated or old and need replacing.
- There was no coffee maker. Why provide free coffee when you can charge $3.75 for a Starbucks coffee downstairs. 
- No mini bar
-The smell of so called rose petals smells good at first, but soon gets overwhelming and give you a headache. 

If you are looking for cheap stay in Las Vegas then this is your place. If you are looking for more comfort then I recommend somewhere else.

Monte-CarNO! This is the most profoundly horrendous hotel experience I've ever had. Like the big turd this place is it started small and just grew in girth and un-pleasantness as the trip continued. When I first arrived in the evening my only desire was to shower; there were zero towels, which took almost 45 min to have the front desk send. Then the lights in the bathroom went out, I looked for another light switch thinking surely these fluorescent bulbs are operational but they weren't. Then after taking a darken shower I wanted to go to bed and discovered a dark brownish poop like stain on the sheets, the part that goes near my face. See pictures. Throughout the night I woke up covered in sweat as I learned the A\/C wasn't working. How you can have a non-working AC in a hotel located in desert is a mystery to me. 

Finally I called the front desk (after being on hold for about 15 min) and was transferred rooms, doubling down on my luck hoping that the next room would be better or at least conform to motel 6 standards. Rolled these dice and it came up 7. The next room also had a non-functioning A\/C but it gets better, early in the morning I woke up to the sound of heavy drilling. At first I thought it was the construction on the closed down pool, that's right they closed the entire pool area down the entire trip but charged me the same and didn't discount my room 1 cent for the totally absent pool area.  This room had a couch with giant stains that all told a romantic sticky story. When I had friends over they went to flip the cushions so they could sit while we got ready but what we found were even more stains that in fear of un-wanted pregnancies none of us sat on. 

When I brought this to the attention of the hotel staff they said "What do you want me to do about it?" Keep in mind this hotel is not cheap, the rates are comparable to other much better hotels in the area but offers not even half of what the others do like caesars palace and the Bellagio. The monte carlo is called that but it lacks any kind of theme, the casino is filled with quiet patrons none of which I saw win a thing at any of their tight money incinerator slots. For those of you reading this considering staying here; DON'T! There are plenty of other nice hotel and casinos in the area that have actual themes and rooms with something more than the monte carlo's tacky colorful tiles glued on the dimly light bathroom walls. To call this place a hotel is wrong, its more like a temporary lodging factory where guests are just numbers and treated as such.  Don't gamble with this hotel whatever deal you think your getting the house is going win here and you will lose.

This hotel is one I'll never stay at again!  First off I got a non smoking room and I reserved a smoking room. The blinds in our suit didn't go up and down they were broken, making it very hard to sleep with all the light pouring in.  Our shower didn't drain, we were standing in 3 inches of water.  We had a do not disturb on our door only to come back to the room and find a cleaning lady in there!  Then it's time to check out, and the express check out tells me I am already checked out.  I go to the desk to find out I am not checked out.  None of the staff at this hotel is friendly or helpful.  It's almost like they don't want to help you. When I complained about the state of the room when checking out it's like they didn't care.   Nor did they take money off! 

  The rooms are dirty and the suites are not really suites.  They are really just big rooms.  The furniture needs a good updating.  For the price of a monti carlo suite you can stay at the ventian.  

I also don't think all the rooms have wifi!  Which is nuts in this day and age.  I lucked out and my room was picking up a signal!

Not a great experience. I was expecting a lot since it was an MGM hotel and loved my stay there a few months ago. The shower was full of mildew and very gross. The shower head was horrible and sprayed water everywhere, no matter how much you tried to close the curtains the bathroom floor would flood. We were given 1 bar of soap to share between the shower and sink (ew!) and a broken hair dryer. Not enough pillows in the room and the beds are horrible to share because they sink in the middle. 

I am extremely disappointed with the how gross the room was and how outdated and broken down the beds and furniture is. I would never stay here again even if it was free.

4 days stay last week before the big fight

hotel is ok, rooms was big

pools were nice

restaurants were good

hotel - seems a little old (rugs and decor) not so new and feels old

staff very good

my big complaint is not their fault  (I guess) - hotel smells of smoke and deodorant\/cologne\/perfume.  I didnt go to Vegas to gamble or drink (visited a sick friend) - my complaint is nothing is non smoking - really stinks all over the strip inside - inside casinos is almost unbearable with the smoke

I asked concierge and they mentioned there is a non smoking casino off the strip, if I ever go back - I will stay there


also the walls were very thin - I could hear normal conversations from room next door

hot water was luke warm all week in the shower

This was about the 5th time I stayed here. Had a  spa suite. I love the place. It is slightly dated, but the staff is excellent. The beds are very comfortable. It is easy to Navigate around. The rates are reasonable. You can find inexpensive tables to play on. 

Checked on comps prior to leaving. Already had the Suite comped and they still took off everything else on the bill. I would definitely stay here again. It may not be 5 star or have the luxury of the Wynn or Venetian, but it is a nice property.

If I had to stay here again, I would. Especially if you're on a budget. I was in Las Vegas for business and we stayed here Tues - Fri. I thought the Monte Carlo was great place for a basic room!

GOOD:
+ Bed was comfortable
+ Food court had McDonalds WITH a $1 menu. I stayed away but I thought this was unheard of in Las Vegas!
+ 24 hours subway
+ Close proximity to CVS & Walgreens (next door!)
+ Great Bell Desk people! I lost my luggage ticket and they were sweet about it

BAD:
- The main light next to my bed didn't work
- The water took forever to drain in the shower (had to stand in there while I showered!)
- TV volume was acting crraazy (either too loud or too quiet)
- Only extended my late checkout by 1 hour : (

Good place for a budget stay, especially if you're on this end of the strip!

There are two advantages to the Monte Carlo:

1) It has a tram which will connect you to nicer hotels

2) Their food court has a Rubio's and a Starbucks.

Other than that, it is at the same level as Excalibur, Luxor, and Harrah's. Hotwire classifies this hotel as a 4 star, which is NOT accurate. It is definitely a 3 star. Their gym and spa is decent, but it's not that nice. Also, another reviewer accurately described this hotel as smelling "like burning hand lotion." The newer casinos have better ventilation so they don't have to have that overpowering smell, but the Monte Carlo tries to cover it up with an extremely intense potpourri scent. 

If you get a good deal, stay here...it's close enough to many amenities center strip, but if the price difference between staying here and say, Paris is just a few dollars, I would go for the pricier option.

This place is decent. Good price for the strip and it's a non-nightmare. All in all a good experience. Not stellar but definitely good at least. The casinos and bars inside were good. I am a big fan of the pub and the Zowie Bowie show.

This place is nice for the price. The rates are good if you can go during the week.  I was aware of the resort fee because you are told about this in writing when you reserve online.  Also the resort fee is for each full day you stay so you don't pay the fee on the day you check in or out.  Check in was slow and there were only about three people in each line.  I had a free all day buffet pass as part of my reservation. I didn't like the food so I barely ate anything.  The room and beds are comfortable. 

 The pool was nice and we grabbed a partial shaded spot because it get's blistering hot during summer.  I recommend this even if you aren't right next to the pool.  The server brought drinks we ordered and I was irritated that once the pool started picking up she never came over again to offer an order even though I tipped her really well and it wasn't ever packed at all. Then when I went to get a mojito at the bar, the bartender was rude too. Don't take your dead end job out on me dude!

The Diablo restaurant at Monte Carlo was a shame. They didn't seem to have air conditioning and it was horribly hot. I ordered a $20 quesadilla and it looked and tasted like something I would make for my kids in the microwave.  The service wasn't that great either and the wait was pitifully long.  I guess the Diablo restaurant wants to make you feel like you're in hell...pun intended? I wouldn't recommend eating here EVER! 

I will say though,  Monte Carlo is in a nice location on the strip and there are bridges and walkways to the neighboring casinos.  I would stay here again.  Sign up for their email offers and you will get special offers for all of the MGM casino and resorts.

Moderately priced. Located at the South end of the Strip. Pool area is nice, but was dirty and crowded (food wrappers in the pool). Rooms had a good view, but poor soundproofing, no wifi, and no fridge (unless you upgrade to the deluxe rooms).

During our stay at Monte Carlo hotel, we have encountered the following issues:

When rinsing our hands and brushing our teeth we notice the sink in the bathroom would take a while for the water to go down the drain. Aside that it smelled horribly we had to wait a while for the water to go down and drain and for either of us would use it again. We then left Monte Carlo hotel at 6:05am on April 28, 2016 to go to the Grand Canyon. We returned to the hotel at approximately 10:30pm the same day April 28, 2016.  We stopped by our room to pick up our car keys to go to dinner. We noticed our hotel room's bathtub had a drained problem since it was clogged and had a water overflow so we called Housekeeping from our hotel room. The Housekeeping transferred our call to Engineering, and I was told that they would come into our room while we went to dinner to repair the overflow, drain clogged, water in our bathtub and bathroom sink. Apparently, when we returned to our hotel room at approximately around 2:30am on Friday the problem with water flow and clogged bathtub was not fixed. Also during our return to the hotel at 2:30am on Friday, April 29, 2016, we realized we were missing my sisters Kunnika Junnumsub's Invisalign braces. 
We then called the front desk immediately from our hotel room to report a lost\/stolen report for Kunnika's Invisalign braces. Within 30 minutes a gentleman named Billy knocked on our hotel room and introduced himself, he mentioned he works for the Lost\/Stolen department. Billy asked us questions, we answered and also described to him that before we left our hotel room, on April 28, 2016 Kunnika had placed her Invisalign braces on top of the brown ice bucket which was located inside the bathroom, on the sink counter. However, as soon as we entered our restroom getting ready for bed, we realized that Kunnika's Invisalign braces were missing. After, Billy had us fill out a form called "Voluntary Statement' in which Kunnika had signed her name. Billy mentioned that the Risk management will contact us within a few days. However, as of today, May 8, 2016, the Risk management department at Monte Carlo hotel has not reached out to myself, or Kunnika. So, on Friday, April 29, 2016 around 4 am we went to sleep, and at approximately 10:30am on April 29, 2016, there were two gentlemen banging on our hotel room door which woke us up. As we ran toward the door to open our hotel room to see who it was, suddenly my hotel room door was opened by these 2 gentlemen who introduced themselves as the Room Maintenance\/Engineering staff to come fix the bathtub over flow water and tub clogged. The hotel management can verify my statement by checking to see that the Hotel Engineer inserted his employee keycard into our hotel room. We were very surprised with the action of the Monte Carlo hotel engineers and we also were scared since we did not expect someone to open our hotel room while we were sleeping. My sister Kunnika and I were still in our Pajamas. Not to mention the Air conditioner was very noisy which caused us unable to fall asleep. We did request a quiet room and privacy when we checked in the front desk. We believe we spoke to Gina. However, she gave us a connecting room and we felt it was scary and unsafe. 
 
When we checked out at Monte Carlo on Friday, April 29, 2016 afternoon, we spoke to Amanda and expressed our concerns while staying at Monte Carlo hotel. Amanda suggested us to write Comments card which it will escalate to the highest management at Monte Carlo so management can help us to resolve our concerns.
 
We also spoke to Reina, the housekeeper at Monte Carlo hotel on Fri 4\/29\/16 at 1pm, we asked her to check with the person who cleaned our room on Thursday 4\/28\/16 and we let Reina know that Kunnika's Invisalign braces was missing when we returned to our hotel that day.
 
Kunnika's Braces clear Invisalign estimated $5,700 USD which she paid out of her pocket which it was missing when return the hotel on April 29, 2016. Now she is in pain for not having the correct size of braces to wear nightly, and her teeth start to shift around which cause her migraine headaches, and she is unable to sleep.  Due to this issue, Kunnika is unable to work and perform her daily activities. 

This was an unpleasant experience staying at Monte Carlo hotel with it being our first time staying at the Monte Carlo hotel and Casino and will be the last time. I will also, mention my unpleasant experience to all my family and friends so they never book a day at this hotel. 

We have been waiting weeks, to hear from the Risk management which never reached out to us. Billy who came up to our hotel room and wrote the report promised us Risk management will reach out to us on Monday, May 2, 2016.

The Director of Risk Managementment TRAVIS MIZER has mention that they are not responsible for any items outside the safety box. Which by the way these are braces which should have not been thrown or taken away.

Talk about rude and presumptuous. My daughter has arthritis and one of the security staff made a comment she is too old to be in a "stroller". It's not a stroller it's a mobility chair for youth. She was so insensitive. This hotel\/casino needs to do some sensitivity training. We actually stopped to share the fact that my daughter has arthritis and its not a stroller. She looked and walked on. No apology, no acknowledgement.

So disappointed with this hotel and thier staff.  Ive played many hours of poker throughout the years and spent plenty of money on rooms, shows and restaurants.  Ice recently returned to play in the poker room that is about to close for good. Ive spent lots of time at mgm properties playing poker recently and throught the years. I recently was upgraded at monte carlo sister property to pearl which I certainly deserve.  This card had me feel great as I now would be able to park for free as a local.  Ive spent over $100 on parking this year and its very frustrating.   So I go to monte carlo mgm players card desk to get a copy my card when the girl behind the counter besides to look at me funny and say who gave you this card? I told her I learned it from playing poker throughout MGM properties and she told me to hold on and she went in the back to get her boss. The boss comes out and tells me he doesn't see any activity of me playing or getting any tier points. I advised him I am not a slot player but I play a lot of Poker throughout the city almost on a daily basis. The girl behind the counter and her Superior made me feel like I'm a bum off the street which I did not appreciate. I had advised them I do play a lot of play Slots and they made it seem as if you need to play Slots to qualify for anything in this town. This is ridiculous and I am definitely considering boycotting MGM properties based on the Prejudice of poker players whom I'm sure the casino enjoys as they take the rake and as a player do not mind paying as long as we feel appreciated at least a little bit to get some free parking at minimal. I've been a diamond card member at Harrah's properties a gold member at Venetian a platinum member at cosmopolitan in the past has I used to play this all the time. Now I don't play as often as I have a working job that I work 40 hours a week and don't have as much time. I'm really disappointed and very upset still. Customer service goes a long way and I felt none towards my way

Mixed feelings on this one..there were a lot of pros and a lot of cons of this hotel.

Pros:
Ease of parking: The parking lot is located right next to the lobby. You won't have to drag your luggage through miles and miles of casinos to check in.

Ease of getting to your room:  After check in, you walk a few feet and end up at the room elevators. It was super convienent. 

Food court:  There is a Starbucks just steps from the elevators so you can stumble down there for your morning cup of wake the hell up.

Friendly staff: The house keepers asked if we needed new towels or the room cleaned, the front desk helped out with a billing issue.

Pool: They have three different pools and tons of seating. We went down on a busy Saturday and were still able to find a recliner in the sun. We did the lazy river ( you can rent a tube) and then moved over to the wave pool which was way more fun. They had beach balls being tossed around, pumped up music and tons people having a great time.

Cons:

Old rooms: The rooms could use some serious updatng. The beds were pretty dated, plan on waking up with a sore back. The carpets and chairs had staining. There isn't a convient plug anywhere in the room itself.

Room cleanliness: When walked into our room we couldn't get a light to work, bulbs burned out. The bathroom has no fan so you get no privacy and if you take a hot shower....prepare to suffocate. The shower tile was cracked and could have used some grout cleaning. There were hairs on the floor that didn't belong to us. The little table between the beds had the previous guest's tickets from a show. Makes you wonder if they really cleaned anything.

The hotel is rather outdated but the gambling environment is not bad.  The dealers are friendly and the high limit area is quite tasteful.  I cant complain about my gambling experience here but I will say that if you are going to play blackjack, bring lots of $$$ cuz the only game worth playing is @ the $100 minimum table in the high limit area.  All the other BJ tables have crappy rules or pay 6:5...boo!

Checked in New Year's Day to a "Diamond" suite!! Nothing about the room was "Diamond"!!! The furniture was missing chunks of the headboard, missing fabric off the chairs and couches!!! A razor blade left on the counter resin and all!! The floors were not vacuumed ex: dirty band aids bottle caps, wrappers on the floor!! Closet door was broken off the rails!!! They charge you resort fees for Internet and idk what else but the internet is so poor you are forced to use your data on your laptop\/phone!! Lobby is very deceiving!! The rooms are NASTY!!!

Monte Carlo is only 3 stars in my book.

Upon arriving early for check-in, I went to the restroom first. Marble floors do not mesh well with drips of water. I slipped almost completing a full split! It is not safe at all. They need to keep a watch for that before someone can get seriously injured. We get to our assigned room only to find a family just come out of the room. Honestly, after sitting in a car for 4 hours...do you think anyone needs to deal with this crap? It was ridiculous and inconvenient. Poor management. Finally, when we get to the next room, all I can say was it was A-OK. Old decor, strange patches of cardboard on the walls, and no ventilation in the bathroom. Really not fancy at all. Positive note, excellent air conditioner. 

Service was slow when requesting for extra pillows and towels. It took about an hour later to get what I needed. The free wifi (technically you are paying for in the hotel fees) is as slow as dial up connection. 

The pool as expected was extremely crowded. After getting settled, enjoy the lazy river or wave pool. It helped relieve the heat in the crazy HOT weather. Free towels. There are tubes to rent out, drinks to buy, food to eat, etc. 


Overall, Monte Carlo needs some renovating in the rooms. Service could be better. 


p.s. Room service is quite pricey!

Monte Carlo, why did I choose to stay here?  Must be that it is located right in the middle of the strip, next to Aria and the City Center.  This used to be my wife's favorite hotel in Las Vegas.  Don't ask me why because I honestly don't know.  With many newer and older but better establishments on the strip, there's really no reason to choose Monte Carlo unless you already knew that...

the POOL has a lazy river!  It's not as long as the ones you might find at MGM, but it is sufficient enough to relax and take a moment away from the busy casino noise.  You can also rental a tube as floating device at the service counter.  But really, that's all the highlights of this hotel, unless you enjoy...

CHEAP FOOD COURT adjacent to the main elevators.  If I remember correctly, they have Starbucks, McDonald's, Manchu Wok, Rubio's, and Subway.  These are some of the choices that you might not find in other hotels on the strip.  Of course, if you want to drop a few hundred dollars, you can do at the casino, unless you knew to...

go to ANDRE'S, the fine dinning restaurant of Monte Carlo.  I have not personally tried it, but according to fellow yelpers, it's a traditional french restaurant that's hidden away inside the casino.  When food coma hits, you might just want to passed out anywhere on the casino floor, unless you already have a...

ROOM at the Monte Carlo, which is nothing spectacular, nothing more a than regular hotel room with regular beds, chairs, and bathroom.  Very regular, but adequate for your nap until the thin walls allow you to hear everything your neighbors do.  That's when you ask yourself, why did I choose...

Monte Carlo.  Must be its centralized location on the strip.

Loved this hotel. The entrance isn't on the strip, but it's close enough that you can't miss it. 

I've stayed here twice now and have never had any issues. It's super clean, nice staff and great rates. You really can't go wrong! If you want something nice, but you don't want to break the bank and you still want to be on the strip, this is definitely a hotel to check out.

We stayed here for 4 nights on our most recent trip to Vegas. It was a decent price for the location on the strip. Not as far south as New York, NY but definitely not central either. We probably did spend a pretty penny on cab rides to other hotels for the pool parties and night clubs. 

The hotel wasn't able to give us connecting rooms our first night there but did accommodate us the remaining 3 nights so that was nice of them. We did pay for the rooms on higher floors which we got but the view was terrible. We stared basically at the construction site next door to the hotel. NOT IMPRESSED. The hotel itself is lacking in its food options. They had a starbucks, Mcdonalds, Subways and a few other 24 hour dining options on the ground floor. I did appreciate the CVS that was pretty much right next door so we could load up on water and snacks. It does stink that there is no fridge in the room- though I told you could rent one. 

If you want an inexpensive option, this is definitely it but if I come back to Vegas I'd definitely stay at a nicer hotel.

This hotel is dirty and not what you would expect for the price and location! 

My boyfriend booked this hotel on hotels.com for a fairly decent price for two nights...just under 400...which wasn't too bad for a tues\/wed stay...everything else was booked so we didn't have much of a choice. But from the second we checked in it was nothing but a downhill slope. When we checked in the front desk attendant charged us another $200 for resort fees and for the specified room with a king bed? Which wouldn't be so bad if we were paying for the luxury, but I have stayed in Motel 6's in the middle of Iowa that are nicer than this hotel. 

As soon as we got to our room...which ended up to be around 600 for 2 nights instead of the 400 we had agreed to pay :( The FIRST room we checked into had broken tiles in the bathroom that my boyfriend had to sweep to a corner so we wouldn't step on them and cut our feet, and the shower head was busted. There was also no mini fridge? Strange for a Vegas hotel for this price?

After speaking to the front desk they moved us to another room...and promised to bring up a portable mini fridge. It was the same exact room...but with 2 queen beds instead of one King...just down the hall. After waiting for almost 30 minutes for them to bring us new room keys, we were on our way to our "new" room. When we arrived the portable fridge was not there and we had to call to again to remind them to bring the fridge up to us. Another 30 minutes passed before our HOT fridge was brought up to us. We plugged it in and had to wait overnight for it to become cool. 

To make matters worse when i called to ask for the pool hours i was informed there is no pool, but we have "free" access to the MGM or Mandalay Bay. (what do the resort fees cover then if there is no pool here?) The MGM is about a half mile walk (about 10 min), while the Mandalay is much further (about a 25 min walk). I have never been to a hotel with NO POOL and NO MINI FRIDGE in the room!

They also charge $13\/day for parking, last time we stayed at the Mandalay and it was free with our stay. They seem to be big fans off hidden\/added fees.

Very disappointed in the standard of this hotel, clearly needs some TLC. 

I will say this though, the customer service\/front desk staff tried to help, but  at the end of it all the overall experience was less than satisfactory. 

Will never return :(

Terrible customer service and dirty rooms. Key lock broke and they caused us to miss dinner reservation because they refused to fix timely. Then room had open hot sauce in desk when we checked into it. Shower head was broke and to top it off had a bug crawling in bed. Pick somewhere else to stay for sure!

We just returned from a long weekend in Las Vegas and our hotel of choice was the Monte Carlo.  Overall, not a bad choice given the deal that we purchased through Hawaiian airlines (room was less than $100 a night and came with a $60\/day credit to be used for food). The Buffet isn't the best eating establishment by a long shot, BUT it is free with the stay. I had to keep reminding myself of this fact when some of the food on the bar literally looked inedible.  

The room was quite comfortable, although quite dated.  Even though we had requested a room with a king-sized bed, a room with two queen beds was available for early check in at 9am at NO additional cost (the King was NOT)...... sign me up for two queen beds please.

The beds were great and my wife especially loved the pillows (would love to find out where one can buy these).

There's a thermostat in the room so adjusting the temperature to a more comfortable level was extremely easy.

The shower was good, yet the water (to me) didn't quite get hot enough, but my wife was happy with its temperature. 

Very quiet considering the age of the hotel and the number of guests it accommodates.

The Casino itself was VERY small in comparison to other casinos throughout the strip.  Limited gaming tables with manageable limits.  The Paigow tables were rarely below a $25 per hand minimum and there was a very noticeable lack of other gaming options for the frugal gambler.  Hell, it might have just been because it was the weekend.

There were two (2) Starbucks in the hotel, one right outside of the room elevators, and the second in the mall on the way to the tram station. 

The tram station is a great convenience if you want to go to the Bellagio, Aria, Crystals or The Vdara hotels.  

SUPER SMOKY !!!! This is to be expected in older hotel\/casinos that don't have updated ventilation systems.  Surprisingly, there ARE seven (7) hotels in Vegas that are smoke-free.

Overall, it's great option if you're looking for a moderately priced hotel on the strip.

There is the option of mobile check-in, so try this option, as it will save you some time. And an express checkout, which is a must, as the checkout line at the front desk, can get really long and 

The rooms are really nice, with comfortable beds. Plus it comes with a safe and a flat screen TV. The bathroom is nice and clean as well. Everything that I would expect from a casino on the strip. 

There is a good buffet on the casino floor, as well as a food court. So there are good eating options, without having to step outside, if you need to get something to eat. And of course, if you want to gamble, there are plenty of options there, as expected in any casino in Las Vegas.

While it does not really stand out, compared to other casinos, in terms of architecture or attractions, I think it does have one of the best locations on the Strip. So in either direction, it is not too far of a walk, or bus ride to get to the other casinos, if wanting to check out the attractions or shows at those places.

If wanting to stay in a casino without having to spend over $100 a night, then this place should definitely be it. The very convenient location is a huge bonus, at more affordable prices. 

I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo because we wanted to be on the strip but didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. The Monte Carlo is a very nice place- its just a little bland compared to other places I've stayed on the strip. 
Our hotel room was the average hotel room- really comfortable bed, nice bathroom. We payed $159 for a Sat night and $89 for Sunday. 
I did get to go to the pool and really liked the lazy river- but the pool area was too small for all of the moms and kids that were over crowding the place. 
The main downfall for me is the location- it takes too long to get down to the casinos I prefer like Mirage, Venetian and Harrahs.

Decent value, older style room with no extras.  Bed and bathroom were good.  The pool was nice (two of them one was a wave pool)  I like the river channel concept. Would stay again if the hotel was part of a package.
