We chose the wrong time to stay here, hotel is currently in remodeling stage so their pool is closed. Be prepared to stand in line for hour to check in, and another long wait to check out. Hotel is Understaff, housekeeping needs more training. Won't come be back

Got this hotel on a package deal with Southwest Airlines... hotel overall is dirty and dingy.  Would rush my showers just to get out of there.  The toilet made a crazy noise whenever we flushed it, it was kind of scary...  

The check in line was always long... At first they told me the wrong room number, went up to the 24th floor and tried my key, wouldn't work... went all the way back downstairs and they gave me the correct room number...

Needs renovations to keep up with the nicer hotels on the strip.  Buffet breakfast was just so-so, would not eat there again even if it was free.  

Would consider staying at this hotel again only if it was free...

For some reason a lot of people grade this place on the same level as Circus Circus, Excalibur and Luxor. But, it is definitely nicer than than that. I think it is between NY\/NY and Planet Hollywood in the Mid tier strip locations. I like the way the casino floor is laid out and the back area shopping and eating. I hate the sportsbook here and buffet. The parking is also difficult here but, this is more about location.

In regards to check in, the line was long for checking in on a Tuesday evening but Andres was great.  He was very personable and pleasant to deal with.

In room wifi sucks!  We had three laptops two tablets and two phones after calling tech support we were finally able to get a laptop connect but it never was acceptable and worked better poolside than it did in the room.  

If you are going to the pool, heads up that you must show your room key to the security guard and outside food and drinks are not allowed.
Nothing great about this place. Pool location relative to the buildings and sun make for too much shade. Room quality was poor. Won't be back.

This place is a disaster, which is disappointing considering how great of a reputation it has. We requested a non-smoking room but were sent to a smoking floor. The smell of smoke hit us like a heat wave when we opened the door to the room, so we requested a room change. Our keys were reprogrammed over the phone so we didn't have the hassle of going down to the front desk or waiting for a bell boy, which was nice.

The next room was non-smoking, but the beds were disheveled and the sheets were stained. We complained to the front desk and an hour later, housekeeping came to redo the beds. The housekeeper told us straight up that all of the sheets she had were stained but she would do her best to put the cleanest sheets on the bottom layer where we'd be sleeping.

The gum in the trashcan was really the last straw, so we checked out immediately. The hotel staff is great and handled everything as well as they could, so they deserve a lot of credit. I felt bad for them actually because I'm sure they receive a lot of complaints like ours and can only do so much. It's not like the housekeeper could have given us unstained linens if the hotel doesn't provide her with any to use.

The Super 8 I stayed at once was much nicer than this. Very disappointing from start to finish and I will never go back.

Seriously?! Coming here wishing to have a good time with my family. Checked in and got our room pretty fast. However, we found trash in our drawer, which let us down a little. But we decided to clean up ourselves, because we understand how many rooms house keepers may need to clean every single day. We rested up and went to a show at night. Came back at midnight after spending good times with family, all we wanted to do is rest and be ready for another fun day tomorrow. Only found out that there was an rotten banana in our ice bucket when we were about to go get ice. Disgusting! I decided to go downstair and informed them the situation. They said they could only send a house keeper to our room to clean, or change me to a lower floor room with no view (the original room I had is the room with good stripe view). Now, why would I pay the same amount of money to downgrade my room only because I want a clean room? But shouldn't you guys make sure all rooms are clean before you let your customers come in? It made me feel like you did not even clean your room. I was tired and I just wanted to rest, so I just said I would like to change to a clean room tomorrow and I would just throw away the banana and trash myself for tonight. However, this two incidents made me wonder that if you really change the bedsheets or just simply tuck it in after the last visitors check out. Huge disappointment. I do not know what to say. Monte Carlo, you officially ruined my mood for this last vacation that I got to spent with my family before school starts.

Would not recommend this hotel at all - top sheet which served as the outer blanket\/layer on the beds had smalls stains which the staff insisted were "rust" stains (?? why they would let us discover them as soon as we set foot in the room is beyond me even if it was rust!) and 2 in our group of 4 came home with small, itchy bites on our arms, legs and back. NOT okay! 

The front desk and bell staff were very helpful and professional, but the manager with whom we spoke at checkout about our concerns was very rude and made no effort (other than comping our $20 resort fee) to reassure or convince us that we shouldn't think twice about spreading the word that this place should NOT be your hotel of choice in Vegas.

I've stayed in inexpensive hotels in Vegas but have never walked away with bug bites or a feeling of disgust that the hotel staff could care less about the guest experience outside of the lobby and restaurants.

Also...what kind of large hotel only offers an ethernet cable and no wifi? Laaaaammmme

I've stayed at the Monte Carlo 4 times now.  I like the location.  I like that for the strip, you can usually get a $10 blackjack table and I've even seen $5 on off hours.  The pool area is good with a wave pool and a lazy river.  Restaurants not so much, but you can go elsewhere to eat, and I find that the best restaurants are off the strip anyway... Lotus of Siam, Weiss' Deli, Bachi Burger, Grimaldi's Pizza.  Unfortunately this last time, my buddy got sick and we spent a lot of time hanging out in the room.  This is not where the Monte Carlo shines, unless you are in one of the penthouse floors with a strip view.

Just your normal room is very basic and since it was NCAA March Madness time, the place was full.  Our room was on a lower floor (14) and kind of old looking.  Our first room had beds so soft that I swear they were 20 year old mattresses and the room smelled like it hadn't been opened in a while.  They switched us right away, when I complained and the new room a few doors down was only a little better.  The next morning we went to make coffee and, the coffee machine had mold growing in it where you put the water.  Glad my friend checked, I never would have.  Who knows how many other people hadn't.  Apparently there was something wrong with the lock on the door and maintenance just showed up unannounced saying something was showing up as "not locking" on their switch board.  Hmm was that like that all night?  I guess so.  A day later, the kick plate of the door came completely off with screws sticking out.  

Seems to me, this part of the hotel is beyond old and run down.  All Low Def TV stations, even though it's an HDTV.  WIRED internet?  Who uses wired internet anymore?  What is this Y2K?  Our iPads were useless.  Having to just use my iPhone for internet, the 3G was very spotty on this floor and even calls were getting dropped.   I know these high end casinos on the strip don't want you to stay in your room very much, so it's not an accident they don't have your basic comforts that a normal Days Inn has, And you are in Vegas, you SHOULD get out of the room.  But since my friend didn't feel well and I wanted to spend time hanging out with him,  It just really brought to light what a crappy room the Monte Carlo has.  Especially at $200 a night (March Madness price - it's normally way cheaper).  Made me really wish I had spent the extra and stayed at the Venetian or the Wynn on this trip.

The hotel is getting a little dated.  It is located right next door to the new arena being built, which would be great once completed.  There are several other construction projects that make walking the strip a little difficult on this side of the street.  The hotel wifi is only available on the first 2 floors, which is lousy these days.  My bathtub faucet dripped all night and the fixtures could have been a little nicer.  The shower head was very low for someone 6' tall.  The food was decent, Overall for the price point, this is a 3 of 5.

Stayed here when my brother was in Vegas for a convention and I just slept in the room his company provided for him. The room was comfortable and rather spacious, but getting from the elevator to the room was a hike! I had no idea how large this hotel is and most of the time I felt like I would get lost if I didn't pay close attention to what was going on.

The service wasn't bad. I managed to get a massage booked in the day I got there and it was nice and relaxing although the room was really small where the massage was.

All in all, not bad. Not sure how much the room was so I'm not able to compare it in terms of whether it was value for money.

My friend and I stayed at Monte Carlo on what was my first time to Vegas and I couldn't have been happier with our choice. For the money, this hotel and casino was the nicest, cleanest and classiest of all the hotels in the same price range.
The slowest check-in service in history, the representatives disappear after helping a few customers here and there, be prepared to wait an hour and half to check in.

I must say this place was amazing! I loved it stayed in the so suit. The room was amazing had a problem with the bed the base was broken took about 2hrs to get them to change it but after that the maid came in and left the room spotless again and that made up for it. She was really sweet I believe her name was Maria. Was up in 25th floor had the view of hotel aria vedera it was better then the back side. I would must diff stay there again. Hopefully get a higher floor and better view but overall diff love this place really clean rooms and hotel. I rate it 4 stars only because of the bed took a long time to get it and after a 4\/half drive I wanted to rest up before the night.

I think we got a pretty good rate which is what attracted us in the first place. The rooms were standard at best with no frills. The room was clean but only had a bar of soap and nothing else like lotions, mouth wash etc. The casino was big and they had lots of different games. I also liked they had various restaurants and a Starbucks. 
Over all it was okay and I'll probably be back because I don't spend much time in the room anyway.

First time staying at the Monte Carlo (basically any hotel not directly near the CityCenter area on the Strip) and would never again. The facility itself was nice (3 stars for facility alone). Clean casino, bar & pool area, elevators, etc., but the service was terrible. Resort fees ($22.50) now include wi-fi connections in room (poor wifi connection, but a wifi connection nonetheless).

Check-in was smooth as everyone else has said, but room was serviced only once in 5 days (after the first night).  I called at 7:00pm my third night to have the beds made and the trash emptied while out for the evening, the person on the phone was friendly, but when I returned to the room at 8:00am nothing had been done. Notified the front desk and two nights of the resort fees were comped. Called another night just for towels and toilet paper, took over an hour to get. Pool only allows unopen water bottles (no juices or soft drinks, if you have kids). Drinks are expensive (but that's Vegas). I didn't even end up staying for the full 5th night I paid for. 

Check out experience was ridiculous as well. Was the only person waiting in the check-out line and was never called forward. Had to physically cut in front of a receptionist and ask to be checked out after a 20 minute wait. Had a long distance phone call on my bill which I was told could not be contested. Finally, spoke to the manager, Ryan, who ended up comping all the daily resort fees and the added long distance call on my bill, which I appreciated. He seemed genuinely disappointed with my experience. Next time I'll pay the extra money to stay somewhere I know the service is always good.

Came here to take a trip down memory lane. Oh, how things don't change. Monte Carlo is still as classy as it ever was. And their gaming floor always fucks me up! Thanks for taking my money and teaching me that gambling is a bad way to make a living. At least when you're impulsive and unlucky like I am.

Oh, also, their food court is bomb. And if you come up big, they have some nice restaurants to blow your money at, too. They got all the bases covered.

It was also useful that it connected to the Vdara where we were staying.

d.Vino restaurant is the worst.  Had a 6:15pm reservation and after over an hour of waiting I finally got up out of my seat to hunt down the manager.  They sent him to our table where I explained that we had been waiting for an hour for our entree.....the entire time he just nodded.....I finally said "well you seem to be acknowledging that you have a problem so when is our entree coming?"  He never answered so we walked out.  The place was a disaster.  As we walked by the open kitchen area you could see the disaster.  No food coming out, crap everywhere and nobody running anything.  Highly recommend NEVER going there.  THE WORST!

Pro: cheap hotel prices, pool area,comfy beds, strip location 

Con: very thin walls, dingy looking, low shower head, no drink deals in the pool area, drinks are weak but tasty, spring break atmosphere 

Tips: your neighbor can hear everything from your drunk stumble in to Getty frisky. Keep it quiet if you want to remain low key. People leave towels on the chairs and often don't come back for hours. No personal items= free for all . Tubes are half price after 2 pm

The room I stayed in was in poor condition,  ripped bed sheets,  holes in the wall,  ripped wallpapers, etc,  etc. 
I will avoid staying here next time I'm in Vegas.

I stayed here the first weekend of March. Our party of 8 took up two rooms. And I don't have any complaints about the hotel. We didn't use the swimming pool or other amenities, but it was nicely located. Just a block down from the drug store where we stocked up on snacks and liquor. Our rooms were clean with enough towels and we had a nice view of some of the strip, including the MGM hotel. It's not a fancy shmancy hotel, but it's still nice at an affordable rate.

We watched the Jabbawockeez show which was located in the Monte Carlo's theatre. 

The employees they had running the line for the taxis did their jobs, but weren't exceptionally friendly or anything. 

I'd stay here again if the price was right.

I've stayed at a few hotels here in Vegas, (Luxor, Rio, Stratosphere), and so far I think that the Monte Carlo is better than the places I've stayed before. I'm staying in a Monacco suite, but I think that next time I would rather just stay in a high floor strip view room. THE PROS: It has an entrance right on the strip. It has a tram that connects it to Aria and Bellagio. There are a lot of places to eat that are right inside the hotel. There are a lot of places with happy hours right inside the hotel. It is connected to Crystal center for some high-end shopping. If you leave housekeeping a note, like I want more towels, they will leave more towels. If you call down to the front desk and need something they respond promptly. The gym is included in your resort fee and it is beautiful. In my opinion the place is clean and the staff is friendly. THE CONS: The walls are thin and the Monacco suite that I am in butts up against the wall holding the elevator, another room's bathroom,  I can hear the conversations everyone is having as they get off of the elevator, and I can hear luggage being dragged over tiles...click click click...you get the idea ( I believe that a regular room would not be as noisy, the location of the suites is just unfortunate ). The shower heads are like pressure washers (not really a con if you like good water pressure). There is no wireless internet, but the wired internet is fast and free. MY SUGGESTIONS: Book a regular room with a strip view instead of going for a suite. Bring a case of bottled water with you. Let housekeeping clean your room every day you stay so that you are sure to get your coffee, bottled water, and towels without having to get them yourself. Leave a note for housekeeping if you need something extra. Check-in at 3pm is a little crazy, it is like that every day, so relax and be prepared to be in line for a while.

The room was comfortable, spacious, and great value. The hotel is a little dated, but the same could be said about Excalibur. The only mini gripe is the hotel room bathroom, which can do with some updating, especially the shower.

I've never written a review on yelp, but this hotel made me go through all that trouble so I can tell you my experience.  So, I went through priceline and got this hotel for around $70 (tax included) and was thinking, sure, the location is great and it's a 4 star.  Please don't be fooled, it's worse that many of the branded motels I've stayed before.  We paid an extra $55 to get a bigger room with 2 bathrooms and a jacuzzi.  Then the front desk tells us we need to pay an additional $15 for their club usage and internet. (which we don't use or need) So total around $140\/night. When we came up to the room, it was old looking and NO amenities what so ever!  Eg. Cups, kettle, coffee machine, water bottle, microwave no where to be found etc..etc.  So we are Asian and we're used to drinking hot tea or hot water in the morning.  So we asked housekeeping whether they can get us a kettle.  "sorry, we don't have kettles. I'll transfer you to room service".  okay...so I spoke with them and asked for some hot water and two cups.  They said "sure, but it'll be $4.50".  So you can see why we did not have a pleasant stay here.  Also, the bed sheets had holes in it!!! 

We moved to PH tower westgate the next day and wow...what a change.  4 star as well, mini suite with a jacuzzi, much newer room, nicely decorated, bigger windows and has all the amenities listed above, kitchenware and even a dishwasher.   The total price was $25 cheaper.  I'm just disappointed that a 4 star hotel can't even afford a kettle for each room.  And they had to cheat us with the $15 additional resort fee when we check in.   I don't think travelers like surprises.

We've stayed in more expensive hotels before and at least there's a reason why they charge so much.  For this one, I must say, it's not worth it.

Older hotel. Good value for the money, paid extra for the Strip View. Older shower, older room, but expected for the price. The bed was clean and felt nice. Good hotel if you need to save money, but want to be close to the strip. Would like to have paid extra to get the spa hotel, probably much better, with the Jacuzzi bath instead of our small bath. Felt like the older traditional hotel rooms, square, minimal, nothing extravagant.

So a friend of mine recently had a birthday party in this hotel. But that wasn't the first time I've ever been in Monte Carlo. In fact, I've been in the place many times. My aunt worked here for a few years after she left the Stardust actually. 

I remember the grand statues and landscaping out front. I remember the arcade in the lame shopping mall in the back. I remember when Lance Burton was the headliner and the bizarre sub-theme of magic the place once had. I remember when it wasn't so red and blue. 

The grand entrance has been replaced with a Linq-ish promenade (my feelings on that are rather ambivalent). The arcade in the back is gone, making the "Street of Dreams" even more underwhelming. The magic theme has been replaced with the aura of the Blue Man Group. 

The hotel room was lovely however. 

It decorated in muted nighttime shades of blue on the walls and in the carpet. The bed was plush and spacious enough for multiple people to lay on it during a gathering. There were two bathrooms (this was a suite) which was perfect for a party environment. Oh, and we were able to accommodate almost 50 people in our one room.

Not bad for a party. Not bad at all.

The Final Verdict

Pros:
Fantastic, spacious suites.
It kinda, sorta serves as a childhood memory? LOL. 

Cons:
"Eh" casino and shopping area.

Huh?:
Okay, I get you guys are trying to blend the entrance in with the new "Park" for the arena and everything, but at the same time by remodeling the entrance y'all kinda took away the only thing that really made the facade distinctive. Now it kinda just looks a bunch of other places on The Strip. Oh wait, that's the point. Never mind. 

Return Factor: 8\/10 if I wanted to have a get together in a hotel room. 5\/10 if we're talking just stopping by the casino.

Noisy! Lots of construction going on that starts before 5am. Staff that lies just to get you in a room (even if it's not the one you reserved) and could care less about customer comfort or satisfaction.

This hotel is tired!!!! Hence, construction and construction noise starting at midnight!! Or some sort of loud vibrating noise. Front desk says, they cannot do anything about it! Ha! If you do not want to sleep then stay at this hotel. Amenities, poor!!! 
Unfortunately, we got no choice on new year's weekend and have expensive tickets to Bruno Mars.

Based upon reviews on Yelp I was expecting to be disappointed by the Monte Carlo, but the price was right and I didn't plan on spending much time in the room anyways so I went ahead and chose to stay here.  I got there at night and check-in was a breeze.  No line and was in my room in around 10 minutes.

The room itself was nothing special.  Modern decor and it was clean.  One complaint was the toilet in the bathroom sounded like a jet engine when flushing and when you turned on the water in the sink it would splash all over the place unless you were careful.  Another minor issue was that the room door wouldn't open at times and I would have to insert the key a half a dozen times or so to get it to open.  Kinda annoying but not a deal breaker.  There's no Wi-Fi available, but wired internet service is available and included in the $15 a day resort fee.  

The casino is of decent size and during the day they have $5 blackjack tables which were nice.  At night the tables were $10 or higher.

A plus to staying here is that there is a tram at the Monte Carlo which goes to the Aria, CityCenter and Bellagio.  It's nice to have when its 100 degrees outside.  The location on the strip is pretty good as well.  It's near the center and there's a CVS right next door and a Walgreens across the boulevard.

Nothing spcial, nothing terrible.

The rooms were clean, and I really liked how I could walk out of the self-parking garage directly to the lobby w\/ elevators so I could go up to my room. That was something special to me. They have Keurigs in the rooms, but the coffee tastes expired. The bottled water is part of your resort fee - speaking of which, I had a comp night here and the guy who checked me in handed me back my card and told me he wasn't even going to charge the resort fee. Kudos, shout outs, and thumbs up.

I didn't explore any of the hotel at all, instead, just spending the night here. It's definitely an older hotel and it's rather dated, especially in the rooms and corridors.

Overall, I'd stay here again... if it was complimentary only.

We had 3 rooms for a bachelorette party. Absolutely horrendous experience! The bed sheets were disgusting, stained and it smelled like B. O. The second we turned the shower on, the smell of bleach was just overpowering. The second room smelled like sewer and again, bed sheets all stained. When we called maintenance for the sewer smell, the person that came up was arguing that it didn't smell, when all other 9 people in out party couldn't get past the disgusting odor coming from the bathrooms. The same attendant was extremely rude and careless. All 3 bathrooms had disgusting mold in the shower and the shower heads were filthy. We didn't dare try the food anywhere in the hotel, if the rooms were that disgusting, I can't even imagine how terrible that kitchen must be! 

-When in Vegas, skip the Monte Carlo hotel for sleeping arrangements.

I won't stay here again! The first room air did not work, switched to another room the next day & that air didn't work! Staff is friendly but did nothing in the way of upgrading our room. I will stay at Paris because they always make my stay a pleasant experience. BTW no WI-FI unless we left the room to go to Starbucks!

Room: Everything was very out-dated. TV from the 90's (CRT, hidden in a ugly wooden closet). Bed was average. Room badly illuminated. We had a room on 6th floor - below average view. Noise from other guests (walls very thin). No minibar or fridge. Room had smell of smoke. Old beddings.

Hotel: No Wi-fi and retractable cable semi-broken. Pool area nice, however closes already at 6pm (seems standard in Vegas). Bars, food-places, etc, closes very early.

Cleaniness: Room generally clean, but common areas had both trash and many signs of being worn out.

Service: Reception wouldn't check me in as my name wasn't on the reservation and room was prepaid, despite having printout of reservation and offered a credit card. Had to wait half a day for the other person. Bad experience! No lines when checked in but saw lines of approx. 10 people at other times.

I wanted a quick get away for my birthday, so off to Vegas I went.  When I made the reservations online, I specifically checked the option for a "strip view."  

Check-in was fine with no problems and I was given the room keys.  When I was walking to the room, I could already tell something was not right.  When I got into the room, the first thing I did was look at my view.  Imagine my disappoint when I saw a parking lot and 15 fwy.  Not happy, I went back down to check-in to get this resolved.  The assistant tried to tell me that when their is a "view" it will only show a "V."  Not my problem seeing that I requested and PAID FOR a strip view.

He assigned me another room.  I asked to see a map of the rooms so I could verify that I would have a strip view.  He did not have a map, he asked another associate... they didn't have a map.  No one seemed to have a map readily available.  Finally he finds a map and we confirm the room has a strip view.

It was a standard room with the basics.  However, the sheets did not fit the mattress.  It was as though they put king sized sheets on a queen. And the sheets made noise when you moved.  I can't describe what it sounded like.

Personally, I will never set foot back in this hotel.

ehhh, Monte Carlo is just whatever. The room itself was nice and had a good view but the bathroom needs some updating, especially the fixtures. We stayed here because of the price and location on the strip but thats about all it had going for it. Wish there were better restaurants there as well. Only real issue I had was with the room keys. I had to get new keys 4 times over a 2 day span since they kept on deactivating. That got pretty annoying but I didn't feel like complaining and all that. Wont stay here again unless it is by far the cheapest out of the all the rest of the hotels.

Fortunately for the Monte Carlo, no one goes to Vegas to hang outin their hotel room.  While the lobby is gorgeous, the shops are a lot of fun to peruse, the restaurants are good and the swimming pool is heavenly, the rooms are basically a really expensive Best Western.

This hotel needs to be renovated ASAP or just choose a different hotel! To all guests, CHECK YOUR AIR FILTER!! We called requesting the air filter in our suite changed. Initially maintenance said that there wasn't anything wrong with our a\/c unit until he looked at the filter.  I don't think it's EVER been changed since they opened this hotel!! I should have taken a photo of it, but I was so nauseous! The filter looked like the lint catcher of a dryer after a load of 20 towels! Yes, it was that thick!! After a couple of ours with our new filter, I felt 300% better! Unfortunately, after voicing my dissatisfaction with the hotel, they felt $50 was a deserving apology. Monte Carlo's casino stunk which is why we didn't gamble there. I expected more & was horribly disappointed. I was more satisfied staying at the newly renovated Circus Circus with my kids paying $40\/nt than paying for the so called upgraded Monaco suite.

JUST DON'T DO IT!!! I was so disappointed in hotel!! The room was absolutely filthy. Stains and spots everywhere. Then to top it off there's a terrible moth problem. There were several real in my room. I asked for a room change and the room I was moved to they had sprayed a ridiculous amount of air freshener and because the toilet smells like sewage and would not stop running. Once again I asked for a room change and I was moved to another room without the view that I was looking forward to. This new room was much cleaner but the same moth problem. I was sleeping and one flew on to me and then when I went to put my makeup on in the morning 1 flew out of my makeup bag. Because I booked the room for hotels.com the Monte Carlo told me there was nothing they could really do for me. When I contacted hotel.com and ask for a refund for one night because the room was uninhabitable it was so filthy. After hotels.com contact in the Monte Carlo they called me back and said the Monte Carlo would not agree to refund me so hotels.com offered me a $100 credit for my next stay.... that room for one night was much more than $100. Needless to stay I will never look at the Monte Carlo again! They did not accommodate me for the inconvenience of having to move 3 times, not being able to take a shower the first night  because the shower was so absolutely disgusting. Save yourself the hassle and just don't book there! See the photos...

Everytime I wanted to catch the tram to the Bellagio, I've always walked through in here.

Overall, everything, including the shopping area in the back which lead to the tram, looked okay.

Just stayed here for a night and I would do it again! Great location and friendly staff. The room was clean; not the newest or shiniest, but we were hardly in it anyway and it was definitely good enough. I wish I had more time to explore the casino and shops inside. Maybe next time!

super unprofessional.. the lady picked up the phone laughing after i had been on hold for a while.. smh... i called the front desk to let the lady know my bed has a dip in it so i woke up with an aching back and also i have a spained ankle and our room was too far from the elevator so we would like to go to another hotel and get a refund.. she didn't apologize all she said was you're responsible for your stay once you check in so you can leave but you will still be charged. then the phone went silent..... i said what are my other options she said a room transfer.. hope i dont get another messed up room! we are stuck here until sunday!!! do not book at the monte carlo.. they need to be renovated... these rooms are very overpriced.. & they don't care about you she didn't even apologize... i will never stay here again!! back to the MGM i go!!! the rooms are nice beds are comfy.. & the customer service is exceptional!!!!!

This hotel was very clean and comfortable and allowed us to check in early since we arrived in town a little bit ahead of schedule. Since the pool at the Monte Carlo was being renovated we took advantage of having access to the pool area at Mandalay Bay and we enjoyed that very much. The walk wasn't too bad and there was a tram that delivered us to Mandalay Bay from the Excalibur. I would stay here again.

I wish I could give this hotel 0 stars!  The worst hotel e patience I've had in vegas.  I paid $350 for a high end room with a spa.  Check in took over an hr.  Then they sent us to the wrong room.  After another he we got to the right room and it REEKED of smoke. The manager was extremely RUDE!  We got a new room, outdated, no spa, and basically paid twice the price for a regular room.  They have terrible customer service. The restaurants service was not great either.  Very sad we chose this hotel for our 17 yr anniversary.  Sad experience.

One of the primary reasons we stayed here was the lazy river... well, it's kinda hard to relax\/drift along when A. you keep bumping into loiterers every five seconds and B. there is booty music being blasted by the DJ. If you're looking to extend your Vegas party to your pool time, this is the place for you... 

The room itself was ok - no refrigerator or microwave, so keeping drinks cool was an issue and bringing leftovers back to the room was a non-option... 

I probably wouldn't stay here again.

They advertise complimentary Keurig coffee in the rooms but they don't provide cream or sugar. When we asked the housekeeper for some, she asked us to call downstairs. We were told by room service that the hotel does not provide cream free of charge. There was only one styrofoam cup for coffee. The housekeepers were talking very loudly in the hall, starting at 9 am. This used to be a great hotel, won't be staying here again.

We are locals and looked at staying at multiple places. We chose MC because it was my friends birthday and she is an M Life member, she was upgraded to a Suite last year for her bday. The check in line was completely understaffed and took over an hour and a half! No upgrade but not a big deal, room was clean and just fine. The AC didn't work and 2 hours after letting them know, a guy came and said it's because a window was open. What???  Called for more towels, took over and hour:\/ same as bag pick up. Over an hour. Staff was friendly except for baggage pick up. Just a let down from everything else.

The room they put me in left quite a bit to be desired in terms of cleanliness.   The carpet was dirty, the chair was dirty and the hallway carpet needs to be stretched as I tripped and fell on it walking down the hallway.  I've stayed in a number of hotels in Vegas and this place needs work, I won't be staying here again.  The check in process takes forever. But the clerks are nice once you get there.

Had a problem with our water in our bathroom but we didn't notice until the next am after checking in. No pressure in the sink, no hot water in the shower and the tub wouldn't drain. But a call to the front desk and they quickly changed us to another room with everything functioning perfect. We had a pretty cool view, we saw the roller coaster at New York New York and the Luxor Light. Close to two cirque shows was a nice bonus.

Me and my fiancee recenlty visited Monte Cralo and had a great time.  The dealers were freindly, the tables were open and the limits were reasonable.  The rooms were decent and for a good price and the brand steakhouse was very good.  The pool wasn't open very often, but looked nice.  The tram to the bellagio was very convenient.  Overall it was a good experience and I would return again.

Sooo many things wrong with this place.  The entrance is grand & quite opulent.  To get to the restaurants & buffet, you must go into the smoky casino.  Yes, apparently it is legal to smoke in casinos.  The buffet itself was expensive (about $30 person).  The food at said buffet isn't anything fantastic.  The crab legs are cut in half so that you don't have to use a tool of some sort to get to the meat (unusual in my book).  Now, on to the dreadful room.  Peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, leaky faucet in bathtub, & mold on caulking in bathtub.  There is no wi-fi in the room, just ethernet.  The beds were okay.  Seriously nothing to rave about.  The amount of electrical outlets was just bad.  Not enough.  Not enough for 4 people to use.  And the way that they were located was just not quite accessible.  No fridge & microwave in the room.  In the age of this century, a lot of hotels are putting fridges & microwaves in the rooms.  Just not this hotel.  The placement of the thermostat was just weird.  It was near the window.  WTF?????  It is electronic, which I give thumbs up to.  Who puts a thermostat near the freaking window????  Parking was okay, but a bit confusing on how to go up a level.  Thank goodness that this hotel will have a remodel next year or so.  The only 2 great things about this place were Starbucks & a free tram to get to the hotels nearby.  If you have a problem in your room (broken light, etc.), they come really quick.  Great staff, but just poor room design.

Because of its central location on the strip, I am a fan of this resort.  It's walking distance to the City Center, a block away from New York New York and across from a Denny's (important especially when cash starts running low from all the gambling).  I  also enjoyed having seen the hilarious Frank Caliendo in the Lance Burton Theatre and being able to workout in their fabulous gym that was ultra clean, located in the rear of their posh spa.  One of their restaurants, Diablo's, is located on the main level and serves excellent mojitos that go famously well with their generous helpings of chips and rockstar, freshly made guacamole.

The room itself was on par with most hotels I've stayed in, but a few items were missing upon check-in like the coffemaker and the keyboard for the tv\/computer.  My bed didn't have a comforter either.  But what really irked me was the pool being closed.  Nevertheless, I'd come back to Monte Carlo...it's a decent price for its central location.
They are doing construction in the hotel but neglected to say anything. Rooms are full price but there's no sleeping in this noisy piece of junk.

We booked our stay at the Monte Carlo this past Spring in order to be closer to the Ricky Martin concert downstairs at the Park Theater. The Monte Carlo was being renovated during our stay but that didn't interfere with our accommodations. The service was uniformly excellent as was the buffet downstairs. We didn't drive to Las Vegas so we didn't have to worry about parking; we simply sent for an Uber driver which was much more convenient. Our hotel rate was not overpriced and although the Monte Carlo doesn't have the luxury and dazzle of The Aria, it has its own much more sedate appeal. We were very pleased with our stay here and I trust you will be too. We felt safe and protected.

Rooms are comfortable and spacious here but the bathrooms are atrociously small.  The pool is quite nice but again, smaller than it looks in the website.  The casino is BORING.  The buffet is decent.  There is a Starbucks and a McDonalds on premises.  Small but decent sports book.

Why so lowly rated?  WELL.........the service here SUCKS. If the Monte Carlo manager reads Yelp, then take heed...your front desk staff is misinformed on MC policies, can be quite rude, and are most definitely NOT customer serviced focused.

Not sure why everyone dogs the check in service. They were very friendly and helpful. Even upgraded my room to a higher floor at no cost because they had a cancellation.

Loved the convenient food court for the late night SBarros or McD's. Also morning Starbucks. 

For the price it's a great value. Clean and in the upper 1\/2 of Vegas Casinos.

Yuck. I made a poor choice when choosing between a suite here, or a regular room at a nicer hotel. Sparse, dark, dirty and left a lot to be desired. Bed was uncomfortable, pillows were awful. Big black hair ball under the sheets was quite off putting. No soap in the bathroom. It may have been over 600 square feet but it didn't make up for anything. Blah
On the plus side, this is a steal for a room right in the middle of the strip.

Average Hotel on the strip: The Monte Carlo is a beautiful hotel, however inside it is just another hotel on the strip. The rooms are clean. The first room I had the bathroom light and alarm clock did not work. When I asked to change my room for the second night at 9 am the next morning they said I would have to come back between 3-5 pm to get a room. So I was without a hotel room for over 6 hours. The check in lines can be long. The vallet wasn't to slow picking up your car, but the drop off lines are. The food at the pub and the cafe were pretty good, however the food at the buffett left us all a little sick to the stomach. The one thing I really did like about the hotel were the wave pool and lazy river. If you are looking for an average hotel on the strip, this is it. $$ - $$$

If you don't know someone who can get you a comp'd room in Vegas, then Montel Carlo is a good choice for the location, price and amenities. It's centrally located on the strip so you have easy access to City Center, Bellagio and the other nicer parts of Vegas. I've always had a good experience with the front desk, valet and housekeeping, but then again I'm not in my room much when I visit Vegas.

We stayed on a Thursday and Friday night vacation for about $180 total after taxes and fees. I think you get what you pay for. It certainly was a decent hotel with decent service. The pools are pretty awesome and the gym and spa were amazing!

The best part of our stay was that the rooms were larger than most standard rooms and it comes with two bottles of water. You can get more bottles at the gym or from the casino servers. Much needed water in a really dry town.

The restaurants looked comprehensive with Subway, Sbarros, Starbucks, and some nice restaurants and a buffet too. We didn't try any of them.

It gets 5 stars for quality per the price. I would definitely consider staying here again.

When you check in, if they tell you "there is a view if the strip" make sure you ask if there is any obstruction like a HUGE AIR CONDITIONER UNIT right in front of your window. And if you get stuck talking to Lorena on the phone when trying to change rooms, just hang up and try again, she's RUDE and will talk over you, she has horrible customer service skills.

I used to really like staying at the Monte Carlo because the price is reasonable and the location is decent. My last stay has assured me that I will never stay here again. 

Checking in was fine, the staff was pleasant even though it was super busy. Everything went sour after we got to our room however. First off, one of our lamps was completely broken and the other lamp flickered enough that it could have been used to create a mini rave. There were barely any towels in our room and the cups left for us were dirty. 

We dropped our bags off and left to go back to the car to get the rest of our stuff. Once we returned to our room, a strange man was inside by the television claiming that he was called to fix the bathtub. We told him that we never called because we had just checked in. He left and we called house keeping to get more towels and ask about the maintenance. The lady from house keeping said she'd send more towels and that she has no knowledge regarding the maintenance because that is not her department. We were expecting the towels to take around 40 minutes to arrive, from experience because my group of friends and I go to Vegas every month. It took about three hours for the towels to arrive and they forgot to bring new cups for us. 

I forgot about this issue until my friend reminded me, but our television did not work. We would turn the tv on and the remote would not change the channel and the volume would go up and down on its own. We called to have the TV looked at and it took a few hours for someone to come and fix it. 
 
We also ordered room service and asked to use our resort credit to pay for is. However, it was charged to my credit card instead and they charged us for items that we not only did not order, but we also did not receive them.  

My friends and I decided to speak with a manager regarding the issues that we were having with the room and while the managers were friendly, they were unhelpful. Half of our trip was calling and waiting for someone to remedy the issues that we were having with our room. Being summer, I know that the hotel was fully booked and busy, but the delay of service exceeded any excuse and went into poor time management.  I also received a random bill for $61 a month after we checked out via mail. I called the number on the bill and the only options were for automated messages, I could not get a hold of an actual person. The bill also did not state how I was supposed to pay the bill. I sent them an email to request an invoice and received a message that I would receive the invoice in three days. A week later, I still had not received anything and so I sent another email with my check out folio attached to email, which stated that I did not owe anything. I asked for a detailed invoice and after another month, I received my original folio that stated I owed nothing. I asked them why I received this bill and then they sent me a random invoice that had the date I sent the email with $61 dollars on it and nothing else. I asked them where this amount came from a did not receive a response. I had emailed and called the representative that emailed me several times for weeks and then I received a collections notice stating that Monte Carlo has sent my account to collections because they "could not" contact me. I am absolutely disgusted by this action because  I tired to contact them continuously to find out where the debt came from and pay off the debt if it was valid. 
This establishment is completely unprofessional and I recommend staying elsewhere in order to avoid the stress.

So I received a call from M.C. Today ..  Very nice phone call to apologize for the experience.  Have to say it does. Make a big difference. I have to say I enjoy the Monte Carlo more than any Casino .  Reason being the location and we'll the cost. My review. Was  based on my current visit.  I have been staying at the MC for the past 8 years. That I starting going to Vegas. ..  This mornings phone. Call really cleared the air..  Monte Carlo you have a wonderful team working. Your customer experience. . .   Thank you 
Kim T. for the phone call. See you in the Fall.

This hotel was better than what i expected. I stayed here during good friday weekend with a couple of friends (yeah I know we are sinners) and it couldn't have been better. We arrived at the hotel at 6AM despite knowing check-in was at 3PM. We were so tired from our trip so we asked the lady in the front desk how much would it be to check-in early she said the hotel does not charge a fee for early check-in (According to the receptionist the website only says 30 dollar fee just as a window so people wont ask for early check-ins). She was so generous and let us check-in to both rooms we had reserved. Over all i love Monte Carlo because of its location, everything is so close and the service is awesome. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because the hotel only has wifi in the lobby and in the pool side but unfortunately the rooms have no wifi which sucks. :(

This is the 3rd time staying here. We enjoy staying here because it's close to everything plus the staff is always so welcoming. 

This time though the rooms were clean but they definitely need to start maintenance on them! They are starting to look worn. There was construction right outside, so with all the noise it was distracting and I was woken early! 

The water drained slow in the shower. I mentioned at check out but the guy who helped us didn't seem to care. He did apologize but there was no genuine tone to it. 

The bed was not comfy and I think it also has to do with the fact that they really need to update the rooms
 I wonder how old that mattress was? 

Sad to say but my stay was mediocre! Monte Carlo come on you  can do better.

The room is nice, we had a great view of NY NY & the sunset off in the distance. The shower had great water pressure. The lady at the front desk was a bit useless---didn't quite understand the concept of 'adding a name' to the reservation. The craps tables are nice (typical MGM felt, a little on the softer side, the way I like). Overall feel of the hotel is nice. The pools on the other hand are a miserable existence. They were dirtier than the water in Hong Kong - bottles, straws, and other junk was floating in the water - it was just disgusting and the towels were a scary shade of light brown (that was supposed to be white). I recommend the rooms - they're a good price for the decent location & the comfort... do not go here if you want a lot of pool time (I'd recommend Mandalay for that).

Beautiful hotel centrally located on the strip. Parking was easy, check in was fast and I'm very impressed with the rooms. The beds are very comfortable and the room is huge compared to other hotels. The staff has been amazing and helpful. The pool was a little too busy but beautiful. We stayed on a Saturday during a busy weekend so we expected it to be packed. Would stay here again!  I came with my family so I can not rate the casino part of it.

I go to Vegas every year. 30 years for xmas time . Last few years we stayed at planet Hollywood. last year there were 30 of us , this year there were a few more . My dad is a helicopter pilot so every year all the pilots get together and their kids etc.. by kids I'm 39 now . 
So I own a salon and my fianc is a Chemist .. we're pretty easy going but customer service and etiquette is a must.  It's not good customer service when the girl at the front desk is grinding her teeth with a huge attitude not wanting to refund you parking fees when you have already paid for it, and you got charged on your room charges and you have receipts. 
I kindly asked her why she was not wanting to credit the charges back if we already paid for it .. she kept on repeating herself.. and I kept on saying I understand, you have already said that my room comes with parking ... however my fianc had parked the car prior to checking in and he has been paying your hotel with his master card .
Here is the receipt...
She now has major attitude, then tells me she is willing to credit back one time charge. 
I asked her .. why would you not credit back both charges? We obviously both paid.. you have receipts.. 
then she says I will go ahead and credit back both, but not being nice. Just because your saying thank you, does not mean your nice it's How you Say it.. 
Then she says My name is AMY, incase  you need it.. 
Why would you give me your name is I did not ask?? Amy: you are Very Very rude. Merry xmas to you too on Xmas day. 
Then we go up to our room and we had a do not disturb sign on so they would not clean .. I have a bunch a expensive stuff and cash in my room just laying around .. 
and of course someone is in there cleaning .. 
we're pretty private people .. so that was not cool eighter . And my boyfriend placed that sign on there .. 

maybe next time .

I have stayed all around Las Vegas for the past 34 years and have experienced everything from the rooms at Vegas World to the Flamingo motel rooms (yep, the Flamingo had motel rooms where the pool area is now) and suites in Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and TheHotel at MB. And everything in between. But this was my first time staying at Monte Carlo (I had gambled there before however). Here is what I found: Check in (arrived at 1:15 pm) fast and friendly. Room would not  be ready till 3 (and it was).  

Stayed in the Monaco Suite. Was very happy. Huge non-smoking room of about 700-800 sq. ft., sitting\/couch area, flat screen TV, breakfast\/dining area by the window, mini-fridge, 1.5 marble bathrooms, 2 thick terry robes, bar area (non-stocked) all for $250 (tax and resort fee included) Sat and Sunday night stay. The decor was adequate and relaxed. Some nicks on the furniture and one small burn on the carpet but overall a very comfortable, clean and well appointed room-even had 3 beautiful glass vases on the bar. The bed was amazingly comfortable! Was initially worried about noise because the door to our room opened to the main area that everyone spilled into from the elevator. However, we didn't hear a peep. BONUS! 

The 2 for 1's FLOW at the MC! We basically did a "bar crawl" enjoying the 2 for 1's at "dVino", Brand and The Pub in Monte Carlo. Got a 2 for 1 buffet (not a fan of buffets in general so we ate breakfast there-not bad). 

The casino: kicked my butt in blackjack ($10 min table) where my bet ranged from $15-$25 a hand.  Won a little back in craps. MC has added a "party pit" type area (next to the new minus 5 degree lounge) where a dancer (think stripper before the stripping takes place) performs as you play blackjack or other table games. Kind of a gambler's "pervert row", not that there's anything wrong with that! Overall an upscale and pleasant environment.

The pool: I am used to larger (Mandalay Bay to be specific) but this pool was nice. I would like to see more cabanas available. Love any lazy river and MC's is perfectly fine. Not huge (like MGM's) but nice.

Location: Not a lot has to be said here. FANTASTIC. Tram or leisurely walk to Aria (where my girlfriend enjoyed a massage and spent the entire day at the spa) where we ate twice and I gambled some. Crystals at City Center shopping is top shelf  (girlfriend tried on a $24,000 vest) and has art throughout the property. Tram to Bellagio (though I've been using it for years) is fast, clean and always appreciated after all the walking.    

Checkout was flawless (even got a late checkout @ 1:00). Bellman and luggage stowage was also smooth. 

OVERALL I was extremely happy with Monte Carlo and will stay there again. I would stay there in December when I go back, however, I have 3 comped nights at the Palms. But after that, MC here I come!

This is problably the worst experience in all the times i have been in Vegas , i put 1 star do to i cant really do 0 because thats what they really deserve , someone BROKE INTO OUR ROOM WHILE WE WHERE GONE and THEY STOLE ALL THE MONEY FROM THE SAFTY BOX , the way they handle the situation was the worst , they lie to us saying that we left the  Room open , thats a big lie because i close the door and im 100% sure i did ,  if that would be the case who the fuck have acces to the safety box ??? If im the one who has the code to opend it ? Them right .. their stuff .. no one else have acces to the room and safety box if is not me or them .. when the security Ryan came he said  "I know what is going on"  i guess he was the incharge of the night shift , we were scare we couldnt even sleep just to think that someone might break in while we where in there , i ask security what did he mean by what he said and he avoid the question every time and start acting rude and he started to laugh at us and left , i made the report with them and the police , security gave us a number to call next day witch supposably were going to aswer all of our questions , and Na The lady that asnwer the phone said that either i or my wife stold our money " that pissed me the fuck off , i close the safety and the door before we left , we were toguether watching a show , and she even said no one can open it if is not you .. fuck that shit .. never again .. we talk to front desk manager night shift he said door was close exactly 10 min after we left the room .. so it means some one was watching us while we were going out and someone else was broking in into our room .. shit is scarry imagine if one of us would stay sleep ? I get chilled jus to think about it , my wife use to do that sometimes while i go play .. i already told all my friends and family about it so they can never stay there ..

yes, the rooms are average, yes it's an older hotel...foods old school Vegas, not what you expect from a strip hotel. 

Then why four stars you ask? 

Service. Period. It counts, for ALOT!

I like a moron left my iPod. I called them, they sent someone to the room while I was on hold, found it, and are shipping it back. Everyone was all smiles. Things came when you asked for them. Granted until they bomb it (like they do everything that gets outdated in Vegas) and rebuild. I wouldn't choose this as my top choice hotel...
But if they had an Internet special, I'd jump on it! 

& when the crazy city center is complete behind the property...It'll be fun!

They'll treat you right..

The rooms are old and run down. The bath tub is dirty and the plumbing needs replacement. They have a sign that talks about water conservation but the tub was leaking ALL day and ALL night. Not just a drip leak but a stream of water. We were filled by Expedia into thinking this was a 4 star hotel. We paid a $40 resort fee and the wifi didn't even work. This was far from a resort. A cheap motel would've been nicer.

We checked in here on 12\/30\/15 for new year celebration. On 12\/31\/15 around 6pm after going out for dinner, we went to our room and  the room smells of pot. We complained via phone as well as with housekeeping and then housekeeping said to go to front desk complain. We went to the front desk at around 7pm and was told that we should have called housekeeping to have a ozone machine brought to the room. I told them that housekeeping told us to go to front desk. Then the guy at the front desk said, let me check if there was a request. He stated to give around 2 hrs to have ozone machine to purify room. We went to the room at 830pm. No ozone machine was even brought in. So we head back to the front desk again to complain!!! Now the last at the front desk double checked and stated that someone came in to check the room but didn't know where the smell coming from. They said it may be with the connecting room but I know for a fact it's not them because they are all non- smokers much more potsmokers because they are my aunts!!! Then I asked them when do they plan on bringing in the ozone machine since I didn't even see the machine in the room and it smelled worst!!! She said let me put in another request to make sure, housekeeping is a bit busy tonight. I asked how long it will take, she said about 45 mins.
We waited again, after 30 mins and back to the room, still nothing!!! We went to the VIP concierge person who tried assisting us and stated that he did see 2 request and security came by and stated that he did smell it at the hall inside our room but once he got in the room he stated it doesn't smell as bad anymore. 
The hotel is supposedly a non smoking hotel. Guest services is definitely is lacking here. If I can do zero star, I would!!!!
So after talking to the security, he suggested to wait for about an hour for housekeeping to bring the ozone machine. We waited for 30 mins to see if they even brought in the machine. Guess what? NO OZONE MACHINE AT ALL!!! We tried opening the window but it opens up to half an inch only. I opened our door so that the smell comes out of our room. BF closed the bathroom door he thinks it might be coming from the bathroom vent. Past 1230am 1\/1\/16, I went to our bathroom. And the stench in the bathroom was so strong!!! Again, the smell of marijuana aka weed aka pot is permeating from the bathroom VENT!!!! BF called front desk again. BF talked to them and complain once more even stated that they have promised to send out ozone machine for the 3rd time already but no one came. BF stated we can't be staying in this room since we have allergies and I have severe asthma, he has condition that may cause to have seizures. He even told them it's coming off from the bathroom vent. They promised that someone will come in to check it out within a few minutes. BF waited for more than an hour but no one came in at all. Not even to check on us.
No one came to purify the air!!! We ended up putting towels 2 big towels at the bottom of our bathroom door so that the smell wont leak out to our room.  At around 9am we talked to housekeeping and told her about the bathroom cause someone was definitely smoking some pot again and its pretty strong. She called her supervisor who also checked and did smell the scent again. Then they ask if we want to have ozone machine be put. But we have to be out of the room for another 2 hours, same excuse. I told them we just want a different room. I was coughing all night didn't have enough rest. My asthma was acting up. My BF has serious allergic reaction rashes all over his body. Any room is fine as long as we don't smell pot. This was by far a nightmare New Year's Eve vacation!!! I wouldn't think of this Hotel as HOTEL but more of a MOTEL or a hotel in a seedy part of neighborhood were its ok for people to smoke pot. This place is a DUMP!!!
So definitely this hotel is not suitable for people who have allergies, asthma, epilepsy or children!!! Stay at your own risk!!!
Plus remote control for tv not working!!!
Now, the kicker, we checked out a day early because of both of us getting sick from their rooms. The bills were not visible on TV, have to go to front desk and try to settle the account there. The front desk said, I see that you're leaving a day early, did anyone explained to you that if you checked out a day early that you have to pay the whole 5 days. I said no one explained to me. I am pretty sure that we have complained so much that it is noted there already. Such audacity, paying for leaving early when we got sick because of the state of their room and the inability to take action to our complaints. And then kind of said well since no one explained to you about it, will just waive it..
No good ill never stay here or at an MGM owned place ever . They aren't very helpful when I had problems.

Stayed here a year ago with my pal and we had a good time. I'm a simple girl, as long as I have a room, hot water, and a TV, then I'm all set. Hospitality is big in Las Vegas and that was proved when we got there. 

We had a snafu when we checked in because my friend got a great deal on Expedia for free buffet during our stay (score!), the check in said it wasn't valid. Huh? So my friend sends a tweet out and faster you can say "Las Vegas Strip." we were upgraded to a better room, our tickets were valid, and the resort fee was waived for half our stay. Sweet.

I wish I could tell you more about the hotel, but since I spent all the trip either stuffing my face, complaining about the bright lights on the street (albeit drunk), dodging bullets off Freemont Street, this is a pretty cool place to stay.

The Monte Carlo is old school and staying here for 3 nights for 4th of July holiday was What we thought, a great idea! NOT! Check in was hell! The tour busses drop off and the foreigners just block the entry! Like its cool to hang in the front door! The first room we got was on the 12th floor and was dirty, the bathroom had urine all over! I was shocked the cleaning crew missed this nastiness! I called the front desk and got Tanshea! If not for this employee I'd only have negativity to share! This lady saved Me! I asked for an upgrade and got a spa room on the 29th floor! This room is my Vegas ideal vacation! During construction don't plan on sleeping! The noise is never ending and loud! Next down side.... the POOL WAS CLOSED! like really  during summer the hotel is doing remodeling. Who's brite idea is that? Fire them! Stupid idea! We never used the neighbor's pools, we didn't want the hassle. Next time we will not be choosing the Monte Carlo and I suggest you don't either. So many resorts, chose wisely!

I stayed here this past weekend and eh it kinda sucked. It was a reasonable price but you get what you pay for. The "wall paper" was falling off the wall right by the window. The lamp shade was all broken. THEre was rust all around the shower. Not impressed. The pool was great. We paid for 2 of the inner tubes at the pool which was like $15 per tube but since I'm part of M life I got 10% off!!! Woo. The absolute worst part was when we were checking out we called for a "bell boy" and we had our car in valet. And they said it would take like 10 minutes. So we went to check out and it took about 25 minutes. So we went and got our car and we had to wait over 30 min for our bags. It was ridiculous. I was so disappointed.

Rooms are extremely outdated. Our room had a mildew smell and the A\/C did not work properly. Front seat sent someone to deodorize the room and the engineer changed the A\/C filter but when we returned that evening the smell was back. A\/C was a little better.

The worst VIP service employees ever!
Voice sounded tired and just wanted to get out of the work. Wouldnt even answer to all my requests What kinda VIP service department does that?

the rooms are crappy, the bed is really uncomfortable and the walls are paper thin.  

You get 2 stars for all the free rooms you keep giving me.
For this price ,I couldnt ask for anything more.Room was clean,friendly staff,pool was ok.Location wasnt bad.Complimentary WiFi is a big plus!

I don't know what's going on with this hotel, but it's not the Monte Carlo I remember from past trips. First, they did not tell us that the pool was under construction. You will have to leave to go to either MGM or Mandalay to use their pools. Also, the customer service is a joke. Everyone we seemed to deal with from the minute we stepped inside was extremely rude. 

Now let's get to the room. My friends and I had adjoining rooms for my bachelorette. In one of the rooms, the toilet seat wasn't even attached to the toilet. We had to call someone to reinstall the seat. The bedding was ripped and old. The smell was musty and the air conditioner was broken. There was a stain on the ceiling that looked like someone may or may not have been murdered. We got major attitude when we called to fix the toilet and the air. After over an hour had passed, we called again and they snapped and said we had only called 7 minutes prior. Either they confused us with someone else or aren't sure how to read a clock. 

My last issue is with the buffet. A friend of mine JUST got stomach surgery and has not yet received her card that allows her to eat kids meals in restaurants due to the fact that she now eats very little. We asked the manager at the buffet if she could order the kids buffet since she eats about 5 bites for a meal. It was only about $3 less than the adult buffet. The manager was unsympathetic and didn't care and told her if she doesn't have the card, she has to pay the adult price. So they lost $100 of business because they were stingy about $3. We took our business elsewhere with better customer service. 

In conclusion, the only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Aside from that,this place is crap. It's gone downhill so much. We will never stay here again. I highly suggest booking a different hotel.

Ah, the poor old Monty. My old guide book has it rated higher than the Mandalay Bay with its single zero roulette, microbrews, tennis courts, and direct line to the Bellagio. So now that that's all history, what's to like? Well...
It's compact - the front desk, rooms, restaurants, and pool are close together, and it's easy to get through the casino to the strip. 
Nice casino - I found good rules (dealer stands on all 17s - couldn't even find these downtown!), had a bunch of fun with the dealer, never had to wait for a drink, and they seemed glad to buy my breakfast.
Cheap rooms - yeah the regular rooms may be getting a little run down...so get a suite. They're inexpensive and comfortable. 
Good choice of food - The pub is still fine without the home made brews, the Sunday brunch buffet was incredible, they have one of the top gourmet rooms, and the fast food court provides a nice alternative. New additions are a nice looking steakhouse in the old lounge and a fun open air cantina on the strip.
I've seen some bad reviews and I don't think it's time to write off the Monte Carlo just yet. It's true that it's suffering a bit from the construction next door (the pool speakers to cover up the noise, the strange view) and there's still some maintenance to be done, but the staff were friendly and we had a great time here. I hope that the MGM folks think it's worthwhile keeping this place up to scratch...

Me and my now fiance (he proposed during our stay here), decided to have a staycation and try Monte Carlo.  We're born and raised here and have never been inside here before and decided to give it a try.  We stayed from 1\/27-1\/29, so a week ago.

We stayed in their Monaco Suite.  What made me pick that room was the giant bathtub they described in the description, and I've been craving a bath from all the stress at work.  When we walk in, it looked very nice and clean.  Of course upon closer inspection there are some scratches, dents, black marks, dust, etc.  It didn't bother me too much so that was that.  But yes, from what most of the reviews said, they really need to renovate the rooms.  Unfortunately, the bathtub wasn't as big as I imagined it would be, but it still was way bigger than what's in my own house.  And one of the room keys they gave us didn't work, odd..

So basically to sum it down:

Pros
- Casino smells fresh, I did not smell any ash tray (for those non-smokers out there)
- Front desk\/Concierge were very friendly and helpful
- Walkway to all the shops was nice
- Room is 80% clean
- Bed was very comfy and soft

Cons
- The Cafe in the hotel has horrible service, took us 3 times to ask for a frickin to-go box and a different server gave it to us!  Our server ignored us for almost the whole time we dined. Unprofessional, we tipped the server who gave us the to-go box.  His expression was priceless haha.
- Room does have chipped off wood, black skid marks on walls and lampshade, pillow had few black marks, dusty counter top, wallpaper coming off, etc..
- The couch was rock hard, I sat on the bed when I watched a little bit of TV.
- Our room came with free WiFi, but even then the connection was shit.
- I did find a few hairs in the showers

Overall, I did enjoy my stay.  But in terms of coming back to stay?  Nope haha.  I will visit the Casino again but not to stay =D

Worst hotel not only in Las Vegas I believe in the world,rooms are outdated smell bad very old furniture,expensive absolutely disappointed don't use this place you will be sorry. 
Everything is absolutely bad nothing worth to mention.

I'm only giving this two stars because of the the gentleman that checked us in, he was extremely nice and helpful, I wish I could remember his name but I don't. 

Regardless, this hotel sucks ass. Everything about it sucks ass. It is old, the beds are stiff and suck, the rooms look filthy because they are so old. The ac claims its at a temperature (for example 60) and it's not even remotely close to 60. The bathroom is still from the 80s, the shower head seems like they bought it at the dollar tree. The casino sucks. The drinks are expensive. The only reason we stayed here is because we waited too long to book for SEMA, and we immediately regretted it. If you want an enjoyable hotel experience don't stay here.

We've stayed at different hotels before in vegas, got a good deal to stay at Monte Carlo. It's an older casino, but with a great location. 
likes: check in was easy, upgrade was free, beautiful view, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, casino let us win some money ;), customer service was very friendly, valet was quick, great ambience!

dislikes: 12.95 resort fee... booo!

My hubby and I stayed at this hotel
for our Valentine's 3-day weekend vacay :]

CHECK-IN
The girl that helped us check-in was a robot.
I swear.
She talked to us like she was reading something off a book.
I mean.. I know that's what they do all day..
and they say the same thing over and over and over again..
but that's still not a good enough reason for her to make us feel so
unwelcome.. yano?
She did give us a nice room close to the elevators though..

ROOM
Now.. this is coming from a girl who's only been to Vegas
ONCE before.. and that first time at Vegas was @ Stratosphere..
so this hotel room http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/5iSmZO0SrKU6EoXK_1M8Kw?select=ze4hUrlQAzAm11lSMlOZMA (eventhough it's the basic one)
was nice.. especially the bathroom x]
Don't ask why we got 2 beds (ones for sleeping.. ones for ___ [you can fill it in] Im j\/m :P)
Room service was quick..
we found out later that one of the bedsheet on our bed had
some.. brown stains on it.. not ONE but THREE different spots!
euwww?? 
So we complained to the front desk
and they fixed it for us right away.
We had to call room service to get new towels too..
all their towels smelled like.. burnt toast O.o weird..

CASINO
highlight of our vacay!
My hubby accidentally pushed one of the buttons on the slot
and came up with $300 lmao.
Lotsa fuzzy navels and pina colada for meee~ weee~ :D

CAFE
open 24 hours..
we got hungry at like 2am..
went to the cafe and grabbed their 
16oz. rib eye http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/5iSmZO0SrKU6EoXK_1M8Kw?select=OF0AjNqudev9gKC6V4R4yA for $19.99..
and breakfast http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/5iSmZO0SrKU6EoXK_1M8Kw?select=am4eZUVzJ54wRR3FEl_OcQ
There was only one server
so it took a while to get our order in..
but it was so worth the wait :]
+ she gave drinks for free.

BUFFET
We got this comped..
So we came for breakfast..
ate lots and lots of bacon http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/5iSmZO0SrKU6EoXK_1M8Kw?select=Qaf9d_VN4Qipzhfp7SFruQ,
ham, scrambled eggs, pancake, waffle, sausages,
country fried steaks, corn hash, grits,
danish (this was nasty.. like the dough wasn't folded enough),
muffins (blueberry!! yummm),
and omelets made to order http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/5iSmZO0SrKU6EoXK_1M8Kw?select=Qaf9d_VN4Qipzhfp7SFruQ. :]

4 stars for this hotel!
4 gazillion stars for my hubby for taking me on this vacay! hehe :]

Lori,
After this experience we will not waste our money on a place that their staff has stolen from us, our jackets, and provided the worst possible uncaring, stressful and disgusting stay environment possible. We understand it is a business and you are only concerned about the money aspect, you personified the term capitalism. So we do understand your business model of "money first, money second, money always, customer never". That is just not conducive to our vacation plans. As a retired veteran I have worked very hard and sacrificed a lot over the years and this anniversary was the first my wife and I have had in thirty years, and this was what we received. You live and learn and we definitely learned what the Monte Carlo was about. I hope no one else ever has the same experience\/disaster that we had to endure, that is why we left early.
Thank you for reading

Alan
US Army(Retired)

Day two and still receiving bad service.   Day one, room was incomplete--no bath mat and we were shorted towels.  Day two and it's 1117pm, housekeeping is now here cleaning our room.  They said we had the do not disturb sign hanging on the door.   We took that off when we left the room at 2pm.  Don't they check more than once?  We saw housekeeping cleaning across the hall when we left... With deals found across other hotels on the strip, I've got to think twice about returning here.

It was a childhood dream for me to stay at the Monte Carlo. That dream ended up to a nightmare...

I booked for two nights at the Monte Carlo... I was excited to know that as an "adult" I can now book for my dream hotel in Vegas.

We got there, and the first thing the person told me at the front desk was that they no longer had non smoking rooms available. Hold on, I BOOKED your hotel and made a reservation and specifically picked "NON SMOKING." How do you NOT have these rooms available?

So the first night I had to stay at a damn room that smelled like death. Mind you I have asthma... and was going through an asthma attack the week prior to staying at the Monte Carlo.

Oh ALSO, according to Hotels.com, Monte Carlo says they have free wi-fi. Well, how come I wasn't able to log onto the internet? The lady at the front desk told me that THEY ONLY OFFERED WI-FI for the first and second floor! 

I needed the internet for business, and yet I had no access to that. 

Luckily they granted me a different room the next day but still I made a damn reservation for a non-smoking room. 

Monte Carlo blows. And so does their buffet. I'm super disappointed, and will NEVER ever stay here again.

We stayed here because of the pools and they were great!

Wave pool, regular pools, lazy river:  rent an intertube and have the time of your life.    Tube rental was cheap.  If you go toward the end of the day it is highly discounted.  Sometimes people will just give them to you as they leave too.

Room was far smaller than Excalibur, but it was plenty big enough for everyone.  Really nice view.  Room was worn and a number of things were in disrepair.  (Furniture was broken; things in bathroom were broken.)

Cleanliness was an issue.  There was icky stuff on the wallpaper in the bathroom.  Looked like someone puked in there many, many times and no one had ever actually took the time to clean it.  That was the worst of the cleanliness issues, but there were many others, mostly small stuff.

Good location on the strip.

Price was very good.  Although the room wasn't perfect and there were cleanliness issues, we felt we got our money's worth when you take the pools into account.

This hotel is absolutely horrible. Construction going on, and you hear it from every room, so moving the room doesn't matter. It's LOUD. From sun up to sun down. 6am to 7pm. How is that even okay?! The staff here has no concern for their guests who stay here. We were NOT told about the construction upon booking, otherwise we would have stayed elsewhere. You'd think it would be obviously from outside the hotel, but it isn't. When I mentioned not knowing, the staff just said "It clearly states on our website that the hotel is under construction." We didn't book online, so we wouldn't know that. Staff needs to be more informative.

I have been staying at the Monte Carlo for the last 6-7 years every time I'm in the area for business. I have to say I have always been happy with my experience here but this last time was way below expectations. The resort fee has gone up to $28 a night, this is a bit ridiculous if you ask me, before the fee was about $20, still wasn't happy then but didn't mind paying the fee as my room included a coffee machine and 2 bottles of water......now the Fee is $28 a night and there is no coffee machine or bottled water? I also noticed that the hotel is now beginning to show its age in the carpet, I stayed on the 28th floor and the carpet was literally rippling, I observed a couple walking and the female companion almost tripped on the carpet. The beds are also worn including the sheets and furniture. 

I planned on returning next month for a mini vacation but will opt out staying here. For what I will pay I am better off staying local in San Diego or some other place where my nightly fee will not include a resort fee and the condition of the hotel warrants the price being charged.

Las Vega's needs to wake up and take notice of what they are doing, soon people will begin to look for other places to visit instead of Vegas.
