This was not my first time staying here .. it's definitely showing it's age. The rooms are spacious, the temporary check in\/reception area is very small and crowded .. 

We played slots both nights we were here and never had a cocktail waitress offer us a drink .. the people playing next to us stopped a waitress bringing drinks to a poker table and they were told it was not her station .. they didn't get drinks either .. it's Vegas where's the love .. 

Good thing it was a short trip.. and there are other places to play and eat ..

I stayed here a while ago and I really enjoyed my time at the Monte Carlo.  It's definitely not like any of the other hotel\/casinos on the strip.  There wasn't any gimmick, no crazy decorations... it was just a hotel and a casino on the ground level. I liked it's simplicity-- i didn't have to figure out how to get to the hotel or find where the restaurants were. Even if I were lost, I could just ask the nice people who work there for directions. The pool was pretty cool, though most people were just there to sun bathe.  The view from my room kind of sucked though- it was of the City Center construction and they pretty much work on that thing 24\/7-- waking up to the sound of hammering and drilling wasn't fun. And because of the City Center, it took a lot of sunlight away from the sun bathers.  I had a good time here, but I'd stay elsewhere just to mix things up a little the next time I'm in Sin City.

I thought I made a mistake of booking a room here before checking the yelp. But despite what everyone said about the room, the room was so nice.
First the lobby was big, elegant, and spacious. We got there around 4pm, so the line to the check in was pretty long. But the line kept going, probably waited for about 20 minutes to get the front. They were extremely nice and helpful. 
Our room was on the 31st floor with the strip view. I will say, the strip view wasnt so much in the day time, but at night, it was beautiful. But becareful at night, when you sleep with the curtains open, the ray of beaming sun will hit your bed in the morning at 7am lol
Okay, the nicest thing about the hotel was the LOCATION. Aria was like 10 minute walk, which was a huge plus since we were going to Jewel, the nightclub in Aria and for their casino. We also took the tram (which is FREE and leads from monte carlo\/aria to crystal shops to Bellagio) to Bellagio to get some food. Everything was walking distance and we didn't pay a dime for parking (anywhere else but monte carlos which is $8 per day). Anyhow, this hotel was beyond our expectations and we enjoyed our stay here.

Great location but hotel casino nothing spectacular at all. Rooms are like a basic hotel or even a motel. Basically if you stay here you're paying for the location. 

Rooms look like a motel very old. Also you can't get roll up beds here anymore due do fire hazards. 

I probably would not stay here again and would not recommend due to the pricing and the old rugged rooms. 

Good luck

From 7\/8\/15 
Came through here on our way to a few attractions. Monte Carlo is in between New York New York hotel, and Excalibur. This place is pretty nice inside there is shopping, restaurants, bars, and of course gambling.

Checked into hotel for 10 minutes and checked out. Ended up staying at MGM. Monte Carlo is extremely dated and not kept up as you would think a Las Vegas hotel room should be. Faucets have water crust on them. Fabric chairs with settled in stains. Floor base boards broken off edges and corners. Carpets worn out. Mattress springy. Will not attempt to stay here again, even if it is super inexpensive. 
Bell man, valet guy, check in representative all nice but not nice enough to make up for the rooms. 
Sorry not sorry for checking out.

First time staying at the Monte Carlo for both my husband and I. Check-in line was fairly long as they only had about 5-6 on staff for the busy Holiday weekend but it was also about 9:30pm when we rolled in. The lady that helped check us in was very friendly. We weren't so happy about the additional $25\/night "resort fee". We should have asked what exactly does that cover... Because we didn't even have a coffee maker in our room.

Upon entering the entering room, there wasn't any "wow factor" with the room. It looked dated and worn. The desk chair looked like it was picked up from the local thrift store it was so banged up. Bathroom fixtures were gold... I'm sure these were "luxury" at one point in time but now they looked old and cheesy. Caulking around shower\/tub was moldy. Toiletries were cheap no-name brand. My husband found a fingernail and a shard of glass on the floor. The glass would have been fun to step on barefoot. I have honestly stayed in Marriotts that were like 5-star rooms compared to this place. A positive was that the bed was super comfy. I just kept telling myself that we wouldn't be spending much time in the room anyways... Basically to sleep and shower so who cares if he room isn't the greatest, the money we saved by saving here can go towards having fun\/eating\/drinking. Oh yeah, and our room overlooked the pool- so we got to listen to the obnoxious BLARING music pretty much all day long. Go to the room to take a little recharge nap? Not a chance. Ridiculous.

Pool: unfortunately we didn't get to enjoy the pool as much as we thought we would... We came Memorial Day weekend and it was in the 60s with clouds our first 2 days. On our third day we lounged out by the pool for an hour or two. Chairs are right on top of each other... Literally, they could not get any closer together. It would be a bit awkward when it is so packed that a stranger would be squeezed up again you, staring into your face, inches away, if you were facing each other. Actually never actually got in the pool but nice to have options of different ones to go in. Not a fan of their extremely loud music which plays pretty much all day long... This isn't the Rehab pool at the Hard Rock. Turn that sh** down. 

I like that there was a food court for quick snacks and meals with Starbuck's, Subway, McDonalds, Sabarro, Rubios, a stir fry place and some chicken tender place... But it'll cost ya. 6 inch ham sub from Subway was almost $7. Bottle of water from the newsstand was $4. Convenient, yes. Pricey, f**k yes!

The overall price and location on the strip made us choose Monte Carlo but I wouldn't stay here again. I would rather spend an extra couple hundred and stay somewhere nicer.

Monte Carlo was not a bad place, but not a true Vegas experience.  It felt like any other resort hotel.  What I did like was their pool area.  So many options, but sadly they close it at 7pm.  The casino was okay, not too busy.  Food court was pricey, but if you are hungry check it out. But I felt you get more for your buck at the buffet just a few feet up the casino.

Our room was clean.  No complaints for that.  What I was disappointed in was they didn't have free internet!  Living in the Bay Area I guess I am spoiled with all the free wi-fi areas.  The hotel felt very child friendly, so good times if you have kids.  Most of the staff were super friendly.  Overall not a bad place.

I try never to be the customer who complains.. But customer service at this place just sucks so bad.

I can totally understand when you're having trouble with your payout system with the slot machines. What I don't understand is why do you keep letting people use the machines despite them not being able to get their winnings or even their remaining balance back. After waiting for over 40 minutes, we gave up because we had to go somewhere else.

Also, I'm sure they're frustrated as well. But I got nothing but attitude from the casino staff after I complained about this. I would've sympathized with them more if they weren't such d!cks. 

Thanks for ruining our Christmas vacation. We won't be staying with you ever again in the future.

Looking forward to staying here for another business trip in a few months. Clean, comfortable room, everything worked, staff seemed to care about the guests. Never had anything bad at the many restaurants\/bars. The location is convenient with the tram and short walk to shops and stores.

Casino not nearly as crowded and noisy as others in town. I don't care if it lacks the luxury of some other hotels, for the price it's a great deal.
We got the spa suite, no complaints. I love the medium sized refrigerator, no microwave though.

This hotel is pretty clean inside as you walk in walk to Slot Machine Pl Tracking will games they have a great bar called the pub with a great band playing they serve strong drinks friendly staff since construction is going on is kind of hard to get in and out of there with your car that is the only drawback right now and it looks like MGM on the properties are going to start charging for parking and I don't like that

Nous sommes arrives vers 8h30 au buffet et dj plus beaucoup de choix. Les produits ne sont pas de grandes qualits . a ressemble plutt a une cantine. Nous avions pris des tickets rductions de 50% et heureusement que nous n'avions pas payer plein pot!! C'est vraiment dcevant de proposer ce genre de cuisine. J'ai demand une prparation de macaronis and cheese ... La catastrophe ! a ressemblait plutt a quelques ptes avec une soupe pour la sauce tellement c'tait liquide! Immangeable

Checking in takes forever. Finally got our strip view room and it was P-E-R-F-E-C-T! ... 

Until we realized there were open water bottles on the table, some false eyelashes in the trash, rearranged pillows,and other random things left behind. Sounds like the last occupants snuck back in after the house keeper.

Called downstairs and they were extremely apologetic and relocated us. It was clean and ready, so we took it ... but it wasn't nearly as nice as the room on the 29th floor. (We got moved down to the 23rd). 

At the end of our stay I called downstairs to arrange a late check out, and from the time I hung up to confirm that was an option and the time I made it downstairs to pay, they were sold out of that option. The manager was awesome and extended our check out to 1PM. 

Yeah, we hit some hiccups, but they handled it well. Unfortunately, when these things happen there's not much they can do. 

I appreciate the graciousness of the front desk agent in the initial call, and also the assistance of the manager in regards to late check out.

But hey, if that's the worst part of my trip then I can't really complain, right? 

Good news: The BLVD area they built up is awesome! I can't wait to check out a concert at the new T-Mobile Arena and I'll definitely be back for some Shake Shack.

Thanks Monte Carlo -- maybe I'll have better luck next time!? :)

I first stayed at the Monte Carlo 9 or 10 years ago and have been here 5 times, including earlier this month.  I continue to come back as it is one of the cheapest places to stay on the south Strip.  If you want a luxurious or lavish place to stay in LV, this is not it.  If you want a simple place to crash after a long day of drinking and gambling, the Monte Carlo will work just fine.  I have had no problems with the rooms, they just aren't that impressive.  MC has a very nice low limt poker room which is tucked away from all the noise of the slot machines.  Other than that, nothing noteworthy here.

I stayed a couple times here.. not too great, not too shabby. Location is superb, but rooms are just very ehhhh... A great mid-range option with 0 pizzazz and not necessarily the type place you'd want to hang out at night. I don't like how there aren't any clubs\/bars\/fun places to go in the hotel.

Compared to other 4 Star hotels on the strip, this one is not up to par. If this is a 4 Star hotel, I'd be terrified to see what 3 and 2 star hotels look like and how terrible the service is. 

Parking: $10.00 a night? And I am already paying a $40.00 a night resort fee? Not a great initial impression.

First Impression Of Hotel: We entered the Hotel\/Casino from the parking garage. The walk way was tiled but most of the tiles were chipped and the grout was dirty. Inexplicably, there is a  15 ft length of carpet in the tile that looks absolutely trashed. Made for a not great impression but we continued in. The casino floor near check in looked nice and was active. 

Check In: We arrived in the check in line about 11 PM on a Friday night. It was pretty busy, but moved fairly quickly. When it was our turn to check in, we were asked how we made our reservation. I said Priceline. She asked do you want 2 queens or a King. We stated we were wanting a King. She said okay. She got us checked in with very little interaction. The person checking in next to us was told how their pool is closed but you can use the pool at MGM or Mandalay Bay. They were also told how to get to their room. Once our check in was complete, we weren't told about any amenities or how to get to our room. We specifically had to ask. 

The Room: We went to our room, on the 9th floor on our way to the room the carpet literally had a small bump or wave in front of the suitcase the entire walk down the hall. This didn't represent a 4 star hotel, but oh well. We opened the door to our room and find 2 queen beds. A disappointment. We call down to the desk waited on hold about 5 minutes. Got switched to a room with a king bed, and didn't have to go wait in the check in line again which was a plus. 
We got to our room, the tile in the entrance\/bath was dirty. The wallpaper the peeling, ripped and had holes. There was no clock\/alarm clock. There were no outlets by the bed. There wasn't a fridge in the room. The worst, the Toilet paper, single ply sand paper. I understand it's a cost, but we are PAYING to stay. I don't expect the best but I also expect a grade above sand paper. Many things you'd think that would be automatic with a 4-Star hotel and the price the comes with it.

The Casino: Casino seemed decent didn't play a lot. They did have live music in one of the lounge areas both Friday and Saturday night that was very nice. 

Restaurants: They do have a Starbucks, which is a plus. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants. We attempted to at 6:00 PM on Saturday. The restaurant we tried to go to was the Italian one. It wasn't even half full and they said on Saturday's you have to have a reservation if you want to eat before 7:00 PM. We walked over to MGM and had no problem eating at Wolfgang Pucks restaurant which my wife enjoyed the best meal she's ever had there. 

Due to the check-in issues. The Room that was a disaster. And not being able to eat at their Restaurants we are giving the Monte Carlo a 1 Star due to the cost and representing itself as a 4 Star hotel and it is nothing close to that.

All in all, not a bad place to stay.  My BF and I got a great weekend vacation package deal through Travelocity for the Monte Carlo, and we don't really have any complaints, except....

There is no Wi-Fi in this hotel.  You can get free WIRED internet in your room, but we had an iPad with us, so that didn't matter.  The receptionist at the desk told us that there should have been a cable in our room for us to use, but we didn't see one.  Again, however, that didn't matter because we had a tablet.

Also, you pay a $20 resort fee per day when you stay here which is supposed to include the newspaper, and use of the fitness and business centers.  Since we did not have internet in our room, we used the computer in the business center to print out a coupon for dinner that we wanted to use.  To our surprise, we had to pay $1 PER MINUTE for usage of the internet, and an additional $1.50 per page that we printed.  So, usage of the business center is NOT actually included in the resort fee.  

To their credit, when we brought this to the attention of the receptionist at check-out, she did offer to take $10 off towards the resort fee total for the inconvenience (and misleading information).

Other than that, I can't complain about our stay.  The place was clean and is conveniently located on the Strip.  It's not "fancy-schmancy" like some of the other resorts, but hey...if all you need is a clean place to crash at the end of the night, it's a fine hotel.

Great stay at a well managed hotel.

Other than no current available movies on TV and the front desk not knowing that and the temporary(all day) loss of wi-fi the stay was perfect.

I've stayed here many times...  it's always been my go-to...  but this time it just seemed somehow...  tired.  

I did use MyVegas points and that was hella easy.  I was stunned.  And check in at 2 PM on a Wednesday was a breeze.  The rooms were as I remembered.  They aren't great but they aren't awful.  They're dated, sure...  but you get WiFi (included in your daily resort fee which is I think around $33 a day) and the usual amenities.  I realize it's Vegas and you're not in the room much but I can't sleep without a TV on and the channel selection is so minuscule!  And the shower head is a joke.  Those need to be replaced\/upgraded ASAP.  They aren't cool or functional and probably haven't been since the 80's.

The bigger complaint though is the size of the gaming area.  I just found it so SMALL.  I don't know if they've reduced the size or I've just spent more time in much larger casinos but I really had a hard time finding a game I wanted to play.  And forget getting a drink while you're gambling.  You could sit there all night and not be approached by a cocktail server.  Worst gaming experience I've seen on the Strip.

The service at the sports bar is still spot on and in general I find the Monte Carlo to be a friendly place that is also pretty conveniently located.  The plans to charge for parking are all set - the ticket system is already in place in the garage so when that happens, you'll be soaked for yet another charge.  And once that happens I really think we'll look for another place to stay in Vegas.  The MC is showing it's age and just isn't very much fun anymore.  You could definitely do worse in Vegas, but you can also do much better.

Do not gamble here, had a terrible time. Out of all the staff here, the pit boss couldn't keep his personal comments to himself, very unprofessional. Not something you would expect from a strip casino. Go elsewhere!

Decided to stay here and take advantage of the shade over the main pool from the hotel skyscraper itself.  

Check in was painless despite the long line.  They gave us a room that wasn't ready to be rented out, so they moved us to another room and gave us a food and drink credit for our trouble.  Thanks Monte Carlo!  

The room was adequate.  The furniture was dated.  

Loved the wave pool and the lazy river.  The shade over the main pool made summer in Vegas at the pool tolerable.  However, there are so many people lying out by the pool, you end up lying on a lounge chair literally shoulder to shoulder with everyone.  No privacy and you're really packed in surrounded by dozens of others if you want to lie down and read or nap.  

The Street of Dreams shopping area isn't much at all.  Loved the Food Court - nice to get a reasonably priced fast food meal on the Strip.  

Check out went OK too.  Long lines for that.  Good price for our room.

Dingy and out dated. Stayed here 4-5 years ago and it wasn't bad. They did say they are undergoing a renovation, but I wish I knew before. No pool and rooms smell. The rooms are dark and musty. MGM or Mirage would be a better option.

Was very pleased with our stay in the Monaco Suite. The extra bathroom came in handy and the 700 sq ft made us feel less closed in. I even slept on the couch and that was comfortable as well as the bed. Great customer service and nice dining choices. The pool was great as well, not too crowded but plenty of eye candy. As far as the casino goes, it's a casino. I will never understand people who give bad reviews when they don't win. It's a casino, not an ATM.

I wish they had a fridge in the standard room. And I'm lazy to walk the strip and through their long casino before getting to the hotel part. Other than that, everything was just like any standard Vegas hotel room.

It's affordable.

In my last Vegas trips, 4 out of 5 times, we stay at Monte Carlo. I love the buffet there. 

I LOOVE their pools.  I love being swept around in the 'River' and floating along the waves in the other one. Fun memories. Kids definitely love it. 

I've never had any complaints about Monte Carlo. Of course in the future, if I have more money, I would love to try the more expensive hotels just for fun. But Monte Carlo will always be 'familiar territory' for me. I love how it's located right in the strip. I have this theory that 'If we're not on the strip, we're NOT in VEGAS!'

Maybe one bad thing....their arcade sucks, but I don't go there anyways. Excalibur is much better

EDIT 
I don't know why but this place is not as poppin as it use to be. Maybe it was because of the fire earlier this year, but it's a lot emptier. Monte Carlo use to be my favorite casio\/hotel...but for now Bellagio has my attention.

EDIT**

I actually stayed at this place, the past weekend. The POOLS are not the same! It's very boring. The 'river' use to be pretty fast, sweeping you around, along with caves and waterfalls. All of that is gone, it's very slow-paced...the Wave pool is not what is anymore. Before the waves were nonstop continuous. Now they turn it on every 10 minutes for about 5 minutes, then turn it off. What's the point of that?

Alot of the changes might be due to safety reasons, but I was watching the lifeguards, I could've sworn one of them was sleeping. Oh! The tubes! You use to be able to rent them and ride it on the river, now you have to pay $12.95 to BUY them, it's ridiculous

They have a small food court (Subway, McDonalds, Rubios, Sbarro) 

Just stay here, cos the prices are decent, and it's right there on the strip.

Been here 3 times, 2014, 2015, & 2016-- First time, AWESOME, Second--disappointed, the room was nasty, internet cables on the floors. Third (and last)- just wasn't that great... just kept on going down hill from there. I just came back from Vegas last week and stayed somewhere else but walked through this mess... I couldn't even figure out where I was.

I get that they're under construction but it's BEEN under construction since my second time there. Would not stay again... At least not until they are finished with their mess.

I expected way more from an advertised four star resort.  The rooms were ok, nothing spectacular.  The bathroom had remenants of a patched up leak but looked like water from the room above might come down at any minute.  Sheets in both beds had holes in them; my holes were cigarette burns!  The towels had holes in them too.  Internet cord was broken and had to hold it in if i wanted to use it.  Walls are very thin, we could hear people going to the bathroom! Not worth the price at all.

Ive stayed in worse places but i have definetely stayed in better. If you make reservations here, make sure you ask for the newer side of the hotel. Our first room was dingy and not cleaned well. Torn wallpaper, greasy substance on headboard and fingerprints.. nasty. They did apologize and offer to move us and they did....but as they told us to go out and have fun they would text us when then had our new room ready, we never got a text that evening. We had to go to frint desk and remind them at 10.30 that night...  not happy. We did get moved successfully. One question, who closes hotel swimming pool as 5 pm in the summer in the middle of a desert.... i was so looking forward to relaxing in the lazy river after our class all day. Got back to room to change in suit to go down and find out pull was closing in 15 minutes! WHAT????? So upset. This is what i was most looking forward to was relaxing poolside with a drink and a book. I dont get it. Get a bank loan to eat anywhere in any hotel or restaurant on the strip. Paid 16 bucks for a pina colada. Good luck!

Only reason I'm giving two stars is because I've stayed here previously and I had no complaints. This time we stayed in a suit with a rusted up shower head, a couch that was ripped and a view of the rooftop of the air conditioning units below us, when I specifically asked for a view of the strip. The maid would start coming in at 9am and not even knock, but rather walk right in till we began putting the "do not disturb" sign up on the door. Horrible.

This hotel should be closed and renovated. There is no wifi, the rooms are old and worn,. There is no clock in the room and the chair is so low you have to put a cushion on it in order to type at the desk. The air indoors is poor. It smells like old stale air and there is mold in the air in some areas which points to the air system not being maintained. The cleanliness is a 6 to 7 out of 10. The whole place us just OLD and not well maintained. Check in was difficult but pleasant. There were no working plugs in the room that were free. We had to unplug the coffee pot in order to plug in a phone to charge.

This was our first time booking a strip view hotel room so we were pretty excited to see our spread.  However, we were pretty disappointed when we noticed that our view only included the Hard Rock and some of MGM as the hotel and the Mardarin block most of the strip.  It was definitely not worth the extra cost for the so-called strip view.  While checking in, we were offered an upgrade of an additional $10\/night for the renovated StayWell rooms.  We didn't see the red accent floors but we were staying on a Green floor...it's a lot of green.  I think the rooms were a little fancier than what we needed and we're both fairly tech savvy, but the bluetooth tv would not properly connect to our audio.  It would show song and title playing but no sound was coming out.  And yes, we checked wifi connection, volume of all devices, and connection of bluetooth on all devices.  I think they should have some conveniently located instructions on how to properly operate the technology in the room. On another note, I believe the gentleman at the front desk was named Shawn, and he was nothing but nice while checking us in. My fiance was also pleased with how nice Herald was with the Bell Hop service.  She needed to retrieve an item from her bag after we checked them in and he kindly walked her to storage.  Very nice and polite. Overall, our stay was nice but we will look into another hotel when looking for an actual strip view.

Fist timer to las vegas, I loved this place.  The room was cheap and very comfortable. Too bad the only attraction is the wave pool and lazy river. There should be a club or something interesting here. On the plus side, it's on the strip and in walking distance of other great hotels.

The rooms are normal. Furniture needs an upgrade. No closet but 1 armoire. Nice LCD TV with low def picture. Serious? Wired internet which we could not find in the room. Walls are paper thin. You definitely could hear your neighbors and people in the hall. Our bed must have backed up to neighbor's bathroom as every morning we were awaken by their shower. $20 resort fee plus tax on the resort fee. 

Positives: gym was nice, casino was good size and centralized, restaurants\bars were cool, and free tram to Aria and Bellagios. 

Hey Monte Carlo, at a bare minimum, you guys should have HD channels for your HD TV's. Wireless internet included in resort fee would have great too. Add these 2 things and you get 1 more star.

Made reservations over the phone. They did not mention the fact that they are doing extensive renovations. They also did not mention that their pool is closed. Sleeping at night was fine but forget going back to your room for a bit of rest during the day. I wear hearing aids and without them the impact hammers or jack hammers were unbearable. They now charge a $35.00 per night resort fee to cover local calls (everyone has a cell phone), wifi (available free to people not staying here), the ability to print a boarding pass (can do free at the airport), access to the gym (yeah right).  We will not be returning. We did find the people friendly.

The most noticable thing at this hotel is that there was only one ethernet cable in a 2-person bedroom and our co-worker had to come to our room to use it as well since his didn't work (according to him).

Aside from that, they have a food court and shops downstairs, and lots of slot machines and table games. They have a pool as well but it was too cold to go there. Unfortunately, their souvenir shops didn't carry certain take-it-home casino games that one of us was looking for.

The technology in their room is very outdated... their clock is for an iPhone 4! Ha, ha, ha!

Anyway, due to my entire party having entirely different jobs and work schedules, we all ended up having to hog the Ethernet cable due to the lack of wi-fi in a single 2-bedroom room. How was any of us supposed to get any work done? I had already brought a lot of power strips with me to compensate for the lack of outlets, but now I'm also supposed to bring an Ethernet switch? What's next, am I supposed to ask the IT guy at work for a server rack so I have to configure the entire connection manually? The speed of the internet is also extremely slow. None of us were able to get any significant work done and our clouds didn't save or load properly. I know wi-fi is available downstairs, but I couldn't find an outlet. Now I'm supposed to bring my own electricity? The amount of tech I have to prepare to stay here already costs more than the total hotel bill. And we paid a separate fee for it too. (Luckily, I wasn't the one paying the bill, but since I'm staying here, I have to deal with it.)

Additionally, the shower does not drain properly. As a result, I was standing ankle-deep in a vat of my own body byproducts (interpret that as you will, I have a lot of medical conditions) and my prescription drugs that require the use of water. Not to mention that the person that wanted to shower after me had taken notice of the leavings in there since it hadn't drained yet and wondered what was wrong with me. I don't remember this happening the last time some of us came here, so what happened to the showers between this time?

Aside from those two problems, the beds are fine, the toilets are fine, the doors are fine, the sink is fine (luckily, it drains properly as opposed to the shower), the mirror is fine, the chairs are fine, the elevators are fine, and the window is fine. I just cannot get any work done with everyone wanting the line and I'm not sure how clean my feet are.

In conclusion, this is no Courtyard Marriott, and after telling my boss about this (he's not happy about the reduced amount of work I did due to the internet issue), he definitely doesn't want to stay here for CES since he still needs to work while at the trade show, so one shouldn't come here if they have to work at the same time. Also, I'm really grossed out by repeatedly standing in my body byproducts every day when I take a shower. If I wanted to do that intentionally, I would take a shower in the toilet. Blech. I used to like this hotel, but something must have changed over the years. I hope it gets better again... hopefully by the time it's summer so I can try the pool out. We always talk about going to the pool but we can't in the winter!

Pretty decent budget place to stay on the strip, where you pretty much get what you pay for. 

Good Points:
- The room was decent. It had a bed, blanket, shower, LCD TV, toilet. But then again, so does Motel 6....
- AC works well, which is nice when its hot all day and night outside
- Pool and fitness center were good. In fact, they give FREE BOTTLED WATER in the fitness center. Amazing!
- Perfectly located on the strip. Pretty much in the heart of it all. 
- Whirlpool and sauna in the spa area are actually free for guests.
- Pretty quiet at night. No "noises" to wake us up....
- Seems like a relaxed, family friendly place. 

Bad Points:
- No wireless internet. Just an ethernet cord stapled to the wall coming up onto the desk. If you really want wireless, just bring your own router, or bring your own super long ethernet cord and plug it into the cable modem under the TV cabinet.
- The ad for Jabawookeez plays nonstop. Everywhere. All the time. 
- While the room is decent, when you look closely there are issues. The wallpaper was peeling in some spots in the bathroom. The carpet seemed old. There is no fridge (but you can rent one for the low low price of $25\/night!). The shower started to drain poorly by day 3. The sink makes a loud "glug" sound when it drains. Like it wants to eat your hands....

There is also a distinct "Monte Carlo Smell": air freshener to cover the cig smoke ... plus the cig smoke. You always know when you are back. 

Anyway, I think on a budget, and if you dont plan to spend much time here, this place is fine. I wouldn't come to Vegas just to stay here or see this place.

So it's my first trip to vegas and my bf decides to take me to Monte carlo, weird. We check in and head to our room. While he's trying to open the door, i notice that something is not right, oh well. We walk in, i put my bag down and i notice that the peep hole on the door is 3 H feet from the floor, so i quickly make a "midget" joke. I head to the restroom and notice that everything is not where it's supposed to be and here come more midget jokes.I opened the shower curtain and that's when it hit me....We're in a "handicapped" room!
"babe, i told you that shirt made you look retarted".......
So we call the front desk and asked to be moved, but they didnt bc they were "booked"  :(
i wasnt myself that weekend

Actually I am being generous for rating the hotel a 3 STAR. It's more like 21\/2. It's not the Monte Carlo I remembered. When we got to our room, I immediately noticed there were spots on my comforter, so I thought I do a thorough inspection just for the heck of it. OMG! I was glad I did. Not only was my comforter dirty but my pillow cases and bed sheets were too. It looked dingy and I don't know what the spots were!! I called the front desk and they said I could get a new room but we were too tired to change rooms. I just asked them to come change it.  

As I was waiting for house keeping, I went to the bathroom, GROSS!! remnants of barf was still on the side of he sink and lower wall!!  It seemed like forever so I called the front desk again and told them I was disgusted by the second and for them to send someone up pronto! Eeeeekkk!!  Ironic part is that house keeping was 2 doors down from me!!!! Why did it take them so long!! When the cleaning lady came in, I showed her everything detail and she asked me if I had been there long!!! I TOLD HER I JUST CHECKED IN!! The nerve!!! Needless to say, I will NOT stay here again!! I probably brought bed bugs home!!! Inspect what you expect people!! If they offer you another room? TAKE IT!!!

If your only going to stay in Vega for the night or two nights at the most , it's fine . Any longer , probably not .. It really , really needs to be updated !!! Even down to the iron and ironing board !! Looked like they have been there since they opened the place .. I thought it was clean , until I got a "new" towel with a stain on it !!! Yikes !!! The rooms look like a courtyard Marriott as a matter of fact I just stayed in a new courtyard that was looked like a W !!! They are building some type of addition adjacent to New York New York . Maybe then they will renovate ... But they did have the best flight hotel package that I found . So, you do get what you pay for .

Did I just step into a Motel6?!?
As soon as I stepped out the elevator on the 20th floor it was as though I walked into a Motel6. Very disappointed about the Monte Carlo. I did not expect to see holes and patched holes in the walls. Dirty carpets in hall and worst of all in the rooms. There are gross objects and stains including old tooth pics. There are stains on the sheets. Damaged furnitures. Don't get me started on the bathroom which has mildew stains and towels. 
Don't let the outside appearance fool you

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!   EVER!!! I would have given it ZERO stars if I could.

This hotel is the worst one I have ever stayed at, and I will NOT be going back to any of MGM's hotels! They are all garbage!

- Mold in the shower\/bathtub
- The door number plaque was missing, and someone promptly used a sharpie to write the door number in.
- The safe in the room was broken
- After declining maid service and putting the "do not disturb" card on the door, I returned to find my room was cleaned and $200 was missing from my room. My friend with me also had cash stolen from her personals.
- After filing a "security report" the hotel offered me a $50 room credit as a show of good faith. When I checked out, there was NO record of the $50 room credit. 
- Numerous calls have gone unreturned. My last call got me to a grumpy lady who was too busy to help me. She told me that Mauricio Chales was going to call me. That was 8 days ago.
- Email that was written to them has also been unsuccessful.

Save your money for a nicer hotel, as the Monte Carlo is not even close to being "nice". 

Terrible customer service, despicable room and thief's for maids. Enter at your own risk!

Kind of a trashy place if I'm being honest. Everything is old, icky, and not entirely clean. The wallpaper in our room was peeling and we found broken outlets. Super safe, right?
Also, there was no one our age here at all. I wish I had known everyone was at least 50 years old. My boyfriend and I (22 and 25) felt very out of place.
Finally, the biggest reason we will not be back is that the place is an overall ripoff. I just can't figure out why they charge at extra $20 resort fee for stuff like water and craps lessons. Does this mean we can opt out of these services? No!
Similarly, they do annoying things like give out free drink tickets for spending some certain amount of money at the (ghetto) casino. The thing about these drink tickets is that it's not as easy as walking up to the bar and asking for a drink. You have to track down the mythical waitress to get your drink. I never found this waitress although the bartender swore was "around here somewhere." So thanks for the useless drink tickets, that ended up coming home in my pockets.
Generally an icky place. Won't be back.

We stayed here recently and got the Spa Suite. Monte Carlo is definitely a little smaller than some of the massive hotels like MGM and Caesar's, but that's a positive factor for me. You can walk in the door and there's a sign that points you where you need to go and it's not a giant tease!

The check-in line was huge and took absolutely forever to get in, but they let us check in a few hours early, so I can't complain about it too much.

The carpet everywhere seemed a little dated and in our room honestly looked like it needed to be replaced. The window was also really thin and didn't quite fit in the frame just right (it opens a couple inches and it took the both of us to lift it at just the right angle to get it fully closed). It also could use a little re-caulking.

But other than that the room was great. Bed was comfy and the jacuzzi tub filled up super quick. Water pressure was great and we never ran out of hot water, which is amazing.

We'd definitely stay again!

Try and avoid this hotel or at least until they are done remodeling.  I was lucky enough to stay in one of their newly remodeled rooms nevertheless I would not come back again.
1) rooms are very uncomfortably designed 
2) no hot water -when I called front desk I was told to run the water for about 15-20 minutes eventually it will warm up and that they are working on the issue
3) the Casino \/ Restuarant Area is lame ... the place looked like a ghost town.  You would not have known that you are in Vegas.  Nothing to eat and everything pretty much closed at 9pm 
4) if you go outside to find something to eat you have to walk for about 30 minutes before you can cross the street to the other side where some Restuarant exist

Overall, I would not recommend this place .... not for now at least 

On the bright side I won $150

A few years ago, I would always stay at Monte Carlo with the family because my parents were constantly offered complimentary rooms and food comps there.

It was a vicious two to three year cycle of staying exclusively at the Monte Carlo...and we would often visit Vegas three to four times in a year. That's a lot of Monte Carlo.

At the time, my impressions of the hotel weren't bad. It was THEN in a good location, it wasn't the disgusting Circus Circus, and it was still considered relatively "new." The rooms were clean with nothing to complain about.

However, I have since then stayed at MUCH, MUCH nicer hotels on the strip such as Bellagio, The Venetian and The Palazzo. Boy does staying at hotels like those really leave a bad taste in your mouth when you begin thinking about a place like Monte Carlo.

Up-front, the resort looks pretty upscale. Almost like a Caesars Palace II. It has a pretty Roman statue-lined exterior facade and marble foyer registration area. It's got chandelier domes. But when you look a little closer, it's not hard to notice the non-brand name shops, the cheap-eat cafeteria-style food court, absence of a resident nightclub, and pathetic attempt at a porte-cochere tugged off to the side of the hotel by an ugly parking lot.

Parking here is miserable. It's not like you park, grab your suitcase, go to the elevator and ride it up to the inside of the casino. If you park in the outdoor flat lot (like at a Six Flags theme park), you have to drag your luggage from your car to the hotel while the sun is beating down on you. If you opt to park in the hotel's parking structure, you still have to trek over a uncovered pedestrian bridge that connects the structure to the hotel. Considering Vegas summers exceed triple-digits, dragging heavy luggage in 110-F heat with the sun beating down on you is not fun.

The guest rooms here are very bland. However, they're clean and have muted colors. Nothing fancy, nothing spectacular, nothing over-the-ordinary. Bathrooms are very motel-like. There's the tub and shower combination with a plain shower curtain and a toilet that has the sucking power of a turbo vacuum. The guest rooms here at Monte Carlo would suit a kind of person that rarely spends any time winding down in the room, but only uses it to get some zzzz's

The pool area is rather nice for this hotel. Lots of palm trees. It has a lazy river, which is a treat.

The thing about Monte Carlo is that it openly admits that it's about perceived luxury on a budget. It's the godsend for midwesterners coming to Vegas and wanting to experience a European style resort and accommodations without having to break the bank. Unfortunately, the whole European theme really ends on the exterior. No theme is carried into the hotel itself.

While not the worst place on the strip, it definitely has seen better days. I can't imagine what it's like staying at Monte Carlo at the moment, with the CityCenter construction going full blast next door. The noise must be so awful.

Had a business trip this week and got Bed Bugs. When I told guest services they denied it. I have never ever been so humiliated!
On the Travelocity review page another guest in September 2016 said they had been bitten by Bedbugs as well. Nothing was done about it. PLEASE READ OTHER BEDBUG PROBLEMS with the Monte Carlo. 
There is another review that said he got bedbugs from there as well. I was in room 8-114.
Lori with Guest Services there are three people now that said they have gotten bit by BEDBUGS at the MONTE CARLO LAS VEGAS

You know what, I love the Monte Carlo. 

It's not super crowded so I got to play tables and slots without having to fight for a spot and the tables had low limits. 
The rooms were great! But it doesn't really matter because if you're like me, you don't spend a lot of time in the room. 

There is a Mexican restaurant in the hotel that had AMAZING chips. 

The hotel is in the middle-ish of the strip so you can easily walk to the other hotels.  
The crowd is mostly older, middle aged types? But pricing was good. 

Aside from one really horrible dealer who was just damn mean, everyone else was nice! I learned how to play craps here!

This is our go to hotel when visiting Vegas, but after this weekends visit we were so disappointed. The hotel is under construction, which means no pool and bare minimum rooms. They offer free passes to MGM and Mandalay Bay pools, which seems good until you actually have to make the trek there and back with your stuff. Unless you're going to a show at T-Mobile arena or The Park, it's not worth staying here.

If you want to stay at a Days Inn or Travel lodge and want to be over charged Monte Carlo is the place for you. Aside from the Bell Desk and Sasha at the pool, the rest of the staff is rude, unprofessional, and needs serious courses in customer service.  The front desk straight up lie to your face when your room will be ready and speak very contending. Yes I am talking about you Cici.  The room itself was dirty and we found evidence of prior guests in there.  There were holes in the bed linen and towels. When you call to address the issues no one seems to care.  The air conditioning was not working and they could not fix and there was no resolution to the problem. The walls are paper thin.  
At check out talked to front agent Thomas. He was rude and didn't even seem to care we had issues. Will never stay here again as the staff needs serious help.  Rude nasty and disgusting is how I would describe this place.

Leaving a review for checking  in. Julius was awesome! He was fast and courteous, making sure we were good before we left the check in desk. Exceptional  customer service!!! Hope everyone gets julius when you check in!

Stayed here a couple days and wasnt bad for some walls and a bed. The steak house is really good, cant go wrong with that. Enjoyed there cigar lounge which is a very nice and relaxing place. The resort fee is pretty muh a joke.

Very pleased with Monte Carlo.  The staff (valet, concierge, bell desk, front desk) were all friendly and helpful.  They went out of their way to ensure we had what we needed and knew where we were going.  For $75 we had a large strip view room with 2 double beds.  No fridge or microwave, but I'm sure upon request they can deliver them to the room.  The room was very clean upon arrival.  Checkout was extremely easy and I was able to do so on my phone.  I would have given them 5 stars, but to be fair, I only stayed one night and did not utilize housekeeping.  I cannot rate on the service other than upon arrival.  Free USA Today papers available at the elevator lobbies.  Monte Carlo has a free tram that goes to the Bellagio.  I was happy I see that as the water show and gardens at Bellagio are my favorite to see.  I will be returning to Monte Carlo!

No Pool due to renovations
No Poker Room
No Steakhouse
24 hr. Store has obscene prices
Long hotel check in line. (Always)
Rooms AC blew warm air. Engineer said he fixed it and it was now blowing cold. Went back to room and still blowing warm. Had to change rooms.
I was told I had two free buffets a day. On my last day Ibwent to. Real fast way before check out time and my room was charged for the breakfast buffet. 
Presented $130 worth of chips to Casino cashier, she handed me $120 in cash. I took three steps walking away and realized it. Still had money in my hand. Refused to give me the $10 until they did a count at the end if shift. 
Supervisor said she would definitely call my cell at around midnight. She never called me. I got a message on my room phone at 6:30AM  the next day saying they did in fact shirt me $10 and come down to get it. 
Also when I asked them to check the camera tape when it first happened, they said no, not for $10
Only good thing is the Casino has Carribean Stud.
I won't be back

We stayed here during the week and it was perfect for our trip. It was an awesome location and the price was perfect. We didn't want to pay top dollar for a hotel that we basically were only going to be sleeping in but didn't want to stay in a "flea bag" hotel. 

The room was in good condition and was very comfortable. At least two of the days we were there, we hung out at the pool. The lazy river is the best but it can get a little crowded at some points. I also recommend, if you are looking for a quick bite instead of running around town looking for food, try "The Pub" the burgers were yummy and you can not beat their happy hour.

This place sucks. Hear for work and they are blasting music at the pool area that I can't think through it so loud. Called the front desk several times, every time they said midnight it was ending.... they lied. It went on forever. This hotel is old, dirty and sucks.

Cons: 
motel-style rooms with no ammenities 
bad views
broken machines
Bad WiFi signal
nobody winning in the casino
grumpy staff
confusing layout
weak drinks

Pros:
Only had to stay one night
The room was decent however they do need to do maintenance to the entire building . The window from the room was very dirty. Overall Comfortable stay

Right now probably is not the best time to visit Monte Carlo as their is constant construction going on, inside and outside of the hotel.  First off, the self-parking is non-existent so you have to valet.  I believe there is a tiny lot between MC and NYNY but it is usually full.  Entering the hotel from the valet, you will be at the front desk\/lobby which is nice and convenient.   Check in is a breeze and the hotel elevators are located very near the check-in desk.  I'm not sure why this hotel receives such low ratings on the rooms but I found mine to be very nice, clean and had a nice view of the north side of the strip.   Over I oversaw the pool and the construction, I heard NO NOISE at all.  The only downside to the room were the super THIN walls.  I could hear the people next door talking and screaming about some stupid crap that isn't it worth me writing to ya'll about.  Besides that, the room is spacious but not as big as the higher end hotels.  With the price offered on promo deals, you can't really complain about that.  I uploaded a picture of the view from my room on the 29th floor \/w construction.  

There aren't too many reviews of the casino, so i'll go ahead and mention that it isn't really all that great.  They offer the usual games.  Blackjack shoe game is decent with surrender option and 3-2 payout.  Penetration isn't all that great for those that understand.  Single deck bj game is the usual crap 6-5...etc.  They have two mini-baccarat games and a few more in the high limit section.  Slots were pretty tight  too.  

The pool was decent but not as good as the ones at MGM, Mandalay etc.  I liked their lazy river but there are too many damn kids around so they definetly need to add an ADULT pool!!!  Lastly, I want to mention the SPA here.  I didn't get any special treatments besides getting a free entrance for the steam\/sauna\/gym.  It is nothing special and actually pretty crappy.  Think about going into 24 hour fitness and using their steam and sauna rooms...its about the same!

The PROS!

Okay I like the casino, I like the sports book, roomy enough, a lot of comfortable seats, their pleasure pit, has a couple of hotties and some not much, so it's hit and miss, but the dealers are pretty damn friendly...and if Marino(a dealer) is reading this, LA rocks...screw boston and miami...he's a major LA hater and i enjoy the banter we had back and forth...and if Franchesca is reading this...'How ya doin, more beads please'. I liked the casino, there's an easy accessed food court for quick food on the go.

Cons! - I wasn't a fan of the room, after having stayed at better hotels, this is not keeping up with the times. I'd like more pillows on my bed and atleast an LCD TV, even a small one, if you're going to compete with the other places, you'll need more than that old 20" TV out of a cabinet that looks like it was in "The Lion, The Witch, and the Wardrobe". When I entered the room it had just 2 pillows on the bed, I'm thinking...seriously? I am more comfortable at home, the whole point of going away from home is to be MORE comfortable...it's a getaway! Not a somewhere to settle and sleep!

This place was okay, only reason I stay here is the comps I get, otherwise I really wouldn't pay for this place full price...

ABSOLUTELY THE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD AT A VEGAS HOTEL TO DATE!

First off the check in policy was miserable.  The line was ungodly long while a manager (Clayton) just sat on his computer and was supposedly doing "reservations" and stated how he was understaffed -- THEN HELP YOUR STAFF!  I asked for an upgrade which was immediately given to me to their newly renovated rooms on the 19th floor.  FYI - it was 109 degrees in Vegas and the air conditioning was not spectacular.  

I booked through expedia and got an email a few days later after the booking about how the hotel was under construction for the pool and we'd have access to the MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay pools - OK cool! No big deal.  Also - it is impossible on expedia and the monte carlo site to even find where it says its under construction.  On Monte Carlo after looking forever it is under terms and conditions - NO one reads that unfort.

Come Monday morning at 7AM there was they loudest sound of someone drilling that sounded like it was coming through the door.  They were doing construction on the rooms around us which by the way is not written anywhere on expedia or monte carlo site saying the rooms were being worked on.  I called down and they offered ear buds which was not going to block out how loud this was - it was brutal.  Then they could switch our rooms.

I go downstairs around 9 since I couldn't take the noise or hear my friends sitting next to me to talk.  I waited in a long ass line and tried to get moved to a different hotel or room - They couldn't do a different hotel.  They moved us up several floors - I walk into that room and it smells like someone just smoked 18 packs of cigarettes in there....I call down to Renata at the front desk who was very helpful the first time and they tell me they can't put her on even though she said to ask for her. She also returned my resort fee which I thanked for since well there was no resort to enjoy.  I went down again and waited in another over 20 min line to tell her about the room.  I called expedia to cancel the last night as I wanted to book a different hotel with nicer staff and ones that actually do their damn job.  The hotel said no to them and would penalize me for an early check-out - ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS.  I moved rooms again and spent the last night there.  

I will never stay here and suggest nobody else does either.  It is the worst hotel there.

Although not memorable, this was a comfortable hotel to stay in and had a great location.  The rooms were standard - clean, but nothing special. I was disappointed that there were no refrigerators in the rooms, although free wifi was offered in each room. This hotel is one of the more standard hotels on the strip - lack of cool themed decor, but well equipped with a casino and food court. 

The location of this hotel is excellent - it is walkable from the convention center (although it requires a longer 30+ min walk), and is very close to the lively areas of the strip. There is a free tram that will take you from Monte Carlo to the Aria (where you can then transfer onto a tram to Bellagio), which is very convenient, especially on cold days. Otherwise, it is very easy to walk from this hotel to the other major hotels on the strip. 

The hotel was under construction during the time of our stay. We were given a paper that stated that construction was scheduled on Mon-Fri from 9-5pm. However, construction definitely began earlier than the specified time on some days. If you are a light sleeper, call ahead to check on the construction status prior to booking.

If you want to stay on the strip and not having to break the bank, Monte Carlo is your place.

The staff are friendly and courteous. We checked in around midnight and since we were in a city that never sleeps, we had to wait in line for quite a bit. Luckily, check-in was a breeze and off we were to our room, tired and exhausted from our drive.

Our room looked pretty outdated. It was simple, two beds, a tv, dresser, writing desk and a chair. The overall interior was kind of depressing to me with the curtain and carpet color. Oh and walls are really thin between the rooms. Our next door neighbor was not a happy camper after hearing my toddler's cries. It was classy of them to bang our walls and let us know. 

The bathroom was spacious, complete with basic toiletries and again, outdated. Housekeeping didn't replace our shampoo and conditioner the next day nor were there any complimentary bottles of water for drinking on our first day. We had to find a cart on our floor to ask for some. Meanwhile, flushing the toilet makes this loud obnoxious noise which can be annoying especially when you're asleep and someone uses the bathroom at night. 

Here we are finally having our much needed rest and the smoke detector starts sending off a chirping sound every 3-5 seconds. We called it in and they say the battery needs changing. We had to wait a good half hour before someone came to our room to fix it. Not a very good first night...chirp...chirp...chirp!

Morning came and I'm just glad the hotel houses a Starbucks along with other fast food eateries such as Subway and Sbarro. All I wanted was my caffeine before hitting the buffets so that was a good start.

I can't say much about their casino as I don't gamble but Ignite Bar has happy hour from midnight to 2am on weekdays. It's located right at the Las Vegas Blvd. entrance of the hotel in the casino area. For other entertainment, check out their deals for The Blue Man Group show. 

They were nice enough to give us a late check-out 'til noon. When checking out, you can either do it the old-fashioned way or check-out via your room TV. It's faster and more convenient compared to lining up at the front desk. 

Would I come back? If the price is right, yes! Located on the strip with a tram that connects to CityCenter and Bellagio, their location is pretty much their saving grace. Valet is free but can take a while during peak hours. I'm all for walking to the garage to burn off all the buffet food!

We just came back from the Monte Carlo today. I don't really have any complaints.. There is some stuff that needs taken care of and its the rooms. They're out dated.. They need a make over.. The people at the front desk were very nice, especially Evelyn! She answered all our questions & was very helpful. I would definitely would stay again!

I'm kind of a snob when it comes to service.  I like it.  I expect it and I know when its sub par, as it is as the Monte Carlo.  I don't think I have unrealistic expectaitons either.  The most recent time I stayed there was my second time.  I chose to stay there again because the rooms were reasonably priced and the hotel is centrally located. 2 pluses.  My first stay there I was with a big group of friends and missed some of the details that I noticed the second time when it was just one other friend and myself.  There was no information about the spa in the hotel room.  When I called dow the the concierge I was told I could come down and get one if I wanted.  Additionally there was no entertianment guide or lsiting to show what the T.V. channels were.  Little details, I know.  But little details can add up to one big less than stellar experience.  Additionally, i found their Premium Steak House: Brand, over priced and the staff rude.  I ended up at Gallagher's Steakhouse at New York - New York Hotel & Casino and it was perfect. I'll be checking out another spot on the strip the next time I'm in Sin City.

We were traveling through Vegas for one night and got a good deal for a room. Good location on the Strip and parking was easy. The people working there were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel needs a facelift however. In the room: old furniture, outdated lamps, old shower head and well-used carpet and flooring. In the hallways: old carpeting and fixtures. For one night, it was fine and the deal was good.

This is my second time staying at Monte Carlo...last time ive stayed here was about 3 years ago before the renovations to the shops and etc. Plus its also  because i went to bigger hotels like cosmo to stay at  (yes i am quite bougie on hotel rooms- dont hate :P )..esp if i can spend a lil more..i would get much more amenties. 

 My last stay 3 years ago wasnt so bad and it was quite decent at a fair price. I never mind it because it wasnt a circus circus. So for this past stay...my bf and i decided to a trip to LV on a spontaneous\/just because trip. Price was fair around 114 bucks for two nights..not including the annoying $20 resort fee. I did recieve 2 buffet passes since i booked it on expedia and their big belly buffet is amazing! even better than the higher end buffets like aria's. 

the front desk was very personable and friendly...i love it when i can get great customer service and have a mini convo rather than a angry chick typing away and youre silent for 15 mins. at first she said there was no room availiable for a 1 king bed...which i found a lil weird because i arrived around 230 so yes its a half an hour early but not even a common room like that? i guess. they only had a double bed open and i asked if i were to upgrade to a suite how much it would be...but it wasnt really much a discount..even though i was willing to pay for a upgrade..just didnt seem worth it because i felt as if it wasnt a great of a discount..if i went on expedia.com then yeah maybe.  i asked how long it would take for my original standard king bed room would be and she said "oh it could be hours and hours."

wth. why in the world would be hours and hours?! thats cray. mhm, i went there..a lil ghetto in me came out.

so i was getting frustrated because it was like going back and forth with options. she looked further into her computer and found a king sized bed but it was a handicapped version of it out of nowhere. i didnt get how it just magically opened up but i took it because i didnt want to wait for hours and i wanted to get my drink on already.

the room was average, better than tropicana, better than excalibur's...one lamp had a lightbulb out, rusty stains in the bathroom, keyboard for the tv didnt work, one of the comforters had a torn hole in them, toliet and bathtub water pressure were super hard! (it was scary flushing your shit down because it felt like it would suck your ass and whole body too!), and other small cosmetic flaws...but even with that i was okay with it because like i said it was a just because trip and it wasnt like i was celebrating an anniversary or a bday..so for the price thats what i got. 

the hotel was at a great location in my opinion..in middle, we used the tram everyday of our trip..great transportation, shops are decent, buffet is amazing, clean casino, clean rooms, self parking lot was breeze (minus the construction) and a good atmosphere..i just wished there was a lil more to see.

i would love to try their hotel 32 if i could afford it one day haha.

My buddies and I stayed here over Super Bowl 50 weekend and we were quite pleased with the hotel component of our stay. Check-in was fast and the front desk agent did a great job explaining where everything was to us. We stayed in room 15-313 and we were satisfied with our room selection (two queens). The room had a semi-strip view, you could see Outback Steakhouse and Coca-Cola World from the window. Our room was not luxurious but it was clean and no appliances were broken.  I am actually thinking about booking my next Vegas visit at the Monte Carlo. 

The only aspect of the Monte Carlo I had was with some of the dealers. My buddies and I gambled a lot there and encountered many friendly dealers. But three of the most darn awful dealers I met were these African women (Not African-American) and they were absolutely inadequate at their job. They would make many dealing mistakes, refuse to own up to it and get mad at you for confronting them about it.

case 1) Free Bet Blackjack: Dealer pushes on all hard 22s.
After all the players made the decisions, the African dealer exposed an A,2 as her cards. Her next card was a 9 for a 12\/22. She automatically pushes the hand, at which point I confront her about having to take another card because it's only a 12. She rejects my claim and I request a manager. She responds with a NO, and immediately discards the cards in the tray. 

case 2) Free Bet Blackjack: You have to make certain hand signals when you want a "free bet" for your double down or split.
This different African dealer had made a number of mistakes already, resulting in the pit boss coming to check on her a few times. Players would make the appropriate double down hand signal for a 9\/10\/11 and she would sometimes give out the next card, forgetting to put out the FREE BET coin. On the second time this happened to me, she claimed I didn't give the appropriate hand signal. With the support of the entire table, I argued I had and she was mistaken. Again, she was adamant that she was correct and she refused to give me a FREE BET coin or call the pit boss over. 

Over the next two days, I would receive this same type of attitude from these African women dealers, nobody else. By the second day, I made it a point not to play with any of these dealers because it was just uncomfortable.

Monte Carlo is located right next to the Aria Hotel & Casino, so you could walk there in 2-3 minutes easily. There is also a free tram that will take you to the Bellagio too. The Monte Carlo does not offer much in terms of restaurants and luxury, but they provide a clean and comfortable atmosphere for their guests to stay and gamble at.

We just went to celebrate our birthday this weekend my husband and I
We usually always stay at the Mandalay this time we decided to try something new so we stayed at Monte Carlo we do have to say that we really enjoyed the pool with the waves along with the DJ but either than that the pool chairs were position in an awful format 
We enjoyed the night club diablos
But if you are a person that cares about the actual room stay it was really outdated the bathtub  was really disgusting to be honest the furniture is really outdated bathrooms are small
The molding around the room was really old and moldy
Bath tub was rotted around it was gross 
We will be back at the Mandalay next time around
Oh and our original booking was for a king room
We got a double queen

To Be honest I expected a little more for the price I paid. I paid almost $400 dollars for 1 night 3 adults & 2 queen beds. One of the beds seemed to be broken from the bottom so my parents had difficulties sleeping comfortable because the bed was hurting there back, the bathroom was not the nicest some of the bathtub and walls seemed to be peeling off, honestly it was kind of disgusting to even shower or use the restroom. The pool was dirty and full of tree leaves. Not my first choice next time I go to Vegas
Worst hotel ever! So old and dirty. This is the hotel on strip, but it's not even comparable to small hotels like Days Inn or motel room

3.5 Stars

We only stayed here for one night. There was a convention in town so a lot of the 4* properties on the Strip were starting at a rack rate of $200\/night. I was debating between Planet Hollywood or Monte Carlo. Monte Carlo won out because it was next to the hotel we were staying for Fri-Sat. A few years back, I had a former manager who had extended stays there whenever he was in Vegas and he said it was a nice hotel, so that kind of sealed the deal. I had read recent TripAdvisor reviews regarding the construction, so I shelled out $94 for a high floor room and added a request for a quiet room. I also noted that we were celebrating our 10th anniversary in hopes that the Front Desk agent would accommodate our request.

We arrived around 2pm and the check-in line was lengthy, but they had plenty of Front Desk agents and a floor manager to expedite the process, so we probably spent about 5-7 minutes in line. Our Front Desk agent, Crystal, was friendly and personable, assigning us a room overlooking the pool area on the 31st floor. 

There is a $28\/night resort fee. The resort fee was getting popular when I last visited Vegas 5 years ago. It's here to stay, folks. Even when you're booking through Priceline or Expedia it clearly says there is a resort fee that you pay separately. The resort fee for the Monte Carlo included: 2 bottles of Monte Carlo water, 2 vouchers for a drink at Ignite Bar (up to $12 in value) or a tea or coffee drink at Samba Latte, excluding taxes and gratuity. You also have access to the gym and a free newspaper, which is located by the elevators on each floor. Wired internet is also included. I'm not sure if pool or spa access is included, but the pool was closed for the winter, so that wasn't applicable for us.

Wired internet was no problem and was actually preferred! My boyfriend is a bit of techie and had purchased a Mini Pocket Router prior to our trip. Plug this into a wired connection and it allows you to set up a wireless hot spot. From this we were able to connect our phones and iPad to wifi in our room. He brought the Chromecast which we then used to stream shows he had put on the iPad onto the TV.

Being as I, too, work in luxury hospitality, and in the spa\/health club department at that, I kind of understand the Vegas resort fee and wished my hotel in DC did that--it would go a long way in maintenance during slow months when we didn't have a lot of revenue coming in from services. However, asides from a USA Today and the internet, we did not utilize anything else. The free water? I thought it would come at turn down service, but they don't do that here. The drink vouchers? Never got around to using them, so left them with our cash tip to the housekeeper at the other hotel we stayed at. Thus, the resort fee did not hold much value for us at all.

The room itself was no-frills and is in need of an update. Even the "Go" rooms at the Flamingo are more modern--and the Flamingo is about as cheesy as it gets on the Strip! I think Engineering had shut off the water to our floor because when we attempted to run hot water from the faucet, it would sputter. No hot water would come out, but cold water would be available. Eventually towards the evening, the hot water returned. No issues with hot water for the shower the following day. There was decent water pressure, though the shower head is quite low, so tall people beware! On a final note, we slept soundly and did not hear any construction noise at all. Additionally, we dined at Yusho, which was excellent, though on the pricey side. Check-out was seamless via the Express Check-out kiosks. It clearly outlined the charges and uses the credit card you provided for incidentals at check-in. It also emails the final invoice to you, as well.

Location: Excellent

Rooms: Could use a rehab 

Price: Good value for standard rooms starting at $85

Resort Fee: Not much of a value--they could lower it to $15-20 to include internet, gym access, and 2 drink vouchers for bottled water, coffee\/tea, or drinks. Save money and paper and don't bother with the newspaper subscriptions. Purchasing Department wouldn't have to order as many cases of water, either.

Had the worst experience ever! I booked my suite over a month ahead of time for my boyfriend's bday celebration. We arrived on a Friday and checked in at 2:45pm. At check In they said our room would not be ready until 5pm! I had dinner reservations and had to get ready. We killed time by getting something to eat. We came to check up at 4pm to see if our room was ready or to request a new room. According to them everything was book. After 10 minutes they claimed our room was ready. We rushed to our room to find the door wide open and a maid still cleaning the floor which had a big spilled wine looking stain on it. We had to wait an additional 20 minutes outside. After we walked in we both took our shoes off and walked right over the stain and the carpet was soaked!. We immediately went downstairs and switched us to another room (I was told 30 minutes before that everything else was booked!!) Once we got our other room we only had a 1 person Jacuzzi, not a 2 person Jacuzzi just how it states on their website, the living room was full of crumbs and there were ashes in the front rest room with garbage on the floor, the upholstered chairs had huge dark, nasty stains on them and our view sucked. We were already too exhausted to go complain again so we waited until the following morning. After I spoke to the manager they had no other room to switch us into so they sent up maids to address the issues and they replaced our chairs. The manager claimed and admitted that their hotel is in desperate need of renovations which actually will be started next year. The sofa was extremely stained and we found baby toys and so much garbage under the cushions. By the 2nd day the rest room stopped working. Wifi does not work! You get no cell phone reception in your rooms! Our drinks took 1 day and a half to finally cool in the mini fridge. The room is really dark and the 3 lamps they have in there barely give you lighting. The wet bar area has plenty of lightning but does not extend to the living room. One lamp in living room makes no difference at all. On a plus side room service was fast, maids cleaned up restrooms and made our bed really well during our stay. The manager at the front desk was really helpful and quick to solve the issues we found in our room but I felt like half the time I was in Vegas I was at the front desk complaining about a new issue I found. Having paid for a "suite" I was really surprised of the condition of the room it was in and all the issues it had with it. I did not use their pool or gym but the buffet was good and the casino area was good and plenty availability for slot machines and tables. I would not go back there again.

Monte Carlo has always been my go to place if I need a room along the strip without breaking the bank.  Being an M Life Member gets me a lot in one of the MGM properties including Monte Carlo.

You have very helpful casino staff, helpful Hotel Management Staff and a good concierge service.  I always stay in there SPA or Monaco Suites and I love the spacious rooms and the way they are strategically placed in the hotel and is easy access to the elevators.

I hear 2014 is a big year for an update.  So I am excited to see what is in store for Monte Carlo.

I have been here more than 20x - so yeah you can say I have seen them grow and improve through the years.

I like the hotel they were pretty nice there but the environment seems more family oriented there were no clubs in the hotel. I guess this would be a great hotel for families but not for friends trying to party. The buffet was also mediocre.

Great experience overall. Great price directly  booked on hotel website. Upgraded on check in to high floor strip view. I'm sure the guy would've done the suite free, but we checked in at 4 AM, and there are no available suite upgrades that time of AM. slip the guy a $10 or $20 anyway. Good Karma to begin your stay. rooms are clean and comfortable although a bit dated as other reviews mention. But what do you need?fancy, useless Dark wood and alabaster bidet? the marble tile is a bit worn the grout is coming out, the showers a bit hokey but the beds are comfortable, and that's the most important thing. Room superclean and comfortable with a great view, at a great price, with a great location. Everyone from the hotel operator, to the cocktail waitresses, to the bartenders, to desk agent, to the restaurant staff were extremely friendly, call you by name and do everything possible to make you happy. this is the kind of place I like to stay. I've to inspected Aria, Bellagio Venetian Caesars Palace Trump, MGM is the worst, those places are super shiny, super fancy and have to many people pretending to have too much money. Monte Carlo is just right - it's very nice comfortable clean, just big enough you can have a lot of fun and just small enough you don't get lost don't have to walk too far and it's the perfect center strip hotel with easy access to everything. Clientele are mostly young people not too many pretty women, lots of frumpy looking guys from out of town but, that's Vegas right? Have a good time and remember - always bet on red! Cheers.

I was really impressed with MC and so was my husband. We stayed in the spa room for  our honeymoon and it was so luxurious and beautiful. The room was so nice, clean, and overlooked the strip. The spa tub was nice and really big. We heard mixed reviews about this place, but the price was great and I really can't find anything to complain about. The valets were quick and really nice. The M life site wasn't up so we had to call in all of our receipts which kind of sucked, but no biggie. I loved this hotel and will stay here again for sure!

I was at the Monte Carlo to meet up with some people to eat at the buffet. I have stayed at the MC and I have to say the suites are AWESOME! They big and spacious with great views. And the bathrooms are choice! The casino is on the smaller side, but there are some awesome places to hang out, like diablo's or the steakhouse inside (I forgot the name). Anywho, the buffet on the other hand, sucks. It's pretty run of the mill fair, so I would recommend to check out some of the newer hotels' buffets.

Monte Carlo Hotel is older, so my experience at this hotel was average. Considering that I've stayed at the Trump Hotel on the Strip, Monte Carlo looks ancient. 

Pros:
- On the Strip.
- You can take a tram to go to Aria and\/or Bellagio.
- Toiletries, hair dryer, safe, coffee maker, two free bottles of water.
- Cheap for $60\/night as our conference had a special promotion for registered participants.

Cons:
- No wifi. I was on the 18th floor and I had to use an Ethernet cable to get Internet. I paid $20 for a resort fee, and they should have wifi! 
- Tub needed to be replaced as there were cracks. 
- Even though this hotel is eco-friendly, Housekeeping still replaced my towels even though they were on the racks. What is the point of posting a sign to not replace towels if Housekeeping isn't going to follow it? 
- Bed was old. I can feel the springs.

Pretty standard.  The room and pool area are nice.  It didn't break the bank.  There was construction going on when we stayed there but it didn't bother us.  If you can score a good rate I recommend it.

This hotel and casino is okay for its location. Hell it is on the strip.  I have managed to get some really good room deals. If you are experiencing Vegas correctly, you really don't need your room for more than to shower and maybe catch a few winks.  My main objective was to save $$ money this trip and spend it on other activities.

I ate at the Chinese restaurant and fast food food court. The brewery pub plays hip hop on the weekends. Best advice is to get there early for drinks and avoid the line.
