I have stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo Las Vegas numerous times, and I'm ready to move on to other hotels.  Its outdated, the food at the main cafe and buffet are so-so, however the rates were pretty fantastic.  Compared to the other hotels, especially the newest arrivals, it shows its age.  

However, I do like it that the concierge will put hotel guests on the VIP list to get into Haze, and other nightclubs in the vicinity.  That was a cool feature we appreciate, and at no cost to the concierge for to get in.  

If its deals you are looking for, and "decent" rooms, it is worth looking into.

(Visit in mid March 2008) Room was super cheap.  Smoking rooms have the best views of the strip - my husband and I got a stinky smoking (not knowing) room to stay near our friends' other rooms... Our rooms were at the end of the tower and that is quite a walk from the elevator...

Pros: location, our floor wasn't super busy, not many children around

Cons: Non smoking rooms opposite of the strip had TERRIBLE construction noise

It was clean enough and the rooms were decent. I kind of liked the view of New York New York and MGM from our window. My parents made the mistake of staying at Circus Circus last time and they were much happier this time around. The room was clean and it was mostly quiet, except that I didn't really like how thin the walls were. We didn't hear much, but it was very loud whenever a "neighbor" was coming\/going and the first night there was a person with a nasty cough near-by (that wasn't fun to listen to now and again). The bedding was.... fine. Nothing fancy, but it was clean and that's all I cared about. The pillows weren't super comfortable so my parents were a little grumpy about that (while it wasn't as big a deal to me).

The rates were great and it was a good place to stay with the family. They didn't have any of the really cool shows or bars, so it seemed like a lot of the patrons (and especially those that stuck around during the day\/night) were of the 40+ variety that were looking to gamble (as they drank and\/or smoked - lots of smoking in the casino). The nice thing was that you could go right or left on the Strip and really quickly get to some fun stuff.

Shopping: The "street of dreams" stores and the pub seemed to be closed every time I headed into that direction. That was weird.

Show tickets: You can get show tickets at the concierge desk, but they recommended that I go to the actual hotel because they said the computer picks out the "best seat" in the front or back area (whichever you choose), but you won't know your actual seat until you get there if they're the ones that do it.

Internet use: People with laptops can get it for $15\/day in their room, or there are these old school machines in the lobby that are 25 cents a minute (with a $5 min). I didn't need to get online for that long, but I needed to check grades so I figured I might as well use up all the time I got for that $5.

The only real issue we had was related to housekeeping. When we left for the day, we put all our dirty towels that we wanted them to take on the floor. When my mom came back and went to dry her hands, she realized that they gave us two new towels and also hung up two wet ones..... one was dirty and wet, the other one was just a little wet. What the heck??? Right away we went down to the Check-In area and let them know about it. The woman there (Angela?) was very apologetic and ended up offering us a free trip to their buffet (first she looked to give us some money, but we had already pre-paid everything and didn't have a card on the room, so that was a no-go). We didn't particularly want to go back to the breakfast buffet, but we figured it'd be a good idea to do that before we take off (and have it be free instead of about $41).

Then we headed upstairs to take down the dirty towels and encountered housekeeping.... who (after asking if we were the people that complained) tried to tell us that the towels they hung up were all clean. Wtf? I didn't feel the towels, but I trust my mom's judgment on that a lot more than a stranger. Sorry, lady..... but that was weird. At that point I kind of wished I could just get some clean towels from them and have them leave.

Over-all..... I'd consider staying here again if I ever return to Vegas.
worst hotel ever!! Always have a horrible experience!! they don't even deserve a star!

My first stay here last weekend...I was on the wall whether to give em 4 stars...but I settled with 3 and here's why.....

Hotel is nice and clean..of course one of the older hotels on the strip, ESPECIALLY being next to the new City Center.
_Front Desk girl that checked me in could have been a little more approachable and friendly
_Deluxe room was like any other, except that they should DEFINITELY upgrade their old school tubey tv's to nice flat screen plasmas or somethin...get with it MC!
_Water pressure in the shower was a little TOO hard for my liking...but it felt nice on my back.
_We had a few ppl in our hallway were smokin a little grass ALL WEEKEND LONG...and swore that it was not seeping from under the door....COME ON!!!! hopefully they got fined
_Though their convenient store is 24 hours, which is definitely a plus, but a $7 bag of Sun Chips?!!?!?!? get outta here!
_The Big Chill or the Chill frozen drink store was NOT OPEN after 8pm..or at least from whenever I went to get one...so thanks a lot for stoppin by BUZZ!!! had to get my frozen daquiri\/margarita fix elsewhere!
_Diablos was dead...not what it LOOKS to be.  Last call @ 9:30pm? WOW! 

Now, there were a few things i loved about this hotel, and i do stress FEW.
_Location is perfect! right across from PH where i'm always at for Happy Hour @ the Halo Bar and eating up samiches from the Earl of Sandwich
_Their McDonalds in the food court serves a 50 piece chicken nugget meal, with 2 large drinks and 2 large fries for 14.99!!! 
_LOW RATES! cant beat that especially around the holidays

Would i stay here again? No.  I would ONLY CONSIDER this place if I WAS BROKE and if i came with a whole bunch of other broke ppl LOL.
No Wifi!!! Yellowed dingy towels!!! No room service menus in room!!! Motel 6? Nope! Monte Carlo! Im a business traveler here too. Come on Monte Carlo!!

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Vegas or anywhere in the world! Air conditioner didn't work in room, just 115 degrees in Vegas, so room was to hot to get ready for function I came to Vegas for! Maintenance finally came and changed filter that had over an inch of dirt on it! Filth! Mold all over in bathroom! NO clock in room, no coffee pot in room, no refrigerator in room, no bottled water in room! They do not take care of this property, and never told pool was closed when making reservations, yet they expect you to pay the so called " Resort Fee"! This is NO resort! A filthy dump!

We stayed starting on 1.24 through today, the 27th. Our entire stay has been very pleasurable. We stood in line for early check in at nine and got really lucky to have a room available to us immediately. The room was easy to find and was clean. Even with construction going on below us, the view is still amazing. Housekeeping is always nice to us. And they cleaned our rooms back to the way they were when we first walked in. They have respect for your own belongings left in the room. The price is pretty decent considering everything included, not to mention the location. 
The concierge was extremely helpful. Me and my husband have called them several times for help with things such as tickets and questions. They offered to print off our show tickets to see carrot top. And it was a quick process. The staff every where is super friendly. 

We would definitely stay here again.
The hotel is under construction including the bedroom.  We could hear the jack knives at 8am drilling and making a lot of noise. It will be over a year before the project is done. Do not stay here!

The Monte Carlo is one of the older "classic" hotels on the North Strip and it could definitely use an upgrade.  

The lobby is definitely missing the wow factor that you get when you step into some of the other hotels. The rooms are decent enough but pale in comparison to the newer hotels on the Strip.  The size of the bathroom was adequate and the bed was really comfy.  We also received two complimentary buffet passes when we checked in and they could be used at a couple different buffets.

The staff was friendly but the check in desk needs some sort of organization - it literally is a free for all the way that it's set up now.

The best thing about the Monte Carlo is the tram that connects it to City Center and the Bellagio, and it's F-R-E-E.

Rooms can be on the inexpensive side, wait for a deal.

I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time ever on the 29th floor. The view....awesome! The hotel is nice however, it does need a bit of a face lift in the rooms. One of the bed linens was torn. The room did not have a "Do Not Disturb" tag anywhere. 
The big issue I had is with noise. There was a big gap under the room-connecting door. The people staying in the room next to mine decided to have a VERY loud conversation in the early morning. I could also hear the TV at a low volume. Not good when you're trying to sleep! The walls are very thin. I could hear every time a person walked past the door.

This place is a great value. The decor is plain in the rooms but it is affordable. I liked the location how is it is central on the strip and had good restaurants. A tram even goes there.

All the staff we encountered were super nice. Stay here! I went here with my fam.

Well, what can I say except less than impressed.  We knew it was a little older hotel going into it and that there would likely be some things that needed updated, but the cleanliness (or lack of) surprised us.  My husband and I couldn't afford to go anywhere too fancy for our honeymoon so the travel agent set us up at the Monte Carlo.  I'll start at the beginning.  It's not bad at all when you walk in.  In fact, it's quite nice!  The line to check in was about as long a line as I had EVER seen and took about 45 min. to get through, but that's ok, we had no agenda for the trip so we had time and didn't mind.  We were set up in a Monaco Suite on the 6th floor.  We also set up to upgrade to a spa room two days later when one became available for an add'l $50\/nite.  

Once we got to the room, upon first look it seemed older but not bad.  some of the furniture was older and the coffee table and nightstand had chips and pieces broken off, but it didn't bother us that much.  The carpet had some big black stains, but ok, we can live with that.  Once we started inspecting a little closer, tho, we weren't pleased.  The curtains had big round stains that looked like someone threw stuff at them.  All the pillows had yellow or black stains on the cases (not to mention the yellow staining under the cases!) and we had to call for new pillows.  the couch had some gross-looking stains that kept us from even sitting on it.  When we pulled back the covers on the bed, we found a couple of hairs.  We were tired and made the best of it for the first night, and at least we now had clean pillows.  

The next morning, however, we were done with that room.  We discovered some disgusting brown stains all over the ceiling of the bathroom that we were praying were water stains and not what we feared they were instead.  the loud neighbors and drunks coming home from the bars kept us up half the night.  We continued to find more and more cleanliness issues and we'd had enough.

Now, this is why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1.  Their service recovery was very good.  We called the first time and asked for a different room and the gal said she could get us into our spa room that day and discount our upgrade to only $30 add'l per nite.  i felt this was kind of dismal for the kind of problems we'd had, but we aren't the kind of ppl to make a big fuss just to get special treatment so we said fine.  They then called back later and apologized and comped us for our upgrade and asked if we could wait a little longer so they could wash and vacuum the carpets and make sure the room was clean.  This did impress us.

The spa room we moved into was better, definitely cleaner.  There were some issues, the wallpaper was stained and coming off in spots, the carpets still had black stains even after cleaning, the spa was not a spa at all but rather just a large tub, and there were hard water stains all over the marble around the tub, not to mention a point where the baseboards where severely warped and looked like someone had beat the crap out of them.  All in all, at least it was cleaner than the last room and we were happy for that.  The pillows and bed were clean too and no mysterious stains all over the place!

While their service recovery is very good and they did their best to give us a better experience on our honeymoon, we would likely not go back until they renovated or at least did better maintenance on their rooms, especially for the price we paid.
Perfect middle of the road place to stay and gamble in Vegas.  Clean rooms.  The crowd at the pool and in the casino is a little of everything and not a lot of the worst.

I give this place five stars. 
The casino is great! The rooms are cute. I have family at this location because of my wedding in a few days. And I'm in love with this place. Oh my the romantic views from the hotel rooms are boss. The room service is on point everyone is nice. And the casino I won X,Y, & Z. That's a lil change in my pocket lol. I don't want to go home I am addicted to this place.

I have always loved the Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino! The location is incredible- next door to New York NY (& now the Park & T Mobile Arena), across from MGM, next door to Aria and you can take a quick tram to Bellagio! Currently, it is undergoing renovations and so there are some growing pains and many restaurants are closed. But that really doesn't matter in Vegas since there are a million close by! Primrose Restaurant is still open in the lobby, and it overlooks the pool area for a garden feel (Check out my review for that separately).
Back to Monte Carlo- being under construction also means the casino isn't as big with as many options, but they still have the most popular games. My biggest concern with construction in the casino is that Monte Carlo used to be one of the least smoky casinos on the Strip. But with all the construction cutting off air flow, it's pretty stagnant. I'm going to hope that gets fixed when renovations are done. 
The Old Monte Carlo pool had a lush garden feel, wave pool, and lazy river. It was awesome. I'm disappointed to see they have taken all of that out and have very basic rectangular pools now. Boring- and bound to get crowded in the summer. Since I was there during offseason, I didn't get to experience it yet, but you can see the new pools from rooms & the tram. 
My room was PLUSH- I had a friend cancel last minute so I had to change my room, but got to see the double room before switching. They all have long velvet couches along the window- perfect for a nap, I know, I took one there! Furniture is modern and has definitely been updated. The room I got moved to was on a Stay Well floor which I experienced before at MGM. There's aromatherapy, air purifier, vitamin infused shower, etc etc. AMAZING! Worth asking for! I have asthma & a Stay Well Room is the key to keeping me feeling normal. Finally, Uber & Lyft pick up in the same area (just outer curb) as taxis at Monte Carlos. Most other Vegas hotels separate them & make rideshare pick up FAR away from front of hotel. 
I can't wait to go back & hopefully give MC (or the Park, depending when I get back) a 5 star rating.
Looking up from the lazy river and wave pool at the Monte Carlo. Get your dance, tan, and drink on!

Came here with my parents for a short Christmas vacation.

It's a small hotel on the strip.  Check in was easy and our rooms were in good condition.  The elevators have different sections for different sets of floors so no long lines for all floors at once.  The buffet lines and restaurants were not crowded at all.  This was especially helpful on Sunday where all the other hotels were crowded like an apocalypse bread line.  The fast food area and the convenience store was very close to the elevators which I liked.  Would definitely stay here again!

Monte Carlo reached out to me several days after I sent in my complaints via a survey after my hotel stay the other week, and gave me a refund to compensate me for the resort credit I mentioned in my previous post. This is the type of customer service they really needed when I was at the front desk. I will revise my review to a 3 star for now. 
If it weren't for the construction and remodeling of the pool, I would be glad to give a 3.5\/4 star review.
However, my friend and I did use the MGM Grand pool and enjoyed it very much during our time there. We rented a car, so it was no issue getting down a few blocks in the 115 degree heat.
I will most likely be back to Monte Carlo later this year after the generous offer they made afterwards to fix my issue.

I have stayed at many properties in LV, but this was my first time staying at the MC. I understood going in, this would be a moderate priced casino and most likely would receive a moderate room... The most important thing to me would be location, cleanliness, friendliness and comfort just to name a few things. I am used to staying at more of  a 4 or 5 star resort in vegas, so again for this trip I went with the flow and was open to what would be offered.

We checked in on a saturday late afternoon and it was a breeze, friendly front desk staff, quick and efficient. The lobby is pretty nice, clean and open. Once we received our room keys, we went to our room and along the way, noticed the horrible carpet leading to our room. I understand that renovations will be taking place and with that you can understand a certain level of restraint on fixing things but come on...this is not a motel nor should guests have to see plain stains in sight and rips in the carpet.

The room had 2 queen beds, where the sheets were clean and beds made well. The linens in the bathroom were cheap and never replaced the same during the trip (3 days). I asked for additional toiletries since ours were never filled right upon arrival as well. The shower is something to be desired. Horrible shower head and when trying to lift the lever to get all the water pressure possible, I almost broke the nozzle. So, I called the front desk and they had someone come up and fix it the next morning. The room was clean, but I have a problem with damaged end tables, a chair that has hanging threads underneath and somewhat broken, carpet that is worn and very dated furnishings at any price. I have to say at least the room was clean. Now, i would have loved fresh drinking glasses in my room as i used the 2 that were there upon arrival and not once were they removed or freshened with replacements.  I had a huge issue with a comment that another guest made to me randomly as I was getting off the elevator....this woman told me she found bed bugs! her room was changed and no further problems....YIKES!!!!! I almost checked out. So, I went to my room and ripped the sheets up and checked everything!!!!! all was good in my room. I did go to the front desk and i voiced my concern.....to my surprise, the front desk guest relations attendant did not deny or agree to this report and rather commented that this could be possible, but not THEIR fault if it was true.....REALLY???? not the answer I  was looking for.

The pool was super enjoyable, water temp perfect and we opted for renting the lounge chair set for 2. What an awesome experience. The server we had was awesome and super friendly! the drinks were delish and I loved the pool!

Casino was fun...not a big area at all. I won on the slots which was good, but table dealers ere terrible except for 1 dealer who was incredible, nice and friendly! The cocktail servers are almost non existent unless you get in an area where 1 happens to be working. Food options are  ok, I don't prefer food malls, but starbucks is important to me and they have 2 plus a great coffee shop as well. I recommend Diablo's for mexican and get the nachos...THEY ARE AMAZING! the buffet is cheap in quality and not too good in my opinion. 

If you want a great craft cocktail go to HIT bar, watch some pros in action and enjoy, they do a great job!

You can often get this hotel pretty cheap on websites like hotel.com, and it's nicer than other options in its lower price range. One big draw for me was that the casino wasn't smokey or smelly. It actually smelled good if you can believe that, but it's true. 

POOL: The pool area was busy, and there were several pool options, including a wave pool and a lazy river. It had a family-friendly-Holiday Inn vibe to it, even though there were a lot of drunk twenty-somethings wandering around. The hot tub was dominated by people who would've been great models for Ed Hardy swimwear. 

ROOMS: Our room was nice with traditional decor. Mostly simple with white and gold decorations. Our room was clean, and the bed was very comfy. On our floor, it was a mix of people wanting to party and families. 

FOOD: The location of Monte Carlo is convenient to a lot of food options, but if you ever get lazy, the buffet is good and the food court is convenient. 

DEAL OR NO DEAL: There is the most amazing slot machine ever--The Deal or No Deal Slot Machine--and there is always a long line to play it, but once you get in, it is really fun and pays out well (for the most part.) This elusive machine isn't found in many casinos in Las Vegas, but there is one machine at Monte Carlo.

I've never had a worse experience at a Las Vegas hotel. 

First of all, the construction. They did not tell us BEFORE we booked the room how obnoxiously loud it would be during the week days. They left us a note when we got there saying the noise would be "left to a minimum" and if a minimum means the sounds of a jackhammer right next to your face from 9 am - noon without interruption then then okay. 

They moved us to a different floor because of how absolutely ridiculous the sound was (there were about 50 people waiting down at guest services freaking out about the same thing when we went down) and we could still hear it from a room they told us would have no issue.

Guest services was basically unwilling to do anything in terms of making our experience there any better, which is completely unacceptable at almost $200\/night for a regular room. 

The food in the food court is pretty terrible. The table games are just okay. There's one $5 black jack table and good luck ever getting to play on it. There are VERY few waitressing going around to get people drinks while they are playing. 

Since there is construction there is no immediate pool for you to go, and they do tell you that you can use the MGM pool but that's ridiculously inconvenient, especially in 115 degree weather. 

The inside of the hotel is gross and outdated. Wallpaper is coming off of the walls, everything seems a little bit dirty, and the drawer space for a room that's supposed to fit four literally fit one person's luggage. I will say the beds are comfortable, but that's it. 

Also, the walls are PAPER thin. You will hear your neighbors conversations, and anybody walking through the hallway. 

There was also something massively wrong with the AC in this hotel because in both of our rooms it was unbelievably warm almost all the time. Other people in the hotel were also complaining of this. How are you not going to have good, working AC during the summer in the desert?!?

All in all, I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Pick literally ANY other hotel on the strip and save yourself the struggle.

Beware! We were slapped with an extra $211.23 in resort fees and taxes and parking for only 3 night stay. What's even more ridiculous is that we checked in just slightly before midnight (several flight delays) but we were still charged for resort fees and resort fee taxes for that day!  We had a very basic room - so basic there wasn't even a coffee maker.  Four of us shared a double room, but we were only given two sets of bath towels, and one bar of soap to share between the shower and sink.  The last day of our stay we did get another bar of soap, but never did get more towels.  Our room was actually very clean and well-kept. However the furniture was worn and the carpeting in such bad condition it had stretched so much it was buckling in our room and all throughout the hallways. Customer service was great from every staff member we encountered! Very friendly and tried to be helpful.  Overall it was not a negative experience by any means, however the quality fell very short of the price point charged.  Not really sure that the new renovations will make a big impact on that aspect.   I do not recommend the buffet, but all the other restaurants get a thumbs up.

I like the Monte Carlo Hotel. I don't gamble, but like the lobby, the rooms and the buffet. Many times they offer special prices and deals if you sign up for email alerts. Overall, definitly in my top 5 favorite Hotels on the strip.

The checking in and out never takes longer than 5 to 7 minutes. Lines move quickly and the people behind the counter are always friendly. You can tell they go through customer service training before allowed to work behind the counter.

Great Hotel. Have fun....What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas unless you bring your wife\/husband with you then you have to disclose it all!

Excellent location; decent rates; decent buffet; not-so-crowded casino; very crowded pool.  Rooms are clean and average in decor.  This is probably one of the better values, if not the best, on the strip.

Recently stayed at the Monte Carlo with my sister for Spring Break\/Bachelorette. We arrived around 9pm and checked in quickly. Our room was the very last room on the 8th floor. View of parking garage. There was some long black curtains with a stand hanging in front of the door to the room across from us and it looked like they just needed a place to stick it and decided next to our room! Also, there was a tray of beer and old food that looked like it had been sitting there for days. We had to walk around it each time we went to our room. 

The room: BLAH. The floor was stained (looked like many people had thrown up on it over the years...) there was candy on the floor from the previous guests. Other than that it seemed clean enough. Nothing special at all, no fridge, no wifi, and all the outlets but one were taken so no charging your phone next to the bed! The safe didn't work, it was open and wouldn't shut. I called the front desk and they sent up security who demanded my ID like a criminal. They said any time they open the safe they have to check ID. I proceeded to tell him the safe was OPEN and nothing was in it so why do I need to show ID? He snapped at me that if I had a problem with their policies to take it up with the front desk. I did and they gave me a $50 credit. They also had to send up 2 more people before the safe got fixed. Also complained about the food sitting outside of our room for over a day and they finally came and picked it up. 

Went to the pool the next day. It was good enough but I've been to better in Vegas. Also the wave pool was dirty lots of "debris" in it. Came back to the room and it had only been halfway cleaned. Again called to the front desk and they offered to send someone up but at that point we were trying to get ready for a night out so we declined. On our way out we heard someone else on our floor say their room was only halfway cleaned too. The next day we had a housekeeping supervisor come to our room and tell us she thoroughly cleaned our room. Parts of the room looked spotless and then parts were still not done like the day before. 

Last day for check out I wanted to just do express checkout, reviewed my bill and the $50 credit was not applied. Had to wait in a very long line to speak with someone to get it applied. Overall I was dissatisfied with our trip and I will not be staying here again. They put us in the farthest room, looked like they were using our hallway as a storage area, and a trash area for room service. Not happy at all.

I got a great deal at the MC and quite enjoyed my time there. It wasn't overcrowed like some of the strip hotels, and the rooms were clean and easy to get to from the main casino floor. The MC is positioned at a nice area of the strip and makes it easy to walk to either the south or north strip area. The pool area does get crowded early so you have to stake out your lounger by early morning. The frozen drinks were a bit pricey ($17 a pop in a sounvenir glass) but I guess I made up for it on the Blackjack table.  All in all, very fair price, clean rooms, and attentive staff. The table limits are a bit lower also than some of the Strip hotels, you can always find a $5 blackjack table as opposed to the $10-15 minimum at some of the other hotels.

My stay at this hotel was through my company for business, and very satisfied with all accommodations. It's nice the hotel has its own entrance, so we didn't have to walk through the casino. The clerks were nice and no waiting in lines. The room was clean and gorgeous. The check out took a little more time than expected, but all in all a hassle free and very enjoyable stay.

Good price (with free buffet if you can stand in long lines daily) and friendly staff.  Good for the budget traveler--you'll get a good sized room that is clean and cool.  The downside is that the rooms (at least the one we were in) need renovating--leaky faucets, stained carpets, crooked drawers in dresser.  There was no refrigerator (so sad when I had leftovers of the most awesome steak ever), no coffee maker (I guess because Sambalate, Starbucks, and McD's were on the premises), and the in-room safe required payment.  

Be aware that you will stand in extremely long lines during check-in and check-out hours (try to use express check-out) and the elevators are backed up during these times, as well (we waited 15 minutes and decided to catch the elevators going up to come down).

The construction started around 2 am. Listening to dump trucks banging around and reversing BEEP BEEP BEEP all flipping night was a joke. Never again!!! Plus the only reason we stayed here was because we brought our kids and the pool isn't even here anymore. That's what all the construction is about. But come on you can't do construction through the entire night at a hotel. I know it's hot during the day- but then you should have done construction through the cold months! 
Be better. We won't be back.

This review is based on our experience at the casino. This place seems pretty average to me. The ceilings are beautiful and the music is pretty good. I just didn't like that it smelled like someone had pooped or something. The buffet here seems cheaper. Drink service was pretty slow here.

So 3 stars is the best I can give this place...here are the reasons why I love and don't love:

AWESOME THINGS:
1) Love the casino!! It has the best slot machines (penny slots!!) and I usually do pretty good here. Emerald Falls and Star Wars slots are awesome and I'm a sucker for the bonus rounds. Haven't played anything else really except for Pai Gow and I did pretty good at that too.

2) Loved that they had 6 elevators for each section. I stayed at the Excalibur once and it took me 45 minutes to get to the 1st floor waiting for 1 elevator. They had tvs in them and went fast. 

3) Their beds are awesome! Very comfy and give you plenty of pillows.

4) The tramway goes from here to Bellagio and Aria...LOVE!! Definitely beats walking over there. And we got to see the fountain show. :)

NOT SO AWESOME THINGS:
5) They charge $20 resort fee each night for what??? This isn't Bellagio or Venetian. We came at spring break time and it was so packed of  jersey shore douche's and I came to realize I was older than I thought. Note to self: don't come to the strip during spring break. So, I think the resort fee was a rip off for not using the pool. Even using the pool I think it's a rip. 

6) They don't have any food places open past 11 in the casino except for the Cafe but blah. This is Vegas people!! That's when the party gets started!! WTF? So, we walked over to New York, New  York and had some good grub over there. That needs to change.

7) Ok, this one is kinda weird but their shower head was the weirdest shower head I've ever seen. No pressure and had 4 little holes for water to come out. Super annoying when you have thick hair and you're trying to get the shampoo out and it takes FOREVER. Also, no fan in the bathroom. Ugh.

8) Finally, the one that really irritated me...NO WIFI!!!! Seriously? I don't get it. You need wifi for Vegas!!!

So in conclusion, I won't be back to Monte Carlo to stay overnight. For being a moderate priced hotel on the strip, you kinda expect more. I had a better experience at Golden Nugget!! They need to upgrade or something to make that resort fee worth it.

This hotel was nothing special. It looks nice and pretty outside, but the rooms are pretty much standard. Since we booked our rooms late for NYE, this hotel is one of the few hotels that still have available rooms. The room service was mediocre. We needed 2 extra bath towels and had to call housekeeping three times in 1 hour but we never got the towels we needed. My cousins had to settle with the face towels they have to dry themselves. When we got back later that night, we had our towels hanging at a bag outside the room. The next morning, the maid opened our room and yelled housekeeping which is enough to wake everyone up. My cousins were thinking WTF is that. I have never experience that before at other hotels. The one thing I liked with the hotel is that they have a tram that connects us to Bellagio since my brother is too lazy to walk on the strip. Other than that, I recommend Paris more.

Visited Vegas for 2 nights with some old friends in mid-November.  Monte Carlo met our expectations.  It is a good hotel, in a good location with a good casino, good restaurants and good service and offers good rooms for a good price.  Nothing was bad.  Nothing was outstanding.  We did not use the pool area, but it is small, which would be a drawback in the summer.  Overall, Monte Carlo is a good base for a buddies Vegas trip.

I booked this hotel because it had decent reviews on hotels.com. I booked a high floor deluxe king room. That's pretty much what I got, a high floor. 

Checking in took over an hour, which I didn't mind, I am a patient person. I got my room key, floor 27, and went upstairs. 

I do my inspection, as I always do when I stay somewhere. The room was clean, however the bathroom was not. The toilet had feces, hair, toiletries particles on it.. I called down to guest services with my complaint, they apologized and said "they would send someone right up." However 30 minutes went by and zero housekeeping, I cleaned everything myself.. I called to re-complain and cancel my request due to lack of quick resolve. 

I read most reviews and everyone complained about the construction. I didn't hear it, it didn't bother me. 

The only thing that bothered me was the lack of caring service..

The BF and I came to Vegas and were looking for a quieter weekend. This place was perfect for that. The Monte Carlo, while still on the strip, is a quieter hotel with a peaceful atmosphere. There aren't any big clubs in the hotel so it's got a way more mellow vibe. 

It's location is excellent. It's within close walking distance to Planet Hollywood, which is a great place for food and shopping. It's also a short cab ride away from any other main hotels and shopping venues on the strip. 

The room itself was nice and clean. It was quiet and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there!

I have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice in the past and have enjoyed my stays each time.  We like the location on the strip and the gaming at the bars at the front of the casino.  The rooms are very tired.  We decided to upgrade to a Monaco Suit.  There were many issues with the room, broken drawer on dresser, shower head that was far to low for an adult (called front desk to get it adjusted, as they said they could fix it and I couldn't figure it out)  they never came and attempted to fix it or if they did they couldn't fix it so they just left it.  The furniture is very worn out and faded, the bed was a king and was clean and comfortable.  The staff at the front desk was very friendly and the manager agreed to refund half or trip since we decide to check out early and find a different hotel.  If you haven't been to Vegas in awhile be aware that complimentary drinks have changed with gambling at many if not all casinos.  This makes it difficult for the bartenders because many people have come to expect free drinks when they gamble and it seems they blame the bartenders for the changed policy.  It is not any worse at the Monte Carlo vs anywhere else on the strip, but we decided to just start gambling in Fremont.  We will try to stay at the new MGM hotel when it renovations are complete.  Also not sure a Resorts fee of $30+ a night is really reasonable when the hotel is under construction.  Curious what exactly the $60+ we spent got us, internet?

Last time I stayed here was 12 years ago when I turned 21.   I was a little skeptical about staying here again because it wasn't that great back then.  But they have done some good things there.  Our room was in decent shape.  My bed was comfortable and everything  worked in the room (a\/c, tv etc.).  I'm use to dealing with incompetent people but this hotel staff was on point, very professional.  The food options were great, gambling was cheap and the overall cost to value was off the charts. Definitely will stay here again

I enjoyed staying at this hotel. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. The concierge Michael had helped get our group on the guest list for nightclubs and made sure our stay was fun. 

Prices for the Monte Carlo are affordable and reasonable. It is located on the strip, so it's easy access to the other hotels. They did have construction going on next door, but my group and I didn't hear any of the noise. 

Our flight was later in the evening, and the hotel was willing to give us a courtesy late checkout of 1pm. 

I wouldn't mind staying here again, however I do prefer Bellagio.

Checked in here on the last weekend of September in 2013.  First thing I'd like to note is the "sketchy "guests" on my floor as soon as I stepped off the elevator.  There were numerous trashy guests on the casino floor as I entered the hotel premises.  This place attracts the low class and smells of senior citizens, hookers, fat cigars, and whiskey cocktails.  My room was dingy and the hallway had the same room service chow cart on it for like two days--heinous!!!

Not recommended, and would never return!

Getting more and more expensive each time I stay at Monte Carlo.  They used to serve drinks when you play in the Casino for you and your companion, however at this time they are rude and tell you that both persons must be playing in order to get drinks. Difficult to find a "penny " machines. The room looked old and need upgrades. Some things did not work properly, like the hair dryer and there was something wrong with the bathroom outlet.  You no longer get your coffee express and a small refrigerator as in the past.  I was not impressed...

we stayed here on our most recent trip. the rooms were nice and clean and we had a nice rear view of the strip overlooking the T-Mobile arena and some other strip hotels. the location was great being on the south side of the strip. only complaint i had was the walls seem to echo the water running from other rooms when they were in use. otherwise not a big deal. lots of dining options and great location.

Well, after reading about 100 of these reviews on the Monte Carlo I finally went ahead and stayed there for a few days. Here's my two cents: 

On the Plus Side: 
-Very nice hotel staff-everyone from the valet parker to the bellman to the front desk. They were accommodating, friendly and they seemed to have a genuine interest in assisting you. 
-Reasonably priced 
-Different pools (wave pool, lazy river, hot tub, regular pool) 
-Good location, go to the right or left when you walk out and either way you'll find fun 
-Decent, clean enough room (although nothing special) 
-A handful of different food choices in the hotel 

On the Down Side: 
-DO NOT let the reservation guy on the phone tell you that the construction workers were all laid off and no more construction is going on-What a line of bs!!! When I got there I found out that not only IS there construction happening 24\/7 but it's around 3\/4 of the perimeter of the hotel AND the biggest construction project in all of North America-WTF???! 
-If you don't want to be annoyed as hell hearing other guests next door to you, make sure you request a room that is NOT conjoined with another. 
I had the joy of hearing those opposite me talking loudly at 7AM (I'm not a morning person) as if they were in the room with me which they almost were. (granted, the staff were cool about getting me another room) 
-Be sure to get alternate directions if you are driving. It was really frustrating to see the hotel practically right in front of me when I got off the freeway after a 4 hour drive and not be able to reach it due to the construction. The road you would usually turn on is blocked and I had to sit in LOTS of traffic and had to figure out how to get there another way. Frustrating! 
-I don't know where the "wheel of free stuff" was that someone else here mentioned but when I was there I got nothing complimentary at all despite the fact that the friendly front desk man knew it was my birthday and we had a very nice chat . Aren't you supposed to at least get a free buffet or a few gambling bucks?? 
-Last but DEFINITELY not least: The pool noise. Mind you, it's great to have pool choices like I mentioned above but the music is ALWAYS BLASTING. I like music like everybody else but this is NOT relaxing if you want to lie there and chill with a book--- and if you have a hangover-forget it!! Also, it would have been nice if they had mixed up the music more. It was all hip hop despite the crowd being somewhat older in general. At least shake it up with some 80's tunes or rock or something... 

Overall, not a bad choice but if any of the above are issues with you or if you're a light sleeper, you might want to stay somewhere else.

I'm actually surprised that it only has 3 stars and some bad reviews. I actually loved this place. I would have given them a 5 if it weren't for some small little things but here we go. 

Checking in was easy, the person we got was nice, quick and helpful when I asked about a concert that was happening at the Park Theater. 

The room was nice. Beds were comfy and clean and the bathroom was nice too. I didn't really like how the windows were a bit dirty from the outside but I would imagine that would be a little hard to clean. Lol the shower head felt great, I loved the pressure of the water. The only thing I didn't really like is how the doors are soooo loud. Every time our neighbor would get into their room it felt like they were coming into mine cause of how clear it sounded!

We encountered a pretty rude room cleaner, she came in without knocking the day we were going to check out...Im sure she thought we would have been out of there by then but we had late check in... I was in the bathroom...she could have knocked. 


But other than that, great. I'd definitely come here again. 
But other than that, great!

This hotel is complete trash. Honestly the only good thing about this hotel is that you can check in and check out online. Besides that it is completely outdated and aged. We left our bags here for a couple of hours because of your checking into a different Hotel and tried to come back and get it and my friend lost the tag and they would not give us our bags! I told them that I stay here the previous night gave them my ID and offered to tell them what the Bears look like and they acted extremely ignorant!  I would definitely never stay at this hotel ever again! Can't wait to get to Vdara!

This is a great location (although I would like to stay at the other end next time) and the hotel is clean and nice.  I thought it'd be worse from what I heard about this place, but it was pretty decent and housekeeping was honest and efficient (they checked my card when I ran in there to get my sunglasses when they were cleaning - I appreciated that).  

One thing is that registration and concierge is piss poor.  Poor service and knowledge.  I asked them both if anything was going on and the registration girl said she really didn't know (she SHOULD know) and the concierge guy (young, white guy, skinny) directed me to "shows".  That's it?  SHOWS?  No specific one.  The dumb thing was they didn't even recommend the chili cook-off that was starting about ten feet away from the concierge desk.  Free food and music only for one day in celebration of the Rodeo finals!  But they failed to mention this.  I would give the registration and concierge negative stars if I could!

I lost $45 in blackjack my last day there so I probably will not come back considering the useless concierge.  They really need to find people that enjoy working concierge.

While there isn't a WOW factor and it's certainly dated I didn't think this place was bad, and when you're on vacation how much time do you spend in a room anyways? The pool is great, the casino was alright and the buffet is ok. I think the best part is how this hotel is connected to the light rail and is so centrally located. I would stay here again. Especially since I can hop on the rail quickly or catch a bus in the front.

I stayed here 10 years ago closer to when the hotel first opened and it was much nicer but it wasn't a bad choice this time for a reasonably priced hotel and not Vegas cheesy. The staff was very nice, concierge was great and the Sambalatte Coffee shop had a great vanilla latte! Would definitely consider staying here again for the next business trip.

Of course as a kid, Monte Carlo never interested me since there was no arcade. 

My boyfriend found a promo code for the Monte Carlo last year before we decided to book our trip. We ended up with a huge suite with two bathrooms! The room was nice and clean, the bed was super comfy which is nice when you're winding down after walking all day.

The only thing I didnt like, was that we were right next to the elevator so we'd hear it ding every time someone was using it. 

Other than that, I would stay here again! I hope they bring the promo code back this summer!

I am disabled and I stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend the rooms are really small      Even though they say it is the ADA compliant there is no room for wheelchair to move and very rude customer service towards late check out I guess this hotel does not understand how long it takes for a disabled person to get ready

I have stayed in a few hotels in Vegas now and I have to say that this one is so far my least favorite. 

From the moment I entered the hotel to the moment I left, the staff was needlessly formal and kind of full of themselves. Which would be somewhat ok if the service and the quality of the hotel reflected appropriately, but it didn't. The room was superficially clean. That means that at first glace, it's nice enough, but if you dig a bit deeper, it's not that nice. For example, there was a long black hair stuck to the shower wall (which definitely wasn't mine or my boy's as we both have short hair) and then I even pulled a long blonde hair out of a "clean" towel.

The walls are thin. All night I could hear a family in a room to one side of us and what sounded like 10 teenagers in the room to the other side. 

The pillows on the bed drove me crazy. They were all so big that it felt like I had two pillows under my head when it was only one. I ended up loosing all pillows and sleeping without one. Fun times. 

I know a resort fee is kind of the norm in Vegas, but that doesn't make them any less stupid. They cover things that most people aren't going to use, like the gym, and daily newspapers. Oh, and internet. And when they say "internet," they mean a 1ft ethernet cable. That's right. A cable. 

The pool area is nice. They have a wave pool and a lazy river but you have to buy the inner tubes! Seriously? 

At check out, the express checkout (via the TV) was "unavailable." 

Basically, for the price, you can get a way better hotel. Don't bother with the Monte Carlo. I know I won't in the future.

The location of this hotel is great, its positioned on a nice part of the strip. And I really liked the casino, lots of table games and the staff was very friendly. However, I wish the rooms were nicer for the price.. The furniture is very outdated and the bath tub didn't drain - yuk! I was also dissapointed that the pool is only open until 7pm.. Overall my experience at Monte Carlo was just okay...

This was probably one of the worst hotels I've stayed at in Vegas, aside from the Imperial Palace which was eventually torn down and the Linq was resurrected (possibility for Monte Carlo???) The issues were non-stop from the minute we valeted our car to the minute we left this dump.  We were greeted by our valet driver, nice gentleman, very friendly and welcoming.  Cue the 80 y\/o bellhop who couldn't differentiate between "This set of luggage goes to one room and this set of luggage goes to another one"  which by the way, he still managed to screw up which bags went where and had the audacity to be incredibly rude to my friend (b\/c I was on the phone with him when his bags, or lack there of, was delivered) Imagine this dialogue taking place while impeding a line of cars who are trying to valet.  We finally hop in line to check in, which essentially resembled waiting in line at the DMV.  I pay for the other portion of my room and upon entry, I find this super grimey q-tip and a pile of hair.  Looks like housekeeping half-assed their duties for the day.  So my boyfriend and I decided to inspect the rest of the room cause we could only imagine what else housekeep DID NOT clean.  Enter the pile of stale crusty chips under the table.  SOOOOO DONE at this point!!  I'm given a dirty ass room with TWO BEDS not ONE KING SIZE BED b\/c apparently it wasn't available based on the price I paid; felt like I was at a glorified summer camp.  I hit up front desk via phone, expressed my concerns, and offered a new room and was instructed to do back down stairs to pick up my new room key.  So I jump into another DMV line again and decided to ask again if there was a king size bed available and sure enough there was, but it was handicap accessible room on the 21st floor.  FINE....WHATEVER....WE WILL TAKE IT. We inspected the room, looked clean, we were exhausted, we'll accept it.  

Fast forward to the next morning...upon jumping in the shower, the damn nozzle hose that connects to the shower  head full on BREAKS and water is EVERYWHERE and the shower drain is painfully slow.  If it wasn't for the fact that it was my girl's birthday, I would've demanded my money back and booked it back to San Diego.  At this point, I'm beyond livid and all I see is red.  I use my best grown up voice I can muster, explained my concerns AGAIN and how deeply frustrating this room situation has been.  To remedy my complaint, they gave me a $50 dining room credit and sent engineering up my room. Did that generosity appease me?  Slightly, but not entirely.  Cue dinner.  I'm from Southern Cali aka home the original authentic Mexican tacos and was I impressed by the meal, not really.  $20 for a plate of crappy tacos with stale tortillas that gave me the runs (I know, TMI, apologies on my end!)...OVER IT. 

And funny how everything we did OUTSIDE of the hotel, we had a blast.  Everything with the hotel vicinity, sucked ass.    

We finally make it to our last day.  Car pulls up, there's a minor but noticeable scratch on my the rear bumper of my car. My boyfriends pissed, I'm pissed, and I just want to get the heck outta there and never come back again.  For the sake of causing a huge scene which my boyfriend wanted to do and given how crappy our experience was here, I should've let him do it.  At least it would've made me feel better.  

Long story short, never will I ever come back here again.  We should've stayed at Mandalay Bay. I'm sure they don't have exploding showers, 80 y\/o crotchety bell hops, and clumps of hair and dirty q-tips waiting for you when you walk in.

Been here a couple of times to gamble and eat. I'd say this place is decent, but they could update their theme as many other casinos have been undergoing renovations recently. It doesn't have that something like a cool attraction that makes me want to stay here or visit for long. 

Right now they are changing up the hallway that connects this casino to Aria. Can't wait to see what the Park will look like. They took down the Avenue of Dreams and the food court so it will be interesting to see how they will incorporate the food options in the future.

Overall this is a decent place, but I'd rather stay at the Bellagio or Aria.

I made my reservation through Southwest Vacations. The check in process was very quick. We had a 2 queen room on the sixth floor. We had a view of the New York New York and the new Las Vegas Arena that will open next year. Construction was still taking place at the Arena as well as the front of the Monte Carlo. So the entrance from Las Vegas was not very clear. And there was only one way out of the hotel due to the construction. I can't review the housekeeping because we kept it "green" during our entire stay. We did call Housekeeping for towels which they brought to us quickly. I used the mobile checkout which i still have not received an email with my receipt. Express checkout is only available from 6am to 10pm. There are plenty of places to eat and drink. The food court had the usual Subway, McDonald's and Nathans. The BLVD had a new coffee and ice cream place and a couple of new restaurants. We at at The Pub during happy hour. $3 off well drinks and select appetizers. We watched the weigh-in for the UFC fight that happened the same weekend as the rodeo. The staff was great. The casino isn't too big to get lost. They have a exit right to Las Vegas Blvd which was convenient. There is also a CVS and Walgreens for those emergency purchases. I did wish they had a work desk which allowed us to plug in our laptop and cell phones.

The people here are friendly. 
Only downside was a blood stain on the bed sheets. However I called housekeeping and Sonia was very efficient and so nice. This company is lucky to have her!!

I enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo. It is a great location. Close to the Tram. Good restaurants. Check in line was long, but didn't take as long as I thought it would. Our room was not ready at 3pm, which was annoying, but we had friends with us so we put our luggage in their room. We had a spa suite. The room was very clean, but it is getting outdated. The bed was very comfortable. We also had a strip view which I loved. Typical hotel noise, but the water noise from the room above us made for miserable 2ams. Pool area is awesome. Very friendly staff. Would stay here again. Good hotel for the price.

Stayed here when I was 18 & it was great! The location on the strip is still good but 10 years later the hotel still looks the same :\/ It's outdated & hello no working WiFi is totally unexceptable!!! The whole weekend we were frustrated trying to get some kind of Internet service! It was just horrible! 
Also our reservation was wrong & they gave us two handicap rooms with one bed instead of regular two queens in them. They did bring a cot to each room but that was not what was reserved! They offered us the choice to swap into the correct rooms in the morning but when we called @ 11 am they said rooms wouldn't be available until maybe as late as 4pm. We gave up since we weren't going to just wait around to move. We wanted to go have fun...which we did! 
Had a blast as always in Sin City but definitely would not stay @ Monte Carlo again!

Yes, I gave a supposed 2-3 star hotel a 5 star rating, and I'm not taking it back! HOWEVER, I would like to say that my rating for the Monte Carlo is not based in comparison to luxury resorts like the Venetian or Wynn, but rather in comparison to my expectations of what a 3 star hotel should be. 

With that being said, I would definitely stay here again. I got a great $39\/night deal for four nights thanks to my M-life membership. Even with the dreaded $16\/day resort fee the total bill was still less than $250 after tax which I was more than satisfied with. If you will be using a debit card to book the hotel, you should know that they put a $100\/night hold on your card. This is important in case you overdraft your account or worse, your card gets rejected. Save yourself that humiliation and plan on that money disappearing for a few days. 

Check-in process was fast and Check-out even faster thanks to Express Checkout either through your television or by simply dropping one of their Express Checkout Cards into any of their Express Checkout boxes! So easy! I never witnessed any long lines at the front desk as there were always lots of employees working it.

Our deluxe (standard) room on the 22nd floor was nice. I was happy to see that our TV wasn't from the 80s but instead was a flat screen plasma with crisp picture and sound for when my boyfriend had to lounge around in front of it while I got ready for our days\/nights. The bed was super comfy and loaded with pillows and clean enough sheets. I say clean enough only because I'm not one of the whacko's that bring a black light for inspection of every inch of the room. If I take a gander at my white sheets and they are exactly that, white, then I'm GOOD. One thing I hate about standard hotel rooms is the lack to lighting! Why can't any of them offer more than just a few dim lamps in the main room!? 

The bathroom was clean and came with your standard toiletries: hand soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion. The sink did seem to drain a little slow which was a little annoying but nothing to cry about. The toilet was a little scary. You just tap the handle with the lightest touch to flush and it makes a loud, explosive noise every time like you're gonna get sucked in with it. Oh and yes I did experience the crazy shower head pressure as well! It would be nice to be able to turn that down a bit but I didn't really mind that much because it felt kind of like a jacuzzi jet on my tired back muscles. 

Maid service was friendly and fast and took care of everything they should have. Bell hop was very courteous and friendly as well. Don't forget to tip! 

24hr McDonald's, Sbarro's, Subway and casual dining Cafe Restaurant right in our hotel? Awesome!! There is also two Starbucks Cafes, a Big Chill (alcohol slushy stand), a Cupcakery (yummy gourmet cupcakes), Minus 5 Ice bar, and at least four other restaurants and bars right there in the hotel for your Vegas pleasure. 

Location is awesome because it is in walking distance to the NYNY, Excalibur, and MGM. Once you're at the Excalibur you can use the free tram to get to Mandalay Bay or Luxor. It's also right across the street from the popular M&M World. If you're headed the other way on the strip you can use the free tram right in the Monte Carlo hotel to get to Aria or Bellagio. Once you're at the Bellagio you are in walking distance to Paris and Cesar's Palace! That tram is awesome because it comes every three minutes so you never have to wait and its also never crowded! It is located up a few long escalators at the end of the Street of Dreams shops on the casino level. 

Last thing to note is that this hotel isnt overly huge, making it simple to get from Point A to B and pretty difficult to get lost. There are many elevators and we never had to wait longer than two minutes to hop on one at any given time of the day.

I'll be back!

3 stars only because the pool is fantastic!  I love the lazy river, and love the wave pool.  Check in took foreeeeverrr and we were even early, at least there was not an early check in fee.  The room was less than mediocre, but cant complain much because it was comped, thanks MLife.  My biggest complaint was Housekeeping was soooo loud at all times of the day.  Like yelling down the hall joking around Loud!  
Other than that... the biggest Pro's:
The Pool
The Pub (omg to die for wings and beer)
The Monorail between there and Bellagio
The Cupcake Place
(And the slots were pretty nice to me - at least enough to keep on playin!)
If you can... upgrade your room!!

just got back from Vegas this morning and just had to post my review. got there Monday morning, 15 minutes BEFORE check in (3pm) and they told us our room wasn't ready. when i asked when it would be, he said it'd be anywhere from now (2:45pm) til 5pm & they said they'd call me when our room was ready. Uh wtf? whats the point of having a check in & check out time then? so whatever, we waited around and by 4:45 no one called me yet so i called them. they said "oh yeah your room is ready & waiting for you." uhhh okay? so we went to our rooms, we stayed at the Spa Suite & no doubt, it was beautiful. once we were unpacked & settled, a private number called my cell & told me our room was ready. (really? a little too late there buddy)

so all in all, just because of that, i do  give this place 3 stars. Last time I went, we stayed at MGM & their shit was on point. & we didn't even stay at a suite or anything.

Horrible experience here could have been better, had us changed rooms multiple times and still did not get the room we requested. Customer service does not exist here, two stars just because the hotel is a decent looking places.

This casino is so boring.  There's worse in Vegas, but with the location Monte Carlo has, it should be better.  The only thing this is good for is the tram to Bellagio\/CityCenter, if you find yourself starting on the south strip.  Their pub has so much potential, too, but just falls flat.

We recently went here to attend a friends wedding.  Which was done really well and you can even watch the wedding over the internet.  It was broadcast live during the ceremony and also saved so you can watch it again later.  That was nice.

So other than the wedding, the hotel stay was awful!  They gave us a room with two queen beds since they were out of King rooms which was fine.  However the beds were so bad that if one of us moved in the bed it moved the entire bed.  It was like sleeping in a water bed.  One small movement rocked the whole bed.  Also the pillows were horrible as well.  They were so thick that I couldn't even rest my head on them.  My husband used the small corner of the pillow as they were all this way.

And don't stay at this hotel if you want to lay out by the pool.  We went out to the pool and it was a joke.  First of all we went at high noon which is prime sun time and the entire pool was covered with shade from all the surrounding buildings and construction.  It was late February but the weather was perfect 75 degrees but no sun to be had.  And the size of the pool was embarrassing as well as it was no bigger than like a Holiday inn size pool.  If you are use to staying at Mandalay Bay and Bellagio then don't even think of staying here even if your friend is getting married here stay at another hotel!

Bedbugs... And a less than lackluster response from the hotel on having to deal with bedbugs in a room that they had just moved me into....
Meh. They need to start their renovation now!  I am on 2 room changes (one for a toilet that wouldn't stop running and the other for bedbugs (only was in there for 30 minutes)). No coffee, no fridge, hallways with wallpaper falling off, poor quality stuff in the bathrooms and way too thin walls.

Booked a really good flight and hotel package from JetBlue. 

We were able to check in early around noon instead of 3pm which was nice. They put us in a standard deluxe room on the 29th floor and the room was very out dated and needed a big makeover. Also, our toilet flusher fell off. Good thing we didn't settle in otherwise I would've been even more pissed. I let the staff know about this issue and they rerouted us on the 27th floor. Our new room was better but not by a lot.

Overall, for the price we paid it was decent as the location was close to middle of strip and was easy for us to get to the popular casinos. Also they had a couple cool looking restaurants in the casino which we didn't visit any for some reason.

This hotel compared to some on the strip isn't as great as others.  With that said, the hotel is in a great location.  We stayed in the 700 sq. feet suite, which was a decent size, but the couch that it came with looked rather "used" and stained.  DISGUSTING!

The casino needs a renovation.  The browns and tans of the carpet and decor look drab.

The service is awesome, and the spa (request Andrew as a masseuse) was really nice.

But with all that, I think I'll stay elsewhere next time I am back in town.

Really nice and lovely quality hotel right off of the Las Vegas Strip, but close enough that it's like you're right ON Da Strip.

My room was lovely.  I stayed here whilst the RODEO was in town.

Ate at the buffet one night with a former boyfriend who tracked me down after I'd moved to LV and confessed he loved me.  Our romance rekindled here.

Clean hotel.  Great bell check for my bags.  Really liked it.  Without having to pay a FULL Strip price.  Just a little savings.  Isn't that always fun?

Stayed here one night extending our trip. The check in is a joke looking more like a Disneyland attraction line zig-zagging back and forth. It took over 30 minutes to check in on a Monday afternoon! 

The room (floor 31 of 32) was so so and at $66 on Monday + the hidden $20 "resort fee" and taxes put the room at almost $100, did I mention it was on Monday? 

We went to the Pub & Keg room and waited for a few to be seated at about 9pm, Monday night. After sitting at a table for 20 minutes with no waiter or waitress even giving us water, we walked out. As I left, I handed the matradee my menu and told her no thanks. She didn't even bat an eye or offer any attempt to retain our business- sad. 

For our money, I'd rather go back to the Golden Nuggett Rush Tower downtown. If you haven't checked that out, do yourself a favor and take a look.

Man you really can't trust yelpers anymore....I looked at this rating and was afraid of where I'd be staying but damn was I super pleasantly surprised! 

First and foremost, thank you Monte Carlo for the 2 comped nights and the tickets to the Chris Rock show!

I don't know why there are so many bad ratings... and as I read them, it's kinda their fault.... people be resourceful!!!!
  You waited forever to check in!? I didn't! I went to the kiosk and here was an employee there to guide me and I was checked in and had my room keys in less than 2 minutes of walking in. I've been in Vegas when there are conventions and the lines are long.... you're an idiot if you wait in line for over 20 minutes....it's Vegas there are endless things to do! If the line is super long, drop off your stuff at the bellhop and go eat, gamble, walk the strip, get a cocktail or site seeing! 

Ohhh you found stains on the box spring!? What the hell are you doing lifting the mattress!? Wear pjs if you're grossed out...plus if you walk around your room bare footed then you're just as dirty so quit your bitching!

Ohhhhh you were playing slots and couldn't get a drink? Ask the floor managers to send them your way! Like I said if you just sit there and wait like an idiot you deserve to wait forever. I got my drinks when I needed.

Even with construction I thought it was clean and didn't get in my way in any shape or form. You had to walk far? Who gives a shit you probably need the exercise....

I had a great time at Monte Carlo and loved that we were able to use the pools at other properties! Thank you for a great weekend getaway!

For our 9 year anniversary we decided to do a weekend getaway to Las Vegas.  Our last visit to Sin City was over 8 years ago and we knew a lot had changed since then.  If we were to head to Vegas we knew we wanted to do it right and have the steak dinner, the shows and the entire Vegas package.  Our last visit we stayed at the Venetian (which I loved) and although super nice it came with a price and we were unable to afford the amenities of the shows and everything else that Vegas has to offer.  After scouring the web and reading a ton of reviews we settled on the Monte Carlo for this trip.

The Monte Carlo is an older hotel but still carries itself with great luxury.  The hotel is still modern in its design and really does feel as upscale as many of the newer places in my opinion.  They have a number of restaurants on the premises and although most reviews I read said to stay away we found a great steakhouse and coffee shop that were fantastic.  Upon check-in we found that the room choice we had made were limited in availability and thus we ended up on the 7th floor which really hindered the view of the strip.  I was fine with this as we really weren't planning on spending much time in the room themselves although higher is definitely the way to go.  The room was spacious and nicely furnished, the water pressure was great in the shower (the tub unfortunately had a slow drain that wouldn't keep the water).  The one downfall to the room is the fact that the Monte Carlo only currently offers a wired internet connection in the rooms (our didn't work) and WiFi is only in the 1st two floors (casino and spa\/pool areas).  It was unfortunately colder and quite windy during our visit so the Pool was never even an option on this visit.

Despite having a long line at check-in, the process was smooth and seamless and we got through it in just a few minutes.  The express checkout is nice and can be done in numerous way as well including through the TV, the kiosks downstairs, via text message, calling a automated number on your room phone or filling out a card and leaving it at the desk downstairs.  

The Monte Carlos also houses a number of stores throughout as well as being the current home of The Blue Man Group show.  The also house the Minus 5 Bar, Ignite Bar and upscale eateries such as Andre's and Brand Steakhouse.  They offer Valet parking in front or self parking in a structure to the rear between Frank Sinatra and Las Vegas Blvd (although it was a bit hard to find unless you know where it is.

For what we got and the time we spent here, I feel that the Monte Carlo was a great value and a definite good stay.  The casino I found a bit lacking overall compared to some of the other nearby hotels but being as I am not a big gambler this was not much of an issue.  I would definitely stay here again for future visits.

One star for location. That's the only good thing about this hotel. First the pools don't exist. Huge major construction going on with the pools. which they stated on the website. They don't tell you the entire hotel is under construction!! I would have never stayed knowing how bad it is and the room shakes and feels like an earthquake!! The loudest drilling you ever heard starts around 5am!! Yes 5am. These rooms should not be rented. They are well aware of this but just try to see what they can get away with. That's the part that really bothers me!! They lie they're shady and they just want your money. No customer care or service!!  I asked for an upgrade since it's my birthday and the girl said " oh I got you. I put you in a new room!" I open the door it's tiny with nothing special. No tub no mini fridge no dressers. Not even coffee. And I realize she lied and put me in the worst room for noise with a "view" of the gravel pit construction shit show!! Thanks bitch for ruining my birthday !!  Her coworker apologized and said this is the worst room for the noise and she knew that. Horrible!! These rooms should not be rented !!!!!!!! Then they have the audacity to charge a resort fee when they don't have a resort!! The MGM pool is about a 2 mile walk!!  110 degree 2 mile walk or pay for a cab\/uber. Then the shuttle they offer to Mandalay only runs on the hour and last pick up is 5:30 even though the pool is open Til 8!  Wtf!?!?  They price themselves up there with some way better properties that offer way more and aren't under construction !!  Absolutely no reason to stay here with so many options !  Hopefully after the construction of the hotel and the building of pools is finished it may be ok but myself and many many others will never know cuz after such a horrible experience with no sleep we will not be staying here ever again !!! As an employee for Hyatt hotels my opinion will reach 1000s of people a week !!!  Stay anywhere but here!!!

I LOVE staying at the Monte Carlo when I go to Vegas. The rooms are a decent size, they're clean, the bathrooms are okay. The maids are really nice. They will switch out your towels daily, without asking. The hotel has 24 hour room service. 

There is a 15 dollar resort fee daily but that includes free internet so whatever. 

The pool area is great, entrance is free. They provide towels and water. There is a pool, wave pool, hot tub and lazy river. There is also two bars, waitresses and a volleyball court. There is a restaurant attached to the pool called The Pub- we had lunch there. The sliders and nachos are amazing. The bar has 100s of different beers. You can rent or buy tubes for the lazy river- we went next door to CVS and got ours for 3.99$.

Oh yea, there is a CVS next door- super convenient. 

Inside the hotel there is a mall and food court. The food court has pizza, chinese, subway, mc donalds, and a couple of other places- great for grabbing late dinner. 

The hotel also has a tram which connects to Crystals, The Cosmo and Aria. 

I would def recommend staying here, and I will be back again!

I guess it was good for the price. No wow factor. Maybe one day I'll see Jabbawockeez. Only plus is that its located mid-strip.  TV is outdated, although we didnt turn it on. Lighting is terrible. Bathroom had a broken toilet seat.  Come Again? No thanks.

Maybe it was because I was with two of my best girls, maybe it was because it's VEGAS....but i have no complaints. We arrived, the valet dudes were kind enough, bellman was attentive...the lines for check in were kinda wacky, but short enough. Checked in to our room, it was clean and cozy enough. As mentioned by other reviewers, the towels did have a slightly burned smell. Odd. The Casino was a bit smokey but not too bad, whatever scent they had pumping in to mask the smell did the trick. I loved the location...we were able to get out and walk the strip, hitting up all the shops we felt were priority =). We hit up two local clubs and each averaged about 10 bucks a cab ride, one way. One of my fav casinos is NYNY, which was right next door to Monte Carlo...so that was great! Oh and the little retail shops in Monte Carlo were great! We picked up a few little last minute items to make us just that much cuter for our nightlife ventures! I would love to stay here again.

Pros: Loved the Spa Suite, it was spacious and very clean.  Super convenient location in the middle of the strip walking distance to everything.
Cons: it had a funny smell which you eventually get used to, also my room had a great View of the Aria, but it would have been better if the Aria wasn't there.....didn't want to see a hotel that was nicer than the one I was staying at LOL.  I would come here again.

One of the MGM properties, booked by phone and received comped breakfast coupon for one of several buffets in town - we picked the ARIA Hotel buffet. ONLY GOOD ON WEEKDAYS-  you will pay a difference if you use the coupon on a Sunday brunch-  a $42 value on this coupon.

Requested an upgrade room but basically received the exact same room, on an upper floor which would have been a suite, if the adjoining room was used. 
Granted, this is an older hotel, so there are not as many nice things to see or do, but you're free to visit the higher end resort casinos without having to fork over the money for it, so why not save a bit on a room that will be used mostly for bathroom breaks and naps?

Visited the pool are but there was an incredible crowd, and the water appeared to be murky from all those people with drinks and suntan lotion on, plus a lot of kids, so I passed taking a swim (impossible with the weekend's crowd). Cabanas available for more privacy, if you want. Not really a happening place.

Slots were not generous but you know the house always wins.

Wish the rooms had more lighting in the bathrooms.

Simple bathroom amenities, eco-conscious (they want guests to re-use towels - admit it - you do at home so why not here too?).

In-room Keurig coffee machine is practically foolproof (except for me, of course - the kitchen gadget challenged - I somehow managed to cause a little overflow of water.)

NO WI-FI! What electronic stone age are we living in?

Ate at their ultra spendy restaurant Andre's which was totally worth the $$$$ (see my related review here: 
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/andres-las-vegas-4#hrid:2r-gYBS-CgaZkcixMe3Liw\/src:self

If I could, I would give management 0 stars for how they handled our current stay at this hotel.  On registration, my hubby asked for an upgrade since it was our 8 year anniversary.  He was given the upgrade and also OFFERED 2 complimentary buffets by the front desk agent, Juanita.  We weren't even planning on having their buffet since we prefer Bacchanal or Wicked Spoon but we were playing slots and happened to see the buffet.  "Why not?" we think and since there were three price tiers, we wanted to know WHICH complimentary buffet they were offering.  So hubby goes to concierge and asks- "hey, which buffet can we use the deal that you offered?"  only to be told that there is NO such thing, we were never offered the buffets and sorry for the misunderstanding but we'll give you one buffet for the mistake.   So wifey is like, "WTF!  They are going back on their word?!"  

So wifey goes to concierge for clarification.  I was told by an assistant manager named Lucero,  that hubby said that buffets were included in the deal when booking the room and that he was asked for proof to honor the free buffets.  Hubby says that never came up.  He said, she said.  

WTF.

Bottom line is - honor what the hell your front desk agent promised.  We don't care about your damn buffet as I'm sure it's a pretty standard one compared to others.  What I care about is how YOU MADE YOUR GUESTS FEEL LIKE LIARS and like we made a big deal out of getting two free buffets that we did not even want!  We travel A LOT and have been to many, many establishments that have top notch service.  This is certainly not one of them.
