To top it all off, the GM, Charles' explanation of "well, we certainly don't give in fully to guests but try to meet you halfway by offering you one buffet" is the most laughable customer service line I've heard in a long time.   We're not asking for anything, sir.  We just expect you to honor your word but in Vegas, I guess that is asking for way too much.

Do yourself a Favor and PASS on Monte Carlo Hotel - There are MUCH BETTER Hotels out there for your Money - You can Bet that Monte Carlo LOST Our Business FOREVER, as Well as ALL of our Family And Friends!!!

Half the place is closed for construction. Even the bathroom by the food court was closed. The room was horribly noisy. Hammering started at dawn. There was a loud fan going going 24x7 two doors down after a flood. One morning at 5:00 AM there was a flood next door, and the idiots turned on an industrial shop vac right ourside our door to suck out the water. Sounded like a jet engine.  

No pool, and the so-called access to other resort's pools meant an hour walk or an Uber just to go to the pool. Not feasible. Do not visit here until construction is complete. As for me, I'd never go back.

Stayed during the week June 18th through June 22nd. Starting with the good. Stayed on the 23rd floor and had a strip view, it had easy access to aria and Bellagio and the casino wasn't good or bad. The pool area looked nice but was way packed mid week so I couldn't even imagine trying to be down there on the weekend. Price wasn't bad on paper but the Internet cord they provide didn't work, the shower had a ton of mildew, the hallway on our floor was always wet. Really wet. The aroma gives you a headache, I would rather just smell the smoke. My wife and I both cut our feet on the tac strip in the room. I called downstairs to let them know about the issues and told them ahed of time I'm not looking for anything free just giving the info, and they were rude. My family and I will be going back to the MGM as soon as the construction is done.

first time here at the monte carlo and i had a good experience despite the long check in line. thankfully, you could check out on your phone. stayed sat-sun. 

ROOM:
checked in at 4-5pm and all the highfloor king bed rooms were already out. so we paid $5 to upgrade our room so we could get a king bed. room itself was very spacious. had a bathroom with a vanity mirror, bathtub\/shower, and hairdryer included. 

* NO FRIDGE in any of the rooms, only in the suites. :( and of course no microwave either. 

our room was facing the strip which was cool but right below us was Diablo and the music was pounding loud despite our high floor room. i can't imagine how loud it was for the rooms below us. thankfully, i was still able to catch some zzz's but if you're a light sleeper, it's probably not a good idea.

no construction noise where my room was located though since it was not next to the construction area but while walking to the parking structure, i did not see or hear construction going on. maybe they had a holiday or they changed the hours of construction. 

POOLS & PARKING:
pools are closed due to construction but you are given the choice of going to mandalay bay or mgm for their pool. parking is free with your room key for both hotels too. 

*make sure to get the parking deal!!!!!! 

TRAM:
there is a tram from monte carlo\/aria to aria\/crystal shops and the bellagio\/vdara. i honestly loved this feature and would stay in monte carlo again just for it. it's free even if you aren't staying in any of the listed hotels but it's way more convenient if you are. :)

Pretty grossed out. I understand this is not a newer hotel but having black mold in the shower area is disgusting. When I called the front desk I was on hold for 6 minutes. The lady at the front desk informed me that they could not change my room since they were fully booked. So nothing was resolved.... not happy at all. The property is very out dated and run down. I visit Vegas 3-5 times a year and will never stay here again

I have stayed at cheaper hotels with better service, however the location of the Monte Carlo in the middle of the strip pretty much made up for anything that was lacking. There wasn't anything to special about the room; it was quite standard. The only thing I feel the room was lacking was a coffee maker and fridge. Seriously I can't recall ever staying at a hotel which lacked these amenities. Although I did not have a strip view, I must say that my view was awesome because I was facing the fabulous Monte Carlo pool and the extraordinary City Center! Beautiful in the daylight and absolutely stunning at night! Housekeeping was on point and the front desk was pleasant. My only complaint regarding personel would probably be the snotty ass concierge chick (excuse the tude but she almost got herself embarrassed but I was in a really good mood). The Monte Carlo Casino has to be my favorite on the strip thus far. It's very comfortable without having too young or too old of a crowd; and the music is on point!. Monte Carlo is not a bad choice. Not sure if I will be back to lodge but def will be back to gamble.
Dirty carpet, stinky room, ineffective AC, no fridge, dirty tub. Price is expensive for this kind hotel.

I booked this hotel for my companies annual meeting.  The sales department was very professional and easy to deal with.  The casino has good location close to the City Center and almost in the middle of the strip.  On most vacation search engines Monte Carlo is listed as a 4 star hotel.  Prices were very reasonable for this resort and casino and shops are nice. The gambling areas are not crammed together so you dont get that hemmed in feeling.  The rooms are very large, but are pretty no frills as far as I was concerned.  A keurig coffee brewer, two bottles of water and a flat screen tv were the highlights as far as ameneties are concerned.  One huge flaw of this hotel is the lack of WiFi and their ethernet internet access is not covered by the resort fee charge.

Overall this is a good value casino.  As part of the MGM family you can stay here and take advantage of MGM's frequent free show ticket promotions.  Monte Carlo and Luxor are the two cheapest 4 star hotels in the MGM group and probably on the strip.  The guests staying at Monte Carlo were not the rowdy low brow bunch found at the Luxor, so if you are looking for a decent place to stay with good location and good prices, Monte Carlo is a good candidate.
Cher was out of this world crazy sexy cool. The room, however, not so much. Casino stinks like old feet, cigarettes and broken dreams. The buffet was a good value and the coffee shop was FAB!!

Despite not having much luck gambling at the casino, I would gladly stay here again.  It is a nice value pick with a great location on the Strip.  Not as trashy as Excalibur or Circus Circus, but not nearly as flashy as the Cosmopolitan, Aria, or the Bellagio.  For value for the money, the hotel at Monte Carlo is a good pick.  Easily accessible by tram to Aria and Bellagio, but a slightly more convoluted route to the Cosmopolitan.  Only restaurant I ate at there was Diablo which was good but priced for the Las Vegas Strip.  The bartender by the sports book, Scott, was one of the friendliest and promptest I've had anywhere in Vegas.

Normally I would stay at MGM, but it's too far from the popular areas of the strip (Bellagio, Caesar's Palace).  We settled on MC because not only did they offer a decent promotion in July (5th - 7th), but they were a little closer to where we wanted to go.

We simply just needed a clean & convenient place to sleep & store our stuff.  MC got the job done.
Smells like burning hand lotion. And, you have to walk for forever to get to that free tram. Anyplace with Sbarro's can't be all that good.

I would consider this place if you are trying to save on hotel. I paid 500 for two nights. That's a pretty good deal! 

However, be warned it it not the cleanest of hotels nor is it one of the most modern of them. It just does the job. It is a place to sleep and a place to shower. 

The service is nice. The concierge is super friendly and always helpful. The front desk representatives are super friendly as well. 

The best part is if you give them your email at check in you get a emailed check out link. The express check out takes literally 3 minutes to do. The best part of it all is that you don't have to wait in the massive line to check out. The lines can get pretty massive during the lunch hours and the morning time!

The Monte Carlo was an excellent place to stay as far as location, But the rooms were not up to par as far as cleanliness, floor not only had a potato chip  on it from the last guests but also had a red stain I was scared to walk around barefooted  the air conditioning went out  a man had to come up twice to fix it which was very annoying!!! They did not offer me to change rooms which I could have pushed for but we were already settled in I didn't want to repack Andrey unpack somewhere else they should have that together prior to guess check in. They were fairly priced compared to the four and five-star luxury hotels out there in Vegas 0mg!!!the pool was not nothing to write home to Mom about!!! Oh& something Sneaky and new they just started in June 2016 is a at a $13 valet parking per day to your stay. which they do not mention  during you booking the room!!! When you walk outside it's over a hundred degrees and they don't have those mist of water coming down for the guests like other luxury hotels so you're out there just on fire anyway this new add-on surcharges is so ridiculous you already have to pay the resort fee and the taxes so all the hotels affiliated with MGM and Monte Carlo have also started doing this new $13 a day valet parking charge to your stay other than that it was a fairly OK!!!! not much to do in there as far as excitement or shows or clubs you definitely have to go to another Hotel & Casino for entertainment

Pros:
- Great location on the strip and easily accessible to NY NY, MGM, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, M&M world, Coke building, Ross, Food Court.

- CHEAP prices!  If you have an MGM player's club card, call into Casino Marketing to make your reservation.  The last time I stayed at Monte Carlo, I got super cheap rates!  The price to stay here alone is worth it!

- Gambling is great!  Finally a casino where you can actually WIN some money and will not rape your wallet royally.  The only problem is trying to peel yourself away when you're winning lol.

Cons:
- Rooms feel a little older.  It seems as though the rooms on the 20th floors on up are a little newer.  The hallway flooring are definitely cleaner & sheets seems cleaner.  I also had to switch rooms after my first night because my room door, safe and lights were not working. 

- Room walls were also very thin.  We could hear the couple arguing next door all the way up until 5:30 am.  Good lord, give it a rest, you're in Vegas- what is there to argue about?!

- Some of the dealers here make it very apparent that they don't get tipped\/would like to get tipped.  Don't get me wrong- they have some really friendly dealers here, it's just a select few that act that way.

For the price, I thought this resort was OK.  The rooms were not new but clean and big enough.  The casino had all the games and wasn't crowded but could have had more of a crowd - open tables were packed, and many tables stood closed.  The staff is the high point, including the customer service, super friendly.

The price was right for me, under $100 including resort fee, but was a bit far from the "Hot Zone" further up towards Bellagio and Linq.

The restaurants were all OK - I tried the Asian fusion and it was good but pricey.  They had sushi at the Chinese (?) restaurant, but I didn't give it a whirl.  I did not try the buffet but the price was reasonable, included drinks, and wasn't super busy.

Includes wifi.

Except for the $20.00\/day "resort fee", we stayed 2 nights for free with AA points.  

Cons:
No wi-fi in room or throughout most of the hotel

Could hear every word spoken in the next room

Minimal elevator security. Security consisted of having to use the room key to get the elevator to operate after certain hours, but anyone could go along for the ride without a key or anyone checking for keys. They would have to hire 3 security persons, since there are 3 elevators.

Crappy food in the coffee shop. Probably the worst breakfast we've ever had.

The tub doesn't drain when taking a shower. 


Pro:

location

decent rooms and manageable-sized casino.

The lobby is the best part of this hotel. It's very luxurious looking. The room and the floor that it's on... Not so much. Everything looks kind of dated. There was mold in the bathroom shower tub, and the sink didn't drain properly. It's definitely okay for a short stay though it doesn't seem like a 4 star hotel. Checkout was easy because they have an express checkout option. The casino is typical but they have a nice lounge in there (hit lounge?) with awesome live music. Be aware there is a $30 per day resort fee which significantly bumps up the room rate as a %. Take that into account when cross shopping because it's sort of a hidden fee and not all hotels charge the same fee if any. I read online that the fee covers internet, the fitness centre, fax, and 2 water bottles, etc. I didn't even get any water bottles. Guess that was taken out of the budget. The pool was closed too. The solution they post is to take a 5 minute walk to the MGM Grand nearby to use their pool. Really. Lastly, the walls are paper thin so you can hear your neighbors easily so pray you have quiet drunks for neighbors.

this is a pretty decent priced hotel for the location,and amenties it offers.rooms are pretty standard, roomy enough. serivce was very nice everyone was extra friendly. the minus 5 bar located on the casino flor.starbucks,subway,mcds,diablos all located within the vincity as well as a CVS with a chase atm.they offer valet,roomservice,it may not be ultra fancy but its pretty legit for the price your paying as well the pool area is pretty decent their pool is better then the mirage,wave pool vollyball area with sand, lazy river.

After staying here 6 times prior unfortunately this will be our last time. Let's start with prior to my stay. I booked 5 rooms for 2 nights. (Mon-weds) I called a few times to get things in order apparently the automated message let's you know they are experiencing high call volumes  (probably people calling to complain) I waited on hold 10minutes.  I was calling to request the rooms I booked be on the same floor, and prices to upgrade room as well as a question about a show. Well, crappy customer service the guy had a attitude an without notice transferred me elsewhere for the show an didn't even answer my other questions so I had to call back an wait on hold again ! Ok well a week later it's check in time out of all the times I called not 1 person put a note in the computer. So my check in took 40 minutes  they are definitely under staffed. We got one of the suites it was ok had a crappy view of nothing out the window and hot water wasn't working in our 2nd bathroom and shower head sucked and extremely small t.vs. Also their pool has been out of service for months and will continue to be so that's a HUGE inconvenience they make u walk to mgm or Mandalay Bay which r both far walks then u have ro walk through the whole place to the back to the pool then you get there an are told 2 people per room key and we had 3 people an 1 key we didn't need  2 keys since we were all sticking around eachother. Would of been nice of Monte Carlo to let guests know that!!! Also didn't know until check in that on the high floors our water would be turned off from 12-6 or 7!!!! It was also nice to have someone else's food carts (3 of them) in front of our door all 3 days we were there!!! Oh not to mention our room keys to 2 of our rooms stopped working out of no where so we had to walk down to the front an wait in their lovely long SLOW line again to get new keys which made us late to where we were going. Also we noticed when walking through the hotel some parts smelt like sewer or something real bad. Walls are paper thin so be prepared to hear vacuuming and people's toilets. Ahh let's not forget the construction who started bright and early every day and the boss man down there screaming at his crew. That was nice. An they still want you to pay their $35 resort fee (which we only use pool not gym or business station) oh plus $8 parking per night even when u are a guest staying at their hotel paying resort fee!!! As if they aren't already greedy enough.  
1 star for the nice patient Lady at check in and the  buffet was ok weds morning nothing to brag about.

It's a nice hotel that located on the strip and it's not far away from all the places you need to explore. Initially, we were going to stay at Luxor, but after reading and seeing reviews that was a definitely no. We kept checking the prices online and soon we were just playing about $50-$54 a night at Monte Carlos. So we paid $250 for 4 nights after tax and resort fee added for a two Queen size bed. Our hotel room was cleaned out every day and our bed was made. We never got enough towels like face and hand and shower mat but that's fine because my friend and I brought our own towels. Right outside of Monte Carlos, there's a CVS and if you go out of the casino way, there's M&M, Coca Cola and other novelty stores like that. You could also take the tram to Bellagio, Aria and Crystal. So the location is was perfect. The only thing was that if you were to sit in the cafe or near the casino you would a whiff of the second hand smoking. The cigarette's smoke always bothered me but if you're in the casino you have to get use to it. I liked it overall, it wasn't bad as motel 8 or day's inn so I'm content.

I love staying here. They're not all snooty about giving you key cards, you can have as many as you need. The service is quick and friendly. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. And if you stay here, you have to check out Andre's. It has the BEST fois gras I've ever had...I crave it just thinking about it!!

It's alright I guess.

No microwave or mini fridge in the room but there is HDTV.

Showers are much better here than my last stay at MGM Grand.

The casino level wasn't large compared to other hotels.

Free internet access.

A\/C wasn't working very well.

Cheaper prices than most hotels on the strip.

You get what you pay for.

So three stars will do.

I stayed at the Monte Carlo while on a business trip in Vegas. It is a decent hotel, nothing fancy at all. The room is very average, but definitely not the worst hotel room I've been in. The pluses about this hotel was when I booked it I got a free $50 food and dining credit for about 5 of their restaurants in the hotel. I went to The Cafe for two nights and ordered two different sandwiches, both of which were actually really good. So it seems that their restaurants are pretty good. I also hit their gym facilities a few of the nights I stayed and the do have a good, full fitness center with a lot of free weights, machines and cardio equipment. They also have a full spa with saunas, steam rooms, hot tubs, massages, etc. The casino is pretty decent as well and wasn't too smokey at all surprisingly. For $80 a night through the week, I guess this was a pretty decent deal.

Extremely disappointed! Hotel was dated, dirty and not up to Vegas standards. Bathroom fixtures were rusty and tub corners dirty. Stained grungy carpets. The only good thing about the room was that the bed was comfortable. Hotel pools were under construction, and guest were routed to other hotels for pool access. It would have been nice to know that prior to booking. Pictures on websites are misleading and do not reflect current state of hotel. In addition, website does not state that hotel is under construction. Therefore, being awoken at 6am with loud hammering was N O T appreciated. It's heartbreaking to know that this dump is part of M Group of hotels.
N E V E R    A G A I N!!!

Don't go! Horrible place... not clean, extremely high priced for what you get. The room looks like motel 6... no joke. I am shocked. Then they charge you a 40 dollar resort fee even though the pool is not working at moment. I'm very upset with this hotel. Oh and the hour wait to check in was horrible. Please check out trump or other hotels! Not worth the price here.

Stayed 2 nights, Feb 5th & 6th.  Check is was fine, a pleasant greeter named Ricky was nice to everyone chatting them up as they waited then directly us to the next open front desk attendant.  

Had asked for a king bed but was told they were not guaranteed...umm..ok..whatever, just need a room.  Was asked if I wanted to change the next night and I said yes.  

The comments that the place is a bit run down are spot on.  Almost everything has signs of being used and abused.  Walls are super thin...thought I was hearing things in the morning but I wasn't....could totally hear a guy taking a pee....that took forever.   LOL!  

2nd night I moved to the king bedroom which had a nice layout but again...everything looked worn.  Each light shade near the bed were broken and the shower faucet leaked.  

I did like the fact that the inter hotel tram was a fast way to get to the Belagio and the staff was very friendly.

If you want modern and nice this is not the place.  Try the Aria...heard nice things about it.

Great price point.  I love this place for the friendly tables.  Lots of food options.  Great asian food options!!!  Check in was great.  Rooms were clean.  Great location.  Once again The Pub is a must for your craft beer fans!

UPDATE: They charge for parking now! $8 self parking!!!

First time staying here and I was impressed. 

Hotel lobby is nice. Great selection of restaurants. There is an entrance off the strip but valet entry is off the side street. Walk way to Aria.

Room was clean and big. Decent gambling prices.

Very close to the City Center.

Would stay again.

Just stayed here for my first visit ever to Vegas with 2 of my other friends. All girls. I have travelled all over the world and everyone always has things that bug them. Monte Carlo is very plain nothing spectacular. If this was in the middle of anywhere you would think this place is amazing but for vegas and from what I have seen in other vegas hotels just from wandering around... plain is the word. The look from the outside at night is beautful and it is also very pretty during the day. The sculptures and detail outside are nice. The staff is friendly and quite helpful. The rooms were you know decent, bed were comfortable we never watched tv cuz we were either drunk or out. There is no wireless for free, the shower wasnt so great hot water was scarce. I noticed other ppl had fridges we didnt.  One thing that did bug me was a "resort" fee we had to pay per person upon check out... I didnt get that .. we paid to stay there why did i have to pay a resort fee.... big fail on that!

We ate at Diablos and had the margaritas. Upon reading the reviews we really didnt have any complaints like many others did. The staff was friendly we were seated right away and prices were reasonable. The food was decent and margaritas were great 12 bucks a pitcher. Left there drunk lol. 

NOW we recieved complimentary buffett .. since there were 3 of us 2 of us were free and it was 12 bucks extra per person for unlimited champagne which we took advatnage of. I think it is completely worth it. The food isnt amazing but it is decent its a nice way to fill up on food and booze for cheap ...


In reality the location of Monte Carlo is awesome .. would I stay here again? Probably not because I have now seen what other hotels look like and offer from wandering around Vegas. 

Would I reccomend it ? sure if the price is right and you cant stay anywhere else in the middle of the strip for that price.

Review for casino only:

I have always enjoyed the Monte Carlo although it seems like it could use an interior facelift.  I like the newer garage, but the walk from there to the casino is a long one.

Cocktail service was excellent last night.  She was around probably 5 times in 45 minutes and she asked each time she came back.

The worst hotel I have ever stayed. 

Old facility, irresponsible front desk and rude\/lazy maintenance people.

Not helpful and lying without any ground.

Don't even pick up the phone at the front desk manager level. All they wanna do is keeping u waiting and waiting!

Security people is just like fake, requested for new keys, never gave the keys to u. The disaster happened twice per nite! Horrible horrible 

Definitely not gonna stay here any more and forever! 

Horrible place and 120% not recommend or u'll regret ur decision

Ok, so I kept my reservation and glad I did.  I had seen a lot of negative reviews. My total cost for two nights was 135.00. That included taxes, resort fee and parking. For the price, it was a great deal.  The location is perfect. The employee's give great customer service.  There is great dinning options and The Park is great.  The wave pool was fun. The casino and public area of the resort is kept clean and is nicely decorated (fresh flowers). The room was clean and had a great view. The bathroom is outdated and the water in the shower drained slowly.  I recommend the Monte Carlo if you get a great deal.

Date of my visit: 24-October-2017
Time of my visit: Early Evening
Total gambling costs: $75 ($45 in sports books + $5 high limit slots + $25 roulette)

One of the better ways to get to T-Mobile Arena is through Monte Carlo.

It looked nice inside.  I walked through the place, all tables looked busy and buzzing.  I ended up make a $5 high limit slot bet and lost...  I walked over to the Sports Books to make three bets, two of them were for Chicago Blackhawks to win the Stanley Cup and one was for the Chicago Bears to win the SuperBowl (yes, you can make fun of me for that one now).  However, I was trying to make another bet (for Vegas Golden Knights to make the playoffs) and they did not have a line for that one.  I found it a bit odd.  Apparently, that bet was available prior to the start of the season, but not once the season started... Go Figure!

Roulette was fun too!  $5 low limits, let me gamble for a good half an hour.

Overall a solid A experience!  Maybe, I'll try to stay there one of those times I visit.

Room was clean and comfortable, but first thing in the morning we were woken up by noise of drilling and hammering . That was going on all morning, until we left. So after long night in the city we couldn't even have much sleep.

MGM group now charges for valet parking. By the time you pay the resort fee and parking the room is double what was advertised for. The charge for valet parking for guests is outrageous. The room was nice but the hotel staff at check in was extremely rude and flippant.  I have stayed here 6-7 times because I have been treated well but the rude staff and parking fee are the last straw. This will probably have been my last stay at an MGM group hotel.  The Tropicana is a Double Tree now, the rooms are newly renovated and you get cookies, not to mention the impeccable service the Hilton group is known for AND free valet parking, stay there instead.

The valet\/ Bell desk guy was superb.  Went to go grab our bags and met us at the taxi stand and loaded them in.

Expedia did not have some things right with the reservations.  Front desk Manager Jake was extremely helpful.  Made a bad first impression into a very good one.

If you want to get a lounge chair at the pool get their early!  Very nice tho.

Waitresses girls for the casino are on top of their game never had to wait for a drink.

Strip view room was nice.  We were on the 30th floor rm313

Over all a good stay!

Bed bugs??? 

I don't know if our bed had them but I came home with red marks on the left side of my stomach and back. (I'm a side sleeper) room # 09-118

There's nothing special about this place except that it's cheaper than other big casinos. It really feels dated compared to the newer high end resorts now.
Nice little hotel - didn't get a chance to hit the pool, but it had a decent sports book, plenty of tables, and some good food spots in house. I would stay here again

Nice Casino for the money.  Clean rooms, upgraded to Strip view no charge, lots of fun.  Not a fan of the $20 per night "Resort Fee" Thought that was included in my $130\/night hotel fee =).  But I can't complain about 130 per night on the strip.

Overall very nice place.  Would return many times.

The absolute worst hotel I've stayed in on the strip. They charge $67 as a resort fee for amenities. The amenities are nothing anyone would use. They dont have free WiFi but they offer wired internet. So if you travel with a tablet, you better have a hot spot. The rooms are nothing spectacular and are definitely not what they show on their website. They do not have HD tv and you will loose cable service from time to time...I can go onbut ddon't feel the need to waste the time. They will never get my business again even if they offered a free room. I wouldn't give any stars but you have to give at least one. Could not find a server to bring you drinks in the casino even after pressing the button snd then waiting an hour for them not to return with your drink. Only positive is the Blue Man Group performing there.

This review if for their ballroom and catering services.  

My husbands company had decided on the Monte Carlo for the Christmas Party. First off, their parking is very easy to access.   From the 15, you take Frank Sinatra Drive and turn onto Rue de Monte Carlo.  Their self parking structure is right there... no need to drive on the busy Las Vegas Blvd.  Hooray!  

Since we were there a little early, we had a little bit on fun 'contributing' to their electric bill.  Since they had recently moved the Blue Man Group show from the Venetian to here, they had a  little parade of instruments going through the casino as to promote their show starting soon.  It was very entertaining!  

It was party time... and very easy to find the ballrooms designated for the company.  It was beautifully decorated for the Christmas season with many trees.  This worked out great for a photo op!  The huge chandeliers also lit the rooms nicely as they weren't too bright but just enough.  

They had set up several different food stations which consisted of a variety of salads, rolls, chicken, beef, baked potato bar and beautiful dessert table.   The potato bar was excellent as they had shrimp and crap meat they would saut  for you.  I actually skipped the potato and just had the shrimp, crab and some mushrooms.  Delightful!   If you know me, I always look forward to dessert time.  Unfortunately they had set this up a little too far in advance.  The cakes and cookies were very very dry.  Bummer for me.  

The waitstaff did a phenomenal job!!  They were right there to clear away any plates, refill drinks and just give you a smile!  

Overall it is a great place for large gatherings, parties or meetings.

PROS +++ The lazy river pool is so fun. Everyone has a smile when they are hanging at this pool.
+++ The restaurants offer a very good meal at a reasonable price. However, any time you order alcohol of any kind, the bill goes from reasonable to are you kidding me?
+++ The food court is not terrible. It offers a quick meal at a fairly decent price for Vegas prices.
+++ Every amenity that you wish is pretty centrally located except for the specialty restaurants. In some casino resorts, you literally feel like you are on a Death March through a smoke filled desert to get any place. Not here!
CONS --- The rooms. They are sadly in need of a remodel. Our double queen on the 28th  floor had one chair at a broken desk, no power strip, no mini bar or frig, and no coffee in the room. Yes, I realize the corporation doesn't want you to hang out in the room, but in America you expect certain amenities especially when comps on the Strip have those features. Is it too much to ask for at least two comfortable chairs in the room?
--- Geez, Louise! It's not even the height of tourist season, and the staff is already full of attitude. The security guard practically told us to get out when the pool was closing. The food service worker at the food court got completely snippy with my poor spouse when he couldn't hear what he did and very politely asked him to repeat what he said. The restaurant worker went cold when we asked if Canadian whiskey was a well drink. My room key de-magnetized and the desk clerk acted like it was my fault. No sorry for my trouble. No nothing. 
++-- Would I stay here again? Oh yeah! $100\/night for a fun pool experience and nice convenient food is totally worth a few crab apples.
I'm sure in its prime in the 90s this is the place to be, but now it is getting old - I mean old! Perhaps a good renovation is called for. Other than that it is still OK I guess.

It was my first time staying here at this hotel and I was very disappointed. The rooms are very outdated, old, and dirty. The carpet had visible stains. The pool was closed and most of the hotel is currently being renovated. The construction started at about 7:00 am, was very loud and could be heard from all over the hotel and not just the room.

While your attempt to rectify our situation seems genuine, my husband and several of our wedding guests  have already spoken with guest services prior to this review and nothing but an apology was offered. 
I will follow up with a phone call again. However, I won't hold my breath for an appropriate resolution. 
**just an update- I was notified by one of my bridesmaids that her kindle was stolen while staying at your hotel. Per usual- nothing but an apology was offered. 

I followed up with this negative review in hopes that your hospitality standards will be raised and nobody else has to have as poor experience as we did.

We had our 'Cousins Weekend' together and booked 8 rooms at the Monte Carlo. We had a great room rate of $85. with complimentary buffet coupons.

When we checked, Melissa at the front desk was extremely helpful and has fabulous customer service skills.  She deserves 5 stars.  She made sure we were on the same floor\/wing of the hotel.   Our rooms were located at the back of the hotel so the rooms were extremely quiet.

Overall, the rooms are clean, beds were comfortable and location was fabulous.  An easy walk to the Aria, Cosmo and Bellagio. 

Four Stars based on value, quality of service and location.

Stayed here on a Sunday night and got a really good rate.

The location of this hotel can't be beat. Just south of City Center and north of New York New York. There is also a free tram to and from the Belagio, which was nice. If they ever connect the Excalibur tram to this one and throw in a stop at New York New York, you could really get around the west side of the strip without having to worry about being run over by a taxi driver!

Quality of the room was better than average. Typical hotel level. There are much nicer rooms out there for sure, but you'd have to pay a few dollars more for them.

Casino was large and the other players were very friendly. Cocktail service was slow.

Pools were closed when I was there so I couldn't rate them, but I could see from my hotel room that there was a small wave pool and an even smaller lazy river.

Didn't eat anything here so cannot comment on food options, but they seemed to be fairly typical. Nothing called to me at all.

A decent hotel for a reasonable price point if you really want to be in the center of the strip, this is a good choice. The room.was nothing special, but clean and adequate and the check in process takes a bit so maybe consider grabbing a coffee or a cocktail near the front entrance to enjoy while you wait. It is $15 a day to valet your car (plus tips each time they bring or take your vehicle) We did this the first day for check in and convenience since we wanted to be on the strip, but the 2nd and 3rd days since we were driving around L.V. we opted for self park, just remember when you park to use your room key to get in and out pf the garage (along with at the other MGM properties) and tell the attendant you are checked in already otherwise they'll charge you at the garage and again when you check out. 

The pool was under construction so you have to go to Mandalay Bay or MGM, we intended to spend a couple hours poolside, but as it would be a bit of a hassle, we decided our time was better spent doing other activities, however if we had brought our kids, we would have just made an afternoon of going to Mandalay Bay and packed a bag to take. 

Casino floor is nice and clean, pretty good restaurants and bars, staff was polite and friendly. Overall we had a pleasant experience, however be mindful that they start construction throughout the resort in the next few weeks, if you won't be at the resort Monday through Friday during daytime construction hours or don't mind a little dust, you may be able to get a really good rate, however if it isn't a great deal, I'd wait to come back until renovation is finished.

I have stayed here before and brought a large group for a 4 day golf tournament for 30 people. What a mistake. They did not mention to us that the pool was closed and the hotel was being renovated. There was construction noise all day. The screwed up several of our rooms and were not even very concerned about how bad the service was. If you parked in valet took 20-30 minuets each day for the valets to fetch the vehicle. It was completely understaffed. I will never stay here again.

We are Las Vegas natives and choose the Monte Carlo because of the location near team mobile, we were going to a concert that evening. 
Let me start with the valet and bell staff we're extremely nice and informative! If I were rating just them I would give them five stars! 
Everything went downhill from there. 
The front desk attendant Alan was condescending and VERY RUDE! He informed us they had no more king beds available and we checked in at 12 noon, not late by any means. Then that the pool was closed and we would be able to access the pool at Mandalay Bay or MGM, not really a bad thing as they both have very nice pools but the inconvenience of travel took about a extra hour and half from our relaxing time and there are only shuttles on the hour and we were pressed for time . 
As I expressed my annoyance of not knowing about the construction and that the information should be on the website so we would be able to make a decision based on that information, Alan very rudely told me he had gone on and read it himself and spoke to me like I was an idiot. His response was, you are locals you didn't know about the remodeling? As I replied no I didn't . He said well maybe you should keep up on local news? 
I really just wanted to get on with our short stay , so we just took our room and left . I did go back on bookings. Com to check if I had missed all the information he said was there , I have used booking so many times so I thought I could have missed it because all my info is there so just a few clicks and I'm done . Not one mention of any remodeling or closure are on there!!!! So Alan lied right to our face. as I'm sure he is having to deal with a ton of complaints due to all but I did not appreciate his attitude at all ! 
The construction noise really didn't bother us . It was like a loud humming fan and we actually liked the noise that drowns out the partying late nighters going through the halls. 
I'm glad they are doing the remodeling, it is very much needed ! The hotel looked more like they haven't done any cosmetic work there since they day they opened .

Paid $800 USD for 5 nights without the $140 resorts fee. No complimentary coffee maker. Air-con is very low. Can only go low upto 15 degree celsius. The house keeping people are the only decent and friendly people. The front desk people are rude,arrogant and ignorant. Stored our luggages at the bell desk area, when we got it, the bag ripped out open, we tried asking for masking\/duct tape but they said that they don't have any or a wrapping plastic wrap. They didn't even say sorry!! Very bad experience. I won't recommend it to my friends. Bad Customer Service!!

I wanted to like it here I really did. My husband had to choose from this and Aria because of a work conference. He chose this because he didn't want to stay at the same place as his conference. First time ever taking a Vacation just the 2 of Us and this place is horrible! 

We added 3 days into our trip for a total stay of 8 days. Our 1st room was on the 21st floor strip view 2 Queen Beds. I went to freshen up and there was a long black hair on the towel. There were holes in the wall and a missing painting. 

They moved us to another queen room for that night and the following day were upgraded with the promise of a King Bed and refrigerator the. Next day. Get a text our new room is ready so we come back early to move our room. We finally get to the counter and the guy has no clue what we're talking about. Takes 20mins to figure it out. We get to the 16th floor a king bed NO FRIDGE! I gave up and didn't bother to say anything! Plus we heard all the construction next door! 5:30am wake up call every morning is not cool! 

Pool closes @ 6:00pm and my husband isn't done till 5 or 6 most nights so he never gets to use the pool. We pay one of the highest resort fees and they can't give you a tube for the lazy river $5.00 is not a lot of money but when your paying for a resort fee it should be free. You can't bring outside food or drinks and there food menu is limited! 

The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the location is amazing and Bruxie & Sambaltta were on point. 

Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else. We will not be back here again!

BEWARE !!! I hate when people think everyone is so stupid you can't see through the lies.We go to Vegas every year and Stayed at the Monte Carlo 6\/18\/16-6\/25\/16 had a good week until I went to check my room bill and noticed a $13 charge for valet parking each day all week and when  I questioned it. I was told that's the way it is. I should've looked at the sign posted at the valet. so out to find this sign I went. But I can't find any sign with parking rates posted.I don't know about las vega but in Boston parking rates have to be clearly posted.So I asked the valet about the sign and was told there was a sign but It blew away and they just haven't put it back yet. REALLY we know the sign was bad for business and had to go. Talk about deceptive practices. If they had made it clear on day one I may have chose to self park for eight  dollars or I may still have chosen to valet. But the choice would've been mine. And even now if you go to the Monte Carlo's own website and search parking or parking rates nothing comes up. And for that reason that was my first and last stay at the Monte Carlo Las Vegas

The hotel is quite clean, and the rooms are very spacious. The location of the hotel is great, there are many attractions near by on the strip.
The negative aspects of the hotel pertain to the bathroom. Although the bathroom is a good size, the toilet and shower are made for the hulk. The water in the shower feels like a pressurized hose and the toilet seems capable of flushing anything. Just remember not to sit on the toilet when you flush! Lol

I really liked my stay at the Monte Carlo. Vegas is Vegas and time to party. For me the room served its purpose, it was cheap, it had a comfy bed and the shower water pressure rocked. The hotel had a pleasant aroma of fresh flowers and not overpowering like the Venetian. I loved the pool. I was there for 5 hours each day drinking, eating and enjoying the lazy river and wave pool. Both were a lot of fun. Loved the lazy river and you totally don't need to pay the $14 for a tube. I think its more fun without one. 

Tip: buy a bottle of water in the gift shop for $4 to save a buck or 2 if you order outside at the pool bar. 

I would stay here again in second, only downside is gaming does kind of stink. But that's OK, I like going around to other casino's to play

Just left Vegas and I go about 6times a year.. Not a great visit! The o my reason it's a 2 star is for the pool. Cabana was great! ... I'm a gold maybe platinum mlife cardholder and check in through bio services .. Check in was ok still had to wait till 1pm to receive my room. I asked for 2 rooms wth a connecting door and wasn't able to get it . It was a Monday so I'm sure something could've been done. I look fairly young so every time I walk In I get a look like what am I doing there. The food at the buffet was horrible I took my nieces and nephews it was the worst 150$ spent! Food was disgusting. Now when I checked out of vip seevices I asked Deborah (who seemed as she wasn't having a good day!) to check if anything can be comped due to my casino playing on my card. She said she couldn't do anything there there's no way for her to get anything comped. Lies. I always do that and I never have to ask. The representative usually calls without me asking and always comps either resort fees rooms food. I continued to tell her I have had this done before and she then says "let me call see what they can comp!" Why not do that the first time??? She just made my day visit to vip lounge uncomfortable!

DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!
I booked this hotel for 3 nights this past weekend about two months ago and as soon as I got to the hotel it was all bad.

They charge you $8 PER DAY just to park there, $12 per day for valet. 

Once I checked in they told me that my King bed room wasn't going to be ready till the next day and all they can do is give me a room with two small beds and strip view (which was horrible and dirty) I would think after booking two months prior till my stay and paying $560 for 3 nights they would have my room ready.

Not only did they over charge me $560 plus for my stay, they charged me an extra $150 at check in.
$100 for "pool access" I called and they told me it was $30 per day for pool access. Which is BS!

And $50 I would get back after my stay but only got $25 because of the 3 days of parking access.

Over all this hotel was horrible. They screwed me over real bad. I never write reviews but I had to for this occasion. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, so if you see this review. Stay Away and Do Not Book. Waist of money.

Self-Parking: We rented a car, and followed the suggestions on here to park on the 2nd floor of the self-park garage since the skywalk to the hotel is located there. Parking was easy and bountiful. I suppose you could park in any other floor in the garage since they have an elevator, but the elevator is hot. No a\/c runnin in there. So yes try to go for the 2nd floor level parking to avoid a sauna experience inside the elevator.

Check-in: We were pleasantly surprised that we were allowed to check-in early (around 12 noon). The Check-in agent was thoughtful and gave 3 options in terms of room type and availability (check-in before 3pm or between 3-5 pm for a room on a higher floor). We chose to check-in early so we can start the fun. (oh I tried the "sandwhich trick" failed miserably. haha. all good. They have this person who escorts you to the counter to the check-in agent and walks up and down observing, I guess for people like me who try the "sandwhich" trick. haha. But the check-in agent gave us some bogo passes for the buffet and 2 other coupons.

There are 2-3 sets of elevators depending what floor your room is and it located just ahead of their gift shop, to the right.

Elevators were pretty quick, despite large crowds. We were given a room on the 12th floor. It was overlooking New York New York next door and the construction site. The room was pretty big for a standard king size room, in my opinion. ( see attached pictures ). Simple, elegant, and most importantly it was clean. The bed, omg, so comfortable. Literally can just sink in and dream away. Love it! No wifi in the room only free wired internet, I brought along a travel router and it worked great in the room. I would have to agree with some of the reviews that the room could use a little updating. However, who stays in their room for a long period of time in Vegas anyway? We didn't! The shower\/bathroom was clean also, did not see any molds in this unit. The water pressure was incredible but loud. Also, you hafta' hold down the flusher for a bit to flush all the way. Shower had no issues except that since the water pressure was on point, it made it really loud. Think Raging Rapids coming out of the shower. Their shampoos and stuff smelt good, like body wash for babies. *smiles* The walls are also paper thin here, so I can verify with the other reviews that you can hear your next door neighbor's conversations (and toilet flushes). Also if your neighbor goes in and out of their room in the middle of the night, you can definitely hear that as well. Construction noises were barely heard in the morning hours.

Pool: Unfortunately we weren't able to go swimming since it started raining and they closed it down. But from the looks of it, the pool area was awsome. They also had a DJ playing house music . Darn Rain!! Maybe next time.

They have a free tram that takes you to Aria and Bellagio. From the pool entrance, look to your right and see the sign for street of dreams. This will connect you to the free tram. Follow the signs.

Casino: They had some ok slots in there, didn't play the tables. Blue Man Group is the featured entertainment at this hotel. They also have the Minus5 ice lounge. M Life counter is on the right side from the center of the casino if your into the player's club stuff.

They have a food court that includes mcdonalds, starbucks, and others. ( Some guy comp'ed everyone's startbucks purchases the morning we checked-out. Thank you man, whoever you are!!)

Staff: All were very accommodating and welcoming.

I like the fact that the Monte Carlo isn't a huge hotel resort where it becomes a daunting task to get around. It's pretty cut and dry and you have access to everything from the lobby. I like that! You can get in and out, even with crowds, in no time. I love the fact that the Monte Carlo is centrally located on the Strip. All the major casinos are all in walking distance. I hope the construction is completed soon, as I will be staying at Monte Carlo again. I am excited to see what the new venue\/area they are constructing will look like.

Check Out: It was a breeze, you also have the option for express check-out, but noone was in line at the check-out counter during that time, so we did it the regular way. Complimentary flight check-in and printing of boarding passes is also available. You can do this in the area next to the Bell Desk.

We had a wonderful time at the Monte Carlo. No issues at all. I will be coming back again. 4 stars only since I had to bring my own pocket router to get wifi in the room. (Wi-fi is available on the first 2 floors).

Thanks for a good time Monte Carlo!

This hotel really needs an update. The rooms are clean enough but really need updating. The pool is nice with a lazy river, standard pool and wave pool. Pool was super crowded the day I was there but that's not completely unexpected for Vegas. Not a terrible hotel but with the other options in Vegas it's disappointing.

I read a lot of bad reviews before going to the Monte Carlo so was a little skeptical. But after staying there this Memorial Day  weekend I have to give it a good review. I have slowly been coming more and more often to Vegas and try to stay at different hotels. This one so far has been really good and would not mind staying here again, its conveniently located close to many great spots. The minute we got there everyone was so nice and welcoming (awesome staff), check in was easy, Vegas has a specific smell and I didn't notice it much here. (clean) Room was clean with a great view, beds were comfortable, as soon as we arrived we got ready,  didn't have to walk much because downstairs they have Diablos. Next day we went out, called house keeping to clean our room, we happened to not stay out long (maybe about an hour)  and by the time we came back the room was already clean. Check out was super easy, they took out luggage right away met us downstairs and were on our way before you know it. Oh and their food court selection is pretty good. No complaints here.

It's clean and comfortable.  The room was a bit outdated but had hot water and flushing toilets.  It's definitely seen better days but for location and price can't go wrong.  The jacuzzi and lazy river pool nice amenities.

Love this place! Nice rooms, great views. This was the first time we have stayed here and will stay again for sure. Not overpriced for what you get. We were very surprised at the quality for the price. Staff is great. 

Casino is nice and honestly pretty quiet compared to the rest. The bars in the casino are nice and pretty much around the same price as other places. Most have great happy hour prices on food and drinks. 

Restaurants are all pretty good but, The Pub is amazing and is great for watching sports! Also has great food and a great happy hour setup! Diablo's Cantina is on the corner of the resort and we go there every time we go to Vegas so, obviously it's great as well.  

They have a nice walkway that has some good shops and a tram that takes you from MC to Aria to Bellagio. 

Only complaint I have is the WiFi is pretty much only the first two floors (that's what the sign says) Which won't  bother most people since they're not in the room much anyways. But, for the cyber junkies it wouldn't be very good I guess. I was fine with it coming and going from our room. We were on the 22nd floor so we didn't expect super great WiFi anyways. 

Keep up the great work and I'm sure we will see you again soon!!

Additional items we noticed throughout our stay:
- USA Today is not delivered to your room. It is in the elevator lobby area.
- There is no wifi. You get an Ethernet cable.
- No easily accessible outlets. Even those that were hard to reach were in use. You had to unplug something if you wanted to use an outlet.
- Elevator doors had grease and residue on the outsides. It appeared as though the metal had not had maintenance in a very long time.
- Subjective but the bed was extremely uncomfortable. The pillows are hard and extremely thick.
- TV remote didn't work 50% of the time. The stations are basic cable at best. The TV guide channel didn't work.
- ATM's in the lobby will cost you an additional $5.00 for surcharge fees. Be sure you need the cash.
- You can hear absolutely everything going on beside you, above you, and in the hallway. From people coughing to partying; you'll be a part of it all.
- Hair dryers are in bags in the closets.
- The linens all smell like they have been put in a dryer that had a fire in it at some point. Everything smells like burned hair.
- Drawers are not cleaned out for use. There are random items in there as well as dirt and dust.
- Rooms are extremely outdated. From the furniture to the carpet to the bathroom counters.


Ultimately, your money is better spent at Motel 8 or in a hostel than at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. If we return to Vegas, we will be happy to pay to stay at a hotel that deserves its four diamond rating.

The Monte Carlo is a nice place to stay on the Strip. The rooms are nice enough but I have been spoiled by the Trump on my first trip to Vegas so it's not really fair to compare the two. My entire experience at the Monte Carlo was a pleasant one, from check-in to check-out. The staff was really friendly and the concierge services were super helpful. 

Although I'm not a huge fan of casinos, mainly because of the smoke, it was kind of nice to have it there for entertainment. I also liked the convenience of the food court. Yes, there are much much better places to eat but when I'm craving a McChicken at 1 in the morning, I just want a McChicken! I probably ate more McDonald's in my short trip in Vegas that I did the entire last year. I'm not proud of it, but it happened!

The casino itself was ok. Don't bother expecting any sort of drink service though. I don't think I saw a single server the entire time I was there. Luckily, there is a bar at one end of the casino in case you really need a drink. 

I do wish that the hotel was more centrally located on the Strip. The tram that they have is kind of a joke; I feel like it doesn't really get you anywhere. I would stay here again if the price was right.
its ok - the hotel kindda has lack of a\/c lol & elevators during check-out r slow - theres a food court inside lol - the pool is kool

I stayed at the Monte Carlo from July 13- July 14. I had reservations through the weekend, but canceled my reservation due to the experience. To start off, the check in line was out of control and took quite a while. Secondly, there was a cricket in my hotel room which I caught and took a picture of before flushing it down the toilet. Third, the construction was very loud and started at 6:00 am in the morning. I was on the 31st floor and could hear every noise made by the construction. I wouldn't recommend staying here until the construction is completed. Last thing, they charge you a resort fee even though there is no functioning pool and you must go to the over crowded mandalay and MGM pools.

Monte Carlo is awesome. They have great dining, and good gambling. I woudn't recommend the poker room, but that's because I only appreciate the classier poker rooms in Vegas. We had a great time at Minus 5, the Ice bar\/lounge where everything is made of ice from floor to ceiling. Made some good friends there and had lots of fun. Diablo's and The Pub are also great places to stop by, however, if you come for The Pub's happy hour, make sure you know exactly what it is and don't let the waiters pretend like it doesn't exist(read more about it in my review of the pub).

We usually stay at the Monaco Suite. It's a decent sized suite with a flat screen and living room area and 1.5 bathrooms(a full sized bathroom and one bathroom with just toilet and sink). The decor is nice and the couches are comfy. The monaco suite also comes with a fridge so its great for keeping your drinks cold rather than having to keep going to the ice machine. We definitely enjoy the Monte Carlo every time we come and couldn't ask for anything more, well maybe if their tv's allowed for my laptop to hook into it, that would be the only thing. Oh, and one of the most important things, the resort fee is about $14 which is mid-grade for vegas but they have free wi-fi which is hard to find when looking for somewhere to stay.

This hotel is really nice. right by the strip next door to new york new york, the hotel has a food court in the lobby, you have mcdonalds, ice cream, pizza, starbuck and others. also the pub is there 5 stars for the pub.

Now i was reading other reviews and i gotta say YES the walls are kinda thin, you can hear whats going on next door to you, TV, Bath ect.

also someone said the lobby smelled funny, i gotta say i agree with them, i dont know what the problem is 

Side note, ASK for a upgrade at the counter! they will give you a great deal like i asked very cheap to upgrade to a better room also the rooms were very clean

i will stay again someday, but i want to experience other hotels also.

What a nightmare!! First time here and booked our room through AAA. Arrive at hotel to a looong line to check in at front desk only to  find out there hotel is under construction and there is NO POOL available to guest! The option they give guests is to take a shuttle to the MGM or Mandalay Bay Resort to go to A pool during your stay ?!  No where on the AAA website did they say this hotel was under construction and the hotel still charges us a $35 dollar resort fee ...for what? To use gym, wi-if (that is free if you enter your email as a visitor!!) so why charge a fee at all??  That's unacceptable and I will be disputing these charges!  My b\/f and I went to MGM just to see pool ... it was awful and a long walk from the entrance! Soooo inconvenient!!! I will never be back to this hotel again and expect a refund of the resort fee!

This hotel is showing its age.  I believe it's undergoing a much needed makeover. We were highly disappointed that the resorts pool was closed.  They allowed us to go to MGM or M. Bay which pools were fun!

As Vegas regular every time I decide to stay at different hotels but Monte Carlo was the worst experience ever I arrived on Friday afternoon like at 5 since  I reserved a 2 night 3 days stay here paid about 1200 bucks for two rooms for what was my 3 day weekend here when I checked in they didn't have the room where I had reserved it I had to check out and back in Saturday night irritated but whatever And btw the rooms were supposed to be non smoking rooms since I had my kid with me and she has asthma I got a smoking room went to ask them to give me what I had reserved the lady insisted it was non smoking room clearly it was then she said they had no room and I had to pay more to get another room she was very rude she made me feel stupid I asked to speak with a manager he helped me and the room I got was indeed a smoking room I switched rooms 3 times in two days I spend my days in the check I. Line most of the days here  ... I can keep going but it was just horrible never will I come here and will tell friends and family to stay somewhere else  even circus circus is a much nicer experience !!!!

Dirty and run down.  Desk chair had bodily fluid stains, feminine stains.  Desk was broken.  Had to call housekeeping repeatedly to get clean linens and to clean room.

We asked for the blood stained chair to be replaced.  They never replaced it, they just took it out of our room and left it in the hall.

Iron was broken, had to ask for a new iron.

Entire gaming network in casino was broken for over 12 hours.  This resulted in Mlife rewards not calculating, 2 or 3 attendants hand to hand payout all gamblers at slots and electronic games.

It really was just a disaster of a place.  Won't stay there again.

So usually Monte Carlo is great.
But recently they charge $25 resort fees for Ethernet cable Internet!?
Outrageous.  
Plus they interrupt your 3G with some kind of Internet blockage.
Plus there was puke inside our lamp and they gave us two queens instead of a king.
Tighten it up Monte Carlo!

We had a great time in Vegas. Our stay at the Monte Carlo was great, although some unfriendly encounters. Checking in was a little hectic. We arrived just as they were opening the lines to check in. The lady snapped at everyone, please wait we are just opening. The lady that snapped at the people in line help a couple next to us. She was unfriendly and seemed to be upset with the couple she was helping. However, we were told that we would have a 2 hour wait for our room, but they texted us our room was ready in under an hour. We loved the pools, especially the lazy river. My daughter was a huge fan of the wave pool. The only down size was the day beds were not clearly marked in all locations. The chairs next to the day beds you could not sit in. One of the pool staff members was rude while asking me if I had previously made a reservation. They said I could stay seated if I spent $200 + dollars on food and beverages. Would have been nice to know that chairs around any day beds are included. My chair was 2 chairs away from the day bed. I think they could have gone about asking me to move a little more nicely. All valet and bell desk employees were great! They are very helpful and get your stuff right away. Hardly any waiting. we saw the Blue Man group. It was a great show and anyone staying in Vegas should see the show. Overall we had a great time and would return.

Gross gross. I am staying at the Monte Carlo. Not only are the rooms gross, but the service is BAD. We waited in the check in line for over 30 mins. Not one apology. I asked the check in woman if they were short staffed and she replied that she thinks they are on lunch. If check in time is 4 and its 3:50, why would they go on lunch?  The room was dirty and old. I think it's time for renovations. Would NOT stay here again.

I don't know where to start with this place. I have stayed here before (many, many years ago) and didn't remember anything bad about this place, so I gave it another chance. With the price, decent location, and decent reviews my boyfriend and I chose to stay here for 3 nights. The only thing that I liked was the aroma of the lobby area. Other then that... I did NOT enjoy my stay here. The (first) room was decent but the walls must have been made out of paper. We could hear the next rooms conversations, toilet flush, and shower turn on and off. So we talked to the front desk, in which they moved us to another room. The second room was on a higher floor, had a better strip view, and looked more elegant but every time we would wash our face, brush our teeth or use the sink in general... IT WOULD LEAK UNDERNEATH. I could feel it splatter on the floor\/my feet. We did not want to have to move again so we dealt with it. I don't know what was up with the sheets either. They must not use stain remover when they clean them, because there looked to be left over stains on them, which was disgusting. Again sounds were an issue. With the neighbors and even a loud banging coming from above us... which sounded like construction. The casino in this hotel is SUPER small. The thing that really threw me over the edge was when we decided to try to stay another night, we called the front desk and they were nothing but RUDE. They were not helpful at all. I would think that since we already were there 3 nights, and lost a ton of money in their casino they would try to work something out for us to stay. BUT NOPE. next time I will choose a better hotel to stay at, with more of a central location on the strip. In my opinion... don't stay at the Monte Carlo.
Dirty dark room. Dirty floor carpet. Lost a necklace there but lost & found never recalled

Stayed at Monte Carlo for four nights during the week of my 25th birthday. I thought the rooms were pretty standard and the shower\/baths were a tad small, but for the price and value- the stay was worth it! 

MC has a central location on the strip and the hotel's tram service is a must, especially when needing to travel further north along the strip (tram goes Monte Carlo -Crystals\/Aria-Bellagio.) 

We didn't have any issues checking-in with the hotel. We arrived early and waited in line for a while, but line moved rather fast. We arrived a little bit before 1pm on a Tuesday and asked the attendant if they had any higher floor, strip view rooms available. They did at no extra charge, but we had to wait a few hours for it to be ready. The wait was worth it though and their text alert notification system was convenient as we walked the strip while waiting. 

I don't plan on returning to Vegas anytime soon, but would consider staying at Monte Carlo again.

I stayed here for the second time in my life this weekend and overall I was very pleased. It's true, the hotel isn't super updated as far as looks and it doesn't have Wifi in the rooms. But for such low prices, it is TOTALLY worth it. If you're going to vegas on a budget, this is the hotel for you.

Also, the dealers and everyone working there is extremely nice and I received excellent service my entire stay. I usually stay at the Aria, and even though they have nicer rooms and are more technologically advanced, the service at the Aria is always consistently horrible. So, if you're looking for an inexpensive room and excellent services, definitely check out Monte Carlo.

With an upcoming trip to Las Vegas on my mind, in which we will be staying at the Aria, I figured I'd jot down some information on the past experiences I've had at our previous trips home base. 

The Monte Carlo is more of a no-frills type of establishment that is nice enough but not over the top luxurious or architecturally astounding as many of its neighbors.  That said we had a fantastic time here, and if it were not for our motto of  "staying at a different place every time" we would definitely return.

Let me start out with what I was impressed with:

-The staff was absolutely accommodating with our check in requests.  We were meeting friends that were flying in from Dallas and we had requested adjoining or near rooms.  We actually got adjoining rooms.  I know this may not seem like an enormous deal but it has been a hassle in times past at other facilities to even get close rooms so I was impressed with their accommodation.

-The addition of a Keurig coffee maker in the room is an absolute delight.  I'm already feeling the absence of that appliance at the Aria.  I'm a 'first thing in the morning" coffee person and the idea of waiting for room service or heading downstairs to get a cup is dreadful.  I can't understand why LV can't just give us this as a standard

-The  location per price is prime.  It's very nice to save steps in Vegas but you take so many of them anyways and the closer to the middle of the strip, the further away you are from long treks back in the middle of the night.  Also, being on the tram stop is a huge additive as well.  A quick ride to the Bellagio puts you even closer.

Where it lacks:

-The casino was definitely not the high point of the facility.  The layout just seemed long and narrow and I'm a fan of larger ceilings.  The restaurants kind of just sit along the borders of the casino and their really isn't any intermingling of the two that I prefer.  

-It's definitely not a place you walk into to look around (a la Bellagio, Ceaser's, Aria, etc).  In fact  if your not staying here or seeing a show here then I can't imagine why you would really enter it.  That said, it's not really marketed that way and probably the reason that it is much cheaper which serves a market.

All in all, the Monte Carlo is a solid choice based on location and price point.  If your goal in Vegas is too spend your money on things other than your room, then the Monte Carlo allows you a cheaper starting off point to work from.   It's Vegas, so you should be constantly moving around anyways as there is so much to see and so many people to watch.

i was curious about when monte carlo was built so began to look it up online and found that it was built with the aim to attract middle income tourists.  haha nice i remembered it still being built when i came here as a kid.

it is seriously outdated compared to its counterparts on the strip. its one saving grace is its pool which has a lazy river and a small wave pool.  nothing compared to the one at the mandalay of course but still a plus.  there are a ton of families here.   the lazy river is so warm you would think everyone and their mamma took a piss in it before you got in.

the one thing that the four of who stayed in the room noticed that upon entering the monte carlo building there is a distinct toilet smell.  the whole place smells like bathroom and we didnt know why. maybe something wrong with the HVAC system

the bathroom has small with one sink.  the covers are the old style thin kind. in order to get to the main entrance\/the strip you have to walk across the whole casino.

i am not sure i would stay here again.

I've stayed at MGM, Mandalay Bay, Flamingo (lol), and Imperial Palace (LMFAO), and I think the Monte Carlo might be the best location I've stayed at as far as its geography goes.  Easy walk to just about anywhere, accessible food for the late late night, good restaurants for the daytime meals, and quick to any place in the casino.  You won't be walking a mile just to get to your own hotel pool.

It's pretty easy to access any type of gambling you desire.  $5 blackjack if you look hard enough.  Bartenders come through the tables often and can make just about anything.  

The pool scene is great.  Wave pools, lazy river, dj setups, and no cover.  Not good for kids.  

The bummer from keeping it from five stars is that the Sports Book is pretty poor compared to other casinos, no club inside the casino, and wifi is poor.  Many didn't even think it existed.

Don't let that stop you though.  Monte Carlo is a great experience, and definitely prefer that over the other places I've stayed at.

I enjoy the Casino at Monte Carlo, I haven't stayed at hotel but there lobby looks lovely. I have been to Vegas about 6 Times in the last two years and each time I return to Monte Carlo. Not sure if they have a members card.

Room was ok, nothing special...especially no coffee or tea in room. 
Also, no pool due to renovations Oh, we were offered to use two other pools blocks away. Really? It would have been nice to been notified about lack of pool on premises when booking...or given a discount.
NEVER staying at this chain again and will definitely warn family and friends.

This is a review of the casino\/gambling section....

Dealers and pit bosses treat you bad.  They assume you know nothing, say backhanded comments while you play.... I do not give them my gambling business anymore.  If you're playing craps here, be prepared for some bad bad joo joo

Decent business hotel.

It's impossible to pick up on the Monte Carlo theme. It's just a hotel with a casino. I've stayed here 4 times previous and the atmosphere was exactly the same each time.

Room was fine. Parking garage fine. Food is much too expensive unless you eat at the food court and get yourself a Quarter Pounder.

This is a fun casino with plenty of good games at all limits.  Staff is great and drink service is surprisingly good for a place this big.  Bars and dining options are also OK to good.  Free Wifi in casino is great too.   Casino renovations look to be complete and the place is loooooking good.  My favourite poker room on the strip and one of my favourite strip casinos.  Like all strip casinos, odds could be better however.

Finally got a room here Feb 2014.  Rooms are very nice, clean & well kept.  Comfy beds, spacious bathrooms, nice flatscreen TV's.  Elevator service was quick every time I tried them, front desk was also quick, mind you it was a Thursday mid day.  

very good overall value for a strip property.

Taking into consideration that this is an older hotel, we were overall pleased with our stay. We stayed in a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and did not experience the "loud" music issue, as others had mentioned. Unfortunately we never made it to the pool, but it looked really nice and never seemed too busy. The location is hard to beat! We may try another hotel on the next trip, but I'm sure we'll be back!

Definitely not the fanciest hotel on the strip,  but I enjoy staying here when I'm paying. It's a great location because of the free crystals team that connects you to the crystals and the bellgio. Prices are decent and it's one of the cleaner hotels. If you need your peace and quiet to relax and sleep,  you won't find that here. Walls are thin and you can hear all the drunkards outside and you definitely know when your neighbors decide to clean themselves. 

This is my go to hotel even though there are so many to choose from. I also love the deal or no deal machine and bubble craps (minimum is $3).

Fast food selection is also good here and next door to the new t mobile arena and new york new york casino. 

I will say to stay away from their steakhouse called Brand. We got a porterhouse there and it was the worst $100 we've ever spent.

$4.32 for a half a can of coke served in a plastic cup?
I'm not cheap but I refuse to be fleeced.
F**K this place!

For what it is, it's pretty damn good. 

Three stars because it is not the best, but most of the time you find some pretty reasonable deals, so you can't really complain.

I've read a couple reviews, where people got a deal on a room at the MC for 39 bucks, but then complain it is not as nice as the Bellagio. Check it, you paid 39 bucks, not $350, like a room at some of the higher end casinos. If I paid that amount for the MC then there would be a legit reason to complain.  

Which is why I said it's pretty damn good. Comfy bed, clean newer room, cozy atmosphere, and supreme location. Right smack in the middle of the strip. I've stayed here two times now, and had a pretty decent time both trips. Most of the time you are outside of your room, drinking, dancing, gambling, and just straight wondering around. 

Save some cash and eat at finer restaurants, drink a couple more, and throw down some extra chips on the table. Stay at the MC and thoroughly enjoy your stay in Vegas.
The rooms were messy, stains on carpet, and open Junction box above Jacuzzi. Also the safe was broken and the shower leaked a lot. Good food though

I stayed in the hotel on business and only slept in the room.  Did not have guests. It was a quick midweek trip.  I got home and saw they charged me $300 extra on my credit card statement. I got no call, no email to explain why.  

I called them and they said i smoked in my non-smoking room.  The only issue is that I DO NOT SMOKE. EVER. 

I spoke to the manager and he said I must have smoked since my room smelled like smoke.  This is impossible since I can't stand smoky rooms. My room smelled great and again I DO NOT SMOKE!

Ricky, the manager, could care less and said he had "evidence."  I asked him to email me the "evidence" and he said hotel policy does not allow this.  So policy allows charging customers $300 for smoking but does not allow them to see why they think there was smoking??? This is straight up fraud!

I filed a fraud report with the Las Vegas police department.  Waiting to hear back. 

Stay far away from this place!  Beware!
The rooms are awful!  They are very run down.  There is no way this is a 4 star hotel.

The hotel is pretty clean and well-kept. It's artificially luxurious and fancy, but who cares?
The rooms are moderate-sized, but I don't see why it has to worth $70 per night. I mean, there's nothing special. I could get a better deal at MGM Grand or something for a similar price.

For some strange reason, despite being mlife gold members and having stayed at nearly every other MGM resort in Vegas, the stars had never correctly aligned and we hadn't stayed at the Monte Carlo before.  Finally, things worked out.

I've always liked the place.  d.Vino has some amazing food, I don't know if Brand still has the sorbet desserts, but you should really check those out if they're still there, the Pub is excellent, I always seem to do well enough at Pai Gow and slots, Diablos is always good for drinks, and the poker room is small but fun.  Now that the construction is done by the arena, access is also much easier.  

Taking full advantage of gold status, I handed the car to the valet and went to check in.  The line was getting long, but the VIP check in experience was incredibly easy and fast.  We were upgraded to a spa suite and on our way in about 10 minutes.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, which is a consistent theme throughout this hotel.  

The spa suites are next to the elevators, which is incredibly convenient.  The rooms themselves are definitely showing some signs of age, but that's why MGM is planning a full remodel of them in the next year. I have every reason to believe that it will be a top-of-the-line hotel when it's finished.
