The surrounding buildings also tend to fill the pool area with shade earlier than other resorts which can be a good or bad thing.  There is also a Dj that plays music on top of the wave pool which can be heard throughout the area, definitely more catered to the party scene than the relaxing scene but wasn't a problem as I was still able to nap comfortably.  

Food:
Recently remodeled front entrance and added a 800 Degree Pizza which was not bad but not comparable to Blaze Pizza in Souther California IMO, which I felt they were trying to contend with, a good ice cream place BLVD Creamery, as well as a few other places I have not tried.  Brand Steakhouse is really good though!  Would definitely recommend this steakhouse, great place for a large party as you can share a 120 oz steak for $250.  It's supposed to be shared by 6 people but we were able to share it amongst 8 of us (6 guys and 2 girls) and it was filling.  The sweet creamed corn is also highly recommended.  Lastly there is a food court with your usual McDonald's running 24 hours, Subway 24 hours, and Sbarro which was almost 24 hours.  The line for McDonald's late night did get really long so prepare to wait.

Overall I would recommend staying at the Monte Carlo if you are with a group of friends looking for a place to stay with a good pool, good cheap food options, and good location.  If you are staying with your significant other and looking for a little bit nicer place, I'd say it would be a hit or miss depending on the room you get.  I would definitely stay here again depending on the price and would recommend it to others as well.

Not sure why I always stay here, but I do. I can afford any hotel in Vegas, so it's not money. I usually drive here, so it's not lack of transportation. I don't know anyone that hooks me up on rates, so there aren't any deals. I guess that it was once a ritual with my friends when we didn't have a lot of money, and I just got comfortable.

I know all the bars and restaurants, which some are good and bad. The buffet is meh, along with the rooms. Elevators feel like your going to blast off into outer space, but I guess they have to with that many floors. Pool is okay, nothing crazy. It does have a Rubio's,
 which I generally stumble on over to at four in the morning to order a shrimp burrito, and try not to get it all over my shirt.

"The Bar" is cool, but a little over priced. Think of this place as your drunk uncle who's house located in a ghetto neighborhood, but you like going because something about it is comforting. 

I'll be back, not sure why, but I will.

As Vegas goes, Monte Carlo is simple right smack in the middle of everything. Middle of the strip, middle of ratings, middle of food, middle of casinos.

Nothing here really screams Monte Carlo, where I was expecting more of a Monaco\/Southern France feel, with the pizazz of the world famous casino. Instead its just like every other casino and hotel on the strip. With the new CityCenter complex right next door, with all its sheen and glamor, this place sits in its shadow.

Nonetheless, it is still a decent hotel to stay at, with all your desired amenities of a 4-star hotel. The casino staff are mild-mannered with nothing special. BUT what did annoy me was a $15 resort fee for guests, which might as well be incorporated within your cost, to use the amenities of the hotel. Oh well, Vegas is Vegas, can't really have a bad time!

Have stayed here twice now and no complaints. Monte Carlo is conveniently located on the Strip, just a few minutes walk from everything else. 

The hotel workers are super helpful and want to make your stay as pleasant as possible. We asked for extra hotel cards and it was completely fine. 

Our room was clean and cozy despite its tiny size. What we love the most about staying at Monte Carlo is their pool area. Monte Carlo has 4 pools: a wave pool, a lazy river, a regular pool, and a spa.

My husband and I brought our two sons and three of their friends to Las Vegas as a birthday surprise for our younger son. We chose the Monte Carlo because we thought they would enjoy the pool area, and they really did.  If it weren't for the pools, we might have changed hotels. It wasn't awful, but we really wanted everything to be perfect for this trip. We travel a lot for business and are used to overlooking a lot. There are a lot of minor irritations with this stay that will lead us to stay elsewhere next time. 

The check in process took a half hour to get one of our three rooms. It was early, so we were okay that all the rooms weren't ready but taking that long when we wanted to get to the pool was a bummer. We were told that our reservation is only a request for a certain room type and they wouldn't guarantee an adjoining room for the guys or a king room for my husband and I. When we finally got our room, we were told it was a king but we got there and it wasn't. We ended up getting a king but had to give up the strip view we reserved. Not a big deal, but pretty disorganized. 

The rooms are okay - nice linens and the decor is fine but the bathrooms are pretty dated. The Internet is only available via a cable so no Internet for devices other than a laptop.  The room seemed clean but there was a towel in our bathroom with urine on it that I almost used on my hair. Thank god it fell on the floor with the pee side up or I wouldnt have noticed it.  I let the front desk know so they could let their staff know to watch for stuff like that. They apologized and ordered a full cleaning for our room.  For some reason half the lampshades in the rooms I was in looked like someone sat on them. Kinda weird. 

All in all the Monte Carlo is pretty decent but I will try a different place next time. I wanted to treat everyone to the Blue Man Group but the best discount the hotel offers still leaves tickets over $100 per person - pretty hefty for our group of seven. Stay here if you want a fun pool area, just don't expect too much out of the rest of the experience.

This is the ugliest hotel we ever been, they still continue charging customer for the resort fee while there is no such thing as resort, They named it Monte Carlo Resort and Casino they should remove the named resort and just make it hotel, Resort by definition consist of Pool Jacuzzi, Gym and for people with normal common sense knowledge of word Resort means exactly like what all people think of the word resort, I will never ever recommend this place and I will tell to all the people that I know to stay away from this hotel. SA LAHAT NG FILIPINO KUNG MAY PERA LANG KAYO SA IBA NA KAYO MGA CHECK IN BULOK ANG HOTEL NA ITO, Maganda SA picture , I used to be with Hilton Grand vacation but I sold my membership so I have to look for hotel, if there is zero star I will score it with zero star actually no star but shit, SA LAHAT NG FILIPINO KUNG MAY PERA LANG KAYO SA IBA NA KAYO MGA CHECK IN BULOK ANG HOTEL NA ITO. SA LAHAT NG FILIPINO KUNG MAY PERA LANG KAYO SA IBA NA KAYO MGA CHECK IN BULOK ANG HOTEL NA ITO. SA LAHAT NG FILIPINO KUNG MAY PERA LANG KAYO SA IBA NA KAYO MGA CHECK IN BULOK ANG HOTEL NA ITO.

When me and my wife go to Vegas we usually fancy the nicer hotels in Vegas.... Monte Carlo was never on my list of hotel to visit but my aunt offered to send us on a little weekend getaway and I didn't want to break the bank so I suggested we look at more modestly priced hotels so me and my wife decided on the Monte Carlo. We were really hoping that we didn't make a super bad choice and to my surprise we did not... as a matter of fact we really loved the hotel and the room and all the amenities that came with the room. I must say that the Monte Carlo has totally changed my mind and I know for a fact that I will be returning here in the future.

So where do I start ...I must say I was excited to stay here for the first time this weekend 2night out of three my husband and I were really disappointed...hotel room are not fancy what so ever we stayed at different places way less expensive with nice room... rooms are small and get stuffy at night windows do not open ...only good thing is that it is walking  distance to a lot of amazing places... other then that not worth it ...I was always having hard trouble trying to reach front desk just kept ringing until we ended up having to go down to the lobby... won't be staying here again !

Location is okay, close enough to walk to most other casinos on the strip if you are not handicapped or lazy. I booked a suite online, booked a smoking room. Check in time is at 3 pm. I left my bags in the car and I'm happy I did. Checked in at 3 PM and was told room would not be cleaned and ready to occupy until 5 PM. They also could not give me a smoking room despite the fact I reserved three weeks in advance. Front desk clerk was like a robot and appeared to be reading scripted responses to my questions regarding why they did not have the smoking room I requested and why the check in time is not the time she would give me my room number. If the room is not ready until 5 then that's when check in time should be, not 3. Was given my room number at 4:45 and they requested I give them another 30 minutes to "finish preparing my room". After 30 minutes went up to the room and found the housekeeper watching the television in my suite. I booted her out and needless to say did not leave her a tip. 
Pros: Free valet parking, location, good variety of food from fast food to higher end items, cleanliness, and suites are quiet even next to the ice machine. 
Cons: Room not ready until over 2 hours after check in time, did not have the room I booked and no discount was offered even though I reserved weeks in advance, bombarded with Jabawokeez music, images and merch at every turn.

Location- On the strip, in the middle of all the action.

Casino-  Decent crowd at night, young and old.  $5 tables for black jack and craps too.  The outside of Monte Carlos looks half way decent with the statutes and columns.  However, the inside is very dingy.  You'd expect a better looking casino inside but it's your average run of the mill.

Price- Cheap for what you get.

Rooms- Average rooms you see in any hotel.  We had adjoining rooms and both had showers with clogged drains.  No one checks your room key at the entrance.

Dear Monte Carlo,

I wanted to love you, I did. I read up on your website and I was interested in your centered strip location and your gorgeous pools, and you know what? THEY WERE! 

I never stay at the same hotel twice in Vegas, I decided to give you a try...

My fiance and I are so disappointed in your lack of customer service. There was a situation in YOUR food court area where a food court employee that goes by the name of NANCY RODRIGUEZ decided to have a personal dispute in the hotel and throw food at her boyfriend, which happened to land ALL OVER my fiance's SILK TOP. It was ketchup, and ketchup STAINS.

After speaking to the front desk about the appalling situation and making a complaint we were told that  "the food court has nothing to do with our hotel, you were at the wrong place at the wrong time". No offers to clean the shirt, no apologies. We came here as a group of 20 whom paid for 6 seperate rooms and have brought plenty of business here and this is how it was handled!

We went back to the McDonalds Nancy Rodriguez worked for and complained to the manager about his employee's behavior at the hotel and how she has thrown food all over a PAYING GUEST! He then asked us " What do you want me to do about it?". You're the manager! You tell me what you are going to do!!!

In any case, with our luck Nancy Rodriguez decided to further her public dispute at the food court, which now consisted of 5 other people looking for a fight. I approached her angrily and told her "Excuse me, when you decided to have food thrown at your boyfriend you covered my fiance with ketchup as well!" She shrugged it off and stated "(Sigh) Sorry" and went back to her fight!

The Manager all the while just watched this without interfering! There was no HOTEL SECURITY breaking up this fight! An employee from HAAGEN DAS had to leave their booth and break it up!

Sorry, when I come to Vegas I like to have a little class and expect excellent customer service. This place just earned itself a terrible review. We are running back to you, Steve Wynn! Take all our money, we don't care! We want Monte Carlo burned down!

Really, the Monte Carlo isn't such a bad place to stay at. It's a little mundane and less lively than some of the other themed hotels\/resorts and new swanky ones on the strip, but when staying on a budget in Vegas and looking to stay on the strip in a large hotel, the Monte Carlo is a great choice.

It's affordable and has the basic amenities like a spa, a show (Lance Burton), a pool with a wave pool and lazy river (I stayed here first when I was a kid, it was great!), a diverse selection of in-house restaurants (French, Italian, Chinese, Mexican, Steakhouse, brewery with American food, etc) and fast food joints (McDonald's, Subway, Sbarro, Rubio's, Starbucks, etc) so you can eat within any price range, however there is practically no shopping, only a little, sad, pathetic, fake cobblestone "boulevard" by the brewery where several stores used to be. There once was a wine shop, a jewelry store and a handful of others, but now only a clothing store geared towards mid-aged women and a sunglasses store now remains.

I would like to comment on the AMAZING water pressure in the showers. Seriously, it was better than any hotel I can vividly remember. You know it's something when you walk away from the trip and that's what you remember of your hotel room. Otherwise, the room was decent, but nothing extraordinary.

Join the MGM-Mirage Players Club and get $10 of free gameplay.

A solid three stars.

Boy where do I begin. I booked a strip view room at this hotel about two months in advance. I was a late check in and called the hotel earlier in the day around noon to inform them that I would be checking in around 11PM. As expected, I arrived on the property around 10:30pm and saw that there was a HUGE line for check in. had to wait in line for about 45 minutes until I finally saw a front desk agent.

The agent told me that the strip view room I had booked was no longer available, whatever that means. I told the agent that I had fully paid for a strip view room and anything else was unacceptable. In short, the agent told me there was NOTHING he could do except put me up in a non-strip view room, then give me a call the next day around 3PM so I could move to a strip view room.

My temporary room was small, bland, utterly boring with a view of the 15 freeway. I waited until 4PM the next day and was not given a call on my room line, nor my cell, as promised by the agent from the night before. I ended up having to call the front desk and after being transferred to 4 different people, I was finally given a room to transfer to with a strip view. I asked that the difference in price from the night before be refunded to me, or comped in some sort of way. My request was denied.

Overall, had a horrifying time at this hotel. I was straight up robbed of money for a specific room I paid for fully in advance. If you're not going to give me the type of room I reserve, why even have reservations? Never returning to this dirty hotel ever again, not even to gamble, drink, or eat at any of its restaurants.

Si we checked in mobile but of course never got to check in when we should have. Service so far has been good. Rooms have been clean, no mold or fecal matter like others have posted. The AC don't work though I noticed. I'm on the 30th flr and it's 5:30am and I can hear the construction going on! Pain in the booty!! Never coming back. Just didn't meet my expectations of what I used to remember Monte Carlo as. I'll rather pay more and be able to sleep!

Whatever you do stay away from this hotel. The security staff is racist and will stop you if you are black, wearing a short dress, and high heels. They will profile you and suspect you are a prostitute.   The worst experience we have ever had at any hotel. I am white and the rest of our group is too except our one friend. We were walking to our room (elevator area) when security approached us and asked our friend\/coworker for her ID. Never cared to ask for ours. Mind you she's the oldest in the group (27) and the one who reserved this whole trip. We felt that this was uncalled and felt this stop was racially based so we asked for her supervisor. When the supervisor came he didn't see a problem. She did not stop the young women that had got onto the elevators before we entered. We then asked to file a formal complaint. Which we did. 
The room was clean but hot. The AC will not cool down under 75. The room key would not open the door so security had to manually unlock it. They did however let us check in early. Just a horrible experience.
For the price the rooms are horrible and there are hardly any channels to watch on the TV. I would t recommend this place.

Upgraded from a regular room to a Spa Suite at check-in. Very disappointed.  The carpet is horrific. We wore our shoes while walking on it because we had no idea what germs & bacteria were living in it. Filthy, worn out & stained. Time to upgrade the carpeting.  Our friends stayed in regular rooms & had similar issues. 

The sink in the wet bar was clogged the whole week we were here. We had to go buy a bar of soap for the shower & bathroom sink because none were ever left for us from housekeeping.  There were no lights in the "living room area" so reading or relaxing in that area was impossible. The light for the shower was burned out & despite several requests to fix it, we went without the whole week we were here. 

The curtains covering the one window in the suite were too small to fit the window & the lights from the strip (MGM's lights mostly) were annoying to us, we're light sensitive.  Is it too much to hope your curtain fits your window appropriately to do its job blocking out lights?

Parents more interested in things beside their children would let their children use the hallways as their playground. Ice fights, yelling, screaming, running thru the hallways, banging on doors & walls...  2 calls to the front desk to complain yielded no help & the shenanigans lasted until after 4am.  

To reach the strip, you're required to go all the way thru the casino. Careful not to get run into by the out-of-control children who are overstimulated from all the flashing lights, bells & whistles. Or the drunk parents pushing strollers around into your ankles & over your toes...  Nevada law states no one under the age of 21 on the casino floor. Monte Carlo ignores that law. 

I come to Vegas a lot & would be hard pressed to stay here again. You get what you pay for & if you're looking for a cheap, ratty room with hit & miss service, the Monte Carlo is the place for you. As for me, I'll stick to the places I love despite whatever "great deal package" places like the Monte Carlo offer online.

I did not stay in the Monte Carlo, but did spend some time there this trip and wanted to review that aspect.

Convenient - The Monte Carlo was very convenient for us since it had a tram connecting it to the Aria\/Crystals and the Bellagio. Made it nice to avoid the heat. Also, it's entrance from the Strip is closer to the street than some casinos, which was nice when trying to avoid the heat.

Casino - Our preferred game is video poker, and then have several price points available - from $0.05 to $5. Some also had USB chargers for your phone, which was a very nice perk.

Restaurants\/Food - I liked that they had fast food up through nice dining, so you could have a variety of options nearby. 

Smoke - Though all casinos in Vegas have some smoking, it didn't feel smokey unless someone was actively smoking nearby. 

Restrooms - The restrooms felt very clean, in part because there seemed to be workers diligently cleaning it at regular intervals. (This was very much appreciated.)

My only complaint is that the signs could be a little more clear throughout, since occasionally you would start walking one way (as directed), but then the desired place wouldn't be included on the next sign. People were very kind to help if turned around, but other casinos do seem to be a little better at this piece.

Rooms: Clean
Shower Head: Perfect
Beds: Comfortable

I like this place because you do not have to go through the casino to get to your elevator\/room. Old hotel been around along time but they do a great, consistent job. Not my first place to stay but I wouldn't shy away from it!

This place is really low rent!  Gave us two queens when booked a king!  The bathroom sink won't drain and you can hear everything going on in the rooms next to you!! Complained about the party next door twice and it continued into the morning.  Will not stay here again and advise others to look elsewhere if looking for something nice.

UPDATED ON JANUARY 30, 2014

After writing the below review and taking the customer satisfaction survey sent out by the hotel after I returned home, I was contacted by the hotel via e-mail.  They genuinely addressed all of my concerns and I am 100% satisfied with their response to these issues below and another that I mentioned in the e-mail.  As a result, I added a star to the review and plan to return. 

==================================================

I usually wait until a stay is complete before Yelping but in this case the atrocity that they call their internet service has driven me mad enough to write mid-stay.  Yes, even Vegas, some people like to be moderately productive during the day.

This was my first time in this hotel and my first time in Las Vegas.

I'll start with the somewhat positive.  The price is decent for the location in just about the heart of the strip.  My room was clean, the housekeeping staff were excellent and the check in woman did a nice job of getting me an early room since I happened to fly in early.  I am not typically picky with  hotels because for me they are usually nothing more than a place to sleep and when on vacation, I am usually outside.  But I do need a functional internet.

The Negative - It's bad enough they charge the so-called "resort fee" (I do realize that is par for the course out here) but to charge it for a service that barely works is unconscionable.  The only access to the internet in the rooms in this hotel is through an Ethernet cable; yes, in 2015, just an Ethernet cable (anyone know if there is a port for that on an iPad?  That is just absurd.  They do of course claim that the resort fee covers coffee, a newspaper, use of a printer for boarding passes (in 2015?, smart phone anyone?) - all things I can get for free at a 29.99 per night rest stop motel.  

Anyway, I digressed,  back to the Ethernet cable connection.  I did happen to bring my laptop for some strange reason, something I barely ever use to begin with.  When I realized this hotel had no WiFi in the rooms  (yes, no WiFi in the rooms in 2015) I was at least relieved to plug in the Ethernet cable into my laptop.  Let's just say in 1997 if I was using AOL and dial-up my speed would  have been faster.  It was slow to the point where it was just plain useless.

Due to the historic blizzard that blanketed the northeast my flight was cancelled and I was forced to stay an extra two nights (it's Vegas, I don't mind being stuck here!). However, when adding the extra two nights on to the stay, and explaining the extenuating circumstances and showing the CNN headline which quoted the weather service as calling the storm life threatening, I thought I might get a little break on the price for the extra two nights - nope. 

As for the restaurants  in the hotel (Brand and The Pub), I will Yelp them separately but they will be positive reviews.

Conclusion - If you want a reasonably priced hotel in the center of the action with a decent steak house and have no plans to use the internet, then this place would work.  If you're like me and like to occasionally check your e-mail and do even a little work when you are away, don't bother.

Where do I begin? It was my brother in law's 40th birthday coming up. We contemplated booking our rooms at a "lesser quality" casino, but I opened my big mouth and said "Hey! Let's spend a few extra bucks and stay at a really nice place instead! Monte Carlo is only a little more per night and it will be so much better." So that January evening I decided to pick up the telephone and call the Monte Carlo so I could speak to a human. The gentleman on the line took my info, confirmed my reservation and charged my card almost $200.00. Great. I'm done with that part. (I assumed). Well, flash forward to check-in. The front desk has my reservation and $177, but will be needing more money for the "resort fees and taxes, and what have you." Uh, cool but I already paid all that. "Yes ma'am, through a third party, and they don't include the fees and what have you's." ....Huh?? "I called you guys. YOU guys. As in the Monte Carlo."
Well, buyer beware: if you actually call to reserve a room, make sure you are actually talking to a person that is physically AT the casino. Confirm what they plan on charging you so you don't have any confusion at the front desk for 45 minutes upon checking in.
Well, once you do get to that 'delux' room, don't expect greatness. You'll be greeted with peeling wall paper, dirty walls, moldy caulking in the showers, a make-up mirror that is three feet off the floor. Oh, did I mention the construction that is occurring outside that sounds like a constant alarm clock going off starting circa 6:30 AM? Or the paper thin walls? And can't say I've ever had to bring my own soap into a hotel. Until now. Thank goodness the husband had some handy. The one little disc they provided for the two days we stayed was inadequate. 
On the brighter side, my sis and her husband won a few hundred on the slots downstairs, so maybe a good place for slots, but not for sleeping.

Stayed 4 nights for the Rock n Roll Marathon. Could be the reason why the place was so packed! Considering all the other new and less damaged hotels in the area, I guess this one was just a great deal.  We immediately noticed that our room was cleaned or attempted to be cleaned prior to our arrvial. Some towels were dirty, pillow case had lipstick stains, hair in the sink, small bits of trash on the floor and all the lamp shades were broken! I couldn't help but smile and shake my head  while staring at the hand prints on the ceiling over the bed! After waiting on hold for 13 minutes (no joke), the front desk finally transferred my call to Housekeeping (another long wait). Finally, our lamp shades were replaced and clean linen and towels were replenished. The room staff is very nice and helpful. I think this hotel is about 10 years old and maintenance seems neglected. Too bad. Loved the pool (heated) which was perfect for this time of year. Other places just close the pool for the season.  Perfect for pre and post race warm up and recovery. Lifeguards were cool!  The casino was nice and great idea on the food court.  Lastly, folks at Monte Carlo, would have been nice to announce on your website that your buffet venue was under renovation and temporarily moved to one of your ballrooms. It felt like a business luncheon atmosphere. Needless to say, we had our meals elsewhere.

Stayed here for my birthday weekend (11\/10-11\/13, 2017), first off- they are renovating and i have no idea the pool was closed (you do have an option to use mgm or mandalay's), heavy lines on check-in, a classic restaurant by the lobby ($$ primrose). For the price i paid, it was not worth the money. I reserved the park mgm queen room.. it was on the 10th floor. (No coffee maker, no microwave, no refrigerator). It has small kone bottles of shampoo, lotion, body wash, 1 bar soap and 1 facial bar soap. The hallways are freaking scary and my nightmare did happen. There was no security at this place, anyone even non- guest can come up all the floors. So i was going back to my room around 9pm, I saw a guy just standing there and as soon as he saw me, started walking\/following me, i started running and he did too, good thing there was an old couple who came out of their room and the guy immediately walk towards the other direction going down the elevator.. imagine the horror and how scared I was. I was so terrified to go out of my room.. its just not a good way to start my weekend bday celebration.

Old kine casino machines\/slots.. it's just really dark in this hotel and for the security and paying $850-900 for 3 days..ugh, should have gone to venetian\/caesars.. never again.

Staff wise--- lobby people are very nice, helpful.

This place is overall pretty tired & showing it's age.  I've been here 3 times and the line to check in was at least a half hour every time.  The food court is handy if you have kids.

Went to the pub one night and there's something wrong with their beer system.  I had 3 different beers and they all tasted a bit off.

No I'm not a gambler, drinker and my party days are in remission since I've been married- love you hun. I lived in Vegas for a time and Even though I was back in Vegas for purely wonder, shopping, and family, I've been all over the strip. I've never stayed at a strip hotel resort and casino. I was skeptical but happy to say I was very pleasantly surprised!

Now in my opinion only and this being my first time staying at a casino but I loved my stay at the Monte Carlo. The shops, the restaurant, the atmosphere was truly Vegas. Each hotel\/ casino is their own distinct finger print but some creative and architecture similarities are present. I'm going to say this in the best way possible: the Monte Carlo is the cheaper Bellagio and that's not a bad thing. 

What lead me to the Carlo was the look and location. It's located right in the middle of everything and it's fantastic, specially if you don't have a car or rent one. Go to your right or left and adventures abound. Now as far as the rooms go, I stayed in the "High Floor Deluxe" room. I had a little bit of view of the strip but not much and they charge and each $20 or so for a room with a view of the strip, beware budget hounds! 

My negative is the resort fee of $28 a day. What's included in the resort fee you ask, well you get access to the pool, gym and Business center. ALL of which I did not use but still had to pay- just in case... No. You get 4 stars Carlo not 5. 

All in all great stay and I would definitely recommend it to my friends, family and anyone that would listen.

I always stay at Mlife properties but this was my first time at Monte Carlo! I Loved the cleanliness of the casino  and the location was great! A short indoor walk to Aria and quick tram to the Bellagio ! Right across from the ABC store ! Heaven!!  We ate at Diablos and it was delicious, also the Dragon Noodle restaurant was amazing food ! The only small issue I had was I felt a summer cold coming on and retired to my room early while my husband played some poker. Around 9pm I wanted to order some soup for my sore throat from room service, but they were closed . I guess I was used to the MGM having 24\/7 room service.  Nevertheless, it was a great trip, this is my first yelp and I am happy to give a positive review !

Review for August 2014 of the high floor double bed room: it was clean, bathroom was decent, and it was well priced.

I'd liken it Paris- more elegant vs high energy.  Still, I had a blast at the pool with great hostesses and fast bartenders.

Monte Carlo will always have a special place in my heart and I'd recommend it to anyone.

*EDIT* After experiencing the SLS, I am updating the wording on my Monte Carlo review.  I will most definitely be coming back to the Monte Carlo because of its better facilities, larger casino floor, and excellent location.  DO NOT underestimate those.  Keep it up MC

Overall the staff is very friendly and helpful at the Monte Carlo. Had one blackjack dealer that was a real stiff. Can't remember his name but he's a taller gentleman with some type of accent. He was very rude and not friendly what so ever which gave me a very bad vibe playing at his table and turned me off to play any further that evening while he was in circulation at the tables. 

Wish they had more restaurant options inside for the quick bite but they are a smaller casino which is understandable in that sense. 

They have or I should say had a great lazy river pool I always visit in the summer but they are doing a full remodel of the pool area. I hope it's something really nice because I enjoy the hotels location and comfort feeling when staying here. 

Overall this is a great hotel that I frequent quite often and enjoy coming back to over and over.

Love this hotel. Stayed here twice and intend on returning again. It's classy, clean, not over the top or overly themed. Our favorite part is the pool and its lazy river. Could spend an entire day there relaxing or partying. Can get a bit noisy depending on what kind of crowds are staying there and how close the room is to the pool which has DJs playing all afternoon. They have all the typical amenities for a hotel on the strip-food court, various restaurants, show theatre, great location, etc.
only good if you're on an all friends trip, need a place to crash, and on a budget.   if none of these apply, you have so many better choices...the place is pretty dumpy.

I visited June 2012 and had a great time!

The price was awesome! The room was clean, quite, cool, and really, REALLY nice!
The people there were friendly, pool was nice & clean, and the casino was adequate. I'd recommend this place if you're wanting to visit Vegas on a smaller budget. Don't get me wrong, still costs a good amount but is less expensive than the more well known casinos.

I'd stay here again, easily!

Had a girls weekend at Monte Carlo and had a blast!
Room was clean and the beds were comfy - enough room for the 3 of us and all our stuff. Bathroom is small. The hotel is clean and not too crowded and connects to Aria. Adam the concierge was great and got us on guest lists for clubs & made our dinner reservations. The jacuzzi was a perfect temperature. It's a good price.

Arrived to check in early  and told there were no connected rooms . Then called Concierge and told if we got back in line we could get rooms connected. Waited in line for 20mins and ended up at the wrong line. Worst way to start our weekend.
YO FAM amazing room. Very simple but clean and pools there's like a lot of them fam Ye that's it cya fam

Awful and stress experience, the room was not very clean and we found broke glass in the floor. We could have get hurt. Of course I ask for a change of room, we had to do at the moment and with out help, going back to the line for the new key and loosing time. They don't care that we didn't have lunch and we were starving, we had to move immediately or stay in a room with the danger of cut ours feet. This is not a very expensive hotel, but experience this situation is unacceptable. They need a change.

Ok Hotel On the strip, But without WiFI !!!
That is just unbelievable !

The primary perk to this hotel is that it is conveniently located along the Vegas Strip for a reasonable price, despite my belief that the resort fee should not be mandatory for those who have no intention of using the pools and such. While the lobby is grand, the bedroom is a little outdated and the hallway carpets did not seem very clean. The express check-out on the computer did not work at all. These things alone would not drop my rating to 2 stars of course; however, the extremely length wait for check in (over an hour) would. Never have I had to wait that long simply to check into a hotel-- it was quite a ridiculous time waster for guests who wanted to maximize their time vacationing at Las Vegas.

Decor and amenities may get just a star or two but all is forgiven when you win. This casino may have become my go-to casino for taking cash home.  I experienced lots of luck on the slots and in the poker room.  The dealers in there surpassed every expectation\/stereotype I had of a dealer, they were a show onto themselves.

Hit or miss kind of hotel yet I always come back because the price is right. They always always always have deals or coupon codes for 20% off rooms or some sort of food and beverage credit. Since I'm not one to stay in my room too much in Vegas, I don't mind that it's pretty much a standard hotel. It's definitely no Paris, Venetian, Bellagio or Caesars but, the price is right and it's a place to crash! 

Typically it's my husband and I who stay here and we especially like that there's a food court with variety inside the hotel for that late night snack or morning when you don't want to hit the buffet. We're not big on eating out heavy meals in Vegas so this spot is perfect for us. Grab a bite and get on our way. 

Gambling is great at this casino as well, you can typically always find a $5 table and the slots seem pretty loose. 

I'm starting to realize I'm sounding like a real cheapo! BUT we all kn ow Vegas can get crazy expensive. I prefer to spend my $$$ on the shows, clubs and bars :)
Got a comment response from Guest Relations. The smoke alarm was still dismantled on the day after. The response says you care.  Why didn't you care enough to fix it?

After 45 min in line to check in, I found my self in the most disgusting room ever.
This hotel is worse than any motel in the desert of Nevada or Arizona.
I am very disappointed by Monte Carlo hospitality. And would never stay here ever again.

The Monte Carlo hotel has a great location and was reasonably priced.  The check in time was fast, and the express check out made the check out time even faster!  Somewhat in the middle of the strip, maybe a little south, which made walking to either end of the strip very easy.  The room was pretty clean, but the view wasn't the best.  I'm pretty sure this hotel is like many of the other hotels that are located on the strip. I would stay here again.

We absolutely loved the hotel! Having already stayed at other high end resorts for example the Aria, the Monte Carlo is an affordable, comfortable, luxurious and fun hotel! We loved everything about the hotel! Right down stairs is a Starbucks and mcdonalds, so everything was at close range! During the week it's more family oriented rather than weekends, but nothing too crazy! I really enjoyed my stay here! The pools are the best part! They have a river, wave pool, regular pool and a jacuzzi! There's many areas to layout, but I recommend to go early when the pool opens to save a spot!

I am actually still here for 2 nights because it has been paid for but the experience is sad. They are under major re model but I was never informed about the pool being shut. They give the option of MGM or Mandalay Pools but one requires walking to the MGM or waiting 20 minutes for a shuttle to mandalay. My mother is here for her 1st ever Vegas trip from Australia and I am embarrassed this is what we are in for. Room has no clock, no coffee machine, no fridge,  it is motel type bare  essentials. My question is what on earth does the resort fee cover? The only good part was the check in kiosk was quick. I'm sure the employees are sick of complaints and I feel for them but they have been programmed to ignore our questions and apologize and "see concierge"  you as a goodbye. Heavy construction noise oh and the strip view high floor that they promised they would try accommodate turned into 6th floor roof and generator view

Affordable, clean rooms, and decent location.  The only negative is that the casino is so so dead!!!  i would never gamble here.  On top of that there is no club.

To Sum it up...This is the over 65 spot.

I had an excellent experience staying at the Monte Carlo. I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 just because it's a bit older than the other hotels in the area. But please don't let that push away from staying there. It was an amazing experience.

I always thought the monte carlo was a nice fancy hotel since i was a kid however its outdated. The room we had had a nice view but it looked old. It needs a remodeling to keep up with all the other nice hotels in las vegas. The room we got had one light with a weird red bulb. Also the toiletries a hotel usually provides weren't nice or anything they were just your standard smelling ones. But i did love the shower pressure =) Oh and the bed was nice very soft. Since it was cold when I stayed there I didn't get to check out the pool area but passing by it it looks nice.

Had a super bad experience!   Checked in at check in time which was 3pm but room was not available till 4:30! Was a complete waisted day!  Pool closed at 5, so could not enjoy that!  But was still charged the $30 resort fees!  Great!! 

It's in a good location and would only stay here if I have to, but for the money you can find better!

Stayed here over the St. Paddy's Day weekend, and was very unimpressed.  

1. They can't clean their windows?  Ours was COVERED in dirt as was everyone elses in our party.

2. The casino is small.

3. Bars -- when did Vegas start shutting down at 2AM?  We essentially shut down every bar inside of the hotel by 3AM and that seems *wrong* for Vegas.

I've stayed at a lot of the different resorts and this was definitely has been the bottom of the ones I have stayed at.  On the positive side, the room was clean and large.

We stayed here for the first time this last weekend for 3 nights and I have only good things to say about this hotel! The rooms are clean and nice, then beds were comfortable. It's conveniently located on the strip so all of our favorite places are just a short walk away. The staff was incredibly helpful, especially our bell hop Melvin. He not only helped us with our luggage but also showed us how to check out through our tv. He deserves a raise. We will be back this summer Monte Carlo :)

We rented a Jacuzzi Suite overlooking the strip on the last Friday in August.

It was nice, nothing spectacular.  Much of the room was the standard 'clean' but there were some parts that were badly neglected.

The carpets were dirty in some areas, the tub had rings and other marks where glasses and tubes ( I don't want to know if they were tubes of toothpaste or lubricant) once were, in other words the maids didn't wipe down the tub surroundings before we got our room.

The electric curtain and lighting above the tub didn't work.

Dirty gunk on the backside of a  least one of the nightstands.

The price was over $250 for the night.  Holiday weekend.

Just checked out with hubby. First time here and great easy experience. The staff are pleasant and always have it together. Excellent service and easy to navigate. Plus it's dead center of everything fun at the strip. Yay us. Also usually this place is somewhat pricey, but we got a great deal. So happy! Love sexy, relaxing time with my babes.

My friend booked our trip and had selected the Monte Carlo, between then and our trip I'd read a slew of terrible reviews.  I was extremely pleasantly surprised, it was clean, the air smelled fresh, our room was large and well kept.  We were upgraded to a higher floor for the view - though it was just a boring view of the mountains... A nice reprieve for the entire trip.  With two Starbucks not far from each other you've got your morning coffee all taken care of.  "The Cafe" was very nice and great food!  We ate there for dinner the first night and breakfast the last.  Drinks were delicious and well priced as well.    The casino wasn't hopping but we seemed to be ignored as far as the free drinks for gambling go, I think we only were approached once the second to last night. We tip well, so the very nice waitress continued to bring drinks by after the first time.  "Brand" had good food, I loved my French Onion Soup.  We stayed to hang out in the night club (which was a pleasant surprise) with the ladies night bracelets and open bar we had several drinks for free. 

The gambling is pretty basic. 

I did not like that you had to walk through the entire casino to get to the front doors from the elevators... one its a long walk as if you didn't have a ton of walking to do out on the strip already. 

The coupons are a rip off -- at least with the Ignite bar.  We were given a coupon for drinks after buying tickets to the Blue Man Group.  2 for 1.  All the lady did was made one drink and split it between two cups... the wee ounce of drink in our cups was ridiculous.  We still ended up paying $15 with the 2 for 1 coupon. Plus we tip well....

Would have been nice if they would have told me when i made my reservation that it we under construction, and there's no pool. We can use MGM or Mandalay, but oh by the way MGM is closed tomorrow, so were going to have Monte carlo guests, MGM guests and Mandalay guests all using one pool.

Front counter was extremely rude and short with us. We've always been told that the resort fee is to cover the pool, wifi, etc and asked that since we have to either hike to Mandalay or take a cab if it could be waived, all of a sudden the resort fee no longer covers the pool. What a joke. 

I've stayed here multiple times in the past, but I'm seriously considering moving to Harrahs properties for future visits.

For my first time in Vegas this place was nice. My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon and we really enjoyed staying here. He's been to Vegas several times and insisted we come to Vegas for my honeymoon. Given I enjoy the country life more than the city life I can honestly say the Monte Carlo made my first time in Vegas a vacation I will never forget. The hotel room was on the 31st floor and overlooked the back side of NY NY. Not an awesome veiw but lets be honest, who goes to Vegas to stare out their window? Our bed was compfy and bathroom was clean. Our room didn't have the problems that other yelpers have posted on here. 

The casino was fun. But it helps when the people you play the tables with are just as entertaining as your dealer is. The three times we played blackjack at the MC we had friendly, engaging and fun dealers and players. Which made playing a game I was not used to playing a lot more fun than I thought it would be. The slot machines where fun. We got hooked on the "Hangover" slot machine for the most part. I really enjoyed playing the bonus rounds. 

As far as food goes, the Cafe was worth the money paid for breakfast. They give you a lot of food for your money. The Dragon Noodle wasn't my favorite. Our food was bland and dry. I was sadly disapointed with it. The Chinese Food in my very small town was better than the Dragon Noodle. 

The Blueman Group color parade at 6:15 every night was fun to watch. 

Never got to the pool but it looked nice.

The tram from our hotel to the Aria and Bilaggio was very nice. Made it easy to get around. 

The Cupcakery was AWESOME!!!! 

All in all, I really enjoyed my stay at the Monte Carlo. We plan to come back every other year to just get away from small town life and plan to stay  here again.

I'm not one to be negative, but this was honestly one of my worst experiences ever. When we were waiting forever to get checked in, an impatient woman cut in front of me and three other guests to fix whatever her needs were. When we finally got helped we had to pay for a couple hundred dollars that wasn't even in the fine print and the receptionist was absolutely trash at explaining the purpose of this extra cost (after we already paid for the "total" cost beforehand). When we got to our room it wasn't even what we reserved for. We went down and the shitty woman helping us said "oh we don't have any rooms available for what you booked but we'll call you and transfer you tomorrow" then we decided to double check on this by coming later in the night and the next person who helped us said we would have to be responsible for calling and pay an additional fee. Like what the fuck bitch why are all the employees so misleading... absolutely trash, and where I work i am an exceptional customer service employee so I'm fucking disgusted at this shitty service. On top of it all, the shower was clogged and the water was up to my shins.

I'm advising my friends to never book at Monte Carlo. And I'm never coming back here again lmao

Pros: I love the atmosphere here! They offer my favorite game and dealers here. Dealers are all very friendly. Everytime I come visit Vegas. I make a effort to stop by here for the day to gamble and even maybe a have a few drinks.


Cons: I used to stay at this hotel all the time because of how much I have enjoyed gambling down stairs. Especially with all the great dealers. But over the years I started noticing the hotel rooms are pretty out dated. Tiles in the restrooms are falling off and\/or missing. I can see lots of mold around the shower doors. Hotel Rooms smell. I love this casino but They need to start renovating there hotel rooms.

This was my first time staying at Monte Carlo and I really enjoyed it! Really, for the price, it was very nice. I stayed with my boyfriend for 2 nights for $226 (room + tax) + $40 (resort fee of $20\/nt). (ps - I booked thru Hotels.com) Specifically, we booked this hotel bc 1) it was the cheapest but nicest hotel on the strip right next to the City Center with a casino and 2) no parking fees since we drove and the other hotels had the resort fee (which is standard for most hotels in Vegas) PLUS a parking fee of anywhere from $15-30\/night which is just ridiculous. I have no regrets of booking my room here. For the price, I wasn't expecting a luxurious room but a decent and clean room which is exactly what it was. We got there around 1PM and we were able to check-in early which was a huge plus since we just got there after a 8 hour drive.

Also, we won the most money here outta all the casino's we went to! SCORE! We were able to come back home WITH some money still in our wallets which was SOOOO unexpected, thanks to Monte Carlo! 

As for food options, they had a food court which had the standard food court joints such as Starbucks, McDonalds, Sbarro's, Subway, etc. Most of which were open 24 hours which was perfect for those late nights! Also, look for my review on one of their restaurants, Brand Steakhouse (I gave 3 stars.. Go find out why!!). They also had a froyo place, crepe place, and a candy store which was all a lot of fun. The crepe place was good but the cashier was unfriendly ;\/ 

Oh and because of the weather when we stayed, it was too windy to really enjoy the pool which is something I was really looking forward too :( So I can't say much bout the pool ;\/

But overall, I was very content with the hotel (considering the price, the location, and winnings [yay!]).

A little disappointed with this hotel. For the price that we paid we sure did get an outdated and sadly you booked a king bed high floor with Strip view! The king bed didn't happen, and the strip view was a little sad looking view. I should have trust myself and go with Caesar Palace .  Room have a little wear and tear, bathroom have ceiling chip paint rip wallpaper and tub stains and chips. So not what a 4 stars hotel should look like. 

The spa on the other hand were good, place was slightly busy, staffs were good to deal with. Pool was okay size and lazy river was fun. 

Overall the hotel room was the shity part, but the Spas casinos and restaurants were awesome. Now the big question is...would I come back and stay here again?!! plain and simple my answer would be "NO".

Overall, very impressive especially for the price that I paid for the room.  Very quick and prompt checkin.  The strip view was worth the few extra bucks.  The room was very clean and comfy.  Well laid out shops and casino.  The buffet was not as impressive, though. I felt for the price, I was expecting much more.

Starting with check in, the front desk help is awful. There is very little information given regarding amenities. The rooms lack cleanliness and non smoking rooms smell like cigarettes. This place lacks experience and should not be on the strip.

I would say this has a few things going for it: clean, good value, central location on the strip, and the pool.  It looks nice, but fairly small and non-descript.  I only stay here when I have a longer than normal stay, but I prefer the upper echelon of hotels, and this is just above average.

Note about the pool.  There's a lot of families.  They have a large wave pool, which is overrun by kids.  They standard pool is also nice, but overrun by adults!  Do not look for peace & tranquility here.

Probably a 3.5 star, but I just can't round up.

$12 a day for parking 
Very loud construction starting As early as 6 am. Even on Saturday. 
Shower and bath drains very slow. 
No chair at our desk 
Elevators very very hot 
Extremely long check in line 
$35 resort fee but u have go to another hotel to use the pool because of all the construction.
Old casino!! Bathrooms are outdated, and the walls are super thin, and loud. Pool area is ok, Internet is slow would not stay there again unless its supercheap!

Here's the deal with the Monte Carlo, they are a nice hotel for what you pay. 
If you want to pay more, you will get more, that is how Vegas works with everything. If you want to pay on average $150 per night, get a prime location towards the center of the strip and not be staying in a crap-hole, then this is the hotel for you.
Don't be the person that pays $150 a night in Vegas and then puts outrageous expectations on it. That is just unfair.
Everything here is nice. You've got a good food-court with normal\/familiar places, ie..Starbucks, Subway & McDonalds.
You've got normal hotel rooms, although I do think the beds could be softer.
And you've got a normal casino that is a bit smoky and a bit underlit.
The location is really great, and who doesn't love a wave pool and lazy river at their doorstep (although it was a little too chilly on our visit).
We'll probably stay here next time we go, again, the location is the key to this hotel.

I stayed here for one night and it wasn't worth it.  I picked Monte Carlo for location convenience but the service was so bad that I wish I went with my first choice, even if it was farther from my party. 

Checking in was smooth and fast - no line and less than 5 minutes to get the keys.  The resort fee, resort tax, and room tax wasn't exactly a fun surprise since I wasn't using the resort features.  It wasn't a negative star for the hotel but an annoyance.  One major letdown was that they wouldn't let me upgrade to a king bed room because they were all booked out.. On a Monday? Of a non-holiday week??  Bamboozled since I wanted to pay for the upgrade.  

The room wasn't ready upon check in.  The smell of the cleaning agent was so strong that it made us gag.  The room was basic, clean, and reasonable for the price.  The decor is outdated though.  No main light in the room so you have to turn on all five lamps in the room.  The blow dryer was pretty sad, from the 90s?  Nice flashback.  The service that made me dislike Monte Carlo was that it seemed disorganized.  The housekeeping staff woke us up at 830 then 930 by trying to get into our room.  It was like they didn't know this room was booked?? That makes no sense and was really annoying after a long night.  Other than that, it was okay as we didn't stay in the room for the most part.  

The hotel had lots of shops and a food court open 24\/7 for convenience so that was nice.    

The review ends here because that's all the hotel had to offer me.  It felt like the hotel just existed.  It didn't feature any great attractions or must sees, but it wasn't exceptionally horrible (aside from housekeeping).

If you're looking for function, this is the place to stay.
Spend your hard earned dollars elsewhere....very rude dealers, pit bosses are worse and don't even get me started on upper management; also, rooms are hit or miss...mostly miss...gross!!

Our room was decent, but the walls are really thin so could hear our neighbors showering. The location on the strip is great though so that the best thing about this hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor with our room view facing the construction but it ok as we were not in the room much.

I love that you don't need to walk through the casino floor to get to the elevators to the rooms, great design. There are many restaurants, including a Subway & McDonalds.
An older mgm property that has been recently renovated. Is at a good location located next to city center. Reasonably priced rooms for deluxe acommodations and fair restaraunts.

My three star rating coincides with the overall three star rating that Monte Carlo has, A-OK.  This was my second time staying at here, the first time was back in 2006.  It's not a new or desired hotel in comparison to some of the newer ones nearby, but it does the job for a few days in Sin City.  Location is decent and the free tram which takes you up to the Bellagio was a bonus in getting to the middle of the strip quickly and cheaply.

Rooms were average, our room was a bit more dated than the others in our party who were on a higher floor.  I also wish the bathrooms had double sinks and ceiling exhaust fans.  A few in our group were VIPs (hence the reason we stayed here), so I did see one of the one bedroom suites with a living room, wet bar, and jacuzzi tub, which was really nice.  Staff were pleasant enough during the few interactions I had with them.

The wifi is really spotty, I gave up after a day or two of trying to use it, but luckily I have an unlimited data plan on my phone so it didn't matter too much.  

The pool was fun and consists of a wave pool, regular pool, hot tub and lazy river.  The food and drinks are completely overpriced, but, welcome to Vegas.  On weekends there is a DJ and some poolside entertainment and its a bit rowdy, however there are some quiet areas to lounge if that's not your thing.  Sundays and weekdays are very quiet and there is music playing but no DJ.  

There are many restaurants in the hotel, from an upscale sit down steakhouse, to a buffet and food court, as well as some take out type places--pretty much something for everyone.

Great location. The new Park area next door is a great for food and drinks. The room itself was nice and clean. The staff members were helpful and attentive . Overall, it was a good and easy experience .

I like the Monte Carlo. It's usually cheaper than the surrounding hotels and the staff have always been super friendly.

Now, it's not the Bellagio- but it's definitely not the Circus Circus. You can get a good Vegas experience in the heart of the strip without breaking the bank. I also like that it's walking distance from the other hotels, so hopping from place to place isn't an issue.

The rooms are clean, but again, no-frills. For us, we don't spend too much time in the room, we usually wander around, shop, gamble and eat. We're not the club type, so having one in the hotel is definitely not a priority.

The casino has the usual slots and tables- but it's not my favorite place to gamble. I prefer heading to the old Vegas where minimums are between $2 and $5. If you go during the week here, they have them, but you're usually playing by yourself. I prefer playing with a crowded table- I think it makes it more exciting (for Blackjack at least...)

Valet is sometimes a little bit of a pain- especially around check-out time for hotel guests. We've waited 45-minutes for our car. After being hungover and tired, that is the last thing you want to do. Yes, it's free. But it's much quicker to just park in the structure and do a quick little hike to get out faster.

Now, I haven't tried the restaurants on property- however, it looks like they aren't favored by a lot of Yelpers. I usually stick to the binging of buffets to fulfill my hunger.

Tip: Check the website and Vegas.com frequently as rates can change drastically from one day to the next.

A group of 8 of us recently went to Las Vegas for a bachelor's outing and decided to stay at the Monte Carlo again given that it was in the middle of the strip.

I am bumping my rating up to 3 stars now, since my second time around wasn't so bad.
Within 2 yrs of my last visit, there has been a noticeable improvement, like a few new restaurants in and around the resort. The area in front of the strip is a nice area for lounging around and people watch.

There is no more solicitors in the main lobby, and the casino lo longer reeks of cigarettes. (Maybe we came in the not so busy season?) "The Brand" is still as empty as when we last stayed here. We ate at "The Caf" for breakfast a few times and the food was quite good with reasonable pricing.

The staff, including the front desk, was very attentive and helpful. We asked to have a refrigerator for our room and they brought that up right away. 

Some drawbacks were the internet and crowded pool. We stayed on the 30th floor and had no internet signal. The Pool was crowded and there was no place to lounge. So it doesn't seem logical to have to pay the 20$ a day resort fee. The carpet\/elevator all seem to be outdated\/ragged. Also there is no reason to have an elevator attendant as 

I am very capable of clicking the button to my floor.
In Conclusion, I would probably stay at the Monte Carlos again for its price range.
Had a great time. Rooms were good size. Casino was a bit smokey. They could do more to fix that in my opinion. Overall, it was a good time!

Worst Vegas vacation.

They TURNED OFF OUR ROOM WATER due to renovations (not in our room) without letting us know. Why would they even rent a room where the water service may not be available at all times, didn't even say sorry for the inconvenience.
(Gave us a different room for 1 hour to take shower before checking out).

During booking no one let us know that POOL AREA WAS UNDER CONSTRUCTION. I would not book it if I've known. During check-in, it was proposed for us to go to Mandalay Bay's pool for free, but its very far  and my husband is disabled and we came by airplane, so you have to pay by yourself to get there, no train between(Mandalay Bay has train connection with Excalibur and Luxor only). Mandalay Bay Pool is nice though.

After check out we went to a restaurant and find out my card was declined as MC CHAREGEDME me TWICE MISTAKELY  from 2 different cards. When I returned to the front desk they said they cannot do anything for us as system not allow to remove the mistaken charge in less than 5 days(again no even apologies) and that we have to decide it by our self to call to our credit card company. My credit card company suggested me to go back to front desk as it's there responsibility (Merchant to card Transaction). After 2 hours waiting they called  my credit card and extra charged was removed by Tony( thank you very much), but why not at the beginning, why I have to stress so much, would that charges stay forever if I just leave. Is it trustful to give your credit card info here, what is it would be $1000.00 and I'll find it later, do I have to wait also 5 days for their mistakes?
   
     When we first arrived to our floor( floor 29, on Sept 6) all hall badly smelled like cannabis smoked, many guests were complaining about it.

    No fridge, not teapot (but I'm ok with that).

     Check-in service was not very informative and not very pleasant, but it was already booked and late to be changed.

      In a nutshell  My Birthday vacation was broken, very sad I chose this hotel. Very bad customer service.

If you're going to stay on the strip, it's good to do it once so you can test your nerves and see if you can ever put up with it again. Monte Carlo is a great hotel to give it a whirl and the features make it worthwhile for a short weekend getaway. When planning your stay, try to arrive later in the evening so the line is miniscule and the front desk can help you find a room if you'd prefer a view of the Strip. And thank the seven heavens and hells, there is free wi-fi.

If it's been awhile since you stayed in a place that allowed smoking indoors, your lungs will get tested. The casino floor has almost cartoon levels of smog as tourists lean on the slot machine buttons, and suckle a Marlboro to the filter. There are respites from the smoke, but good luck getting a break from the noise, which is probably the point of keeping you on high alert as you're eating, drinking, gambling, and trying to relax. 

Your room and hallway are the few quiet places in the whole building, and the room is nice enough until you realize there is no coffee, HBO, or room service. This is a problem when you get back to your room at arse o'clock and are too tired to stay up until the buffet opens. In lieu of HBO, there are some basic cable options with plenty of commercials for local politicians who have prepared to fight Daesh with their bare hands because Obama is going to take our guns (apparently). Stay excellent, Nevada. \/s

The Monte Carlo does have some terrific parts and one of them is the pool. Be prepared for lots of sun through the day so grab a seat with shade early and don't let it go. The shady side is a bit better about keeping the noise down, but there is a DJ spinning by the wave pool and a woman offering up free shots. There's a wave pool, a sandy beach area, and the lazy river, with plenty of space to shower, complimentary towels and tubes, and massage services. There's an amazing spa upstairs, but I'll gush about that separately.

Those who gamble will have more expertise to share, but if you don't partake, give it a whirl at least once. My style is firmly with the Rat Pack, so it's heartbreaking to see so many slot machines, roulette tables, and card games go digital with touch screens. The MGM and the Bellagio have more modern casino floors. Monte Carlo's casino layout seems leftover from the 80s. For the old school at heart, there are still plenty of dealers working the floor and older slot machines. In the true spirit of the venue, I bet $20, won $15, and lost it all. Good work!

The staff were terrific. It takes a strong nerve to work a maelstrom like Vegas, and while some weren't sure what to recommend in the area, others were able to direct me to restaurants or rentals. The ZipCar rentals are way out of the way by the university, but the Avis was convenient. And if you want to do some sightseeing outside the city, and all the car rental has is a blood red Mustang convertible, remember, "screw it. I'm in Vegas.

Stayed 2 nights for NYE. Good stay. Busy lobby. Parking wasn't too bad, I get nervous when I drive in new places but my bf always ends up finding amazing parking, which was true in this case (2nd floor right by the walkway). He really wanted to watch the jabawockeez perform but the tickets are insanely fast to be sold out. There's a Subway, Mcdonald's and Starbucks downstairs, great for after a long night :-) The cafe downstairs wasn't horrible and it was decently priced for a late night meal (I was craving a quesidilla & bf had chicken and waffles), we skipped the buffet and went to the cosmopolitan's wicked spoon for a bfast buffet. Our room had a handicap shower and a view of the out of season pool and the monorail. I called the operator for a razor and they sent it up pretty quickly, definitely wasn't expecting it so quick. It was a better alternative than going to the CVS and waiting an hour in that humongous line. I really wish they had one of those huge bottles of water in the room, I was so dehydrated that I wouldn't have minded spending an extra $5 on a bottle of water. I know better than to use the hotel's soaps and stuff, so I brought my own. No microwave or fridge, no coffee maker either. Bummer but that's what free alcohol while gambling is for, right? Lots of extra hangers, hairdryer in the closet. I would come back. But I would definitely try somewhere new too. Good place to spend the night but not to hang out. Free CABLE internet, useless when it comes to ipads.

Water was off at night. Took frontdesk 10 minutes to answer the phone. WiFi then stopped. You would think for $30 the one thing I am paying for would work!  Apparent crackhead accosted me outside my room repeatedly saying "This ****** doesn't chirp". I felt fairly unsafe and I'm used to dealing with the scum in Vegas. I actually left the elevator before door ever closed when some girl stepped in appearing about to puke.

 Now they charge you to park there as a hotel guest  (And try to justify it with their silly lighting and painting of the concrete).  All blackjack is 6:5 instead if 3:2. Even the machines. Guys coming around asking you to sign up for their little comp system. So they can then shower you in free parking?  Get out of here with that nonsense. Horrible place. The carpet is all screwed up and my gf tripped going down the hall.  Ugh. Stayed at the IP for many years and never had experiences like this place. Vegas is nothing like it used to be. I am no longer a MGM fan.

One positive aspect of this place is the location relative to the monorail. It is easy to get to the other casinos where the gambling isn't as awful as this property. You an also walk directly into the Aria. Good for NL Holdem players. This place however doesn't make the minimum standard of what a room should be.

Love that you don't have to go thru the casino to get to your rm! Rooms are clean and the staff is so accomodating. Professional staff... negative is their chk in line was sooooo long. Other than that I had a great experience here overall!

Can't trust the house keepers.  They threw out souvenirs that we had left in a very obvious gift bag on the floor near the TV.  It did NOT look like garbage.  So if you don't want the housekeepers to steal or throw out your personal belongings, do not let them in.   When we called to complain about it the only thing they could do was reimburse is $20 for the resort fee, which doesn't cover the sentimental value of the gift that was stolen\/thrown out.  Also, when I checked my credit card statement, it turns out that they did NOT reimburse the money.  It's safe to say that the customer service is a DEFINITE let-down.   

The location is also pretty bad - it is NOT central.  We had to cab everywhere.  

There's really nothing special about the monte carlo, the rooms are very sub-par

I booked a king bed, non smoking room at Monte Carlo for 6 days, 5 nights for 295$ through Hotwire. For this price, who would complain? Well, let's just say I'd rather pay more for something better. Our room didn't come with a fridge or a microwave. The walls were so thin I heard everything that was coming from our neighbors and passerbys. It felt like people were in the room with us. Every time our neighbors door opened or closed, we jumped because we thought someone had entered our room. On a more positive note, housecleaning was pleasant and did a good job cleaning the room. I guess they have to since we were charged 29$ + tax per day for maintenance. 

Casino:
Some dealers were rude and complete assholes. Getting drinks were nearly impossible because a waitress was hardly around. Also, the drinks were served in ridiculously small glasses. The Bellagio served drinks in bigger glasses and they  tasted better.

Food: 
The buffet was decently priced and surprisingly pretty good. Definitely worth it. They had a good variety even though the venue was smaller than other buffets I've visited. 

I liked that the Monte Carlo was in the center of the strip. Everything was pretty close by and within walking distance. Overall, the negatives outweigh the positives. Will not be staying here again despite the cheap prices.

Old, dated and dull. Very disappointed as we spent $250\/night and expected a nice room. The room literally reminded me of a Best Western in the middle of Louisiana, not a Las Vegas resort.

No fridge in the room. Paid extra for a "premium room" with a view. Nothing about the room was premium, including the view.

The only pro about the hotel is the location on the strip.

Do yourself a favor, go next door to the Aria and stay in a high end, stunning hotel for like $20 more per night. Best decision we made was moving hotels to Aria.

So my wife and I had our anniversary and decided to go back to the hotel, huge mistake. Making reservations I stated it was a special occasion, apparently it didn't matter. At 6:00am the hammering started and by 8:00am the drills and pounding reached levels you could not hear your own voice. There was no warning about this to be happening, no alert by the front desk and no apology. 
We ran into a bachelorette party which needed to be planned months in advance and they received no help from the hotel to enhance their experience. 
Never again! Horrible support and no one to take authority, aside from no pool still charging a full resort fee for this disaster. 
We decided to leave a day early since the noise in our room gave us no retreat for relaxation what so ever, shame on you @montecarlo for you lack of caring and your shameless lame responses to our concerns. You not only lost my business but you also lost the business of my company. Shame on you

VERY disappointed! I have stayed here in the past with no issue. This time our room had was in REALLY bad condition. The furniture was falling apart, carpet was stained and dirty, wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. So-so food choices. However, great checkin and checkout experience with mobile app. Unfortunately, the room was bad enough that I would never stay here again.

For a town where "over the top" is the norm, the Monte Carlo is refreshingly balanced. It's not the cheapest place on the Strip, but it's definitely not the most expensive. However, it's perfectly placed between many other spots, so if the MC doesn't offer enough, it's a quick jaunt to other resorts.

The action in the lounges and casinos are similar: It's not the hottest spot in town, but it's far from dead or boring. So, if you are looking for the wild 'n' crazy Vegas, this ain't it!

As a 40-something married guy, the Monte Carlo is perfect for me and my wife. We can afford the nice suites without breaking the bank, we enjoy the reasonably priced restaurants that offer respectable menus, and can have fun in the casinos and lounges\/bars without feeling overrun by the wild party crowd.

Service is outstanding; always a sense that people are trying to earn well-deserved tips (and when you do tip, the service leaps to extraordinary levels, as it should in Vegas).

The only things that keep it from earning a five-star review are minor details. For instance, the Internet (WiFi or wired) is very slow. The soaps and shampoos are generic and inferior. Noise in the hallways and neighboring rooms can be a slight nuisance. Then again, it's perhaps all the more reason to get out of your room and enjoy Vegas!

We like the Monte Carlo, it is really reasonably priced, and the location is great. We will be returning there in a month. 

This is our tenth trip to Vegas in the last decade, it's my favorite place in the world. Our requirements are modest, a decent room, and good location and a good pool, 

We have stayed at eight different casinos on the strip and when I calculate price, location and amenities the Monte Carlo is the clear winner. We always dine all over the strip, the Rio and downtown. We also get two or three shows in, and there is a half price ticket location just across the street.

Round trip air fare from Phil.and 5 nights at the Monte Carlo this year was only $540 per person.  Great deal.

I travel a lot for business. This is my first hotel review on Yelp.

Last time I stayed in the Monte Carlo was in 1998. Staying there now is like traveling back in time, only worse. Nothing in the decor has changed, with the exception of a flat screen TV and Wifi. It's like a bad Fairfield Inn or Day's Inn, that happens to charge $250\/night. But that's not even the worst issue.

I stayed there this week for three nights during CES. I was on the 26th floor facing the new arena under construction. The noise from the construction, specifically the "beeping" of construction vehicles, started nightly at 3AM. Yes, 3AM, which is a violation of Las Vegas Noise Ordinance 9.16.030, which says construction can't start until 7AM. http:\/\/bit.ly\/1PkBPTn

So maybe MGM, who owns the hotel, can't control construction noise? Well, the construction project with the new arena is their project, on their land. And the hotel doesn't have double pane windows, which is a given in a hotel, so you can hear road and freeway noise, and especially construction at 3AM. Not even using ear plugs helped the situation. You could still hear the noise.

I complained, but they told me they didn't have any more rooms in the morning and that I needed to be back at 430PM to move my bags to another room there, or they would give it away. Granted, this is the busiest business conference of the year. I don't really want to interrupt business meetings to travel 1 hr back to the hotel to move my bags.

I was so tired from a lack of sleep for three days that I was grateful to be home. Providing a quiet place to sleep, free of construction noise at 3AM, is basic. If I want a bad experience, I won't pay $250\/night to be woken up, in a dated hotel.

The hotel also wanted to charge my company 1 night stay for checking out 1 day early, even though I checked out at 9AM. They had the chance to provide the room for someone else and still charged us.

Needless to say, I won't be going back to the Monte Carlo, and maybe any other MGM property after this mess. IMHO, I don't believe that you should stay here either.

Worst hotel in Las Vegas. Terrible service, awful rooms. 

I had to change room 3 times when doing my check-In: the first room they gave to me wasn't cleaned at all, it's not that the it was badly cleaned, it really wasn't cleaned: the bed was unmade and the towels were used. The second one looked ok, but then we realized there were cigarettes still in the ashtray and the water bottles were used! After that they finally upgraded us to a nicer suit but the keys wouldn't open the door, so I had to go all the way back to the lobby for the 4th time!!! Unbelievable!

I stayed 10\/6\/2014 thru 10\/8\/2014,  Very disappointed in this Hotel.  We reserved 2 adjoining rooms for myself and 4 friends with a strip view.  We were given 2 rooms that had a view of air conditioners and the end of a roller coaster.  Our sheets had rips in them and our towels were dirty. The toilets did not work properly. To say this place needs updating is an understatement.  Apparently they are under renovation, but neglected to inform us of this when we booked these over priced rooms.  Tried to get the manager to at least acknowledge some of the problems we were having, but we were told the hotel was 95% sold out so pretty much tough.  Not only will I not be staying here again, but will be sure to let all my friends know not to stay here as well.

Not planning on being a guest in this hotel again.  I found the beds to be uncomfortable and the thermostat did not cool the room properly.  The lamps did not work nor did the bathroom light.  After 2 complaints at the front desk they eventually had the bulbs changed so that issue was resolved but the bathroom light had to be tripped every time for it to work so on our 3rd day maintenance came and replaced the entire outlet leaving behind parts boxes, screws, electrical tape etc...
