The thermostat was never looked at.  We were not offered a different room but we were asked when maintenance could come and look at it.....I said immediately!!!!  Needless to say, 2 complete days without lights and again no room change offered.  The pool was amazing!  I would not rent a tube again for the lazy river because there are just too many people that stand in the pool and sit poolside that it is congested to be in a tube.  They have a nice regular pool area but everyone was hanging in the lazy river and it was like bumper cars in there running into people just hanging around.  Hot tub was very nice....I found the spa to be way over priced and 'professional' staff seemed to lack knowledge!  I really enjoyed relaxing on the amazing patio meeting new people and simply sipping coffee and reading a book.  The rooms were clean but dated.  Does not cater to the shoppers...one store for women.  We had to pay the mandatory resort fee for internet but was unable to access internet in our room...we had to use the casino for an internet connection...also reported to front desk with no results.  Do not plan to stay here again.

Stayed here during spring break last year. This resort & casino has a renaissance theme from the front entrance to each of its rooms. Not a lot of people rave about it, but it's actually pretty nice. Went to see the Jabbawockees perform at their own theater inside the Monte Carlo, which was nice because we didn't have to travel outside of our hotel.

I really wasn't there long enough to write a good review, but I'll write one anyway.  The room was average.  The front desk service was very good, maybe even great.  My view sucked because of the construction.  The location is great, right between the Bellagio and New York New York.  The breakfast buffet was just like every other hotel in the world.  The casino was pretty good.  The dealer at the poker table was great, and everyone at the table had a ball.  The waitress hunted down some matches for me since she didn't have any on her.  And the price for the room was pretty good, just $110 per night which included breakfast, although it was the off season.  Unfortunately I did not get the opporunity to see the pool or the spa.  The only complaint I have is that the water lines were pretty noisy, so if I had been asleep at 5 am the sound of someone showering in another room would have woke me up (did I say that right?? I better drink some more coffee).  Speaking of coffee, I don't think there was coffee in the room.  I have another complaint, now that I've thought about it.  I kept smelling toilet at various places around the building.  I don't know what it was, but it could have been my imagination.  I think I'll give it 3.5 stars.  I would stay there again.

I haven't been to LV in years and stayed in the Monte Carlo for the first time this past weekend.  They ended up messing up our reservation (wrong keys) and comp'd us 4 free brunches, which was very very good.  Overall, the hotel is nice.  Nice comfortable beds, fast responding elevators and the Jabbawockeez show was siiiiic!  My only beef was the hotel pool kinda sucked - bunch of drunk idiots, and HORRIBLE HORRIBLE music (clubby pop house stuff).  I like to relax at the pool.  If not for that I would've given it 4 stars.  Cheers!

The room's are no better than Motel 6. There is no coffee in their rooms. We had to call them because the AC was not working proper and when the gentleman came up to fix it he seen that the filter was so black it was Unreal. Once he replaced the filter it worked a lot better. I think you get better food at Denny's then you do at their Buffet. I really don't have much to write about on this place as it was very disappointing . Not sure whether I'll stay here again or not. At least there were a few team members that were very nice and polite.

So I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo from 11\/3\/17-11\/5\/17. I read all the reviews previous to my stay and was worried I wasn't going to have a good time due to all the negative feedback that was left. Well that was not the case. The staff at the check in counter was friendly and welcoming. I was on the 23rd floor which are the newly renovated rooms. Very clean and neat. No complains what so ever regarding the room. The only complain I do have was the parking and the people who clean the rooms. To start off, the parking was a hassle to get in and out after it was charged to my room because the activation never went through all the times it was activated. It was a hassle having to phone in the front desk in the parking structure to let me out. On to the next problem which really made me mad. I had took some individual sized chip bags that I took for my son. Well the person who cleaned our room took some of my sons chips. I know this because the big bag were they were stored was open which I left closed before we left to walk the strip. Pretty sad if you ask me. But overall, hotel is good. I will go back but put stuff away or leave it my car.
I'll start by saying the experience received here was great. Would recommend a stay here at this business. The garage parking representatives outside were helpful, which was nice.

It's not the fanciest or nicest looking, but it's clean and it gets the job done.  I like that in the morning they have $5 blackjack tables and once you sit down you can be grand-fathered in for the rest of the day.

The waitresses are a bit slow to come around sometimes, so make sure you give them a tip if you want them to return to you.

The walls in the rooms are paper thin. You can hear everything going on in the room right next to you. 
The room was clean and the staff was pleasant. 
While playing, my cocktail waitress,  Elizabeth was the best waitress I had all weekend. She was friendly, attentive, and not once did I have to wait or ask for a drink. She is what kept me at the monte carlo playing games the entire night! I wish she worked the whole time I was there because I did not get that good of service anywhere else!!

This was my first time in Las Vegas and I must say this hotel and the staff are absolutely amazing. I stayed in the amazing hotel 32. Which is an exclusive floor that has the penthouses, lofts and studio rooms which. It is only open too people with the hotel 32 cards. You get VIP check-in, get picked up at the airport via limousines (complementary) and a suit assistant that is sort of like a Butler. Also we had our own lounge where we recieved smacks and drinks throughout the day. The rooms are super clean and the cleaning staff was amazing. The only not so good part of the entire trip was the poll area under construction but we could have visited other hotels in the area too use their pools with the hotel 32 card. The food was great and so was the casino experience.

I stayed at this hotel because I got a special deal for $40\/night. Being my first time in Vegas, I knew I wasn't going to be in my hotel much. Room was nicely decorated, modern, and check in\/check out was a breeze. Casino was smaller than the others on the Strip but I liked it because it wasn't full of weirdos and overly smoky. So it was a great deal! I had no problems whatsoever. Location is perfect too! But next time I'm in Vegas, I'll try a more high end hotel with more amenities (spas, clubs, better restaurants, etc) since I'll be spending less time exploring the Strip and more time actually relaxing. I didn't go in the pool although it looked decent; I stayed away bc I could hear the kids screaming all the way from my room...sheesh!

Really disappointed with our stay and BEWARE of rooms here. We rented a spa suite here at the monte carlo just because it was a little cheaper than some other hotels  but we really regret it. There was the most extreme construction right above us in our room that started every morning when we were out all night and just trying to sleep. When we brought it up to the receptionist she just rolled her eyes as if thats what we should have expected. I would have gladly paid more for a room somewhere else to avoid the EXTREMELY loud drilling and hammering. I understand they have to build at some point but there really should have been a disclaimer, a discount, or those rooms should have just been out of service for the time they were working on it.

We also had an issue with checking in where they told us they would email and text us when our room was ready, which they estimated at 3pm. At 5 we had to call in ourselves after waiting to hear from them for 2 hours and they said its been ready since 3. On top of all that we knew going in that the Monte Carlo pool was closed, but they mention the MGM would be open for us as well. Turned out THAT was closed too but was failed to be mentioned to us when we were booking.

This is a 4-star hotel with a lot of 5-star ameneties about it. 

1. Location is fantastic. You're in a centralized location on the strip and  you can walk or shuttle it (what is that light-rail lookin' thing?) easily. 
2. Check-in is a bitch. There isn't one single line - you line up at each individual employee. This is confusing and dumb and frustrating. 
3. Our room was awesome. It was a suite that overlooked the pools. Came with internet, flat-screen TV, couch, fridge, two bathrooms. However, the shower water was low-pressure, lukewarm, and the sinks didn't drain properly. 
4. Eating is easy. There is a fast-food court and a handful of restaurants that cover steaks, mexican, asian, brewpub. Whatever you're looking for. And room service is fucking the best EVER. Yeah, you pay a lot: It's ROOM SERVICE. But it comes fast, they don't forget anything, the portions are pretty big, and the ingredients are top-notch. You can really taste where that extra cash is going. 
5. The casino bar (was there only one? that's all I saw) is overpriced at $6 for a bottled domestic, but hey - you are on the strip and the room was cheap, so suck it up. 
6 & 7: The chapel and catering departments. 
Top-notch since day one. Every call answered. Every voicemail returned. Every email responded to. Many choices in regards to food and even decor. They do your flowers and photos. Both are not as expensive as you would think, either. I hate flowers - my flowers were freakin BEAUTIFUL. For the ceremony, the chapel shuttles you in and out QUICK after meticulously explaining what you're supposed to be doing ("walk when I say GO!") Open bar? Not that expensive! We went with a buffet-style dinner and it was freakin delish. Long list of choices... I mean LONG... and it didn't taste like a buffet at all. Came with salads, crudites, and a dessert table in addition to the wedding cake! Open bar included red bull - now how nifty is that??

Absolutely the best, no, much much more than the best value for the price you pay. 
However... they will nickel-and-dime the shit out of you. No free rooms or hefty discounts (just little tiny ones) even when you're dumping a shitload of money into one four-hour party. But at the end of the day, tally up all you spent and look at what you got and that is what makes all the difference.

It's been a minute since I've stayed here. I decided to go on a budget hotel this time around and this fit the billing. I had the M Life Rewards that knocked down the price of 2 nights here to the mid $30 range. As other Yelpers have reviewed, this place is in a remodel phase. It's obvious with all the closed off sections and the loud drilling going on. Upon walking in, I showed up early as my flight landed earlier then usual. There was a line leading to self check in kiosks and a line leading to the front desk. It was slightly confusing as it seemed the designated line overlapped both. I walked to the desk check in and got a funny vibe from two of the staff. None of them seemed to acknowledge my existence standing there. It seemed the lady working glanced up and looked back down. She seemed to mumble something to the guy who finally after a few seconds nodded at me to come forward.  What bothered me about this interaction was the lady helped an elderly couple behind me and immmediately turned on the charm and smiles. So you're telling me you don't treat all customers the same way huh? Anyway...the guy was helpful and got me a room for early check in as one was ready. He pointed me to where the room was and gave me a tip about using the tram to get to the middle of the strip for free. Kudos to him. Can't say the same about the female  working with him. As for the room, they gave me an updated version which isn't bad. But you can tell people have already broken the room in with some faded stains on the carpet. The bed and bathroom looked fairly modernized and theres a new Samsung TV in the room also. At the time of this review there appears to be a restaurant downstairs that's open, but I don't see any other options. Guessing the remodel is holding off any other eating options for now. The beauty of Vegas is there's always something to eat somewhere so that's not a biggie for me. I'm guessing once the remodel is done the Monte Carlo may be a better hotel. For now it's pretty standard and budget friendly.

'Monte Carlo Resorts and Casino...now with 100% LESS SUCK!'

I feel that should be the new ad slogan because I haven't had the most positive experience with this place in the past, but time and time again I would book a room here because for a centrally located strip hotel, it ranked as one of the cheaper options. 

and then each time I stayed I was rudely reminded why.

Let's see, where can I start: the rooms are drab, the window views are dismal, even when you're looking out the 'front of the hotel' you see a crap view of empty lots and the freeway.  The restaurants are nothing special and there is not hot nightclub venue that draws in the nightcrowd.  This place is like the Holiday Inn Express of the strip, clean but boring, and purely a place to sleep and maybe partake in the buffet.

So this trip my friend who booked the room asked me what my hotel prefs were and I said 'I dont really care, just prefer no Monte Carlo'  and of course guess where we ended up.

However this time around I noticed the whole experience felt different.  Ever since the completion and opening of MGM Group's crown jewel Aria City Center, i suspect they have infused a bit more cash and life into this once drab resort.  It's not glaringly obvious but little things like the rooms, amenities and service seem much better, and their shops have new additions with the biggest plus...internal walkway to City Center connecting it to Aria and no longer making the hotel feel like a cut off locked in the attic stepchild.  Also access to the tram gives you free mobility to go to City Center and Bellagio with a gorgeous almost futuristic view of that section of the strip in AC'ed tinted windowed comfort.  Even the crappy pool area seems to have new life as I tried the lazy river and wave pools which seemed quite fun.

Whatever MGM did, they sucessfully transformed MC from a solid 'bleah' to 'yeah its ok' hotel in my mind.  The style, amenities and rooms will never approach a Palazzo or Wynn level, but I feel like its not meant to, and thats ok, because you dont have to pay those level prices either.

C'est un htel plutt "chic" situ au dbut du strip. Bien entretenue, avec toutes les commodits. Beaucoup de divertissements possibles, dont le spectacle des "Blue Man group" le vritable problme est la quasi absence d'insonorisation, donc quand les voisins rentrent  3h du matin et qu'ils font la fte jusqu' 5h, il n'y a qu' patienter, en attendant de se rendormir... Sinon l'absence de wifi  partir du 3me tage est  noter galement...
I thought it was good place to stay, had deluxe strip view room. Good location on strip. Has tram. Had fun. Our room was nice and clean.

My first time going to vegas so I booked with them since my friends stayed there. We bought the early check in and when we get there at 8 am , lady tells us just come by 9 and pick up keys your room will be ready. Come back at 9 there's a huge line, waited in line about 30 mins, the rude and unprofessional lady (her name was kathy) short hair called us over, no greetings,  she tells us we do not have any room available,  I was shocked. What do you mean, I just came here an hour ago all was good. And weirdly all other guests who were being helped by other staff were getting a room and seemed happy. Kathy told us to come back in one hour but room is not guranteed, so if there's not a room ready, she Will refund the money and basically we are screwed and have to find ourselves different hotel. Wtf.. told her no I paid early check in so I want my room by 10 not another hour,  she said ok check back, worst customer service. She is ruining the reputation of monte carlo. And I wasn't the only guest unhappy with her that time. We came back and we made sure to go back to different person not kathy, and we got our room with no hassle.  Even the staff was shocked that kathy sent us away to wait for a "IF" available room.. two stars because the room was decent and served it's purpose.

Not as classy as Aria, or as modern as Cosmo, but Monte Carlo can definitely hold its own. How? Well, they have great deals that are half the prices of Aria and the other high end hotels, has a great location on the strip, AND...It's attached to Aria!! You can go to Aria without ever having to set foot outside, OR take the tram and go to Vdara\/Crystals or Bellagio! The opportunities are endless..so take the cheaper hotel and explore all the other hotels!

PS: The Monte Carlo rooms are very well kept up and worth what you pay. You can also check out via email (they send you a link).

***Please note this is only a review of my initial interaction with Monte Carlo VIP Service and NOT MLife Reservations; however the lasting impression ultimately prompted my decision not to request a reservation at Hotel32 as well as cancel my existing reservations at Aria.***

I recently contacted MLife on Thursday 9\/7\/2017 at approximately 4-4:30pm and was transferred to Monte Carlo's VIP services because of my inquiry regarding Hotel32.

I was interested in changing my three upcoming room reservations at Aria to stay at Hotel32 and Monte Carlo; however when I inquired about promotions I was simply provided an answer of "NO".

I am a frequent Las Vegas visitor and my previous experiences with MLife and more importantly Aria VIP services have been the greatest in customer service that I have had, with representatives assisting me with additional suggestions for my 40th Birthday as well as going above and beyond to finding me the best rates for my stay.

However my experience with the Monte Carlo VIP service representative has tarnished all that was great which I experienced. Being transferred to any "VIP" service representative, I believe there are certain expectations to be fulfilled on the representatives side such as asking for the requested date of stay, offering to check booking system, and then offer a listing of current rates to allow me to decide if they were viable options for me.(Simple common sense, customer service protocol to attract guests to stay or visit the property) Instead I was provided with a firm "NO" and the call was complete. 

Unfortunately, this recent experience with the representative at Monte Carlo VIP services has prompted me to not only change my mind about staying at the Monte Carlo, but has also prompted me to cancel my three reservations at Aria that I secured for my 40th Birthday as it is also an MGM property.

If the Monte Carlo plans to compete with the likes of the Cosmopolitan and the Cromwell boutique hotel\/casinos once they have fully renovated to Park MGM and Nomad I hope they also look at their "VIP" staff as well.

Beware - stay away. My worst experience in Vegas ever and I've been coming for my entire life, literally. I will never step foot in the Monte Carlo again. We actually have 2 more nights here and I'm booking rooms at another resort.

First off, it's all torn up, construction everywhere, basically the whole casino floor is shut down. Why in the hell would you not disclose to people making reservations that your entire hotel is under construction. 

No food? We came back here at 11p our first night planning to eat.  You can't, there's no food. Vending machine or go to another hotel.... seriously?  Why am I paying a resort fee? 

The new signature rooms are a joke. They look like your crazy aunt watched too much flip or flop and had a $150 budget at the goodwill to decorate.  No fridge, no coffee maker, no microwave. Towels made of, I believe, sandpaper.  Couch doesn't match the chair, chair doesn't match the table, none of them go with this hideous lamp. Seriously, whoever thought this lamp was a good idea should probably be given their walking papers. 

Now the view, not too bad, we paid extra for the strip view. Now if I could only see it through this window. It's so dirty that the first half of the day while the sun hits it, the dirt is so bright you can barely see through it. The MGM is directly across the street and all I can see is a big dark blob. 

Then, for some reason before 5am construction started on our floor, hammering and drilling in the room right next to us. After an hour, now almost 7am, they moved to the room on the other side of us and started all over again.  

The walls are paper thin, listening to the construction crews open and shut the blinds next door literally sounded like it was coming from inside our room. You can also here every conversation going on down the hall, doors closing, etc. 

1 star for the good water pressure and a decent bed.

I stayed here a few times in the past, and didn't have any real problems, but like Lily J said - the walls are THIN.  Maybe even the space between the door and the floor are to far apart too, because I distinctly remember always hearing people talking as they walked pass.

Other than that; it's in a good location on the strip, with decent rooms, the staff were nice (from what I remember).  I've had a few meals at their cafe and pub - both places had pretty good food.  I recently had drinks in the bar downstairs of Andre's, which was nice - friendly bartender and delicious pours!

This used to be my favorite LV hotel. Sooo disappointed in the service, room, and overall hotel appearance. They are under construction (wish they'd have mentioned that when we made reservations over a month ago); hopefully it's the timing and they will return to their glory of old.

We only stayed here because it was the cheapest of the options in our deal.  The elevators are saunas when it's hot outside.  Our room was about a quarter mile from the elevators.  We had two rooms; one on the 15th floor and one on the 12th.   In order to get from one to the other, we had to go all the way to the first floor and take a different elevator back up.  The rooms also have no fridges.  House keeping was pretty good and it might be worth it for the price we got.  The casino doesn't smell too smoky.

I have seen other reviews complaining about the conditions of the rooms but I room was clean and had everything I needed but when it comes to me and Vegas I just need a room to crash in when the night is over. Who really spends too much time in the room in Vegas.

The problem with this place is that there is nothing unique or fascinating to draw lot's of people.  It is just kinda bland.  Stayed there - thought it was ok - left.

Dubya out!

Checked in and noticed that the bed sheets had all kinds of stains, ranging from blood to marker. Called the front desk and they promised to replace it.
After returning from a trip down the Las Vegas Strip, I noticed that the bed sheets had been flipped over, so that the stains were present a bit higher.

This place is affordable, but downright filthy. Would not recommend it.

It's an older hotel. Walking inside and then also walking inside the other newer hotels, you can tell the MC probably needs a renovation. But hey! It's cheaper without the renovations I think. And it's perfect for those looking for a cheaper stay. 

Like any other hotels, lots of gambling on the first floor. You got to walk through a lot of tables and slots before even getting to the lobby if you are coming from the strip.

Decent place to stay for the price. The other places are probably more expensive.

The hotel lobby is amazing, the shops inside are unique, yummy French eatery inside the hotel (Primrose) and 2 other places we did not eat at, Starbucks inside the hotel, and the room was VERY cool and roomy. I enjoyed the lighted mirror, magnified mirror and unique decor.

The shower was big enough for 3 people to share I'm sure! and I LOVED the long velvet couch installed in the window seat with a view of the strip. We sat and enjoyed the view many times over our 2 night stay.

LOTS to see\/do and walk to, free tram to other hotels in the area. Event venue attached to the hotel, no need to go outside to enter.

Cons:
Casino, some lobbies and elevators smell like cigarette smoke BAD
The trek to your room is quite long
They are transitioning to ParkMGM so lots of construction\/loud noise
No A\/C
No fridge without renting for a free
No microwave or coffee maker
Parking is $10\/day
Pool is closed right now
Most of the restaurants inside the hotel closed at 10-11pm
TV cable did not function for 1st night
Wifi did not function for most of 1st night

Very bad customer service. Its very sad to see a known hotel in Las Vegas that has been around for a long time with worst customer service ever. It's no longer about good service. It's all about making money. If they are not making money off of you....who are you to them...."Nothing"! Very Sad. This is our first stay and our last. Thank you for ruining our vacation!!!

pros... an okay hotel in vegas.  good location, you can get to most other places pretty easily, when traffic permits.  right across the street from game works and the big m & m store as well.  our suite was big, clean, nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable.  all you would expect from a hotel of this price range.   

the only other good thing was the front desk clerk.  our csr was named phoung and she helped us out very quickly and was very cheerful as well.  

cons... the hotel is showing it's age.  went here when it had first opened, and it was so much more of a vegas hotel.  now it's luster has gone and it is just another hotel that just happens to be on the las vegas strip, nothing special.  it's not super bad but for the price it's not really worth it either. 

the other thing which was missing was a good place to eat, like a restaurant on the ground floor or something.  i didn't much expect to see just a sign saying, "buffet" and "diner" or something to that effect.  the food was edible but nothing special.  the one other good thing is that you can get a 2 for 1 deal on the breakfast.  

the elevators were in horrible shape.  doors all banged up and scratched, it's not so much the appearance of the doors, yeah they are elevator doors, but they didn't even close right.  if you happen to be nice and hold the door open for a straggler, the alarm would sound, and then the doors would slowly, noisily, screech their way close.  one door had a large gouge taken out of it, and was severely dented.  not once in the 4 days that i was there, did i see anyone cleaning or wiping down the elevators.  in other hotels along the strip they have whole battalions of people cleaning, dusting, moping, sweeping, and polishing anything that wasn't human.  that was not the case at this hotel. 

as for the rest of the casino, it was typical las vegas, confusing carpet patterns, every where you look, looks exactly the same so you get lost inside the casino.  the lights are perpetually muted so you don't know what time it is.  the heavy oppressive smell of smoke, you don't see the smoke but you can really smell it.  

t.v. here sucked.  my buddy's room had a poltergeist t.v. which turned on in the middle of the night and would turn off, remote would change channels and volume but wouldn't turn it off, and even the button on the actual set wouldn't turn it off.  oh and our room didn't even have the "do not disturb" door tag, or any note paper as well.    

all in all a pretty disappointing hotel to stay at.  i would expect this type of hotel off the strip, nothing fancy about the front, nothing eye catching, nothing to say, "hey look at me and come in for a good time".
in fact, this hotel should be moved out somewhere off the strip.  it's like a second class hotel charging first class prices.  not a good place.  i would rather stay next door at new york, new york then here.

I'm in a room that overlooks a construction site that starts every morning at 6 am. I have to listen to the sound of hammering and workers yelling every morning before 7 am.

Nightmare.

Also, in the room
-no fridge
-hardly any outlets to charge phone
-no coffee maker
-no alarm clock

Stayed here and had absolutely no hot water in our shower and even after they "fixed" it we shivered form lack of hot water! Management handled the problem poorly and made us feel like it's unreasonable to ask for a warm\/hot shower! I'll never  ever stay here and recommend if you like to shower while on vacation don't stay here!

Our friends wanted to stay, but honestly I'm not quite sure why.  Not the worst, but far from the best location on the strip.  It's a good location, but I'd try elsewhere on our next vacation.

Edit: Thank you for the reply.  I'm not quite sure what makes the Monte Carlo seem less extravagant.  Perhaps it's the lower ceilings in the casino area compared to other M-Life properties like New York, New York and MGM Grand.

Came here for the weekend and was planning on staying two nights, but the room's AC is so bad! I usually get cold at hotels and in this room I'm still catching myself complaining about how hot it is, even when the AC is on! We are checking out after the first night and staying elsewhere for our second night. Oh and to top it all off they don't offer room service for dinner. Room service ends at 2pm!!!

What the hell happened Monte Carlo?!? You used to be such an awesome place to stay..

We decided to upgrade to a room with a view of the strip.. What we got was an outdated room that smelled like weed from our lovely neighbors and oh yea..  a fight broke out in the hallway at 2am.. I get it.. It's Vegas.. But it's all fun and games until someone yells "go get my gun!".. And yes that did actually happen.. 

The only reason why I'm giving it two stars is cuz the refunded me the amount to upgrade the room.. Would of been nicer to also comp the "resort fee" but whatever.. Doubt we'll stay here again..

I've never stayed in a hotel that was this run down and especially not for the price I paid.  The Monte Carlo sent me an email to upgrade from their standard room to a suite for $40\/night and since I was going to Vegas for my wife and I's anniversary I figured why not.  BIG MISTAKE! 
I asked for a room\/suite on a higher floor and that didn't happen. They first gave us a room on the 3rd floor with a view of an ac unit. It was also near the elevator which resulted in a lot of noise in our room.  I called and talked to the front desk and they offered me a room on the 12th floor. Saying that was the best that they had and all of the suites are located by the elevator due to the size or something like that. I took them up on their offer for a room on the higher for which happened to be available that next day.  I wish I would've stayed on the third floor. The room on the 12th floor that we had was completely in shambles. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall, the sink in the main bathroom was cracked, the towel rod was hanging off from the wall, the towel hook was loose and just spinning freely, all of the furniture was dinged up scratched and just in horrible condition and the sink in the small bathroom was broken and the stopper did not work.  Not to mention the window film was half peeled off on the only window that overlooked more of the roof. Needless to say I've stayed at the Monte Carlo multiple times and the rooms were always in good condition.  And the resort fee... what a joke! There were no amenities that we could utilize for the "resort". The Wi-Fi was free anyway. And again everything else was shut down so none of the amenities could be used because of construction. So, for an average of $208 a night I would've expected something better then the quality that you would find at a cheap $40 a night Motel6 or something like that.  And when I filled out the survey that they emailed me I voiced my concerns and now, 2 1\/2 weeks later I have yet to hear from anyone. Do not stay at the Monte Carlo! Save your money and go to a better hotel. The Paris, the Aria heck even the Jockey Club was in better condition that our room.

Just look at their shower faucets.. Need I say more.

Had to wait. 5 minutes outside the room after checkin because room service had not cleaned it yet!

Easily the 2nd tier hotel on the strip. Look to MGM grand for quality rooms.

Our barrel race gang all staying here first time during our NFR trip. Rooms are real good except not bedside elec outlets. They are hidden behind furniture, etc. Sux and not up to date in this gadget world most of us have going on, keeping all the stuff charged. Otherwise, all is real good.

Great location, looks good from the outside but is a bit dated inside and could use renovations. They charge you an extra $15 a night which covers Internet but they don't even have wireless. Also both my wife and I ended up with bug bites so I'm thinking bed bugs and on checking out I told the front desk and they said they would check it out and call me. They did call later and naturally they said it was clean.. So who knows maybe we got bitten some other place but sure seems suspect.

Had a fairly positive experience staying here. It seemed like more of a hotel geared toward families\/older people. It's a fairly small hotel but our room was nice. It was quite an upgrade from my first floor room at excalibur. It's a pretty simple, no frills hotel. We didn't have to deal with any rowdy people and the halls were always quiet at night. The pool area is fairly small but there are many pools to choose from, hot tubs, and I spent a lot of time in the wavepool and lazy river. Great for kids. It's a relatively quiet, lowkey hotel to say the least. Doesn't seem to attract much riff raff, which is a plus if you're not into that.

Stayed 3 nights; basic room- clean, iron, ironing board, toiletries, hair dryer all available in room. Room service available but didn't use. No mini fridge or microwave in room. Ice machine available on floor. Limited TV stations available. Hotel pool being remodeled so it was closed but invited to use pools at MGM Grand or Mandalay Bay- wasn't convenient to use those pools- checked out the one at MGM- crowded and didn't want to have to pay for a seat by pool. Had asked for a room on a higher floor and had paid more for it but wasn't given it on check in but hotel refunded money at check out when brought to their attention. Weekday rates were very reasonable. Ate at the buffet- average priced - nothing extraordinary just basic buffet food-not much fresh fruit selection which was a but disappointing. Staff courteous. Casino had variety of games to play. Small food court also in casino as well as a Starbucks. Access to gym for hotel guests; spa was exceptional- $15 for all day pass- open 6am-6pm; steam room, dry sauna, whirlpool and cool pool- lockers, robes, showers, toiletries, towels, lounge area with comfy seating, tv, fruit infused water and a basket of fruit available. Additional cost for services like massage etc. Helpful, friendly staff. Was relaxed and rejuvenated. Hotel is older than most others and shows it's age but was clean and conveniently located on strip and walking to other venues was easy. For the price it was well worth it.

So I tried giving this place another chance since we got a good deal but the rooms still are not upgraded and once again we checked into our room and they gave us two beds instead of one king bed! They did not accommodate our original reservation for a king bed either.  You are better off staying at New York New York or Mandalay Bay because I have never had any problems.   

I gave them three stars because they do have good customer service people working here.  But I am not very pleased with the room accommodations.

The shower head feels like an elephant is spraying water from its trunk. It actually hurt to wash up! 

The room itself was nice though. Me and another girl shared a two bedroom and it was a good size especially since we were there for a week. It was just the darn shower head. At first I thought it was just our room but my friends were on another floor and they couldn't stand the shower head either. The best thing about this place though is the location. It's so easy to travel to any part of the strip. If you have more $$ I'd say spring for the Wynn. But the Monte Carlo is good enough for especially for the price.

Wish I could give ZERO stars 

Stayed with a friend for a comp night as she is a M Life Gold member  and rec'd a free night and comp Cher tickets . We were late arriving due to cancelled flight and arrived around 12:30 am the room condition was deplorable !! I don't know how with good conscious they could have guests staying in such a  dilapidated room !!! 

Please save your money and stay at a real casino that has customer service as we had the run around the entire time . Luckily they let us pay for an upgraded suite ( newly renovated side) that felt we were in a completely different casino !! 

They also fail to tell you the pool is under construction and you must shuttle to Mandalay Bay and they won't shuttle you to MGM . However they continue to charge the resort fee !!! 

First and last time !!! I will stick with the Ceasar's  group

2.5-3.  I can't decide which.  The check-in lines were hugely disorganized and there was a random pill (yup, a unmarked PILL) on my friend's bed when we stayed there.  We picked it because we wanted a cheaper place that was within a reasonable walking distance to Mandalay Bay for a concert (because MB is too expensive).  So this place did the job.  We walked to Excalibur and caught the tram.  MC has nice decor and the BRAND Steakhouse we ate at was pretty good, but if I wasn't so cheap, I'd have stayed at a different place.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo during our sister retreat. The hotel is under a major renovation currently and isn't expected to be completed until 2018. Upon check-in there was an issue with locating our reservation. I booked through the 3rd party website my company uses. GTA is the company it ultimately found it under. It took about 30 mins standing in line, then about another 30 to find our reservation. Thinking this could've handled better. The pool is currently closed due to these renovations so we had to hike it over to the MGM in our swimsuits whenever we wanted to take a dip (not fun). Not sure why we could use the pool at The Aria since it was literally connected. The hotel staff was friendly and prompt each time we called from the room (extra blankets, wash clothes, and to unclog the tub). The rooms are really out dated, so the reno can't come soon enough. The smell in the casino is a bit overwhelming (like smoke, incents, & baby powder).Other than that, the hotel is in a good location on the strip and the view from the room was really nice, we were on the 21st floor with the strip right outside our window. The Park across the street is really nice place to grab something to eat, drink, and people watch. Overall, it was a decent stay.

Spend an entire week here, and see how much you like 'em then!

Granted, I've never tried staying at the classically crappy strip hotels like the Imperial or Treasure Island (maybe?) but this one, wow. First, the walls were SUPER thin. I could hear everything, and being in Vegas, 10 guesses on what I heard the most.... My coworker (for example) experienced hearing a group of girls (in the next room) come home from a club, argue, get in a drunken fist fight, and get thrown out of the hotel by security (after he made 2 calls to the front desk)--all in the privacy of his room. 

No wake up calls here. Because if the construction at 4AM didn't wake you up, the roller coaster next door will keep you awake all night anyway. 

Restaurants here sucked. Their house "Cafe" (where their room service comes from, btw) was extremely gag-worthy. The brewery is a decent place to get a drink and watch sports on their large screen, but if you are planning to eat, I'd really suggest going to a different hotel, or just filling up with more beer. Because believe me, if they couldn't get the Chicken Wings and Burgers to taste good, I suspect they can't get anything else to taste good either. 

I stayed here for an entire week during a tradeshow, and I will never come back. I gave this hotel 2 stars for being cheap, having a nice lobby, and for not catching on fire while I was there. Thanks, Monte Carlo!

The Monte Carlo is somehow easily overlooked.
Sure the location on the strip is ideal, but somehow its tucked a bit back and even though the fountains and design are beautiful from the front, inside its missing its shine.
It needs a serious facelift. Almost like a ghosttown inside, old people, dirty floors, fairly empty, it was missing that Vegas spark. What a shame, I hope they put some money in this place, it could really shine.

been here a few times and its safe to say this is a great casino.waiters are fast beer flows like wine rooms are nice.not the best rooms but how long are you acually in there anyway.i will be there soon and im sure ill have a great time.

The only good thing this hotel has going for it is the fact that it's close to other good hotels on the strip. 

We decided to give this hotel a chance, given the good deal they had on one of their suites. 2 hours after check in our room was still not available so they gave us a downgraded room and still charged the $30 hotel fee ...   they then gave us a food credit and told us to charge it on our room and then they charged us for that too at check out. 

Don't expect normal Las Vegas customer service from this less than average hotel. There's honestly no reason to give this place a chance with at least a dozen other great hotels on the strip.

Place is ok. Long overdue to to stay at this place and wish I had stayed here when it had first opened. A good sized room but bathtub\/shower looked dated. Being on the strip, it is close to the major hotels and within walking distance. Decent amount of restaurant choice and there is the food court too if you want the fast food.

With the building of The Park hotel, it was pretty busy and getting there can be a pain due to walking traffic.

Staff there was helpful, courteous, and friendly. 

The show entertainment is the Blue Man Group.

Be nice to have Wi-Fi available in the room and not wired. Most that connect are wireless like myself.

Complimentary water too.

Not sure why people are knockin this place cause I think it is quite decent for what you pay. Almost every room has a view too, ours faced NY, NY and Excalibur. The location is pretty cool cause it is the connected to the tram which takes you all the way down to the Bellagio for free. The pool and food court are conveniently located right by the elevators and front desk so you don't have to hike all over hell and gone. Our group frequented Starbucks and Rubios the most which were both overall a good experience. They also have a Subway, pizza joint and a Mickey D's. 

The pool is pretty sweet they have a lazy river, wave pool and a beach volleyball court. Thing I liked too is they aren't super anal about bringing in outside food or drinks. I would like it if they had a bigger spa though or maybe more than one. Overall the staff was very friendly and we got towels and other necessities quickly. I would stay here again.

After a terrible afternoon which included a flight cancellation and the need to book a room on a Saturday at the last minute we ended up here.  I had stayed here years before and the place is definitely worse for the wear.  The first room they gave us was not clean, in a few disturbing ways, leading me to change rooms for the first time in my life.  The second room, on the 28th floor, was better, but still not four star quality.  The staff was nice, and the casino is solid and has reasonable limits, but the rooms are more three star than four and I would hesitate to stay here again without a big room renovation and assurance the cleaning staff was doing a better job.

My goto spot to stay when in Vegas.  While it is certainly not a fancy place the staff are always VERY friendly, it has a great location on the strip, it is clean, has 2 starbucks and I nice little poker room with some cheap daily tournaments.

On the downside the sportsbook is not great but other than that if you're going to Vegas and want to put your money into entertainment as opposed to the place that you basically only see for the 30 minutes when you get up and 30 minutes before bed then the Monte Carlo is ideal.  Was just there in May and Nov and booked today to go back in Feb.

I stayed at this hotel in May. My experience was pretty terrible from the get-go.  I booked a handicap accessible room for my sister (who is in a wheelchair) through the phone with the Monte Carlo people.  Upon check-in, they gave me a room key to enter my new hotel room.  Upon opening the hotel room, I noticed that the room reeked of marijuana and someone's stuff was sprawled all over the room.  It took a moment to register that I just walked into someone else's room. I went back to the front desk and explained what happened and that we needed a new room that was handicap accessible.  They gave me another room key.  After checking out this room, we realized that the bathrooms were NOT handicap accessible.  So at this point, we were pretty frustrated.  What we wanted was a comfortable experience at our hotel, and now we were being dragged up and down the hotel with our bags.  After the 3rd time speaking to the front desk, we were placed in a room that was handicap accessible.  However, the room was not very clean. I could tell the toilet needed a deep cleaning as the inside rim was disgusting.  The sheets weren't switched out on a day to day basis.  We sucked it up for the few days we stayed there, but I would never stay at this hotel again.

There's apparently a reason why I have not stayed at this hotel in about 10 years. It's freaking disgusting. Gouges in the furniture that they couldn't bother replacing. Gouges in the mirror that they couldn't bother replacing. Disgusting stains on the walls that they couldn't bother wiping off. Cracks in the bathroom tiles that aren't fixed. The bathtub looks like it's about 50 years old. And when I checked in they asked if I wanted housekeeping service while I was here... Isn't that standard when you stay in a hotel? No apparently a lot of people say no. Well please don't put me in a room where the previous guest decided they didn't want housekeeping service during the length of their stay because that's probably why the furniture is disgusting. I'm afraid to walk on the carpet in my bare feet and I'm so grossed out by the bedding that looks like it came from a Super 8 hotel that I might go sleep in my car. There's clearly a reason why I've been staying at Vdara or Aria for the past years. It's too bad because the Monte Carlo used to be a nice hotel and now I get the impression it's just a lower priced hotel for a bunch of drunk disgusting tourists, and that's why the rooms look like trash. Keep your fingers crossed I don't need to go get antibiotics from sleeping in the bed. I'm floored that this is affiliated with Hyatt. They oughta dump this place faster than the tourists waiting in line to check in can down their little mini bottles of alcohol they bought at the gift shop.....
Ah...update.  Construction!! Beeping trucks and sounds of dump trucks at 1230am! Oh...that's the Aria but they should be done in the next hour or so.  Yeah...no! Moved me to another room...right by the Strip do all the lovely music coming from the bars etc.  Yeaahh... no! Not to mention...wait for it...a used rubber glove in the middle of the hallway on that floor!! 
Third room.  I'm so exhausted since it's 1am and I have to be awake in less than 5 hours that once again I'm just hopeful I doubt need an STD test from sleeping in this bed.  Oh and ladies, yes, I'll be squatting over rather than sitting on the bathroom toilet seat for the next 3 days...suggest you do the same. The used rubber glove in the hallway tipped the scale on that one!
Nutshell = RUN FAR AND RUN FAST TO ANOTHER HOTEL AND SPEND THE EXTRA MONEY!
Update....3rd room.  What looks to be urine stains on the walls.  Someone trying to get into my room about 230am. Checked out. Let's see if I get the full refund I was promised...

To Lori from Guest Relations...no thanks.  Three strikes you're out. Never again.  Renovate all you want.  You might want to tear it down and start from scratch.  Hire new housekeeping staff while you're at it.
I love this hotel. The spa suites are so much fun. The restaurants are great and the hotel is beautiful. I love the spa and pool. I think the Monte Carlo and Paris Hotel are my favorites on Vegas.

The Monte Carlo in Vegas is not nearly as nice as the real place but it's an okay Hotel on the strip.  It's kind of inbetween the worst and the nicest hotels.  I've walked through it a couple times but there's nothing really I can recall that catches the eye.  It's a pretty simple place and it has lower limits if you want to gamble smaller here instead of the high minimums of some of the other hotels such as Caesars, or Bellagio.  It gets three stars.

Nice big hotel with comfortable rooms - good for the price if you don't want something cheap and crappy but also don't want to spend a fortune on a room you PROBABLY won't be spending much time in (other than sleeping). My husband and I didn't visit the pool area but as far as the actual hotel goes, we had no complaints!

Do not stay here. Bad restaurants, old small room, bad customer service. Nothing here is worth $300\/ night during memorial holiday weekend. Except the location and the exterior. I should have listen to yelp reviews and didn't book this hotel. NO WIFI only the first and second floor ( which is lobby and spa )No refrigerator, no hair blow dryer.

Which I could do negative stars.  Had the best in Vegas in general!!!  First night in our room on the 7th floor I had a terrible coughing\/sneezing attack where I threw up and couldn't leave the room.  The air conditioner didn't work so after the first night we kept it off.  The last night we were there I went to ask for an oscillating fan, they didn't have one but she sent an "engineer" to let on at our air conditioner.  The picture is what he found.  He told us not to look because it's disgusting!  I snapped a picture and went to complain.  The manager did the bare minimum by offering us $50 room service credit that wasn't available during our stay (we were leaving the next morning) and waived our resort fee that shoulda been waived in the first considering the pool was closed.  We could use a sister pool that was over a mile walk...still unacceptable!!

I am severely allergic to dust and can have an asthma attack because of it that leads to vomiting.  Now, I understand that when I travel the room is never going to be up to my standards...I accept that.  But...when we approached the resort\/hotel manager we asked when the room had been last serviced...she said that she didn't have access to the maintenance records.

For the $50 credit they wanted us to go to another hotel to use it.

I am completely appalled by the level of sanitation this resort provided us.  They are minimum was done, credit for room service couldn't be used and it was overall just completely gross.  It looks like this filter handy been replaced for a year.   Stay at your own risk!!!!

I'm kind of late but I stayed here during EDC weekend and I have to say I was really impressed with the amenities and how awesome this hotel is. The dcor is a little older but the customer service was wonderful. I have stayed at a few hotels in vegas...Vdara, The Venetian...etc and this hotel blew them out of the water. They are nice hotels but honestly I found all the bellmen at the Vdara rude. I will continue to go to the Monte Carlo anytime I'm in Vegas. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

Pros: Lazy river, casino, delicious buffet
Cons: no wifi :(

Decent stay with my wife and kids. Clean room but carpet was a bit it worn. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Air conditioning worked well. My kids loved the pool area. 

The hotel is nice, but when we have stayed at places like the Vdara, the Trump, and Caesars Palace, the Monte Carlo isn't quite up with them. Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed Monte Carlo, but I just can't give it more than 3 stars when the others we have stayed at were probably 4 stars or better. 

No major complaints and we enjoyed our stay here. 

I will say this:  the staff was very friendly. The valet service staff, the bell staff, maintenance personell, etc were all very friendly.

Vegas has become a massive theme park, where each of the mega hotels immerses you in the experience of a vacation in places as exotic as Egypt (the Luxor), as medieval as England in the days of King Arthur (the Excalibur), or as romantic as France (the Paris) or Italy (the Venetian). You can even stay in the urban jungle of Manhattan (New York, New York) or join Dorothy and company on their fanciful journey to Oz (the MGM Grand). For comfort with a touch of Old World Mediterranean grandeur and Riviera luxury, check into the Monte Carlo. All 3,002 guest rooms are spacious, decorated in brown and beige tones, with rich cherrywood furniture, plush carpeting, and Italian marble and granite bathrooms with brass fixtures. Junior suites have a sitting area, dining table and chairs, and an additional half bath. The property's 21,000 square-foot pool area, a tropical oasis where one can escape from the glaring desert sun, features cascading waterfalls, lush landscaping, and a number of swimming pools, including a meandering easy river ride, where one can use an inner tube or raft to float among the towering palms, and a wave pool that recreates the movement of the ocean. There are three tennis courts, lit for night play, and a morning clinic with lessons, ball machine, and racquet rental, and a fitness center, although the $22 per day charge for hotel guests is excessive, in my opinion. As in all major Vegas properties, there is a 24-hour casino, featuring more than 2,100 slot and video poker machines, blackjack, high-limit gaming areas, a poker room, baccarat, roulette, keno, and a full service race and sports betting area. Gamers can receive awards by joining "The One Club," which tracks slot and table play. Dining options include one of the city's most elaborate buffets. Rates start at $79.95 per night, Sunday through Thursday, and $119.95 per night, Friday and Saturday, based on availability. For  reservations, call (888) 529-4828.

Our room smelled like a sewer.  The front desk didn't know why it smelled that way but since it was July 4th weekend, they said they didn't have any other rooms for us . The hotel looks nice on the outside. I'm sure some of the other rooms were nice but ours looked like a Super 8 quality room. Every time I hear the words Monte or Carlo I am immediately reminded of the stench of this hotel.

Just stayed here, first off the rooms are not comfortable. The beds are stiff and I woke up with a back ache, the bathroom is tiny and the food from room service was disgusting. (We ordered a pizza) There was some issues with the bill at the end of our stay so when we called to speak to someone about it the hold was eternal til a representative got on the line and of course they did NOT help us with the issue at all. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL!!!

This hotel wasn't anything out of the ordinary, just your standard bed, and tv nothing else, coming from staying at the Aria, the monte carlo just doesn't hold up to it, for the price I paid, staying at the luxor was a lot better and cheaper. but the casino floor and fast food resturaunts were pretty close to the elevator to the rooms, ill give them that.

One of our family favorites hotel and casino. Friendly staff, well kept rooms and the pools are fabulous. Lazy river is our favorite.  Center of the strip and easy access to many shops. Had a great time and will continue to book here.

Very disappointed with the rooms. Decor tired and bed uncomfortable. Casino very slow 
Stayed here 4 years ago and was very impressed... What happened?!?! Sports book disappointing too

March 2016- Nice hotel in a good location. Clean and lots of food\/shopping options. The gym is better then most resorts. I would do 4 stars but I would expect a little more for what I was charged. If it was $30 per night cheaper it would deserve 4 stars. I am staying here due to a work conference but would not mind bringing my family here. There is a lot of construction going on outside this hotel but it is not an issue.  I don't gamble so I can not comment on pros and cons of the casino. Pool area has lots of options. Wave pool. Lazy river. Large spa.

Got a text that my room was ready. When I put my keycard in and entered the room, I was greeted w\/ a scene from a party scene and orgy that lasted for days. I saw empty and half-filled glasses, empty beer bottles that surrounded the beds, and bed sheets so messed up, it would be shocking and devastating if no orgy took place. 

The room I got after I went downstairs to ask them WTF were they thinking when they texted me? I did not need my room comped, I did not need an upgrade.. I just needed a room that I paid for. After getting re-assigned, I walked into an outdated room; walls, floors, doors were old, dingy, and had cracks and faded paint. 

The bellhop was nice but it took forever to get my belongings. The outlets were in weird places leaving me w\/ no choice to charge my phone on at the foot of my bed. 

+ free self-parking is always a plus 
+ easy access from the freeway

Never again though.

The hotel is neat and very well priced. The only negatives were that I booked a room with a king bed and found my wife and I in a room with two queens. I called the front desk and they changed my room with no questions asked. In my new room my side lamp didn't work. They didn't wash our glasses after the first night. There was a plate of cream pie lying outside a room in the passage for the entire weekend.  It was never removed.

All in all we had a great time and the hotel is in a great location. Good value for money. 

BTW the latte in Cafe' restaurant is delicious!

Very very disappointed, I usually travel to Vegas about 3-4 times year on vacation with my wife. I've stayed in many different hotel on the strip but I do have to say that my experience at the MONTE CARLO WAS NOT GOOD,

To start, the place needs a more modern Devore in room, the "First room" (I had to switch rooms) the shower head was squirting out water from the sides onto the floor, and the floor tile was falling. Our second room was then missing the iron board. 

The reason I gave one star was because of Gina at the front deck. I our room was next to a building that's under construction and started making ALOT OF NOISE at 5am!!! I went down to front desk and got relocated to another room with the SAME PROBLEMS, bad shower head and falling tile.
 
I'm not too sure if I will ever come back, sad to say, I had heard great things about this place but unfortunately I can't do the same....

I was really nervous about staying here because right after I booked it I came on here and read reviews, and nearly all of them were bad reviews. I was really impressed with my stay though. Parking was only $20 for the whole time there, just use your room key to get in and out of the parking garage. The rooms are very clean too. No fridge though so if that's something you need then you might have to make sure you request a room with one. The only problem we did have was the shower didn't drain very well, but that's honestly not a HUGE deal to me. I even got lucky and got a pretty good view from my room. Overall, pretty impressed with this hotel.

The Monte Carlo is not upscale, but it gets the job done. Cause seriously, who really sleeps in Vegas?

We got two rooms here 3 days, 4 nights and it was truly affordable. Rooms are spacious and clean.

There's a variety of shops, bars, restaurants, and even fast food here.

It was a big plus when the Jabbawockeez were still performing there cause their gift shop was stocked with their t-shirts.

I would definitely stay here again if I was back in town.
Totally BS. I didn't get a ticket at self-Parking and I got charged $30 for lost ticket.

I originally stayed here because it was cheap and because it was for a wedding. I enjoyed it, even though I lost my credit card and fell asleep in the hallway trying to cancel my credit card at 6 a.m. because i didnt want to wake my buddy up who I was rooming with. The staff was cool with my drunken self when they woke me up in the hallway. But I stayed here last week for New Years Eve. I enjoyed my stay here!
Pros:
Cheap
good selection of table games
nice room
walgreens and cvs right next door
easy accessible semi-center strip
working safe in room
friendly staff
late night food court. cause when you are drunk at 4 a.m. pizza and mcdonalds is a great idea!
Two starbucks which is nice (but can one of these hotels get a damn dunkin donuts****)

cons:
food is awful
buffet is really really bad. $30 and you get what chef boyardee would consider a bad meal.
Can't move shower head, really annoying!
Both times I stayed here did not go into the pool, last week cause it was too cold!
I enjoy this hotel because it's cheap. and honestly I was not in my room a lot except for the last night cause I started to not feel good.
But I would go back here again!

Pros...hotel has 3 pools ..lazy pool,  wave pool, and regular pool.
Djs are lots of fun and interact with crowd alot. Rooms are decent. Hotel was clean, elegant and modern. Parking was spacious.

Con...hotel is next to tmobile arena and if you have a vehicle and there's an event going on....you better be prepared to deal with horrrrible traffic. It took us 45 minutes to get back into hotel and if you have kiddos under 7yrs old......45 minutes is a longggg time.

I would absolutely stay here again.

I'm starting this off review with s dose of reality. You are in Vegas. A decent room for a decent price is what you'll get here.  Are the walls a bit thin? Maybe. Will they need to renovate in a few years. Yes. However I found the customer service from valet parking guys to check in\/out to bellmen was stellar! Very nice and helpful.  If you want super luxury in ALL areas go somewhere else. I feel some of the bad reviews are from people who don't travel a lot or have mixed up expectations about what make a place good. It's the people mainly.

Stayed at the Monte Carlo for our anniversary. .the casino not bad, the restaurants amazing,  location great, room was an absolute nightmare and couldn't get management to do anything about it...called multiple times an nothing done other than told they would fix the shower soon...I will stay elsewhere mu next visit

Everything I could ask for in a low\/mid-priced Vegas hotel. A mid-week stay during the summer was only like $50\/night. Central location on the Strip, with easy parking and not having to get stuck in Strip traffic. Room was large and clean with no issues; not fancy like other hotels but gets the job done. Food court with plenty of cheaper options (McDonald's, Starbuck's, Chinese, etc.), as well as a wide variety of nicer restaurants. The $50 food voucher that came with our reservation was only good for maybe half a dozen places. Loved the big gym that had lots of cardio machines, weight machines\/free weights, and fresh lemon water; unfortunately very limited hours since it is located in the back of the spa. Large pool with floating river was also a nice perk. Only cons I can think of is long lines at registration and elevator.

Listen, I'm EXTREMELY picky with just about everything in life, but this hotel is great. The beds are SUPER comfortable, the staff all were very helpful and accommodating and the rooms are clean. Hey, it's not the grandest of hotels, but it's great for the money you spend. I'm currently wiggling my toes on the lovely bed and enjoying very clear TV on a flat screen. Did a little work earlier using their WiFi and took a tram in their lobby to the Bellagio. Winning for sure. I took away a star for them not having a fridge or microwave in the normal double queen bed rooms and a couple of bubbles on the wallpaper. Other than that, it's groovy and I'll definitely be back!

We really enjoyed our stay here and, considering this is an "older" hotel on the strip, we really have very few complaints. Our room was of average size - it was nice but nothing elaborate. The location on the strip is fantastic and the shutte is a nice plus. The pool had its grand opening and we really enjoyed the set up of the pool with the sand volleyball court and the lazy river. The negatives are small - they searched out bags when we went to the pool - a first for me in a Vegas hotel and not for weapons. The search was for outside food and beverage - I don't know...seems a bit excesive to me and makes them look like a bigger cheapskate than the person who brings in a bottled water. The second negative was the fact that the casino smelled like a dirty Depends. We couldn't walk thru it fast enough! I would stay here again for the locaton alone. Not new and fancy, no award winning shows or restaurants, and no wifi (seriously - r u in the stone ages), but functional, clean and central. Wasn't in my room much anyway...

Oh...the resort fee? Silliness. I knew in advanced that I'd be charged but really? What exactly did I get for it? Resort fees are super passe and they need to get over themselves.

Do not stay here! This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Las Vegas. After noisy housekeepers constantly banging everything in every room around you... the rooms are plain and ugly... they make you pay a resort fee and don't even provide wifi (wire Internet only)... I left my expensive bathing suit in the restroom after checking out and called that same night and everyday after that to then have them finally say that it was never found...the trash compactor was right outside our room and started blasting its horrendous sounds beginning at 7am....and so much more! I cannot say anything good about our stay here!! Never again!!

For what is starting to become an annual family trip to Sin City, my mother wanted to stay at the Monte Carlo for the second consecutive year. My mom's rationale for the move was that it was cheap but I would argue there are more better rates along the strip. My experi nice this year was less then stellar. We were given rooms on the fourth floor and they didn't even ask if we wanted a connecting door for my two reservations and how many key cards. The room was not set up as advertised.We didn't have bottled water and they skimped on the sugar and creamer for the coffee. My parents' room next door didn't even have a television remote. The water pressure in the shower was lackluster and availability  of hot water unpredictable. Without a Do Not Disturb sign, housekeeping came in while I just got out of the shower.the morning of checkout, the kiosk in the lobby was not working. I think given our experience this year, the 'rents should be willing to fork out more moolah for a heightened experience in a newer hotel next year.

My stay was sunday thru wed. I was looking forward to the pool area with the music sound system. However the DJ only plays weekend. When I went to the pool on Monday the crowd there was ready for the party because on vacation everyday is the weekend. I didn't expect a DJ but the workers there were unable or allowed to operate the volume control knobs on the power amps thus unable to turn the music up and channel to different wall mounted speakers. I think perhaps train a few employees how to work the volume controls, when the crowd dictates.

The Monte Carlo would have received a better rating when I stayed there a few times a few years ago, but during my 3-year MC hiatus, the rooms have gotten beat up and in need of a serious update.

There are still a few upsides to the place:
- Excellent mid-strip location: next to the new City Center and NYNY, and walking or tram distance to all kinds of other good stuff.
- Seems to be about the cheapest place on the strip without dipping into the potentially nasty category of rooms (yes, we're talking about you, IP and Luxor).
- Lazy River and "Wave Pool" (more of a slosh-pool) are fun for summer, although the corrugated steel backdrop from the City Center ain't pretty, even if it does shield you from the Vdara Death Ray,
- Staff is all-around super cool, except for the check-in girl, who wouldn't take my $20 bribe, er, tip to upgrade my room. 
- Diablo's (see my review on that fun place) and The Pub.

And about those downsides:
- That beat-up room:  scratches on the wall, fading carpet, dinged-up furniture, and in 2010, can we at least graduate from the 19" old-school Trinitron to something HD?
- $8.50 Bud Light at the pool? 
- Bag inspections for contraband while entering the pool area.  I think the staff is aware that people make take measures to avoid a $8.50 alumibottle of glorified water.
- The "resort charge" nonsense, which gets you all the USA Todays and local phone calls you can handle.

For a pretty basic and last-minute Vegas trip, like my last one, the MC works, but doesn't work as well as it once did.

If you are looking for a plain vanilla hotel on the strip at an average price...this is your girl. I know they have some shows there , but there doesn't seem to be anything that cool going on there. Loved there being a CVS across the street.

I have nothing bad to say about it, but I have nothing great to say about it.

The buffet had bottomless mimosas...hooked the waiter up with $10 (yeah I know baller hahah) straight off the bat (and $10 afterwards) and he kept them flowing quickly. 

Certainly isn't the worst place to stay in Vegas.

As you pay a resort fee per day you will get internet and gym included in your stay.

This is my second time staying here and the reason why we keep coming back?  Price.  It's not a bad place to stay but like Chelsea P. said, it's a "little mundane".  The room was adequate and clean.  
The pool area has got a regular pool, a lazy river pool, and a wave pool.  Be sure to stake your spot especially if it's a holiday weekend. (We went for the 4th of July and good Lord, it seemed as if every inch of the pool area was filled.)  However, it's a good place for people watching.  The food court is pretty convenient for a morning pick-me-up or lunch.  Right now, there is some heavy construction going on next door so the walk from MC to Bellagio is a loooong, covered concrete walkway.    I would consider coming back again but would like to check out the other hotels.

Our room was all the way in the back, so our view was construction, not the strip, lol! But it's okay didn't come to vegas to sit in the room. Smells like cigs as you walk through the casino but once I stepped off the elevator on the 6th floor, it smelled so clean. Our small little room was also very clean and smelled so good. The beds & pillows were comfy! House keeping was so nice & freshened up our bathroom & gave us enough extra's for 3 ladies! I would stay here again because it's in a prime location right in the  of the strip!
Always amassing, costumer service AAA better than Mandalay Bay and other 5 stars (sic).

Paid a lot for a nice room with jacuzzi bar living room. The bathroom lights didn't work the bathtub was stained. We wen though 30 keys none of them worked. Stains on towels and bedding. And the worst is the Internet wifi did not work at all. So I ended up getting a 500 dollars bill from my phone company. This place is older the casinos are awful the food choices and shopping are bad. Just choose anywhere else to stay it's not worth it.

I was in Vegas for work and extend my stay for a personal vacation. I was staying at Aria for the event, but moved to the Monte Carlo because it was much cheaper. Though not as modern as some Vegas hotels, this hotel was very nice for the price and location. Tip - book through the website. It was cheaper for me than calling them - don't know why. If I go back I would stay at this hotel again.

*did not stay here* we walked through the Monte Carlo to get to other destinations, I do not understand how anyone could stand the perfume smell there. It looks like a really nice place but that smell made us sick.. We tried to hold our breaths till we could make it back outside. Again.. Beautiful hotel, if they would get rid of that perfume smell it would be great.

Stayed here for the first time 2 years ago.  Like the pool but with all the construction from City Center it is a bit to be desired.  The wife and i had fun though, and we enjoyed being centrally located.

I loved staying here on my first trip to Vegas. The location really can't be beat. It is smack in the middle of the whole hotel scene. The walk to Bellagio is very easy, and they also have access to the air tram. 

The rooms were very nice, and I never had any problems with room service or cleanliness. I loved that there was a food court. Made it very easy when we wanted a quick bite before going out for the day, but didn't want to spend a lot of money or time. 

Check in and out went quickly. The only thing that would have been nice was more night life in the hotel. Thankfully, it is attached to The Aria, which had some nice bars with amazing margaritas and mojitos. 

For the price and location, I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again.

I've always loved Monte Carlo, less the time we spent there during renovations after their fire a few years back. The rooms are always clean and in good taste--no cheesy Vegas haunt here! They are always decently priced...not my favorite of the casino\/hotels but it will do for a quick trip and you can't beat the centralized location!

We stayed one night Oct 6th.  Arrived at shortly after 1pm.  There was a line 10 deep to check-in.  There were  about 10 agents checking in people.  The line moved quickly.  Room was a standard room-decent size and clean.  Pools were great, 3 pools and a jacuzzi.  Tons of chairs for both those who want the shade or sun.  Casino is average size, not too big, not too small- with a wide variety of games.  Access to the strip was very convenient. Kids loved "Licks", the candy store on the property.  Food court was convenient for a quick bite.  Overall, the property was great.  

ps-used myvegas reward for the one nighr comp, which was easy to redeem-once u get the email, u call and book ur room.  u will not receive a confirmation email, which i thought was odd, but all went well!

This is our first time staying here and our LAST!
First off I called the day before to let them know we would be a late check in and I verified that we would have a king bed, they said yes.  So we finally get here and check in and go all the way up to our room and it was not a king... I called down to the desk and was told that asking for a king is just a "request " and if I wanted to upgrade then it was a $10 per night fee...I was never told this at booking or when I called the night before. My husband said let's change to the king... not happy but exhausted I agreed and we went all the way back downstairs and get a new room. We come up to the room and it is the nastiest room. The bathroom is a joke, poor shower pressure since half is filling the tub, table and other furniture damaged,  the mirror coming off the wall. For the money we spent I expected  more.  We have stayed a Best Westerns that are way better. Total disappointment. Monte Carlo should be ashamed!

Today is our last day here at the Monte Carlo. We had purchased a Southwest Vacation Package, and this hotel was one of our choices. We went moderate priced since we here such a short time, but man, I won't be doing that again.  Something I expect and I can live with. Such as a long line to check in, etc.  The front desk staff was friendly, but I feel that they are obliged to leave details out of what is going on at the hotel.  No pool, construction.  Our room was missing chairs to sit in. No coffee or mini fridge, pretty much a tv and a bed.  While I understand that the hotel is renovating, they are obligated to let their guests know before they arrive, what is happening at the hotel.  You can't call it a resort.  It's more like a hi-rise travel lodge.  Very disappointed, and it was my first time to Las Vegas ever.  I don't know if it's worth coming back for mediocrity, and bad tasting food. And add more $5 tables.  You'd have more people sitting in them.   

Laurie

It was our first stay in Monte Carlo; we liked the moderate price and the free buffet deal that Expedia threw in. Our check-in experience was smooth, but the room was just ok: a chair had an obvious hole in it, and the bathtub needed to be replaced; no mini fridge in the room is definitely a disadvantage in LV heat. No wi-fi, just the slow internet at the desk, which means no favorite shows in bed. Don't think the hotel deserves the 4 stars... I'm not quite sure why they charge $22.00 a day resort fee, cuz it definitely didn't feel like a resort. Perhaps if we tried their pool we would have been blown away, but something tells me probably not.  

Now to a very big unpleasant incident, for which my friend insisted I gave the hotel 1 star. When I opened the curtains to enjoy the view from the 25th floor, I saw... women's panties in the corner of the window seal. Yep, somebody had fun times, but it was definitely TMI for us. And the evidence of poor cleaning services. They sent someone up to clean the room and waived our "resort fee" as a courtesy for inconvenience, but will we be coming back? Me thinks no!

I've been to Vegas several times and like to try new hotels to mix it up. 

For being Monte Carlo I was expecting a little more. I stayed in a standard room for a birthday weekend. They gave us a handicap room, which we did not request and got stuck with. So everything was very "accessible." Not a happy camper.
The location is not bad, walking distance to just about everything in the main strip. The rooms were clean and standard and the view was OK. The room walls were a little thin. I could hear the showers going off and some noises going on in the other rooms. 

Diablo's Bar is cool to check out----they have the greatest Nachos ever. 
Overall the casino and rooms are just average. 

Check in and check out was a breeze. Staff was friendly as well.

Checked in on Friday, December 26 - Checked out Monday December 29.. I will never ever stay here again.  Our restroom was gross!!! Mildew all around the tub, the wall was falling apart....
