Towels that were there were stained with black and to top it off our bathroom sink was clogged!! No point calling to complain was left on hold forever.  I will never stay at this hotel and I would not recommend to any, you would think for being a hotel right on the strip it would be up to date however NOPE!
Very outdated rooms. Stayed at one of the suites and the furniture was old. Not a bottle of water or coffee machine provided. The construction noise is horrible. Will never come back to this place.

This is the worst Vegas hotel experience I've ever had.  We came here for my husband's 40th birthday and paid over  $200 per night to listen to non-stop construction noise, have no pool, and a slow drain.  When we talked to the front desk, all they offered was $80 off.  Apparently the fine print said "under construction", I guess that's supposed to cover the fact that we didn't sleep and had to take our family down to Mandalay to swim...would never come back here to stay, even when construction is finished.

Horrible first impression, still staying here but thought i'd write this already.  Do not stay here while they are completing construction,  very loud is an understatement!  The noise sounds like they are working in the room next door. On top of that, room and\/or hallway smells of marijuana. You can also hear people next door to you or passing in the hall way. Not staying here again even when the construction is over.  

We were also told by noah at the front desk that the construction does not happen on the weekend, well that was a BIG LIE. I'm up at 5am saturday morning because of all the NOISE! Hope I'll last 4 nights and 5 days.  NEVER AGAIN!

Stayed in the 11th floor in room 334. No view of strip but the beautiful mountains. Great service - as always. Monte Carlo has won me over with food selection, amenities, location, and price. Great job!

Check in was easy and fast. Navigating this place (drunk) is insane though! The hotel main area is relatively small and the quick dining options are REALLY limited and not that great (McDonald's is the best place in the area). I really didn't like the $25\/night "resort" fee considering the place had NOTHING to do in it that was worth it! "Brand" nightclub was lame and not on par with the other nightclubs in LV at all. 

The room itself was great, though. The beds were extremely comfy!

The way I judge a hotel is, would I stay here again.  My answer is yes.  It has a great location, it is arguably in the middle of the strip.  The casino is nice, has a nice number of restaurants and cheap eats places.  Self Parking was very convenient and valet was great, the high level room we had was very nice.  We paid extra and got a room at the 31st floor with a great view of New York New York and based on other reviews I don't think the rooms are used as much.  I would suggest to pay the extra $15 and get the high floor rooms. The bed was fantastic- having a bad back many hotel room beds suck and here the mattress was as good as I have at home.  The pool also was very nice.  The bar at the front of the casino was great we used coupons that the casino gave us and the bartender comped our drinks because we were playing video poker.  I did have to tell the hooker that sat next to me  I was married - but hey that's Vegas.

The problem with the Monte Carlo comes down to the fact that it is almost twenty years old and the rooms need a makeover.  It was obviously a luxury hotel when it opened but by todays standards not so much; that said it is still a very nice hotel and would stay here again.

My worst experience here was at the breakfast buffet.   I used some MyVegas points for a free buffet and got in the high roller line to get in because at the Bellagio that was the line they told me to get in to when I got lunch the day before.  The cashier at the Monte Carlo snarled at me, and treated me like I committed a felony.  When I pointed out that the Bellagio policy she was indignant and told me that at the Monte Carlo they are different or something that she couldn't verbalize.  She should be fired for her attitude, don't remember her name but it did ruin my breakfast which thank goodness I didn't pay for because the buffet wasn't very good.  Comparing this buffet to the Bellagio's is like comparing McDonalds to a Michelin starred restaurant.

The Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino is a bit run down. The lobby is nice, however there were no wash cloths in our bathroom. The odd thing was that no one bothered to replenish our room with wash cloths. The next day. I contacted housekeeping and they eventually sent some one up to put in fresh towels and wash cloths. The person who cleaned our bathroom said that the hotel didn't have enough wash cloths and towels for every room. That was such an odd thing  for a hotel not to have enough towels and and wash cloths. The ice maker was broken on our floor. I had to go to another floor to find ice. The bed comforter was way too hot for this time of year. The furniture is a bit run down with nicks and bruises. I was surprised there was no refrigerator in our room. That's usually a norm in a hotel. This morning people were on wires scaling the side of the building. Oddly they weren't cleaning the windows outside. I was on the 22nd floor. I had enough sense to to make sure I was properly clothed once I saw the wires. My question is...why didn't the Hotel tell us that people would be peeking in our windows? This hotel really needs a good manager.

This is my favorite hotel to stay at when I'm "slumming it".  My actual favorites are the Wynn and Bellagio, but when I want to save some dough, the Monte Carlo is the best place to be.  They frequently have promotions where you can stay for as little as $60 a night along with vouchers for free food, drinks, etc.  The rooms are comfortable and clean and there's a CVS conveniently located right next door so you don't have to pay an arm and a leg for drinks, snacks, toiletries, etc. as you would if you'd purchased them at the hotel convenience store.  I pretty much agree with all of the positive things other users had to say about this hotel.  

Minus one star because they charged me double for internet because we had 2 laptops.

This was my first time staying here.  It had reasonable rates and the location was good, so I thought why not.

The rooms are not that nice, out dated and I hated having to stare at the ironing board leaning against the wall.  They missed cleaning the room on the first day, but sent someone up after I called.  The pools are nice but small, it was not too crowded since we were there mid-week, I would hate to see it on a busy day.

If you are doing Vegas on a budget, this is a good choice.

First trip to vegas. check in was long but they acknowledged the wait and waived 2 days of the resort fees. It's nice and the location is good.  Can tell it's an older hotel.  The pool area is nice if weather permits.  didn't like the fact that they tack on a resort fee of $33 per night, however, in order to use the spa facilities, you have to pay an extra $25 per day.  I thought that's what the resort fees are for?

***Never Again***

We have been coming here for over 10 years and this is the last time we will check in.  

This hotel was great 10 years ago but the last two years during the past visits have been a below expectations.  

No fridge
No free water
Sheets with holes


Today's visit is a complete disappointment.  

The bed we got is old and the head portion was caved in from the rest of the mattress.  We called it in and requested to switch rooms only to be told there were NO ROOMS available. 

Instead we were offered a plywood board to prop up the bed.  The person came 45mins after we called and even he was apologetic that he could not solved the problem. 

We called again to let the front desk know of the status.  This time a room was available but on the 3rd floor.  Our room, the one we paid for, is on the 24th floor with a decent view.  Now we are offered a choice of going to the 3rd floor for a "better" bed but it was not guaranteed.  

We told the person that we will not move to the 3rd floor and we are disappointed with this visit and will no longer check in to the hotel in the future trips to Las Vegas.

Stayed 4 nights at the Monte Carlo just last week and I do not have not one complaint! For everyone complaining about stains and smells and all this other extra petty stuff come on! You are not staying at the Four Seasons!!! However, the Monte Carlo is a decent hotel that was clean, comfortable and had staff that was very friendly. If you are looking for fancy rooms and marble beds go and pay $500 a night or more and stay at the Caesars Palace or The Venetian. When I book a hotel room, I look for a comfortable bed and cleanliness. I found that here at the Monte Carlo! The staff is outstanding, I must say. At any moment that I needed anything housekeeping was always available and met my needs. The casino dealers and attendants were also super friendly and attentive to my needs. Check-in went smoothly as well as check out. As a matter of fact when I first went up to my room on the 23rd floor I discovered they had given me a hotel room with a Strip view which was awesome enough. The Bell desk was helpful with car rental and holding my luggage until I was ready to leave the hotel since my check out was way earlier then my flight was. Waiting for an elevator was not a problem either . I never waited not more than one minute for an elevator to come . Yes, there was some construction going on but nothing that stopped a show or ruined your night or day. I don't understand why people will complain about Construction because how else will they continue to improve the hotel and make it nicer! The location of the hotel was perfect and there were plenty of eateries, bars, and attractions nearby. While the hotel rooms may seem a little dull... please keep in mind that coming this fall they are upgrading the Monte Carlo to be the new "The Park at MGM". There will no longer be a Monte Carlo and upgrades will be in place. In the meantime if you're looking for a nice place to stay , I definitely recommend the Monte Carlo!

Hotel was pretty over priced for everything it consisted of. Purchased the deluxe queen and upgraded for 60 bucks for a better view. View was okay. Moths filled our room and it was very disturbing. When the house cleaners came they did nothing about it either. Pretty much you only get two small cups which sucks for if you want to pregame. The lock on the bathroom was broken which isn't that big of a deal just seems kind of trashy. I'll add an extra star for location but cleanliness and overall experience was pretty poor. Ps I hate moths

I have stayed at several hotels in Vegas and consider this my favorite, though it is not perfect.  It has a good location on the Strip, not far from the airport, by a bus stop.  It has a 24-hour food court and is across the street from Denny's.  The rooms are large, and I have always found the water hot and plentiful.  I have never had a problem with noise.  It often offers a food promotion.  
What are the negatives? It charges a $20 "resort fee" that is a total ripoff.  It sometimes charges an early check-in fee.  It does not have free wifi in the rooms but does in the lobby.  On my last visit housekeeping did not leave enough washcloths and towels for two people.  The food court is too noisy in its music.  The pool sometimes closes at 5 pm.
I would stay there again.
One of the best Casinos on the strip! My favorite was playing the big table baccarat with the virtual dealers. That was so much fun!

I write this review, not as a young party animal, but as a budget-conscious mom w\/ a family to take around. If you are a young party animal, then the Monte Carlo might not be the most bangin' place, not the most upscale (although, personally, I think the place is quite adequate).

But if you are a soccer mom or dad who wants to take the fam bam to Vegas and you want to stay on the Strip, then Monte Carlo is a viable option for you! They have a lazy river and wave pool that the kids will love. My little ones hardly eat, so taking them to a Las Vegas buffet is often not the most economical thing to do, as you will not get your money's worth, given how they eat like birds. But at Monte Carlo, not only do you have the standard buffet fare, they have a food court in the premises that will suit many a child's dining needs, such as Subway, Sbarro, Rubio's, Starbucks, and some Chicken Tenders place.

Then, if the kids want to try something else, there are other places to eat outside the Monte Carlo that is just within walking distance, like Denny's, the Hard Rock Cafe, Fatburger, and the Hawaiian Marketplace ain't that much further away. The M&Ms store is just across the street and is often a hit with the little kids.

And you're just next door to New York, New York, if the kiddos want to ride their rollercoasters. And the MGM is just at the corner. You can walk to enough places if you don't want to deal with the hassle of driving through a lot of pedestrians and general traffic, unless you want to head to the northern Strip (in which case, grab a Lyft or Uber).

wont stay here again.

we reserved a king bed non smoking and when we show up they dont have any, but they looked alitte harder in there computer and found one. We get to our room and right when you open the door it smells like nasty cigarettes. we called to complain right away to get us another room and there was nothing they could do but send up house keeping to spray the room which didnt help that much. we left the window opened all weekend and the fan on. and like someobody else said, it is a boring hotel compared to others.

Every time I've visited Las Vegas I've stayed at the Monte Carlo. That being said I've always like it here.This time unfortunately I can say I won't be back. The construction is too much to handle, loud banging and no pool(which we were looking forward to) combined with terrible conditioned rooms(the wall heater cover fell off out of nowhere and struck one of my friends). And after complaining there was no effort on the side of the hotel to try to accommodate us better. Really sad because I wanted to keep coming here.

The hotel is on the strip,which was great. I've stayed at different hotels on the strip before and yes I agree with other reviews here that the decor is outdated when compared to other hotels on the strip. However, due to the fact that we spent our time outside the hotel engaging in different activities,the location and price worked great for us. We had no problems with our room, housekeeping did a great job in keeping our room clean. The pool area was great as well. If you plan on being out and doing different things on the strip and just need a place to rest and get ready and you don't mind the outdated decor then this is a good place to stay.

Terrible experience. Saturday night on the floor server gives me shit about how I need to be gambling to order drinks. Who do you thinks paying your wages? I paid for the room and I gave GF $1,000 to blow on the floor. Will not be staying here again.

I have mixed reviews about this hotel. I like it, but there are a few things that I just can't let go of. Where do I begin....

I love the lobby here, it gives off a wonderful aura that is Vegas in a classy way. Lots of patrons there to check you in and check you out and they are extremely nice and courteous. My complaint lies with their policy that they cannot guarantee you the exact room that you put a deposit on. My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday. Vegas is a favorite city of mine. He is a smoker, while I am not, but I know the importance of needing to have a smoking room while you are staying at a Vegas hotel. Not sure why Vegas is adapting the California non smoking laws, but it is what it is. When we arrived to check in, we were told that there were no more spa suite rooms on smoking floors. My husband was furious as he should have been. It's such an inconvenience to have to go down to the casino to smoke one cigarette. We called in a manager and he was very nice and apologetic. He offered to upgrade us, but we wanted to spa suite because the spa was in the window overlooking the strip, not in a bathroom. Needless to say, our room was not available, but by the grace of God, a room that was not showing up in the system because it was out of order to to carpet shampooing popped up. We took it. We were given a $100 food and beverage credit from the manager, which was very appreciated and definitely was used while we were there.

The spa suite was large and spacious. A full bar (not stocked, but I love it when there's a fridge so I can chill my water bottles), separate toilet from the rest of the bathroom, comfortable bed, nice television and the spa was right in the window. The spa was right in the window....overlooking the airport and freeway. Totally sucked, but we did get the room that we wanted. The walls are paper thin here. We could hear the neighbors tv on which seemed to never be turned off, and we could hear anytime a neighbor flushed their toilet, showered and we could totally hear the loud bang every time the toilet stopped running after someone flushed. It woke me up a ton of times throughout the night.

Other things I'd like to mention:

Parking structure is easy to get to, ample parking. and totally easy to find your way to and from the hotel from the structure. The mall inside here was great. They have just about everything. Starbucks that is in this hotel is one of the larger ones I've come across in Vegas and they have a good selection of food there as well, we actually found an Italian restaurant here that we ate at both nights we were there, it was delicious (d.vino)!. Clean casino and it didn't reek of cigarettes and booze. I would totally stay here again as long as we were guaranteed the room we booked. A tip that the manager told us: call the day before you're coming so they can block that room out for you so it will be guaranteed.

I can sum it up in one word... Lame!!!!!!  Nothing really happening at this Hotel.. tables are overpriced and you may get t know your dealer to well just for lack of having another person to have a convo with.  Almost no night-life if it wasn't for the late-night cleaning crew that came out to jam..   A pretty un-memorable hotel.. for the price you can do much better!

4 stars for the price and location...Had spa suite with incredible view of city center, strip and pool. 0 stars for cleanliness as our room had mold around spa tube and an item I shall not mention stuffed between the couch cushion.  Thank God my wife didn't see it as she would have been physically ill.  We never sat on the couch after that.  Staff was great and very helpful although I have not mentioned our room matters to them yet.  Pool was o.k but cramped and the lazy river was just too small to attempt to navigate the kids on a Thursday afternoon, I'd hate to see it on a weekend.  Very smokey place and just not kept up like it should be.

To much construction work going on. It was just suppose to be the pool but seems to be all over the hotel. The room is nice can't complain but I didn't come to Vegas to be in my room. You can't walk the hotel because to much stuff going on

Stayed here for a weekend trip to Vegas. Location isn't awesome, but it's close enough to the popular places on the strip so you can walk (Ladies - it's a bit of a walk. So be prepared for hurting feet or don't wear heels) but we did use a cab to get to the Venetian. 

Check in was a PAIN! We got there on Friday around 3:30, and it was starting to get busy. We finally got to the front desk, and they said there was a problem with the rooms (we got two adjacent rooms, one across the way, and one was down the hall...) and the guy acted rather snooty. We had to wait while he "fixed" the problem, and we had requested adjoining rooms but he didn't give us that. I was just glad to finally get inside the room! 

Beds were comfortable, A\/C worked, TVs were nice, everything was fairly clean.  My complaint is the shower. It was like a high-powered mist. Takes a few extra minutes to ensure everything is actually CLEAN because of the power of the shower.  Not awesome. Room service was speedy (we were still inside the room when they initially passed by, the lady waited for us to leave and then cleaned it) and we never had to call the front desk for anything extra. The towels did have a strange smell (like burnt?) but I didn't mind it much. 

We stayed here because it is CHEAP compared to the other places on the strip, and all we were doing here was sleeping and getting ready. 

I didn't gamble much (just the slots for the free drinks) so I can't really say much about that. 

OH... if you stay here, definitely check out Diablo's. That place is cool at night. They push the tables out of the way and it becomes a dance floor. Bartenders are fast and make the drinks well... but they abruptly shut down and close around 3AM (I think? Haha). They turned off the music mid-song, turned up the lights, and ushered everyone out. Kind of a buzzkill, but we just moved on to the next place. A good place to start off the night if you're staying here.

Great location since you are next to Aria, NYNY, and MGM.  This area is definitely getting better especially since you have the T-Mobile arena here as well.  

The casino is kind of dark and depressing.  Drink service come extremely slow when you are gambling.  

Rooms are just ok and probably need a makeover.  

Lazy River and wavepool are cool, but kind of gets crowded.
We got a good deal on this place because someone's mom spends a lot of money here. It was your standard LV big Strip hotel, nicer than most. Nothing to complain about.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days. We walked up and down the strip and found this hotel to be one of the nicest. The place is newer and very clean. The inside has one of the nicer casinos. The staff is pretty friendly.

I usually love this place but the fact that they are charging such high prices for summer when their pool is closed is obscene!! No one likes to have to pack up all their things to go to a different hotels pool. Very inconvenient. Not to mention they try to hide it from you by making it in tiny print that their pool is shut down for summer. Robbers.

***This review is for casino only***
We stopped in before a Golden Knights  hockey game and the casino floor is indeed under construction and a lot of machines taken out until the construction is done. However, we still managed to have a lot of fun and though we never expect to win we DO EXPECT to have fun, get efficient cocktail service, have respectful and nice employees, have our money last and that's what we got! The cocktail service was excellent. The employees that we met at their players club, bar, cocktail servers and an executive who stopped by were all super nice. This is our 2nd time visiting this casino and won't be the last and I'm sure when they are done with renovations it will be quite nice!

I visit Vegas several times a year and this weekend was my first time staying at the Monte Carlo. Worst decision ever.  Originally booked a deluxe king room and paid the upgrade fee at check-in for a high room. Immediately disappointed upon entering the room. Carpets were stained and dirty. Air conditioner was sub-par and didn't cool the room. Minimal electrical outlets that were not near the bed which made it inconvenient to charge our phones. No mini refrigerator or coffee pot in the room like every other hotel provides in their deluxe rooms. Minimal TV channel selection. Bathrooms have no fan or heater so the mirrors fog up every time you take a shower and the shower water pressure is terrible. Doors do not have any additional locks inside the rooms for safety when in room or sleeping -- the only lock was the basic keycard which is horrible because that is a basic safety issue.

The price of this hotel definitely does not meet with the accommodations it provides.  In all honesty, I have stayed at remodeled Motel 6 locations on road trips that were 100% better than this 4 star hotel. There are tons of other hotels on the strip that have the same rate and are actually worth the price. I will never stay at this hotel again and do not recommend it.

I recently just came back from my 21st birthday in Vegas. We stayed at the Monte Carlo. At first, I was SUPER nervous about staying here because of all the bad reviews I've seen. But once I entered the hotel, I was at ease. The room was clean and spacious enough. I liked how the hotel had many amenities such as the lazy pool, gym, spa, casinos and shopping center. It gave me and my best friend a lot of choices. Also, I think the Monte Carlo is the only hotel that has a food court (McDonald's, Subway, Starbucks, Sabarros, etc), which is very helpful on those drunk nights. I also loved where on the strip the Monte Carlo was located. The only reason why I am rating it a 4 stars experience is because there is not a fridge or microwave in the deluxe regular rooms. I had to go down to the lobby and ask the manager if I can warm my leftovers up in their microwave. But  for the price I paid to stay on the strip, I would say it is DEFINITELY worth it. Overall, I love the Monte Carlo and will be back to stay there very very soon!!!

Love this place... Not the most expensive place, but it sure served it's purpose.  The pool was great.  It gave my crew and I so much to do while not having to leave our hotel... Love the beach volleyball btw... Location was perfect.  The food court centrally located downstairs was perfect.  Other hotels may be more glamorous but who actually spends an extended amount of time in their own hotel in Vegas anyway.

Will stay here again!!!!

I really like this hotel. It's clean and nice and  located around a lot of fun places. The room was clean and spacious 3 of us girls went and let me tell you the room can feel a little small when you have so many girls in 1 room.  I was there for my sis 21st bday and they offered us late check out for a really low price.. THAT WAS A LIFE SAVER!  It has a good court near the elevators so when we got back from a night full of dancing it was nice to be able to get a slice of pizza with out having  to go far. I really enjoyed my stay here and would totally stay again.

Wish I could select zero stars. 

My husband and I have been staying at the Monte Carlo for years, but NEVER AGAIN. 

Since I was so looking forward to this trip, I was almost in tears once we walked in the door and began to walk around.  There's a big wall\/road block in the middle of the casino and all the gaming tables were moved towards the front of the hotel.  If I had to guess, I would say a little more than half the slot machines are gone.  The card room was gone.  One of our favorites, The Pub, and all the stores in the hall leading to the shuttle and Aria, gone.  When we booked our stay, we were not informed of the construction\/remodel of the hotel.  It felt like we were in an old, dirty motel.  Totally blindsided . . . 

Negative - - The pool was closed (brilliant, it's summer Monte Carlo, if you didn't notice) and they expected you to "Pool Hop" to either the MGM or Mandalay Bay hotels.  Like anyone really wants to travel to a pool, get all wet, sweaty and then travel back to your hotel...this is ridiculous.  Of course they are not compensating the guests for this and are still charging a full Resort Fee.  At this point, calling the Monte Carlo a resort is laughable.  

Another negative - - We completed the online pre-check in that we received the day before arrival since we would be arriving prior to 3PM.  Understood that we might not get to check in early, but they told us to get out of line unless we received an email telling us we could check in early.  Meanwhile, others were in line checking in early.  We never received the email with our room number as promised and ended up waiting over an hour to check in which is totally unacceptable.  Four employees working the Front Desk does not scream excellent customer service.  

Another negative - - NOISE from the construction!!!  Are you kidding me?  We were on the 16th floor and the noise started at 6:00AM.  OMG, no sleep to be had once that started.  It was banging, drilling and vibrations so loud that at times, it was almost impossible to have a phone conversation.  

I will not deny the Monte Carlo needs to be upgraded to compete with all the fancier hotels with the shopping areas.  The guest rooms are sorely in need of upgrades to include outlets for charging electronics.  The carpeting in the entire hotel should be replaced.  The decision they made to do this at the expense of their unwitting guests is inexcusable.  

It might have been better to just close for a few months than to chase away your regular guests and receive an avalanche of negative reviews here and on social media.  You have a rough road ahead to earn back those who were cheated out of our "Resort" vacation and rely on these reviews when making their decision on where to stay.

This Hotel not so popular like others in Vegas , but it's on a Strip !! And we decide our room - Monaco Suite - it was absolutely always perfectly clean and fresh. Resort was nice , but little quiet ... I think this is Hotel definitely for oldest people .

A cheap deal lured me in.  How can I resist? especially since it's directly connected to Aria and a tram takes you to the Bellagio so you can avoid walking in the 105 degree heat.

We were grateful they let us check in at 9am. The beds are comfy enough but the pillows were too firm, even for a side sleeper like me. Even though housekeeping cleaned the room, I feel the bathroom floors weren't properly mopped. I was glad I brought my own toiletries since their soap was too drying on my skin. The towels are yellowed and some of em have that funky smell. Yeah, I know. Ewwww.

Points for the pool area, they had much comfortable pool chairs than the ones at Mandalay Bay. Look for the shaded areas around the Palm trees, you want to get tanned, not fried, especially in scorching Vegas summers.

I do like the fact that CVS pharmacy is nearby for last minute sun essentials. But if you're looking for moleskin, (for all night partying in sky-high heels, THIS is my secret!) go to Walgreens across the street.

The great part about Monte Carlo? the Mickey D's at their food court came through for me when I needed it most. It's a lifesaver! ;)

We stayed in remolded rooms 9 2017.
The safe did not work.
The new air conditioner was not strong enough to actually cool the room during the day.
The water pressure in the new showers was very weak.
and they charged $34 a day for a resort fee while all 3 pools were under construction?
and they charge $10 to $15 a day for parking.

When we brought this to their attention  we expected a discount. None were given

I'm sad to say this hotel sucked, but please read on because there is a bright spot to this dismal review. First the bad: No refrigerator, no microwave, no iPod player in the rooms. We walked in and we're knocked over by the smell of sewer gas in our room and we also had a pervert standing in his undies outside his room two doors down trying to entice passers-by inside. But alas....the bright spot:  DON FROM OAKLAND. This brainiac speaks 13 languages fluently and knows a little something about customer service and making people laugh. Keep on keepin' on Don. U da best!

I just got home from a 2 night stay at this hotel. We had a non-smoking room with two beds; the room was alright except there was a giant crack in the window. I work in hotels, so I know these things are somewhat common, but I'm surprised they would rent a room with a crack that big (maybe lack of communication, but whatever). Our view overlooked an ugly roof, but I didn't care; we weren't there to stare out the window. I was disappointed in the lack of soundproofing between rooms. Our room had an adjoining door with our neighbor, and we could hear everything! It wasn't even like they were being extremely loud (except for the music at 4:30 and 5am), but just them talking came right into our room. I wasn't really impressed with the guest service. The guy who checked us in-- no personality and not very helpful. How are you gonna tell us our room isn't ready but still give us keys and a two hour window? Were we supposed to wait around and hope it would be ready at 3pm rather than 5? The bell person was nice though, and so was the guy who checked us out, so maybe it was just the first guy but he left a bad impression. The pool was nice, crowded of course. I would stay here again. The rates are reasonable and the location makes it easy to get places. People were also saying they liked how the parking wasn't too far from the actual hotel, so that helps.

Monte Carlo is the definition of average. They do some things well, but overall nothing memorable. Sometimes on Yelp a 3 is a 3.5 or 2.5 but this is a solid 3.00, but that's not always a bad thing!

They have a normal food court! People love to go to Vegas party it up, live like rock stars splurge on bottles, clubs, dinners. But at some point cheap and easy is needed. They have a food court with Mcdonald's and Subway and some other fast food. 

At 5 in the morning, when I'm getting back from a casino or club I really don't want to go to a SUPER over priced cafe which will charge me $15 for nachos or an omelette just because choices are limited. Good Job Monte Carlo! When I stay at Aria I definitely walk 1 hotel over to Monte Carlo for a quick bite.

Casino, basic pretty standard, they have enough tables and machines for their customer base. reasonable minimums for their price range too. 

Rooms are standard, nothing fancy or memorable.

They send a good amount of comps too. I've had some weekends where other hotels in its class were full or expensive, and they sent me free comps for that weekend. 

From several stays there, I can recall 1 incident where the front desk took about 25 minutes to check me in, when there was no one else in front of me... they just had no one at the desk. That wasn't too fun.

I haven't seen the Jabbawockeez show so I can't speak on that, but I'm sure it's fall of nice choreography.

If you want to spend a lot of your trip at Aria or Cosmo but don't want to pay the price to stay there, Monte Carlo is a great option to stay at and save some money on cab fare.

Very outdated and appeared very isolated when it came to patrons despite the busy lobby. I booked a corner room suite and it felt like an oversized studio... actually a huge studio! I was not happy at all with the layout and when I waited for my friend to come and go, I kept the door propped open, it was so quiet.. almost too quiet and the atmosphere was eery! I would not stay there again.

Terrible! The hotel (inside) is under construction, not under renovation believe me!!! : it's under construction at this point!!!! They still advertise their pool (main raison why I reserve a room in this hotel was the pool) but I found out at my arrival that their pool is also under construction with no access!!!  and you still must pay the resort fee (+\/- $40 incl. taxes ) + parking! I stayed in August this year 2017. The new room are not even pretty and there is no fridge and no coffee maker.

I reserved a suite and it wasn't available when I came to check in....so they upgraded me for free to the diamond suite. That was awesome. I was meeting friends there and we enjoyed the two bathrooms in the suite as we'll as the jacuzzi in the master bath. The room service was great and gave us extra of whatever we needed (mostly coffee capsules for the coffee machine in the room). The casino is fun and friendly and the poker room is very intimate and easy on newbies. Enjoyed every second.

Elizabeth was our waitress in the poker room. I simply asked for a Bud Light Lime and another guest asked for a scotch and water.  When Elizabeth returned she brought only a bottle of water.  The guest vocalized, "I asked for just a Scotch, just a scotch with a water back."  She walked away without bringing my Bud Light Lime, nor anyone else's drinks at the table.  I don't know who she thinks she is...but she isn't.  This is a casino.  We are gambling BIG money, period.  Your job is to bring us drinks.  I'll never return until she is reprimanded.

If you are generally homeless this is the place for you!  We upgraded to the "best" room and glad we did.  As filthy as it was I would hate to see what the "regular" rooms look like.  The big spa tub was so dirty I wouldn't wash my dogs in it.  The mold in the shower was beyond gross.  No coffee makers!  Really??? They removed them from all rooms on May 8th and have not one "sitting around". Garage sale?????   With the stiff competition in Vegas you'd think they would at least update the rooms.   I think Sammy Davis, Jr. and Frank visited on the couch  Although there was no sign of it I think someone overhauled a motorcycle in the hallway in front of our room.  The carpet could use a Stanley Steamer! The dirt in my back yard is cleaner than the carpets in the hallway AND the room.  Way over priced for what you get.  Very disappointing stay to say the least.

Casino only here, I haven't stayed in the hotel rooms.

I think the interior decor is eh, the dealers were also eh, none too nice, a lot just a bit unattentive (inattentive? nonattentive? you get my point)...

Anyway, I love the location of Monte Carlo, I loved the Beatles Cirque du Soleil and I think their shops are pretty darn nifty, so they're "A-OK" in my book.

AWESOME price for the FANTASTIC location! Love this hotel. Check in was a breeze, friendly staff, and the location is just amazing. We ended up going to the Marquee at the Cosmopolitan one night, and Hakkasan at MGM Grand the next night. Monte Carlo was walkable distance from both night clubs, incredibly convenient not having to pay for any taxis\/Ubers. Lots of great food destinations around, cheap options at the food court straight in front of our hotel. Our room was clean and spacious. Will book again

It was a good place for the deal with our airfare. We decided to stay here because of the deal and because we knew it was in the middle of the strip. We booked the Monaco suite. It was a pretty decent room. My friends and I went together and they were able to accomodate us to have rooms on the same floor level. It was also great because it's connected to the city center. We didn't realize this till our last night there but you can walk through city center and get to Aria. 

I wouldnt mind staying here again but if it were a $100 more than what we paid here, I'd stay elsewhere and at a better casino\/hotel the next time I visit Las Vegas.

NOTE: I am back tracking on some reviews... this is based off of a trip I took July 2008, I wasn't using Yelp then.

This is the first time I stayed at the Monte Carlo (MC) and it wasn't bad. I went with a friend of mine for the 4th of July weekend and she chose the MC because she wanted to relax. The MC is definitely a nice hotel if you want to relax because there are not many "young singles" running around the hotel. There are no clubs\/lounges in this hotel so if you are a "young single" and you're looking for the nightlife, you will definitely have to leave the hotel and go somewhere else.

At check in, the hotel staff was polite and "there for you." I arrived before my friend and she called the hotel to allow me to check in. When I went to check in there were no issues, which was great because sometimes it becomes an issue when you don't make the original reservations. Once I arrived at the room everything thing seem to be in order. The bathroom was a nice size (big enough for me and her to get ready at the same time). The only issue I really had with the hotel was that the hotel windows were filthy. And the view was nice, you could see the MGM Grand among other things; but the windows were dirty. That would be the most negative thing I have to say.

We laid by the pool a good bit and there were two separate pools. The far side pool was a "lazy river" and that allowed you to rent tubes and let the water push you around the course. I would suggest to get to the pool early in order to get pool side seating otherwise you will be SOL; luckily my friend was up early to reserve seats. The hotel does have a food court that allowed you to eat "cheaper" than the average restaurant in Vegas. They have a Subway, McDonalds, Sbarro, Manchu Wok and I think a few others.

All in all the experience was pretty good, But you want a nice hotel without all the noise of night life then the MC would be a good choice.

This is the first hotel i ever stayed in when I turned 21 and came to Vegas. 
It's in a pretty good location but other ten that there isn't much to draw you to this hotel. There are no good bars, restaurants here so it really is just a place to get ready.

Horrible rooms. This hotel is badly in need of a remodel. The bathrooms are awful! There is no cable tv. Don't stay here. And they don't have wifi. I hope you have an adapter for the old school modem cable. Even if you get a discount because there's a seminar being held here, don't stay here.

Recently stayed at the hotel, I arrived around 11pm on a Friday and all I wanted to do was have a speedy check in to rest before gambling and the line to check in took about 45 minutes. The hotel needs to have more employees working to check guest in on busy nights. As i stepped out of the elevator to the 7th floor it was so disappointing on how bad the carpet and elevator doors looked both stained. I thought maybe it was only by the elevators that the carpet looked bad but as I walked down to my room which was the last room of the hallway the carpet was in bad shape the whole way down. I wish I could continue to refer family and friends to stay at the Monte Carlo as I was in the past but after this recent stay I don't know if I would want to refer it if it is not kept up. I took the survey they emailed me and emailed guest relations and they never replied to my comments. Hope that management works on cleaning up the 7th floor. 

I will say the express checkout option that was sent to my email was a nice option and the restaurants choices are good and they have a good variety of slot machines.

-Walls were so thin we could hear an entire conversation from the other side. 
-We did not have a keurig in our room. 
-The window view was of the dilapidated empty pool down below. 
-Besides the bathroom sockets we had 2 total available power sockets for the room to charge our phones. 
- mandatory resort fees included the 2 daily waters, coffee, and drink vouchers for the hotel's cafe and bar. Drinks were only available specific times. Bottled water was gross.
- no wifi in the room. And the wifi available on the first 2 floors did not even work. 
- room service was still cleaning rooms on our floor at 4pm. Check in is at 3.
- use of the business services room was part of the resort fee. But most services from there were not free, but very expensive. Minimum $7 charge for using the internet up to 7 min.
- no fridge.
- the AC turned off on its own in the middle of the night and actually got really hot in the room. Las Vegas was in the 40-50F that night. 

Only perk was the myvegas discount.

Oh man... my second time in Vegas and it's going to be one that I will never forget for too many negative reasons. 

First off, we got to the hotel and checked in. Surprisingly really busy... tons of people seemed to be checking in at 9pm. 

Here comes *strike 1*: we ask the lady at the front desk what the wifi password was. She proceeds to ask us "what password? our wifi is open", so naturally, I went "YES! free wifi in the rooms", when she proceeded to say "oh, no. We don't have wifi in the rooms. We only have wifi in the main lobby here and in the food court". Wiped the smile off my face. Right away. Just a little back story, I wanted to travel light so I traveled with my tablet and I was doing a lot of the social media work remotely. Couldn't really do that now because the internet in the room was only connectable via ETHERNET CABLES! Seriously bro? Ethernet cables? I think the Monte Carlo missed the coming of the digital age because event the Super 8 motel has wireless wifi. LAME SAUCE

Anywhooos, we got our keys and went up to the room. It was your standard room with 2 queen beds, a tv, bathroom- the usual. The beds were very comfy. Bathroom? Meh. It was your average bathroom... nothing that really surprised me. The shower heads were surprisingly VERY powerful, which made me happy. 

Here comes *strike 2*: went down to use the wifi in the main lobby just to make a quick FaceTime call via. I was under the impression that the wifi was going to work because I was told that it only worked in the main lobby and the food court. WRONG. can't even get a decent connection in the main lobby. 

and for *strike 3*: room service takes an awfully long time for low periods during the day. I would call for blankets and pillows at 10pm, when I anticipate that not many people would be calling for these items at that hour of the day, but apparently room service's phone was ringing off the hook because I wouldn't get the items until 45 minutes after I called for them! I also had to remind them that I called... and then they'd finally come. 

I would not stay here again. The location is great, but for the price you pay- so not worth it. A resort fee for internet? There was no internet in my room.
\/end rant.

I tried to enjoy my stay at the Monte Carlo because we were there for the Billboard Awards and it was right across from the T-Mobile Arena. Unfortunately convenience did not make up for the experience. 
Upon arrival, we waited about 30 minutes in the check-in line. We were able to check in early, which was a plus. The rooms, as the hotel, are very dated. When you think of Vegas you think vibrant, fun and young.... that's not what the Monte Carlo is, at ALL! 
The shower kept leaking, it smelled like weed from the room next door and the worst part - the pool was closed. They offered up the pools at MGM but that too was closed one of the days, which was a complete bummer. 
Not only was the hotel a flop but a few days after I got home, I noticed super itchy bug bites all over my body, specifically my feet. I went to the doctor and he confirmed that they are most likely BED BUG BITES. I didn't see any on the beds but I wasn't really looking for them (I will be now) but I was so terrified they came home with me... thankfully, the coast was clear. Just be aware and check your beds before laying down to sleep because the saying "don't let the bed bugs bite" takes on a whole new meaning here.

I stayed at the Monte Carlo this past weekend...and i was disappointed. The rate for the room was pretty good but it's not that great of a hotel when you compare it to the others. I stayed at Paris last year for about the same price and it was wayyy better. I would say that Monte Carlo is more for older people and families. It's kinda boring and isn't as themed as the other hotels. I was also expecting an awesome pool...but it was just okay.  I went over to the MGM pool on the first day in Vegas (Saturday) because the Monte Carlo pool area was so packed. Also they are building a city center...which TOTALLY kills the whole pool experience because you have a ugly view of the on going construction and  its so noisy!!! The room I was staying in had a few problems...the shower didn't work so we had to wait an hour for some one to come and fix it..and then when they finally fixed it the water wouldn't drain. Also whats up with the room lighting? There are only two lamps and no other available lights. It was so dark in there. My friends had to change their room twice because the locks wouldn't work. Also, I guess the walls are paper thin because we could totally hear the people next door getting it on...ew.  I dunno it wasn't thattt bad but I wish I would have just stayed at Paris again and payed the same amount. It's not terrible but it was just very dead and boring and def. not someplace to stay if your young.

Not clean!!! I would never stay there again or recommend this place.
The only thing nice I can say is that the staff was friendly and thank God at least our beds were clean.  BUT once we were on our floor--disgusting!  The hallway carpets were really dirty (even the walls were!), and once inside our room we found a total of three towels, HAIR in the shower and the glasses in the bathroom were so dirty they had a coat of dust inside them.  Even worse, there was trash in the hallway, trash in one of the elevators and someone on our floor had ordered room service and no one ever picked up the tray or the dishes!  We checked out this morning and there was the SAME tray with day-old food at the end of the hall-- it had been there all night!  That is so disgusting and really quite unbelievable, especially in Vegas in what is supposed to be a fairly nice hotel.  Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!  It's not that much cheaper than anyplace else, I'd rather have spent more for a nice, clean room!

I wanted to thank the staff for being so helpful. I dropped my purse in a cab and they immediately helped me figure out what cab company it was (Whew!!) and had the phone number handy and let me call them. Melanie at Yellow Checker\/Star cab the dispatcher located our driver and he was back in less then 10 minutes with my bag. Very lucky to have had such concerned and helpful people in a bad situation. Thank you everyone that assisted in the effort. I really appreciate it.

Check in was terrible as it took so long and then I get to the room and can't get it cool enough. Stay out that night and come home but can't sleep over the sound of construction. I also got to learn my neighbors shower habits as the plumbing through the walls is so loud. And then on my final night, something falls from the ceiling or picture frame, and guess what...pincher bugs. They waived the resort fees...how nice of them considering I lost a night of sleep due to bugs and the fact that it's not a resort. When I informed the staff, I was told in these exact words...what do you expect, it's the Monte Carlo. When I asked what they meant, they said that it's like Excalibur in quality in that it's about 22 years old. Never again! I want my money back

I have to give this hotel it's props.  Our room was very nice and clean.  Monte Carlo was on my list of hotels I want to stay in.  So far, I have stayed at Excalibur, Flamingo, Treasure Island, Harrah's & Tahiti Village (my cousins timeshare).  The timeshare and Treasure Island have been the best.  Flamingo, I would never stay again.  Monte Carlo I would definitely stay again.  

The casino and everything about the hotel was a nice experience.  I enjoyed the buffet.  But my favorite is the Bellagio.  I have tried numerous buffets, but Bellagio stands out.

My next adventure will be the Venetian.  

I flew Allegiant Airlines for the first time.  We were 45 minutes late getting to Vegas.  And, in Vegas every minute counts.  I almost forgot to mention that I won $ 476.00 at the Palms Hotel & Casino.  

I was not at all impressed with the Rio.

But if you get a chance, try Monte Carlo.  The staff is great, and they try to help you as much as they can.  You get a $35.00 food & beverage credit.  Use it!!!   

The quesadillas at "The Pub" are great!! And so are the Mai Tai's.

This hotel is listed as family friendly and that alone is what would make me return to this hotel. You park your vehicle and the lobby is connected to the parking structure so theres no need to travel through all the second hand smoke with kids. Next time I'm in Las Vegas if I don't have the kids I will not be booking this hotel. If the kids are with me then I will and I'm aware there's better hotels on the strip to book but this hotel is very convenient to settle into. I can't rate this hotel any higher as I found it to need remodeling; furnite is old, we found one pillow with a stain-it would appear the maid just flipped over the pillow, there was a pubic hair in the sink. Overall this casino is not as luxurious as it sells itself. In my opinion the Luxor is about the same as far as condition and for a little less money.

I understand that mishaps can happen, but what I found here was horrible.

1) My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day and were thoroughly displeased. First of all,  I took a shower before I getting ready for dinner, and the shower pressure was so high it felt like a hurricane and was piercing my skin. After five minutes, I had to get out it was so painful, and there was no visible way of turning it down. 

2) Although a minor detail, the sink did not drain properly, making it hard to comfortably wash your face or hands.

3) When my boyfriend and I finally made our way into bed after our night out (mind you, it was about two in the morning), we opened the sheets to find STAINS. We immediately called room service, and as we waited for 45 minutes, we fell asleep. When she finally came in, she explained to us that she was the only one working that night, and the hotel was empty. She then went on to tell us that her job was really hard because almost all the guests every night complain about dirty sheets. 

UM... I think that's when it's time to get new sheets. EW.

As she was explaining this to us, she went through ten sheets just to find a new one that was clean. 

She then went on to tell us that the hotel had really gone downhill and was not getting much business.

If I may give some advice to the hotel, I would say make sure your staff isn't telling your guests dirty secrets, and disgusting them.

Although I asked my boyfriend to please call downstairs, from what she said we decided that getting a new room wouldn't help. We uncomfortably tried to sleep from there out, but I still don't feel comfortable that I didn't complain.

4) In the morning, I looked over to the wall to find lipstick stains that hadn't been cleaned off. EW.

It just kept getting worse and worse....

Mold in bath tub and on the floor in the corner by the tub and I was given only a 28 dollar credit.  They tried to clean it but it was under the silicone.  Had 2 rooms for 2 nights in my name and 2 other rooms for family and they still couldn't comp at least one of my rooms.   Rooms was suppose to be non smoking but all night I could smell smoke in my room. Would not recommend this hotel.  Apparently this hotel has had several complaints of mold in bathrooms and dirty rooms.

Monte Carlo wouldn't be my first choice, but because EDC happening at the time, everything was booked. The hotel itself is okay and it has plenty of restaurants and shops. The pool area is great, much better than expected. Huge pools and great overall experience. The rooms are clean, but could use some remodeling, they have seen better days. The staff was great and welcoming.  The price was very moderate too. No complains at all.

Horrible hotel , our nightmare started on the 1 h check in, then they put us in a room which a construction on the room upstairs, we woke up
at 6 o'clock in the morning with construction noise, we left to the pool however, the pool was close so they gave us mandalay bay pool pass witch has a long walk. I tried to speak to the manager to find us a new room ,but we were another 30 m in the line and nobody showed up, so I just let this hotel , I called them to say I was leaving but did not want to wait any longer for check our, but they refused to give me the refund. I do Not recommended it!

This review is long overdue but I stayed here (not on my most recent trip) a few months ago and it was my first time staying at Monte Carlo and it exceeded my expectations.  We stayed there for 3 nights and the rates were about $50.00\/night which I thought was a great deal.  The hotel and the rooms were very clean and if you're a Jabbawockee fan, they play the music in the elevators which I really enjoyed.  There's also a food court (Sbarro's, Subway, McDonald's, Starbucks and some other restaurants) which is great when you don't want to spend $$$ for food and just wanted to grab something quick.  I would totally stay here again.  There's a shortcut to walk over to Aria (follow the signs to the tram) and there's a tram that will take you to the City Center and Bellagio.

Disappointing! They charged an extra $20 per night  for services like coffee and water bottles. The fee was reversed after I talked with a manager and showed booking paper work. Another 15 minute chat. Pool closes at 7, even during summer. Multiple calls from security letting us know our door was ajar. It was closed and locked.

The other reviews pretty much sum it up.

The hotel and casino are extremely tired and in desperate need of renovation.  The casino floor is so tired, it's down right depressing.  The slot machines still have gold-colored trim (remember when that was a popular styling choice?  Neither do I.  It's been a long time).  The pool area is crammed to the gills with chairs, laid out so that too much of is shaded, and not relaxing in the least.  The free wi-fi is unusable.

All that said, location, location, location.  There isn't a better one on the strip.

And the management and staff are doing a great job with what they've been given to work with.  My room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the linens were soft, and everything in the hotel and casino seemed to be in good working order, if a little dinged up.

Further, it's priced just where it should be (I think I averaged $130\/night over a 3-night stay on Labor Day weekend, not including the egregious $28\/day resort fee). 

Pro tip, go for the strip view.  Not for the view, but because the half-hearted attempt to turn an already lame pool area into a "day club" leaves the side of the building facing the pool rattling with a "bmmm tsss bmmm tsss" from the DJ, 10am (?!?!) to 7pm.

Another pro tip.  If you're the type that wakes up hungover in Vegas, a noodle bowl at Dragon Noodle on the casino floor is a perfect cure.  Ask any doctor.

We settled on this casino and resort on one of our recent trip to sin city. We arrived really early in the morning, 5am, so the check in was super fast and efficient. BUT when we got to the room and requested a roll away bed, it took them a good hour to get that sucker to our room .. errr?? what happened monte carlo?? 

The room itself was overall ok. The sheets were soooo tough against my skin.  I'm not saying I'm used to luxurious (ok I am, lol jk), but it was not comfortable at all. The a\/c unit was fairly loud so throughout the night, it would wake me up. The pool area was small and crowded.  I wish they would have a better pool but then they made it up for the lazy pool I suppose.  

I'm not a smoker so I am not a fan of casinos period as smoke was everywhere; a puff to the left, to the right .. and right in front of my face =\ Nor am I a gambler so I can't comment on the gambling experience. I'm just a lurker who does not know what is going on with the tables in front of her. 

We also had brunch at the cafe here and it was disappointing. The wait to get our food was outrageous as there was less than a handful of people dining there. I ordered a chicken sandwich and my sandwich came out super soggy on the bottom from the juice of the chicken.  Guess it was sitting there for too long....

Would I stay here again, probably .. as it is a fairly decent place with a decent price tag.  But then most people are out and about walking\/playing in the city .. so yes, I would stay here again.

Monte Carlo is currently in the process of remodeling. Luckily for my boyfriend and I, we got the new room.

We got a wake up call by the sound of the drill from the room next door and directly above us. Also, we also had a beautiful view of the construction zone. The casino was also kept low maintained as majority of the slots and tables were stained and dirty. 

Positive thing about this place was that the location was good.

I've stayed at the Monte Carlo many times in the last few years (I travel to Vegas 3-4 times a year for business). I've stayed at other hotels on the stirp before (Excalibur, Westin, Caesar's Palace, etc).

The value for the hotel is great (usually can find a room for around $40-50\/night). They've included a 'resort fee' now of $12.95 a day which includes wired internet (no wifi) and 2 bottles of water a day.

I think all hotels now charge a 'resort fee' which includes the internet service (wired or wireless). I've always gotten the internet fees as I need to be able to work through VPN so the 'added' bonus of 2 bottles of water is nice.

It is an older hotel and does not have a wet bar or fridge. The rooms are average and the pool is ok. They do have a 'wave' river where you can float around all day but there's nothing spectacular about the pool.

The hotel is located a little south on the strip and isn't near the Tram. You can walk a block or two to MGM Grand and catch a tram from there to get to the Convention Center or the other hotels. Diablo is a bar that is connected to the hotel and faces the strip. It gets a little wild around Cinco De Mayo (which is when I was last there).

Overall, good value if you aren't planning to spend a lot of time in your room although if I were coming for personal travel; I would opt to stay at Caesar's or at the Wynn.

So I was skeptical about this place from the beginning of the planning stage for my trip, but the room rate was good and we were getting a spa suite which looked really cool.  Normally we try to stay at the venetian or bellagio but the pocket book was a bit light and a bargain seemed like a good idea.  This trip was to celebrate our first anniversary and it was our first true vacation since our wedding so needless to say we were very excited.   The night before our flight we called to confirm our room and it was all gravy.

The next day we arrive and are told that there was a "problem with the suites" and we would be downgraded to a normal room.   I'm on my f'ing anniversary and only vacation this year and this is what I'm stuck with.  The "manager" wasn't even all that apologetic, in fact she was pretty indifferent, kind of like the treatment that we have all become accustomed to receiving from airline employees... the "I couldn't possibly care less about you" attitude.

So we called the four seasons, they gave us a great rate with an UPGRADE to a room that has arguably the best view of the strip in all of Vegas and treated us like royalty for our whole trip (I'm gonna write a detailed review for them as well).

Bottom line:  If it's a budget trip your looking for and all you need is a bed and toilet, I guess this place will suffice, but I would never (again) risk it for a special occasion or if you can afford better.

I have stayed here 3-4 times have had a solid 4 stars every time

The rooms are clean and nice....The pool area (especially the lazy river) are good ( a bit crowded on summer weekends, but heck, its summer at a Vegas pool!)

The restaurants are good and the location of the hotel is awesome!

The price is also good (best deal for a good hotel in the middle of everything!

Not a 5 star, but a solid 4 stars

I would and will stay there again!!!  Thank you Monte Carlo!! See you again in the future

Can't say I've got much to complain about regarding my recent stay here. Personally, I couldn't care less about my hotel room in Vegas; I'm not here to spend any time in it. As long as it's clean, well-presented and isn't a rundown shithole akin to Circus Circus, anything will do. I booked an online deal for $49\/night. That was attractive. What wasn't attractive were the room fees which are added onto your bill involuntarily. I think they charged me something like $16\/day for wi-fi access (which I didn't use), pool access (which I used once), fitness center access (which I didn't use), and a few other amenities which, you guessed it, I didn't use. I would prefer these were available to guests a la carte since I didn't plan to employ most of them. 

The rooms are nice, but far from decadent. I paid about $40 extra to get a "strip view" room. Unfortunately, they didn't mention that the strip I'd be viewing was the strip mall across the street. The angle of my window left me with an obscured view of the MGM Grand and the ginormous condo tower next door. As I hadn't been here before, I had no idea that my view would suck as much as it did. So, though the cheap upgrade might seem worthwhile, I assure you it is not. 

I had heard from a friend that the walls are thin here. I didn't hear any moans or groans, but the fact that I can hear the person on either side flushing their toilet didn't jive with me too well. I don't need an audible confirmation everytime my neighbor takes a dump. 

Parking was great here. Got a spot on the 2nd level, which leads to the lobby, with ease. And it's free. Can't beat that. 

The pool here is grossly oversold on their website, though. The "regular" pool is oddly-shaped, small and crowded. The lazy river is more like a crowded stream. And the wave generator pool is about half the size of the one at Wild Rivers and, yep, crowded. Even worse, the lounge chairs are practically stacked on top of each other, and finding a seat that doesn't appear to be claimed by an anonymous towel is nigh impossible. We just brushed a couple off and snagged some seats. There's a pool bar, but bring plenty of lube because you'll be brutally raped by prices. 

I'd stay here again, but only if I can continue to get good deals on their rooms. The free parking and ease of check-in were about the only things that really mattered to me. I don't like that it's so high up on the strip, but for the price I suppose the brisk walk down to the middle is worth it.

Monte Carlo is looking tired these days...we were here for a family event....I personally found the hotel "deal" high.  My friend who joined us  last minute got much better prices that we did plus she got food and beverage credits.  The $20 resort fee seems like a way to make the room seem to be cheaper but its a manditory fee so why even play that game?  We were on a high floor and our room was nicer than those in our group who saved a few $$ by booking a lower floor.  The beds were comfortable, but we did have problems with the shower draining and the sink backing up.  They had to fix them twice. 

The pool was nice & we were able to arrange for a private cabana with a private pool for a fair price for our group, of course $17.00 cokes pool side seems beyond steep to me.  

The check in & check out process here is horrible...plan on waiting a long...long time and then don't plan on getting into your room right away  " they are backed up & will call you when your room is ready"  about an hour or two after you check in.

The casino has a nice morning gaming class for those who want to learn craps, & roulette.  There late night dealers were lots of fun...one named Victoria was very helpful in teaching some of us how to lose our money slower..she was at the roulette table....from 11 p.m. lol As a result she made a higher percentage in tips from our group.  

Monte Carlo staff helped us get tickets to the LOVE show for a better price than the "Half Price Tickets" store.  No one had the tickets for 1\/2 price but we did get them for 40% off.  That show was the best part of our trip

We stayed at this hotel definitely no complaints, close to everything room was very good and staff most helpful and price was cheap.
This is the3rd time that I have stayed here and would definitely recommend it.

I cannot say enough about Deborah Jones in VIP services. We are currently staying in the Monte Carlo for my sister in laws 21st birthday. Deborah went out of her way to give my sister in law a welcome\/Birthday gift. She is definitely going to make this trip one of the most memorable trips ever and we cannot thank her enough for everything she's done. She made our process a breeze and would come back to the Monte Carlo in a heartbeat! Thank you Deborah

Check in was fast, no issues with staff or rudeness as several other reviews mentioned. Dcor in rooms is pretty outdated, but the bed was super comfortable- softer than I'm used to with hotel beds. Fixtures in bathroom are very old. That is a weird thing to mention in a review, but the bathroom door handle and tub faucet wasn't all the way attached and the tub dripped throughout our stay. The water pressure was insane. I'm pretty sure I lost a few layers of skin. 

The pool area is nice- enough space to find a patch of sun even when it was busy. Drink\/food service was pretty fast at the pool. 

Casino was nicer than I expected- pretty clean & good air quality. The caf had good breakfast. 

I'm one of the last 10 people in my late 20's without one of those fancy internet phones, so I didn't mind not having wifi, but others in our party were slightly annoyed at this. But what is with the resort fees? I'm so happy I paid $20\/day for a miniature bottle of water & cheap coffee (not Keurig as described). Not a huge deal, but would have been nice to know about up front. 

Overall, a mediocre experience here, and if I ever come back to Vegas, I will stay elsewhere.

I stayed at this hotel. All I can say is WOW. The place needs a remodel, an upgrade. Looks like I stepped into the 1980's when I went into my room. (Better then Circus Circus which makes you feel like you walked into the 1960's, I had to look down and make sure I didn't have bell bottoms on) ANYWAYS, these hotels are HUGE so it takes time to go back and forth to your room when you leave. Our view from the room was the top of another buildings Air Conditioning units. The cool thing about the Monte Carlo is the statue of all the womens bootys outside. THATS IT. Wait, one more thing, it was close to Dennys, McDonalds, and 711. Okay, now that's it.

Wow, for the nicest rooms they offer, they really do let down.  First night the automatic blinds wouldn't close, got fixed the next day after trying to sleep with the sun in my face.  The room had a stain on the couch and floors needed a severe deep cleaning!  On my second night there was a huge group in the room next to me that was extremely loud!  I called the front desk and they were able to move to another room.  So I had to pack up and move out of my nice suite because of some loud jerks.  Fine, so my new room is quiet and I politely called the front desk if they could offer me a food comp or anything for the inconvenience.  NO, wow, being in the industry, send me to the buffet, the food will get wasted at the end of the day.  So ended up with a bad taste in my mouth, money paid for the room didnt matter and money I dont, nobody cared.  Look forward to my HORRIBLE experience at the cafe, I'll warn you now, STAY AWAY!  Much better places to stay at and want you to come back, I left feeling  like they just want my money and who cares, someone else will fill the room and have the same experience.  Please make this situation better, I work hard for my money and when I feel totally ripped off driving home its not cool.

My husband and I got married at The Monte Carlo a little over 2 years ago. We stayed in one of the Monaco Suites with a strip view and it was amazing! We booked our room online and got a package deal that was at a very affordable price. montecarlo.com. The wedding coordinator was great with communications through email and fax. This is a beautiful hotel that I would recommend to everyone! The wedding packages are very affordable and include photography and flowers. I highly recommend the wedding services. The chapel is sweet and the the employees were very helpful and kind. The hotel staff is also very accommodating with early check in and late check out.  The pool area is awesome too! Go to The Monte Carlo!

They try to be a cheap value hotel.  But they add in a resort fee on the end which is $13-$15 a day.  The cost is for internet (no wi-fi here), two bottles of water in your room and a stack of USA Today newspapers at the end of the hall. The room had stained carpets and bed spreads and somebodys sock was in a drawer.  The pool was weird because the buildings surrounding it block the sun in the earlier and later parts of the day so high noon is more the time.  Unfortunately they have all of these additional charges everywhere.  This place loves to nickel and dime you.  Rent a towel...seriously...and a silly inflatable raft for $9 for the pool.  Then they tried to recreate this place into someones spring break trip by having someone massacre music blearing loud with stupid twister games on the pool deck.  The dj couldn't even beat mix the beats.  It was a nightmare.  This place has no life in it.  Casino is smoky and dead and the dining is sub-par.  We came with family of all ages and everybody stayed away from here.  We had to go enjoy other resorts for the life of Vegas.  Mandalay Bay had the best air quality and was hopping...so was MGM.. But warning, they are all owned by the same company.  Only the Wynn\/Encore...my preference.  And the Venetian\/Palazzo...the next best gorgeous place, are owned by better run and high end company's.  I prefer cleanliness and one fee.  I pay for my room and truly enjoy the resort I'm staying in.  This is not that place.  You will end up spending more and feeling ripped  off.

If I could give this hotel no stars, I would. 

I will never stay here again. My poor boyfriend got contact dermatitis all over his body from this hotel. When addressing this issue to the hotel manager, the manager offered no apology and implied it was his fault for not requesting hypoallergenic sheets. My boyfriend has stayed in tons of hotels--good and bad. Never has this been an issue nor has he ever had allergies, so why would he ever request for hypoallergenic sheets? Aside from Monte Carlo being run down, management handled this issue very poorly.

Monte Carlo use to be my favorite until the next door neighbor Aria came along. Just kidding, :). I paid $277 for 2 nights for High Floor (29th Floor) facing the pool. Service is not bad and my room is bed-bug free! Yay right. I like the marble flooring and the HDTV this room provided. Room, is your typical. I don't think i need to review the room that much.

Monte Carlo is on a pretty good location on the strip (like another post said). It is accessible to Aria + Crystals + Bellagio (Aria Express Monorail) and the Strip is just right outside.  

THE GOOD:
The elevators on the Monte Carlo have a very interesting tune. Highly recommend paying attention to the music. Haha. 

Great Service - Monte Carlo is a classic, staff there are knowledgeable. 

$50 Credit at their food places - Including their Big Belly Buffet. Great for two people. :] 

I believe WiFi is accessible from floor 1-9 and the rest don't get WiFi. Not too sure.



THE BAD:

RESORT - sucks, its only a pool filled with people hogging it. $20 a night for the RESORT Fee. Workout room is crowded too. 

CHECKING IN - Sucks. Its really long. But I shouldn't complain because all the other hotels is just the same. But still. 

The price might be higher because JABBAWOCKEEZ is here. :]

Stayed here for 7 days about 2 weeks ago. It's what you'd expect from an older lv strip property. Check in was fast. Staff was great. Room was somewhat dirty. Moldy bathroom, worn furniture, previous guests coffee still in the coffee maker, dirty carpet, etc. But, whatever. In my opinion it's Vegas and I'm not there for the room. It's not the bellagio but it's not circus circus. Everywhere we dined in the Monte Carlo was good and reasonable in price for the strip. In the casino the drink service was good during the day but lacked in the late night early morning hours. That perturbed me somewhat. Overall a decent place to stay if you're not looking for all the glitz and glitter b.s.

This place was rather disappointing. 

The good:  centrally located on the strip.  Fitness center was basic but clean and equipped with the essentials. 

The bad:  we had to wait in the massive reception line multiple times a day because our room keys never worked. Mysterious resort fee that covered non-existent wi-fi. Outdated bathrooms. Mystery stains on sheets. Thin walls. Ripped sheets. 

The ugly:  murky pool water.

THIEVES! Obviously, there are no cameras in the hallways, sooo whats the best thing to do? Steal from their guests, over $1,000 cash that was stolen while we had a night out! Supposably they were going to call me back and they gave me a number to call for security all it is, is an answering machine, I left message after message with no response!!! Thanks Monte Carlo for nothing!! You have lost alot of guests due to being thieves, obviously I am not the only that this has happened too, check out other reviews on here!!

Just passing through after catching the tram to and from the Bellagio. Never had the chance to stay here. All I can say is the casino area looks clean and well kept. Good mix of restaurants and stores.

Went here in late June and had to say that location wise, this place was great.  Prime spot on the strip and most things were in walking distance.   Unfortunately, it was 100 plus every day while we were there, so we kept mostly to the indoors.

We stayed in the spa room on the 29th floor which was pretty nice.   The spa was a wide enough to have two people lay side by side with plenty of room still, and the view from there overlooked the strip for the best view I've ever had there.   Shower had a space between the glass door and glass wall so water was always squeezing between the two and wet the floor, so we had to have a couple towels there all the time. It had a steamer control but it's a wise idea to keep your feet far away from the tube that pours that out, as it's HOT!  Room safe faces you as you sit on the toilet and wasn't big enough for a laptop so that did us no good.  TV was an older tube with the volume blown, but who really comes to Las Vegas to watch TV?  

Bed had no comforter on it, but with controls for maintaining the room temperature, I guess it wasn't really needed.  We did get chocolate left on the pillow on the day we called for new linen from housekeeping which was cool.  And we got the wired internet (that's right, wired!) and two small bottles of water for the price of the resort fee which blows.  A copy of the USA today was available in the center of the hotel floor, but we kept waking up late and found the copies were always gone.  

The casino itself was somewhat on the quiet side, but like every other casino I've seen there lately, they had booty girls doing their dancing from 3pm until ?pm\/am.  I have to say also that this was one of the best smelling casinos except for the front of the Lance Burton Theatre, where it always seemed to have a strong fart smell.

Slots were very tight and unforgiving and the waitresses seemed few and far between - you could get super thirsty waiting for any to pass by.

This I guess replaces a review I had here before but has mysteriously vanished.

Pool is so loud you don't even want to be in the area or your room if you're facing it. Why do they think blasting music is for the masses? Maybe 15% of the people were of the lifestyle that would enjoy it. 
Room was lame, no coffee maker, TV didn't work, bathroom needs major update, bed was lumpy...
Never again with all the other options out there.
