Two stars because its right next to diablos and for $20 you can drink all the beer you want from 9-12. Other than that they have no other place open after 11pm to eat. They charge a stupid hidden fee $20 each day resort fee that they could of included in the package that me and my wife reserved for. The pool sucks lots of immature people I've seen a family at the pool side minding their own business and a few people acting inappropriate with no respect or caring who is around. No wifi too.they have a radio where you can sync your iPod in but no wifi wtf?

My go to place when I travel to Vegas alone or with one buddy. Always decent pricing, convenient..etc. This time wasn't pleasant at all. Loud construction Thursday and Friday in the morning, and a leak in my room that never got resolved. Now I understand things happen. However, to charge a $35 nightly resort fee when you currently have ongoing construction, no pool, and fewer amenities doesn't make sense to me. Between the noise, the leak, which ended up getting my charger wet...I was not happy at all with this stay

I would not recommend this hotel do to the horrible service we recieved. I stayed here this past week with a group of 10 and not one of us had a good experience with any of the staff. The woman who checked us in was short with us, we had to speak to several ppl about an event they were supposed to be hosting that no one knew about but advertised throughout the whole hotel. We also had to call down for someone to fix our TV twice, and we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door everyday and the housekeeping still let themselves in, which did not make me feel comfortable. I would only recommend the pool area, everything else was average.

Sad to say but Monte Carlo has gone from an upscale hotel to a shabby shack of a hotel.  Similar to the fate of the Luxor and New York, New York who once reigned in cleanliness and comfort but now have become grimy and less-than-impressive.  It's no wonder that the prices for rooms are going down.  This is not my first stay here but will more than likely be my last.  My room was a little beaten up with a shower head that rivals the ones installed at a Holiday Inn while the grout work was coming up and peeling.  The bed was okay but the sheets are now stiff and slightly uncomfortable.  I paid extra for a higher room only to be greeted by a view of the large construction across the street that awakened me every morning at 6:00 am.  Granted this is not MC's fault but it only added to the overall impression that this hotel has seen better days.

The Monte Carlo also does the now standard practice of adding a hefty daily "resort fee" that includes "Monte Carlo water" which is only two very small water bottles, wired internet (note, not wireless but wired, a very much out of date service) and access to the health spa.  But the last part is not completely accurate.  You do get to walk through the health spa but you don't get to partake in the showers, sauna rooms, pools, etc..  Those are for the folks who dish out an extra $15.  What you do get access to is the fitness center that, to be honest, is very decent with new equipment that is in excellent shape.  But it is disappointing that my resort fee doesn't actually cover all of the resort.

The staff is one of the saving graces: friendly, helpful, professional, and accommodating.  I had an issue with my iron where someone decided to iron the bottom of their shoe as it was caked with some kind of rubber coating, making ironing impossible.  I asked the maid a few doors down if she could help and within a few minutes she had a brand new iron for me!  That was excellent service and spoke well of the staff.

In all, if you are not looking for any frills, a cheap rate, and rooms that accommodate but don't impress, then this is your place.  For me, I'll keep looking elsewhere for my future business trips.
Quick, super friendly check in staff, porters and valet. NICE CLEAN room. Hotel. As well casino. AWESOME CONVENIENT LAYOUT!

This place is def. an a-okay hotel.  

There are a ton of construction going on right by the note Carlo Hotel.  Finding the entrance to the self-parking lot was a head ache but once I found it, everything from parking to check in went smoothly.  The self-parking was easy to find and there were lots of parking spots.  Easy access to the lobby and clean but dated hotel rooms.  It's fine with me though since I'm only here for one night for work.  

I didn't check out the restaurants in the hotel.  

I utilized the tram both nights I was there to the Bellagio.

So this place charges extra for everything, except for the free water bottles that the maids leave in your room each day. However, the rooms are are very home-ie.  The gym is about 20 bucks per day, internet is 15 a day, and no there is no one around for free to piggie back free wi-fi off of (at least not on the 30th floor where I was). They have a food court with subway, sbarro, rubios, mcdonalds, and starbucks. They also have a great buffet, a steakhouse, and a cafe. The staff was really helpful and nice. I have no reason not to go back. If you have a ton of money, stay at one of the ritzy hotels, but this was affordable, nice, and on the strip. No complaints.

This hotel is decent, and like many hotels there's long line to check in.. Monte Carlo is part of MGM and you can take the City tram to the other locations

Our room was nice but the shower heads are painful, it was like they drilled a plate on top and added 4 holes, no adjustment for height or pressure. the pressure is strong feeling like needles attacking your body.. Poorly designed. 

Toilet flushes loudly and kinda splashes out... Beds got me itchy... had to sleep on top of sheets... i hope it wasn't bed bugs... 

On our 2nd to last night there grease smelll making it hard to sleep... it smelled it sewer and it wasn't pleasant. My other travel companion smelled it and called the front desk but they said "we got lots of complains... can't help you, deal with it for the next few hours" I don't know how to react to that..... 

Since it's Vegas, all hotels have strong smoke smell...due to Casinos.

Let's be real. For the price you get for staying somewhat on the strip, Monte Carlo is your best bet. We booked through Mlife and saved a lot of money compared to the Aria last year. You get what you pay for, so we had no complains. The front desk to check in was fairly long but the service was good. 

The sad thing is there's only one convenience store downstairs which is highly over priced. A pack of cigarettes for about $11. Soda $5 and so Is wAter. Your better off taking the less than 5 min walk to CVS ( or was it Walgreens? )

The walk to the middle of the strip is simple and not so far of a walk since you can walk to the tram in the Aria. 

The rooms weren't your greatest room, but they were decent. We decided to walk to Ross just to buy sheets since ours was stained and room service never picked up any of our calls. The bathroom had a few molds but that's in every other older hotels. 

The construction never bothered us because it was fairly easy to drive in to the strip or off.

Another pro is a food court right downstairs. Way better than eating out everyday at a buffet or fancy restaurant.

My company booked the Monte Carlo for our work trip.

After reading the reviews prior to going, I noticed a lot of the reviews said that there were moths in the rooms- and that's THE FIRST THING I NOTICED!! 

There was a moth in the bathroom sink, and one on the floor, that someone had stepped on. Yuck!! 

Also, the casino downstairs smelled like straight bathroom spray- very overpowering. I would rather smell cigarettes, than cigarettes and deodorizer. Eww!

Other than that, it was a good experience, but I feel like a rich hotel & casino like that can afford to get an exterminator.

Instead of wasting my time revisiting the thought of Monte  Carlo, I will share the letter I sent to vegas.com  after my visit. 

To Whom it May concern:

I'm unsure who to contact about my recent trip I booked through vegas.com, but unfortunately I attempted to settle a multitude of incidents at our stay at the Las Vegas Monte Carlo Resort & Hotel through their site management. None of which I feel were satisfactory. 
This was a trip that was meant to be memorable in the best of ways, yet the negative is what overpowered our experience by far. 
On the second night of our stay returning from dinner we are surprisingly greeted by small bugs on our hotel room ceiling, walls & bed!! We're disgusted & heartbroken because not only is this happening, but when we called to inform the front desk the response was not one of surprise, concern or genuine urgency at all! We were clear & explained we had very time precise plans we couldn't be late for. 
The lady assured us we would be moved out of our room within 5minutes by bell people & transferred into a new clean room. After waiting 15 minutes noone has shown up to our room to do anything promised. We called for status & were told to come get keys ourselves. We were forced to walk down to the bell desk & ask for lugguage help & keys for our new room. Wasting more time. Noone seemed to know what we talking about & all the bell people were scarce. At this point we are more than unpleased & frustrated with Monte Carlo's customer care. I got the room & shortly after a bell person came to "help." Ultimately, we missed our engagement which ruined our night. Noone apologized, expressed any kind of sympathy or compassion. Now its near 3am & were trying to settle in our new room when crickets jump out near our television. Seriously at this point our trip is sounding like a bad movie. I'm left feeling pathetic. 
 There's food & trash behind the tv stand. The lamp is broken, the bathroom shower head is very rusted & hard. The water spits all over your face & smells of strong chlorine & the faucet leaks all night!! I mean we never ever ever complain about anything, but this was a bit much for a vacation meant to be stress-free. Moved, to now our 3rd room. Same thing with front desk wait around games so this time we moved all our belongings ourselves. Noone checked on us again. No apologizes.
In desperate search for some kind of empathy or genuine understanding of our bad stay; I asked to speak to management. We met with Ricky. He seemed very helpful & promising. He explained the testing protocol of the tiny bugs...& kind of made us feel like we'd be equally compensated. Never happened. He said the bugs in both rooms were professionally tested. I found this to be very dishonest because in the midst of hurrying out our first room I must have forgotten a bag. I got the key at front desk to go back & there hadn't been  a single stir in the room. Bugs still residing, perhaps they did it later. 
All in all nothing was done beside a voicemail  "confirmation" that the bugs were not bed bugs or potentially worrisome. We also got a resort free discount. I handled myself both professionally & tactful which lacked in return from Monte Carlo. Not to mention I arrived home in Minnesota 7am without my lugguage due to it being shipped to Phoenix instead of Minneapolis. What is the proper protocol for this complaint? Hypothetically turning tables I know the small gesture MC gave me wouldn't be sufficient enough for even Ricky. I was told to contact who I booked through . I understand nothing can be perfect, but things can be properly cleaned, repaired, cared for & certainly addressed in a more acceptable manner. Especially one as popular & busy in Las Vegas. We didn't leave happy. Vegas.com can you help? If necessary I can attach pictures.

Yelp, I didnt include that I asked housekeeping for 2 extra towels and was told no. Said that I needed to  go to front desk for that even though her cart was fully stocked with cleaned wrapped towels. I said "ok thank you" 
I didn't include that who seemed to be the housekeeping supervisor knocked on my 3rd room thinking it was empty. I asked if he would like to check the room? "No." I expressed that I would LIKE him to. "Thats ok."
Now obviously one doesn't fly to Vegas to sit in a hotel room for 4 days so really does it matter about these things?  Yup! Sure does when your money is paying!!

We have stayed here three times in the past 7 years on our annual visits to Vegas.   I think if you go with the rightg mindset it's a great place.  Mindset being LOTS OF KIDS!  It has a great lazy river pool but that does draw families with kids.  The one and only time we took our teenager sons to Vegas we did stay there and it was appropriate but if you're a couple looking for a swanky and romantic place don't stay here. It does have a great food court and the rooms are adeqate.   It is centrally located so waking to lots of places is also great.

I stayed at the Monte Carlo Fri 8\/22-Sun 8\/24\/14. I know it's not the nicest or newest place, but the price is right & it's in a good location on the Strip. I've stayed before with no issues, but after this last trip I will NEVER stay there again.

I went to Vegas with my sister & one of my best girlfriends. We checked in late Friday night (11pm). We were in our room for about an hour so we could freshen up, regroup with friends & then we went downstairs to gamble & drink. We were out of our room for less than 4 hours. Somewhere in that time frame, all the cash we left in our purses in the room was stolen (a total of around $650). We noticed the next day when we woke up. 

We reported the theft to hotel management & security. We initially spoke to Ryan, position unknown, as he wasn't wearing a name tag. Ryan accessed their computer system which shows each time a door is opened by a guest or their staff. Long story short, the "system" shows that we did not close the door all the way when we left. There is no way this was possible. The door is so heavy it closes on its own. Their "system" also alerted them to this issue 10 mins after we left the room & security did nothing. Second manager named Celeste came over. They refused to comp our room and only offered a $100 credit towards food & drink. We demanded to move rooms and were told we were being upgraded to a suite. Upon entering the new room, we found it to be the same layout as our first room, just on a different floor. Julius, security personnel, wrote a report on a scratch piece of paper. My sister & I wrote statements. The police were never called. We were told this incident would be referred to Risk Management & they would follow up in 3-4 days after an "investigation". Over a week later and no word from the hotel. 

Upon my return back to work on Monday 8\/25\/14, my coworker asked about my trip. When I told her the story, she asked "Wait, where did you stay?" Turns out she stayed at the Monte Carlo in June with her sister & their boyfriends. Their boyfriends went to EDC & the girls didn't. My friend was sick & knocked out on cold medication, but her sister woke up in the middle of the night to find a man in their room. He said he was "security" and was checking a "report" of their door being left open. Super shady business going on at this place! 

DO NOT STAY HERE! If you must, use the safe AND deadbolt your door!! There are NO cameras in the hallway, so definitely stay at your own risk.

Over all the hotel was nice and pretty clean. The beds were okay and the pillows were just about fine. However I was not a fan of the towels in the bathrooms. The first night we were there the towels smelled cleaned but the second night when they had come in to clean and restock the towels it was so stinky!! This would be a good place to stay for just the weekend but I wouldn't stay longer.

After touring the Grand Canyon and Zion National park my family wanted to spend four nights in Vegas. Now it should be noted my two kids are 21 & 24 so Vegas had a certain adult attraction. Also I was working the Black Hat conference and attending the DEFCON show so my stay would be two nights longer.

I'd booked my room several months in advance and received a good rate that averaged just over one hundred a night, before fees and taxes. Unfortunately, my original reservation was for a king room so I needed to switch it to a dual Queen, so I couldn't check-in online. On arrival the check-in line turned out to be 45 minutes long. When I finally got to the desk they assigned me a room with "some minor" construction noise that might start at 6 AM, and they said if it was a problem then they'd switch it tomorrow morning.

On arriving in the room it was plainly obvious it hadn't seen an update since it was originally constructed some 21 years earlier, the same year my son was born. Everything was seriously worn, and dated, but we were all exhausted from a full day hiking Zion, so we crashed. At 5:15 AM construction began with banging on I-beams, dump truck back up alarms, material being dropped, and all manner of construction noise. I then went back down to the service desk, next to check-in, where I waited another 30 minutes to talk with someone. Now I was told they didn't have any rooms at this point in the morning, but that they'd text me later in the morning when something came available.

They'd never called or texted me during the day with the room change. So on returning from a full day of Black Hat show set up and meetings I was compelled to spend another 30 minutes at 5 PM at the service desk waiting for some assistance. I'd politely asked for a more modern room on a higher floor away from the construction. I was offered a third-floor room facing the front entrance, still with 1996 appointments. My family quickly packed up and we moved from the sixth to the third floor. 

The room was identical down to the lack of outlets, pillows, and towels. We had to call every day for additional towels. The only difference was no 5:15 AM construction noise and a view of the front balcony roof.

While the hotel is under construction, from late 2016 through 2018, there is no pool or outdoors to speak of. Did I mention the $35\/day non-negotiable "Resort" fee? This entitles you to a bus ride to another MGM property to use their pool. Oh, and the buses sometimes depart early so plan ahead. My family made use of this exactly once, so $210 for three people, $70\/each or $35\/hour\/person to use a pool. Oh, I forgot to mention the resort fee also includes Wifi in the room.

I'd mark the casino as one of the most run-down ones in a major hotel on the strip. While the restaurants were on par. In the prior two years, I've stayed at both Mandalay Bay and the Venetian, and had meals and gambled at Bellagio, Ceasar's, Paris, and have even gone down town to the historic Golden Nugget and Binions for dining and gambling. So I have a fairly good grasp of what the town has to offer.

Personally, I'm never returning to this hotel. My nightly room rate, before taxes and resort fees, tripled from Monday night to Saturday night. This is nothing new, many hotels now use this surge pricing practice. If this was the Venetian I wouldn't mind paying more for something nice, but this hotel room could have easily been an old Courtyard property in some backwater town. It was far from something special.

This was my last ever stay at the Monte Carlo never again. It's just not worth it!

Okay, so I booked another room under a different name so they didn't even know it was me this time to treat me different and they were able to accommodate a change that I had been told by other customer service with other resorts that they couldn't and I truly appreciate the service.

I don't know what room I will get but I'm already more pleased with the service so I'll give this update pending my new stay.

We have stayed here many times. Has always been good. We stayed here over Thanksgiving and was so disappointed. First they never told us when we booked it that was under construction. The casino machines were few and far between. The smoke was unbelievable. Was so bad, no venting. The room was not great either.   The bathroom was stained and the sink backed up with just a little water running. No mini fridge to keep anything in. Friday morning we were awaken at 7 to sound of really loud construction noise. Sat morning was awaken at 7 again to loud construction crane noise. Upon checkout we were charged resort fee!  For what?  No pool. No spa. What would the resort fee be for?  Were told could go to MGM to use their spa and pool. Really!  Walk all the way through the Monte Carlo, go outside, walk down the several several blocks, cross over the bridge, walk all the way through the MGM just to use the spa.  What a joke.  False advertising not telling you when you book.    Will NEVER stay here again. I dont care how they upgrade the place. Worst money spent.

We come to Vegas twice a year and stay at a different hotel each time.  The Monte Carlo is my least favorite. The rooms have little to no amenities.  We didn't even have a coffee maker in our "Upgraded Strip View" room. Yes, we have a view, but nothing spectacular.  
I did appreciate the warning from the in house dining attendant that the pot of coffee I ordered would take up to 45 min to arrive. Yes, I am not being sarcastic, I really did appreciate the honesty.  Another positive, my WiFi connection was great.
Over all, I am underwhelmed by the Monte Carlo.

For a first experience of Vegas, this hotel just did not do it for me. Front desk was extremely rude. Especially when we inquired about a coupon for the buffet. He had no reason to say "oh i don't think you were suppose to get one, but let me check." Before we even gave him our room number. He basically profiled us. 

The room was okay. Outdated to say the least.

Great hotel. Great service. Great price. I was in town for a 4-day conference and the Monte Carlo was suburb! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The price was fantastic. The room was very clean and comfortable. They could use an upgrade on their linens and towels. My only complaint is that they charge $5 for a pot of hot water (no coffee\/tea maker in the room). Overall, it was a great place to stay.

I was expecting worse to be honest.

In town for my brother's wedding, it was decided ahead of time that we were all staying at the Monte Carlo.

I would have preferred to spend a bit more $ to stay at a nicer hotel, but it would have been rude to stray from the group.

The rooms were not half bad. Clean, spacious, and a comfortable bed. Pretty much all I'm looking for in a hotel when I'm only staying for a short time.

The staff was friendly, especially the doormen and housekeepers. I bribed the housekeeper $10 to give me extra shampoos, etc.,  as I donate them to a shelter, and she brought me a gigantic bag of stuff.

I think the dining choices could be better. I didn't try every place, but the one place I did try still haunts me.

Internet access will run you $14.99 per 24 hours, which I think is a bit steep. I guess with so many business travelers, they can get away with gouging you.

All in all, your basic, non high-end, non dumpy, 3 star Vegas hotel.

We waited an hour and a half to get into our room, and were late to make our plans. As we are standing in line to get our keys, the team is having a meeting out on the floor, not helping customers. In total, there is MAYBE 3 people working the desk checking people in. Meetings should happen behind doors, not in front of customers. Low and behold, ONE PERSON HELPED US, Lisa. She literally waited for the locksmith to come up and when it took too long, upgraded our room so we could go in rather than wait in the hallway with our bags. She made sure we had a new room, showed us how everything worked, and asked us if we needed anything else before she left. The first checkin staff did not let us speak with a manager, and when we did speak with a manager, he was very arrogant and did not give a solution. When we tried calling the concierge line it was closed. When we got to our first room, there was a pile of trash sitting outside our door. When housekeeping came to pick it up, their response was "that's it?". I personally don't think any trash should be left outside of a room. When we were finally able to talk to a manager, he was literally no help. After a long conversation about all our troubles, he said he would waive our resort fees, but when we checked out, those fees were still on our bill. I had to go talk to the front desk again, who tried to deny that he ever waived those fees. Overall, it was not the best experience to start our weekend off. If i went to vegas again, i definitely would not be staying at the Monte Carlo again.

it was my first time staying at monte carlo this past weekend and i had a good experience! check in was a little annoying since there isn't 1 general line, you have to figure out which line is the shortest and try to line up there. check out is the same way =\/

the room was nice and spacious, i appreciate all the mirrors and tiled bathroom floors. service was great! they gave us all the towels we asked for =)

the pools were newly remodeled (apparently) and was really fun! the DJ was the best and played the greatest music by the wave pool (which was super fun) on saturdays theres a really cute MC who does a scavenger type game which is also really fun :D

I'm really shocked that after complaining multiple times due to a domestic dispute in the room next door, that started at 3am, that the hotel manager would not comp us the last nights stay, that pushed us to check out early!!!! 

That's flippin ridiculous! I would never stay at this hotel again due to the service provided at the end of our stay... They even billed us wrong!!!! Had to review the rate with them since we paid in full at check in...

When we got in our room, I don't think it got cleaned. There was still a water bottle (half way done) in the corner of the room, hair in the tub and dirty carpet. We had to leave a note for the housekeeping to please have the room cleaned. We're pretty laid back people and hate to complain, so a note was left for the housekeeping hoping for a change. I know that this is an old hotel, but being on the strip, I expected a lot better. Not sure if I want to stay here again. I'm really having the worst luck in finding decent hotels on the strip.

I stayed at MC a few years ago and while it wasn't a dump it needed a facelift.  It appears that it's received one.  Not sure about the regular rooms but the junior suite I had was fantastic for the price.  It's about 700 SQ Ft and I enjoyed the extra space in the lounge area and the second bathroom.

Most important they have improved the beds or the beddings.  The bed was almost as comfortable as a Westin Heavenly bed.

The front of the MC was fairly bland and restaurant options limited.  They've made big strides with the addition of Diablo.  The Pub has been one of my Strip faves for years and it's still a good option, especially for game day, but it's not quite the value that it used to be.  

The pool area is much nicer too with the addition of sand volleyball and the wave pool.  The downside to the pool though is that the sun is limited by all the surrounding buildings.  The area in the middle gets sun most of the day but most of the areas have a 4 hour window depending on the time of the day.  

I'm going to give the MC kudos for stepping up its game and making major improvements.  My one complaint is that they charge premium prices on food & beverage for a non premium hotel.  The MC is in the middle or low end for the MGM franchise and its pool doesn't warrant $14 cocktails.  

I will compliment the casino for not jacking it's minimums, even on weekend nights you can still find $10 BJ.  Avoid the tables near the front with the Go-Go dancers due to the poor odds.  6-5 BJ rather than 3-2 and no surrender.

seriously vegas veterans are spoiled.  unless there is a convention in town, this spot is a great deal for the $$.

we got:
- cheapie rooms!
- tram to the schanmcier spots like bellagio\/hello!
- free valet - don't bother parking in self-park and lug in the bags.  it's freeeeee + tip.

the small VIP club is teeny but we were just there to dance before a 5k race 1.5 hours later.  ok, who am i kidding?  the group raced, i met them at brekkie.

i'm a foodie not a gambler so i lost a whopping $1.50.

the food spots do close early but ya'll got feet and it's vegas.  walk a little to the bars and buffets!  might do ya some good - try it in 5" heels for a solid calf work out.

dings: walls are thin.  we were set until the last night when some family with screaming kiddos moved in next door.  bring ear plugs.

as for the $20 resort fee - lots of places stick that in. be sure to factor in parking, wifi and other goodies like free brekkie before committing if you are on a budget.  otherwise, just head elsewhere.  it's vegas! take a cab.  better yet, a limo.

the pool part-ee was fun with unce-unce tunes so like i said, bring ear plugs if you want to sleep in.  the food and alchie is super reasonable. have fun, nap, have more fun, nap, repeat until you take off.

xx

I wish I could be a fan cause I think it can have what it takes. I would definitely recommend this place. The lazy river is awesome. The tram is convenient  and not too many people know about this. Housekeeping is awesome. Rooms are nice. now let me tell you where i was disappointed. there is no WiFi in the RESORT FEE neither is the sauna in the gym AND neither is checking email in the business room they want to charge you for everything. They did have wifi in the food court but lets face it, who wants to sit in a very LOUD and smelly atmosphere to use the internet and or do work.  while everyone watches you. But I guess i should have looked this up before I made reservations. overall its still a nice hotel and great location.

I just recently stayed here for the second time.  I took an early flight out and i was pleasantly surprised that we could check in at 10am.  The rooms here are nice and the price was really affordable.  If your staying at the hotel you can get 35% off Jabbawockeez tickets.  The show was pretty cool and wasn't expensive so I was happy we checked that out.  If you gamble enough at MGM casinos and have a players card you can use your points towards your room rate.

This review is purely for the room I was assigned to (not for the hotel lobby\/casino which is nice, clean, standard for a the Vegas strip hotel). The room was nothing to sing songs about. I was ignored when I asked if there was any room available that was at a higher floor & maybe with a bit of a view (I don't expect strip views and hot tub, but I do expect a little bit of effort when someone asks for anything... especially when paying Vegas strip rices). They proceeded to simply give me what come up on their computers, with no efforts in looking for availability for something a bit better. OK, fine. OK, now I'm in my room. There is no wifi at all (because the room is far from everything... the wifi literally doesn't reach). I am right above the air conditioning units, over the parking lot area, in the very back back of the hotel.  Since the room is hidden away at the very back, and at the lowest floor possible, I only get EDGE service on my phone (which is good for pretty much nothing, not even phone calls), so i'm not only possibly the worst room at Monte Carlo, I'm also unable to chill in bed on the web, in between my escapades on the Strip.  I found an old\/used\/dried up coffee package in the coffee machine in the morning... it hadn't been cleaned. There was no hair drier (isn't this a standard even for a non-baller room??). Needless to say, the room was not good. It served it's purpose, which is to give me a place to sleep with a nice king sized bed, but that's all. For the price? I would not stay there again. Certainly not in that wing \/ floor \/ room specifically. Again... the lobby is nice and big and bright and clean. It's a historic hotel (one of the originals!) so it's beautiful with it's chandeliers, for sure ;) But I would highly recommend demanding a better room on a higher floor (even if it costs more) because if they have their way, you'll get stuck in the back like I did.... gggrrrrr! Thanks for reading!

If you can't fall asleep after too much Vegas stimulation, just look at the tired atmosphere around this place and you'll be nodding off in no time.  Good news is it's attached to Aria and very close to MGM Grand and New York New York

Unbelievable how terrible we were treated just terrible and after sitting on hold several different times I felt disrespected and just flat out mistreated. I have stayed here several times now and this time may be my last it got so bad we ended up switching to a different hotel within 1 night about 12 hours staying there. Broken shower blood on ceiling light issues plain out rude when checking in and we talked to Ryan a staff member who I was led to believe was a manager questioned if I was a blood expert and when I asked to send someone up he said "well we don't have a blood expert in the building" somehow when I report that as a issue it didn't do much. I was questioned why didn't we report it when we got in. Mind you that we arrived at 1am and that we had a 8 hr drive and were exhausted when we arrived. Staff such as bell hop,valet, room service was excellent but it wasn't enough to get me to stay. No one contacted me after and I stayed polite with the staff but overall just a terrible experience the trip was for my birthday And now we are at the Rio.

Just as I was starting to love Monte for it's excellent location & reasonable rooms, they are going to change it all up.  Great spot if you are going to a show at the arena, but now it's going to cost twice as much.  And one of my favorite Sunday spots for football, The Pub, will be no more.  Rooms do need updating, but leave old Monte alone!!

I just spent Labor Day Weekend at Monte Carlo Resort and Casino!  Overall, I really enjoyed my experience at this hotel and I would recommend it to friends.

Although it's not the nicest hotel on the strip and a little bit older than the surrounding hotels like Aria, but it was still relatively clean and I'm happy to say I was not greeted with a cloud of smoke upon entering the lobby during check-in.  

The Cons:
1.  It's on the south end of the strip which is far from the night clubs we wanted to check out (ex: XS @ Encore)
2. They charge a daily resort fee
3. Older rooms and bathrooms
4. Thin walls (could hear neighbors coughing or talking sometimes)
5. One worker at the bell desk was a bit unpleasant upon our check out

The Pros:
1.  Not too expensive
2.  There is a free tram that runs from Monte Carlo\/Aria to Crystals shopping to Bellagio and back
3.  Spacious rooms
4. The casino area isn't too smokey like other hotels I've walked through
5. Jabbawockeez! 
6. The employees at the front desk and Concierge are all very pleasant and helpful
7.  Cute shops 
8. There is a wave pool and lazy river (did not have time to check it out though)
9. There is a cafe that is open 24 hours 
10. Bed and pillows were comfortable 

I really enjoyed my stay at Monte Carlo and wouldn't mind staying again the next time I visit Las Vegas!

I am giving this hotel a 3 star rating because the captions on the TV were "not available".  This is in direct defiance of the Americans with Disabilities Act passed in 1990.  I stayed at this hotel from 4\/4 to 4\/8 and was hugely disappointed not to get captioning on the TV.  When pressing the "CC" button on the remote control, a message "Not Available" appeared on the TV screen.  Also observed several casino patrons *smoking* ... I thought smoking was not allowed in any public building ?

  Otherwise the room and bathroom were very nice and clean..

2.47 stars.

Monte Carlo is about as mediocre a place as you can get.  I really see now why a lot of reviewers give it the 3-star.  There was really nothing wrong with it, but if you're going to Vegas, why not find a place that has some personality?  Everything that's good about Monte, some other place definitely does better.  Here we go:

Room:  Plain, clean, functional.  Bed was not the most comfy, TV was weak (OK, so no one watched TV anyway), and the bathroom was standard.  Better rooms almost anywhere for the same price.  Non-strip view of the NYNY wasn't really that bad.  AC was ice-cold.

Casino:  Boooooring.  This was probably the worst part.  Standard games, dealers were on the quiet side (one craps dealer, Robert, was TERRIBLE but another guy offset him).  Players' card (MGM Grand) is good for a lot of other casinos.  Better casino's at Mirage, NYNY, MGM Grand, Flamingo, or some of the low-roller joints.

Pool:  Very good.  Lazy river was cool, cabana service was great.  DJ kept it loud, with enough Britney and Lady Gaga to go around.  The crowd, however, is a bit on the middle-aged side.  Felt like a topless hot tub with all the male boobs hanging out.  I didn't really notice until after going to Hard Rock for "Relax" but now YOU will.  Mirage, Flamingo, Palms, and Hard Rock all do it much better.

Buffet:  Surprisingly GOOD!  Lot of selection, taco bar, roast meats, sushi, etc.  Did not have fresh seafood, though.  

Service:  About as unnoticable as possible.  This is a good thing, but sometimes I just want a little low-roller attention.  Housekeeping forgot extra soap 2 days in a row.  Front desk was good, they knocked off the wi-fi that my buddy used by mistake.  Didn't use concierge.

Can't say yes or no here.  I'd rather head back to Flamingo anytime for the same price.  Also not a big fan of the South Strip, as I prefer the next few blocks up...  Skip the Monte.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times and they are always very helpful and nice. Price was not bad I booked my room a day in advanced and it was a 1 master bedroom for $70 not bad at all... You have the famous Diablos Cantina under you and it's also so close to the strip so you have pretty much everything close by! That's a plus! Also I recommend you book your stay ahead of time they have a separate line for people who are checking in and it goes by faster... They also always have early check in available so you can get up to your room before 3. Not always guaranteed tho but all 3 times that I have stayed there we were able to do an early check in... Housekeepers are also very nice and they do a good job of cleaning up your room they are not always knocking on your door like other places and annoying you lol. Although this last time that I stayed at Monte Carlo they are doing construction so be prepared for that.. Construction workers start drilling and doing what they gotta do at 7ish I personally DID NOT mind at all but if you are a light sleeper and you wish to get your sleep you will find this very annoying @ 7am so just don't stay here until there construction is FULLY complete. (In my opinion)

I came here for my wedding anniversary with my husband  since this is where we stayed when he proposed to me. The check in process was long...I guess as expected. The lady was nice and offered us more upgraded rooms for a slightly higher price. I thought the room was going to be nice and have that new room feel. First thing I noticed was the pillow cases didn't fit the pillows, one of the pillow cases was turned inside out, and then one of them had stains on them. So gross....yeah those things should not happen in a "new room" or any room for that matter. Overall I wouldn't  pay money to stay here again.

Was there for 3 nights in a non smoking room.  was in room 25214 which smelled like smoke....as in some one was smoking weed next door.  Called security and turns out the ventilation  in that room was continious to the smoking level. They did switch me to different room for the last 12 hours  but did not get any apology  or courtesy  discounts for ruining my stay there. Not to mention i had severe headaches and sleepless 2 nights.. ...

I stayed at the Monte Carlo the weekend of the Rock N' Roll Marathon. My friends and I planned this trip and booked the hotel about 9 months in advance. We chose the hotel based on its convenient location about midway between the start and finish lines of the race.

At the time we booked the hotel we had no idea it would be under construction during our visit. We never received any advance warning of this fact. It was actually just a few days prior to our trip when I was looking at Las Vegas travel forums online that I saw a post about the construction and what a headache it was. At that point it was too late for us to find alternate accommodations, so we kept with our original plan.

When we arrived the employee at the check-in counter didn't mention the renovations at all. He did ask if we would like a "quieter" higher floor room for a $5 upcharge. We said yes to this, thinking that we would avoid construction noise. 

During check-in we were told about the resort fee, which is approx. $30 per day in addition to the room rate (we had already pre-paid the room) so they put a hold on my friend's card for the resort fee plus $5 high-floor, plus an "extra" hold. Kind of standard, and we didn't say anything about it. 

I think my biggest disappointment of this trip was the pool being closed. I had heard they had a nice lazy river and really just had my heart set on relaxing by the pool. We started to wonder what our resort fee was good for since the pool was closed, so the next day we went down to the lobby to find out what our other options were. The employee at the desk this time gave us what sounded like a canned response that the resort fee covered "wifi, complimentary newspaper, boarding pass printing, and access to the spa and gym". My friend who had booked the room tried to see if they would reduce the resort fee based on the reduced resort offerings but he wouldn't budge on it. 

To be clear, the wifi at this hotel is open to anyone that walks in, there's no password or need to enter your room number. We never saw a complimentary newspaper during our hotel stay, and we didn't need to print our boarding passes. So, we decided to check out the one remaining amenity, the spa. 

When we stopped in the spa we were informed that if we wanted to use the spa whirlpool we would have to pay an additional $25 for a spa pass. Seriously??? After we're already paying $30\/day in resort fees? That was nuts. She said the normal rate is $35 for the spa pass and as guests we get a discount. That was the stupidest thing I've ever heard. (And while I would have LOVED to visit the spa prior to the race, there was no way I was going to pay extra for it.)

So, long story short, if this hotel staff was compassionate in any way they could have given us a spa voucher or something to make us happy guests. But they didn't seem to care. 

Truly, we didn't have a horrible stay here. The room was nice, the beds were comfortable, and the housekeeping staff did a great job supplying extra towels and pillows when we asked. I just don't feel like we got what we paid for with the resort fee.

Bonus: Ongoing headaches with the hotel after our stay as my friend still hasn't had the hold on her credit card released two weeks later...

We stayed here for two nights and right from the beginning everyone was very nice and accommodating. The rooms were nice we even got some what of an upgrade to have a strip view. The only thing I have a complaint about was a bartender down stairs at one of their bars. I don't remember the name of it but the old man there was very rude and made it so hard for us girls to get drinks and just gave us major attitude. Other than that the stay was great. Oh yeah the pool was closed down due to remodeling which kinda sucked but they gave you the option to go to any other MGM casino.

I will never, ever, be staying here again.  The rooms are overpriced for a weekend stay - had I noticed I was paying $250 a night to stay here, I would've picked anywhere else.  They are currently doing construction, so if you are planning on sleeping past 9AM, don't stay here.  Also, the walls and doors are paper thin.  We could hear everyone walking past our room in the hallway even if they weren't being loud.  We could hear doors closing of any room near us, and also we could hear rooms near us as well.  

None of the rooms come with any fridges (you have to pay $25 a night), no microwaves, and the room we had was lacking in USB ports and electrical outlets - overall the room we stayed in was outdated.

Also if you want a pool at the hotel, don't stay here - because as of the time of this review, they have no pool.  You can use the pool at Mandalay Bay or MGM Grand, both of which are a 20-30 minute walk away.  We used the MGM Grand pool and I was severely impressed - it's a pretty nice setup.  They have several pools and a lazy river.  Mandalay Bay is rated as a "Top Pool" but we just didn't want to walk that far away.

The hotel Staff is pretty good and nice, but it doesn't make up for the crappiness of the hotel.  The first room I was checked into (which btw, took me an hour to check into), was so bad I made them switch me into another room - and I have NEVER done that before.  The bathroom was so utterly disgusting and run down, there was no way I was staying in that room.  Only two of the four spickets for the shower head worked, and the rest of the time the water just dripped down.  

The Casino floor is okay, but they are missing some of my favorite games (like Big Bang Theory and a different Hangover game), so I can't rate it very high.  The best thing about this place, is that there's a food court with a Subway, Sbarro, Starbucks, Nathan's, Chinese\/Mexican and one other place I can't remember the name of that was very great to have when stumbling drunk back to my hotel room at 2AM.  They also have an Ice Bar here, as well as another bar that generally is advertising a $4 draft special all day.  

The location of the hotel is also pretty good.  NYNY and T-Mobile Arena is right across the street, where as a tram ride will take you to Vdara\/Aria\/Cosmo\/Bellagio.  From Bellagio you can pretty much get anywhere else on the other side of the strip.

However, after saying all that, I will not be staying here again until the renovation is complete, if even then.  If I'm paying $250 a night for a room, that room better come with all the sparks and whistles.

Gross! I've stayed at motels that far exceeded the Monte Carlo standards! I don't normally complain (or write reviews) but I couldn't take it. I called the front desk and they immediately gave us a new room! Great, I thought... until our next room was almost identical in cleanliness and worn out furniture! I tried to get a room at another hotel, but on this holiday weekend, everyone was booked! This hotel is old, over 20 years old, and is definitely showing it's age. They have waited too long to renovate. Stay somewhere else! Anywhere else!

What better way to fly to Vegas to celebrate our 1 year anniversary?!
NOTHING!

The hubs and I flew our happy ass's to Vegas for the weekend and decided to forgo our normal stay at Excalibur (let's face it, it's cheap AF) and opted for a little more class - so to the Monte Carlo we went! Here are the takeaways:

STAFF: Super friendly, but ridiculously understaffed. We checked in on a Friday night, stood in a line wrapping around the entire lobby to check in! A mere four people manned the front desk and the online check in kiosks were off. Thankfully - after about 30 minutes in line we were greeted and welcomed to Las Vegas! Originally we had booked a strip room view, and were offered a "free" upgrade to a nicer room on a higher floor. I made sure to ask the attendant if there was an additional charge, she said "no, on us!". Until we saw the bill - which had an up charge of $35. Other than that, staff was friendly, accommodating, and made sure our room was cleaned each day!

ROOMS: Our suite was spacious featured a large king bed, window overlooking the Aria and 2 bathrooms - which is more than i have in my apartment! The space was arranged nicely with a large couch, bar area and a little dining area - which totally made the space! Although it had some dust, it wasn't a big deal :)

PRICES\/LOCATION\/VIBE: For 3 nights it wasn't too bad on our wallet and cost us just around $450. The location is perfection, as it's not quite at the end of the strip, but more in the middle - which makes it easier to walk to various casinos and restaurants! Because it's located next to New York, New York - there are plenty of options available!! Vibe is relaxed, yet fun. Everyone here seemed to be enjoying themselves! Not too bad for Vegas!

**Pro Tip: A food court is located in the back of the casino, making grab and go meals - easy peasy!

Stayed for a conference at special rates so the price was A-OK. The Suite was OK and had a jacuzzi, but the 'strip view' was disappointing since we were so far from the strip all we could see was the top of the casino.

CASINO! - PEDER!!!!!  (Peh-dare or Peter?) Watch out for this older scandinavian mustached gentleman dealer, he will take all your money!!!!!! Aside from that the casino is a nice cozy size with all the games you could want. Warm-up Goldfish for me so I can hit the jackpot :)

Pros: location, tram to aria bellagio, and the icebar.

Cons: It's no Venetian or Wynn or even douchebag Bellagio.

I have to say I was a bit disappointed with the Monte Carlo. The hotel seems like they skimped on construction costs and here's why. Walls seem thin. We could hear the people in the other room next to ours. People walking and talking in the hallway are easily heard. The tour helicopters flying down the strip are easily heard through the windows. No wifi in the rooms only an old school wired internet cable. No refrigerator. The electrical outlets were either missing the plastic cover (behind the nightstand) or felt loose when pulling the plug out of the outlet. Seemed like a possible safety hazard to me. 

I realize this isn't the Bellagio but for the money I expected a little bit better quality. We stayed on the fifth floor and can hear the traffic down below on the street.

This was my first time staying here. For the cost of our hotel for a 2 night stay was about $230 not bad but the one thing I didn't like was the $20 resort fee they charge for amenities I think I can do without... I don't remember specifically but one was definitely to have Internet access using an Ethernet cord... are those still around? The room was nice and clean. It had a fresh appeal to it and the bed was way comfy. I really enjoyed the pool area it was clean, heated and the staff was super friendly. Also the lobby smelled abnormally good like ocean breeze lol... Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to check out any of the eateries or the club in the hotel.

Overall coma pared to the other hotels I was looking to stay this one isn't bad so I would stay here again.
Nice staff and was reasonably priced. However some of the furniture has seen some better days, it could use some updating.

Huge price drop on Wednesday made me stay here. Monte Carlo is a pretty well-known name, I didn't even hesitate when I booked the room.

The place is really nice, everything is high class and I had a good time here. People who work here are polite and professional. The location is on the strip, which gives you a lovely view of Vegas, depends on what room you end up getting.

Weird thing was, the bathroom in my room didn't seem to be well-prepared. The bathtub was stuck and the toilet cap was a little broken when I first entered the bathroom. That literally made me wonder if they also didn't prepare my bed sheet...

Other than that, everything else is great. Good casino, good food court, good gift shop, nothing to complain.

I enjoyed my night here, and will definitely come back here again, hopefully with a girlfriend.

I don't know how anyone could ever come back here.. First impression -not good, old, dingy, smoky, worn out, pool dirty, trash on ground, yuck.. Gives me a stomachache!
Changed to two stars because I slept great, comfortable bed and quiet.

Yeah, It was a nice hotel to stay for the two nights. I didn't have any problems nor encountered any issues with the room that I stayed in. The bed was comfortable, the room temperature was nice, I didn't see a dust, unexpected objects on the floor, and no revolting objects that previous guests may have left before they checked out from the room. 

The buffet was nice and I enjoyed eating the steaks. The food was great but I wish for the restaurant to clearly write the names of the food labeled on the glass because it was hard for me to read the fancy writing. One example on the steak, I assumed it was written "NY Steak." With the fancy writing it made it look like "NYSTEAK" added with fancy cursive writing that it made my mind response as: "???"  

The only thing that I regret was not gambling at Monte Carlo. I should have but my conscience was telling me to visit Aria and Vdara hotels and gamble over there. Overall it was a nice hotel for me and I wish for the other guests to give Monte Carlo a chance and enjoy your time visiting in Las Vegas.

I would never stay here again.  First, after booking way in advance, they did not have what we booked.  Then they never bothered to clean our room, even after asking.  Never again!!!!!!!  There WiFi wasn't working for a long time.
This hotel is a construction zone! They start at5am. There has been NO water since 2am..the front desk isn't andwering their phone. WARNING..you stay here at your own peril!

Absolutely horrendous and unacceptable. We booked through Tripadvisor's Tingo.

We check into the hotel at 5:30 PM we have dinner reservations for 8:00 so we are in a hurry to get ready and rush out the door. While getting ready I keep getting whiffs of a urine smell, but can't figure out where it's coming from. I hurry up and get ready and leave for the night, not returning until very late. By this time we go to sleep and when I wake up in the morning, again I keep getting smells of urine. 

I start smelling all over the bed sheets and on the very bottom of the sheet where it was tucked in from the bed having been made is a spot of urine. I assumed that it was just the sheet at this point and asked for them to change the sheets and asked (why I needed to ask and it was not offered is beyond me) at that time for some sort of compensation as this is absolutely unacceptable. They offer a $50 food and beverage credit. I told them I do not want the credit, I would like some compensation off the reservation total. However, I was told that since we booked through Tingo that they are unable to process this. I felt like I had no choice but to just accept it. We didn't want to change rooms at this point since we had unpacked all of our things and were all settled in. They come and change the sheets and everything was fine. I was at this point satisfied. 

Until I bend down and keep smelling urine, my friend sits down on the floor to put her shoes on and she smells it as well. We start smelling around the entire room and find that there are multiple areas that smell of urine. It seemed like someone had snuck a dog into the room and it marked it's scent everywhere. At this point we ask to change rooms, and I am beyond disgusted. 

I am forced to go down and speak to a manager and explain the situation and request AGAIN for some sort of compensation off of the room fee. Again, I am told that because I booked through Tingo that they're unable to do anything. I felt as though I was being penalized for booking through a third party service. Why would you allow your hotel to be booked through it if you don't intend on providing the same service compared to if I were to book directly through the hotel. 

I spoke to one last manager when we checked out and she was the worst of them all. Not only was she rude and condescending she made me feel as though I were being unreasonable. If you were to book a hotel and it was filled with the scent of urine would you be happy? The manager then proceeds to tell me that going through Tingo is the ONLY way to get my money back. 

So, I call Tingo and they tell me the opposite, that going through the hotel is the only way to get my money back and that they tried to contact the Monte Carlo and they are refusing to do so. So between the two companies I keep getting pushed around and bounced back and forth and neither are willing to assist in anyway. I cannot explain how frustrated I am, it is not about the money it is about the principle of the matter. 

Bottomline: 
1. Don't ever book through Tingo, and be weary of booking through third party services as the hotels seem to act like they are unable to assist you when you do.
2. Don't ever give the Monte Carlo any business. They clearly lack in cleanliness and any respect for their hotel and their customers
3. I am in the serve industry and I understand that yelling and screaming will not get you anywhere which is why I kept calm and was very reasonable throughout this entire process. Maybe if I would have raised my voice someone would have listened. 

I'm a LOCAL from Vegas have been since I was 7 years old. I've worked in numerous properties on the strip and never in my life have I experienced this level of dissatisfaction. I tried to have a great staycation with my friends, and unfortunately this is the looming memory I'll have. I would NEVER recommend staying here, and will tell everyone I encounter about my experience.

You got caught cheating.  That is the plain truth of the matter.  

You welched on a bet.

In the old days a goon would come break your hands with a hammer.

Now, I have to "empathize" with the plight of a poor casino on the verge of collapse needing to mechanically alter the normal performance of the machine to intentionally prevent it from paying out.

I sincerely hope that you grow as ugly on the outside as you are inside.

I will be reporting you to the Nevada Gaming Commission.  I took a very clear set of photos of the cheating.

Perhaps you should have asked me for those.  Now you can see them when your machines are tagged for audit.

Overall experience was great! We got the cheapest room available, but it was a beautiful, clean room with a nice view of New York New York. Rates are very reasonable, especially if you go during the week. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The grounds were very well kept. The pools were awesome (loved the wave pool!). There is the "Street of Dreams" inside which has a few bar\/restaurants and some boutiques. The buffet wasn't that great, not worth the $24. But the food court they have is convenient when coming back at odd hours of the night! There was a Mcdonald's (CASH ONLY), Subway, Sbarro, and Starbucks. The casino here was nothing special, but I would recommend checking out the ALL ICE bar, unfortunately we didn't get to go but it looked really cool...literally! The location of the Monte Carlo was not bad, right next door to New York New York and near Planet Hollywood. Not exactly the middle of the strip, more towards the end, so take into consideration where your going to go because there aren't many places to cross the street on Las Vegas Blvd.I highly recommend getting an all day bus pass!

Pro's
- Good location
- Decent price
Con's
-Boring rooms
-Parking is in an open lot so stuff gets stolen off your car....  :(
-Construction going on 
-Lance Burton's picture in your face 24\/7

So we stayed here in August 2011 and we had a good time. Our room was clean. The service was good ,we liked the value of the hotel for being on the strip, we had a good time at the pool and we liked that we didn't have to walk across a hotel to get to self park, the valet or to get a cab (everything was laid out well)

So when we decided to celebrate our 3 year anniversary, we thought why not return? We initially got a handicap room because they had no other room available. We were told that the room was exactly the same except there were rails around the shower and toilet. The rails did not bother us but the room was gross. The carpet was filthy, there was a blood stain on our comforter, which smelled like a dirty gym (GROSS). There was a blood stain on one of the towels in the bathroom (DOUBLE GROSS), and the other towel had light brown stains and a hole in the middle of it (WTF). So we called down to have our room changed but they couldn't move us until the next day so FINE, we toughed it out for the night and tried to touch very little. 

The next morning my girlfriend (now fiance) actually proposed in the room. So the moment was extremely memorable because she made it extremely personal and sweet BUT what I found out afterwards really upset me. She told me how she called the concierge ahead of time and was trying to arrange a special room service breakfast (heart shaped pancakes and what not) and the guy just shut her down and said we don't do that. He didn't offer any alternatives or even give any suggestions. Now she prefaced the request with, I am proposing. I get that they have limitations but seriously?? You could not do a cheesy heart pancake? Obviously, the moment was perfect as is and I said yes, but to just shut someone down and not offer an alternative is ridiculous. She ended up even ordering the flowers from an outside flower shop because the hotel was ridiculously unhelpful. 

They moved us up to the 29th floor the next day and the room, towels and sheets were much better and the next two nights went off without incident. 

Between the beyond gross room and the completely unhelpful concierge, we won't be revisiting the Monte Carlo.

This place needs a serious update. The rooms are clean, but they are old and dingy. They have seriously seen their better days, as the furniture is scratched and rundown. Checking in was a bit of a problem, as they did not have the rate available that we had made our reservations under at 3pm, their normal check-in time, so they gave us a handicap room, with an awful shower. The towels are scratchy and old. But, for the price on a holiday weekend, and, with the fact that in Vegas no one really spends that much time in their hotel room, it was an ok deal.
It seams this place is under continuous renovation. No pool and 10$ parking. So what are those hotel fees for? No frills here.

My husband had a seminar to attend at this hotel so we decided to stay here for convenience We arrived midweek, so not busy at all and found great parking. Once we got to the front desk line and had to go through the maze of ropes, we were conveniently cut in line by other guests WITH the help of a hotel employee. I made a comment as I walked past him about why we had to walk the ropes and they were just let through, and this fool acted like I couldn't speak English. Anyway, moving forward, we get into our room... there's no in-room dining menu and when I called for someone to bring me one, they asked me if I just wanted to go through the menu with them... what?! Oh, and room service ends at like 2pm... Our room did not have a clock and we were supposedly given a king. Mind you, my bed at home is a king. My husband is a human calculator\/ruler guy and he even said it was a tad small. 

Anyway, room service guy was friendly (I had the same person both mornings we stayed) and the hotel in general wasn't so busy (again, we stayed midweek to Friday so maybe that's why). Not sure if we will be staying here again. It wasn't an overall bad experience.

Is everything in this room broken?
While I'm only staying in the hotel for the night. I can't help but wonder why everything in my room seems to be broken... okay, not everything is broken, but it might as well be. When I first got into the hotel, it looked nice and I thought it'd be more of an upgraded compared to the Planet Hollywood - but I was wrong. Once the doors opened to my floor, I realized that this hotel is rundown. The walls and doors look dirty and the border is bent and coming off, but hey, it's only the outside so I won't complain too much. While the room doesn't have any bad odors, it did have old gum on the carpet - which was a bit gross. When I went into the bathroom we discovered the little mirror was actually broken so if it was touched it, it would fall off and possibly shatter.
After walking the strip, later that night, I tried to turn on the lamp between the two beds and the button was broken - at least they had two more in the room, otherwise, the room would be pretty dark. When we turned on the TV, the remote was having issues and would not change the station. It just seems like this hotel is a bit of a mess at moment, which is disappointing, because I excepted so much more...

Also, skip the Buffet, tastes like a frozen TV dinner, definitely not worth it - even if you get one of the meals for free. We found plastic on the pizza too.

We've stayed at this hotel before and it's been fine. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because there is no disclosure of the loud banging construction going on at 7AM. It is hard to walk and drive around the construction. A new theater is being built in front of the Monte Carlo. I would have made reservations somewhere else.

I stayed here on a vacation for a couple of days but really spent most of my time out in the city or in the other casinos. When you are in Vegas, you are not going to be most of your time in the room, well, unless you are there for a honeymoon, or a romantic trip with your significant other. The hotel is nice, clean, good customer service, and not smoky. The rooms do need some upgrading but it's expected after servicing so many people that come and go. They had plenty of tables, slots and entertainment to pass the time away. They have a food court and restaurants. I would not mind staying here again if the price is right. And having WI-FI connection is a plus for me and was glad to know they had it.

Upon arrival the check in line was ridiculous, so we checked our bags and played some slots. Which was fine, went back later and line was shorter.  We checked in and the lady asked if we self parked or valet parked, we told her that we used valet parking. She said to hold on to our voucher and the valet parking would be comped.  That was awesome. 
We get up to our room, nothing special about it.  Definitely needs some remodeling. Was very disappointed that we didn't have at least a coffee maker in our room. Nothing else was in our room, like a menu for room service, or what amenities the the hotel has. We stayed for 5 days.  On the 4th day we were gone almost all day, came back to the room around 7pm, and our room hadn't been cleaned, huge disappointment. My husband called at 8:30 pm for our room to be cleaned as we were leaving to go have dinner.  
The next day we were leaving, and I received a email to review our final bill and check out.  The bill was for $26.00 for valet parking.  So we went down to the desk and told them we were told the valet parking was going to be comped. The lady was very rude and said no its not, who would tell you that. We explained it was told to us upon check in. She just said no, I'm afraid not. I was already pissed and just paid the money to get out of this place. We go to leave and scan our ticket for valet to bring our car, and the machine says we owe $26.00. So even more upset by this time, go to the valet booth and talk to someone, show her we paid the $26.00 at check out. She tells us, we only paid half, it's the balance and would not give us our car unless we paid it. So this just made our stay here worse. Paid $52.00 for something we were told was comped, unreal.  
We chose this hotel because of its location and pricing, but now see you get what you pay for.

Although the lobby and casino are pleasant, our room seriously grossed me out. The refrigerator was unplugged, so as my husband is plugging it in, he finds an empty bag of chips behind it. I then made the mistake of walking around in the room barefoot, only to step in a huge, cold wet spot on the floor right next to the bed. Gross! I then went to check out the bathtub because I wanted to try out some bath bombs I just bought. The bathtub was grimy and looked exactly like thousands of people had used it before me. I opted for a shower and the bottom of the tub was so gross that I kept my toes lifted the whole time. There were weird stains on every surface-the floor, a chair, the couch. Just ew.  There was also this weird bell sound that would go off outside our room every 5 minutes or so. I would not stay here again and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

I am not a girl who expects a lot from a 3 star hotel in Vegas. With that being said I was very pleased with my stay and the money that I paid. There were a couple snafus during check-in such as the first room given to me had the wrong bed and the second room had housekeeping still in it but the front desk was very accomodating and housekeeping was apologetic about it. I thought the room was good sized and clean. As long as a room in Vegas is clean, doesnt smell, has a bed and a shower I'm all good. What do you really use your room in Vegas for anyways? Just to sleep and get ready. 

I really enjoyed the pool area, I was concerned at first that it would be a little lame because of the city center blocking the sun and it being an older hotel there wouldn't be any good music to make it like a party atmosphere. But the city center had no impact on my experience and the pool had a DJ there that played good music all day. Loved the lazy river, definitely provided a lot of laughs for me and my friends. 

I would've given the Monte Carlo 5 stars but I was super disappointed in the gaming area. It just seemed so dead. Although from what I've been reading this is possibly a result of this recession our country is going thru. 

Definitely would stay here again, like I said totally worth what I paid.

Booked a King Sized room for two nights. The room looked and smelled old. Well aged carpet and a bathroom with a bath faucet growing mold inside the handle paired with a hard water crusted shower head. Not the most welcoming hotel casino.

Great spot on the strip. Not to crowded. Not full of hipsters and not full of old people. I was  happy to stay here for my 26th birthday. Table limits are reasonably low compared to some of the other surrounding casinos. When we arrived they asked us if we would like to upgrade for a 15 dollars more a night to a MONACO SUITE and of course we said yes.  It was an amazing suite just renovated with a his and her bathroom. 

I love Vegas, being from LA, its just a 4 hour drive or if I want to plan ahead of time 42min flight!    VIVA LAS VEGAS!!

Came here for a family reunion. The entrance is very deceiving. I guess because it is an older hotel you can't expect much, but for being the same price per night as say, The Palms, this place is more like the Monte Dumpo. Rooms are gross and for paying a $30 hotel service fee, you have to pay extra for pool floats. Won't ever stay here again. Oh and M Life points don't count towards anything and you don't get any points in the food court except Starbucks.
It was a wonderful stay. I got the spa suite and it had the view of the strip. All I can say is I will go back to this hotel again.

This review is for the maintenance gentleman Randall. I called and asked him for help with the hot water in the shower, her came and helped right away although he was on his lunch, I took about 30 mins of his lunch from him. Thank you so much for helping!

The location was great and close to everything. The pools were also very nice but closed early (7 pm). The rooms were below average with few outlets, no provisions such as a coffee machine, or just plastic cups or a fridge or any guides about the hotel like hours and information pamphlets. However the lobby was nice. Overall, it's a decent stay but not great.

This hotel looks super nice inside and out... I don't know about inside the rooms, but I will definitely be staying here next time to try it out.

Anyway, I watched the Jabbawahkeez at the theater inside and it was very spacious and the seats were comfortable.
Later on we went to a lounge they have inside the hotel called "Brand". It was a $20 entry fee and for ladies it was unlimited drinks. Inside the lounge, it was very small and the few available seats were for people that payed more I guess? The bartender was super fast and got to everyone pretty quick. Overall, it was a good experience... I don't know if i'll go inside "brand" next time but for sure I'm getting a room there :)

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip and celebration of his remission from brain cancer and boy were we disappointed! This hotel is disgusting, outdated and way over priced! We had to change rooms three times, wasting most of our first day. The staff was friendly but didn't really do much to fix the actual problems. The furniture was broken, dented, dirty, dusty and sooooo outdated. Stains on the walls, carpets and drapes. The rooms don't even have a fridge! They make you rent one for $30 a day!! I refused to pay for that after having to change rooms so many times and they eventually took the fee off. The bathroom was so old and ugly. In fact the whole room was ugly. Really ugly, dreary, musty and just plain gross! The management staff just kept telling us that they are in the process of renovating and gave us two vouchers to their buffet which I thought was unsatisfactory for all the issues we had. You could tell the staff was getting multiple complaints about the rooms because they didn't seem too concerned or to really care or try to fix anything. We got our buffet vouchers and went for lunch where my husband got food poisoning! Our trip was cut short because he was so sick all day from that stupid buffet! We will NEVER come back here. Stay away and spend your money elsewhere! We were so upset that our celebratory trip was ruined because of this disgusting hotel.

Stayed at the Monte Carlo for the 1st time and i would have to say that the stay was just "OK". 

Upon entering from the parking level, it didn't smell like cigarette. What a surprise! 
Check in was a breeze i was in the line for no more than 5 minutes and we got out room.

The hotel is easy to navigate if you follow the signs. :-) The casino floor is full of young adults in their mid to late 20s trying to party and get drunk. Oh yeah!

We recieved our room on the 30th floor. Pretty high, makes for a great view! The room itself was just "OK". Nothing really stood out. Modern "european" style. 

My only complaint... loud next door occupants. It was 4 am and they were SO loud i almost wanted to yell "STFU" but eventually they got quiet and got rest.

Checking out was a breeze. Drop your key cards off at the elevator box and fill out a form, and they will email you a copy of your folio receipt.

Would i stay here again? Probably, but i would try and get a suite for a MUCH better experience.

I would give it 3.5 Stars.

I can't in good faith give this place five stars anymore. The construction outside woke me up at five in the morning and they are still drilling nonstop. I know they are rebranding and are not quite done with all of the improvements, but this place is just not the same anymore. Unless you get a really good rate and are a heavy sleeper, stay away from the "new" Monte Carlo.

I am at awe to believe that this hotel is rated 4 diamonds (as claimed plastered onto the walls of the lobby) Where do I start? First, the walls are paper thin. On one side of the wall I hear a couple arguing. On the other side I hear Chinese people arguing at 4 a.m.  The showers are so loud, I mean do I have to know when everyone around me is taking a shower? Second, the carpet and bed sheets are filthy. There were pink stains on the carpet and there were red stains on my bed sheets that I don't even want to guess what it could be. The pillows are probably the most uncomfortable things I've ever slept on. The shower was dripping when we arrived and it has to be adjusted a different angle every time we use it to get the dripping to stop. On top of everything, the hotel charges $22.40 a night for the "resort and hotel" amenities. Are you kidding me? This was nowhere close to a resort experience for us. I think the Travelodge across the street would've been better or just the same experience for a cheaper rate. Never again.

This place is definitely deceiving. Maybe the right word is conniving. 

I was gambling in the casino and called the blackjack dealer out on not knowing the rules because she was trying to talk me into doing things I didn't want to do and she was demanding that i must hit.... called the pitboss over and he said she must have been mistaken and I shouldn't get mad because there's nothing to get upset about. I guess they don't know that when you are gambling with your own money it matters when you catch the house trying to cheat you! Don't trust this place!
This place is ok but expected more for the price. The cafe is not that good.  I order the fried chicken and waffles and was not all that.

I stayed here from June 18-23 (EDC weekend). Loved that it's off the strip, close to Cosmo, and has a food court at the base floor. The room was very nice, but not the most extravagant. What won me over was definitely the staff. They were the friendliest and most efficient staff I've ever encountered in a hotel.

Stayed here after being stranded from winter storm. Friendly staff and very economical price. The room is outdated but they are renovating. I would give four stars but the water was turned off during the very early morning without notification. All the things that were low satisfaction is really non that big of a deal since the location is outstanding!

Don't get me wrong, it's not the Bellagio, Aria or even Planet Hollywood.  But what the Monte Carlo has that the others don't is amazing customer service.  The valet, front desk, bellman, cafe staff and the workers in all the shops were friendly, helpful, and good at their jobs.

The rooms are basic but clean.  The bathrooms need serious updating.  Our bathtub faucet leaked constantly, the sink faucet broke off in our hands (!) and the toilet seat broke also.  The toilet is incredibly loud-flushing, also.  The worn walls and cruddy (but clean) floors need desperate help, as do the walls in the hallways of the hotel.  But for the price it can't be beat.

Location is great.  Walkway to Aria, tram to Bellagio or City Center, CVS next door, quick walk to MGM, NYNY and Mandarin Oriental.  The construction in front is a little annoying but I am sure it will all look great when it is done.  

The casino is, however, filled with people up to no good.  We were approached by drug dealers and prostitutes several times, and there were a lot of people who looked like they were trying desperately to win their rent money. 

My suggestion is to stay at Monte Carlo and use the money you saved to gamble at Aria.

Normally, I write big, long reviews, even on "meh" places. The Monte Carlo was so thoroughly  "meh" that I'm just going to give the Cliffs Notes version.

Huge lines to check in. Took over half an hour. Only half the desks were staffed. The desk staff were very nice and very professional, though.

What kind of a hotel has a pool area that closes at 6 PM, and has only one hot tub for a pool area that has a capacity of many, many hundreds? Sure, Las Vegas gets hot... from May through August.
