The rest of the year (as when I was there, in April), I want to use the dang hot tub and not cuddle with the scary man in the Speedo next to me.

6 PM. What a total joke. I'm sure you want me on the casino floor, but sometimes, I just want to sit in the pool or the hot tub. Jeez.

We booked a room with a king bed, got up there to find two queens. After an eight-hour drive down, too exhausted to wait in that stupid line again to get it fixed, so we spent our anniversary getaway in separate beds. Awesome.

No wifi? $20 daily hotel fee (thinly veiled Internet charge)? Boo. Boo boo boo.

Toilets flush like airplane toilets but even more noisily and ferociously. Shouldn't weird me out, but it did.

Water got hot fast. That was nice. Shower heads were low, though.

They don't use covers on their comforters, just a sheet on top and bottom, so of course that doesn't stay more than one night. Annoying.

Location is great, of course. It's on the strip, after all.

Our room was pretty quiet. Nice.

Restaurants and shops didn't attract me for even a moment. Neither did any of their in-house shows. Bummer. Good thing we had a car.

In all, a blah stay--it was everything we did outside the hotel that made it a great vacation.

I'm still bugged about the pool hours. Enough that coupled with everything else, I will never, ever go back.

I got a nice room for a great price in Vegas. ($69.00 a night). Plus I got a $25 off food coupon which I used at the Buffet-see other review of Buffet. I got two 2 for 1 drink coupons and some other stuff I didn't use.)
The rooms were clean, bland but clean. The a\/c worked fine since it was 118 outside the 3 days I was there. I was lucky and got one of the bath tubs that drained right. My brother from South Carolina was in another room on the same floor and his drained really slow.
Overall it is a nice place and is a lot less for other comparable places. When you park, using the valet is a must. They are building a new convention center next door and the construction people are using the parking garage. They have Monte Carlo & the New York New York next door sharing the same garage. There is a small lot at street level but it is hard to find a spot in there. If you park valet, you don't have to worry about it. (I mean a $5 tip when they bring you your car that has been sitting in a covered garage is worth the money.
If you sign up for the players club you can charge meals, drinks and whatever else at 7 or 8 different hotels on the strip. It makes it so you don't have to carry that much cash with you when you go out.
(I only went to Las Vegas this time to meet my brother and his fiance who flew in. I wasn't really going there to gamble.)
While we were there, we went to see Hoover Dam. It was 9 a.m. and already 102 outside. I had gone to the Starbucks in the lobby and my wife had a breakfast sandwich from Mc Donalds. I went to fill up a plastic cup with ice for my 11 month old son at the Subway in the lobby. The dickhead that was working at Subway stopped helping his customer long enough to yell at me 20 feet away. "That's for customers only, don't take that." I went over, stood in line and asked him how much for a cup of ice for my 11 month old son. He said, "we don't sell ice. You need to pay full price for the beverage. Beverages are for customers only." I showed him my Starbucks cup and pointed to my wife's Mc D's. I told him we had the remains of 2 subs from his Subway up in the room. All I wanted was a cup of ice for my son. He said I needed to by something. I gave him $3 for a large soda and went to fill up the plastic cup I bought from them the previous night. I went back over and said, "Thank you for going out of your way and being a total douche to me. I really appreciate that you felt the need to yell at me from 20 feet away and try and embarrass me. The only thing that happened was the Monte Carlo now has a mark against them in my book and it took me an extra 5 minutes to get to Hoover Dam. At the end of the day, you will still be a douche though."
Everyone that was standing in his line laughed at his ass and he still had to help them. I walked away with my frown turned upside down.

If you plan on staying here the hotel is not updated. They state it  is but it isn't. has dirty  hall ways.  Rooms have dirty carpet make sure if you come bring shoes to wear at all times . Yuck. You can not even view your bill or check out on the TV. We come 4 times at least to Vegas and thought we would give them a try since 2 years ago we stayed her at it was terrible. The pool is a joke if you want a good seat you had better get here when the open 8 as people come and put towels down all over and leave. When you address the attendant she stated thats how it's done but we go and remove the towels ever hour. WRONG. I was there 3 1\/2 hours and they never came around. So many chairs with towels but No Customer. Made it difficult for people to sit.  

My last important suggestion if you are dumb enough to stay here. Do not give them your credit\/debit card to pay After being charged to my account of over 1,000 for a 390.00 bill which I went down and paid cash for and had to have the manger reverse the charges which is still holding my funds they say computer error on Monte Carlo system. Next day same thing again they took and are holding funds for 257.00. Manager said O my the computer did it again after talking to my bank they will not release my funds Back  in for 2 days   So with that said you better have plenty of cash ..

I just retired from a casino and now I know what 5 diamonds means with triple A. This hotel will not get my business and I will continue to tell everyone about our experiences 



I will be posting this on trip advisor. Don't stay here.

Booked two rooms for my family so we can celebrate Thanksgiving. Requested for connecting rooms that was granted, hence the 2 star. But we had plumbing issues the entire stay. They did send a room engineer to fix it twice but both times, nothing changed. 
I'm an Mlife member and have multiple vegas vacation already set for 2016. I doubt I'll book in this hotel again. 
Room change nor resort fee refund were both declined.

Dates of visit 2\/26-02\/29.

It is a basic no frills hotel.  Nothing fancy, but be honest who spends the majority of their time in a hotel room while in Vegas?! 

Areas that could be improved upon; wiping down the surface areas (had finger prints on the bathroom door); since when did hotels not have a coffee maker after a night out most need a caffeine pick me up, given our technology driven ways charging stations on the night stand would be helpful and when walking into the casino from the strip sometimes guests were hit with an unpleasant smell. 

The positive spots: Checking in & out was a breeze, got my tickets to the show, had a little snafu w\/ the tickets, concierge desk was closed & Mary at the front desk provided guidance that ultimately got my issue resolved.  Location provides easy access to all things Vegas. The minus 5 bar is located in the casino and is a cool experience :)  Diablo's Cantina is also located there and good place to meet friends for drinks and food. 

Overall I got what I needed, a place to rest my head after busy day on the town.

I definitely had fun at the Monte Carlo. Me and my friends came to celebrate some birthdays and friendships and we had a ball. The Casino wasn't as exciting there vs other hotels on the strip but it was nice. The breakfast buffet was okay, the other fast food restaurants such as subways and McDonalds was definitely over priced though. The pool was fun but I wish the DJ played other music such as hip hop n r&b and pop. It was strictly techno, which was not fun. Some of the wait staff at the pool didn't have the best customer service.

My family and I went here for New Year's 2013 celebration and ended up having my cell phone fried by their after-market, alarm clock, charger.  Besides the fast food court, the restaurants are overrated and overpriced - nothing spectacular.  
   We were also disappointed because they don't have or no longer have their own brewery, which we were looking forward to.  To me, it's just another fancy looking hotel that is overcharging customers and not taking care of their needs and complaints in a proper and professional manner; I waited months for them to tell me that they did an investigation and found they were not responsible for frying my phone.  They didn't even want phone records to prove my phone was working the day I got there and that I wasn't using it for days after it got fried.  
   We also spent hundreds gambling and didn't have "any luck" whatsoever.  Overall, a disappointing and extremely expensive New Year's Eve in Las Vegas!!!  Don't ever plan on going back!!!


U.S. Consumer
The water is not hot..the mattress is old is falling in the middle, there's no refrigerator in the room.. No wifi!!  Really??
So it's been a few years but I loved this place. Maybe because it was my first trip to Vegas (and last), but we stayed here and the palms. I preferred The Monto Carlo

I arrived in Vegas for the first time and my friend picked this hotel for us to stay at for the next 3 days since its somewhere in the middle of the strip.  The lobby was nice and the staff were friendly. The only problem I had with this hotel was when we checked in they did not give us the room that we originally wanted.  We wanted a king size but were give two queen.  Also, the towels in our room did not smell fresh and clean.  But the room was decent enough.  Nice shops inside the hotel, easy to get a cab and the tram connecting it to adjacent hotels was really convenient instead of walking outside the strip.  We had fun at The Pub lounge during karaoke night.  It was a blast and we really enjoyed the buy one get one free drink special.  I don't gamble so I cannot comment on the casinos.  But overall, our stay was pleasant.

If I can give absolutely no stars...  I would.  My husband and I stayed here for a quick getaway.  That saying you get what you paid for...  An understatement! This place is worse than a MOTEL.  The rooms were filthy.  The pillows had the former patron's leftover eyeshadow and dried up booger on the pillow, half used shampoo, and dust in EVERYONE CORNER of the room.  My question is how they are able to maintain their "luxury"  status? The rooms were unsanitary and disgusting! When I complained, they decided shut me up with $25 comp which we decided to use it for the buffet...  Turns out not enough to cover for one person's cost for the buffet.  The buffet was for lack of a better word PATHETIC! Dried up, overcooked, nasty tasting food charging about $28 per person.  The staff was nice so I can't complain about the staff at the buffet but what a waste of money! My husband and I will NOT be coming back here at all!

First off, I love the Monte Carlo casino. I have been in a few times and always enjoyed it's layout and variety of activities available. I was pretty thrilled to be staying here this time because I thought the rooms would have to be amazing.  Nope. 

Now, our room could be a 'one off', but I doubt it.  It was apparent that housekeeping takes no detail in their cleaning. There were dried up French fries under the TV stand. iPhone plugs left in the walls by previous guests. I was afraid to 'look' for anything else. 

The beds were very comfortable. I really should've checked for bed bugs, but I didn't.  By the time we went to bed, I was just beat. But the blanket that they cover up with a sheet looks like it had not been washed in a month. There were fresh food stains on it, some daquari, just gross. 

Now the bathroom is where it got real nasty. The shower is LINED in mold!  MOLD!  Black\/green mold along the caulk, and a real nice thick pile of nasty yellow mold in the grout. I thought maybe it was a sealant, so I took a towel to it.  Nope. Gross. 

The door knobs had dirty thick finger prints around them, so you know it hasn't been wiped.

The sad thing is that this is usually all found out the next morning. I know when we got to our room, we dropped our bags took a quick (slightly disappointed) look and left the room for the night. I didn't think I needed to pull out white gloves and a black light at a 4-star hotel.

Needless to say, we were very disappointed. I don't know that I'd stay here again when there are so many other hotels that I have stayed at before and not experienced this.

Tired looking hotel. Very nice hotel staff and accommodating but you can tell the hotel is aging because it is showing it's wear and tear. Also, beware, construction outside of the building starts early (between 6-6:30am) so if you are a late riser and that type of sound bothers you--you may want to look at staying elsewhere.

My boyfriend and I stayed here two weeks ago for our first Vegas trip together\/sports tournament trip. I originally booked the deluxe room but noticed a few days later the Spa Suite was available for an extra hundred dollars a night so i decided to upgrade. Check in was long but it was a Saturday and there were around six employees checking in guests. The hotel lobby was very nice and didn't feel outdated at all. I admit it was not as modern as places like Aria but it was not themed to be so I didn't feel it detracted from the hotel at all. The Spa Suite was very nice. It was clean and spacious we enjoyed the glass shower and large sink area. The bar area was nice and clean. Our room overlooked the strip and the large window with the spa was very nice. Best was very comfortable and we slept great. We would definitely stay here again.
How can I enjoy my honeymoon with this stupid lousy noise !!!! I will nvr ever book at ur hotel again !!!!

Girlfriend and I stayed at the MC last year and it is an excellent resort.  Is it the Bellagio? no.  But for price and location you can't beat this place.  We enjoyed the pool and lazy river as well as the sports pub located there as well. The casino itself is very nice, and if you get a chance eat at Brand's steakhouse.  It's amazing.  And I know steak!  

I honestly cannot find anything wrong with this place that would make me regret staying here.  Are the color schemes and wallpapers up to date, yadayadayada.  Who cares?  You're in Vegas!  Why do you care what your room looks like as long as it has a bed and a shower, that's all you need.  It's got a nifty food court for when you want a quick cheap eat, it's in the middle of the strip and the tram that is conveniently located behind it takes you to the Aria, Vdara and Bellagio.  

We liked it so much, that we're going back this year as well and I'm taking my parents to stay there for their first ever trip to Vegas.

This place is falling apart! We wanted to end our trip with relaxation but the room was filthy and old. In the hall the wall paper was falling off. We wanted to try it out because they had the lazy river and the wave pool. There were no waves and the water was cloudy. The only nice person who worked there was the person who checked us in and the guy you get the towels from at the pool. The people walking around there were rude and housekeeping was a joke! I asked for two clean sheets and two blankets and all they brought up was one blanket and the guy was rude. And don't expect enthusiastic dealers. My husband did some sports bets and sat a couple of tables and said all the dealers had the same crappy attitude. The walls are super thin as well so don't expect to get good sleep if your neighbors are up late. As soon as I woke up I got our kids ready and we booked it to the Mandalay bay. I was not about to end my vacation at some run down hotel with miserable workers. Don't expect anything great at this place! And if you complain when you check out all they say is sorry...how about getting a manager. Happy to be checked out some where else with my family. When all of the charges went through they charged me twice and every time I call someone tells me their computer system is down. Guess I'll just have to call my credit card company since they are trying to scam me out of money. Terrible place!! It's still a nightmare and I'm not even there anymore :\/

Vegas Virgin In Bad Hotel

So this was my first time in Vegas. I had high hopes for the hotel based on the website, and because it was on the strip. I was super disappointed. Like TERRIBLY disappointed. The check-in procedures were good but that's where the good time stopped. The rooms are extremely OLD and outdated. The carpet is worn and tattered. The bathroom is also old with old fixtures. Don't believe any of what the website says. The rooms do not look like that!!!!!! The fist two nights my hot water was NOT HOT. We finally complained, but that technician came up with no tools, and promptly told us the water was hot. It was only after we protested did they switch our rooms and offer a credit on our bill. I also didn't know that the Casino wasn't smoke free. I had trouble breathing during the entire trip. The buffet was decent.....not worth $25, but it wasn't terrible and there is a huge selection. I definitely won't stay at this hotel again. Not ever.
Attentive staff. Room service was excellent but pricy. Lots to do to stay busy within the casino, which is now attached to the Aria Resort as well. Awesome pools!

get what you pay for:  Paid 100 a night.  Just a room over looking all the vents of the building. 30 min in line to checkin. No coffee maker, no micro,Just OLD.  It is OK to just have a place to sleep and go.
I would not stay again

Clean and cheap hotel.  However, I knocked off 2 stars because of the lack of sound insulation between the rooms.  I stayed on the 20th floor and could hear my neighbors whenever they talked, watched tv, flushed the bathroom, or used the showers.  And this was from both sides of the room. We also got $50 food credit for our stay, but the several restaurants we went were not open at the time they said they'd be open, like Diablos and the cupcake place.

Goodness this was a terrible place to stay.  Wife and I decided to book their "Diamond Suite" and were less than thrilled.  If we weren't on a roadtrip just passing through for the night with a 19 month old, I would have taken the time to actually vent to the hotel management.  For one of the best suites at this hotel, the experience was terrible:

-Website claims "these outstanding rooms all feature glittering views"-Not true.  I saw the side of Aria and a smidge of a sign on the strip.

-Valet took 20 minutes to greet us\/get to our car upon check-in.  No option to leave keys and go.

-Asked an employee in the lobby if I could check in under the M Life line "for M life Gold & Platinum members and suite guests."  I was a top tier suite guest, but not gold\/platinum, seemed like a legit question considering Bellagio and other nice hotels have a separate line if you book a nicer room. Employee told me he had no idea, but I could always try standing in the line to "see what they say."   

-Upon arriving to room, found a sack full of half eaten candy in one of the wet bar cabinets

-Some nice pubic hair found in the Jacuzzi tub

-Mold along the entire base lining\/caulk in the shower.  Not just dots of black\/green, it was completely covered.

-Upon check-out, you can't even call valet to bring your car around.  You have to hand them your ticket in person.  What's the point?

-No room service if you want to order food-unless its breakfast

-Luckily the room was big enough to have two phones.  One didn't work, and the other one only one of the speed dial buttons to various departments of the hotel even worked.

I've stayed in Vegas five or six times and always like to splurge for a nice suite at a different hotel on most occasions.  I know how they treat you at other hotels on the strip, especially when you book an expensive suite and they don't go out of their way one bit at Monte Carlo.

Where I lost most of my money but this review is for the horrible service I was provided. Sure, the Jabbawockeez show wasn't bad and Britney Spears sat a couple rows behind my sister but this place is so grungy and needs to keep up with the architecture. Come see me at the Bellagio!

I stayed here on a Wednesday and Thursday night and had a great time.  The rooms were big, the bathroom was a decent size and the curtains were good (you know, the kind that can keep the room completely dark all day?  Very important if you've been out till 4AM and want to sleep in till noon!)  The construction wasn't that bad (aren't they constantly building in Vegas?  You can't really escape it)

The pool was awesome.  It had a kiddie pool, a regular pool, jacuzzi, a lazy river you can float around in, and a wave pool.  The bar was decent and there were plenty of lounge chairs.

My friends and I ate at "Cafe" and had great service and even better food.

The casino looked the same as any of the others on the strip, although I didn't gamble; only played a little video slot machines....

Overall for the price, I can't complain....and they give you a discount for being a AAA member.   I would definitely stay there again.

This is just for the pool.  First if you have ever been to the Mandalay pool this one is similar.  The lazy river is suppose to be bigger but it looked to be about the same. You can bring in your own tube or they will rent them to you for a fee.   They also have a wave pool which my daughter is able to get in.  At the Mandalay she is not tall enough.  The best thing about this pool is that they have a nice shade area.  Some of the others pools on the strip have shade you can but at a high price or really just non to speak of.  We will be back.

I've been here before, and I'm back again.  Absolutely no complaints with this casino and hotel.  They are quick to get you checked in and going, and their checkout is so painless (you can do it by phone if you have the reception, or even at the quick checkout kiosks in the lobby).  

The room was clean, the beds were comfy... absolutely no complaints.  They also have quick access to Vdara\/Aria and are a quick hop skip and a jump to visit the other hotels on the strip.  Despite it being a chilly end of December\/early January we were able to hotel hop starting at Monte Carlo to go to Caesars and stopped by the Bellagio on the way.

PS there is only free wifi on the first and second floor.  Wish it was everywhere.  Phone service is spotty, you'll get enough for calls, but not great for data (2-3 bars max).

This hotel is very good for the price that you get. The casino and spa are very well maintained.  Although some of the dealers did not seem very friendly. 

Room service was extremely helpful even if they were slow coming o your room.  Although I do have to agree with another user, the bathroom was very large compared to other bathrooms in some hotels. It was well maintained..

There is a beach volleyball court on the pool deck but they charge 30$ hour to play. Not really worth that price for fake sand and a junk ball

C'mon guys!  Millions of dollars is pumped into this place but you cannot afford to supply your customers with WIFI in their rooms?  What year are we in?  Cheap mofos.

And what's up with your crazy ass shower heads?  Feel like I just walked out of an F5 tornado.

When searching for a place to stay in Las Vegas, a few factors came into play: PRICE, location, and comfort.  The Monte Carlo fit the bill on all accounts.  I was a bit nervous on the way there from reading different reviews but once we arrived, I knew that for us, we'd made the right choice.

Check-in was quick and pleasant.  We arrived at 11am on a Thursday and were directed straight away to our rooms even though check-in was not until 3pm!  Pow!  We were a group of 6, so we had two rooms.  The front desk clerk suggested adjoining rooms which was excellent and really added a lot of fun to our stay.  The rooms were very clean with very comfortable beds, 42-inch plasmas and the a\/c worked fine.

My favorite parts about the MC are the in-house casino (OF COURSE) and the number of drinking\/dining options available right on the first floor.  There's a buffet (you can buy an all day\/all meals pass for $38 w\/ tax+fees), a food court (McD's, Subway, Sbarro's, Haagen Daaz, etc.), and then various restaurants and bars (The Pub, Minus 5 Bar, Andre's, Diablo Cantina, etc).  The buffet was decent enough for the price.

If you want a hotel where you can just about have the whole Las Vegas experience without ever leaving the building, MC is for you!  That wasn't our aim, so we did do a LOT of sight-seeing and traveling The Strip.  In that aspect, the proximity of the Monte Carlo to other attractions\/hotels on the strip was perfect for us.  What we couldn't get to on foot, the bus route took us directly there.

In addition to being clean, Monte Carlo is more than comfortable and it's a fun place to stay.  There are more than a few discounts available to go here at a great price.  I LOVED staying at the Monte Carlo and it will remain at the top of my list for my next trip to Las Vegas!

Never again! We just checked into out room.  It wasn't very clean, few things looked broken or used. We were only staying two days, so it fine I guess. We went down to the casino to walk around and see what's going on, it was pretty dead in there. 30 mins later we went back to our room, to find our hallway Flooded with about of inch of nasty smelling water! Joking about our room being flooded,  to find out it was our room! Our door was open with staff all standing around blocking our door way, pushing them out of the way. I guess the toilet tank over flowed while we were gone. Our luggage were left in a puddle of nasty water! The staff didn't bother to move anything! We had to call a manager ourselves. They were too busy trying to mop of the flood. The they said a Manger would not come up to our room,  they don't do that. All they were going to do was move us to another room! Turns out after yelling at everyone the manager showed up with security!  We got moved to a worse room with view of construction,  we said hell no, got moved again. They wanted us to do some BS checks and other stuff, we only came back to our room to get ready and leave for a show. I was bothered they never called us to let us know our room was flooded,  nor check on us after we got moved the next day. I would never say here again,  everything looks old and dirty.

Heads up!  They just converted the 32nd floor.  Check out this new hotel feature...

http:\/\/www.hotel32lasvegas.com\/

Located on the top floor of Monte Carlo Resort & Casino, HOTEL32 offers an exclusive escape that savvy travelers search for but seldom find; a celebrity VIP experience available to all. As a guest of HOTEL32, all reservations include the following services and amenities:

* Round-trip airport limousine service to and from McCarran Airport.

The hotel is terrible! The rooms were outdated and disgusting! I could understand if rooms were just out of date but our room was dirty when we arrived! There were stains all over the bathroom floor!! The mirrors were all dirty. The bed and a huge indent in the middle and the comforter on the bed had brown stains. So gross!! The bathroom sink also had an awful smell coming out of it. And there were splatters and stains all over the walls in the room. I even found food wrappers by the bed. We didn't even waist money in the casino. Would NEVER stay again.

I needed a get away from work. I just wanted to relax sleep in. If you are traveling to Monte Carlo major construction going on. You have a drills and pounding starting at 6 am till about 7pm. If you complain about it they say we have signs posted and on site I was I did not see anything I'm sure if something was posted probably in small letters. I check out and went to Excalibur. I wish I would have got a full refund. Totally ruined my get away.

Giving it 2 stars because it does have a really nice pool area.   As far as the room goes...gross.   The wallpaper was ripped in the bathroom, the towels smelled like mold.   There was mold on the shower and there were stains on the bed sheets.   I go to Vegas all the time and I can honestly tell you that I will not be back here again.  I would rather pay more money and stay in a nicer hotel.   They really need to update that place.
Nice Hotel and in a convenient location on the strip.  Within walking distance to some really good shopping and activities.  Would come back!

Definitely not the Venetian!! The room is tiny, the bathroom is tiny and the hotel is inconveniently located.

However, the beds were comfortable. However, I found the roll-out bed was not. 

Housekeeping is pretty prompt in delivering towels.

Nonetheless, the place is cheap!

This is a cheap and convenient place to stay but don't expect luxury. Or a good nights sleep. Every morning we could hear neighbors showering. The blankets on the beds are thin, towels are thinner, bed sagged in the middle and the pillow made from some strange foam stuff. 

On the plus side the staff were friendly, the breakfast delivered was hot, prompt and yummy. The choice of food was not great but there is always the food court for late night snacking. 

Could do with some modernization and work on soundproofing and would be great.
Always stay here when we come to Vegas. Mainly because of the online discounts and the food court. Diablo's is fun! We love the pool area too!

So I came here on a deal through some random website I can't remember. The price was outstanding so I figured, why not? 

Interestingly enough when we checked in we got charged a "resort" fee. Really?! Funny, because there is nothing "resorty" about this place when the pool and outdoor area is closed down for construction. That just sat with me wrong but I have no idea if other hotels on the strip also charge this fee...but I'm guessing it's a new trend.

Hotel is in a great location right in the middle of the strip across from NY NY. It's an older hotel\/casino and it shows...but really who cares when you're in Vegas and can walk to pretty much anything or hop in a cab.

Very dissapointed with out stay.
First of all the pool is under construction, besides the inconvenience that you have to go to other hotels to lay in the sun, the construction workers work during the night till daylight. You can hear loud Cranes and heavy machinery. 
As that wasn't enough, apparently they are remodeling some rooms, and during the day they are working on those. The construction inside the hotel starts at 7am and they are working all day till 5pm,(you hear loud jackhammers coming from the ceiling, as they work on the room above), we couldn't sleep for our whole stay.  
As of the customer service, we went and kindly asked to get a different room where there wasn't any construction above, the person helping us was very rude telling us that it was posted on their website about the construction( on the website it was only posted about the pool being under construction, NOTHING about the construction in the rooms next door or on the above floor) 
After insisting,she told us to wait and somebody will call us shortly with another room number to switch from the current one. 2 days later and nobody called us. We are still waiting. 
Save yourself the headache and some money(the room wasn't cheap)  and book at another hotel.. 
DONT recommend this hotel to anyone.   

rooms are not like in the pictures(old and outdated)

Nice hotel overall, a bit dated but clean and meets expectations. We were a little disappointed having been offered an upgrade to a Spa Suite, only to find out that the Spa tub did not have jets. Well, ok...it overlooked the strip, was a larger room and was nice for the money, but the mold in the shower, not acceptable. I would probably stay elsewhere next time. Didn't bother to tell staff because i have found in Vegas, they generally have an " I don't give a shit attitude". Next time, we will likely stay elsewhere. Not a bad value for room size and strip location but next time I will be willing to pay more for what I want. What do they say, "You get what you pay for?" Well, honestly it was not that inexpensive and I did expect more.

It's really hard to judge this place.  For one, this hotel is generally rated as a four-star resort, which clearly raises expectations to a point that the Monte Carlo is never quite able to meet.  It'd be overly harsh to say that I hated my stay here (because I didn't), but there were many many things that could have been handled better.

Upon checking in, the credit card used to pay for the room was immediately hit with a mystery $543 charge (the room for three nights was supposed to be only $370, and the first night had already been paid).  After calling around for awhile, we were told that the hotel takes a $150 refundable deposit and a $20\/day resort fee, neither of which were disclosed to any of us.  The $20\/day resort fee was not too much of a surprise, but we left confused as to what the charge was actually for, since other hotels have used this fee to "pay" for Wi-Fi access, HD service, etc., and Monte Carlo provided none of this (not to mention piss poor cell phone service).  All in all, the stay set us back about $500, which was quite a bit more than the agreed price of $370.

We got the cheaper room, so we weren't facing The Strip, but instead, got a view of the pool.  This was not a bad thing considering that we came during their Spring Break festivities.  Speaking of the pool, it was one of the bigger pool areas I've seen, complete with lazy river, wave pool, hot tub, and sand volleyball court (this was by far the best part).  Facilities were surprisingly good, but they were somewhat tainted by the presence of Jersey Shore wannabes.

Casino was pretty standard among those on The Strip, but equipped with a number of bar dancers towards the entrance, which was a nice touch.  Sports book was small, but then again, this wasn't a huge surprise, since no one goes to the Monte Carlo to place bets.

It wasn't the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, but I can say that I don't foresee coming back to this hotel with so many other legitimate 4-star resorts on the Strip at comparable prices.

This is more or less my go-to hotel and casino in Vegas. 

By no means the newest or the fanciest. High end dining options are lacking. There is no nightclub (not a big deal to me, but if you are into that sort of thing may be something to consider). 

What the hotel has going FOR it (and I why I keep coming back): 

1. GREAT location - possibly the BEST location on the Strip 
2. Easy check in - usually only a very short wait 
3. Reasonable Rates 
4. Good, clean, basic room 
5. The PUB 
6. Nice casino - not overly crowded 
7. Nice pool 

Bottom line: If you want a high-end room and don't mind paying for it go elsewhere. But if you want a nice room at a good rate and a great location - this is your place!

Stayed at this hotel and casino for the first time recently and had a good experience. Being one of the MLife resorts, it's a great strip-central location and easy access to Aria and Bellagio resorts by way of tram or short walk. This may be one of the older hotels but still a nice stay for the money. 

The suites are clean and basic. Didn't get to try the more luxury rooms, but was satisfied with the mountain view room I got. 

Food: Many options from the budget food court area to more fancy upscale dining. I've dined at Brand in the past and enjoyed their menu and service. Highly recommend the meat entres. 

Casino area is what you expect. Tables and slots galore, pick a denomination and play your heart and wallet out. A few bars to grab a drink as well.

Entertainment: This resort has a good variety to check out. I didn't get to see the live bands in the bars or restaurants but did see Blue Man group a couple years ago and it was good. A bit slow and the music a little repetitive sometimes, but overall a nice show to see at least once. Some cool audience participation and interaction as well.

If you are looking for a hotel\/casino on the strip, this is a good option. 3.5 stars!

My husband and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for one night (6\/17) since I had a comp room through MyVegas. We arrived in the evening and didn't find a line at the check-in desk.  The clerk who helped us was friendly but appeared to be new since he needed assistance from another clerk.  No problem.  Finding the elevator to get to our room was easy. When we entered the room, it was spacious with two comfortable beds.  The bathroom was okay.  One think I did notice though, unlike most other hotels where you would find a clock.....there was none.  I had to keep checking my cell phone for the time.  We headed down to the MLife desk to redeem a comp for two buffets.  Luckily, the courtesy clerk was nice enough to explain that if we didn't use the comp for that night, we'd lose it.  We took her advice and used it for another night, when we had more time. We instead redeemed another comp for a free pint of beet at The Pub. After venturing out for a couple of hours, we returned to the hotel and headed straight for the food court.  Glad they have one. We slept pretty good but like most other hotels, you do hear people next door or out in the hallways.  When it was time to check out the next day, instead of going back to the front desk, I found the express check-out box close by.  There was a computer on top of it for guests to print out their receipts.  I only wanted to drop the room keys in.  A guest was taking her time at the express check-out box.  Maybe, they can just leave the box by itself so guests can just drop their keys in without waiting.  We left our bags with at the bell desk since we were going to check out the surrounding areas.  The bell man was accomodating and very friendly.  The next time we will have to stay longer than one night.

They're doing construction in the front of the hotel, hotel is ok, beds are comfortable, pools are heated if needed, service and check in was great, pretty good food court..!rooms themselves do need a bit of updating, wallpaper peeling, carpets a bit dirty. Other than that everything was nice

I thought it was a nice hotel.....obviously it not a swanky hotel like Ceasar's or Venitian but you get your money's worth. I do admit there was alot of construction but at least they didnt make noise until after 9am whick is alright. They rooms were very roomy and housekeeping made sure our room was fully stocked. They were sweet lady's! 

The pool was great we spent alot of time there. We rented tubes for the lazy river and it was great. There drinks at the Pool Bar were awesome and very tasty. There is lots of sitting room. I do advise that if you want a cabana book it when you first book your room. Its $200 all day with fruit platters, drinks and waiter it comes with chairs, misters, fridge, phone and those inter tubes for the lazy river. 

I ultimately liked this hotel and will most likely stay here again!

Also go the Monte Carlo Buffet & Pub..........also they have a great food court.

I think this place is a little deceiving. Based on the interior of the casino and the price of its restaurants, they want you to believe the hotel is fancier than it actually is. The only real kudos I can give the Monte Carlo is its location on the strip, proximity to other casinos, and their fitness center (see below).

The room was ok. No luxury, just the nuts and bolts of a standard room. The Monte Carlo offers very cheap deals during weekdays, but note they do charge a MANDATORY resort fee daily. I believe the fee is about $15 and includes high speed internet (but not wi fi...crazy!!!!!) and access to the gym (but not the spa). These were the only two amenities I used during the visit. I had my laptop and had to use a plug-in cord, which did not work very well. The Internet kept cutting in and out...very annoying. The gym was a pleasant surprise; it had nice equipment and it was not overly crowded. 

Would I stay here again? Probably not, in a town that prides itself on exceptional hotel quality (ie, the Palazzo), I will continue looking for deals and pay a little more to stay at nicer hotels. Some might say, "why spend so much $$ on a hotel room in Vegas that you won't spend much time in?" My rebuttal is that I am on vacation and want to be pampered. To each their own.

This resort is ok. 

I was disappointed in the service. 

Housekeeping either knocked at the door at 6AM or never came at all. So we had to call & request for them to clean our rooms each day much later in the day, or it would never get done.

Nothing to brag about. Simple. Just Ok. 

Oh, and the disappointing part is the pool is extremely over crowded, and if you get a room that faces the pool you don't get any sun in your room.

For our first time in Vegas, 3 buddies and I crowded in a room for a four day trip. The hotel is relatively centrally located and the rooms are quite nice. We got upgraded to a strip view because it was our first time in Vegas. The rooms were quiet and clean! The one issue we had with it was the hall smelled like marijuana.

The casino floor is huge and easy to get lost in. A lot of the dealers are quite friendly, talkative and outgoing if you chat with them while they deal. Plenty of great restaurants to eat at. I finished $6,000 up playing their roulette tables! 

Huge con though is they don't allow outside drinks in their pool, quite disappointing.

Overall, I had an incredible experience. It was quite fun cashing out in the casino and having the cashier in shock that a 22 year old won 6 grand! Always great to "rob" the casino of some money!

Will be coming back!

I had the killer MyVegas deal for 2 free nights, and chose Monte Carlo because of the cheapness. I'm pretty easy to please when it comes to hotels, so if you're picky or expect to be treated like royalty everywhere, need not continue reading. The bed and pillows were SO comfortable. I had the standard King, so my view was of the TMobile arena (not very nice). My room was clean, and house keeping did a great job. Like most other reviewers, my shower quickly turned into a bath from not draining. I didn't report it or anything because it seems the issue is in every room. No pool here during renovations, although I never heard the construction.which was a big concern of mine. They made sure to put me somewhere furthest away from it, and I got to check into my room at 11am!
I wouldn't stay here again unless I get another couple nights free here, but I LOVED the fact they have $5 blackjack every day all day. Great tables, lack of variety with slots. Didn't care for their buffet either last time I tried it. If you're just looking for a place center strip for basic hotel needs, this is for you. If you want luxury and pampering, go somewhere more expensive.

Yuck. The rooms are nasty. I've stayed in Holiday Inns that were 500x nicer than this dump. The carpet on the floor in the rooms bunches everywhere and feels so gross I never took my shoes off. 

The bathroom smells like mildew and mold. I hate going in there. The wallpaper on the walls is coming off. Everything is dusty as hell and my allergies are a mess. 

The sheets suck and the mattress is one of the worst I've slept in, ever. I keep getting wiffs of wet mildew and it grosses me out. Everyone smokes in their rooms and the hallways stink. Run down, nasty, old, & dated. Needs and insane remodel. 

I've stayed at Planet Hollywood which I would say is much nicer than MC. I've also stayed at Paris which was the best experience thus far. 

And that's all I have to say about that.
Jacke

Horrible overpriced hotel, tub didnt drain, also no fridge or coffee in the room they charge extra. They charged us an early check in of $20 for checking in 2:30pm with 3pm being the time you can. They later reversed it but our points that were going to be used for the resort fee was used for that so either we paid for it because the front desk was too lazy to go to the MLife desk to find out what happened to our points. Also, the MLife linked my boyfriend's card to another person with the same last name so who knows maybe that person used our poi t's which we gambled pretty heavy on Saturday night and should of had something....I don't recommend this hotel. Good location but can stay somewhere nicer with the amenities and a staff that will help with isdyes.

Upon my arrival, Jerry (with the Bell Captain's group) not only greeted me and took care of my bags; he remembered my name over the next 4 days and greeted me by name every time our paths crossed...great customer service!  The front desk folks and Concierge folks were very polite and extremely helpful.  The housekeeping staff was efficient, responsive to our requests and very pleasant each and every time we spoke with them.  I've rarely met so many pleasant employees at any hotel.  The room was clean; the location is great; we had a wonderful time.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  You won't find better or more accommodating staff anywhere!

This review is strictly for the swimming pool.  A friend of mine was visiting and stayed at the Monte Carlo.  We made plans to hang out at the pool all day on Saturday.  We got there around 10 am and lucked out and found 2 lounge chairs.

The swimming pool has 2 small lazy rivers and a small wave pool.  There were a lot of kids at the pool, but they didn't really get in the way that much.  Dance & Hip Hop music was playing on speakers and every once in a while they had competitions for various prizes.....like being on a cruise ship pool deck.

There's a bar conveniently located towards the backside of the 2nd lazy river and they have cocktail & food service to the cabanas & lounge chairs.  Our server Samantha "Sam" was very cool and kept us hydrated with Water, Shock Top, Mai Tais, and Jamaican Rum Runners all day long.

Overall, it was a great time.

Will I return?  Most definitely!

I was very uncertain about staying here because I saw a lot of bad reviews but I thought my stay was pretty great. All the staff was very helpful. There was a line for check in but it wasn't bad and I was able to have an early check in. Check out was QUICK! I used their express check out and it was sooo fast! The room was clean! They gave me a room far from the construction, I still heard some noise but I didn't mind it! Overall it was such a great stay! Especially for the price! $35 a night?! It wasn't such a modern room but it's for the location, the service and for the cleanliness of the room it's a deal!! Overall great stay and will stay here again! I'm excited to see the new pool area once it's finished

Do not book your room at the Monte Carlo absoulety a horrible experience just booked on 6-18-2016 for my wife's b day,rooms are old rustic and feel like your staying in a old motel 6 ,no refrigerators for your drinking water,beer etc. Might be suitable for party people because we weren't able to get good rest next time I'll pay a little more to stay in a better hotel....straight up!! You get what you pay for!l learned the hard way.

I recently just stayed here from 8\/28-8\/30 and I hate I booked a room here.

By the pictures I saw on the website I thought it was a nice hotel with a beautiful clean room! Annnnt WRONG!
1. The carpet is filthy and disgusting. This carpet looks like it hasn't been cleaned in years. You can literally seen the dirt on the carpet and spots.
2. The bathroom floor was very nasty and dirty and so was the toilet. They switched our and room and the 2nd room was an F instead of an F-.
3. The 2nd room carpet was just a filthy. I had to keep my shoes on and it really scared me to sleep in their beds. 
4. The tub was stopped up after I took a shower. They had to send someone up to run a snake to clear the drainage. 
5. The bell serviceman was HORRIBLE! When we arrived to check our luggage with the bell desk we were not greeted and the Bellman by the name of 'Warren" just stood there and then proceeded to help someone whom had just walked up after us. After standing there the female handler took our bags. Unfortunately we experienced the same treatment by "Warren" when we returned to get our bags. He totally ignored us and then told the other woman behind the desk that he was 'OFF'... Well he fooled us because a minute later he ask someone else did they need help who again came to the desk after us. And after all of that he had to bring our bags out because he apparently was the only handler there. He was very rude and for this Monte Carlo including your fake advertisement of a room I WILL NEVER stay at your hotel again! 

Please search yelp before booking with this hotel. I unfortunately did not and I did not enjoy my trip to LAS VEGAS because of this horrible dirty rude motel.

My initial welcome to The Monte Carlo was rather abysmal, but overall it turned out to be a rather pleasant stay, and I think the sum of it amounted to a very reasonable rate for a nice room in what is still a great spot on the Vegas strip. The weekend we happened to be visiting played host to not only the Pacquiao versus Bradley fight (and controversial upset), but also a big series between the Celtics and Heat, the third leg of the Triple Crown races, and most significant to us locally, the Electric Daisy Carnival, which boasted nearly 350,000 attendees over a 3 day span.

Obviously, Vegas was packed, and so perhaps it wasn't the most optimal time for MGM properties (all of them, not just Monte Carlo) to decide to do a system upgrade to their computers. What wound up happening was that all of the check-in systems for all of their properties (Bellagio, Aria, Veer, Mandarin, Mirage, Luxor, Mandalay, MGM Grand, etc...) shut down completely for 2 to 3 days, causing check-in times of 1.5 to nearly 4 hours, depending on your property. The Monte Carlo folks at least made up for it as best they could, waiving all amenity fees for guests (who asked for it) and offering everyone a free night stay on a return visit (although I find it kind of shitty they wouldn't just refund one your nights already spent). Since it was a corporate level decision far above them I'm not holding them directly responsible, but I would be remiss if I didn't mention it here.

Most important to me when booking a room in Vegas is what am I going to get for my money, factoring in how much\/little time I will actually be staying in my hotel room. Considering I would normally go to sleep around 5AM and wake up around noon, shower, and head straight out to lunch, I essentially just needed somewhere to put my suitcase with a (hopefully) comfortable bed and a good central location to all the places I wanted to visit in Vegas. We got all of that at The Monte Carlo, with two queen beds in a strip view deluxe room for about $200 a night, which wasn't too bad a rate considering how booked of a weekend it was. (For comparison I just checked a random weekend in July and got about $125 a night for the same room.)

The Monte Carlo rooms may be a bit outdated, for sure, but ask yourself how important the wallpaper and minibar actually is. They've got a nice 40 inch HDTV, but I never even turned it on. What are you paying for? Convenience, that's it, if your trips to Vegas are anything like mine. They've still got a great pool scene, a casino that seemed relatively busy (although I don't gamble, so no clue as to the quality), and some pretty good dining options with Brand and Andre's. The feature show also happens to be The JabbaWockeeZ, one of the best dance groups to hit the US in the last decade. Overall I think they definitely justify the rates they're asking, with my only real drawback being that it's not quite as central as say Aria or Bellagio, but it's also a fraction of the price.

Get me Out of here!  This stay has been awful.  We upgraded to a Monaco suite upon checking in hoping that we wouldn't end up with a non-renovated room like some of the rooms here.  My Fiancee just got off a 13 hour shift, and all she wanted to do was get some sleep after eating dinner.  I got back to our room at about midnight and as I'm writing this, it's 5:30AM and I still havent gotten any sleep.  There is a hole in our mattress, the bed springs squeek, I can hear the guy next door farting, and we've been getting the runaround from both the front desk and AMEX, who we booked our reservation through.  I even tried to sleep on the couch, which is definitely more comfortable than the king bed with the hole, but for $300 a night.....I SHOULDN'T BE SLEEPING ON A COUCH.  The only thing they've offered us so far is the Handicap Access suite, or a new room after 11AM after being put on a waiting list.  I'm hoping to call MGM Resorts at 8AM and hopefully they can amend this, then maybe my rating will go up.

Stayed here over Super Bowl weekend - we had a great time, enjoyed the "strip view" room (that I paid extra for and is totally worth it) and loved the convenience and price of the hotel. We spent most of our time at the Cosmo and Aria, but the dining options looked fun and affordable (the pub, etc), and the casino, pool and everything else was great. I would stay here again to experience the pool and everything else it offered - also for the great price of a strip hotel!

The hotel was clean enough, and my stay was good.

I felt 4 starts but 3 because;

*Construction started very early morning, and it woke me up
*Hard to enter to the self-parking area because of the construction

This place sucks.  

From the valet, to the rooms, to the restaurants, to the gaming.  Low rent.   

Only stay here if you are staying for free.  Like I did.  But, even for free, it sucked.

The End.


If you care to read my "Hollywood" review, here you go:

I was only there because my current crush was given a Vegas weekend from his work...obviously, they went with the cheapest place they could get on Priceline.

He flew in from DC, I drove up from LA.

The people at the desk were nice.  Extremely incompetent, but nice.  They fixed everything they had screwed up.  After a half dozen attempts...numerous times.

At the Monte Carlo they don't speak the same language as Vegas.com.  Strangely, they communicate by fax more easily than by internet. 

I got there before Mr. TeeJay's plane landed.  I had spoken with a Vegas.com person to confirm that I was named on the room the day before I left, and I was sent a confirmation email.  Yes, it would be no problem.  However, it was a problem.  

After driving through the desert for 4 hours, the last thing my sweaty ass (110 degrees, broken a\/c) wanted to hear was, "We don't have you listed on the room."  Huh...waaa...come again?!?  Okay, well, here is a printout of what they sent to me.

Soooo, they faxed my confirmation letter. 25 minutes later, a fax back okay'd my entry.   Who are these faxing people?

Upon entering the room and  opening the curtains, I gazed upon the construction site known as City Center.  Really?  Eh.  A free room is a free room.  I ain't here for the views.

I Vegas'd myself up, to greet my crush.  Happy greetings!!  Let's go gamble and be fabulous!

Whoa.  Whoa. Whoa.  Who are these people in this hotel?  

No shows.  Crappy hotel band.  Lackluster menu.  Nothing at the Monte Carlo was appetizing.  So, we trekked down the Strip and ended up at the Venetian...where I am a VIP.

Thank you. Thank you. Curtsey and bow.  That will be another review.  However, we are staying at the Monte Carlo...

Sooooo, we woke up the next afternoon, and rolled into our swimwear.  The pool was fun.   Waves, good music, abundant sun (no credit for that) and plenty of chaise lounges for our friends (read: Mr. TeeJay's co-workerrs).  But, ah damn, I forgot my hat.  So, I had to go back up to the room.

It truly sucked leaving the pool and going back to the room to have my key card fail.  Pick up the courtesy phone.  Busy signal.  I kept trying for 10 minutes.  

Seriously, I have not heard a busy signal in forever!  So, I went back down to the front desk.

I waited behind all of the people checking in to finally hear, "Oh, sometimes the cards de-activate if they close to the cellphones".  

Are you kidding me?  I have an iPhone.  Eh.  Re-activate.  Through the labrynth, and back to room, only to have the card fail again. 

Don't tell me it's my freakin' iPhone!  That was in my bag, the key card never left my hand.  Lucky for them, this time he courtesy phone rang the front desk and a security person magically appeared to open my door.

It's coming around that time of year again.  Mr. TeeJay will be getting a vacation weekend, courtesy of his work, at the Monte Carlo.  I will be driving up to see him, but he will be staying with me in a much better hotel.

Stayed here in Dec. 2005. Average rooms and good environment, although empty casino, although that didn't matter for me because I'm not 21 yet. Again, like the Rio Hotel, the hotel room I had had available AV connections in the TV so you can connect your DVD player for the kids. The buffet wasn't that good. I had better. But if it's cheap, it's a good hotel to sleep in on the LV Strip.

RIP Stardust Hotel

Love this place even with all the Renovations. There is no pool right now but we did have access at other places. It seemed confusing at first but everyone is so helpful we figured it out fast. 

I love how helpful Dustin was at self check-in. It took no time and they just texted when our room was ready. What a view of the T-Mibile Arena and New York New York. The room had so many plugs to charge all of our devices. The cleaning staff kept it spotless without being intrusive. They are so good!

I did not do well at the casino but the staff was so friendly that I had a wonderful time. They were patient teaching this newbie the games. My drinks were served right to my machine always with a smile.

Just stayed here for 6 nights on the 22nd floor.  We had two rooms.  Lobby Staff and cleaning folks are  extremely nice.  Only negative is the bar in the hotel called Ignite.  They have about 10 beers on tap and none of them work.  We had to leave the hotel and go next door to the Double Barrell to get a draft.  The bartender said the draft beer is broken all the time.  They should fix this.

I booked my hotel through booking.com, and I should have read the fine print because you actually have to pay $20\/room resort fee!

I asked the girl who checked me in if this was required for everybody, regardless how you booked the hotel, and she said yes.

Granted, the deal with booking.com came up to only $62 (w\/ taxes already) for the King room, but added on with the $20 resort fee, it totaled up to $80 for a Sunday to Monday stay, 1 night.

The cons: 

* No wifi. Again I should have read the fine print! They had the Ethernet cable, but I was using my tablet so... that is a no-no.

* CLOGGED sink. This wasn't really annoying but I called the front desk and they said someone would be up to my room in 10-15 minutes. 22 minutes later, I called again and then they said someone will be up there soon.  Waited another 10 minutes later, the plumber was very nice and courteous- he fixed the sink right away, but shouldn't management require that repaired before you check someone in?

* Resort fee= $20 which only includes...the gym entrance (I don't think anyone goes to the gym while at Vegas!), free newspaper (again, no one reads newspapers when they're at Vegas?), internet (again...no WIfi which sucks, only the Ethernet cable). Coffee maker, and some other stuff that you don't really use while you're at Vegas. 

* I really don't care about decor but there were just stains on the carpet, on the chairs, and some marking on the walls. Kind of outdated.

* The showerhead has green rust on it... which even in some inns don't have that! They really need to clean that out.

* It was 8:30am and I was awoken by someone's alarm or music, and I couldn't help but sing along to it (it was Snow Patrol. Haha). I guess the walls are pretty thin... and I could hear the next door people showering. As soon as they turned on their shower, I would hear the pipes going at it. 

Pros: 

* Clean sheets. BUT I did see one pillow with a dark marking. Good thing you have more than one. 

* Doesn't smell like smoke. Got the non-smoking.

* Quiet A\/C, quiet room! 


I don't think I will stay here again...I guess I will pay an extra $10\/$20 to experience a high end room instead of one that "pretends to be one." 

You used to have such great ratings, Monte Carlo!!

Just returned from a three day stay at the monte carlo, and what a fantastic stay it was! Had a situation with check-in and my credit card being compromised and they made an exception for me to allow a family member out of state to pay for our room. That was extremely appreciated! We were up on the 21st floor. Our room was very nice and comfortable. Had an issue with the a\/c not blowing out very strong. They had someone from maintenance up in less than 15 minutes. Luckily it just needed a new filter. We enjoyed the restaurant food court down by the casino and ate at several of the other restaurants on property, our favorite being Brand steakhouse (so good!). The casino was nice and did not have an overpowering odor of cigarette smoke even though many people were smoking. Spent a day down by the pool that was very nice, the lazy river was my favorite part. Drinks were really expensive but I think that's too be expected. The tram to bellagio was also really nice, just wish we would have known about it our first night and not our last ha, could have saved our feet some agony. Every employee we dealt with was kind and courteous. It was a great stay and we will definitely stay again!

Service is poor and lacking in all the restaurants
We were suppose to get a text when our room was ready, NEVER got the text room was ready awhile ago, had to call my self to find out.

We will never stay here again.

Bunny

We stayed at monte carlo for 3 nights in november. The hotel was clean and had a good choice of restaurants & food courts. We booked a deluxe king-bed room on the 30th floor of the hotel and the resulting view was very good and peaceful. The bed and the bathroom were very plain. The spa was very good and clean and the hotel had a free tram facility to the nearby hotels (Bellagio and Aria) on the strip (just like other Vegas hotels). We didn't use the pool and internet cause we were mostly busy doing other vegas stuff.
On the whole , I would rate the Monte Carlo as very moderate. There was nothing fantastic or awesome about it - and considering its great location on the strip you would think the authorities would jazz it up for the attraction quotient ! The hotel guests had no special discounts or booklets for using the amenities of the hotel (except spa -where we were charged a discounted price of 10 dollars). It was a no -frills hotel which offered all the basic amenities with very few notable complaints (the shower was extra powerful and hurt your face, so be careful). This hotel might score still in other locations but in Vegas were people come to enjoy the grandeur and luxury, Monte Carlo appears really drab. I mean, why would you want to stay here when every other hotel in the vicinity (Bellagio, Caesar's palace, Paris, Venetian, Treasure Island etc etc..) have their own free shows, breathtaking interiors and great attractions in the hotels itself for just a few bucks more??

Stayed here with 3 rooms for a bachelor party.  Beds are very comfortable and soft.  For the 4 hours of sleep per night it felt amazing.  Rooms are ok, standard cheesy Vegas hotel room.  Water pressure was great in bathroom.  They put us all on the same floor, which was nice.

Great location on the strip, but check in and check out process were very slow.  you'd think for a hotel with thousands of rooms the front desk would be able to handle the capacity a little better.  Also, the Monte Carlo Cafe in the casino is one of the worst restaurants I have eaten at.

Overall, not my favorite hotel on the Strip.  If you need a average priced room on the Strip in short notice, then it is definitely a great option.  If you are planning ahead a couple of months, you can get a better hotel at or about the same price.

My husband and I came for super bowel 50.... The lobby, casino, shops, and outside of hotel are beautiful and clean. The staff from room service to dealers to store employees were super friendly. Loved the pub and again very friendly bartenders. The walkway to the aria was awesome... Lots to do. Disappointments were my room was dirty, the bathtub had hair stuck to the tub and left on the floor and garbage left on the floor. Also someone was smoking pot on our floor, it stunk up the hallway and our room, must have been blowing into the vents. We also upgraded our room to a higher floor for a fee but we were not told when asked about the view that we would be overlooking the construction that starts very early and yes we could hear it.

Whoever rated this hotel as a 4 star should be fired. Where do I begin? When checking in, they asked if we'd like two queens or one king and thinking someone might want to crash in our room, we choose two queens. Excited and anxious to start our mini getaway, we ran upstairs to our room and oppened the door to find an employee sitting on the bed talking on her cell. When she saw us open the door, she jumped off the bed, flustered and disoriented, and made her way out of the room. Feeling a bit violated but not wanting to get her in trouble and start our vacation on a bad note, we decided to forget about it and move on. After she left, our attention was brought back to the room. This is when my heart sank to the floor. I was completely repulsed and disgusted. The bed sheets had yellow stains, towels had black marks and brown stains, the nightstands and desk had these half inch diameter circles drilled in them, the curtains had cigarette holes, everything had severe wear and tear, just felt like an old, cheap motel. We usually like to use drawers and cabinet provided to get settled in but there was such an awful stench when we opened them that we just kept everything in suitcases. At this point, we just wanted to get settled in and escape the room. Walking around the bed and towards the windows we found a diabetes strip in the middle of the room on the floor. We just kept looking at each other and looking at the strip. It was like a scene from a horror movie. Feeling completely repulsed, we called the front desk and explained what we found and asked to be switched to a different room and asked for a king this time instead of two queens. In a way, we were actually pleased that we found a valid reason to switch rooms, thinking that we just got a bad room. Front desk rep re-coded our card key and assigned us a new room number. This was possibly the only pleasant thing about this whole ordeal, that they were able to do this electronically without us having to go down stairs again. So, our spirits up again, we made our way to our brand new room, opened the door and were completely dumbfounded to find the same disgusting issues with this room that we had with the first. We just gave up, accepted what was and took notes and pics of everything to write this review.

Few other points worth mentioning:
*If you must stay here, bring your own house slippers or sandals bc the carpet is so disgusting you wont want your bare feet or socks touching it
*Bring your own toilet paper, their toilet paper was so rough it irritated our bottoms (we purchased ours from the cvs on the strip)
*bring your own soap, unless of course you want you want to smell like you just went through a dumster
*be prepared for long showers, water pressure was so bad I didn't need to close the curtain when showering and my husband, who usually takes 5-10 min showers, would take 30 min 
*shower head was chrome, the handle gold and the bottom tube faucet shinny silver.
* walls are so thin you feel like you're in the same room

Saved the craziest part for last. Happened during the morning after our first night there. Maintenance\/housekeeping was vacuuming the hallway and decided to open our hotel room door, which, mind you, had the do not disturb sign, then vacuum the entry way to our room and then close the door. Like what? Drowsy, confused, and half awake, we looked at eachother and confirmed that yes that really just happened. 

Never again, Monte Carlo, never again.

not a fan of the rooms... didn't like the pillows (not fluffy enough), the bathroom (the toilet is kinda scary when it flushes) and the sink was really small... i splashed all over when i was just trying to wash my face because the faucet comes out so far into the sink... and the towels all smelled burnt (maybe because they were place right beneath the heating vent?)

otherwise, the hotel ambiance is pleasant... it not a bad hotel, but i've definitely had better...

I made reservations at this with ease and they gave me a great price.  The hotel personal that gave me the reservation receptive to me needs and they took their time to give me what my family needed.  I will post another review when I go to their hotel for my vacation.

Ok, screw this place now.  My room card didn't work, so I had to track down my fianc in the casino.  Which was hard because my cell was having trouble getting reception in there, so I couldn't just call him.  I finally found him and his card worked. Don't even suggest that I should have gone to the front counter, because there were too many people in line.

Got in the room and could hear every word that was spoken in the room next to me.  Not just the yelling and cutting up, but also their regular voice conversation. Um, how many people are allowed to stay in a room again??  I'm too old for this sh1t.  

Went to brush my teeth for bed and the sink had a slow drain.  Then I felt splatter on my toes.  Yea, the drain was leaking and creating a puddle under the sink.  

Old cell phone charger with radio, no adapter for the 5 or 6

Already made reservations elsewhere for tomorrow.  Soo annoyed, shoulda payed more attention to the previous reviews!

Yet another update, at midnight we changed rooms.  New room smelled like dirty sheets and stale air but was quiet.

At 7:45 next morning we heard a light knocking.  We couldn't tell if it was a knock at our door or another room.  Then suddenly our door opened!  It was the maid, she stated "room check, what time are you checking out?"  WTF?!?!?   First of all, wait a few seconds before you open someone's door.  Second, when you happen to open an "occupied" room at 7:45, APOLOGIZE!!!!!!

Only thing good was the valet guy, he was nice and apologized for our negative experience.

If I could give this place a zero or a negative I would. The slots are tight as they are in most of Vegas. The food is horrid and expensive. I would highly recommend the buffet at the Bellagio or even Mc Donalds. The rooms were nice but noisy. The couple in the room next to us had a battle and smoked weed to make up. This flowed under the adjoining door. We went to the front desk to report this. They said they would send someone up. This never happened. Not a great safety pro-caution for the girl getting slapped around or for me because I am allergic to weed. There was a mix up on our tier points. I called...9 people later I still need to email to get the points straightened out. That said I talked to the desk manager about the incident and he was very nice and credited us back some funds. I still wish it would have been handled when it happened. That said everyone that we met was very nice, especially the Valet team.


The view from our room was the roof top and the construction site. Not real enjoyable.There were limited channels on the TV and the bathroom needs some construction of its own. The tub dripped water constantly and the paint was a bit peeling. We should have taken better notice of the wallpaper being held up in the main hall by electrical tape. That was nasty.

Resort fees are added to the base of your hotel price. Seems a bit odd since we never used the pool, gym etc. No coupon booklet is given for free play or discounts in the hotel. They should take a lesson from South Pointe, its a nice touch.

We came to Vegas for a week long glass convention and stayed at the Monte Carlo to get away from the noise. That was a mistake. Never again will I use the Monte Carlo. M-Life has a lot of hotels in Vegas. I will try the MGM for our trip n May.

I would not recommend the Monte Carlo to my enemy little lone a friend.

Just rating the casino -
When Monte Carlo opened, their big gambling push was they were going to feature the european style roulette wheel, with just a single zero instead of the hideous american two zero system pervasive on the strip.  The american wheel gives the house a whopping 5% house edge, the european about half that.  Apparently no one noticed, and the MC is back to the two zero wheels.
Worse, nearly all the blackjack is 6\/5, with a few 3\/2 tables interspersed.  No surrender.  JOB video poker is terrible with 7\/5.
Craps is 3-4-5 odds.
So this is a gambler hostile casino, apart from craps I'd move down to the MGM which is far better.

My husband and I were guests at the MGM "Monte Carlo" resort from Saturday (2\/16) through today (2\/20).
I would like to outline for you our experience and how in the future we will steer away from MGM resorts in the future.

We stayed at this resort because my husband was attending a conference and it was convenient for his meetings.  

Comments:
1.  Baggage.  When we arrived, the bellman took our bags and said they would be brought up after we checked in.  He did give us a receipt.

2.  Check in.  We arrived at the hotel at about 11 AM.  There were about 20+ people in line so we elected to go to lunch first. We had a nice lunch in the Cafe.  When we went back to check in, the line had dwindled by 50%+.  When we checked in, the clerk did not offer us an upgrade and did not mention the "M Card"  just basically gave us the room key.  We mentioned that that the bellboy had the bags and she said matter-a-factly that we just needed to call once we got to the room.  

3.  Room Quality.  The "standard room" was very disappointing.  The bed and pillows were uncomfortable.  There were not enough outlets in the room for us to charge items.  2 Keurig pods and no real cream was chintzy. Shower was small.  

4.  Baggage part 2.  After traveling for 10+ hours to get to the room, we called for our bags and was told that we needed the receipt.  In the haste of getting to the hotel, we misplaced the receipt. We were told that we would need to come and identify the baggage and after speaking to a manager of that department, was told that we would have to come down and that there were 3000+ guests, clearly, no VIP treatment here.  After finding the receipt, I was surprised by this practice since the receipt had my NAME clearly on it. AND THE BELLBOY could have checked the ID. Instead I was inconvenienced.  WHY THE BELLSTAND AND THE FRONT DESK don't coordinate so bags magically appear in guests' rooms, I don't understand.

5.  Restaurant.  While we had an ok experience the first time in the cafe, our experience yesterday was awful. We arrived a bit before 8 and waited for table for 15 minutes. After we got table, we waited for server for almost another 10 minutes. We immediately ordered and the food arrived at 8:51.  The bill was never presented. And after we had to rush eating, we left at about 10 minutes later. The person who claimed to be the manager couldn't find bill.  We left a low tip and explained why and he was not apologetic at all. He felt the need to pull the receipt and act argumentative -well your order didn't go in  until....The point was this was a hotel serving 3000 guests, making eggs, isn't that complicated and once again we learned that the customer is NEVER right at MGM.


6.  Front desk part 2.  We went to the front desk to add the "M Card" my husband had enrolled for online to be hooked to our stay.  The girl was very confused by this.  He pulled it up on his phone and it had a number.  She said she would do it.  When he asked for a spa visit to the venitian be added, she didn't understand and got argumentative.   She said "She couldn't be responsible for other people's actions"  What kind of team building do you have?  Clearly she won't ever be in charge of anyone's else's actions and she should be terminated immediately.  Argumentative yes, helpful, no.

7. Gym\/spa.  Very bad.  Really is this a holiday inn?

8.  Cleaning Rooms.  Yesterday, we left our room at 7:45 and went back at 1:45.  During this time, maid service had not come. 

9.  Front Desk Part 3.  When standing in line to check out, 2 check out clerks waved for me to come to them. I went to the closest one. She looked at me confused and I said what, she goes "I thought you were going to him"--Like she didn't realize her colleague was also waving at another customer who stood in front of him while she was saying this to me.  She proceeds to pull up the account and stating each and every charge--you have a starbucks, a dinner here, a gift shop there, etc.....INSTEAD of printing the bill and letting me look at it.  Very bizarre indeed.  

The point of these comments is to let upper management know that we definitely were not treated like VIPs, that your staff was argumentative, unfriendly and not helpful.  Will not recommend your resort anywhere.
it was ok, just an ok place. but there is not hair drier in the room. and took a long time to check in.
I really like this place. it is inexpensive, in a good spot, and the pool is always fun. I always stay here when coming to Vegas. you cant beat the price for the location

Went here for my birthday recently.  The room I had reserved was already booked...so they ended up upgrading us to their "Top of the Line" room which had a SPA inside of it right off the living room.  That was nice.  The view, however, was shitty...as there is a ton of construction going on in the area.  (What's new in Vegas?)

Outside they have a "rapids pool" where lots of people gather and have fun during the daytime.  That was pretty cool.  Inside there was a restaurant that pretended to be a "brewery" but did not brew any beer on sight.  (Fakers!).  The dining room looked like it could be converted into a dance floor within about 60 seconds flat...probably wouldn't eat there again unless it was a quick lunch.

Overall a decent stay...I'd probably go back again...but other hotels like the MGM and Mirage are much more interesting.
Perfectly located on the strip.

I booked this via Priceline for Easter weekend with my boyfriend. The location was convenient, being in the middle of the strip and having fairly easy access to other places on the strip. The outside also is pretty, and there is a new plaza with restaurants and stores at the front of the hotel.
I only gave two stars because the room itself was overpriced. There was not even a hot water kettle for coffee and tea and this was the only hotel I have been to that lacked such amenity. The bathroom was also run down, with the faucets and shower heads stripping and showing discoloration of the metal material.
FYI, it was still free parking when we went, but starting April this year, they will start to charge for parking. The parking garage was also a pain to park in because most slots were filled and sections were blocked off for renovation(?). 
Overall, we will be staying elsewhere next time we come to Vegas.
