My wife and I travel to Vegas on average 4-5 times a year. We have stayed at all the Mlife hotels and stay at the Monte Carlo often. With the Mlife rewards we usually have great offers from here. We usually never have to wait long to check in. The rooms are always clean. The rooms could use some updating but the beds and pillows are comfortable. 
We will be back in a couple months!

I wanted to like this. I really did.

Since I was in Vegas for a concert, this review will not be based on the casino (although it would not have made a difference).

It was my first time at Monte Carlo and it just might be my last. I normally stay at Circus Circus which I always have a great experience with despite the reputation it has. This was my first time staying at an MGM property so I was expecting a little more from Monte Carlo. 

I keep my expectations low so I didn't mind the problems other people were marking stars off for (no fridge, free water, old TV, etc.). I think everyone can agree the resort fee is ridiculous based on what was available and what wasn't. 

Upon booking the room through the website there were some problems I needed resolved and I was put on hold several times. However after three people, I had a woman assist me with ease (I don't remember her name). I was so grateful for how fast she helped me--this is what earned a star in my review.

The plan was that I would book one night and my friend would book another night--same room. However it turns out my card was charged to both room despite it being under different name. I dont understand how that could happen when the credit card is only issued to one person. During check out I noticed two activities on my bank account. I wanted to resolve it before heading back home so I wouldn't have to call and be placed on hold. I was told to wait several business days to see if it clears. It hasn't.

I called and was placed on hold. Called again, placed on hold. One hour later Gabby was able to help me with amazing service. I'm still waiting for the changes to be made but I feel all this work was not worth the stay.

Like I said, my expectations are low. I was warned to stay away from the buffet but since I redeemed a free buffet from MyVegas, I decided to try it. I liked it. It wasn't bad. It was free, so why not. I also tried the Dragon Noodle Co.'s sushi rolls and it was decent price. Not bad, either. 

I just feel like what should have been the easiest part of the trip (booking\/refund) took up too much of my time.

I am a regular of MGM Mirage and like some of their properties very much (ex. THEHotel at Mandalay Bay) They have lower end properties like Excalibur. I came to Monte-Carlo on a casino free room promotion (still has to pay $14 resort fee).

From the image I was expecting an average property, it's low end kike Excalibur more more pretentious. Rooms were noisy bad sound proofing with next room and corridor.

It was OK for $14 but would not pay more!

Have to be the worst place to stay in Vegas. They don't give you information about the hotel when you check in. When we checked in I ask for an upgrade room was not an upgrade room smelled like sewer. Whole room smelled like nothing but sewer. The carpet looked like something for the 1800. And the bed it had nothing but sheets on it. They didn't even put a fitted shirt on the
Bed. Nothing like the pictures they sent or online this was very deceiving. Said would have a bar in room didn't even have a refrigerator. Was the worst place to stay. When checked in they didn't ask if I would like to see shows or nothing. Didn't know where anything was and it was just the worst. Went here for my wife birthday and this place was a mess. Please go somewhere else instead of here, had to be the worst. Be aware and stay some where else

I was showing a friend around the strip, since it was his first time to Vegas.  We were not gambling or partying, and we only had a short stay in town, so I told him he had to at least walk the strip once so that he can see all the different casinos.  Many of the other casinos have something to offer, a theme, free show, etc, but the Monte Carlo, is so plain and boring.  We walked inside and basically walked back out.

This was my first stay at the Monte Carlo. My room was nothing special and I didn't pay for or expect any different. After all when your in Vegas who is worried much about your room. The one thing that did annoy me was the fire alarm needed new batteries and would not quit beeping. Drove me up the wall until I finally took it down. 

The hotel amenities, eating, pool and staff were all decent. The casino floor is busy and bustling. It's positioned well on the strip with convenient access to many of the other popular hotels.

Stayed here in August as part of a Southwest Airlines Vacation package, and I thought it was a good value for the money I spent.  I thought the decor was tasteful but not overbearing, and even though it lacks a "theme" you still get that Vegas grandeur, so it was nice.  I ate at Brand Steakhouse (again in September actually) and I thought it was really good.  Not a cheap meal, mind you, but very well done and the wait staff was excellent.  I also ate at the Dragon Noodle, and I thought it was only okay for the price.  This may have been because the person I was with was getting on my nerves, but I wasn't overly impressed by the food.  The menu was extensive though.  

The pool is decent, nothing fancy, though there is a wave pool. 

The rooms at the Monte Carlo are decent, not super cheapo but nothing extremely fancy.  I too thought it odd there were only two pillows on the bed, but I don't use pillows so it didn't matter.  Overall I will say the room was nicely sized, as was the bathroom, and the maid staff was on top of things.  Like other reviewers have mentioned, the walls are not the thickest, but who cares if you hear your neighbor's shower.  Who needs complete silence in a room in Vegas?  Who's even in their room when they're in Vegas???

I thought the addition of a food court was nice, because you don't always want to have to sit down in a restaurant (and sometimes you really jsut want subway) and it came in really handy for late night munchies.  However, it wasn't open 24 hours, which was kind of a bummer.  The casino area is pretty big, but not really confusing like some of the other big hotels, like say Caesars.  The Monte casino is pretty much straight back from the street, so I found it really easy to find the rest of my party when we did wander away from each other. 

Overall, I would stay here again, it is nicely situated on the strip so you're close to all the action, but it didn't feel so crowded as some of the other themed hotels.  If you can catch a good deal from MGM, this is a great bet.

My fianc and I stayed in the spa suite at Monte Carlo. The room was incredibly outdated, the "spa" was just a big bath tub with jets that have been covered over that gave no use, the bathroom lighting was sterile, and the shower had mold, as well as the furniture looked like they were from the 60s. Overall it was ugly and depressing. Also, for a "spa suite" they do not supply a coffee pot or a microwave. When we asked for one from the front desk, they told us they do not supply those for ANY of the rooms. Seriously? I have never been to a hotel that did not provide us with at least a coffee pot. Insanity. Not to mention, I went to the Starbucks downstairs and a grande sized drink was 7 dollars!! Go figure. Will never ever be coming to the Monte Carlo again.

I went there on Christmas because it was cheaper than other places. At check out they mistakenly charged me 3 nights with resort fees instead of one. if I hadnt called they would have got the money. At 7 AM housekeeping just barged in. even if I didn't out the do not disturb sign I would expect they knock on the door first not come in and then tell me they're housekeepers. 

Rooms had no design. they just seem to throw tables and chairs and chest of drawers in there. Dusty and dirty.

This rating is probably too high... valet and check in was smooth n quick...and it ends there..... the room was an embarrassment to any hotelier who thought their rooms were great......NOT!!!! lets see.... NO DRAWERS, ONLY 1 CHAIR AT A HIGH TABLE, HUGE WASTED SPACE IN THE BATHROOM, NO DRAWERS TO PUT YUR UNDIES N SOCKS IN!
Unbelievable!!!! For over $200 a night...no drawers(did I mention this??)...nothing to put anything... ANYWHERE!!!... 
2ND HUGE areas of nothing...SEE PHOTOS....THEY ARE REMODELING OVER HALF THE CASINO....and over 17000 people will be just next door to watch the VGK first game..... if i was on the MGM board, i would be asking for the resignations of the piss poor planning managers who run the place..... what a disgrace

This hotel teeters between 3 and 4 stars:

4 stars b\/c...great location on strip, cheap room rates, easy entrance to hotel rooms w\/out having to weave into casino section, FUN FUN wave pool and lazy river!

3 stars b\/c...old hotel, so-so beds, old bedding - still uses flannel blanket padding with a flat bedsheet over mattress, so it comes easily untucked at night.

Overall, the 4 star pros outweighted the 3 stars.  We got a great deal that included 2 day entrances to the spa (worth checking out), 2 free drinks at the Monte Carlo brew pub and 2 free buffet tickets.

Their spa entrance is $22 for the day (or just $19 to use the gym).  They have a cold pool (70 degrees), hot whirlpool (104 degrees), steam room and dry sauna.

Their brew pub is ok.  They stopped brewing their own beer 2 years ago, so it's a little misleading, but nonetheless it was a nice\/large pub.

TL;DR: I'm never staying here again. Terrible customer service, dirty rooms, and the place is under construction so the pool is closed and there are loud noises.

My friends and I got a hotel room here. I landed much earlier so I checked in in the afternoon. No issues until I got to the room and realized that the outlets in the room were broken, the lights were out, and to top it all off, after a quick 10 minute nap my whole face was covered in a rash - not sure how clean the sheets are (read reviews that there were bed bugs?!)

Anyway, I feel that when a customer is literally going through hell, that the first rule of thumb should be to make things right. Instead, they sent me to a new room that reeked of old cigarettes when I specifically told them I needed a clean room and for the sheets to be switched to the hypoallergenic kind given my experience less than 2 hours ago. The lady at the front desk who I spoke with was curt, rude, and was speaking so fast like she just wanted to get off the phone.

Currently awaiting the third room change - I've been waiting for over an hour now...

EDIT:

Waited an hour and called back down. Turns out they were never even fixing up the new room so I was waiting for nothing. Front desk manager is going to "make it right" and throw in $50 dining credit, but at this point, I know for a fact I'm never staying here again.
Really liked this place.  It had a nice layout of the casino floor, it was not smokey, and it had a very open feel to it.  Well kept up.  Stop by and say hi.

Overall, my stay was a decent experience considering the price and the location.

Checking in was a bit of a wait but once we reached the front desk, the staff was very personable and friendly. We arrived earlier than the 3 pm check-in time but they had no issues finding a clean room ready for us. 

Our room was on the 14th floor which sadly had a terrible view so I kept the windows drawn the majority of the weekend. It was clean and I was happy to find the bathrooms bigger than I expected.

I did notice that during the duration of our stay housekeeping came at odd times. Our room was ignored the majority of the day when we were out but was clean between 4pm and 10 pm when we came back. I'm used to housekeeping cleaning at an earlier time but as long as it's done right?

There is complimentary monorail system within the resort connecting the hotel to CityCenter and Bellagio. Check the times that it runs though. I tried using it Saturday morning around 8 am and it was not running. We ended up walking to Wicked Spoon for brunch which was fine.

The restaurants in the hotel all got less than stellar reviews so I more or less avoided them during my stay. My sister went to their breakfast buffet one of the days and found it lacking especially for its $22+ price tag. Her words were "nothing to write home about." 

I did like the fact that the hotel was right next door to a CVS which is open 24 hours a day. It's convenient!

The daily resort fee includes internet access, gym access and 2 complimentary bottles of water among other things. Use of the steam room and Jacuzzi is not included in the price ($10\/person\/day). The resort did not have Wifi. The internet access is via a cord on the desk in the room. 

If you want to ride their shuttle to the airport, it's $7\/person so it's nice if you are traveling alone.

Overall, it's not a bad resort but I would probably look at the room prices at other resorts on the strip to compare before booking.

I have probably stayed at the Monte Carlo about 4 to 5 times over the span of my lifetime. Each time was a decent time spent here - however I realized this past stay it's pretty FAR from the clubs and restaurants I like to frequent. Below is a review of my most recent stay this past weekend - one nighter trip folks. The Monte Carlo is slowly becoming one of those old Vegas hotels like the Flamingo and Imperial Palace. 

Pros:
+ Room rates are great 
+ Room was decent size
+ They have a Casino War table
+ Friendly staff (Valet, Check-In, Restaurant staff) 

Cons:
- Room temperature was just never right (too warm or too cold) 
- Sink and tub clogged everytime someone used it (We had to wait in between showers - LAME!) 
- Food selection besides food court was very limited, it seemed as if the only moderately priced restaurant was the Cafe or Diablo's Cantina. 
- The $10.95 Resort Fee that is mandatory charged for amenities I did not take advantage of. Besides the two mini sized water bottles they left in the hotel room. 

I guess there are more cons to this hotel, however for someone that doesn't really sleep when I'm in Vegas my bank account appreciates the concious effort to save money on the hotel stay.

Hey, I remember these fixtures and these pastel paintings -- my mom decorated our home this way in 1992! Hello not-yet-retro, bleck!

Everything started off predictably well - the check in service was quick, and the staff was friendly. But all went downhill when the light of day hit my room. 

No WiFi, and the wired in outlet was on the fritz. The room was not properly cleaned before my arrival. Sure, it was surface swept, but not well at all - the remains of a shopping spree's plastic price tags littered the floor between the beds, the toilet seat was wet, and there were strange black smears on two of the pillows and the outer comforter. Partner that up with a suspicious smell to the water, a shower fixture that could decapitate any royal and soaps that left me so dry I immediately peeled two layers of skin in an alligator like fashion and well... it's not tough to see why I wasn't impressed. 

Salvageable moments: the cabana guy lent me an inner tube for free, but he also made me wait a few minutes while he helped people who came after me. Worth getting it for free, because a $10 inner tube rental for a pretty small and bland lazy river would have really made me feel ripped off. And from the tram station, the pool looks pretty - complete with a beach volleyball court! 

For the deal I got, it was almost worth it. $50 a night plus the $15 a night hotel fees, of course. But I think next time I'll remember, you pay for what you get.

As it's my last day staying here I thought I'd share since the reviews seem shaky.  This place is beautiful and has a great location on the strip.  The room is actually a great size for a standard king bed room.  Clean and nice!

The hotel is very clean and I enjoy staying here but the furniture in the rooms need updating. We stayed in the one bedroom suite with kitchen and living room and the couch and chairs were extremely uncomfortable. Good location on the strip

As you see by the response from Monte Carlo customer service looks like there in the process of updating. Thanks for the quick response!

Monte Carlo is a pretty tired hotel. The rooms were pretty worn out, with no WIFI, which is bad if you are an international or business traveller. It does have a pretty good selection of small restaurants and fast food places, but a quick look on the web will find you better accommodation at the same or cheaper prices.

I stayed in this hotel for the second week of June for about 2 nights. We arrived Friday night ( basically Saturday actually) because it was a little past midnight. There was no problem checking in at all. We got to our room and everything was fine . The hotel rooms are basic. Nothing spectacular or great . A bed, a television a desk and a chair . The bathrooms are pretty basic as well! I think the price was a little bit to much for the room itself! I paid about $417 and really didn't feel like I got a bang for my buck! Most importantly the only thing that really caught my attention was the extremely nice ladies doing room service! I guess our room door sometimes didn't lock properly, and as me and my boyfriend were leaving Saturday morning the lady cleaning the room before ours told us how to make sure that the door was locked and not kept opened ! If it wasn't for her we would have left our door unlocked !!! Overall I would not mind staying here again, but it's nothing fancy or over the top just a little pricey!

You lend your parking garage to T-Mobile arena so when folks like me set out to visit your property, the garage is full. Your employees direct me to the Excalibur garage, a half a mile away. Big Bummer. While seeing Bill Burr the ushers gather in a clump along the left side of the theater and talk during the show to the point I had to SHUSH them. I go to the concession stand inside the venue, The Park, to get a drink and before the show started - the concession stand is closed. Wow.

I'm in my 3rd of 4 nights at this hotel. I've been to Vegas several times, and never stayed at a ruder place or more of a dump, and that's impressive when I've even stayed at the Flamingo.

First, I booked a smoking room, as my friend (in her first trip to LV) is a smoker. Get here and find out, after getting to the room, that they have no smoking rooms...it was a website glitch that offered it. So can we cancel because they were unable to provide the room we booked, since we found one that offered it (and cheaper) at Treasure Island - a much better hotel and end of the Strip? With a lot of attitude we were told sure we could cancel, but since it was within 24 hours of scheduled check-in and they bear no responsibility for not offering the kind of room we booked, they indeed would charge us for the entire booked stay. Awesome customer service and way to own up for your own mistakes, while earning a repeat customer (sense the sarcasm). Best of all, I certainly expect to find charges for all of our buffets, which were covered in our stay. Though I showed them the confirmation emails that stated it, they had no record of it in their systems. We will find out in a couple days on check out.

Off of the elevator, the carpet looks like it was installed in the 50's and never thoroughly cleaned, since. The air in the hallway wreaks of some spray that smells like a cross between cigar smoke and b.o. The room has cheap, ratty wallpaper and cheap faux brass bathroom fixtures. The a\/c has been on 62 for over 2 days and we are still sweating because it has one small vent blowing directly at a wall. No amenities at all...don't even expect a $10 coffee pot in the room. Not even in the suite we originally checked-into.

The new T-Mobile Arena is next door. Don't expect to sleep if there is any event and you're facing it, because the speakers blare so loud that even 18 floors up, you can hear every word as your windows shake.

Overall, after many trips to Vegas for both fun and work, and staying at a variety of hotels, this has been the worst. (1) Rude employees who do not care whether you get what you booked and paid for; (B) Incredibly dated rooms that look cheap and feel dirty and never cool down thanks to the non-existent a\/c; (3) bad location at the north end of The Strip; (4) Loud, even for the Strip, if you are Arena-side - you might as well be sleeping under a runway at the airport. Trust me, Caesar's is worth the extra money, as it beats this dump in all these ways and more. If you can't afford that, try Paris, TI, etc.

As far as the rooms go, I've stayed in nicer Motel 6's. We got a standard two queen bed room. There is NO WI FI available in the rooms; only in the food court and the business area. Horrible showers! Ours only half way worked. Most of the water came out of the bath tub spout rather than the shower head. 
Location is good. Love the tram that is above Aria (attached to monte carlo!) it takes you to the Ballagio in about 5 min.

This place looks really, really old inside. In the room I was in, the pillows smelled of an old attic, the remote control to the TV was dusty, the carpet on the floor was falling apart, and the TV turned off by itself with the remote all the way on the other side of the room.

1) NO WI-FI - really? 

 2) BEWARE - Resort fee on top of booking price.  If you look on their website it's actually called Monte Carlo RESORT & Casino.Booked for $51 and came out to $83  b\/c the stupid resort fee and taxes. TRUST ME--IT'S FAR FROM A RESORT EXPERIENCE. Might as well stay at the motel 8 or excalibur for 1\/3 of this price since it's a very similar setting.

3) No refrigerator

4) Did I mention it's REALLY OLD inside?

Solid hotel for a ridiculous weekend. 

Let's face it, we're not here to relax and lounge in our hotel rooms. We only need the basics: comfy beds, a semi-spacious bathroom and enough mirrors to put on our faces! Monte Carlo hit the nail on the head. 

We did have two issues: 
1. The check in process took well over an hour due to their servers being down.
2. Due to MC's chaotic and poor organization, a group of guests were given access to our room and actually walked in on us. Thankfully we all had our clothes on! :P

Why it took over 2 days for the servers to get back up and running is beyond me! Are there no IT guys in Vegas??

We were able to get free entry into the spa\/sauna and some credit for room service due to the mishaps. Nice sauna & steam room. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion and other toiletries are available for use. They also have a couple lounge chairs and sofas with veggie\/fruit infused water in the spa. 

Room service was not very memeorable. It would have been nice if they gave us credit for the food court instead- better value and better food! 

There are a lot of other nicer hotels, but if you're just looking for a decent place to stay, look no further!

I will never stay here again. 

When we first arrived, check-in took far too long - 30-45 mins. Not because the line was particularly long, but because the 20-something kids at the check in desk were laughing and chatting with each other, not helping customers. We finally got to our room, and it was more comparable to a motel than a Vegas resort. Everything was outdated, yes, but the sheets were ripped, there were stains all over the floor, the a\/c was broken (on the hottest day on record in Vegas), we found bugs, and the "strip view", which I paid extra for, was a view of a few cheap liquor stores and the massive concrete roof of the casino below. On top of it all, there were no extra sheets or blankets in the room, so we shared the sheet that sat on top of the stained comforter. We suffered through a fitful sleep and left early in the morning for another hotel. I will say, however, the woman at check out was extremely apologetic and refunded a good portion of our money. 

If you're young, don't have a lot of money and are looking for a place to crash after you party, Monte Carlo is for you. Otherwise, I suggest going just about anywhere else.

My husband and I have been coming to the Monte Carlo for years. It's a great location and has a lot going on but isn't as crazy as some of the larger hotels. One of the main reasons we always come back is Scott the bartender who works days near the sports book. He is super personable, hilarious and keeps us entertained while we play video poker. The hotel is going under massive renovations so even with less tables and restaurants it's still our top choice. This is the first trip where we stayed in a renovated room and the upgrades are a big improvement. We were pretty bummed out that all of the outdoor restaurants are gone now, and understand they are getting rid of the sports book in favor of a smaller area where you can place sports bets, but we are looking forward to seeing what further improvements are going to be made. I would probably give it a three star rating since there is a lot of construction, but it gets an additional star because of Scott.

Who make the pillows in this hotel?
They are so thick and hard that we all woke up with our neck hurting.

Trashy.  Poorly maintained rooms.  Poorly maintained pool area.  Unhelpful staff.

The last night of my stay found the adjoining room serving as a battleground for a couple.  They screamed for hours.  A child in the room cried uncontrollably,  When security arrived around midnight to "take care" of the situation, they left without doing anything.  Ok, ok, so they knocked on the door several times, but when the guests refused to open the door, security left.  They reported to me that they could not violate their guests' privacy.  What about my right to get a good night's sleep?  The fighting continued after security disappeared.  It was 4 am before they stopped.

My complaints on checkout fell on deaf ears.  Please find a Vegas hotel that cares about its good guests.  Unless you like to stay in a trash pit, do not stay at Monte Carlo.

Faulty wiring in the room. Tried for two days to get it addresses with no resolution. It is quite unnerving to find bare wires just shoved into the electrical sockets. What are these people thinking?!? Does Nevada have no building codes?

Stayed here for two nights for my bday this past March and I was not impressed. For some reason I was thinking the hotel was new or newly renovated.... I guess I was wrong. We decided to stay here since the rates are always high during spring break and Monte Carlo was cheaper than Excalibur. 

Hotel is small but it was fine. I'd stay here again over Excalibur.

My second stay at monte carlo. I love this hotel
Its on the strip, easy access, back entrance for valet parking, great staffs, great services, great valets, great atmosphere, ambiance people.  Its not crowded and its nice and quiet. Although we didn't get a strip view but thats okay. Giant comfy cozy king size bed non - smoking room fabulous!  2 free breakfast buffet! Yay! Affordable prices, would definitely come back and enjoy this hotel again

I'm not a Vegas Girl but Vegas is okay every few years. However, my mom and dad love Vegas. And when they go, we (my brother and sister and their families) HAVE to go as well.

That's how Boyfriend and I ended up in Monte Carlo.  PARA LA FAMILIA. Family consensus.  Never mind that  BF and I wanted to stay at the Venetian which is my first choice for my forty winks in Vegas. It has to be where my mom and dad, sister, brother-in-law, baby, brother, etc. (you get the picture) stay.

Monte Carlo is actually not bad:

1. It is on the Strip right across New York, New York within walking distance to the Paris, Bellagio, etc.

2. It's one of the few hotels with no gimmick. It's just what it is-- a hotel, not a theme park, a pyramid, a city in France, etc.  It is still opulent with marble floors and huge chandeliers.  

3.  The rooms were decent although our bathroom had a tiny mold in it. But our room  on the 25th floor with the view of the Strip ($40 more), it was worth it to see Vegas come alive at night!  The hotel was loud but the rooms were quiet. 

4.  Monte Carlo has Brands Steakhouse which was hip and contemporary as well as a so-so cheap buffet restaurant ($20 dinner)  and Diablo's Cantina Club\/Restaurant. It has a spa and pool frequented by semi-nude, hot looking people.

5. I can't really be hating on Monte Carlo since this is where Boyfriend and I won $1000 on a 25 cent slot machine. Yes!  (We only spent $20!)  My family could not believe it since they knew I don't gamble since I'm such a sour loser. (I'd rather go shopping!) Must be my beginner's luck!  

6. What did we do with our winnings? 
     a. Check out my review of Smith and Wollensky Steakhouse. ;)
     b. Boyfriend and I spent $50 on room service at 1 AM for champagne and potstickers which came on a round table with white linen which was wheeled into our room with all the cutleries and our nicely chilled bottle of champagne in a bucket.
     c.  I treated my whole family to a lunch buffet.
     d. Countless cocktails in souvenir glasses while walking on the Strip with my whole family to check out Caesar's Palace, Paris and watch the dancing water at the Bellagio (my dad's favorite.)

Being with my family was equally fun and crazy.  This weekend was for the family but BF sneaked in a little romance on the side.  WHAT HAPPENED IN VEGAS HAPPENED.  I'm so glad it did!
It's a decent hotel that's in the middle of everything on the Strip...  Hopefully they renovate it shortly since some stuff is dilapidated.  The front desk girls here are cute too! =)

Monte Carlo is in a prime location on the strip - the middle.  For me, that's their biggest highlight.  Judging from the nice statues and upkeep of the outside one might come to expect more from the inside.  However don't.  The inside looks old and dingy.  Their rooms reflect this feel.  I was disappointed and felt deceived at the table when we ordered Hennessy shots and were given some other cognac.  When we asked the cocktail waitress she said that's the only kind they're allowed to serve... fine but at least be upfront with me about it instead of hoping that maybe I wouldnt know the difference!  I give it a 3 stars because the rooms while old looking were decently clean and price was reasonable.  Stay here if you're on a budget but party and play elsewhere.

Would give them 0 stars if I could.. Horrible horrible customer service. Had an issue with my bill and the girl didn't seem to know what she was doing . Talked to Maurico the manager and he said there was nothing he could do and tried to transfer me to someone else.. if your a hotel manager isn't that your job!? Don't try and pass the problem. Handle it yourself and take some responsibility. Long hold times on phone and also got disconnected on hold multiple times. Room service food was terrible. Fees after fees after fees.. UPDATE MAURICO called and refunded some of the FEES I was charged after my YELP and FACEBOOK REVIEW.. I am happy they reached out and will give them 3 stars instead of 1 only because customers shouldn't have to go through so much trouble

I was surprised at how reasonably price the rooms are here not to mention clean and hospitable.  It's primo location, right in the middle of the Strip and it really is a nice hotel.  The pool area is pretty large, complete with a lazy river.  It's no Mandalay pool but it's less crowded and the rooms are way cheaper.  I would definitely stay here again!

Blood on the bathroom wall! I will attach photos and video soon. There was blood next to the toilet in the bathroom, they switched my room to another one with an uglier view and that room had stains on all of the sheets. I will post photos and videos of this, they took off $50, that is it. 

Do not stay here.

Good hotel. Pricey. Rather stay at Venetian. However the Spa upgrade would be great, but they didn't have any for me as they were all booked. My aunt had it and the room was amazing. 
The pool was WAY too crowded... And don't waste $ renting the tubes.. $10 to rent $12 to buy, much better to buy them. I feel it's worth the extra $ to go to Venetian

Called the number on back of Player's Card and this place had the bet rate for a Friday night - $130.

I will be back here again, and here's why:

-Rolled up at midnight and was in and out of valet within 30 seconds
-Check in was a bit confusing since there was no line but people just standing around an waiting.  I waited in an open spot, was promptly called up, received the room keys and was on my way in less than 5 minutes
-Elevator is right next to check-in, no walking across the casino floor
-great location: right next to City Center
-late checkout at 12pm

No problems here. We stayed for free, thanks to a time-share presentation that was actually FUN!!! The casino and hotel were big enough but not too big (Hello, MGM!) and the late-night food court options were highly welcomed. Read: Sbarro at 5:00 am after a looong night playing blackjack might be the best thing I've ever tasted.

The entire pool area was surrounded by a vast construction zone which was taking the place of the late and great Boardwalk Hotel and Casino, where I happened to get married. However, the pool-area speakers were blasting 80s, 90s and today's hits at the perfect pitch to drown out 99% of the construction noise. The pool was awesome, complete with lazy river, regular pool and wave pool, as well as some of the most beautiful bodies in swimwear you'll ever see (my husband especially!). 

The location of the Monte Carlo on the Strip is also fabulous. Good stuff, good stuff.

For the price, this place is great. Party of 3, spending about $40 a night per person for a great hotel, great location, perhaps one of the best locations on the strip! Buffet is not that good but you can get a good deal if you go to a discount booth where they sell discount show tickets. We got in for brunch for 12-13$ and the food was mediocre but fairly good value for the cost. Lost of variety.

McD, Rubios, etc in the downstairs lobby for cheap food if you like. Also Monte is one of few places with $5 blackjack tables so if you want to do that this is the place!

A complaint though is shitty wifi and shower head was not the best but still overall pretty great.

I will never stay at this hotel again!  The staff were all very nice but the management needs to wake up.  I brought my daughter and her friends here for a 21st birthday.  Well it started with the deluxe rooms with wallpaper from the 80s overlooking a construction site (and the noise that goes with it), and duct tape holding the carpet together in the hallways.  It is all about the bottom line for the hotel.  The shots the bartender recommended that my daughter wanted at midnight when she turned 21 ended up costing $82 for five.  Drinks at the pool ranged from $15 to $18 apiece.  No coffee makers in the room so you have to go wait in the Starbucks like for 30 minutes each morning.  And of course no minbar or fridge in the room to keep anything you brought with you cold because they want you to buy it from them. And to top it off be sure to bring your ID to the club.  Not to show that you are 21 but you have to have an ID to get into the club.  After spending 30 years in the Army to keep this country free I now have to show an ID to go into a public place. Really!  If you want to spend over $1000 for a three day weekend and get this abuse then the Monte Carlo is the place to stay.

Perfect location on the strip! Our room was nice, clean, didn't smell of smoke at all. In fact, our entire floor (31st) was smoke free. Check in seemed crowded, but the lines moved fast. Staff was very courteous. Called for feather pillows and they arrived within an hour. There is NO coffee maker in the room, but at least there's a food court with Starbucks, McDonalds, etc.  The music at the pools was rediculously loud, and the wave pool was emptied for the season. Kind of a party crowd scene at the pool area. There's a GREAT free tram that goes to City Center & Bellagio! Overall, good stay and would recommend this hotel because it was priced right and the location can't be beat.

I stayed here for three nights with my fianc last week. For the most part, the hotel is pleasant. The hotel lobby is big, welcoming. Hotel concierge and desk clerks are nice and outgoing. Once we got up to our floor, the hallways look much older than the rest of the hotel downstairs. The carpet was a little dirty, it was wrippled, and there were moths on the ceilings in the hallway and we even found one in our room. The room wasn't too bad. The bathroom sink could have been cleaner along with the shower. The faucet was dirty and soap scum covered the rim of it. Moving from there, I have some Pros and Cons:

Pros:
-Flat screen television in the room.
-Two bottles of water provided each day by housekeeping, along with coffee.
-Casino floor was clean and enjoyable. FREE DRINKS!
-Breakfast buffet was really good. Plenty of selections for breakfast needs.
-Caf restaurant had decent food for breakfast.
-Pool and lazy river were comfortable.
-Check in and check out were easy and quick. 
-Decent parking structure, safe.
-Tram service from the hotel to the Bellagio was very useful, especially for getting over to Caesars Palace quickly and the rest of the strip.


Cons:
-Bathroom was a little dirty, shower and sink.
-Leaky iron.
-Buffet lunch and dinner weren't fantastic. Very mediocre.
-Room floor hallways weren't very welcoming. They were somewhat dark and the    carpet could have used a good cleaning.

Overall, The Monte Carlo is a decent place to stay for a couple days. I don't recommend the buffet for lunch or dinner, just breakfast.

The pics on their site and the room does NOT LOOK THE SAME!!!! 

* booked the "SPA SUITE" for 5 nights for a little over $1500 and it was NOT worth it. 

Cons:
- wallpaper peeling
- cricket in our room
- couch falling apart (a nail scratched my leg, cleaned it and I was praying no flesh eating bacteria was gna kill me)
- dirty glass cups
- ceiling on top of the spa was leaking one night
- escalators rarely on (and I have a bad knee... Handicap elevators led u outside and back inside, inconvenient) 

Pro: 
- friendly staff
- clean casino floor

I don't recommend this hotel

Honestly I expected a lot better! Let just say its a cleaner version of Excalibur Hotel. I would come back personally. The pool was cool and the ambiance was good. The casino was just like any other casino no complaints there. Promoters kept bugging us to go into their lounge but to tell you the truth it looked very badly kept and they were letting people in with anything on so I had no intentions of going in there. It centrally located on the strip which is nice. It was not a dirty hotel but I am not going to lie and say it was nice either.

Of the hotels I have stayed at in Vegas, I would rate this one as average.  Nothing spectacular.  We arrived in the morning hoping to check in early.  No such luck.  Went and had lunch and while there, I received a text my room was ready.  Went back and it was, however, the people we were with, their room was not.  And this was at almost 300 PM.  So, we all went to our room and hung out until their room was ready shortly thereafter.  Anyway.  Hung out at the pool area some, it was average.  Drink service was kinda slow, although the towel service was super friendly and the pool was nice to take a quick dip in.  Room was nice, but nothing amazing (we stayed in a Monaco Suite).  The wi-fi was painfully slow, which was annoying.  Gym was nice, but kinda small.  And various machines were broke while we were there.  The spa looked nice, but I did not get any treatments done this trip.  There was an amazing yogurt place called Yogurt In that I tried while there.  AWESOME.  Try the peanut butter.  Also ate at Diablo's, which was a fun vibe and super yummy (try the veggie burrito and chips\/salsa).  We hung at Ignite one night and had an awesome time people watching.  Drinks were yummy there.  Hotel was very hard to get in and out (tons of traffic).  Weird location that was very busy on the Strip.  Anyway, if you can get a deal, stay here.  If not, there are better Suites on the Strip for sure.

A nice mid-range Vegas hotel. The prices are good, and the rooms are comfortable.

It is right next door to the brand new T-Mobile arena, which can be a problem. When there is an event the hotel get very busy and the check-in line gets impossibly long.

The hotel is 20 years old, an eternity in Vegas time. It is going to have a $450 million dollar renovation next year and be relabelled Park MGM. The hotel will stay open during the renovation.

Room was decent and the hotel itself was nice but wasn't impressed with the food choices or the dealers attitudes. I would not stay here again unless it was for another bachelor party or for guys weekend as it is a nice place to sleep.

Good enough for people looking to save on a hotel (if you get below rack rate), while still being on the strip and close to good restaurants and bars. 

Service is mediocre:  long lines at check-in and while waiting to re-issue keys.  
Rooms are fine, but aging
No wireless internet:  Only wired internet is included with the $20 resort fee
Fitness center is decent:  Not at all crowded, while the spa is quite nice with treatment rooms, whirlpool tubs, steam room and sauna.
Good location near the south end of the strip, very close to Aria which has nice restaurants and the cosmopolitan clubs.
Pools:  I found it to be an odd combination of spring break partyers with music thumping in one pool and kids playing with floaty toys in another pool.  Couldn't really determine the target market for the hotel.

My lovely fianc and I stayed at the Monte Carlo recently for my birthday. To say the least, this MGM property was terribly disappointing. 

The pool was closed for remodeling. Very disappointing since it is June, and the weather is warm.

Upon arrival, our room, a "spa suite" as advertised was a total disappointment. For one, I'm citing false advertising as the suite has a large "tub" in the room; not a spa or jacuzzi as you are led to believe. 

After dinner and a very late night on the strip we paid for an extended check out time of 3:00 pm. At 6:00 AM we first were woken up by a poorly designed room that lets ALOT of sunlight in at an angle that beams directly onto your face while in bed. Not a great way to say hello to the morning Vegas sun after being out in the strip all night. 

About an hour or so later we were again rudely woken up by another poorly thought out idea by this MGM property. Our suite was right next door to Construction WORK, like right next door to our suite!! Loud constantly drilling and pounding that didn't stop. We called guest services to complain, but the construction kept going on. Not a great way to sleep in after a night on the strip. 

Lastly, there were remnants of bugs on the sheets and dirty stains on the carpet as well. 

Overall the experience at the Monte Carlo was not that good at all. We were expecting much more for for the price we paid and what was advertised. 

I most likely would not recommend the Monte Carlo to anyone for that matter.

I've never stayed here, but I may have to try sometime.  This is one of my regular gambling spots in Vegas.  It's a clean casino -- as clean as they can be anyway -- and, while not large by the standard of other Strip casinos, it's got a decent mix of tables, slots, etc.  I find the machines relatively loose too, and I seem to find lower-limit tables more often here than most other nearby casinos, neither of which ever hurts my desire to return.  It seems to be a somewhat forgotten hotel among some of the big dogs at the south end of the Strip, and the lighter traffic means it's generally more open inside.  (The addition of Diablo's Mexican Cantina outside between my last two trips definitely seemed to increase the pedestrian draw, but I still didn't see much of an increase inside.)

Non-Smoking Room... 

I was staying in Las Vegas for work and was put up in the Monte Carlo hotel. 
As for choices of restaurants and their casino, it's like any other, pretty good.  As for their security's willingness to respond to a customers complaint... pretty poor.  

I was on the 29th floor with an adjoining room and the people next to my room were hot-boxing their room and somehow due to the ventilation in their room and mine, the smoke blew directly into my room. 

I called down to the front desk earlier in the evening before I went to dinner and they apologized and said they would send security up to handle it, I'm not sure what happened because I left. 
Then I came back to my room around midnight and went to sleep. Around 3:00 am I woke up out of a dead sleep with cigarette smoke wafting into my room. 

I called down to the front desk again and they had a record of it because they saw that I had called earlier in the evening. They again said they would send up security. As I'm writing this at 4:30 am nobody from security has come to their room. I called down to the front desk again and they acted surprised when I told them Security had not been up to handle it. So, I asked if I could could switch to another room and they said they would set something up for me by 5pm I'll told them I'd be working most of the day so that would be fine. 

This review is really more for their lack of security presents and lack of ability to handle something as simple as a customer smoking in a non-smoking room and it effecting one of their other customers experience. 

Note: When I checked in they asked me what was my "smoking preference" and I told them "non-smoking room" look, I'm not being a complainer about "a little cigarette smoke" it was terrible  

Hopefully in a few hours when I get up to go to work they can get me into a non-adjoining room and the rest of my stay will be smoke free... 

we'll see what happens...

With a spontaneous trip to Vegas, we needed a CHEAP hotel on the strip.  Looking online we saw Monte Carlo had a great deal for $171 for two night stay.  With 4 girls, we couldn't turn down that price.

This is the first time staying at Monte Carlo and I have to say I wasn't really impressed by anything.  They had few amentities in the hotel such as shops and places to eat.  The rooms were not modern and beds were not that comfy at all.  Also, BEWARE of the construction going on around this place.  We were awoken every morning around 8 - 9 AM with banging noises.  Pretty annoying since we didn't go to bed until 4 AM every night. 

The plus side about this place was the awesome pool they had.  They had a great DJ playing all day along with a river pool and wave pool.  If It wasn't for the pool I probably would have given this place one star.

Other than being centrally located, Please don't waste your time stay somewhere else. This hotel needs some serious up grades! Upon entering my room I noticed a strong cigarette smell. It's was terrible! I called down to the front desk to let them know they put me in a smoking room and I didn't request a smoking room. She let me know that all rooms are non-smoking. (Could of fooled me). So they sent someone up to febreeze the room. That didn't work. I called back down and request a room change. I spoke to TanShea (I think that was her name) she was very professional and she assisted me immediately. Second room smelled much better. 

Pros: a lot of restaurants with in walking distance. 
T-mobile arena directly across the street.

Not sure where to start but I travel quit a bit and this was the worst stay I can remember. Check in was brutal 90 minutes on a Wednesday at 4:30pm when i finally did make the counter I commented on what a rush they must be having and the guy said "it is always like this" I can confirm this as every time day and night I walked by the front desk the line was way too long. Wifi was awful i called support services and they had me walk down the hall 6 rooms to a hot spot to get on so every night when I needed to work I sat outside room 14 208 so i could connect, on the positive side the wifi was very good so if you need a place to work the connection is great there. When i went to bed I pulled the night stand out a little to get to a plug for my phone (see pic below of the napkin and Doritos on the floor behind the stand) I don't think my room had seen a vacuum in a very long time. It also looked like they had pulled of the phone cord but left the staples sticking out of the wall, seemed very dangerous for an ankle or child. On the positive side I doubt anyone would bring a child to this place as CPS would likely take them away from you for doing so. The carpet in the hall looked like a dead body had been dragged down it and by the elevator bank was truly disgusting (see pics) also the wall in the hall was opened up and the base board was falling off. To add insult to injury I had to pay a $39 nightly resort fee for a hotel with no resort...The pool area is completely closed. They do offer a shuttle to Mandalay Bay but it runs on the hour making it a little difficult to try and catch a little quick sun between meetings. On the positive side my meetings were next door at the Oriental and my buddy gave me his extra room key and their pool was fabulous. The first morning I left a tip and note for housekeeping which I always do (see attached pic) when i got back to my room that evening it was still on the desk, no housekeeping came by. Positive side I saved $5. The last straw was the incredible construction noise that starts at 7am and goes to 5pm, I happened to be staying on floor 14 while they remodeled floor 15 so the noise was crazy loud. DO NOT STAY HERE ANYWHERE WILL BE BETTER!!!!!!

Stayed here for a couple of nights.  We got one free night with the resort fee comped to us because of the MyVegas rewards.  Stayed an additional night for about $59.00.  The room was very nice as well as the bathroom.  All staff we dealt with was fantastic and enthusiastic.  Nataly and James at the front desk were great as well. Even the houskeeping staff was really nice to us when we needed something.  When I saw how nice the room was, I couldn't believe I had once paid the same price to stay at  a roach-ridden Motel 6.  The pool area was fun.  My husband, son and I had lots of fun in the Lazy River, Wave pool and regular pool. We would definately stay at Monte Carlo again.

The construction noise near the hotel was unbearable. Jackhammers everywhere building the City Center complex. Very loud at the pool. They try and cover up the noise with ultra loud bad rock music that just adds to the din. If you're planning on being by the pool a lot forget it. The rooms were ok but I've seen better. I'd consider staying there after construction ends if the rooms stay cheap. If not I can think of plenty of other options.

My boyfriend and I stayed here 3 weeks ago for the first Rock in Rio festival ever in the U.S. I must say I was very impressed for the price and what we got out of staying here.The location is great because it's right off the strip so you're close to a lot and there was a pretty great view from our room.When we checked in we got 2 buffet vouchers for the buffet in the hotel.The seafood in the buffet was awesome!My man liked the pozole they had there as well.Also there is a food court which is convenient if you want something cheap and quick to take up to your room.I can't remember if the wifi was free but I'm pretty sure it was.The walls weren't too bad either.I only heard my neighbors after I woke up.But it's true what they say it's the city that never sleeps because I hardly got any sleep.Overall I would say this is a great place to stay if you're on a budget because it was only $141 each night if I remember correctly.We were only there for a weekend so it was perfect.Honestly I've seen some reviews and  Vegas has so much to do that there's no reason for you to be couped up in your room.We definitely will be back here!

the room was lacking a lot of common commodities that a motel 6 may offer you. The view was great of the strip... the casino was alright, the pool was real good though!  It wasn't spectacular, it looked a little dusty and run down.

Pros: The bed was comfortable. The location was great. The casino was nice and the ventilation was good. 

Cons: The room wasn't anything special, but we weren't in the room much. The $20 resort fee is BULLSHIT and not only that, you have to pay an extra $10 to use the jacuzzi?!?! What the hell. The gym has ridiculous hours.

Not the nicest rooms, carpet smells like wet dog, mold in and around the bathrooms. Complained they just moved us to another moldy room. It's loud because construction starts as early as 750am...;( disappointing!

But if your not going to spend anytime in the room, it has a great lazy river and pool area, casino and nice shows.

This is my first time being here. I booked my reservation online without really knowing anything about the hotel. It's on a great street and had a great entrance, but the room is terrible. The wallpaper in the bathroom is peeling off, bathtub looks dirty, windows are dirty, etc. I'm not a regular and I don't drop thousands of dollars, but if I paid for a room at the "Monte Carlo" please keep your service uniform.

I really enjoyed staying here. It didn't break the bank, however I still had all of the wonderful amenities of staying on the strip. Only a quick walk to New York New York, MGM, and many other great hotels nearby.

FRONT DESK - Never too crowded and always there to help. I even used the concierge to plan a night out. She called the restaurant and helped me decide on a club to go to, reserving the bottle and everything.

POOL -  Fun, good drinks, but not overly crowded. There were some kids there, but they never seemed to bother me. I did find it odd that they played some serious club music at the pool, and the crowd didn't seem to match the energy they were attempting to create at the pool.

CASINO was a blast. I loved that I could find $10 Black Jack tables 24 hours a day. I rather not play at $25 at night when I have had a few drinks.

I used to come here a lot as a kid. I came here once 2 yrs ago for Christmas and this time I found myself @ Monte Carlo again for New Years Eve.

Although somewhat of an older hotel now, I feel Monte Carlo is decent. Beds are fine, bathroom is clean. A few downers though are the underwhelming TV and the funky shower faucet. Perhaps the biggest downer is how audible the water piping is, meaning if someone a room next door or upstairs were to turn on a faucet, the sound would be quite loud. Sounds like a large cardboard box being dragged across the floor.

Other than that, Monte Carlo is not bad. Not the oldest, not the newest. And esp for New Years, I feel as long as you have a bed to sleep on, you should be fine because for the most part you're gonna be out drinking and engaging in your various shennanigans. I know I did :)

OMG, worst experience ever! When we booked the hotel there was no mentioning about the pool being  under construction. At least give the common courtesy to put it in the front of the web page not this tiny little print where you really have to search for it.

Now comes the worst part. We were booked on the 13 floor ok no problem. Next morning at 600 am sharp, there were lots of drilling and cutting that just rumbled through the room. Seriously they were working next room over and right above us until 600 pm, 12 freakin hours a day!  I recorded the noise so I could back up my claim. Of course I called the desk and told them about my situation. They said they could upgrade my room for an additional fee WTF!!!!! Plus they will throw in a 50 gift certificate meal- LOL 

We ended up toughen it out because I wasn't going to spend another dime and put money into their greedy pockets. 
We didn't even go to the pool at Mandalay Bay or MGM. I was too disgusted with them. 

Overall place  is a joke and customer service is even worst. Never ever again will I stay at this  place. I really wish I could give them negative stars.

Nice from the outside, but the people on our floor were loud and obnoxious. I barely got 3 hours sleep. We went during Halloween weekend, not a wise decision. Every hotel was packed. Otherwise, great hotel, amenities. I would recommend this hotel, if your ever in Vegas. Clean rooms  as well. I will be back.

The look of the Monte Carlo building is pretty good but the inside is so-so. The newly-renovated room looks simple but yet still quite stylish. Monte Carlo is currently undergoing a rebranding process - it will soon become MGM Park. That means there is a lot of construction going on. I, unfortunately, had a construction view room - which actually makes Aria in the background look sooooooo awesome! I lived on the 26th floor so it's not loud at all and I managed to have a very good sleep there. Some down points are -
1. I really missed the free parking a while ago. It was so easy to drive around the strip and enjoy different buffets and shows at different resorts. Those prime days are gone. Now the parking is 10 dollars a day and my parking cards failed to work twice during my one night stay. 
2. The resorts fee is quite high. I don't get it why there is a resort fee when you can actually factor the resort fee in the room rate. I didn't use the pool (it's at MGM) nor the gym (it's on the first floor) so I kinda felt that money went wasted.
3. The checkin line is quite long and slow and there were only three counters (50% capacity) open for customers. They could have opened more counters to expedite the checkin process. The staff is friendly and amicable though.
I hope the rebranding \/ renovation works well and I still look forward to check MGM Park out in the future.

Went to Vegas for the weekend to see Dane Cook, we decided to stay at the Monte Carlo because of the price and the location. The price is decent for a nicer hotel in Vegas; it all depends on how much money you want to spend. If you want to go cheap you go with Hooters or Excalibur, if you want to pay a decent amount of money you are looking at Monte Carlo, TI or NYNY. If you wanna go big, you're looking at The Bellagio, or Phoenician. Everyone is different, everyone has different taste and everyone has a different amount of money to spend in Vegas, that is why Vegas is so awesome to go to, so many options for everyone! I really enjoyed staying at this particular hotel this time because of its location. I felt like it was somewhat in the center of everything! Not too far down the strip one way! Also anytime I rode the bus, there was a stop about 10 feet from the front of the Monte Carlo, so when I was tired and didn't want to walk, hopped on the bus and took me straight to my hotel, five seconds later im in the casino of the Monte Carlo. Not only do they have a great casino, the restaurants they have are a nice variety to choose from, along with a nice variety of fast food! Having everything you need in one place is awesome in Vegas because you do tend to get a tad lazy sometimes. The rooms were nice, clean, smell free and the beds were pretty comfy! The lobby is beautiful, their convenient store carries anything you would need and the pool is pretty awesome. They have a lazy river, a wave pool, a normal pool and a hot tub! You name it Monte Carlo has it!

Very happy with the service, the set-up, the dcor, the price, the room, casino, food, all of it! When I go back to Vegas this maybe my go-to hotel!

Overall, I would not recommend the Monte Carlo.  I just arrived yesterday and upon pulling up, I was shocked at how bad the exterior looked.  The place looks like a construction site.  When I got to the front desk, it took me a good 20 minutes to get checked in.  Their computers are super, super slow.  When I got up to the room, I was not impressed.  It was very basic and looked dated.  There were some random stains on the bathroom wall.  The internet connection here is terrible, so don't come here if you are a business traveler.  As for the casino \/ entertainment, it looks really tired and unexciting.  This is definitely not a destination spot.

On the plus side, the room view is pretty nice and they were nice enough to upgrade me to a "City view" room for the same price.  They do have $5 blackjack tables, which is nice.  The location is also central to other places on the strip.

At $40 \/ night plus $35+ "resort fee" this place won't break the bank, but for the same price you can stay at some of the other hotels that are newer and more fun.

The Monte Carlo is actually a pretty nice hotel.  We got a great deal on Priceline.com (name your own).  However, they were doing construction on the parking structure, so the entrance was crazy and unorganized.  There was a small lot for parking.  I suggest going for the free valet.  Our room had an amazing view and the gentleman that checked us in was a sweetheart.  The buffet did not look good at all.  We'd stay here again, but will definitely wait for the construction to be done.

It was a pleasant stay at Monte Carlo last week, my bf and I had a great time. We stayed from Thurs-Sat night. We didn't spend as much time in the hotel as we only stayed only for 2 nights. We were checked in super quickly and staff was attentive.The resort fee was about $67.00 after check-out. Our room was spacious and we had a view of the swimming pool--that was awesome. The fact I didn't like was there was no fridge and no other amenities--like coffee, or kettle for hot water. TV had a variety of channels so we were able to watch a bit of TV before sleeping. Also, I noticed we did not get a full box of Kleenex that was in the restroom, which I find a bit odd. Well we only had approximately 15 tissues in there, probably the hotel staff did not tend to replace it since it was not empty before us. Our showers were great, super high water pressure though.There were a few dent\/peeling off the walls inside our restroom, well it didn't bother us. One good thing about Monte Carlo is they had Starbucks, Subway, McDonalds, and other places where you can grab a quick snack. I walked through the casino and it looked pretty nice. They also offer quick taxi service over at the West Wing just at the corner on the left of the check-in desk. They also have the City Tram where you can take the tram over to Aria and Bellagio. YES, praise the lord that I did not have to walk as much. 

Our check out was pleasant as well, we did not wait at all and they do offer bags check in at the bell desk if you decide to just leave your luggage and walk around on The Strip before your flight--which we did. Would recommend this hotel if you plan to stay here.

This place was o.k.  Went there on a business trip and got told that that even though I reserved a King Bed they were in fact "First Come First Serve" and if I wanted one I would have to stay in a smoking room.  That wasn't pleasant at all. 

I've stayed a few places on the strip and for whatever reason this place just didn't wow me much.  Not terrible, just not great.

I came here this past weekend on a last minute trip. All the hotels in Las Vegas are ridiculously expensive during the weekends in the summer. I had some points on my credit card and Monte Carlo came in as an option. I checked in relatively late so there was no on else in line. The check-out employee was nice and courteous and didn't try to push an upgrade. I got a standard room (I didn't upgrade since I was only going to be here one night.) 

The room was really clean and nice. One of the reasons why I am hesitant to stay in older hotels is that most of them have adjoining doors with bad sound  proofing. (The last time I stayed at New York New York, it was so noisy in the next room, I had to switch rooms). The room that I got had no adjoining door, so it was quiet. The bed was also comfy and was not too hard or soft. 

This place is obviously not as good as Wynn or any of the other 5 star hotels. You can tell it was a little older because there was cracks in the doors and floors. But, for what I needed (a nice hotel on the Strip), it was a great and cheap option. I will definitely stay here again.

As an added bonus, MGM properties has a tram between Monte Carlo, Aria, and Bellagio. So, all I had to do was go downstairs for the tram.

Monte Carlo is one of those hotels in which people wither love or hate it. Based on the mixed reviews on yelp (many of which aren't too great) I would have stayed away from this place. But the bf found a great deal here (originally we booked 2 nights at Luxor, but for about the same price, Monte Carlo offered 3 nights instead. Score!) Let's begin:

Our Room Floor 21, #113 (3.5\/5 stars):
- It had a nice king size bed, 2 night stands, desk & chair, lounge chair, average sized dresser with a fairly large flat LCD tv, closet and full length mirror, 2 telephones.
My only complaint is that there was no mini fridge to store our drinks (this should be a standard every where). Also, the "temperature control unit" had poor circulation and weak output so it took awhile to get the room cool to the temp that we enjoyed. The view we had was not of the strip, but of the back of NYNY and residential area. It wasn't a bad view, in fact it looked nice at night when all the homes had on their twinkling lights or in the morning when the sun would rise in the horizon. It was a relaxing and peaceful sight. You can hear riders from the NYNY coaster scream their heads off, not to mention your neighbors in the adjoining rooms practically fart in their sleep because the walls are so thin. That's my main gripe. The bed was comfortable and there were both firm and soft pillows. The sheets were soft and clean, pretty standard nothing bad about them, but nothing spectacular either.

Bathroom (3\/5 stars):
- shower\/tub combo with vanity mirror over the sink. The toilet was off to the side in front of the shower with a wall as a divider from the sink. The shower pressure was not the best, and the shower head didn't have a wide spread so it felt like I was a flower and a gardener was trickling water over me. And since the shower\/tub floor had a textured feeling to keep you from slipping, if you decided to take a bath be warned! Don't try to scoot across  it or else risk skinning your bottom. Lol. Didn't happen to me, but definitely has the potential. Also, there is a vent that doesn't really suck out any of the steam in the bathroom so if you shut the door, you're in an instant sauna once you finish your hot shower. And don't be startled if you hear a loud whoosh! Sound late at night,  it's just the incredibly loud toilet flushing. Every person who used their toilet, I could hear it flush! Not attractive. 

Casino (2.5\/5 stars):
Didn't really play the slots here, but did walk around and it seemed to have updated machines. Only problem is if you have sensitive smelling or breathing conditions, I wouldn't suggest walking through it. Just getting off the elevators from our room to the food court area adjacent to the casino I was already having a coughing fit from all the smoke. Their ventilation system isnt good. 

Overall, I give Monte Carlo 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 because their customer service is phenomenal. The clerk at check in was kind, personable, and quick. The cleaning staff is nice and on time. We changed out our towels a couple times and had our bed sheets changed once, they were great. Also, the bell hop and valet people were friendly and courteous. They never acted like they needed to be tipped, like many others I've experienced. But generally appreciated their helping us out. That's what makes a hotel good: a hardworking, respectful staff. 

Don't be afraid to stay here because of some of the negative feedback by some yelpers (hey, even five star hotels have their share of horror stories). For it's price and LOCATION on the strip, it is definitely a great value hotel. I would stay here again.

I enjoyed my stay at the Monte Carlo, over all it is a pretty average hotel but it does have its perks like a nice pool area, and a great location. My first night here we stayed in a normal room and it was comfortable for 4 people. The bathroom was large and our shit was EVERYWHERE but still felt like there was a lot of room. For the rest of the trip we were in a suite with a conjoining room. The suite was nice, 1.5 bath, king size bed, sofa bed and a ton of open space to for air mattresses. 

I was hoping that the suite would have had like a kitchen area as well with fridge and sink. You know the basics in most suites. 

I didn't spend much time in the Casino, just walked through and it was your pretty basic Casino, nothing too special. Walked by the food court, which had a McDonald's and Subway- skip this obviously. The pool area was really great, there is a lazy river, wave pool and a huge regular pool. Lots of cabanas available as well. The other great thing about the Monte Carlo is it is connected to this tram that takes you to a bunch of other hotels, SO HELPFUL! 

I would probably stay here again- Price was pretty much what you would expect for peak summer weekends.

Well unlike other reviews I read prior to my stay in Monte Carlo I have no complains at all!  Me and my boyfriend stood in Monte Carlo for 5 days May 19-May 24. Check in was at 3:30 but we got there at 9:30 am and we where helped right away! We got a room in the 30th floor and it was really quiet the whole time! We didn't hear anything coming from the room next door and we hardly saw anyone in the hallways all week! Me and my boyfriend are not picky at all and we thought Monte Carlo was great! Good location and overall a nice hotel! If and when we go back to Vegas we would def stay in Monte Carlo again!

Monte Carlo has been our hotel of choice for the last few years in Vegas. This was probably our last stay there. We booked two rooms for family, a deluxe room and a spa suite. The  deluxe room shower was backed up and we called maintenance to have it repaired while we were out gambling.  We returned to find a nice hair ball in the toilet that was apparently pulled from the shower drain, thanks for that maintenance guys. It wouldn't have been bad if the shower was fixed but it was still backed up. We didn't bother calling again and we showered in standing water for the next few nights.   When we got into the spa room we discovered that what used to be a jetted jacuzzi tub has been replaced with a regular non-jetted tub. We would not have paid for the upgrade if we knew they removed the jetted tubs. The lazy river was full of trash and cigarette butts on Monday morning, kinda gross.  It was clean when we returned on Tues morning and we did have fun in it.  The poolside waitresses only seemed to be concerned with the day beds so we could not order anything to eat or drink. Then we discovered that only food\/drink from certain restaurants are allowed into the pool.  You can bring Starbucks food\/drink into the pool area but not McDonalds...even though they are both in the MC food court. Makes no sense. Sorry MC, time to find another Vegas hotel.

All I have to say is... Spa Suite!    I always bring a lovely lady or two if I stay at the Monte Carlo -- it's a beautiful site in the hotel room's Spa Suite... the ambiance and environment is just as fitting ... and, as I have said in my other reviews of hotel rooms.. there is really no point in being in the hotel in Vegas --... BUT.... the Monte Carlo Spa Suite is the one piece of fun I've repeadedly had over and over ever since I first went with Kristy Rocks (What up Kristy!).  Since then, I often bring the lovely lady I am currently dating and its spectacular (Hey Sharla, Hey Cynthia)!  

I can't say anything about any of hte other rooms... but i will say... "Spa Suite is where it's at!".   Tell them Michael sent you.... and yep, they'll have no idea who you are talking about ..... haha, smile!

Other than being centrally located on the strip, there was really nothing else that stuck out as memorable. Stayed here once and the rooms were bland and plain. The casino didn't have much that is worth mentioning. I typically never even step into this property when I'm in vegas because there's really not much to see. Good option if you want a cheaper room on the strip but you'll likely spend most of your time at another property for the fun.

Realistically I give Monte Carlo a 3 1\/2 star rating. Paid $301(pricw with all fees) for a one night stay. Selected the High Floor "deluxe" room thinking it was going to be something more than just basic. While....we got basic. Nothing spectacular about the room. Beds, tv, desk, thats it. Decor is simple to none. However, super clean room. No issues with the tv (minimal channels), lamps, ac, iron, all worked with no issues. 
Its an average room, in my opinion, room should have been cheaper in rates.

I am a very seasoned business traveler logging over 100 nights a year inhotel rooms so I think I am qualified to make a review on this property.  First, I have to say the price I paid for the room was well worth the cost.  The Monte Carlo is a little dated and the guest rooms need an remodel pretty soon but the rooms were comfortable and clean so I won;t complain about the value here.  I have stayed at over 15 different resorts in LV and for the money this is a decent place.  It's convenient to a lot of things and my experience with the staff was good as well.  It's not the Cosmopolitain or Aria but you don't pay the same type of price either.  If you are looking for a decent hotel but don;t want to spend a lot this is a good option.  If\/when they do a remodel it will be better but it's still fine unless you are expecting a 5 star hotel.  If you are then look elsewhere.  I liked the Pub bar and Diablos on the property and also liked that I could walk to quite a few other properties withn a short walk.

Solid hotel, low price - generally under $100\/night. I'm not saying it's a 4-star hotel, but it gets a 4 star rating in my book when you think about what you get for the money. If I can't find a killer deal at a nicer hotel, I'm pretty satisfied with the Monte Carlo. It's budget & basic, but without being gross or too embarassing (ie Flamingo, Imperial Palace). When I stayed, they were running a promotion where showing your keycard got you pretty good discounts around the property and at NYNY. We took advantage of the 2-for-1 buffet for breakfast just about every day. With the 2-for-1 deal, it was like $22 for both of us which is not much more than if you went to Starbucks.

I also loved the day spa access. I think guests pay only $15 and you can use the steam room, hot tub\/cool tub, and loungey areas in the spa all day. The loungey room was stocked with juices, fruit, and nuts. Definitely worth it to chill out here, especially since the pool area is so insanely crowded. And if you have a lot of friends sharing your room, just run up to the spa to shower if you bought your pass that day, lol. Big showers plus hair dryers, hair products, straightener, razor, everything you need.

I had no issues with my stay, the room was clean, awesome center strip location, and friendly on the wallet. It's also convenient to the free tram that takes you up to the Bellagio. On the negative side, as a "resort" it's pretty boring. But the bright side is that you're saving money on the room so you have more to spend outside of the hotel.

Do your research carefully though because I see offers come up for nicer hotels that are about the same price as the Monte Carlo (when you factor in the resort fees).

Recently stayed at the Monte Carlo. It used to be a really nice hotel, but this recent stay wasn't as great as I thought it would be. I chose the hotel because it was cheap, good location and I was familiar with the resort. Our stay was not very pleasant. The check in line was over 45 minutes long. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Room was outdated and needed some renovations. Wallpaper was peeling off and some mold was found in the bathroom tile and ceiling. The room next door had two adjoining rooms full of noisy kids. You can hear everyone's conversation in the next room and hallway. Very noisy and not accommodating. Also we got a few prank calls from another room throughout the night! First time I ever had a prank call during a hotel stay! Not impressed. Although it was fun and entertaining, but not at midnight! We decided to get a room change... They switched us to another room on the same floor, but we decided to upgrade to a nicer room with a bathtub. They gave us a studio at the hotel 32, which they said had a tub and shower. When we had gone up there was only a shower in the room. We called the front desk to let them know it wasn't the room we requested with a tub (additional $50 plus $6 tax on a weekday). They sent us to another studio at the hotel 32 and yet it did not have a tub! After all our efforts, we decided to stay in the room anyways. Needless to say we were thoroughly unimpressed with our stay.. We did not get the room we requested. The studio at hotel 32 was on a nicer floor. You couldn't tell we were at the MC. They had a front desk assistant that was very welcoming. There was a lounge that provided free cold water, juice and soda. They had a machine for tea coffee and hot chocolate, which I did not figure out how to use. For breakfast they offered pastries fruit and yogurt parfait. In the morning they have a newspaper waiting for you on your doorknob. Although really nice service and amenities, still a standard room only renovated.. Exact same room only newer furnishings and bathroom is very very small. The pool is small, overcrowded and mostly in the shade all day!!! Only stayed at the pool for an hour during our stay. There were not enough chairs and pools were small. This hotel is good for families w children, but not a vacation for

We originally reserved a room at MGM Grand and got bumped to the Monte Carlo. The first room they gave me had pubic hair all over toilet, so they moved me to another room. The second room had hair all over the pillows so they had the maid come and change sheets. Both rooms were old and with very little upkeep. The chair in our room was so nasty we didn't even sit on it. The coffee maker was missing parts. No wifi. They had a iPod\/iPhone dock for the first generation iPhones. No hair dryer. We were very unhappy with out stay. The hotel is run down and needs a complete renovation. I would never stay here again.

This casino is just kind of "blah" and plain for me.  Nothing exciting or special here.  The location is okay, not ideal but not the worst either.  I haven't been here a lot. It's obviously a pretty nice casino- above average, but it doesn't have anything that really stands out or worth writing about.  Sorry.

My used to be home away from home... Still Affordable, high floors are decent rooms, gambling is alright... I feel like they've just been renovating for so long it shoves the casino floor slots and tables around in an awkward formation. Food court has some variety, and there's easy access to the tram for enjoying other central locations!
