I just don't go back as often since the Total Rewards program has way better perks, but we'll stop by from time to time to play. The dealers are a bit unenergetic, except for a Hispanic dealer at roulette, who was awesome as heck! Even though I lost, he made playing so fun. 

Even being a platinum card holder, we'd still have to pay resort fees, and would end up gambling elsewhere. 
Hopefully after some upgrades and construction they'd step it up and we'd go more often.
Not the fanciest hotel, but a great mid price option. The rooms are acceptable and the location is key so I'd stay here again!

Just got back from Vegas.  The room was nice and clean.  Front desk was friendly and helpful. Now here are some disappointing things about our stay....
1. Food and drink was a bit pricey for what you get
2. Lazy river really wasn't much compared to other lazy rivers from Vegas hotels
3. The pool area was small and boring....we have seen much nicer
4. Service in the Cafe was SO slow and the food average
5. The shower head was horrible......it felt like it was tearing at your skin

Would not recommend if a nice pool area is important....it felt cramped and dull

Just stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights.  The rooms were a little outdated and could use some remodeling, especially to keep up with the newer hotels.  The room itself was okay but I was not fond of the bathroom at all.  It really needs a face lift.  

The hotel is conveniently located and there are lots of different places to eat in the hotel.  Room service was good, and the staff were great.  I got my room for $57 a night on priceline so for that price, I can't really complain much.  However I wouldn't pay more than that to stay here and Priceline should not list it as a four star hotel because it's not. It's more of a 3 star, 3.5 being generous.

Was very disappointed with my stay at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. When I walked into the hotel i thought it was very nice, clean and upscale. The lobby and check-in area also gave a very good first impression. When i got off the elevator on the 14th floor i noticed the hallways were outdated, plain, and crusty. When i walked in the room i was shocked, i thought i had booked a 4 star hotel. But the room reminded me of Excalibur, it was disgusting. The ceiling was peeling in the bathroom above the shower, there were stains on the sheets, no mini bar\/fridge, and there was only like 15 channels on the tv. The pool area was very disappointing as well. In my opinion the hotel does not deserve anything close to a 4 star rating. I am not one to complain so I didn't, I just tried to make the best of the stay. I originally booked the hotel via priceline bidding and it was 2 nights for $351 which priceline charged my credit card. Upon check-out the front desk charged me an additional $100, for fees that i thought were already included. And also a daily fee for valet car service and storage which most hotels offer free for their guests. None of these things really bothered me, after returning home i noticed another charge on my card for $300. I thought it was just a security deposit that would be refunded. Monte Carlo informed me that i was charged the $300 cleaning fee for smoking, which i do not understand because i do not even smoke. So my two night stay at the Monte Carlo ended up coming out to around $800. I tried to save some money booking a "4 star" hotel and got ripped off. Just pay the extra money and book a nice hotel such as Palazzo, Venetian, Wynn, Encore, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan or Aria. Book the Monte Carlo if you want to stay in a dirty mediocre room and be wrongfully over-charged.

I was there with 15 friends this weekend, and the customer service was horrendous. They didn't book our rooms together (as they had promised) and offered no apology. We were there at 9am but unable to check in until 5pm, and again, no apologies. Just bad attitude from the people working at the front desk and the managers. Every employee we spoke with was condescending and rude. 

Also, they charge a resort fee of $15 per night. For what? You still have to pay $10 to have access to the spa area. The pool was closed the whole weekend, and the staff there were rude and unapologetic as well.

Sad that we gave them so much business and got terrible service and attitudes in return. I won't there again.

This review is for the casino\/cocktail service only.  We walked over from Aria to gamble here a bit and get a change from our home casino.  The layout here is a bit confusing, and the machines they have here aren't that great.  My biggest issue, however, was the cocktail service!  We were happy because we sat down, and about 5 minutes later a cocktail waitress came around and took our order.  She came back in about 10 minutes, not too bad.  But, while she got my boyfriend's drink right, she brought me a vodka cran when I'd asked her for a vodka Red Bull.  She apologized, and she said she was going to go get the correct drink, took our tip from us and then left.  And then...nothing.  I don't know if she went home, got lost, kidnapped or what, but we never heard from her again.  I stayed at the machine I was on for half an hour and played, and she never brought me the correct drink back.  I understand if it's busy (which it really wasn't, it was a Tuesday evening around 9pm), but if you bring the wrong drink and accept a tip, I feel as if the least you can do is actually, you know, bring the correct drink back.  Eventually we got up and left, and didn't see her again until an hour later when we were walking back through the casino to head back to Aria.

My original review of the Monte Carlo was less than favorable but I am pleased to say my second stay has definitely changed my mind. The changes made in a year and a half were massive. The staff were all helpful and professional and the cleaning staff were extremely accommodating. The location is central and the tram to the Bellagio makes getting around very easy. Wifi isn't available in the rooms but is available on the 1st and 2nd floors and there is a business centre for printing. I will stay here again.

If you're looking for a cheap ass hotel room under $100 and are willing to sacrifice a lung (or two) due to the overwhelmingly obnoxious toxic stench of air freshener and carpet deodorizer that will not go away regardless of airing the room out all day and night and freezing your ass off because you had to leave the window open all night thanks to the drunken party animals who rented the room out before you and puked all over the place which is why you have a nauseating headache the next day while you're trying to enjoy the beautiful Chihuly art pieces and the mediocre buffet at the Bellagio, then this is the hotel for you!

My fiance and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in 2012 and enjoyed the hotel for the short time we were there. 

The registration process was very nice and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and upgraded our room for us. We had an amazing view of the pool area. 

The room was nice and clean. The air conditioning worked well. The pool area looked amazing, however we didn't get to use it. Our trip was cut short due to a death in the family, and we had to check out in a hurry. The Monte Carlo was incredibly nice and reimbursed us for the nights that we didn't stay. I thought that was really cool of them because a lot of places (especially when you book through hotels.com) won't do refunds.

The Pub in the casino has  good food in the $$ price range. 

The location was great because it was close to everything we like to do. 

***We stayed again in the summer of 2013 and this time we got to use the pool.  There is a regular pool and hot tub, a wave pool, and a lazy river.  I have to say, the lazy river is awesome!!! The pool has a great environment, fun with music and a good vibe.  The drinks are a little on the pricey side but the tube rental was cheap and there are plenty of chairs.

Definitely a scene. My family is split between three hotels, Caesar's, Monte Carlo, and Bellagio. The pool scene here is much more lively than the others. Too busy to pop in and find a chair. Need to pay for a cabana for some relief from sun. Waitresses are super nice.

i was excited to come here for my 21st birthday. 
First mistake under my account i had two rooms which they gave me and my friend which they didnt ask for confirmation numbers or anything therefore asking to screw it all up. Then my parents came a while later to get assigned one of the rooms that we already had and when they went to tell them that the room was already in use. they canceled one of my rooms to give my parents their room. and at 2am we had to argue with the front desk to give us back the room i paid for which had all our luggage in. They said that the room was under vacant i told them they wouldnt have this problem if they asked us for our confirmation number and our ID for each room checked in so they wouldnt have a problem when assigning rooms. so that was it for then i went had fun and then what happens at the end i see charges to my room i did not do. Since they gave us some money to eat for free because of their mistake we used it and when i was checking out they told me that the charges would drop A FEW HOURS after i checked out. Since it was my first time at a hotel i believed them 24 hours passed and i was still negative in my account so i called my bank which told me that they lied it takes about 3 to 5 days for the charges to cancel. yesterday they finally canceled giving me back my money to my account. today i wake up to an email that said that i only had $22 left so i checked my account and saw two charges from monte carlo which im not sure should be there at all. how horrifying. This has been the worse experience ive ever experienced at a hotel. Now ive been on hold for 20 minutes and probably maybe even longer. This has been horrible not the way i expected to spend my birthday. They are honestly a headache for being a 4 star hotel they should have things under control, mess ups shouldnt happen when theyve been doing this for so many years. I am TRULY DISAPPOINTED will NEVER go there again. Definitely will not recommend this hotel to anyone not even friends family no one. I love Las Vegas and have stayed in so many different ones because we like to see the different hotels this one has been the worse, most disorganized hotel ive EVER stayed at. Specially since im trying to recover my money, trying to figure out what all these chargers are for. Now they cant figure out where the money is getting charged from... how ridiculous. SO UNORGANIZED.

well what can I say. I  wanted  to give it one more try . Well I get there and there is no king beds after ask twice  before I came. so strike one .Then got to room and it was remolded but took forever for hot water too get to shower  and my friends also in next room over. water barley came out of shower so that suck. 3rd thing is they were hammering every am from upstairs. 4th thing is  looking at dirty dirty windows looking at view. 5th thing, I love pool area that was closed and had to walk with all my stuff to go to MGM not cool. 6th  most of food area were closed so had to go some were else. So I would love to go Back to Vegas  but stay some were else or in a suit owned by MGM ,because what I had to pay for  me and friends is wrong for what we got. So Monte Carlo \/ MGM  you get  a one star at this time and I will tell all my friends and pass the word on unless you can make this right.  MGM \/ Monte Carlo   Please read my last stay  2015  also 1 star So I Really think MGM  you should make this right thank you

We didn't stay in one of their rooms but while walking around, we came across the 
Monte Carlo Hotel. 

There are a bunch of restaurants in here as well as a food court. They have a spa, salon and fitness center. The Blvd Plaza, which is located at the Monte Carlo is an outdoor plaza on Las Vegas Blvd. It offers culinary venues in a casual and interactive environment and is open 24 hours.
Not a good experience. Construction outside my room woke me up at 6am every morning of my stay. Very unapologetic at checkout. Much better options available on the strip.

They aren't the worst hotel on the strip, and they certainly aren't the best either. I can't say it's really worthy of the Monte Carlo name considering nothing about it really stands out. I try and stay at a different hotel every time I go to Vegas. So far I've stayed at 7 of the hotels on the strip, though my stays tend towards the middle of the pack so that's mostly what I'm comparing the Monte Carlo to. 

I rated it 3 stars because as it says on yelp, it's A-OK. Nothing really stands out to me. The room is your average Vegas room, the Casino is decent but not too special. I guess the casino is a little better for me because I'm not a high roller and unless I'm doing pretty well or feeling particularly risky\/drunk I try and stay below $15 a bet. 

The Monte Carlo does have a pretty good location so it has that going for it. It's pretty easy to get everywhere from the Monte Carlo. It's certainly not run down which is good in my opinion since it seems like a lot of the older hotels are starting to get neglected. Maybe because the economy is picking back up they're able to focus more on revitalizing everything. When I stayed they were doing a small revamp of the outside of the Hotel. 

I didn't think the restaurants seemed like anything too special and their buffet doesn't seem to be rated too well. Having said that though, you can get their buffet for really cheap at Tix 4 Tonight so if you're looking for a cheap meal this might be it. I may be confusing it with some other Hotel though so don't quote me on it. 

Overall, like the rating says, it's A-OK, making it midrange and a decent value for the price.

Great hotel located in the heart of the Las Vegas strip. The rooms will be renovated this year and the new arena will be done in April. If you are here for just a night or a weekend this is the spot for you! If you are looking to go to any shows or tours the Concierge team is more then helpful with accommodations.

I always enjoy staying at the Monte Carlo. The rooms are always clean, and available at a very good price. In the summer their pool is one of the best in Las Vegas. They have a lazy river and a wave pool. Their pool is also not as crowded as Mandalay Bay's pool is. "The Pub" is a great place to go for happy hour and for the beer connoisseur to try new brews. The "Hit Lounge" is an awesome place to go for classy drinks. "Diablos Cantina" has a great view of the strip and a good place for margaritas. I've also had some luck gambling at the Monte Carlo. The machines don't seem to ever be too tight.

I was here a couple of days ago. The room is nice and well-tended. The walls are pretty-thin because I can hear the people in the other room having you-know-what. I coughed and faked my sneeze hoping they would hear me and realized that if they can hear me, I can hear them as well. It didn't work. It was very awkward nonetheless. Glad I didn't see them by the hallway.

Other than that, the next time I will go to Vegas, I will definitely stay at Monte Carlo.

I booked the hotel after having got a good deal with southwest vacations. So, I would write the review with that in perspective. 

I and my wife booked this for a 3 nights stay. I love the location of this hotel. You can walk to quite a few casinos around and the RTC buses stop right in front of the hotel. 

The casino, the restaurants and the shops and bars are all quite decent. The external to the room facilities in the casino\/resort are quite alright. The room, maybe it was the rate that we paid, it wasn't the best. It looked like one of those regular extended stay hotel rates. It was nothing worth writing home about, no wow factor, just another hotel room. We wanted a king bed, but got 2 queen beds, so one bed ended up being our clothes pile! The bathroom was so very normal and under lit. The shower area barely had any light falling on it. The toilet paper used was amongst the lowest quality, not what you would expect to find in a 4 star resort. I sort of started to think that we should have paid that 200$ extra for 3 nights for a Cosmopolitan or Aria. But for the price and the location, I have to give it a 3 star, especially considering the fact that you are going to be out most of the time in Vegas :D..

A few hours after checking into our room, I notice that the toilet is about to overflow. I call guest services, they transfer me to engineering, who come and check out the toilet. The man flushed the toilet a couple of times and said, "it's now fine." I asked him a bunch of times, "are you sure? I can hear the shower drain too when this happens" he reassured me and said it is all good. 

Fast forward to 2am I get a call from my friend who was staying in the room with me saying "our bathroom is disgusting, there's poop everywhere." she told me she called the hotel and there was a guy who came and left and it has been twenty minutes and he has yet to return. I call the hotel and tell the man at the front desk what happened and he said, "if you're not there how do you know this is happening?" I get transferred to  management who finally agree to move us to another room and take off the "resort fee" (about $25 a day) for 3 days. 

Our next room also has plumbing issues, the water in the sink takes a long time to go down and this room smells like mold. However, it was 3am and we were too tired to care. I would not recommend this hotel as their customer service is unsatisfactory and they have way too many issues with plumbing. Even the guy who helped us transfer rooms said that they had been having plumbing issues, though the front desk assured us this isn't a common occurrence (I assume this was a blatant lie judging by other reviews). 

The only redeeming qualities about this hotel are the pool and the conveniently located restaurants in the hotel (ie: subway, Starbucks, McDonald's, S'barro, a Mexican place). 

I'd also like to add that the superficial reply left with "deep regret" on my review and others does not excuse the hotels behavior or show any sort of actual regret or illustrate that things will change in the future. I would never recommend staying at this hotel.

This place has a grand entrance and lobby but that's where the magnanimity stops unless you count the wasted area when you get of the elevators and have to figure out which hallway to go down.
The staff are friendly and courteous. 
the Valet were the best part of the facility.

We checked in around noon on a Monday, they didn't have a room ready but gave us room keys and texted me the room # when it was ready.
the casino\/ food area was not well outlined, it was the standard Vegas "we are gonna keep you in our hotel as long as possible layout"
The rooms are nothing special the view was nice.
 I have stayed at nicer rooms at some holiday inns.
Some of my team had issues with drainage both in the sinks and showers.
I do not believe we will be staying here next year for this event.

I did not stay here but just visiting the casino and coffee shop, I firmly believe hotel management has decided to let this place simply waste away. The casino is dark and appears like they cut back on the cleaning crew. We went to the coffee shop and stood behind a party of four(we were 2). There was no hostess around and the patience level got to the point the party of 4 just grabbed some menus and seated themselves. We did the same. The service was terribly slow, although fortunately the food was served hot and wasn't too bad. I was surprised we had to go the cashier to pay rather than the waiter taking the bill but it was, after all, just the coffee shop. So we asked the cashier about the no-hostess and were told it was a "shift change." When my wife (perhaps inappropriately) sniped back that was kind of a lame excuse, the cashier said to us "then go eat somewhere else."   Maybe a "we're sorry for the inconvenience" would have diffused things a bit.   
Finally, the race and sports book is a mess in that they now require a minimum bet before allowing you to get a drink. I know some hotels are doing the same but the Monte Carlo has what I consider to be outrageous betting limits(Some guy sitting nearby told me he didn't get a drink voucher until he had bet $200 on the ponies). 
I say let this place go away; there are nicer and better places to go where customer service is still part of the equation.

It was okay.  I wouldn't say it was bad, but I wouldn't say it was super good.  Can't remember which floor I stayed on, but the rooms were decent.  You can hear just about everything when you are in your room because I overheard my neighbors conversing even if they weren't talking loud.  Parking structure wasn't too bad and the check in process was pretty efficient.  I did like my stay here, but it probably isn't a place I would consider staying at again.  Either way, thanks Monte Carlo!

$20 RESORT FEE on top of hotel rate booked online. Plus 12% hotel tax. All Vegas hotels add the BS resort fees now. Great location. CVS just out the front door. Ross and movie theater across the street. Easy hotel layout- elevators, food court, casino, taxi, strip. Free internet via ethernet cord- good thing I brought my laptop. Couldn't find a good free wi-fi access. Glad we skipped the Minus5 ice bar. Gogo dancers at one of the tables. Buffet $45.38 for two.

The room was nice and the hotel was in a great location. We put a 200.00 hold on our credit card incase we wanted room service. Two days later we checked our account and it was actually taken out of the bank along with an extra 183.00. We asked about it. The hold shoukd have been in pending not taken out. The front desk woman couldn't tell us why or where the 183.00 charges were from. We asked to speak to the manager Brian Vitto. However he did help us resolve the issue. He made snide remarks about us "needing" the money, because we didn't want 200.00 in food comps instead of our money back! He still couldn't even tell us where the 183.00 charge came from. They had to call the bank and refund it into the account. And gave us 200.00 cash out for the 200 they took for the holding. The day we checked out the front desk lady said we owed 24.00 because of unpaid fees. It was taken off our account. We also paid for two all day buffet passes for one day which came out to 80.30 including taxes, when we checked our account we were charged 90.30... Wth! Where did that other 10.00 come from? 
We will never stay there again, my advice if you do.... constantly check your bank account\/credit card!

Disappointing, to say the least. Made a reservation at MC and was not told the pool is closed. I would like to make an informed decision when it comes to booking a hotel. Nevertheless, we were transferred across the street to use the MGM pool. It's a 30 minutes walk - huge inconvenience. We were asked if we had reservations to use single beds. When we told MGM that we are MG guests, they waived the reservation and asked us to pay $25\/bed. A regular single pool side bed. 

After speaking to the manager at Monte Carlo, matters got worse. The manager blamed me for not checking their website about the pool renovations. She was rude and offered no compensation for my inconvenience and not being truthful at the time of the booking. This will be the last time I will stay at this hotel.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo because it is right across the street from the T-mobile arena. The room was large and beds comfortable. It appeared to be clean. There was no coffee maker! I thought that was a hotel standard. A Starbucks was located very close to the elevators but the wait for a simple cup of coffee exceeded 30 mins. 
We enjoyed the selection of games in the casino but we were never approached by a hostess asking if we wanted a drink. Then, we sat in a bar for at least 10 minutes waiting to be served. Plus, we paid $34 dollars for two martinis.

I can't say enough good things about this place. My most recent stay here was this weekend, but I have been a long time patron of this hotel\/casino for years. 

First, let's start with the rooms. The rooms! My goodness! The best way I can describe them are that they are comfortable and clean, which in my opinion are the two most important traits that any hotel room must have and Monte Carlo hits them both. The standard deluxe room is just that...standard. But that's okay because you don't come to Las Vegas just to stay in your room all day, you go out and have a great time! It's functional with the most basic and necessary amenities you need in a room: a bathroom, a comfortable bed, TV and closet space. Any more than that is just extra icing (again nothing wrong with that). 

The check-in process was relatively easy. For such a long line at 5:30 PM I didn't have to wait long. Most of the desks are were open and I was in the line less than 15 minutes and checked in and on my way to my room in less than 5 minutes. 

Monte Carlo also boasts a number of eating establishments that range from fast food to first class dining. The fast-food places are conveniently located right by the elevators and if you're in the mood for a higher end dining experience, Monte Carlo offers that as well. 

One of the main reasons I stay here is because I very much enjoy playing at the Monte Carlo. They have many of the newest slot machines and some of my old time favorites. The table games are exciting and welcoming. The dealers are first rate and are friendly. They are professional and personable and will take the time to answer question about the nuances of the game should you have one. 

Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino is and will always be my go to hotel when I come to Las Vegas. The location is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the employees who work here are the best. You can have your modern (and in my opinion) sterile new fancy hotel rooms. I'll stay at Monte Carlo and enjoy it's charm. 

Till next Yelp!

I stayed at Monte Carlo June 2016 for 3 days. The price was right, we booked directly through the hotel not an online site. The rates were much lower because we are Mlife customers. Our first time staying at this Vegas hotel, we knew it wasn't going to be on the same level as Aria, Wynn or The Venetian. From the moment we arrived and got in check in line it was enjoyable. There was a Bellhop\/ Concierge greeting people in line, He was super nice and informative! The man ( I forget his name) was fluent in several languages and really wowed us! My Fianc speaks English & Spanish and when asked what type of Spanish speaking the man carried on a short conversation, he then greeted the couple right behind us in line and the man wanted to test his knowledge so he asked the man a question in Japanese and was answered with several sentences! Got to front desk and even though we were early and didn't expect a early check in they gave it to us! Which was Great because we had been traveling for 8 hrs! The staff there was very friendly. The service in room was good. The food & drinks were good also. A little expensive, we got 2 Mojitos in lobby bar and it was $28.. The pool area is fun & clean. The only downside to this hotel is that it is outdated somewhat. The room was ok, nothing fancy. We did speak with an employee who informed us that the hotel is going to change its name and do major overhauls on the hotel rooms and lobby. If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of the strip and cost effective this is a good choice! I'd visit The Monte Carlo again, hopefully after its renovation. A Happy Medium.

The Monte Carlo wasn't my first choice to stay in Vegas, but the price was right for a weekend getaway. 

The hotel and casino is pretty much thin and long to walk from the back out to the Strip. 

The rooms are decent and clean but nothing overly wowing. 

There is a Food Court with a McDonald's, Starbucks, Panda Express. Longest lines I've ever seen at a Starbucks except for LAX in the morning. 

The pool is just OK. There was a DJ but the way the area is situated that a lot of the chairs do not get sun until the afternoon since it's blocked by other buildings. There is a lazy river which is nothing compared to the one at the MGM. There is also wave pool which was nice. The pool bar is ridiculously priced, even more so than expected in Vegas ($75 for 2 salads, a turkey wrap, and 2 alcoholic drinks). Bottles of water are $5, they will not give you tap water, but they will give you a cup with ice and then you need to fill it up at the water fountain near the bathrooms. 

Check-in\/out was relatively simple and easy. Not long of a wait for someone to help you. 

The parking deck for self-parking is large and it's free. It's in the way back of the hotel but it's really not too long of a walk to the elevators to the rooms. 

Clientele ranged the gamut to bachelorette parties, families, young groups of guys, older couples and retirees. 

Plenty of tables ranging from $5 to $100+ minimum. Lots of slots, many only 1, 2 or 5 cents. 

Diablo's Cantina right out front was the happening place - still going strong at 3 am when we walked by.

Wonderful location on the strip, very helpful concierge, nice pools, several stores and restaurants located inside of the hotel and clean rooms. My only complaint is housekeeping was a little overeager to clean the room each day; theyd start knocking at 9. I would definitely stay here again.
We stayed here one night after staying at the Bellagio for a while. The room was really outdated. There was so many college kids everywhere. Its worth it to pay extra for a better hotel than this.

Got it on a bid from Priceline as a FOUR-star hotel so be warned. Good deal though and all we needed the room for was for sleep. I was totally expecting the worse based on Yelp reviews but it wasn't that bad. 

Checked in around 1 am so and weekend of iHeartradio festival so rooms were sold out and I'm guessing because we got it through Priceline, the lady couldn't give us an upgrade.

Got a King Deluxe on the 24th floor "strip view" but it was overlooking the bottom half of the hotel so it was kinda ugly but you could see the strip. No torn lamp shades but we did see some white hairs in the bathroom and that was pretty gross. Room is a bit outdated and worn but it served its purpose. 

Hotel was alright..loved the tram to Bellagio. A bit sad we couldn't utilize the pools but it did look like a lotta fun. I would come back...It wasn't like a "Motel 6" experience to me.

We decided not to check into this hotel at the last minute. The service was friendly. I guess it is now a non-smoking hotel, and our travel site didn't tell us in advance. The room was fine; everything seemed fine here. 

I really don't like the location. The City Center is such a bore to walk through when trying to get to other places.

Also, I couldn't get a cell signal in the room while I was trying to find a new hotel to stay at.
If you're looking to stay somewhere that's wallet friendly, the Monte Carlo will get the job done. They're clean, they have a casino and pool, just don't expect too many frills!

I am very dissappointed with the Monte Carlo.

The room, in my opinion, is old looking and dated. The bathroom had a broken floor board and the wall paper was peeling. 

We used the shower and the water would not turn completely off.

The absolute worst part, I was looking forward to a blended Strawberry Margarita and this hotel does not have that capability.
I decided to try the Sports Bars regular margarita. What a big mistake! It was $12.95 for about an 8-10 ounce glass and it was the worst margarita I have ever had.

In my opinion, this hotel is one big let down.

I came here for their Grand opening weekend 15+ years ago, and have been back a few times since. Not just because we get great deals and it's really nice, but because the wave pool and lazy river pool rock! We even snuck into the Monte Carlo pool once because the hotel we were staying (at down the strip - which we referred to as the "Dump behind the dump") had a sucky pool which paled in comparison. Not that I just love family friendly hotels, which this hotel is, but I don't mind it here, because the pool area is big enough for everyone. 
The buffet is good and the location is close to the overpass that takes you into the MGM. There, you can catch the Monorail all the way to the north end of the strip. 
If laying by the pool or riding an inner-tube around the lazy river all day doesn't float you boat, you can walk next door and ride the roller coaster at the New York, New York hotel. In the evenings, it isn't too far to walk to the Bellagio to watch their famous free outdoor water show. 
For me, I preferred to lay by the pool and drown my hangover with a little hair of the dog, then gamble in the Monte Carlo casino - hopeful I'd win enough money to pay for some drinks one of their many bars. 
I think my favorite thing about the hotel is the clean, quiet feel. The clubs\/lounges can be loud, as well as the gigantic gaming floor, but when I'm tired and need a comfy bed to take a nap before hitting the clubs or the strip, this hotels' beds and nicely decorated rooms suit my needs just fine. 
You can also find some really good rates at the Monte Carlo; half what you'd pay at the new boutique-ish hotels.

There were several cleanliness and maintenance issues in our room which they didn't address when we reported to staff. All the drains were slow. For example, by the end of your shower, the water at the bottom was feet deep, and the sinks drained similarly slow. The curtains were stained and lopsided. The carpet was stained. The dresser top was peeling. The grout in the shower was dirty. There's plenty of options around, pick a nicer one. And if you don't, I hope you don't get 24-201.

Don't stay here. Checking in we were excited and thought the hotel was fine. We left to walk the strip,came back and the key to the room didn't work. We went to guest services and gave us new keys and said they may have deactivated from our phones. We go back to our room on the 17th floor and again they didn't work. We went back to complain and then they said the battery must of died on the door. We had to wait 30 minutes before someone could let us in to our room. When we did get in we had to have some guy in there to work on the door which was very uncomfortable. The next day when we checked out they asked if we enjoyed our stay and when we told them the situation there was no apologies or any care, they disregarded the complaint. We will no stay here again and will be sure to advise everyone else not to.

My husband stayed here in our first trip to Las Vegas for our 10th wedding anniversary! It was NOT a good experience...from the moment we checked in we had a feeling we were in for something bad. The front desk person was rude, didn't believe my husband that we needed a mini fridge for medical reasons and after telling us we could have one, never ordered it for us, so our medication was left in the heat for hours and after talking to two other employees (bellman and room service) we FINALLY got the fridge which froze our medication solid, rendering it useless....we also were assured that we would get our deposit ($150) back a few days after we checked out, and after almost 3 weeks without it, we called and they sent it to someone else's MasterCard , meanwhile we didn't even use a MasterCard to check in...all in all, the room was fine, and we were informed that there would be construction noise but we could hear every persons conversation walking down the hallway and that made it hard to sleep and just relax in our room. We won't be staying here ever again!

We stayed here when we came to Vegas a few weeks ago. 

We decided on this place based off the pool really. 

I was VERY disappointed with the rooms. 

Very rundown, there were rips in the lampshades, stains on the bedding, mold in the bathroom, and broken furniture all throughout the room. 

And No wifi in the room. There was a hard wire you could plug in, but they doesn't help me much for my iPad. They offer Wifi in the lobby. Thanks,

Are there some rundown hotels on the strip? Yes. 
Are there some really nice hotels on the strip? Absolutely. 

When I come back to Vegas again (I go about twice a year) I will not be back. 

Although, I do have to say, Amanda at the front desk was a total delight! Very helpful during my check in when I had a million questions.

Yes, I am a fan of the Monte Carlo.  We stay at the hotel on 12\/10 - 12\/13 and the customer service was outstanding.  The pool outside is excellent and you can order drinks and bring them outside...great palm trees.  

The Hotel has great location...the heart of everything, across the street is Hard Rock Cafe and great taxi service outside.  Very low price to stay here.

The rooms were okay nothing special and the spa was odd because if you want to use the gym...you must enter through the spa.  I posted reviews of the spa already.

Your choices to go eat...The Brand (Steak joint), Buffet which was great price for $35 to eat all day wearing a bracelet, Diablo which is a lounge and bar, Sports Bar, Starbucks, Noodle Dragon that cooks dim sum and lots of fast food places like McDonalds, Subway, Panda Express, and a Mexican joint if you want to save money.

The mall is crappy called Streets of Dreams...go to Caesars Palace Forum Shops or Aria if you want to shop...and the gambling section is small but friendly tables & dealers.  

The shows was excellent...I had the hookup so we went to watch Music which features the JABBAWOCKEEZ!!!!  We had front row seats and took pics with them which I posted in my pic profile here.

Overall, I enjoy my stay and I hardly stay in my hotel only to take a shower which was excellent because the showerhead pressure was like a massage.

Stopped by here to hang out with our buddies before hitting the clubs during Labor Day weekend.  What I really liked about this place was that the gaming area was really big, lots of games, modern layout, plus lobby areas were all modern too.  What I didn't like was the room, they looked a little old, you can definitely tell they spent a fortune renovating everything except the rooms.  Plus, the place was dead, no one was partying there.  In comparison to were we stayed, at Hard Rock, the lobby was old, but the rooms were nice and modern, plus the place was busy with peeps during the day due to the pool scene.

Stayed here over cinco de mayo weekend. It was a my first time staying at the MC and it was a very good experience. On Friday we had a studio that had a great view. The room was very spacious and presentable. 

For Saturday and Sunday we had a penthouse and it was beautiful. The bathroom was amazing. No problem sharing here lol the view was killer. Huge tv in the living room and bedroom. EverThe bathroom had a tv too. There was two bathrooms. A bar area. A high table that sat 8 people. Service was top notch.
Very nice hotel especially the location. They were nice enough to check us in a little early, And It was close to everything. They have a tram that connects to Aria and Bellagio hotel. Room were okay

Monte Carlo is going thru construction and it SUCKS they have no pools open you need to go to MGM or Mandalay Bay in over 105 degree weather it sucks. The atmosphere in the casino sucks especially with the construction it seems like a small casino. The rooms are old, water pressure sucks and windows are super dirty .

This hotel casino is old and needs updating. From the multiple cracked marble tiles in the lobby to the worn and damaged furniture in the room to the dirtiest hallway carpet I've seen in many years of business travel. For $210, this room is a disappointment. The gym was well equipped, and included in the $33\/day resort fee. However; after a intense workout I was told I couldn't use the shower, whirlpool and steam room, because that is considered the "Spa" and it would cost $15 extra. Really? MGM resorts have a reciprocal agreement with Hyatt (where I booked this hotel) so even with my Diamond status, MLife platinum status and $33 resort fee... Nope, still costs $15 for the"Spa". What a joke. Oh well, I'm sure your other Monte Carlo customers on the packed elevator appreciated my intense workout. Hyatt, I'm surprised you would be affiliated with a hotel like this. For others, there are many better options on the strip, stay away.

On a recent visit to Las Vegas, my friends and I decided to stay at the Monte Carlo because it had been recommended to us and we like the location. I would say overall that we had a nice vacation, but we experienced a problem at the end of our stay.

After we had packed our bags, and just before checking out, I called for a bellman to take our bags down for us. After checking out and driving home, we discovered that a bottle of perfume had been broken in one of our bags. As all we did was go straight from the hotel back to our house, we concluded the bag had most likely been mishandled by the bellman.

We immediately called the hotel, and a very sympathetic person took our information, and told us he would investigate what happened, as well as what they could do fo us, and get back to us within 72 hours. After waiting for 5 days without a response, I called back to follow up. I was unable to speak to the person who originally helped me, and found that the person with whom I was now speaking had a very unpleasant, almost accusing tone in her voice. 

She informed me that there was nothing that they would be able to do, insisting that the negligence lay with us. We were also advised that the first person with whom we spoke should not have committed to returning our call within 72 hours as this was not their policy.

Overall I would say that I was disappointed by the fact that they are not willing to do anything about the broken bottle of perfume (which spilled all over an expensive piece of luggage), but even more unsatisfied by the disingenuous manner in which we were treated. It was an unpleasant end to our vacation and I certainly have no plans to revisit the hotel, nor will I recommend it to anyone I know.

For years I have been under the impression that the Monte Carlo was an affordable luxury hotel\casino, but it turns out this impression was completely unfounded. Though the Monte Carlo's lobby does Support my original theory, the rest of the 'resort' leaves much to be desired.

Guest Rooms: Standard rooms are very small, decor is out of date. My thermostat said it was 68 degrees but the room felt more like 78. The bathroom wallpaper was stained and peeling, faucets and knobs were mismatched. The whole place seemed cobbled together from spare parts. My room at the Circus Circus was way bigger and nicer!

Casino: The casino itself is small and doesn't offer enough table games. The decor is typical obnoxious Vegas, but in better condition than the rooms.

Restaurants: Considering the size of the resort, there are a lot of dining options, including several sit-down restaurants and several fast-food places. The Pub is the best of the dining options, but it won't be winning any awards.

Shopping: Forget it unless you love Vegas kitsch. 

Location: Excellent location! This is about the only thing the Monte Carlo has going for it. Right in the middle of the strip, walking distance to most of the best casinos including the Bellagio, Caesars, Venetian...

When it comes to bargain hotels, The Circus Circus, and Sahara are hard to beat. If you want luxury, spend a little extra money, check out the Venetian, Caesars, The Bellagio, MGM Grand, and Planet Hollywood.

I enjoyed staying at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. I enjoyed the fact that they had a food court with a bunch of my favorite foods. I loved the convenience of it, the person who built the hotel was smart they put the food court right next too the elevators and they knew that the people that would be eating there the most would be the guests of the hotel.  

The size of the hotel was perfect! It wasn't too small and it wasn't so huge that you could lost in it. My favorite part of the hotel was the pool area. Monte Carlo has a wave pool and a lazy river, perfect for their hot weather. I just didn't like the fact that it was ten dollars to rent an inter tube per day.

Monte Carlo would have gotten 5 stars their service, food, and cleanliness was great but I didn't like the twenty dollar per day resort fee they had. I know they need to make money and all but just charge that amount when you first book the hotel don't do it after your guest has already stayed. I would definately stay here again but hopefully next time there is no resort fee.

very disappoint in my stay at the Monte Carlos I had a  suite which had a  old sofa ,old center table, wall paper on wall coming off  wish I should have taken pictures. front desk  didn't have any other room available. my room reservation wasn't ready. I think it sucks that as a guest we still have to pay for parking as it is we are still paying resort fees . not staying at Monte Carlos again .

We scored rooms on Monday-Wednesday for $50\/night on Expedia. Such a good deal! The rooms are comfortable and roomy enough for 4 girls. Beds were comfy enough and pillows were fluffy enough, no complaints. Water pressure was good too. And the pool isn't bad either! It's no EBC or Wet Republic, but order some drinks and a donut floatie and you're good to go. Music is a bust but oh well. I don't know how I'd feel about spending more, but for the $50\/night we paid, well worth it.

just spent four nights here,,,,,,,,very nice service,,,,nice room,,,,good food,,,,,,reasonable rates,,,,,,close to lots of attractions,,,,,,,a  ++++++

only trouble was ethernet for the web,,,,,,,but they said that on the web site,,,,,,might be a good idea to have the connectors to plug in to the usb port on all laptops,,,,,,,should be able to have those for sale on site,,,,,

The Monte Carlo is quite unfortunately on a downward spiral. It's amazing when older hotels go through a type of renaissance and build its way back up to compete with newer ones, but sadly this hotel is a sad story.  The check in line was long, and there was 1 kiosk for fast check in. My husband and I was looking forward to a pool, because ya know? It's kinda nice to take respite from the 107 degree heat. Sadly, it was under construction and the only option was Mandalay Bay and\/or MGM. If you like the sound of jackhammers, construction trucks and pipes greeting you every morning then this place is for you. We couldn't even take a mid day siesta, because of all the noise.  There was 1 roll of toilet paper so heaven forbid you and the guest you're staying with all of a sudden end up with the urge to drop the kids off at the pool.  And the kicker? There's no mini fridge or free bottles of water. So good luck paying for that $4 bottle of Aquafina down at Rubios!  

Maybe we should just stick to Caesars.  What a disappointment this was. Hopefully we don't find any hidden charges on our bill.  I'd hate to update my review to a 1 star.

More than normal for even the strip casinos, most Monte Carlo penny machines have a minimum bet so they're not truly penny machines. Also, their twenty-five poker machine, near the Sports Book, had a manual button called "bet one" whereby pressing it, it would set me up to play the "max bet." It shouldn't do this, according to the slot technician on duty, so the floor supervisor then immediately returned my money, on the spot. I would like the casino to run an audit of all the slot machines on their floor for me to be completely satisfied. Thank you!

I had reservations at the Monte Carlo and Planet Hollywood but, had just stayed at PH and thought that the Monte Carlo might be nicer. WRONG. Like other reviews have said, the lobby is very nice but, the minute you take the elevator up to you room it's a different story. My hotel room has filthy carpet and blinds and seemed more like a motel than a giant hotel on the Vegas Strip. Would rather sleep on the streets of Vegas than in this hotel again.

I am not happy with the service that I received at this hotel. First of all, I was not informed that the $20 per day resort fee, as it was not part of the package that I paid for. I understand that it is not necessarily the Monte Carlo's fault, and that it should have been explained by my booking agency. I am upset because when I brought this up to the concierge, she was extremely loud and rude creating an embarrassing situation for my family. She kept repeating in a loud voice that we would have to pay the resort fees, and kept telling us it was only "$20 per day". The issue is that there were 4 of us in 2 rooms, so it was actually  $40 per day for a 4 day stay or $160. We could have seen a show for the same price. The manager was more civil, but did not apologize for the behavior of the concierge, and basically told us the same thing with a quiet and calm voice and a dirty look.
This set the tone for 4 more days of wishing we were at another hotel. The hotel food was awful, and the ice bar was $25 just to get in. The only nice thing about this hotel is its central position on the strip which allowed me to get around on foot easily. A good thing too, since I wanted to be in any other hotel during my stay. I will never go back to the Monte Carlo.

The hotel itself isn't all that bad.  There really isn't anything wrong with it per se, but it isn't the best hotel on the strip.  If you want to stay on the strip, be relatively close to everything, and not pay an arm and a leg, then this is your place.  I normally find the best deals here and haven't been disappointed with anything.  The hotel is like any other hotel, only probably bigger.  The staff are friendly for the most part.  I think that it's more geared towards the middle-aged and older crowd, but maybe that's why the deals are fairly good.  

So, if you don't need to stay in a fancy hotel, but want to stay on the strip, check out the Monte Carlo.  Oh, the other plus is that parking normally isn't that bad if you have a car, and it's fairly close to the hotel itself which is nice.

Stayed at the hotel this last weekend with 16 of my friends from work. The rooms were descent but nothing exciting. No dresser to store clothes. No mini bar or refrigerator. I had a problem with my air conditioner not cooling the room which I was told Maintenance would be up to repair. When I entered the room that evening the thermostat was set to 60 but it was still warm. We sweated through the night yet again. Went back down to guest services the following day to have the air conditioner repaired and to discuss housekeeping entering my room with the do not disturb sign on the door and still doing a poor job. They apologized and gave me a $50 credit for food or drink and sent maintenance right away. Maintenance arrived and was very nice. He checked the room temperature and it was 74. He flushed the line and rechecked and it was dropping to 60. Let's say the first guy didn't do his job! I appreciate the offer of the room credit but this experience was not pleasant and next time I will be staying at another hotel. Also, it was not made aware when making reservations that their pool are was under construction!

Meeehhhh.....

The location is good not great (it's a little too far down south of the strip for my taste). 
The casino and hotel room were nice but drifted more towards simple and sedate. 
I guess when I'm in Vegas I want my hotel to have more of a theme and then go balls to the wall to make it happen. Be gaudy, be extravagant be grandiose and bizarre , but have a personality. 
The Monte Carlo is adequately modern, clean and geographically sound, overall a "safe bet" by Vegas hotel standards. But who wants to play it safe in Vegas?

To me the Monte Carlo has changed.  My husband and I stayed 4 years ago and much to our delight couldn't wait to return.  The pillow top mattresses were extremely comfortable, everything was extremely clean and well maintained.

Although the hotel is nice for the price, you can see that they must have made cutbacks.  The wear and tear of guests are starting to show. The mattresses are no longer pillow top...at least in the room I stayed in.  The carpets in the halls were stained and even on the 21st floor we could still hear the noise coming from the parking lot.  They room was close to being clean, our pillow cases were stained and there was hair from the previous guest on the bathroom floor and shower walls.  This increases my "EWW" factor.  We found the toilet humerous.  Do not stand close to it as it likely will suck you in with its flushing power.

The location can't be beat, good amenities and helpful staff.  I personally would not bring my kids to Las Vegas but if I ever decided to, I would not allow them into the casino floor during the evening as they have now placed scantily clad dancers on a raised stage near the game tables.  They most likely would be in bed at that point however this is just my personal preference.  

Be aware that their advertised price is not their full price.  You will have to pay an additional $12.99 per night when you arrive for the miniture water bottles they place in your room and to pay for access to the pool and spa, regardless if you are using them.  So you may have booked a room for $79 but the actual cost will be $92.  

Would I stay here again, probably but it wont be my first choice any longer.

For a supposed 4 star hotel I'd suggest any other big name hotel on the strip. 

First, it took over an hour waiting in line to check in. The line was LONG yet they didn't  add any more front desk workers. You would think that they would be fully staffed when check in starts at 3pm. 

The hallway to my room, the carpet was crumpled and bubbling up....didn't expect that from a 4 star hotel. The ice machine was broken on my floor and we either had to go up or down a floor in order to get ice. The room didn't have a coffee maker....don't remember the last time any room at any hotel didn't have a coffee maker (yes maybe im being nit picky on this detail but this is supposed to be a 4 star establishment!)  

The bed...wow they must have used the cheapest mattress they could find. You could feel every spring as u moved in it. 

Shower Head was full of lime deposits, you can pretty much figure out how the water was shooting out if that thing. The tub floor was pretty dirty looking. 

The M Life booth..."sorry our system is down". 

Don't remember if the hotel has any shows or night life....pretty much sums up the activities there. You'll have to go elsewhere for that. Shopping is definitely a trip to another hotel. 

On the plus side, the place had 2 Starbucks. There are multiple choices for restaurants and a food court. Employees, from front desk, to food court, to housekeeping, etc...were all very pleasant and professional. 

Pretty bad stay overall from a comfort and amenities level. The place is dated. Hopefully there are plans for renovations

Pretty hotel and it is a plus that the hotel is on the strip. No complaints about the service either. The gentleman who checked us in was really nice. It's just so unfortunate that our room was not the greatest. First off, we were greeted by a roach that ran from under the bed into the closet. Thank goodness we didn't see anymore. The beds "looked" clean but our bathroom clearly was not. The shower pressure was too high, and the drain was not working properly. My boyfriend and I were so glad that our stay here was just for one night. The rate was dirt cheap, but like the saying goes, "You get what you pay for".

The room was comfortable but it was outdated and in need of a remodel! The brass fixtures were tarnished and scratched and the lampshade was broken. The check in process was slow and parking was a hassle due to events near by. The buffet was terrible!! The food was bad and very overpriced!!! I have nothing positive to say about this hotel other than I never have to go back!

Couldn't have been more disappointed. The standard rooms are so run down! Chips in everything, old furniture, stained carpet and walls, broken lamp shades. The manager said they haven't renovated the rooms in 17 years. Well, maybe add that to your website! The water was turned off for 3 hours on Friday for maintenance. The pool is completely shaded all day. We will never stay here again.

My husband and I have been avid fans of the Monte Carlo for years. We come here 4-5 times a year and if you read my original review from a few years ago you'll see why.  This used to be a great resort for the price.  This is our first visit back to the Monte Carlo since this summer (the longest we've gone between visits) and I truly feel like its the end of an era for me & my husband that found this place so special.  

At check-in, we were informed that our once free valet & daily parking was no longer such. It is now $13 a day for valet or $8 a day for self parking. I've never paid for parking in Vegas and I kind of thought that was a given when we are squeezed for every cent on resort fees wherever we go. So that was a disappointing start to our trip. 

Then, we got in after dark so when we got to our room & I looked out the window that I was fairly confident used to face the pool, all i saw in the darkness was the faintest visual of a dirt construction area. My husband assured me I must be mistaken and the pool must be on the otherside. After all, Monte Carlo has one of the best pool areas on the strip. I began unpacking and noticed the room just seemed a lot more rough around the edges than rooms we'd had in the past. 

The next day we were rudely awoken by construction at 7am sharp outside in that dirt lot...not exactly the time I'd planned for considering we're in Vegas.  

We walked through the Street of Dreams towards the tram and was surprised to see that it was gone. Every shop, little restaurant, The Pub (a great restaurant) all gone. There was just fake walls everywhere with advertisements for a new Park MGM. Then I realized the doors at the beginning of what used to be the Street of Dreams that took you to the pool area hadn't been there.  We raced to the tram station as it gave a great visual of the pool area and my fears were confirmed. It is gone. It is all gone and its not coming back. They are using the space to make 2 new hotels for the MGM revitalisation. Monte Carlo will no longer have a pool.  Guests will have to pack their items and walk to another MGM resort in their swimsuits to have access to one of their pools...something I can tell you no woman wants to do & is inconvenient to everyone. 

Now I'm laying here on Saturday morning, went to bed at 2am, and was again awoken by construction at 7am sharp. We will never stay here again. I used to be a walking advertisement for Monte Carlo. Now, I will tell my friends it might as well be torn down. I'm angry, disappointed and I want my money back because this is not the resort I made reservations for. Not a resort with plenty of shops, great restaurants, a fantastic pool, and relaxing mornings. I might as well go home early where I CAN sleep in, park for free, swim in a pool (I get that it's January), and NOT pay exorbitant resort fees for nothing that is even resort like.

I've stayed here twice. The last time over Thanksgiving. Yes, the hotel rooms need updating but the condition of the room are in line with pricing. It's reasonably priced and a clean place to sleep. The hotel does have some perfume smell that hits you as you enter the lobby. Overwhelming but thankfully it goes away. The casino is a good size, nice to not have to walk miles looking for people. And not too crowded. The comps accumulate quickly so get a mlife card. The food court options are nice for a quick and cheap meal. The casino cafe was also decent. Unfortunately, not much shopping so unless you only gamble, staying at Monte Carlo can get boring. The hotel staff have been generally nice too.

not bad.  consider several details before booking.
whatever the rate is.... always add at least 35-40 bucs\/day. these are resort fees and taxes.  also.. if considering a suite... dont expect lotsa of sleeping space.   the room is large..but not for several persons. kinda waste of money.  stick to a standard room and save on the taxes.  make sure you get a players card thru m-life and you will get points for both dining and gambling. they will send you awesome offers.   location is smack in the middle of the strip. everything is clean and the staff is kinda friendly.  overall good
value

This is quite possibly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Everything was awful from the start. First day we check in, it took 5 people at the check-in desk an hour to get 15 people in front of us their rooms. After finally getting our room, the whole hallway smelled like weed on our way to our room. In our room, we could hear all of our neighbors and the construction through the thin walls. Speaking of construction, there was no hotel pool available because of construction but they generously told us we had a pass to the MGM Grand pool a mile away.

Here's the kicker! We called the night before and requested a late checkout at noon. We were packing up and went to get breakfast at 10:50 and come back to find we're locked out of our room! The maid couldn't let us in so we had to eat our breakfast in the hall waiting on security to let us in. 

0\/10. Do yourself a favor and go stay in the Mirage or Caesars

Typical on-strip Vegas hotel\/casino. Rooms are average, but outdated and in need of renovations. I was here for two back to back conventions; one at the Aria and the other at the LVCC. All my coworkers wanted to stay on strip, so on the strip we stayed. The room price was decent, I believe around $110 per night, but then they add the ludicrous "resort fee".

Pool is under construction and they want you to walk to MGM or take a tram to Mandalay Bay...and still charge you the daily resort fee! Seriously? This hotel is a joke, don't waste your time or money. We will be shredding our M Life cards and spending all future money at non MGM properties!

Nice hotel, cozy beds, not too busy if you want to avoid crowds.  My fiance noticed that our first room was not well cleaned and the air filter was filthy so he went down and pointed out his findings and they immediately upgraded us to a strip view room on the 31st floor.  Quite accommodating I think, but they should clean all rooms the same regardless of how much you pay.  

If you are planning to do a lot of walking on the strip, I would suggest finding a hotel a little more centrally located so you can explore more.  

If you are looking for fun bars within your hotel, I would suggest looking elsewhere.  'Brand' is a lounge that offers $20 entry fee and free drinks all night for ladies, but it didn't look too exciting so I never went in.  

Reasons to stay: nice, accommodating, cozy beds, not too crowded.

Reasons not to stay: not centrally located on the strip, no fun bars within the hotel

Pros:
-Cheap prices (for group rates) 
-walking distance to most things on strip
-nice rooms
-lots of penny slots
-Very clean rooms

Cons: 
-thin walls where you can hear your neighbors tango'ing - mattress style.
-sunlight down by the pool looks blocked by the building
-construction noise from Vedara (name?) 
-no nightclub
-not enough hot young chicks
-middle aged crowds (I'm in my early 30's, I want to feel younger (-:)
-pay internet (are they all like that now?)

Don't get me wrong, this is a nice hotel. But it's just a hotel. There's not much else about it. No glitz, no glamour of the standard Vegas kitsch that we've all come to love about the strip. It's good if you're looking for someplace cheap and classy. I have a feeling this will take over Casino Royale's spot on the cheap list when CR finally gets demolished (and they all do)

My husband and I have stayed here three separate times- October 2014, March 2015, and October 2015.  Each time we have been happy with our stay, however we hope with this review everyone can understand exactly what you get when you stay at the Monte Carlo.

Check-In.
I have gotten braver at asking if there are any strip view rooms upon checking into the hotel.  Each time that we have stayed the view has been wonderful.  On our last visit, we didn't get to the hotel until approximately 10:30PM.  I asked the gal checking us in if there was any rooms with a strip view available and ended up on the 4th floor because there were no rooms available at that time.  She assured us that the next day we would receive a text message between 1PM and 3PM with a room change, and all we would need to do is go to the check-in\/guest services area and we would get new room keys.

We received our text message at 10:30AM.  I went down to switch rooms and was helped by Juanita, who I had read in a previous Yelp comment was at best, difficult.  She proved to be the same when I dealt with her on this instance.

The Rooms.
When my husband and I got to our room on the 4th floor our first night, it smelled as though it had just been cleaned.  When we showered the next morning, we noticed that the pressure in the shower was, for lack of better word, extreme.

For the reviews that say that their room\/hallway\/hotel is not clean, I have never experienced this.  When we left the 4th floor to go to the 19th, there was a maintenance man mopping the walls.  He would spray on a solution, and use a mop to wash them.  On a side note, as clean as the 4th floor was, the 19th floor was spotless.

The view from our room on the 19th floor, even side room facing north, faced the Aria\/Cosmo, directly above the Monte Carlo pool area.  The room was better than average, as was the view.  We could see parts of the strip, including part of the Planet Hollywood.  

The Service:
During check-in I had been told to tell who ever I spoke with for my room change that my last night staying with the Monte Carlo was comp'd through MyVeagas.  I had forgotten to do this when I spoke with Juanita, so I trekked back down to the Guest Service desk.  I was told that all I had to do was come down on Thursday morning to get a new key made for that night.  I did so on Thursday before my husband and I left the hotel and was helped by Lorena, who was sweet as can be.  Lorena checked me out Friday morning, and remembered me from the day before.  Kuddos to you, Lorena, for outstanding personal customer service.

The Casino\/Sports Book:
Eh. I go to Vegas to enjoy one on one time with my husband and getting tipsy.  We go to the Sports Book religiously, though, had have a ball making bets on whatever games are that night, whether we know what we're doing or not.  I especially enjoy the older gentleman that works at the Sports Book who looks like what we think of as an old mobster.  The casino appeared to be packed when we came down in the morning, however died down through out the day.  It appeared to us that more people played in the back of the casino vs. the front.

Overall:
We have never had anything but positives to say about the Monte Carlo.  We often comment to others about the value the Monte Carlo is when you consider the price, service, amenities and experience.  We will be back to the Monte Carlo in the future, and are already looking forward to it.

Checked into the Monte Carlo tonight, I haven't been this disappointed in a long time. We are suppose to stay here for 3 night's , but we will be checking out tomorrow.  I'd leave tonight but we are exhausted from a long day of traveling.  The place is a dump, carpets are stained, wallpaper peeling off the wall, cracked tiles in the bathroom.  We have an HD TV without HD service. I asked for a fridge in my room, they want $25 a day for it. The Luxor is cheaper and a way nicer hotel. Stay away from this place.

Moths everywhere in the room... poor upkeep of the shower \/ tub... I'm never staying in this place ever again. Would not recommend to any of my friends, it is most definitely not worth the price. Pay the extra bucks and stay somewhere else this place blows.

Royally disappointed when we checked in tonight... we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that the reservation that we had for two queen beds was turned into one king bedroom. I've been up since 4am and drove 3.5hrs just to get here tonight to hear this... of course I was pissed. We were told that house keeping would send a roll away bed so that I can sleep on that tonight and get our room swapped tomorrow but by the time we got to our room we had to call house keeping to follow up with the roll away and then was informed that they don't have anymore for the night... while this is adding fuel to our frustration, we went back down to the front desk and to them what we were told and the night Manager just said that there's nothing he could do. I asked for towels, blankets, sheets and pillows to try to make a make shift bed for myself and he said that he will have house keeping send it to the room in 15 minutes... 15 minutes go by and nothing so I had to call them to check and I got the operator who told me they don't have anything for me then forwarded my call to house keeping and house keeping turned me down and forwarded me to front desk... front desk told me that they can't send me more than four towels a one blanket because they're not allowed to... seeing that they're already making me sleep on the disgusting floor, shouldn't exceptions be made to accommodate a dissatisfied guest? Apparently not, because they gave me more run arounds and made it assume that I was going to steal their towels because I was asking for a stack of them. I only want to make the best of a crappy night to try to at least make my stay a little more comfortable instead of being accused of being a thief... by the time I made enough complaints, house keeping brought five towels, 2 blankets and 4 sheets... the first sheet that I picked up and unfolded there was a used bandaid stuck on there... I'm totally disgusted now and have made the rest of my party annoyed with me and the hotel. Some weekend this will be...

I can only speak for my experience, but staying in Monte Carlo was a disappointment. Yes, it's located in a fabulous spot on the strip, and yes it is a pretty good value compared to others, but the yes' stop there. First off, the room is very very basic\/standard. I would NOT describe it even close to luxurious nor upscale. I would say it's a notch or two above the Imperial Palace and well below hotels like Mirage and MGM. Inside the room, there was no refridgerator, the beds were Holiday Inn quality, the toilet had this God aweful suction action when flushed, and the toiletries they provide are horrible (the shampoo made my hair bridle). The hair dryer they provide you was also useless. Additionally, they charge for EVERYTHING. No courtesy toothbrushes. Internet access is $15 a day. To use the workout gym you have to pay $50 for 3 days or $25 for one day!  Annoying!!  Overall, the hotel has a very old, Las Vegas 70's feeling to it. I would actually say the hotel is themed to the Las Vegas era of 1970's. It feels classical in that sense. The Casino is like the hotel, which is very very basic and standard. It has an old feel to it.  I would say all of the restaurants do not stand out, and not many outsiders come to this hotel for the food. There is a pretty nice steakhouse located in the Casino, which has pretty attractive and scantely clad hostesses, but then it occurred to me the only reason why they need attractive women in these roles is because hardly anyone outside comes to this hotel. I would say the only big attraction at Monte Carlo is magician Lance Burton, but other than that Monte Carlo is very dull.  The whole time there we were wishing we stayed on the other end of the strip in the Mirage. That's where all the action is at.  But hey, if you want to stay on the strip for a good price in a 'decent' hotel, then Monte Carlo is for you!

Pros: 
- Great service from lobby staff.
- Free tram\/monorail that travels back and forth from Monte Carlo, Aria, and Bellagio (if I had known about this, I would have stayed at the Bellagio since the price difference was negligible in mid February).
- Food court on the first floor; McDonald's and Subway are open 24\/7 while the other fast food joints are open until midnight. 
- Inexpensive

Cons:
- Very dated rooms; my bathroom at home is nicer than this hotel's bathrooms.
- Paper thin walls. I could clearly hear the person in the next room snore as if he were in the same room as me.
- Limited channels on TV. Every other hotel I've stayed in had all the starter cable channels.
- Currently under construction.

There are nicer, flashier, newer hotels on the strip but The Monte Carlo isnt a bad deal. For around $100 a night you get a clean room (somewhat outdated) in a fairly well maintained room in a prime spot on the strip. 

Connected to ARIA, The City Center ( high end shopping mall ), and bellagio via tram system is a nice convenience. Walgreens is right next door incase you need to make a liquor supply run ( prices are marked up considerably, it is the strip after all ). Most of the time the hotel offers 2 free buffet breakfast\/lunch with your stay which is a nice touch. Their buffet is not  spectacular but decent and you can't complain since its free.

Checkin lines seem short. Not at all like the craziness you see over at Ceasar's. They have kiosks for printing out flight itinerary's. The ladies over at the convenience store are super friendly and gave us alot of good tips. We didnt visit the pool so no comment there.  

Overall had a great time for our 2 night stay. If you're not going to be in your room much and do not need anything fancy, Monte Carlo will do the job. 

3 stars

Went to check in tonight and.... they don't have my reserved spa room. Don't waste your time. I came to Vegas to get Married. Supposed to have a good time. I booked my room well in advance. I had all my guest book here as well. I paid for the spa suite for us since it's our wedding and all. I check in in online, told them when I was coming everything. Guess what, they overbooked, didn't have my room and wouldn't even offer an upgrade or to refund me. I have never hear of a hotel overbooking a suite. This is not a regular Room. Management acted like there is nothing they could do. I will have to write them or call but I don't think anything will happen. Thanks for ruining a magical trip. This was my first time here and a mistake. I've stayed at so many better hotels here.

Monte Carlo made it on my list of last resort places to crash at in Vegas. The beds are too mushy (I like firm beds) the air in the hallway is thick and old, there's no air circulation in the elevators, at any given point 1 or 2 (and at 1 point) 3 of the 6 elevators on our side were out of commission, the buffet is bleh... BUT the 1 big thing MC has going for it is it's fairly inexpensive and that it's located in the heart of Vegas nestled between the big boys of the strip.
Do not stay here unless you want blood on your sheets PRIOR to checking in. UNACCEPTABLE. WILL NOT PAY THIS MUCH FOR A "6 star hotel.

This place is janky and dirty, at best. Construction is for New York NY, not MC. No wifi in rooms in 2015.  My room is tiny for Vegas, and furniture sell by date was 5 years ago. Missing a comforter, now 45 mins waiting for house keeping to bring the missing bedding. Comforter was promise on the phone, I just got a $5 nylon blanket. Classy. 
Best part? It's connected to Aria, should just stay there.
We haven't ever stayed here but the casino is always clean & the staff helpful. We visit often when we're in town & love El Diablo Cantina. So go have fun!

Really the Monte Carlo is 2 1\/2 stars.  This hotel is more impressive on the outside than on the inside.  The decor inside was blah and the gaming is seriously lacking.  

When me and my boyfriend checked in we "upgraded" to a strip view room for $10.00 more a night...but the lady failed to tell us that the room had two queen beds and not one king bed.  We managed anyways.  Their rooms are even less impressive than their casino.  The window tint was starting to peel at the top of the window...very cheap looking.  The best part of the room was the shower and I enjoyed many long relaxing showers!  They also add a $10.00 resort fee per night for two tiny bottles of water and for the use of their telephone for local calls.   That's a little shady to me.  

They don't have very many restaurant options, and they have NO shops...other than the one or two that sold the cheap trinkets and the overpriced sundries.  On the positive side they did have a good sized food court that is right next to the hotel rooms.  

The room was at an O.K. price but I would never pay full price to stay at this hotel.  There is just way too much competition, especially with the new City Center that is opening right next to them in December.  I will be looking at other hotels for my future visits.  Good Luck Monte Carlo...you'll need it!!!
The Monte Carlo is one of our favorite hotels. It was very nice and clean, the staff was friendly. My husband and I really enjoyed staying here and plan to stay here the next time we are in Vegas!
I just came here to see the Blueman Group so I can't speak for the rooms but I just wasn't feeling the casino.

I have stayed twice at Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, I had to give it a second chance plus try a jacuzzi room. Well, the "jacuzzi" room now is just a big bath tub sitting near the window, they removed the water jet tubs :-( The Monte Carlo marketing pictures and info show jets, for that reason, I had to mark them down.

The location of the Las Vegas Monte Carlo is great since I like walking the strip to go through as many casinos as my feet will let me. I ate at the food court for breakfast because a number of the food chains actually have a breakfast menu; it was quick, good and reasonably priced.

The pools are nice and a lazy river and wave pool are cool, but there is a lack of seating so they are hard to enjoy without planning. I went to the pool on a Monday in fall and was barely able to find a place to lay down for some Sun.

My previous stay in Vegas was in a basic room and I got what I expected: basics, so I would stay at the Monte Carlo Las Vegas again if I had to, but they won't be my first choice.

My boyfriend and I stayed here Tuesday through Thursday. 
Valet is EXTREMELY polite and welcoming. 
The line was short to check in. 

We got free tickets to the buffet.
Let's just say, good thing it was free.  

Our room was the Spa Suite. 
I loved everything about it. 

The bathroom had it's own separate door for the toilet, which was great.

The hot tub was HUGE! 
I recommend bringing bubbles. It gets really fun. 
The hot tub is just next to the window to enjoy a view while having a drink. 
They also have little jets inside the hot tub that are so relaxing. 

The couches were uncomfortable -- stiff. 

The kitchen was nice. 

The AC is spectacular. It actually really works. 

The food court has a great variety.
[Subway, McDonald's, Sbarro, Chinese food, Rubios, chicken tenders]


Monte Carlo, you sure did satisfy our needs. 
By far my favorite hotel on the strip now. 

Would have gotten 5 stars, but I feel like you should update your lamps to have an outlet to charge your phone. 
And also, the bottom sheet under the bed, [the "skirt"] was dirty. Looked like vomit. :\/
