Casino: I had some good times as well as bad times at the casino here. I did super bad when I played alone but when I had my friends with me I did fairly good. Haha. We had a good laugh with one of the casino attendants (the guy in charge of the table). The dealers were nice and friendly. 

Buffet: A friend and I woke up earlier than everyone else once so we decided to check out the buffet with our 2 for 1 deal. It was okay as far as buffets go. Not the best but not the worst. I preferred Bellagio's buffet but that's not too surprising. Their orange juice was kinda gross though =\.
The hotel is really worn down and in need of up dates. The windows were filthy. There were stains on the shower curtain. There was an extra charge for gym access even if you don't use it.

Hmmmmmm where to start.  The Monte Carlo use to be a really nice hotel.  I know the hotel is under renovation which is a blessing.  The check in staff was really awesome.  I checked in online and was notified that my room was ready via email.  When I went to get the key I was told it was over where construction was going on so he gave us a room on the opposite side of the building which was very nice of him.  The room itself was nothing to write home about.  It seemed to be lacking things and very dated.  Carpet was stained and worn and the wallpaper was coming off everywhere.  The bathroom had cracked tile and mold was starting to grow in the corners of the tub.  The positive thing about the room was the bed was nice and comfy and the sheets were clean.  Last time I was in Vegas I had stayed at the Flamingo and I would have to say I felt like the rooms there felt more modern with more amenities and well taken care of.  Needless to say I would probably stay there again on my next trip to Vegas

Stayed here last week.   Bad experience.   Requested to move rooms, which could not be done until the next day.    Received a phone call that the room was ready.   Left the pool and went to the front desk.   Computer system was down for several hours and nothing could be done.   So went to my room to shower, and turned on the water, it was brownish orange.   Called the front desk, who said oh yeah we had to turn the water off, it will clear in a few minutes.   NOT!   25 minutes later still a disgusting color.   Called the front desk to complain.   They offered a $50 food credit.   Of course when I received the bill, I didn't get the food credit.   Had to call "accounting" which took another 35 minutes of my time.    Lumpy beds too.  Never going back here again!!!!!!

It's hard for me to review this place because of what happened just recently...

The power went out and the whole hotel was out for a good 4 hours and while only 1 elevator was working. When we chose to checkout we talked to concierge about our meal that we are at "the pub" because we were eating cold food in the dark, I got my money back but the concierge was really rude by just throwing the receipt to me and not even handing it. However, the manager Christina took over and was really kind and handled my situation professionally. 

As for the hotel itself, it's a somewhat good hotel. Decent but slowly aging. I would debate to come here again but it would be a last resort if I couldn't stay anywhere else. Some of the outlets in our room didn't work and the AC was not putting in much effort in keeping our room cool. The only reason why I still liked this hotel because it was in the heart of the strip which is really awesome.

um.....meh. This is a huge hotel but it could be better plus it needs a renovation to compete with other modernized hotels nearby. One thing I hate about Vegas is that they allow smoking inside and everywhere! I requested for a non-smoking room but the smoke smell came over from the smoking rooms. We didn't get any smoke but we could smell it. The casino area is the worst!!! We got our deal from hotel.com and it came out to be $269 for two nights plus $50 for the resort fees. That is ridiculous but all the hotels charges that fee. I didn't even use their pool and it cost $20 to reserver a lounge chair even when you pay for that fee. The decor is outdated and so are the rooms! This hotel offer no popular attraction.

It would have been nice to know that construction was under way, 3 shifts, never a break from the constant beep beep beep. The room was okay, holes in the wall where a large picture was removed & not replaced. Their attached eateries were good, we enjoyed the Dairy Ice Cream Shop. We won't be back.

**Casino review** 

It's funny how we end of playing here more than the hotels we are actually staying at. Bottom line is we always seem to win a bit, the dealers are friendlier than a lot of other casinos and the layout is super easy to navigate. Also, the Monte Carlo never seems to get as busy as some of the newer, swankier places.

I usually despise those paid girls who dance on the tables while people are playing their table games but at the Monte Carlo they seem less skank and more friendly (instead of shooting your husband "I wanna f* you" looks they actually smile at everyone). 

I've stayed here a couple of times in the past and always thought it was okay. Apparently they've upgraded since the last time we were here. Considering the amount of time we spend here maybe we should consider staying too. It would definitely make the trip from the blackjack table to bed a helluva lot quicker!

I stayed in this hotel for three days for a girls weekend in vegas. It was clean and had free parking. It is on the southern part of the strip so walking around isn't impossible. You could see a lot of stuff on foot but would probably want to take a cab to the north part of the strip for sight seeeing. I didn't use the pool or workout facilities so I don't have any rating there. The hotel has a small food court with a mc donalds and starbucks and subway so you can stay on a budget for food. We had a $35 champagne brunch at the hotel's buffet and it was ok. Not amazing but not worth $35. Id stay at this hotel again.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for six nights including his birthday and thanksgiving. We ordered off Priceline, which said it was a 5 star hotel. When we got to the hotel we upgraded to the spa suite. The hotel did nothing for birthdays which was fine because is figured upgrading up 2 times to the suite would be fine. 

When we walked into the room the carpet was dirty and scratched up, stains all over the walls, stains on the beds, and the spa hot tub didn't have any jets, you couldn't order movies, the only room service was a tiny menu from there 10 restaurants, and the pools were closed. 

As to say we were very very disappointed in the hotel. We travel all over and this is one of the worse hotels I've ever stayed in. The Italian restaurant was great but we ate at an Asain restaurant and we couldn't even touch our food and they made us pay for it. 

We ended up double booking and moving to the wonderful sls hotel. Don't stay at the Monte Carlo. They need to upgrade the whole hotel.

This was our first stay here; a short two night trip. The lobby was clean and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The Pub was a great hang out. The room we had was a queen on the 11th floor, friends had a suite on the 12th floor. Both rooms were dirty, with various broken fixtures and fittings (bathroom tiles missing, outlets coming away from the wall etc). The grout in the bathroom was filthy, the makeup mirror was so dirty the dust was sticky and the walls appeared to have been bleeding.  I heard a rumor that they are planning to either raise this hotel to the ground or refurbish it; one of the two needs to happen.

The Monte Carlo is starting to lose it's luster.  My wife and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend because we wanted to stay with our other family members.  The lobby is nicely kept and the staff in my experience was friendly. There is also a nice tram which takes you to the Aria and there are two Starbucks within a thirty second walk in the Casino. We ate at the Brand Steakhouse restaurant and although it was pricey it was well worth the money. The prime rib was excellent and the Brand salad was a nice refreshing surprise. 

But, it starts to go downhill once you get off the elevator and head to your room...the carpet looks dirty and in some spots it is starting to crease.  The room we were in was clean but looks worn.  There is a nice LCD tv in the room and the bed was comfortable.  The toilet scares you every time it is flushed  and the shower head sprays very hard. (my wife called it a "Silkwood" shower) 

If you are on a budget it isn't bad but would have preferred to stay at a nicer hotel. Don't think we will be back to stay.

I'm a Vegas regular, and thought Monte Carlo was supposed to be one of the nicer hotels ... Not so. Just returned from two nights there, and will not be back to MC. To start I had to change rooms b\/c the first room had the carpet along the baseboard completely off the wall - they were nice and quick about changing my room. But, all the rooms need serious updating ... the bathroom was loud (toilet and sink were very loud) and shower was dark and tempramental with hot\/cold water. There is no honor bar or refrig in the room, and the surface areas (desk and dresser) are minimal - the furniture was very old and dumpy. The bed and pillows were comfortable - but that was the only decent thing in the room. Oh, and the walls are paper thin ... I could hear the young kids in one adjacent room, and then at 4am I heard the women returning back to the other adjacent room ... and always could hear people in the hall.

I picked MC partly b\/c of the nice pools (lazy river and wave pool), so my minor daughter could have fun. She did ... but I was very uncomfortable in their pool area ... VERY crowded with lounge chairs - you can't move them, and there aren't tables or even ground space to put your bag, and very few "cabana boys\/girls" to help you find a spot. Of course the best spots are the premium cabanas, for premium prices ... no thanks. Also, it's very claustrophic with all the buildings surrounding and encroaching on the pool area. And, to top it all off, my t-shirt was taken from my chair! (Thank goodness my ID wasn't taken, but my shirt had been on top of the chair and when I returned from a spin around the river, it was gone. I checked lost and found numerous times, but it never turned up. Tacky ... I thought the clientele would have been better.)

The only highlights were that the food court was decent for families (McDonald's, Rubio's, Sbarro etc.), we didn't have to walk miles to get from self parking to the elevators or pool, and bed was comfortable (when the noise from the hall or adjacent rooms didn't keep me awake). Oh, and they get a decent amount of TV channels including Nickelodeon for my pre-teen daughter. 

Thank goodness I "got a deal" to stay here ... if I'd paid more than $90 a night (with their bogus resort fee) I would be really PO'd. For now, it's just live and learn, and never return.
Worst stay ever. Construction everywhere Noise, Dust, Workers all hours. Limited food and NO Pool. Resort fee with no resort. No compassion from heartless staff. STAY AWAY

I stayed here once and will never again step foot in here!  Huge lines to check in, mediocre rooms, smells very smokey.  In the room, you can hear every time your neighbor flushes the toilet...

i went with a group of girls... bathroom was kinda weird... HUGE room with sink and shower, then separate toilet area.  Would have been more helpful to have the shower and toilet separate from the sink\/mirror area to better help everyone tryin to get ready... but oh well... that's juss my take on it... we have no shame in front of each other so you can imagine everyones convo in and outta the shower lol.. 

Not many restaurants i even care to remember... so no ver memorable all around... I recommend another hotel over this one anyday!

So I came here for a conference and if this was my first time in Vegas I would prob never come back! The Monte Carlo is horrible compared to where I've previously stayed on Vegas. Where do I begin? Let's start with the room.

Room: super old school, dirty carpets, nicks in walls, chipping paint etc. I've added photos to this review so you can see exactly what I'm talking about, but the worst of the worst was the bloody bandaid that I found on my shower wall on day 1 that remained until day 6 when I left despite me telling the housekeeper about it. Also didn't appreciate the holes in the sheets and the lack of hot water! Now I stayed on the 17th floor and when I say I like to take hot showers I mean steaming up the bathroom almost too hot to breathe showers lol. So I thought maybe I'm being unfair and the water does get hot just not as hot as I'm used to. WRONG! I polled several of the hundreds of women at my conference and they all said the same. The water feels hot when it's running in the tub but when u turn the shower on it's like warm at best. It's also hard and made my skin super dry, but I was told my a local that Nevada has some of the hardest water in the country. Funny I don't remember that from my previous stay but whatever.

Housekeeping: not worth their weight in salt! Housekeeping never changed the sheets, cleaned the tub or toilet. They only thing they did was provide new towels. I had to request soap. Also didn't appreciate leaving my room at 9:30 am, coming back at 3:00 pm and still having a dirty room. Especially when the same housekeepers were in the hall in the exact same location "cleaning rooms" when I left and returned. The last thing I didn't appreciate was the housekeeping staff placing my items in my luggage bags despite them being out of the way. It kind of makes me feel like they were going through my luggage and made me uncomfortable. I've never had that happen before.

Dining: so I loves the cupcakery! Great tasty cupcakes and Starbucks was good with pretty fast service. I also appreciated the 24 hr fast food places in the hotel. This proved very useful with my early morning flight. The Cafe was where we ate several times. Good food horrible service! They seem to be understaffed no mater what time you patronize them (I went during normal business hrs and late at night\/early morning) and the service is very slow so if you're in a rush to catch a show you may want to skip this place. The good thing is they had 2 for 1 house wine for happy hour and it was good. The buffet was okay, not worth $20 bucks in my opinion, but hey it's Vegas!

Overall this hotel could use a major renovation big time! The only reason I gave it two stars is bc the waitresses in the cafe are very hardworking and try their best to accommodate you and the food is decent. I wouldn't stay here again or recommend anyone else to.

First they are under construction so a lot of issue they get a pass on. Don't take the upgrade to the wellness rooms they are not worth it. There is no dresser so if you don't like to live out of a suit case it's not for you. Rooms were clean but wasn't supplied enough one bar of soap for dink and shower and they didn't give us another as well as they didn't give us more shampoo until we were there for 5 days. 

There is hardly any place to get food unless you go outside. Casino is on small side but some of the improvements look nice. 

If your not going to the hockey arena don't stay here as you will have to deal with the crowd when you try to park. Or leave in any way. 

Plus they make you pay for parking when you are staying there

We think a vacation is what you make of it, that being said, our room is clean, quiet, and the staff is wonderful.  The best part is that unlike so many other hotels no one is chasing you around trying to sell you timeshare!  If you do get sucked into timeshare for show tickets and stuff, go for the real shows, not "free" play at the casinos, after timeshare presentation they will try to get you to trade in your show tickets for a free vacation, it's just to try to get another chance at you... that being said. I'm thrilled with my show tickets and my hassle free room at Monte Carlo

This is one of the worst if not worst MGM property casino. Beware of the facade. The good thing is it's decent location, but with so much construction, it takes away any pro of being close on the strip.  You want to go to a different casino you need to go all the way around the back on Frank Sanatra Blvd. 

Next bad things is check in...plan to take forever and where some casinos make it easier on card holders, this casino doesn't, all one line! And if you check in with VIP services avoid the lady in my picture, African American Short hair, she is not polite or welcoming.

Next bad thing, rooms are literally one\/two bed hotel rooms that you would get at holiday inn.  I stay at Marriotts and at least you get a coffee machine, a fridge, TV that has more than 2 channels, and a lets not forget a fan that's in the bathroom.  I thought it was common to have a switch for light and fan....when my girlfriend went #2 we had to wait it out, if you get my drift.  

Honestly I usually only like using yelp for good experiences because you want ppl to know how great experience was. I just couldn't in anyway possible say something positive about it except I left up a couple hundred.

Worst hotel on the strip. Hands down. I've stayed a lot of places down her but this place does not care about their customers. They turned the water off in the middle of our stay. So basically 140 bucks a night for dry camping. They said they would put bottled water near the elevators but that never happened. Pool closed two years in a row. Grumpy cocktail waitresses. Never ever ever again. Check my history. I give good reviews to everyone. Not this place. Been coming here for years and it gets worse and worse. Worst hotel experience of my life.

Update:  Tried to get a little money taken off the bill due to the water outage. Front desk told me they would discount the resort fee for one night. Then when I got my bill, they charged me full price anyway.

Monte Carlo has really dropped the ball these days. 

Shortly after I made my reservation I heard they were under construction. We figured it would be reasonable, my issues with Monte Carlo are partially related to said construction but the staff could have been more helpful. 

Upon check-in we had to wait 45 minutes in line. At one point there was only one person working the desk to check in guests. We were told that the pool was closed but that we would not be having our resort fee refunded, which I fought and subsequently lost. They did "upgrade" us to a newer room which was extremely small and we were not impressed by. Come 9 or 10AM construction began Saturday morning waking us up, aggressive grinding sounds. At night the shower did not have hot water so that was also fun.

We likely will not be back even if they rebrand. We mentioned our experience to staff but they were indignant.

We booked the Monte Carlo for July 28th-30th to see George Strait at T-Mobile arena.  Here is a rundown of our horrible experience!

1.) When we arrived,  we were greeted with a $15 a day parking fee as registered guests. 

2.) We spent 45 minutes in line at check-in.  There were only 3 people doing check-ins.  

3.). We got to our rooms on the 12th floor where we were greeted with a dilapidated time capsule of a room which we are paying $300 a night including resort fees, plus an extra $15 if you wanted your room cleaned daily  Our room had a view facing the Aria and all the pool construction. We booked 3 rooms for the weekend. 

4.)  We arrived at 3pm, and there was loud banging, pounding, beeping trucks, and jackhammering in the pool area.  

5.)  On Saturday Morning at 5:15am,  the construction began with the same banging, pounding, beeping trucks, and Jackhammering.  As we are not able to get away much because of having kids,  this was not the way we were imagining our little get away.  

6.)  We complained to the front desk, and they were not able to switch us rooms because they were sold out due to the concert being right across the street.  

7.)  On Sunday morning again, we were greeted with the same loud construction.

8.)  At check out,  we had asked for some type of discount due to our horrible experience and stay.  We were politely returned a No!  

We highly recommend staying somewhere else where you would not be subjected to such horrific accommodations.  We will never stay here again when we return to Vegas.  Please take this review into extreme consideration when choosing where to not stay in Vegas!

Came to see Katt Williams' performance. Parked on the 3rd floor. After the show, the entire third floor of the parking garage was at a dead standstill for a very solid 30 minutes. My, my girl, and about 1,500 other angry, drunken individuals were stuck in the Monte Carlo parking lot, cars bumper to bumper, for 30 minutes.

Innocent civilians and Monte Carlo regulars desperately rushed to their vehicles to escape the madness. Horns honked in an oddly harmonious (and very deliberate) unison to agitate staff, straggler employees strolling around the parking lot were harassed with a barrage of complaints and questions- questions I harassed them with myself. 

If it lasted any longer, there is no telling what level of mayhem Monte Carlo would have unleashed onto the city from that parking garage. Turns out paid parking isn't such a good idea. And after 30 shitty minutes, everyone who was parked on floor 3 got detoured out of that fucked up garage to the backstreets. For free.

In conclusion:

Monte Carlo = good
Monte Carlo Parking Garage = shitty

Almost let it ruin my night but I still prospered.

This is the place to stay if you're on a budget. We managed to fit six girls into one room, so you can imagine that the rooms are decent in size with a big enough bathroom to accommodate all of us.

Conveniently located right on the strip and connected to the Aria. Easy access to tram makes it quick and affordable to travel to other places. I particularly like how there is a food court in the hotel. Makes easy access to food after a night of fun in Vegas.

I did a lot of shopping around for our first trip to Vegas, I wanted someplace nice, and central. I was booked at Caesar's but then switched and got a suite at the Monte Carlo for $500 less than what the basic room was at Caesar's. I paid like $900 for a week for a suite, I consider the price great.  We had a nice sale I think because of the fire.

The suite was beautiful in design and layout, very well appointed, very stylish, very nice. 

The TV could have been larger and HD I guess. I mean, they put in a flat panel, but then it is small for the room and not HD, so why upgrade to a nicer TV when you go with the lowest end nice TV possible?

The slots were very tight.

I wish more hotels would give free wifi, charging for it is so 2003, even McDonalds has free wifi. So what you do here is buy a high gain antenna ($20 or so) and point it out your window at the McDonalds across the street. Free wifi for you. 

We didn't use the pool or the fitness or the spa, we meant to, honest, but the weather was unseaonably cold, and we ran out of time for the others. Plus, we got in so much walking, we didn't need to work out.

I would stay here again. I wish they had a topless pool, wife likes to sunbathe topless and I like to join her.

I think this hotel is great for the price.  The location is good with easy access to NYNY and MGM.  There isnt really anything too exciting in the hotel itself but that didnt bother us.  My friend was very lucky in the casino - me not so much - oh well.  Parking was never a problem, check in was easy and she gave us all sorts of comps because she was originally from my home state.

Room was decent but LOUD! You can hear everything in the hallway and the next room, no sleep and the AC didn't work with a damn. Purchased a large coffee at their Starbucks on my way to the pool and was told I couldn't go out to the pool with it? F off! Nice sports bar and casino but wouldn't stay here again, ever!

Monte Carlo is a great spot to be on the strip. Honestly, I enjoyed how close to everything we were. Food, shops, things to do, all around us. The hotel has amazing service. Everyone is kind and ready to help. This hotel has a mini food court so that people can enjoy other food. While my stay here at Monte Carlo was great, there were a few things that might need improvement. There were a lot of sounds coming from the walls. Mostly scratching sounds, it was weird. There was no fridge in our room. How upsetting is that in such a hot place? The water in our bathroom fluctuated between warm\/hot to warm\/cold. Don't use the shampoo, it feels like you didn't use anything. The beds were nice and comfy. The room set up was simple. It wasn't too grand. I wish it had some special decorations going on. We had an amazing view to the strip at 31st floor. They are currently constructing the swimming pool. So we could use it. Great hotel, needs minor improvements.

I did not stay here, but I ended up playing Blackjack in the Monte Carlo casino 2 nights in a row and had an awesome time!  Monte Carlo has the best dealers. They are very personable and entertaining! We ended up playing here for hours. I am hoping to come back to Vegas soon. Monte Carlo is at the top of my list for places to stay!

ok, i know this aint a 4 star hotel or anything. i would say it's like ur avg cheapy vegas hotel (luxor). *however*, a couple things i am very very happy with...

1, no crazy check-in line...on the evening of nye! 
2. there's a full-length mirror and magnifying mirror in the room...very important if ur tryin to slut it up real good, duh!
3. cleaning service seems to be better than luxor...they took away our room service shit the same day we took it out our room (luxor leaves that shit in the hallways for dayssss)
4. cab lines were pretty short and quick all new year's weekend
5. the best freakin food court ever!!! subway, manchu wok, sbarro, mcdonald's and some mexican joint...who wants to stand in line for 2 hrs for a buffet or to get a table??? this is str8 to the point, get me some food to buffer the alcohol type shit. sbarro is open late too if u want pizza at like 3am!!!

My fiance and I just got back from our Vegas weekend yesterday. If there was one word to describe this hotel, it would be CRUSTY.

We always stay at the MGM, however, our "hook ups" no longer works there. I found a room at the Monte Carlo for around $100 a night, which seemed really reasonable. 
When we walked into our room, we both looked at each other like "WTF!"
First of all, there is no comforter. Only a semi-thick sheet. It was definately not a hang-over friendly bed. The top sheet had a rip in the middle, probably about 3 inches long. Also, there were stains everywhere! All over the pillow cases and sheets. GROSSSSS!!!
The A.C. hardly worked. We had it all the way to 60 degrees and on high, and we both woke up sweaty during the middle of the night and the morning. And as for lighting? What lighting? Out of 4 lamps, only two worked. I had to apply my makeup in the dark....which is luckily the look alot of Vegas girls go for. =)

The pool situation is so sad. One pool was about as big as my mom and dad's pool. The lazy river is nowhere near as big as the MGMs and there were about 1,000 people crammed into the tiny pools. You could barely see water.

It is safe to say I will never ever stay here again. I'm sure the Monte Carlo was "something" when it first opened but they obviously haven't touched the rooms since then!!!

Paid $267 for a wens and thurs night. Over paid. Front desk lady did not want to upgrade our room, did not give us dining credit for food, and charged us $20 extra for early check in. Even after I told her it was my girlfriend's birthday she still didn't hook up crap. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the cleaning lady, bell hop, and valet guy were really nice. Rooms were OK, but outdated. And there is all kinds of loud construction going on. Oh and the Jacuzzi was broken by the pool area. Pick another hotel unless you get rooms here for dirt cheap

Low key casino compared to the others on the strip. It's classy and has lots of restaurants but there aren't any popular clubs or pool parties going on here. They've got Blue Man Group and the -5 degree ice bar though! Both should be checked out!

Quite possibly the worst Hotel experience I have ever had in Las Vegas. Last April while visiting some friends that were staying at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas our golf clubs got stolen from the trunk while inside gambling. We should've learned our lesson then and never stay there again. After checking in on Friday my girlfriend and I proceeded to our room only to pass a group of four individuals with their door open having an orgy. I didn't care so much but my girlfriend was absolutely disgusted. I asked housekeeping if they could let the people know to please keep their door shut. That night after gambling we came back to our hotel room only to pass that same room doing the same thing. Oh well it's Las Vegas. That night we couldn't sleep because the people across from us partied until 9 AM. I went down to the concierge and ask them if we could please switch rooms and they informed me that there were no rooms available being that it was Halloween weekend. They did however tell me that I could upgrade my room to a suite if I wanted to fork out an extra hundred and something dollars. No thank you. Saturday night was no different we had a terrible time sleeping and just wanted to leave early Sunday morning and chalk this hotel experience up as a loss. Sunday morning as we walked to the parking garage to grab something out of the car We saw it was gone! Someone had stolen it and our belongings as well. Our stupidity for leaving valuables in the car. We called security and they called the aria security and both were trying to convince us we mis-parked our car. After an hour or so of trying to convince them that our car was not miss parked they finally went to the cameras and saw the truck we had driven in on Friday and told us we were right we did park in that parking garage. We filed a report and tried to figure out how we were going to Get back to California the following day. Ultimately we had to Rent a car Monday morning. This was by far my worst experience at any hotel I have ever had. Have been here twice and have had things stolen from the garage twice. If I were to ever go back it would definitely have to be free and I definitely would not leave a vehicle in the parking garage.

Pool: Prob the most memorable part of this place ( but mostly bc I hated myself for not making time to go)! Lazy river!!! Come on!!!!!!

Casino: Pretty good (price wise)! Better than the surrounding hotels.

Food: DEcent late-night options - high of course, but convenient ( Subway, McDonalds, FAT BURGER ACROSS THE STREET, etc...)

Rooms: Eh! I vote for updates!! Not the hotel room to stay in all day.

Location: near NYNY & has a tram to Aria, Vdara if I'm not mistaken (don't quote me on that)?!? Otherwise, a decent walk to everything else!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The beds are heavenly. We never wanted to get out. The best sleep I had in a long time. The hotel was clean and everything was great! My only complaint is the Internet sucks

We stayed in their VIP floor called Hotel 32!!  On this floor, there is a loft area where you can hangout, watch television and best of all...eat!!  They provide breakfast and small appetizers to all the guests in the mornings and late afternoons. 

The room was nice and clean.  Bed was ,of course, comfy.

They had a good sized gym and it wasn't overly packed.

Most of the restaurants downstairs were overly priced and food were just okay. 

Overall, I had a good stay and would definitely come back!!!

There was a time when I liked staying at the Monte Carlo for its location and value. Sadly, during their current reconstruction phase, this hotel has gone downhill fast! The casino itself is still pretty nice and the front of the hotel with their different dining options are still up to par with the strip. Just don't expect the room to be up to date. 

During our last stay, they stuck us on the seventh floor all the way at the end of the hallway where at least one third of the wing of the floor was occupied by loud college kids that didn't know how to sleep or talk in a normal voice. Walls were super thin and furniture was pretty beaten up surprisingly. I'm sure they would have moved us if we complained but figured we weren't going to be in the room that much anyway. Yeah, we should have moved. But you know what was louder and more obnoxious than those kids? The GD DMN construction going on seven floors down. One word, brutal! If you stay here, you have to choose a room as high above the ground as you can get and even then you might still hear those beeping tractors. 

I won't be returning to Monte Carlo until they finish their remodeling and transformation process. Which I read isn't going to be the Monte Carlo any longer but the new MGM Nomad hotel. So expect the room rates to go up and be on the level with aria and cosmo because it looks like it's going to be uber nice! Until then....

I'm beginning to really like this place. It's clean, the service is outstanding. Especially John at the VIP check in. Their buffet is way more tasty than the Luxor or Excalibur and the same price. My favorite thing is the parking situation. You don't have to weave through the casino to get to your your room.

I come to Vegas every other week for work and this has become my go to place.

I stayed here back in November. My room was booked together with airfare off expedia so I did get a great deal. Then again, all hotels in Las Vegas were dirt cheap in Nov. 

Anyways, the first night, I hardly slept because of the noise from toilets flushing and water running. I could also hear the neighbors who were up all night and others that were up real early. In the morning, I went downstairs to ask if I could have a different room. They kindly moved me to the very last room  on another floor. 

Well, it was the same thing again. Plus, at 5am, I was awakened by construction noise from the Aria hotel next door. OMG I was there for a conference and getting absolutely no rest. By day 3, I was a zombie. 

The hotel rooms are ok but nothing special. In fact, my sheets had several holes in them. Not what I'd expect from a place like this. The Monte Carlo seems a bit out of place on the strip with all the other hotels having themes and nicer rooms. This hotel is plain jane. It's a total disappointment. 

I went to the buffet one evening which was ok. I'd give it 7 out of 10. 

The pool was closed this time of the year like most Vegas hotels. I really wish they'd leave them open for those of us who like to sit in the hot tub and are in the city for something other than gambling.

I would like to see the Monte Carlo torn down and the other hotels nearby take over it's space. The new Aria or the neighboring New York New York could expand. Otherwise, the MC really needs some work. 
The price was great but I got absolutely no rest at all. 

When I was checking out, I asked to speak to a manager about my terrible experience. She comped me the resort fees and said if I hadn't booked and paid through expedia, she could have done more. Good to know they at least care about customers. However, I would never stay here again. I've stayed at better Super 8's. And really, being in Las Vegas, your hotel choices are endless. There are much better places to stay.

First time here tonight the service was absolutely horrible, valet company are not very smart or helpful, neither is the staff at the casino. Valet did not tell me they charge the only signs are posted in the pickup area, by that time they already have your car , no manager around at all to resolve problems. Then the valet Anna was driving my car with no headlights, apparently my automatic headlights got turned off, as long as I've had my car I've never turned them off . I valet all the time never had my lights turned off or had anyone drive my car without lights. I called the hotel to ask for the valet info sue was not aware of the companies name which to me makes no since that they don't know who they are contracting to drive people's cars, worries me a tad, also didn't know the corporate #, said she'd have a manager call me, next thing I know Ashlee the valet screw up calls my phone saying she heard I called the front desk. I then called them back At the hotel wondering why my # was given to this girl I had a problem with when I requested to speak with management  explained t o them again I only wanted to. Speak to manage mm horrible experience still waiting on a call
Their suites are pretty nice here and i like this place.  3 stars cause one time i came here and won $2000 but they took it all back after sitting at the tables for over 2hrs.

Here on my Honeymoon. 

This is a decent place. Clean but out dated. Our room looks towards the Strip. However, it yields the view of less the than ideal. It's no parking lot, so please don't get me wrong. The Bellagio, Caeser's Palace, Wynn and Paris are in a much better location. 

 Pub and Blue Man Group are here. Both are not to miss Las Vegas attractions.
Nice hotel clean good service but there is no microwave in the rooms so it's hard to keep your leftovers
Had a three day stay, Nice view on 20th floor. The casino is nice as well, close to everything!

Its never easy to give a place like the monte carlo such a low rating. I stayed here more then 10 years ago when it was in much better condition and had a better overall feel. I stayed here for a company group trip. The group reservation department handled everything great and gave us a good deal on the rooms. The main reason for this hotel given such low ratings is that it feels like everything is old and not maintained that well. upon arriving to my room, the AC did not work. they sent someone up right away to fix it. The maintenance guy fixed it and also put in a air filter since apparently it was missing, The room while overall clean, you could tell the wear in the carpet, chipped furniture, peeling paint in the ceiling. the sofa had unidentified white marks on it, which required a call to housekeeping for some white flat sheets to cover it to sit on. The bed while clean was sagging on both side which kept me sleeping dead center even if i didnt want to the one thing positive about this hotel was almost all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room i had was a monaco suite. So in conclusion for the right price its not overall bad, just dont expect high luxury.

VEGAS! not hard to have a bad time here right? well it can be frustrating when many little things go wrong. Monte Carlo has many great upsides too it as well as a few downsides. 

Upsides: great location if you would like to stay on the strip. Walking distance to many other casino. Service at the front desk was excellent. Price was reasonable for the quality of the room, minus the downsides in the room (see below) Sports Book was friendly but a bit understaffed. minus 5 bar is cool (literally)

Downsides: Bar tenders at almost every bar in the casino were slow, seemed unhappy at their job. Bit of a "Debbie downer" attitude (but waitresses were great) rooms had no WiFi capability. This one baffled me, but they still used an old school hardwire plug in. So dont bring an ipad an expect to use WiFi. The bathroom in our room spelled like sewage. Good thing we didn't spend much time in the room but the odor was bad. Smelled like the plumbing was backed up. 

Our experience here started off a little rocky with not being able get a WiFi signal in the room. Especially when you have work that needs to be done. 2nd was the smelly bathroom and taking a hot shower just made it worse. Then walking down stairs for a drink and having slow\/rude bar service did not help. But with the rest of the trip going well and hotel being right on the strip, it was worth the stay. Would do it again, just as long as the plumbing issue is fixed

If you're looking for an affordable hotel in a good location while in Vegas, Monte Carlo is your place. I know I'll never be able to afford something like the Wynn or any of the other fancy hotels, and I'm fine with that. No one goes to Vegas to be in a hotel room, right? 

After staying at NYNY the year before, we decided to stay at the Monte Carlo this year to save some buckage. As long as a hotel room is clean, I can deal. However, some of the aspects of the Monte Carlo's room cleanliness were a bit questionable... we had a few not-sure-if-they're-clean-but-they're-super-crunchy towels and there was an interesting stain on the curtains... blood or nail polish? We decided to believe it was nail polish. Here's hoping. But, whatever. If you drink enough, you won't even notice these things.

Aside from the room... we had excellent service from everyone working at the hotel. We befriended one of the Player's Club guys, which netted each girl a free $20 to gamble with every day... and my free $20 allowed me to win $250 on a slot machine. They essentially payed me to win... who can complain about that?? We scored a bunch of free buffet's from the wheel-o-free-stuff that was outside, and we definitely ate the hell out of that buffet.

The only major downside is all the construction that is going on next door at the moment... it really kills the whole lay by the pool & relax vibe. You can't relax when you're too busy picking dust & dirt out of your drink, teeth & eyes. If you're looking to lounge by a pool, this is not a hotel for you (at the moment, anyways). It was apparently the windiest day in Vegas, ever, and people were freaking out about it. Vegas, I laugh at your "high winds"... you would most likely fall over if you spent a day in Chicago. 

Overall, I was fine with the Monte Carlo, even though there were a few cleanliness concerns on my end. I'll probably stay there again until I meet a sugar daddy that is willing to pay for a 5-star.

My friend and I stayed here for two nights on June 24-26. Check-in was an easy process although there was a long line and the mobile check-in was not working. Everything went pretty smoothly minus the new resort fee of $100+ and also $10\/day for parking. Something we weren't aware of, but apparently that is the new policy as of 2017. However during our stay, the pool area was under construction and we were told that we can go to any MGM affiliated hotel to use their pool. Which was a little bit of an inconvenience, but luckily there is a free tram\/shuttle that took us close to must hotels. You'll just have to wait in the heat for 7+ minutes for a tram\/shuttle and walk to the hotel you wish to use the pool at. 

Upon booking our reservation, we request for two connecting rooms with two queen beds, which they could not honor. However after insisting that we prefer the two queen beds, they mentioned that due to the reconstruction our rooms will be shaking and it would be extremely noisy. Mind you, they start construction at 6 AM! Normally that wouldn't be a problem, but what happens in Vegas is a raging headache from a hangover!! Not something you want to deal with so early in the morning. :( But what else can we do, when we already pre-paid for our rooms? We deal with the hangover and noise, that's what. 

The night before we checked out I had a lovely surprised in my bed. BED BUGS!! Luckily, I only found one sandwiched between the duvet and comforter. Let's just say I was freaked out, killed it and slept with all the lights on in hope that it would scare the bed bugs away. It didn't and I was bitten, I guess not everything you find on Google is true. But I was hopeful! Anyways, I called front desk to speak with one of the manager on duty. I believe her name was Laura. Super helpful and reassuring. I left the hotel feeling better, with the promise that if they found any evidence of bed bugs than they would compensate by getting my clothing and luggage steamed and free of bed bug larvae. 

Since it was my last night and I was heading back home, they said that I could just leave my luggage and everything I had in the hotel room in my rental car so that the Las Vegas heat could hopefully kill off any bed bugs. However, if my house is infested with bed bugs than they will also compensate for the inspection cost. Let's just say when I got home, I received a call from another manager on duty who said that their testing for bed bugs in my room was a negative. I was surprised at their finding and mention that I was bitten, to which the guy repeated that the result was negative so it couldn't have been bed bugs. Long story short, I mentioned that I have pictures of my bites, the bed bug, and a video of me killing the bed bug! That must of shocked him, because he was silent for a bit, but then came back and asked if I had a management team he could contact about this issue. Uhh...no it's just little ol' me trying  to get the room resolved before you gave it to the next guest! 

Overall, this trip was a disaster and how Monte Carlo's management team handled it was a disgrace to MGM. But I must say it was a pleasure speaking with Laura. She was the only one who seemed to want to make sure that I was okay and that my items were safe. So my tip for future guest is if you want to stay a Monte Carlo for whatever reason, just make sure you take pictures of everything and hopefully you have a helpful and thoughtful manager!

I was excited to stay on the strip, but was not impressed w\/ this hotel. There was an odor to our room when we 1st arrived. Absolutely no good insulation and you could hear every living thing from people in the hallways to your neighbor peeing in the toilet. It even sounded like someone was entering our room but really it was neighbor opening up their door. The shower head was rough and stung my skin. The buffet was ok. It's in the middle of the strip and location was great! Also had a great view of strip, just not sure id recommend it to others

If you want to hear your neighbors tv, loud maids talking outside your door, your neighbor coughing, and your neighbor taking a dump...this is the place for you. It also comes with wet carpet as an added bonus.

Silver lining - the front desk people are nice. They got me a room change fairly quick. Hence why it is 2 stars instead of 1.

Tidbit - don't get a room with an adjacent door to the room next door unless you like to hear your neighbor.

The checkin for the hotel is at 3, but we arrived around 12:30 and were able to checkin at that time. The casino smelled a little of smoke which is common in all casinos. 

The hotel is being remodeled so there is no pool on site. You have the option of going to MGM or Mandaley Bay. It's a bit of a walk to get there though. The elevator got us to our room on the 23rd floor smoothly and quickly. There is a lot of construction going on so there is a bit of noise during the day. 

The rooms are definitely outdated. The bath fixtures were a mix of polished brass and brushed nickel. The chairs in the room were old and scratched. There was no fridge, microwave or coffee maker in the room. There was one blood stain on the bedding. There is remodeling that's going to occur and the hotel will become the MGM Park so when that happens it'll be a different place entirely.

I have to admit that I was hesitant when making reservations at the Monte Carlo. All I could think of was an old casino with musty smoke-filled rooms but fortunately that was not my experience at all!! We chose to stay here because of it's proximity to the T-Mobile arena. It could not get any easier just walking straight across the street and into a show and then back up to your room within five minutes, the location if you were going to see an event can't be beat. I had heard that they were in the middle of a renovation and the top floors had been redone so when we checked in we asked if we could get a renovated room. Our request was met with a smile and they were happy to accommodate at no extra charge! We got a room on the 21st floor overlooking the arena and I was definitely impressed!! Everything was new and super clean, smelled good, aesthetically pleasing, and most importantly ... the bed and the pillows were fabulous!!! We definitely plan on staying at the Monte Carlo again the next time we are in Vegas for an event at the T-Mobile arena.

There was a hole in the wall because the door knob didn't match the door stopper. The shower head was leaking and the walls were very thin, you could hear the awful noises of bodily functions between two people in the other room. 
The lobby was pretty but the hotel room was not what I had imagined. Very outdated and wished the walls were thicker and the bathroom leaks were fixed. 
Wifi was free and fast, though. So two stars for that.

Well, we were checking out and I was checking all the drawers making sure I did not leave anything behind.  When I opened one of the drawer, I found an open box of condom. It made me think if they even clean the room at all.  I was going to give it 4 stars, but I had to give it one star because of the open box of condom.

Where's the wifi guys??? Oh that's right I need to upgrade my ipad air to a laptop and get a Ethernet cable to get internet in room or better yet just walk around Monte Carlo with my ipad...sweet...get with it there are cheaper places that get it... Now for the rooms..stayed here 3 nights..happy with location and easy to find our room but the room itself needs updating...bed was comfy..housekeeping was alright.. Bathroom sucked!!!! I took a Luke warm shower everyday and the tub occasionally would fill up with water (slow draining) it just felt dirty and I felt more dirty even after showering.. Bring your own soap,shampoo and conditioner they don't soap up. 

 room and resort fees ,.what a rip, customer service and check in was good... But let's try and keep up with the rest.. I will consider staying again if it was free....  I would elaborate more but I need to contact the hotel first

Don't go here. Service is trash. The suites aren't worth it. And the amenities offered here aren't functional. 

ZERO STARS

What a good weekend! 

I give this hotel 4stars because it never gave us any problem. Clean, nice, & simple. You get what you paid for. The lobby is nice. They have a little food court and they have this one place were I ate at for a snack which is called Nathan's hot dogs it's pricey but really good. Give it a try. The casino here is cool I won money that's all that matters. We checked in early and they had a fee. They gave us our room key and we were on level 20. We didn't get the strip view but we got a view on what they are building for 2016 or 2017. 

The beds are comfy clean carpet and nice house keeping service. 
They would greet us every time we would pass by. We didn't get any noisy neighbors maybe we were the noisy neighbors jk lol. We also had a chance to watch Sunday football at Diablos pricey for food and drinks just know to bring a lot of cash to eat or drink there. I enjoyed my stay here. I read reviews before I got here
And they kinda scared me but I thought this hotel was nice and clean maybe I just had good house keeping lady! lol well Monte Carlo did us well!

I will start with the one positive thing about this hotel other than the holiday decorations. There was one concierge who went through a heck of a lot of trouble to switch our Cirque Du Soleil tickets after we missed the show we'd signed up for as part of our vacation package. We received no information regarding the show other than confirmation that we had tickets so we didn't realize the tickets were for the night we arrived. He was very professional and polite and made 5 or so calls to sort things out. I don't know whether those were real calls or not but he made a great show of it.

The service beyond this one gentlemen was extremely lacking. We had to pay $25 to check in before 3pm even though we arrived at 11am. Neither of us wanted to walk around the strip with our luggage so we paid it. They will hold your bags for free but failed to offer this option until we were ready to check out. 

At check-in we requested a king size bed rather than two queens since we were there for our anniversary and it was the off season. The lady checking us in was polite but smug and rewarded us with a room facing the roof, dirty towels, dirty sheets and a crusty tub. The room was intended to be handicap accessible but the tub was raised to the point where it was dangerous to step out of it onto the slippery marble floors. The glasses in the room were scummy and there was hair on the towels and sheets. When I called room service to swap the sheets after discovering makeup stains and hair they replaced them and put on another thin top sheet which was tucked under the mattress (instead of a bottom sheet). A lot of things happen on these beds, I want more than a thin top sheet between me and that mattress. 

The pool was much smaller in person than in the pictures and its directly under the rail system that connects the hotels which is public and loud. Don't believe the pictures for this hotel, the lazy river and wave pool are comically small. We felt so out of place we left almost immediately. It's not worth the $10 to rent a tube and most people just float instead. 

The Monte Carlo's location isn't horrid, it's next to a lot of other hotels\/casinos but it is on the end of the strip meaning if you want to go to the Paris, Mirage or the Wynn it's going to be a hike. 

Upon checkout we explained our experience to the lady at the front desk, she apologized and immediately asked for the $25 a day resort fee. 

The airport shuttles pick you up out back where the only seating options are some concrete benches.

In summation, I wouldn't stay here again. The Monte Carlo needs a solid polish, a proper update and better customer service.

Stayed here with the wife for 2 nights. Good, centered location on the strip...nice casino....great restaurants. Didn't get to go to the pool, but it looked nice from our room. VU at the front desk was very accommodating---we weren't pleased with the view in our original room so she moved us too a better room on a higher floor. Check-in and check-out was easy and fast and all staff was pleasant. My only complaint would be that they do not have room service, but I would stay here again and recommend it for people who want easy access to entertainment and food on the strip.

Unlike previous reviews, we stayed here 2 weeks ago for 2 days\/3 nights, in the suite, and it was really clean, neat and comfortable. 

The only reason why I am not giving it 5 stars is because the walls are paper thin! We could hear our next door neighbors sneeze! Then we got a gaggle of drunk girls, who loved screaming, jiggling our door handle (this hotel is old enough to still have room-connecting doors) and playing an array of rap-country-rock music at 8 am. Also, we had a couch in the room that was awkwardly placed at a weird angle by the bed, making surrounding bed space uneven and hard to maneuver around. Also, I used the jets in the tub, and by next morning, there was black residue on the tub.

Other than that, the cleaning staff was very friendly, the decor was new and modern, the lobby was lovely, and valet was somewhat fast. Its location is NOT the getto, but smack in the middle of the strip, so everything is close and accessible. It is waaaay better than the Luxor and in a better location than the Wynn. I'd recommend it.

DO NOT STAY HERE!  Unfortunately this hotel has gone down hill! Hotel is disgustingly dirty throughout!  Rooms are BASIC. No frig, no coffee maker, air conditioner wasn't working properly in 110 degree weather! Broken glass, garbage, dirty dishes, etc...in hallways to our room! Pool was CLOSED which they DID NOT disclose in the booking process!  Who goes to Vegas IN THE SUMMER and doesn't want to hang at the pools?! Had to be shuttled over to other pools which were packed and could hardly find available seating!  Wanted to change room type from King to 2 queens and they charged us an extra $15 a day! Expressed our concerns with Zachary, manager on duty, who was not accommodating at all and truly did not care about our dissatisfaction!  Trying to checkout of the hotel was a complete joke and took ridiculously LONG! And front desk staff quite rude!  Will NOT be back!!

Hi if I could give them a no star or negative -5 I would .
first of all we reserve are room in advance when we arrived we had to wait for the long time to get in are room 
2th:at the time of reservation no bodies  mentioned anything about renovation and the pool being close and still charge me for resort fee and no Info for the pool is close after I start complaining to the front desk he give me the manager which  was rude and confrontational and told me do what ever you want give us a bad review we don't care .
3Rd:The casino it's small and not clean the same as a room which is not worth it for the price and the time definitely I will call the BBB and I will tell all of my friend to don't even think of this place .
Horrible experience.  Booked at the Monte Carlo as I have stayed here before and loved it here.  Was not aware of the construction going on at the hotel, was not able to get any sleep or rest.

Actually, I was pleasantly surprised.  Four of us got a killer deal of three nights plus airfare for about the same price as airfare alone.  I mentioned to a few people where we would be staying, and got the Ewww looks.  We normally stay at Harrah's due to their generous comping system, and it's always nice.  But, I figured, the hotel is just a place to crash, it just needs to be decent.

It was decent.  The rooms were clean.  Housekeeping was prompt when we requested extra amenities.  The water pressure was good and the water was hot.  

So, why only 2 stars?  1) 95% of the employees act like they hate their job and they don't care who knows it.  2) There was some draining problem in the shower and you wound up with 3 inches of water with each shower.  3) The casino only tracks table games if you play $25\/hand.  I have a "system" in Pai Gow and vary my bets, and this rule seems unnecessarily elitist.  (All MGM\/Mirage owned hotels are the same)  4) Housekeeping knocked inappropriately... when we had Do Not Disturb on and when we called down and asked housekeeping to skip us.  Girls need their sleep, dammit.

Wish I could give NEGATIVE stars! Housekeeping, the Front Desk, and Security needs to be improved. 
I had reserved a late checkout during my recent stay until 3 pm. I was in my room at approximately 1 pm after having taken a shower when Housekeeping came into the room even after having the "Do Not Disturb" sign outside on the door. I told the guy to leave the room after he was surprised I was still in the room. I told Housekeeping the "Do Not Disturb" sign was outside for a reason. He then left. I immediately packed up my belongings from the room and went to the Front Desk to report the incident since obviously Housekeeping doesn't understand what "Do Not Disturb" means. I spoke to the manager "Zachary" at the Front Desk and informed him of what happened. He blamed it on "the System" and said Housekeeping has the right to come into the room. I responded by saying: "Even if there is a Do Not Disturb sign out front AND I have a late checkout at 3 pm!?" Again he blamed it on the system. I told Zachary I have no plans to return to Monte Carlo nor would recommend the place to anyone since he did nothing to correct what happened. He ultimately crossed the line with horrible customer service when he responded by saying "that's fine". After asking him how they will improve the situation, he said they'll look into it since it seemed to have been a one time thing. Great management skills there Zachary.
Customer service skills needs to seriously improve in addition to security since apparently privacy is not a priority at Monte Carlo.
Not impressed. Construction was taking place and started at 4am. AC was barely working. Oh and they charge for parking.

Stayed at Monte Carlo in January 2013 for three nights. I was looking for the best priced hotel in the middle of the strip. I paid $80 per night and could have gotten a better deal if there weren't so many conventions that period. 

But basically, I was happy with the room I got and the price I paid. It's right next to City Center which was what I really wanted to see.

good location, likely good rates (location-wise), and convinient tram to the Aria\/CityCenter and Bellagio...wouldn't necessary stay there again, but i wouldn't not stay there again either. pretty standard!
Good price, good hotel!clean and welcoming in a great location!If it weren't for that nasty garbage truck at 5 AM in the morning, I would give a 5 star!

So the Monte Carlo has recently been renovated. This hotel is a great moderately priced hotel and the renovations make it look a little nicer than it did before. 

The hotel is pretty central strip. It's in between Aria and New York and right across from MGM. The hotel is pretty nice and the staff is good. We had no problems checking in or out. 

There was one problem in that we had our do not disturb sign on the door all weekend but when we came back from a pool party on saturday we came into the room and one bed had been made. First, we had the do not disturb sign on because we didn't really need the room cleaned. Second, if someone was coming into the room to clean it, I would have locked my things up in my suitcase. This was a minor problem with us. because we didn't want our things being gone through which is why we had the sign up. But it appears that the sign was ignored. 

Other than that, it's a nice hotel. It's not the Bellagio but it's not Harrah's. It's a nice room that is in between the two in regards to luxury.

This was our second Vegas hotel, our first night was at the Bellagio which will forever be burned into my memory as one of by best hotel stays.

With that said the Monte Carlo is a standard hotel IMO.  One gripe is that we paid for an upgrade to have a room with a view and there was no view.  Hey Monte Carlo - a high floor facing away from the strip is not considered a view just so we're clear!

This hotel is out of date withe electronics in a massive way.  You have a hard line Internet line that doesn't work (too loose for my lap top) and no wifi.  The outlets were not close and were all used by other electronics so if I wanted to charge my cell I had to unplug something to plug in my cell, very inconvenient for the modern person.  

The hairdryer is in a bag at the top of the closet like it's a game of "where's the hairdryer".  Who wants to play that game with wet hair?  Not me!

The beds are not the most comfortable in the world, I've had better.  Check in and check out was a breeze.  Overall a fine hotel experience although I think I would error on a higher quality hotel on the strip instead with more modern upgrades for those of us living in the 21st century.

I have yet to have a good experience at an MGM property, but last night down right pissed me off. I am on chemotherapy so the meds I take causes me to drink water like it's going out of style. We waited and waited while playing a slot for a good 30 to 45 mins before we finally saw a cocktail waitress. She looked right at us and waved her hand in front of her face like my boyfriends cigar was disgusting and kept on walking. With plenty money in my pocket I went elsewhere!

Casino
+1 Love the Deal or Deal $0.1 machine.  
+1 Dealers were patient with me as I played roulette for the first time.

Hotel\/Amenities
+1 Pool Area is cool and close to the elevators unlike the MGM where you have to walk nearly a mile to get to the pool area.  They have a small wave pool. a lazy river, and a kiddie pool for the little ones.  
-1 The drinks at the pool are super expensive though so get buzzed before you come.
+1  You can find rates as low as $55 and cheaper if you are a Las Vegas resident. 
-1 You can still smell smoke in the non smoking room.  I recently stayed at a non smoking room in MGM and did not smell a hint of smoke because they designate the whole floor as non smoking.  
-TV sucks and decor is outdated.

I'd stay here again for the price and central location -solid 3 stars in my book.

I visited 6 casinos today with a group of friends, at all other 5 we were able to drink with our friends who were gambling while we were watching them (I'm talking about 2 gambling, 2 hanging out). We end up at the Monte Carlo and they refused the two of us a drink bc we were not playing black jack (while our 2 friends were at the table each in 100 bucks). Totally killed my Vegas vibe. Won't go back, and I recommend stayin away.
